company_name: British Columbia College of Nursing Professionals
job_description: Does the idea of data, where it comes from, how and why we use it, and under what authority, light a fire for you? Do you get excited helping people analyze their data? If yes, read on if you want to be a part of our team!The BC College of Nursing Professionals (BCCNP) has an opening for a Data Analyst (DA) in the Operations Department. In this role, you will work closely with the Information Systems Team to identify and facilitate the collection and analysis of accurate and reliable data for BCCNP to make various informed business decisions.DOES THIS SOUND LIKE YOU?Data is like a puzzle for you. You enjoy understanding data, linking it to policies, recognizing the relationships of information, how it is classified, who owns it, what legislation enables the College to gather and use it. You have managed databases and data warehouses, and you know how to deliver excellent customer service.WHO WE ARE:BCCNP is the college empowered under the Health Professions Act to regulate the practice of all licensed practical nurses, registered nurses, registered psychiatric nurses and nurse practitioners in British Columbia. Regulation helps to protect the public by ensuring that professional care or service received by the public is competent, ethical and meets the standards that society views as acceptable.At BCCNP each of us strives to meet our commitment to the following values to maintain a workplace that is respectful and supports the well-being of every BCCNP employee:Trust is essentialBetter togetherSpeak the truthProtect the publicStay curiousAs a member of the team, you can expect to be treated in a respectful and professional manner. While your workload will be busy, the College supports staff in achieving a healthy work-life balance.WHAT WILL YOU BE DOING?Reporting to the Chief Officer, Operations, and working closely with the Information Management and Corporate Risk Team Lead the Data Analyst (DA) requires an understanding of BCCNP’s mandate and statutory obligations to collect and disclose information under our legislative framework and information sharing agreements signed with external organizations.The work of the DA is to identify and facilitate the collection of accurate and reliable data for BCCNP to make informed business decisions on our registrants, support the authorized disclosure of information and to support strategic decision making, including developing reports for the management team, BCCNP Board, external stakeholders, and for predictive analytics.The DA is responsible for working with data owners to ensure the quality and integrity of data collected and created by BCCNP is reliable.RESPONSIBILITIES INCLUDE:Planning, coordinating, controlling, developing and implementing controls on the lifecycle management of data including data analysis, data preparation, data modelling, and data evaluation.Leading the evaluation of data needs of stakeholders and researching, implementing, and supporting business intelligence tools to meet these needs. Reviewing and making recommendations to improve the delivery of data requests, reports and to support e-discovery and/or FOI requests.Assessing the data, including understanding the interrelationships among data elements, investigating data quality issues, and working with the relevant data owners and stakeholders to correct and/or improve data quality issues.Implementing and maintaining a data migration project and/or a national registry.Developing and implementing various data modelling techniques to address the business needs of stakeholders, to detect patterns, interrelationships, and abnormalities among various data elements and making predictions, forecasts and monitoring trends.Responding to requests from internal and external stakeholders for data, developing reports and data extracts in meeting reporting requirements, assessing the key attributes of data and information (i.e.) integrity, accuracy, timeliness, appropriateness and their limitations within the context of the intended use.Developing, implementing and maintaining a data glossary and data dictionary which includes defining, classifying information fields and mapping BCCNP data with external organizations’ data structure as stipulated in our information sharing agreements.Reviewing and recommending policies and processes to control where data is stored and how it is shared.Assessing and evaluating data models periodically to determine the reliability and usefulness of the models in supporting business and data objectives.Monitoring and verifying that the data extracted from organizational systems is correct.Responding to and addressing privacy and confidentiality considerations relating to requests for information and reports.YOUR EDUCATION & SKILLS:A baccalaureate degree in Mathematics, Computer Science, Information Management or Statistics. An advanced graduate certificate in data analytics is an asset.3 to 5 years of experience as a data/information and/or reporting analyst managing and controlling data.Demonstrated experience working with databases (MS SQL), advanced MS Excel, extract, transform, and load (ETL) frameworks, knowledge of and experience with reporting packages and business intelligence tools.Excellent quantitative, analytical, and problem-solving skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy.Demonstrated knowledge and application of relevant legislation; ethical and legal obligations, guidelines relating to privacy, confidentiality and security of information.Ability to plan, prioritize and manage workload within a time sensitive environment.Demonstrated ability to keep track of industry trends in data analytics including artificial intelligence, machine learning and the Internet of Things.Excellent oral, written and interpersonal communication skills. Ability to use audience appropriate communication and language to present information, analyze results and convey concepts.Ability to work outside of regular work hours, on occasion, to ensure the smooth functioning of BCCNP related systems.Data warehouse implementation and experience with data dictionaries is an asset.Experience with Dynamics CRM and SharePoint is an asset.Ability to develop and apply statistics and statistical methods in managing large amounts of information, and experience with a range of statistical analysis tools is an asset.COMPENSATION AND BENEFITS:As the successful candidate, you will enjoy a generous compensation and benefits package.HOW TO APPLY:To apply, please visit https://www.bccnp.ca/bccnp/Careers/Pages/data-analyst.aspxThe closing date for applications is April 1, 2019.To learn more about our organization, please visit www.bccnp.ca. Thank you for your interest in the BC College of Nursing Professionals.While we appreciate all responses, only shortlisted applicants will be contacted.Job Type: Full-time

job_title: Pension Specialist and Pension Analyst, Data & Employer Services
job_description: The Alberta Teachers' Retirement Fund Board (ATRF) is an organization that takes pride in our outstanding investment management and exceptional plan member services, resulting in more than $16 billion of assets under management on behalf of more than 80,000 plan members.As a growing and diverse organization, we're building for the future and require the skills and talents of people like you. Join our team in Edmonton, Alberta and be part of a high-performing, collaborative group that shares a purpose and a commitment to excellence.OpportunityIn 2018, ATRF has embarked into a multi-year initiative called Project Lantern to ensure we continuously meet our evolving clients’ expectations. Project Lantern is about assessing and modernizing how we deliver services to our members and employers for years to come. It is about understanding how our clients want to consume services, interact and transact with us in the future, while building on our existing solid foundation and service attributes that our clients appreciate. Enhanced experience for members, employers and ATRF staff is at the heart of this project.We are seeking enthusiastic Pension Specialists in Member Services and Pension Analysts in Data and Employer Services to continue delivering exceptional Pension Services operations and allow resources to be allocated to Project Lantern. These permanent positions are members of the Pension Services team which has a broad responsibility in all aspects of the delivery of high quality pension services at ATRF.StakeholdersThe Pension Specialists and Pension Analysts will partner with key individuals in various departments across the organization and will interact on a day-to-day basis with plan members, beneficiaries, other representatives and employers.ResponsibilitiesAs a Pension Specialist, Member Services you would be responsible for: Ensuring accurate and timely processing of all member transactions including retirement, termination, death, reciprocal transfers and service purchases.Processing and peer reviewing benefit payments and other transactions.Providing excellent customer service by communicating with plan members and beneficiaries about their pension entitlements and responding to their questions and requests verbally and in writing.As a Pension Analyst in Data and Employer Services, you would be responsible for: Ensuring timely and complete reporting of employer data by fostering relationships, including providing training to employers on the reporting software and reporting processes.Conducting reconciliations of the employer data and ensuring all required data for the administration of the plan are accurately reported and available for the benefit transactions.Data management, analytics and reporting.Qualifications and ExperienceA post-graduate diploma in business or other relevant field, plus at least two years of experience in pension administration or related experience.A Certified Employee Benefit Specialist (CEBS) or Pension Plan Administration Certificate (PPAC) designation or equivalent would be an asset.Exceptional customer service. Have an interest in working directly with plan members and employers in a professional and highly regulated industry.Strong communication skills, both oral and written. Being fluent in both French and English would be an asset.Self-motivated with strong organizational and time management skills, attention to detail, and the ability to multitask and prioritize.The ability to work efficiently and effectively in a team environment with minimal supervision.Strong analytical and problem-solving skills and a strong aptitude for math.Proficient in the use of Microsoft Office as well as the adaptability to learn in-house systems.The ability to identify inefficiencies with processes and recommend improvements.As one of Alberta's Top 75 Employers we offer a competitive compensation package which includes:100% employer paid benefits, defined benefit pension plan, health & wellness spending accounts, paid volunteer time and much more.Excellent opportunities for professional growth and career development.Learning and development supported through ATRF's education reimbursement program.An engaging, inclusive culture where you can be you!At ATRF, diversity is one of our core strengths. We are an organization that takes pride in ensuring the people we hire and the culture we create reflects and celebrates diversity of thought, background, and experience.Complete details are available on our website at www.atrf.com.To apply, submit resume and cover letter Attention: Carrine Willocks, Recruitment Specialist.Job Type: Full-timeLanguage:English (Required)

About Our CompanyFounded in 2003, Aquatic Informatics provides software solutions that address critical water data management, analytics and compliance challenges for the rapidly growing water industry. Aquatic Informatics is the trusted provider of water management solutions to over 1,000 municipal, federal, state/provincial, hydropower, mining, academic, and consulting organizations in over 60 countries that collect, manage, and process large volumes of water data.Aquatic Informatics’ platforms include AQUARIUSanalytics software for natural environments, WaterTraxcompliance and electronic reporting tools for municipalities, and Linkosoftware for the management of industrial pretreatment and hauled waste records. From source water through to receiving environment, our interconnected data management platforms drive the efficient management of water information across the water cycle to protect human health and reduce environmental impact.Aquatic Informatics is headquartered in Vancouver, Canada and has offices in the US and Australia. We are one of the fastest growing clean technology companies in Canada. We value independent thinking, initiative, teamwork, a relentless pursuit of quality, a playful spirit, and a sense of humour. We like smart people – IQ and EQ – who care about the environment and want to do good in the world.About the OpportunityAs Business Applications Analyst your primary responsibilities are to analyze, document, and gather requirements for the implementation of AQUARIUS software. Ecotagiousis a cleantech software company currently experiencing rapid growth in customers, people and revenues. Our flexible product platform combines a wide range of IoT and energy data, advanced big-data analytics, machine learning and social psychology to help utilities reduce energy demand and meet energy efficiency targets.  To ensure our energy analytic products are optimized, delivering accurate results that lead directly to customer savings, and to help continuously improve and innovate our range of product offerings, we’re currently seeking a creative and experienced Database Analyst.The opportunity. As Database Analyst, you’ll be working with our development and production teams to manage the broad range of energy, home, device and weather data that feeds our advanced disaggregation and analytic processes.  You will continually be thinking about and applying ways to optimize existing data processes to improve quality, automation and efficiency.As a part of the core product delivery organization and collaborating closely with product management as well as customer success teams, this role is an impactfulopportunity to influence,improve and evolve our solutions and to deliver real-worldenergy savingsthrough your efforts. This is a full-time position, based in our downtown Vancouver office. What impact will you have?  Your experience in Database management, software development, and analytic concepts combined with your collaborative approach will enable you to directly drive the continued success and growth of Ecotagiousby improving our products and customer results.Working with both SQL Server Developer Edition on-premise and SQLAzurein the Azure cloud, you will be responsible for maintaining and extending existing database systems used for both real time and batch computation operations. Depending on your skill set, you’ll also have ample opportunity to be involved in and/or be responsible for backend software development projects.Key responsibilities will include:  Working with customer success managers to ensure their clients’ data meets the standards and formats required for our disaggregation engines to run effectively.Building and maintaining ETL processes for new and existing clients.Managing and cross-checking batch run operations in our disaggregation engine.Collaboratively helping to improve all aspects of our data and analytic processes.Providing effective and timely updates across projects, including product feedback.What experience and skills are needed to excel in this position? You have a bachelor’s degree or equivalent training and experience,preferably related to computer science, engineering, IT or database admin.3-5 years progressive experiencein database management, or elated work experience.Comfortable writing advanced SQL queries against relational data structures.Experience using Microsoft SQL Server, Visual Studio and Azure DevOps.Familiar with ETL using Microsoft SQL Integration Services as well as Azure Data Lake Storage and Azure Data Lake Analytics.Ability to quickly grasp the contents of complex documents written in SQL, JSON, XML, Excel and CSV.Deep interest in data, its integrity and analysis.Bonus points for Experience with utility/AMI data architecture, formats and transfer techniques.Demonstrated time management and organizational skills.A passion for the environment and energy conservation.Why join us here? At Ecotagious, we’re a lean, innovative start-up company that’s investing in being a great place to work for all our people – with a dynamic and collaborative work environment, competitive remuneration, comprehensive benefits, comfortable downtown office space, a full kitchen complete with free snacks and beverages, free Friday lunches and lots more.   Beyond the welcoming workplaceand deep spirit of teamwork, we take pride in our position at the intersection of technology and making positive change in the world. We don’t buy carbon credits or plant trees – our business is literally all about helping people use less energy and ultimately reducing greenhouse gas emissions. Work hard, innovate, learn lots and make a difference!  If this sounds like the right challenge for you, we look forward to hearing from you!Job Type: Full-timeEducation:Bachelor's Degree (Required)Location:Vancouver, BC (Required)

job_title: IT TECHNICAL SUPPORT / HELP DESK ANALYST
job_description: The First Peoples’ Cultural Council is a First Nations-run Crown Corporation mandated to support Indigenous language, arts and culture revitalization in British Columbia, and is based in Victoria, British Columbia. We are looking for a capable IT Technical Support / Help Desk Analyst to join our growing team in supporting the success of FPCC programs in B.C.SummaryThe IT Technical Support / Help Desk Analyst is responsible for providing technical support in the configuration, installation, maintenance and utilization of systems software, hardware, network and storage platforms, and FPCC applications and servers, including providing Tier 1 & 2 problem resolution for FPCC users, customers and vendors. The Technical Support / Help Desk Analyst is responsible for operating and controlling installed information systems, and sets up, submits and verifies all work for internal and external clients. The position assists in the maintenance and day-to-day operation of the security and data backup system. The position receives technical direction and support from the Information Technology Manager.Responsibilities:Provides technical support by receiving calls, diagnosing and resolving problems, and collaborating with more senior staff as required on priorities or problem resolution.Escalates, and follows up on, unresolved problems with technical support staff, vendors or systems specialists; tests and verifies the service incident fix or solution.Generates systems usage and incidence statistics, trend reports, and maintains current user contact information for Service Level Management.Builds a repository of information and frequently asked questions and problems.Performs systems testing and makes recommendations regarding proposed new applications/systems and their compatibility or impact on existing systems, applications, processes and maintenance services.Reviews quality of systems, procedures and services; identifies issues and makes recommendations for systems and maintenance improvements to specialists/team leaders.Participates in technical evaluation of new or upgraded systems and procedures.Participates on information technology project teams to identify changes required to hardware, software, custom application and training requirements.Advises clients on upgrades, network outages, systems problems, upcoming enhancements and procedural changes.Conducts performance assessment of services for effectiveness and efficiency, interprets and reports on systems performance and recommends improvements.Provides technical support to remote users for assigned projects, including the requirements for network, power, data cabling, and vendor installation services associated with changing/setting up office environments.Monitors use of software licenses by employees and escalates misuse.Prepares requisitions to purchase technology hardware, software, contracted services, and maintenance/support agreements.Applies policies and procedures, interprets and evaluates work requests, maintains the planned schedules and coordinates production batch runs to meet service and deadline demands.Prepares processing documentation, makes recommendations for alternate approaches and performance enhancements and performs ongoing reviews of effectiveness and efficiency.Creates and tests processing scripts to support business and computer system applications and modifies processing scripts to complete the regular and unscheduled work.Identifies and analyzes a range of system messages, codes, and status reports, to monitor and resolve operational problems as necessary.Tests, analyzes and installs new and existing software and systems to determine processing requirements/conflicts and recommends alternative approaches. Tests system changes, hardware and software components using prepared test scripts for integration and compatibility into production environment and reports outcomes.Follows procedures to perform system migration tasks to implement new/modified applications and ensures compatibility with the FPCC environment.Monitors and reports utilization/capacity for data storage, network utilization, software licensing, and user IDs.Archives data according to established standards and procedures.Provides input into Corporate IT policies and procedures.Analyzes and determines reasons for failure and implements fix or recovery.Participates and supports administration of IT security.Education & ExperienceA Diploma, certification or equivalent in the computer science field, combined with at least two years, of related experience, preferably in a client-focused work environment, or an acceptable combination of education and experience.Skills and AbilitiesMust possess demonstrated skills and abilities as outlined below:Ability to participate in project teams including application developers, business area users and technical resources.Ability to work to established standards of accuracy.Ability to work effectively in a project team environment and organize and set own priorities.Demonstrates customer focus and establish effective interpersonal relationships.Demonstrates professional conduct.Applies conceptual thinking and judgment.Provides excellent customer service.Demonstrates innovation and a keen interest in keeping up to date with technology.Skilled in identification and resolution of majority of technical problems and tracking, escalating and following up on unresolved problems.Effective oral, written and listening skills in dealings with clients, vendors and staff.Skill in employing discretion, listening, and verbal skills including utilizing these skills with remote clients when solving problems over the telephone, and relaying solutions or recommendations.Experience preparing effective detailed reports.Excellent organizational skills, including ability to manage multiple deadlines.Ideally brings an Indigenous point of view and an understanding of the importance of what FPCC does and the value of Indigenous arts, heritage, languages and culturesInterest in and knowledge of First Nations issues in B.C.For more information about the First Peoples’ Cultural Council, visit: www.fpcc.caSubmissions from applicants with Indigenous ancestry are strongly encouraged to apply. Only short-listed candidates will be contacted. All applications will be treated with strict confidentiality.Job Type: Full-timeExperience:IT Support: 2 years (Required)Help Desk: 1 year (Preferred)

PURPOSEThe Research Analyst will work internally with Sales and Marketing teams to help develop research pieces which support the sale of PATTISON Outdoor Advertising products, educate our teams as well as our end clients, and provide context in terms of industry trends. The successful applicant will have strong problem-solving skills, be able to work under tight deadlines, and take pride in producing accurate, high quality work. This position will report to the Research & Insights Team Lead.ESSENTIAL DUTIESCollect and analyze data from syndicated resources on consumer demographics, psychographics, and habits in order to identify opportunities for sale of PATTISON’s products across Canada.Prepare reports which derive strong insights from data and deliver them in a concise, visually impactful way that is easy to understand.Manage and coordinate all aspects of the research process from survey research design, analysis and interpretation of results through to preparation of reports and delivery of presentations.Communicate clearly with supervisors, peers and Marketing team members in person, via email, and on the phone.SKILLS & EXPERIENCEUndergraduate degree in business, psychology, sociology, political science, or a related discipline. Diploma in a market research-focused program and knowledge of the advertising industry are both assets.A minimum of two (2) years of experience in Canadian market research (supplier or client side) companies.Familiarity with Numeris RTS, Vividata, Numerator, and/or Environics data is an asset but not required. Knowledge of location mobility data is an asset.Experience in managing custom research projects, interpreting respondent data and providing insights or recommendations and delivery error-proof work.Critical thinker, with strong logic, reasoning and problem-solving skills. Able to assess research questions at hand and determine the best solution using available resources.Active learner, open to taking direction and able to apply feedback to future tasks.Strong communicator who articulates ideas clearly, asks questions confidently, and listens actively in order to ensure complete understanding and retaining of key messages.Well-developed time management skills, with the ability to juggle multiple timelines, prioritize changing needs, and keep team members as well as clients updated on timing expectations.A high proficiency with the MS Office Suite.The short-listed candidates will be required to undergo a test on site and/or off site and provide their certifications (e.g. technical certifications) and portfolios in any forms to showcase their skills and knowledge during the interview process.Pattison Outdoor Advertising is an equal opportunities employer. We welcome and encourage applications from people with disabilities. We are committed to providing employment accommodation in accordance with the Ontario Human Rights Code and the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act. $50 - $60 an hourContractJob SummaryINTRODUCTIONThe Ministry of Central Services (the Ministry), on behalf of the Government of Saskatchewan (GoS) requires one (1) or more qualified Senior Business Analyst(s) to join the Ministry of Justice.Contract DurationThe duration of the Contract will be for one (1) year with options to extend the contract for up to two (2) additional years.Job Type / CategoryPosition OverviewThe Ministry of Central Services is looking for one (1) or more Senior Business Analyst(s) to work with the Strategic Systems and Innovation branch (SSI) of the Ministry of Justice, dedicated to the IJIMS (Integrated Justice Information Management Systems) portfolio of projects. CompanyThe award-winning Vancouver Public Library has been dedicated to meeting the lifelong learning, reading and information needs of Vancouver residents for more than 100 years. Our vision is an informed, engaged and connected city. Our mission is a free place for everyone to discover, create and share ideas and information.Our public library is the last freely available indoor public space in Vancouver – open to everyone. We help people of all ages to pursue their passions and to fulfill their creative potential. Across 21 locations and online, VPL is the most visited major urban library per capita in Canada. VPL values a diverse workforce which represents the vibrant community we so proudly serve. Consider joining our committed team of staff and being part of an innovative, inclusive and rewarding workplace.MAIN PURPOSE & FUNCTIONReporting to the Manager, Policy & Planning, the incumbent is responsible for data compilation and analysis, report writing and research in support of organization-wide planning, marketing activities, library performance measurement, and policy management. This role gathers, researches, and interprets quantitative and qualitative information from a wide variety of sources; presents information in suitable formats; drafts reports; and provides project management support for initiatives led by the Department. The incumbent works collaboratively within the team and system-wide to deliver on the Library’s goals and objectives.The incumbent demonstrates and models conduct that adheres to the Library’s policies and procedures in accordance with the Library’s vision, mission and values.Duties and ResponsibilitiesCollects, compiles, analyzes and interprets data from a variety of sources to support strategic initiatives, planning and departmental projects. Duties include: converting data from internal and external sources into local databases and spreadsheets; interpreting data; and preparing narrative and graphic material for inclusion in reports and presentations.Drafts and edits reports for manager review, including strategic plan progress reports for management and Board, annual operating report, and annual provincial grant report.Performs special research tasks and analysis on a variety of topics as required. Contributes to the planning and execution of primary research projects.Liaises with internal and external contacts, such as VPL and City of Vancouver staff, to gather and/or provide quantitative and qualitative information for organizational planning, reporting and forecasting.Maintains the Board and Administrative policies of the Library under the direction of the Manager, Policy & Planning.Conducts research to inform the development and maintenance of VPL’s policy management framework.Provides research and analytical support to staff throughout the organization; shares best practices and enables the adoption of evaluation / assessment tools and processes.Applies project management principles and practices to planning, research and analytical projects and other types of strategic and operational initiatives.Creates and delivers presentations related to the work of the unit for peers and colleagues; undertakes research, provides input and graphic support for manager’s presentations to library senior management and the Board.Maintains awareness of emerging demographic, technological, and social trends and changes, and supports interpretation of the ways these and other trends will impact library services.Participates in professional development activities to ensure currency with trends and best practices relevant to library planning, research, analysis and policy-related work.Job RequirementsEducation/Qualifications:Successful completion of a university degree, preferably at the Master’s level, in Business Administration, Social Sciences or other relevant discipline. Successful completion of university-level coursework in statistical and research methodologies is also required.Experience: One to three years of related work experience in a business or public sector setting.Required Knowledge, Skills and Abilities: Proven ability to collect, compile, analyze and interpret quantitative and qualitative data, and to prepare related reports and presentations.Knowledge of analytical and research techniques, particularly as they are applied to strategic planning, business planning and performance measurement.Sound analytical skills, including the manipulation of data and the interpretation of patterns and trends.Sound written communication skills, including solid report writing and editing skills. Strong presentation and oral communication skills.Considerable skills in using Microsoft Office, with considerable knowledge and experience using Excel, Word and Powerpoint. Experience with statistical analysis software is an asset.Ability to learn and quickly adapt to software used for reporting writing, presentation materials, mapping, data compilation and analysis.Knowledge of trends and issues affecting public libraries and library services and policies.Knowledge of project management principles and practices.Strong organizational and time management skills; ability to deal with multiple tasks and meet competing deadlines.Ability to work collaboratively and supportively in a team environment, and to build effective and trusting relationships with colleagues and internal and external contacts at all levels.Job Type: Full-timeEducation:Bachelor's Degree (Required)

Position Title:  Supply Chain Process AnalystPosition Type: Intermediate, Full-time, PermanentDepartment: OperationsLocation: Edmonton, AlbertaStart Date: April 7, 2019Organization SummaryBased in Edmonton, priMED is a leading designer, manufacturer and marketer of single-use medical products to customers worldwide. This includes all aspects of supply chain and logistics operations including inventory planning, connecting with suppliers and customers to ensure production capacity is maximized, collaborating with various departments to develop a strategic plan, and ensure delivery of products to various customers and partners worldwide.Position OverviewThe Supply Chain Process Analyst (SCPA) is responsible for developing decision support tools that will assist the Operations department in making important strategic business decisions. This includes planning and monitoring of an inventory management system along with analyzing unique costing opportunities. In addition, this position is responsible for managing the rebate program and administering ad hoc sales reports when necessary.The SCPA is a key member of priMED’s success and requires exceptional communication skills, team involvement, interpersonal skills and professionalism in order to perform day to day job tasks. They will analyze the structure, operations, and work instructions in place and propose, plan, and implement improvements.Working RelationshipsThe Supply Chain Process Analyst reports directly to the Senior Operations Planner. Other close internal working relationships include the Director of Operations, Customer Service & Logistics Manager, Senior IT Manager, Finance team, Product Managers and the Sales & Business Development teams. External working relationships include Distributors, Customers and Contractors.ResponsibilitiesThe Supply Chain Process Analyst works closely with the Senior Operations Manager and business stakeholders and analysts to model and mine priMED’s supply chain data. Company:
Opta Information Intelligence Corp.
Full-time Intermediate Business Analyst - SDLC (Markham)
Job Description Summary
Job Description:
Role Summary

Reporting to the Manager of Business Systems, the incumbent will be acting as a business analyst, and R&D resource. He/she has an understanding of software development life cycle (SDLC), requirements and testing practices, and a proven ability of working with internal and external stakeholders. Incumbent will deliver product changes, customized solutions and associated documentation that maintains product stability, delivers value and create sustainable market advantage enabling the organization to achieve its goals and objectives.

He/she will also deliver improved internal delivery systems and processes. This will include building strong working relationships with all stakeholders, internal and external, and with clients by providing knowledgeable and beneficial assistance to their challenges. Strong communication and interpersonal skills is a requirement.


Competencies required to succeed

Strong communication and interpersonal skills.
Ability to build and maintain good relationships with internal and external stakeholders.
Strong service orientation – actively looking for ways to help people.
Detail,analytical and process oriented.
Worked with large data files and data manipulation
Creative with an ability to solve problems.
Self-motivated.
Strong work ethic.
Works well on his/her own and in a team environment.
Excellent time management and organizational skills with the ability to multi-task.
Ability to prioritize and complete tasks with strong attention to detail and accuracy

Responsibilities

The incumbent will liaise with internal and external stakeholders as an integral part of performing his/her responsibilities.
Understand the benefits and features of assigned product/service lines, including iClarify Residential, iClarify Commercial and Peril score and familiar with manipulating and working with large, complex data files. Also be able to effectively communicate such to other parties.
Develop and document requirements and use cases for all changes to assigned products including associated test cases, matrices and approaches. Execute testing as identified.
Work with other departments to identify business needs and implement change while ensuring that business requirements for successful implementation of initiatives are accurately and thoroughly understood and defined.
Support, and where required, creating and updating front line user documentation, FAQ’s, manual’s and technical documentation.
Work with stakeholders on strategic research and development of identified product lines.
Provide summary reporting to management on his/her ongoing work, analysis and projects.
Support other company projects as required.

Education, knowledge and experience required

Written and oral fluency in English.
Written and oral fluency in French would be a strong bonus.
Minimum 3 years work experience in a property insurance or risk control in a business analyst role or equivalent.
Strong computer and telephone skills.
Working knowledge of SDLC, specifically requirements documentation and testing practices. CBAP preferred.
Working knowledge of property insurance and insurance principles.
Strong training and experience in statistics, data analytics or predictive modeling would be beneficial.
Post-Secondary Certificate or Degree in computer science or statistics preferred.
Formal Project Management training and experience is preferred
OPTA and affiliates welcome and encourage applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available on request for candidates throughout the recruitment and assessment process

Company:
Opta Information Intelligence Corp.
Full-time Intermediate Business Analyst - SDLC (Markham)
Job Description Summary
Job Description:
Role Summary

Reporting to the Manager of Business Systems, the incumbent will be acting as a business analyst, and R&D resource. He/she has an understanding of software development life cycle (SDLC), requirements and testing practices, and a proven ability of working with internal and external stakeholders. Incumbent will deliver product changes, customized solutions and associated documentation that maintains product stability, delivers value and create sustainable market advantage enabling the organization to achieve its goals and objectives.

He/she will also deliver improved internal delivery systems and processes. This will include building strong working relationships with all stakeholders, internal and external, and with clients by providing knowledgeable and beneficial assistance to their challenges. Strong communication and interpersonal skills is a requirement.


Competencies required to succeed

Strong communication and interpersonal skills.
Ability to build and maintain good relationships with internal and external stakeholders.
Strong service orientation – actively looking for ways to help people.
Detail,analytical and process oriented.
Worked with large data files and data manipulation
Creative with an ability to solve problems.
Self-motivated.
Strong work ethic.
Works well on his/her own and in a team environment.
Excellent time management and organizational skills with the ability to multi-task.
Ability to prioritize and complete tasks with strong attention to detail and accuracy

Responsibilities

The incumbent will liaise with internal and external stakeholders as an integral part of performing his/her responsibilities.
Understand the benefits and features of assigned product/service lines, including iClarify Residential, iClarify Commercial and Peril score and familiar with manipulating and working with large, complex data files. Also be able to effectively communicate such to other parties.
Develop and document requirements and use cases for all changes to assigned products including associated test cases, matrices and approaches. Execute testing as identified.
Work with other departments to identify business needs and implement change while ensuring that business requirements for successful implementation of initiatives are accurately and thoroughly understood and defined.
Support, and where required, creating and updating front line user documentation, FAQ’s, manual’s and technical documentation.
Work with stakeholders on strategic research and development of identified product lines.
Provide summary reporting to management on his/her ongoing work, analysis and projects.
Support other company projects as required.

Education, knowledge and experience required

Written and oral fluency in English.
Written and oral fluency in French would be a strong bonus.
Minimum 3 years work experience in a property insurance or risk control in a business analyst role or equivalent.
Strong computer and telephone skills.
Working knowledge of SDLC, specifically requirements documentation and testing practices. CBAP preferred.
Working knowledge of property insurance and insurance principles.
Strong training and experience in statistics, data analytics or predictive modeling would be beneficial.
Post-Secondary Certificate or Degree in computer science or statistics preferred.
Formal Project Management training and experience is preferred
OPTA and affiliates welcome and encourage applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available on request for candidates throughout the recruitment and assessment process

Sinclair Dental is a proud leader in the Dental Supply Industry, distributing over 20,000 unique dental products. We’re privately owned and we are growing. Our success is due to our entrepreneurial spirit and our unwavering commitment to customer excellence. Join our team of more than 600 employees across Canada.Do you feel you have gone about as far as you can in your current job?Opportunity knocksWe require an experienced Business Analyst who will analyze data related to accounting workflow, processes, and reporting to evaluate and improve the efficiency of current-state business processes. You’ll be responsible for creating, communicating, and implementing best practice internal accounting policy and procedure guidelines to provide solutions to maintain and strengthen internal controls.Your storyYou have been working as a Senior Accountant for 5+ years and have solid project management experience. You are recognized for your ability to analyze processes, redesign initiatives and develop efficient and robust accounting policies & procedures. You are a skilled communicator who is able to easily achieve buy in from stakeholders. You are an advanced user of Excel, creating vlookups and pivot tables with ease.What’s in it for youIn return, you’ll be partnering with successful, growing company in a strong market. You will be offered a competitive salary, extensive benefits coverage, complimentary parking, and access to our onsite gym facility.What you need to do nowIf you feel this is your next career step, please send us your resume.Thank you in advance for your interest in Sinclair Dental! We know that exploring a new career opportunity takes considerable time and energy and for that, we sincerely appreciate your decision to apply to Sinclair Dental, we think you’ve made a great choice!While we greatly appreciate all the resumes we receive, please be advised that only candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.Job Type: Full-timeExperience:accounting: 5 years (Preferred)business analysis: 5 years (Preferred)

Job no: 502284
Brand: Finance
Work type: Full time
Location: British Columbia
Categories: Business Support

Data Reporting Analyst - Vancouver

About the opportunity

As part of our Americas Business Intelligence Team, the Data Reporting Analyst is responsible for assessing business analysis needs including gathering requirements, analyzing source system data, and developing proof-of-concept data models and visualizations. In addition, the candidate will dig deep into company data to uncover insights and information to help drive profit, process improvements and best practices.


Duties and Responsibilities

Designing and developing enterprise-wide data analysis and reporting solutions (as opposed to reporting silos)
Converting functional requirements into technical solutions
Analyzing data from multiple internal and external sources
Helping visualize technical data in a way that is meaningful to business decision makers
Understanding, interpreting and applying business rules to ensure a high level of data integrity and consistency
Engaging and consulting with team members on new data, business needs and opportunities to improve system effectiveness
Scrutinize and assemble raw data from multiple sources, generate reports, automate best practices and build dashboards that facilitate efficiency, profit gains and productivity
Work with operational stakeholders and the project management team to assess needs and document requirements
Testing, reconciliation and validation of data and coordination of UAT for production-ready products
Recommendations on process changes and best practices
Skills / Experience

Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy
Experience with SQL and dimensional modelling
Experience with data transformation/ETL and proof of concept development
Experience with tools such as Alteryx, Tableau, Power BI or other visualization and analysis tools
Strong interpersonal and communication skills with the ability to develop relationships at all levels
High level of commercial acumen and professionalism
“Agile” in both personality and development philosophy – a high degree of flexibility and the ability to deal with change and a high-pressure work environment
A team-focused individual that enjoys collaboration and can “leave the ego at the door “Highly creative and outside-the-box thinker who believes “it’s always possible”


If this sounds like you, come on board with a global organization, and one of Canada’s 50 Most Admired Corporate Cultures!


We thank all candidates for their interest however only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

Our promise is to provide an environment with equality of respect, dignity and opportunity for all our employees. We value an inclusive and supportive workplace which truly reflects the diversification of our society. $37.07 - $42.13 an hourReporting to the Supervisor, Spatial Solutions Services, the GIS Data Analyst is required to maintain and assist in administering the City’s Corporate GIS database (i.e. data entry, editing, manipulation and quality control). Performs information product generation tasks (i.e. queries, geo-processing, tabular summaries and reports), and provides customer service to internal staff and external clients. Assists in the development of methodologies for database input and maintenance by staff
QUALIFICATIONS & REQUIREMENTS:
University Degree or College Diploma in Geographic Information Systems, Engineering, Land Surveying, Geography and Urban Planning or related disciplines including Library Science, Computer Science, Information Systems. Five (5) to seven (7) years of demonstrated experience and proven knowledge in mapping and spatial database analysis and user support, including practical experience working with GIS technology (Esri suite of products preferred), preferably in a municipal environment.
Must have knowledge of standards and methodologies for GIS data management including, integration, conversion, manipulation, transfer, compatibility, valuation, storage and maintenance, data security and quality controls for data entry to manage the data life cycle. Demonstrated experience and proven knowledge in designing and implementing spatial database technology, preferably in a municipal or related environment. Working knowledge and experience with a range of GIS products, processes, and principles (e.g. Esri ArcGIS), GIS databases (e.g. ArcSDE, Oracle 12c, SQL Server), GIS terminology, GIS methods and techniques, scripting languages (eg. FME, Python), cartography procedures, coordinate systems and projections, geo-spatial digital imagery, digital equipment (e.g. survey, GPS, data collectors) on-site users GIS and tool support and trouble-shooting, managing GIS software and databases.
Working knowledge of relevant legislation (i.e. Freedom of Information and Protection of Privacy Act, etc), and procedures related to information management, data standards, intellectual property rights, data security, copyright license data sharing agreements and privacy to ensure data is maintained in a secure environment and that the City's interests are met and value gained.
Must have good attention to detail and demonstrate analytical, problem solving and technical skills to manage, maintain, update and prepare database records (spatial & tabular formats), manipulating, analyzing and managing tabular and spatial data; and to resolve technical problems and information requirements by gathering/analyzing data, selecting/designing desired file and record format requirements, documenting revisions undertaken.
Knowledge of project management methodologies, including capacity to monitor projects, track work and provide input into work planning; and working knowledge of office software applications (e.g. Outlook, Word, Excel, PowerPoint) in support of communications, reporting, presentations and training.
Good written and oral communications skills including experience preparing reports, technical instructions, and data share agreements. Good interpersonal skills to effectively deal with requests and concerns of clients/partners.
Ability to work both independently as well as in a team environment, work under pressure and meet deadlines.

Knowledge of project management methodologies, including capacity to monitor projects, track work and provide input into work planning; and working knowledge of office software applications (e.g. Outlook, Word, Excel, PowerPoint) in support of communications, reporting, presentations and training.
Good written and oral communications skills including experience preparing reports, technical instructions, and data share agreements. Good interpersonal skills to effectively deal with requests and concerns of clients/partners.
Ability to work both independently as well as in a team environment, work under pressure and meet deadlines.

The Analyst will help guide businesses areas within Individual Customer in improving processes, products, services through data mining and analysis. The role requires high mathematical capability and problem solving skills combined with the ability to translate complex problems into plain language commiserate to the audience.

Accountabilities:
Identify business problems, that if remedied, will return significant commercial value (either through increase sales, reduced cost, or lowered risk)
Delineate, with specificity, the underlying root causes and contributors causing the business problem through quantitative/fact-based analyses
Work with large data-sets (millions of records & thousands of variables)
Work with data-sets that are not always clean, consistent, & fully modelled
Mix of proficiency with SAS, SPSS, R, SQL, VBA, Python, Tableu, PowerBI
While this job requires mathematical skills, it also requires strong presentation & communication skills as there will be significant interaction with executive leadership across multiple lines of business. Insurance experience preferred

Qualifications and Competencies:
Post secondary degree (or equivalent) required, as well as at least 1 year of experience
Highly proficient in the other core Microsoft Office applications
Ability to communicate effectively with management, advisors, customers, and prospects
Strong analytical skills for problem solving purposes and to monetize value for the organization
Strong creative thinking skills to determine unique ways to deliver on unmet customer needs
Proven interpersonal / teamwork skills on high performing teams
Experience working on project teams to analyze business needs
Proven ability to learn and handle multiple priorities in a challenging work environment
Proven ability to think at an abstract level

$120,000 a yearPermanentOur client…

Our client, a global asset management firm, is looking for a Dynamics 365 Business Analyst who is used to working in a large, complex environment. They are looking for a professional who will provide a detailed understanding on the features and functionality of MS Dynamics 365 for Finance and Operations from the user and technical aspect and how the business process is achieved using the application.

What's in it for you?

You would be joining a dynamic organization that embraces cutting edge technology to drive their business vision. In addition to a generous compensation package, our client empowers its teams to harness new ideas, and allows staff unleash their imaginations to create innovative products and services to improve services and respond to customer needs.

Responsibilities:

Accountable for MS Dynamics 365 for Operations ongoing support and enhancements, business requirements definition, end user access, and configuration.
Ensure quality and timely delivery of support to end users by documenting application support procedures for Tier 1 and 2 support groups.
Participate in all phases of the Solution Delivery Life Cycle including planning, requirements definition, solution design, test execution, and implementation of business applications.
Work with Program Director and Service Delivery Managers to analyze and validate the business needs of project stakeholders.
Complete applicable project-related documentation, including; design specifications, application test plans, test cases and scripts, as well as end-user and system admin guides.
Perform impact analysis of changes to an application or technology platform.
Manage small to medium-sized solutions, including minor enhancements, reports development, and operational support of MS Dynamics 365 for finance and operations.
Work closely with the Applications Support, Service Delivery, and other Application Management teams to ensure business systems and system implementations are supported appropriately.
Participate in Project Intake Phase to help develop appropriate time and cost estimates for discovery and high-level requirements definition.
Must Have:

Strong understanding of Global Corporate Finance and large scale Finance ERP
Understand financial reporting and various financial process
Advanced Microsoft Excel skills
A strong aptitude for numbers, problem solving and data analytics
3-5 years' Finance operations experience, with strong interest in Technology in particular in ERP or GL applications (e.g. SAP, Oracle, IFS, Dynamics).
Experience in Solution Development Life Cycle, including; design (creating functional/technical specifications), test scripts and other system administration, and support documentation.
Knowledge of accounting guidelines and principles. Experience with Platform, Storage, Monitoring, Network, Data Centre, and Desktop technologies.
Nice to Have:

Bachelor's degree preference: Finance or Information Technology degree
Process engineering (Black belt) is an asset

Would you like to be part of a company involved in the transmission of clean drinking water for more than 150 years? Singer Valve of Mueller Water Products, the nation's leading manufacturer of flow control devices for the water and gas distribution industries, has an immediate opening for a Plan for Every Part (PFEP) Analyst in our Surrey, B.C. facility. Mueller's manufacturing commitment ensures one of the world’s most precious resources, clean drinking water, reaches millions of people on a daily basis. Come be a part of something that sustains and enriches the lives of every human being. This position reports to the Buyer.

Responsibilities will include, but are not limited, to:

Drive working capital improvements and lead-time reductions using the Plan For Every Part (PFEP) process
Create, implement, and improve PFEP standard work with appropriate revision and control levels
Teach and train the PFEP process cross functionally
Support purchasing and production as needed
Process invoicing exceptions
Controlled maintenance of the PFEP following established guidelines and standard work
Required Skills:

Strong written and verbal communication skills
Work effectively in a team. Knowing role on team, based on project/task
Demonstrated ability to successfully achieve goals through influence
Demonstrated analytical mindset
Have ability to follow and challenge Standard Work processes on a daily basis (planning, system messages, etc.)
Ability to adapt to system/technology changes as well as use of current systems
Ability to identify road blocks in material/information flow to manage exceptions.
Demonstrated advanced skills in Excel
Ability to blend multiple sources of data to formulate opinions and recommendations
No restriction to travel internationally (i.e. USA and Asia)
Analytics: Analysis of data contained in our ERP system and other systems with the goal of continuously improving the flow of materials and data through Singer operations
Required Experience:

1 to 5 years of professional supply chain experience
ERP program experience – SAP, Syspro, AGILE, JDE - Preferred
Ability to learn and understand mechanical products
4-year degree desired but a combination of education and experience will be considered
Education:

Graduate of a business operations management program – diploma or 4 year degree
APICs training an asset
Undergraduate education in business or engineering an asset

Job Title: Technical Analyst
Department: Omnichannel
Job Overview and Responsibilities
The Aldo Group is investing in the creation of a world-class Omnichannel experience for its customers around the globe. Our digital experience lineup includes our consumer mobile app and responsive websites, in-store technologies such as beacons and sales associates’ apps to name a few. Reporting to the Senior Product owner of Store Applications, the technical analyst will work directly with internal stakeholders to ensure the delivery of changes and enhancements to applications used by our store associates.
Elicit, gather and document solution requirements or business processes
Help identify desired results and provide an understanding of the opportunity or problem
Gain consensus and ensure stakeholder sign-off of proposed solution
Prepare detailed functional specifications and supporting documents to guide development teams
Assist in scope definition and managing initiatives from definition through implementation, providing necessary updates and communication to stakeholders
Work with developers to ensure requirements are understood and proposed architecture aligns with best practice
Contribute to test case development and coordination with QA
Work with QA to review requirements and test scripts and assist in prioritizing and closing defects
Plan and coordinate User Acceptance Testing for global stakeholders
Meet deadlines and communicate any delays in a timely manner
Monitor overall project progress and timeline
Coordinate across business and technology teams to push delivery according to agreed schedules
Assist in coordinating global project team activities
Support project team members as to resolve problems and issues in a proactive manner
Produce quality deliverables and ensure that the solutions delivered are documented adequately
Part of a 24/7 on call rotation

3 to 5 years of demonstrated professional experience
Strong written, verbal and interpersonal skills, including the ability to interact effectively with business stakeholders to understand the business and gather requirements
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Familiarity with SDLC, Agile, Kanban and project management methodology
Ability to make effective decisions under pressure
Proactively take on projects with minimal supervision
Ability to communicate complex analysis in a clear, precise, and actionable manner

About the Role

L3 WESCAM Service Operations team is looking for a new member to drive the development and delivery of process and technical solutions. The ideal candidate will be responsible for the leadership of projects to develop and/or implement new tools and processes to improve the management of customer repairs and material forecasting. This individual will play a hands on role working with cross functional teams to facilitate workshops, capture business requirements, create functional specifications and prepare gap analysis.
As part of this role, you will become a subject matter expert of ERP system and key tools. This role will allow you to continue to develop your Business Analytics, Project Management and technical skills.

About L3 WESCAM
At L3 WESCAM, we develop the most advanced and complex optical and sensor systems for global defense and military sectors, Homeland Security, Search and Rescue and Airborne law enforcement. From long-range covert surveillance missions to search and rescue operations, our MX-series systems, and the mission systems solutions they are a part of, produce stabilized high-magnification electro-optical and infrared images from airborne, marine and ground based platforms, enabling our customers to see farther and react quicker.

L3 WESCAM offers a culture of true innovation and collaboration, and above all - work that you can be proud to be a part of. What we do protects and saves lives around the world. To experience more, go to http://www.WESCAM.com

Learn more about what we do…

Responsibilities
Analyze business processes and synthesize complex information into clear process models and process documentation
Lead workshops to gather requirements and convert into use case, training instructions and departmental practices
Provide support for project management and report weekly updates to the management team
Act as subject matter expert for all aspects of ERP (ERP LN) and related applications for the Service/Repair Operations team
Create project business cases – by interfacing with the management team – to analyze processes, determine project scope, define resource, budget, timelines and document the deliverables
Work with users, management and other business units to investigate issues and make recommendations and implement required changes
Recommend and maintain business system user procedures, system documentation, and standard work instructions to maintain Quality documentation
Develop strong working relationships with the Customer Service, Service Center, Supply Chain, Materials, Quality and Finance teams
Develop functional software design documents and work with developers in production of technical design documents
Ensures the technical design conforms to functional requirements
Participate in System Integration testing and User Acceptance testing with the business users to ensure a high quality delivery of software updates and process changes
Provide status reports to the executive sponsor or other stakeholders as required
Skilled troubleshooting experience to diagnose the root cause of an issue and make recommendations

#LI-GDD

Desired Skills
Strong knowledge of Tier 1 ERP Applications, preferably Infor's ERP LN software package and material forecasting systems
Strong knowledge of Customer Service and Supply Chain business processes
Strong knowledge of Lean Manufacturing concepts
Experience in gathering requirements for and understanding complex work flows across multiple departments
Strong analytical problem solving and investigative ability
Strong written and verbal communication skills
Technical business writing skills is an asset
Knowledgeable with SQL queries and report development (MS SQ, SSRS, PowerBI)
Project Management experience (PMP nice to have)

Ability to lead meetings with stakeholders of all levels

Minimum five years Customer Service experience
Strong customer service skills, and serve as part of a motivated and diverse team

Green Belt certification or experience with lean processes
Life at L3 WESCAM

Our work environment is both challenging and dynamic – our physical environment is state of the art. Here’s what you can expect as an L3 WESCAM employee
Every other Friday off (paid – with our rare 9/80 work schedule)
Free wellness programs
Free fruit and bagels
Subsidized cafeterias
Work/Life balance that is supported
Real opportunities for growth and development
Everyone’s role at L3 WESCAM contributes to saving people’s lives
Diversity & Inclusion
We believe that diversity among our employees makes us a stronger organization.
We are committed to diversity and inclusion within our L3 WESCAM family, and our community by welcoming and encouraging applications from anyone interested without regard to race, colour, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, protected veteran's status, Aboriginal status or any other legally-protected groups. For people with disabilities, we work with you throughout the recruitment process to ensure you have what you need in order to be at your best. If you require any accommodation for any part of the recruitment/interview process, or as you begin you career with us just let us know and we will take care of you.

About L3 Technologies

L3 Technologies is a prime contractor in Command, Control, Communications, Intelligence, Surveillance and Reconnaissance (C3ISR) systems market and a leading provider of a broad range of electronic systems used on both military and commercial platforms. Our customers include the U.S. Department of Defense and its prime contractors, U.S. Government intelligence agencies, the U.S. Department of Homeland Security, allied foreign governments, domestic and foreign commercial customers and select other U.S. federal, state and local government agencies.
Organized into 3 segments – Electronic Systems, Communications Systems and Intelligence Surveillance and Reconnaissance (ISR) Systems – L3 Technologies employs over 31,000 people worldwide with reported 2017 sales of $9.6 billion.

$56,157 a yearThe Workplace Safety and Insurance Board (WSIB) helps people overcome workplace injuries and illnesses and helps business owners make their workplaces safe and healthy. Our people are at the heart of what we do. Bring your enthusiasm and expertise to the WSIB, and we’ll help you achieve your personal and professional goals through meaningful work, development opportunities and a culture of compassion, integrity and teamwork.
We are the WSIB. And we’re here to help.


This is a temporary opportunity for up to 24 months in duration.
Starting Salary: $56,157.00
The WSIB’s Portfolio Management Office is a key partner in achieving the goals of the organization and is currently responsible for the overall management of a large internal systems project.
The position reports directly to the Manager, Portfolio Management Office and is responsible for providing support to the Project Management Office (PMO) of a large-scale project in the analysis of documentation/data and development of project deliverables. This role will ensure the regular updating of project management plans and status reports, as well assisting in the timely communication with project stakeholders related to decisions, risks and issues. In addition, this role will support the PMO to ensure project sponsors and project managers are kept up to date on the project lifecycle.
Key Accountabilities and Responsibilities
Participate in project/program activities and deliverables pursuant to project plans by:

Coordinating status reporting, issues and risk management (including those pertaining to labour relations) and change control procedures following established policies and procedures
Participating in work plan reviews to facilitate resource capacity planning process, as required
Keeping project and portfolio managers appraised of project status and any issues and variances
Performing cross-functional tasks and/or other project-related duties as required
Update and maintain project management collateral which includes:

Assisting in the development of and updates to project charters, presentations, spreadsheets and other material as required
Monitoring adherence to project schedules and budgets, tracking progress and expenses, producing status reports with critical milestones identified and escalating issues and risks to project managers
Maintaining existing project management plans and assisting in the development of new plans for future phases of work using MS project
Participate in the facilitation of stakeholder communication by:

Scheduling, coordinating and participating in meetings and events, collecting and distributing relevant materials, taking detailed meeting minutes and highlighting and following up on action items

Job Summary

You are dynamic Industrial Relations or Human Resources professional early in your career. As the Industrial Relations Analyst you will collaborate with others within the department to build internal/external relationships, provide knowledge and develop expertise through the service and programs provided throughout the company. The Industrial Relations Analyst assists with collective bargaining, labour market research/analysis, grievance management and negotiations to effectively support Ledcor's competitive advantage.


Please join our Industrial Relations team inVancouver, BC today!


Responsibilities

Contribute to the research, administration and distribution of Industrial Relations documents including but not exclusive to wage schedules, meeting minutes, summaries, presentations, Collective Agreements and their associated documents involving unionized employees

Facilitate the completion of external and internal wage and benefit surveys involving unionized employees

Research grievances, labour relations standards, plus other work-related legislation as assigned

Responsible for the maintenance of various documentation including the bi-monthly IR Bulletin, reports and weekly / monthly summary documents
Act as point of contact for internal and external Industrial Relations related inquiries
Interface with Union Representatives on employee related matters including progressive discipline, grievances, wages, working conditions
Establish an external network of professional contacts in order to remain current on Industrial Relation trends
Maintain a positive working relationship between the Industrial Relations department and other business units
Assist Industrial Relations Administration with requests from unionized employees for employment information as required.
Perform other related duties as required

3-5 years of experience in an Industrial Relations or Human Resources role with experience supporting a unionized workforce
Aptitude to develop business skills by broadening one's understanding of internal and external drivers with an ability to learn on the fly and deal with ambiguity

Office based position
