job_title: Junior Application and Finance Data Workflow Analyst, Integrated Service Centre, Finance
job_description:
Position Overview
The Integrated Service Centre within Finance is currently seeking a Full-time Regular Junior Application and Finance Data Workflow Analyst .
Reporting to the Manager of Financial Systems, the analyst is responsible for configuration, maintenance and managing workflow reassignment and delegation activities for the FSCM PeopleSoft system to enable users to manage the day to day business operations for financial transactions for the University of Calgary. There may be situations that require the employee to work outside and in addition to core business hours (e.g. resolving a critical problem, validating a system change).
Position Description
Summary of Key Responsibilities (job functions include but are not limited to):
Support and Maintenance
Clarify and fully resolve workflow issues in a timely manner, coordinating solutions with other support units and external departments as required to ensure accurate and timely approval of Finance transactions
Provide recommendations and direct support to all users specifically on the delegation of Finance transactions in PeopleSoft, as well as the approval and reassignment of Finance Transactions as required
Resolve system issues and apply fixes in order that the various modules are kept up-to-date and working as intended
Test solutions thoroughly using scenarios, scripts and data to validate the development and/or configuration against the design specifications, under the guidance of more senior analysts, and in collaboration with IT Application Developers
Communicate changes to end users and training developers to improve consistency of usage across units and departments
Implement tested and approved solutions into production environments using appropriate change control procedures
Test IT-specific projects in the FSCM system such as version upgrades, application of maintenance packs/bundles, Oracle database upgrades, PeopleTools upgrades, Cobol upgrades, implementation of IT specific applications such as the PeopleSoft Portal under the direction of more senior Application Analysts and in collaboration with IT Application Developers
Participate in cross-functional troubleshooting, analysis and testing with other PeopleSoft functions and IT units (e.g. HCM, Student, Enterprise Reporting)
Business Analysis
Assist with design of solutions and have support responsibility for system configuration and reconfiguration for one or more modules to facilitate approved changes to the system
Assist in the analysis of business requirements to evaluate and recommend appropriate solutions
Qualifications / Requirements:
Undergraduate degree preferred; a combination of IT or business experience, training and education may be considered
Experience in a University environment is preferred
Working knowledge of one or more PeopleSoft FSCM modules, in particular as it relates to business process
Ability to prioritize and organize work, handle multiple assignments and meet deadlines
Ability to work collaboratively and interact respectfully and persuasively with a variety of internal and external contacts
Ability to provide effective advice, information and assistance to a wide range of customers
Excellent verbal and written communication skills, strong problem solving skills; uses diplomacy, good judgement and negotiation skills to seek satisfactory resolutions or implementations
Strong documentation skills and experience implementing new processes and change management strategies
Application Deadline: March 25, 2019
We would like to thank all applicants in advance for submitting their resumes. Please note, only those candidates chosen to continue on through the selection process will be contacted.

Additional Information
This position is classified in the Professional Career Band, Level P2 of the Management and Professional Staff Career Framework.
To find out more about management and staff opportunities at the University of Calgary and all we have to offer, view our Management and Staff Careers website.
About the University of Calgary
The University of Calgary is Canada’s leading next-generation university – a living, growing and youthful institution that embraces change and opportunity with a can-do attitude. Located in the nation’s most enterprising city, the university is making tremendous progress on its Eyes High journey to be recognized as one of Canada’s top five research universities, grounded in innovative learning and teaching and fully integrated with the community it both serves and leads. The University of Calgary inspires and supports discovery, creativity and innovation across all disciplines. For more information, visit ucalgary.ca.
The University of Calgary recognizes that a diverse staff/faculty benefits and enriches the work, learning and research experiences of the entire campus and greater community. We are committed to removing barriers that have been historically encountered by some people in our society. We strive to recruit individuals who will further enhance our diversity and will support their professional success while they are here. We encourage all qualified applicants to apply, however preference will be given to Canadian citizens and permanent residents of Canada.

$45.52 - $47.91 an hourPermanentThe Operations Analyst provides analytical, systems, business process and financial support to the organization through the Revenue and Assessment Services department which includes the operations of the Corporate Accounts Receivable or Assessment and Taxation area. This position requires the ability to utilize past exposure to business environments to successfully manage multiple priorities, including the review, research and analysis of existing processes, systems and procedures, the development and implementation of new initiatives and business processes, the evaluation and development of internal controls and corporate policy and procedure and the ability to interpret, apply and draft complex bylaw/legislation. Reconciliation, analysis and decision making based on complex corporate financial and taxation data is necessary. Project development and leadership, reporting and presentations to senior management, committees and City Council is required. An analytical nature, exceptional communication skills, proven leadership, superior critical thinking, demonstrated project management, strong problem solving and effective persuasion skills are essential in this role. This is largely a self-directed position and requires the incumbent to take initiative, seek opportunities, exercise professional judgment, develop strong working relationships and work independently. Decisions made in this role have impact across the department, organization, on City Council and the public.

Job Requirements:

Professional accounting designation and a university degree with a focus in business, accounting or project management. Equivalent education and experience may be considered.
Six years’ progressively related experience in a sophisticated and integrated system environment preferably in a large organization, with a strong knowledge of business models, decision making tools, accounting principles, financial and management systems and business processes.
Demonstrated experience in the following areas:
project management including coordination and leadership of multi-disciplinary teams
business process development and documentation
development and monitoring of internal controls
risk and gap analysis, critical thinking and evaluation of complex concepts
formal report preparation, including financial impact analysis and evaluation and recommendation of alternatives
proficiency in MS Excel and MS Word. Familiarity with MS Access, MS Powerpoint and MS Outlook
proven aptitude for understanding software system configurations and operations.
The following experience would be considered an asset:
Implementation experience for systems including setup and testing
Experience in municipal fund accounting including the requirements of the MGA (Municipal Government Act) and PSAB (Public Sector Accounting Board)
Experience with forecasting and variance analysis
Exposure to interpreting and applying complex legislation
Exposure to a variety of property tax and/or financial accounting software
Experience with invoicing and collections
In addition to the 9 Core Competencies identified for all employees of the City of Red Deer (Ethics & Values, Service Focus, Thinking, Planning & Organizing, Leadership, Development, Communication & Interaction, Adaptability & Change Management, Understanding the Municipal Political Environment), following are specifically required in the position:
Ability to listen effectively to understand the needs of a wide range of users, synthesize information and prepare and present analyses and business cases to support recommendations
Superior demonstrated accuracy and attention to detail.
Apply advanced accounting and business management principles, knowledge and skills to the maintenance of a multifaceted set of accounting, budgeting and management records.
Perform financial and budgetary analyses, prepare complete financial reports and complex account reconciliation.
Communicate effectively, both verbally and in writing, with the public, other City departments and agencies, including during situations of conflict. Must regularly communicate with customers, contractors, suppliers and other organizations such as the City’s external auditors, legal providers, etc.
Work with considerable independence and focus and demonstrate maturity, initiative and resourcefulness in achieving business objectives.
Handle sensitive and confidential subject matter, which, if improperly handled, could have a significant negative impact on the City.
Prioritize, plan, organize and react in situations of competing activities to ensure deadlines and goals are achieved efficiently and effectively.
Display strong interpersonal, teamwork and flexibility skills.
Create and maintain a safe work place, adhering to the policies and procedures outlined by the City.
Demonstrate leadership and actively participate in building a respectful workplace environment.
Specific Demands of the Job:

High degree of professional judgement, independence and initiative is required in performing these duties while supporting the department and organization
Working within a budget of greater than $200 million in revenues and $3 million in expenditures
Must quickly prioritize work while dealing with frequent interruptions, conflicting priorities and continuously evolving and changing objectives as determined by organization administration, City Council and City residents
Must effectively understand interdepartmental impacts on own results and creatively work within these constraints to meet deadlines
Must work through periods of stress associated with identifying and resolving problems, multi-tasking and working within a team
Required to occasionally work outside regular business hours, including weekends and holidays in order to meet deadlines, especially during project implementations
Affiliation: Canadian Union of Public Employees, Local 417

Normal Hours of Work: 75 hours biweekly, Monday to Friday.

Facilitate risk assessments in accordance with Babcock Canada Risk Management process and policy.
Develop of Risk Management training material and facilitate the education of all stakeholders involved in Risk Management to improve understanding of risk assessment and risk management process.
Identify potential areas of risks within the assigned area, including specific projects related to contract, processes, ship yard production and project management; propose solutions to overcome risks.
Act as point of contact for stakeholders on risk reporting issues; keep them updated on relevant status’ and progress of all risks, issues and opportunities.
Contribute to and maintain the Project /Program Risk Management plan so that all risks are identified, documented and understood by project managers and other stakeholders.
Contribute to and maintain governance arrangements for management process through the project/program lifecycle including proposed improvements.
Develop and maintain Program/Project Risk registers, monitor risk treatment actions such that all parties are informed.
Perform regular qualitative and quantitative risk analysis.
Generate and circulate weekly, monthly and annual performance reports and associated analysis & narrative to inform management of progress of risks and issues as required.
Complete other duties as necessary
As our ideal candidate,
You hold a Bachelor’s Degree in Business Administration, Statistic, Accounting, Finance, Math, or Engineering.
You have 3-5 years’ experience in risk management and/or project risk environment on multiple projects of varying type and project cycle phase.
You may hold a Canadian Risk Management (CRM) designation and/or Project Management Institute – Risk Management Professional (PMI-RMP) designation.
You have exceptional computer skills including proficiency in Microsoft Office, Microsoft Project, Primavera Risk, and strong spreadsheet modelling skills.
You have strong analytical, quantitative, and investigative problem-solving abilities.
You are knowledgeable of ISO 31000:2018.
You have highly refined analytical, communication, facilitation skills, strategic thinking, project management, negotiation and leadership abilities.
You are eligible for a Canadian Secret Security and ITAR Clearance
Applicants, please apply online through our LinkedIn posting or through our website at http://www.babcockcanada.com/ .

Position Title: Financial Analyst

Team and Location: Retail Finance, Calgary, Alberta

Company Profile:
Parkland is unique. We fuel communities by safely delivering high-quality petroleum products to motorists, businesses, consumers and wholesale customers across North America. Through unrivaled dependability and service, we connect communities to the products they need to heat their homes, fuel their industries and drive their economies.

Parkland is strong. We are one of North America’s fastest growing and largest independent distributors and marketers of fuels and lubricants. Our family includes Bluewave Energy, Columbia Fuels, Elbow River Marketing, Island Petroleum, Fas Gas Plus, Farstad Oil, Les Pétroles Parkland, Pioneer Energy, Sparlings, Superpumper Inc., Ultramar, and most recently Parkland Refining (B.C.) Ltd.

Parkland is growing. Our organization is powered by effective leadership, progressive strategies and industry-leading best practices — but more importantly, it is driven by talented, customer-focused people who value integrity, innovation and quality. We are looking for good-natured, hard-working candidates who want to build a rewarding career in a dynamic and collaborative work environment. We are a family and our family continues to grow.

Position Summary:

The Financial Analyst provides analytical support services to the Retail Division through continual analysis of P&L statements, responding to queries and enquiries from Retail Division Managers, preparing and distributing pre-determined monthly financial and analytical reports, compilation of general accounting entries and establishing strong working relationships with managers within the Retail Division.

Key Responsibilities:

Financial Analysis, Reporting & Audit (External): assists in the timely and accurate monthly & quarterly reporting process, responsible for reporting operational metrics (KPI’s) and contributes to the monthly presentations for Retail
Management Reporting (Internal): assists in the preparation of monthly financial management reports to Retail Leadership Team and ensures compliance with IFRS reporting
General Accounting: prepares accounting entries for areas such as fuel margins, Non-Fuel GP, OPEX and MG&A and verification of retailer commissions, dealer payments and TVA’s
Maintenance and development of P&L’s and other reports within Hyperion
Provides support to the Retail Division budget process through research, data compilation, entering and maintenance of approved budgets and reporting
Checks for accuracy and circulates monthly analytics designed to monitor and identify key operating areas for budget compliance and variance identification to ensure corrective action is taken in a timely and effective manner
Works closely with cross-divisional and other accounting departments and must develop a close working relationship with these teams
Forecasts fuel volumes and reports weekly trending compared to budget
Ensures reporting deadlines are met and distributed to the business in a timely manner
Research and respond to day-to-day enquiries from Territory Managers, Directors, and Retail Controller and provides analytics and variance analysis on financial results
Assists in IT projects, system enhancements and seamless integration of new acquisitions
Ad hoc reporting and information (data mining) requests as required
Qualifications and Skills:

University degree in Business or Finance
Actively pursuing their accounting designation (CMA, CGA, CPA)
3-5 years’ post-secondary accounting experience
Excellent working knowledge of GAAP and IFRS
Experience with Hyperion software would be an asset
Excellent computer skills, specifically with Excel and PowerPoint
Excellent written and verbal communication skills, combined with an approachable manner
Enthusiastic learner with demonstrated ability to thrive in a fast paced work environment
Candidates must be legally able to work in Canada at this time. Parkland regrets that it is unable to sponsor employment Visas or consider individuals on time-limited Visa status for this position.

Our main priority at Parkland is our people. As an employee, you can expect a fair workplace, a professional work environment, competitive compensation, outstanding benefits, and a share in our success through the Employee Share Purchase Plan and our Annual Incentive Plan.

Our preferred method of application is online at www.parkland.ca

We strive to provide accessibility in employment to ensure equal access to employment opportunities for candidates, including persons with disabilities. Parkland Fuel Corporation will endeavour to provide accommodation to persons with disabilities in the recruitment process upon request. If you are selected for an interview and you require accommodation due to a disability, please notify us upon scheduling your interview.

Business/Project Analyst
Information Systems R24

An eligibility list may be established.

An opportunity to contribute your valued project and information technology expertise

The Health Sector Information Management/Information Technology Division provides sector-wide leadership in Digital Health, IM/IT planning, policy and business solutions. A major contribution of the division is to build and maintain a capacity for the integration of enabling technologies and data into health systems and services, including and policy development in support of the stewardship role of the Ministry.

Province-wide planning, implementation and delivery of Digital Health is a major focus of the division’s efforts over the next several years. The division also spearheads and actively supports the collaborative development of broad IM/IT strategies and plans intended for implementation across the BC health sector.

The Strategic Projects Branch provides leadership, coordination and expertise through the management and delivery of large scale transformation projects on behalf of Health Sector IM/IT Division (HSIMIT). These projects often cross organizational boundaries and have a broad scope of impact. Projects often include multi-partner stakeholders and vendor outsourcing, and the branch provides oversight to ensure terms and conditions of contract are met. The branch also plays a key role in fostering internal and external relationships with stakeholders through knowledge transfer and facilitated discussion. The branch employs project management and change management strategies to transition projects from the Branch to operational business areas. Projects include PharmaNet systems development and related initiatives such as e-prescribing, as well as the BC Services Card, and Virtual Care technologies to support Mental Health and Substance Use services (e.g. Personal Health Record, Video Counseling).

In the Business/Project Analyst role, you will provide cross-functional project management and change management support, technology planning, business analysis, systems design and stakeholder engagement services. The position coordinates the design, development, and enhancement of systems projects on behalf of the client(s) and works with the system developers to achieve high-quality, timely and cost-conscious solutions for the BC health sector. You are a skilled analytical thinker, an effective communicator, have excellent time management techniques, and thrive in a dynamic project environment with evolving priorities. If you are an experienced information management professional with the initiative required for this challenging role, we look forward to your application.

The ideal candidate works effectively in a team environment, while also independently managing projects and tasks

The BC Public Service is an inclusive and accessible employer. Please advise the hiring manager if any accommodations are required to assist you to ensure equitable participation.

The capital of British Columbia, Victoria is a beautiful city, with beautiful beaches and harbours, and a variety of provincial parks to explore. Located on Vancouver Island, Victoria offers a bustling downtown scene and has a wide range of restaurants and entertainment venues to choose from.

The BC Public Service is committed to creating a diverse workplace to represent the population we serve and to better meet the needs of our citizens. Consider joining our team and being part of an innovative, inclusive and rewarding workplace.

As a member of the Performance & Analytics team, the Hedge Fund Performance Analyst will participate in new client implementations and will provide ongoing operational and analytical support to alternative investment clients (hedge funds, FoFs, private equity) using SS&C’s services and platforms. Cultivating relationships with both internal and external partners

Excellent written and verbal communications skills

This position is responsible for providing general support for the office of Information Security, as well as performing security activities pertaining to Information Security under the direction of the Sr. Manager – Security Operations or Senior Security Analysts. Assist and provide recommendation towards the published Information Security Policies, Processes, and Standards.

Responsible for System implementation, operational support and incident management response as required for the following Information Security systems:
Security Event Management (SIEM) System
Logon Violations
Privileged Access
IDS/IPS
Firewall Policy
Anti-Virus/Anti-Malware
Remote Access
Vulnerability Scans
Information Operating System & Application Patching
Email Filtering
Data Loss Protection
Internet Content Filtering
Participation in the Change Management Process.
Work with IT Operations on the alignment and implementation of Information Security recommendations.
Work on Assigned Information Technology projects as the Information Security Subject Matter Expert (SME).

General Skills:
Excellent time management, organizational and prioritization skills.
Excellent interpersonal skill.
Administration experiences and office support focusing on customer satisfaction.

Willing to learn and to match challenges from new technology and research in the area of Information Security and Business Resiliency.
Ability to conduct presentations and convey ideas from research.

Good working knowledge and experience in at least one or many of the following areas pertaining to Information Security: Security Event Management, IDS/IPS, ICF, email filtering, Firewalls, Virus, Application scanning software, Forensic software, Risk Management and Assessment software etc.
Experience in mobile technologies including Enterprise Mobility Management (MDM), Blackberry, Android, iOS, and Windows Mobile will be an asset.

Exceptional communication and advocacy skills, both verbal and written, with the ability to uexpress complex and technical issues in clear and concise language.
Ability to collaborate and communicate effectively and tactfully with both business-oriented executives and technology-oriented personnel.
Ability to work independently and as part of a collaborative team.

Unix (AIX), Windows
Technical Security background

Professional designation: CISSP, CISA, CISM, CBRM, CoBit Certification – desired but not required

Previous IT development and implementation experience.
ATTRIBUTES FOR SUCCESS:
You focus on impact over hard work: what isn't of a concern is the hours you work, but your results and impact on team members and customers
You like to solve difficult problems, together: no one said transforming banking was going to be easy, but we’re collectively reimagining it and there are no solo heroes welcome
You operate with a mentality of Build-Measure-Learn: our agile mindset is not just for our technical teams, it's a mindset that every one of us is asked to operate from. We move fast, we make mistakes but we measure the impact, learn, grow and change as a result
You focus on 10X and leave the incremental thinking at home: if something doesn't have significant impact, you are the person to challenge whether or not it's worth doing
You do it with passion or not at all: you’re inspired by our purpose and you see the link between yourself and the work you are doing to transform banking
You’re comfortable with being uncomfortable: we won’t always have the answers and change is a constant in our world. As a Transformer you trust in our vision and own an attitude of willingness and patience
You keep the customer at the heart of everything you do: Empathy is a core driver in which you navigate the world. You don’t build products, processes and solutions for the sake of checking something off your checklist, you build with the end user in mind, openly engaging new ideas, listening with intent and making decisions with the desire to balance both compassion with logical reasoning.
As a team member with the Transformation team at ATB, you can expect:
No day will ever be the same - we’re learning, iterating and making big steps towards our vision of transforming an entire industry, everyday
The ability to grow a career within an inspiring, impact focused culture where you are surrounded by changemakers and leaders that empower you to use your voice to make banking work for people
To be a part of the energy of an organization that is unlike any other, where you may pinch yourself on the daily and wonder how you got so lucky
Bragging rights! You get to call yourself a Transformer and an ATBer and know you play a direct role in helping us become a cutting edge financial institution (it’s going to feel more like a technology company, but either way it’s hella cool.)

And being part of ATB Financial you get:
An excellent benefits and pension package, opportunities for career advancement, and a financial institution that’s leading the way in change – now you’re talking about a career with a company that allows you to grow.
Amazing benefits for your everyday banking, mortgages, loans and investments needs.

ContractWhy join us?
OMERS (Ontario Municipal Employees Retirement System) is one of Canada's leading pension funds. OMERS actively manages a diversified global portfolio of stocks and bonds as well as real estate, infrastructure and private equity investments. As one of the key contributors the Test Automation Analyst will be responsible for developing and implementing a test automation strategy and deliver quality automated scripts to support the needs of Software project development and testing.

Work with CRM system integration teams, non-functional requirements team, Scrum Master, Test Leads, business analysts and domain subject matter experts to develop test automation strategy to meet Overall test automation requirementsDefine, develop, and implement a re-usable, maintainable and high quality automation framework for the selected test automation tool (Azure DevOps, Selenium Web Driver and Selenium IDE).Develop and implement test automation best practices, standards and guidelines.Pro-actively work and coordinate with all teams and automation package users for change requests.Provide regular project / deliverable status and schedule update to PMO.
Implementation & Support
o Develop automation scripts (Java / SQL / JavaScript / Unix shell scripts etc.) to implement test scenarios selected by teams.
o Create and develop self-sufficient automation packages (data and test environment independent) to meet the needs of different test runs.

o Keep the packages updated for changes and fix any script defects.

o Create documentation for framework, code implementation, setup as well as user guides.

Training & Knowledge Transfer

University degree or above in the field of Information Technology.

o Azure DevOps

Personal Attributes
Experience working both independently and in a team-oriented collaborative environment is essential.Independent and self-motivated.You are curious, creative, biased for action and love solving problems.Your strengths come from collaborating with others, reading, learning, and sharing your knowledge with the team.Strong communication skills, both written and verbal.
Our story:
Founded in 1962, OMERS is one of Canada’s largest defined benefit pension plans, with $97 billion in net assets as at December 31, 2018. A jointly sponsored pension plan, with 1,000 participating employers, OMERS invests and administers pensions on behalf of almost half a million active and retired members. OMERS members include union and non-union employees of municipalities, school boards, transit systems, electrical utilities, emergency services and children’s aid societies across Ontario. Contributions are funded equally by members and employers. OMERS has employees in Toronto, London, New York, Amsterdam, Luxembourg, Singapore, Sydney and other major cities across North America and Europe – originating and managing a diversified portfolio of high-quality investments in public markets, private equity, infrastructure and real estate.

PermanentWhat is the opportunity?
Reporting to the Director, Business Analysis in Enterprise and Wholesale Credit Risk IT, this role requires a leader and team player to assess, research, analyze and document business, data and system requirements, in order to recommend and implement system solutions that meet sponsor/stakeholder needs. To start, this role will be leading a small team of BAs (2-4) on the Large Exposure Framework (LEF) program in collaboration with the larger IT and business teams. The framework will define common standards for measuring, aggregating and controlling single counterparty concentration risk across jurisdictions. The standard will apply to both direct and indirect exposures, in the banking and trading book.

What will you do?
Lead BA team in detailed analysis and design phases identifying, tracking, escalating and/or resolving data and systems issues
Analyze Business requirements and creates documentation such as system requirements, data catalogues and use cases
Work collaboratively with partners and stakeholders in Group Risk Management and multiple IT teams (source systems)
Analyze and review different options for data integration and provide recommendations on the solution; such as assessing and defining materiality of data quality issues and possible impact to project objectives
Contribute to successful project completion within budget and on time by identifying risks and developing/recommending mitigation strategies
Govern the adherence of the BA team to the enterprise standard requirements methodology in requirements planning, analysis and documentation
Manage performance through regular coaching discussions, providing transparency on where the employees are at from a performance perspective

What do you need to succeed?
Must have
7-10 years of experience working as a Business/Systems Analyst with progressively increasing responsibilities in the areas of requirements management on large and complex regulatory projects
Experience working on projects dealing with large amounts of banking data using tools such as MS Excel, Datameer, SQL for data comparison and analysis, particularly on the wholesale/commercial side and/or Capital Markets
Understanding of banking book and trading book and/or financial risk management concepts and practices
Proven experience working in various delivery methodologies such as Iterative Waterfall and Agile

Nice to have
Certified Business Analysis Professional (CBAP) or Project Management Institute – Professional in Business Analysis (PMI – PBA) Certification or Masters Certificate in Business Analysis will be an asset
Experience as a team or project lead – facilitating and driving the activities of multiple team members towards project deliverables and goals
Strong knowledge of fundamental data concepts (for example, but not limited to groups, hierarchies, data structures)

What’s in it for you?
We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation, and stock where applicable.Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities.Ability to make a difference and lasting impact.Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team.Opportunities to do challenging work.Opportunities to take on progressively greater accountabilities.

Description
Are you super passionate about both retail and data? Are you excited to support awesome Saje growth through new technologies? If so, this may be your #dreamjob!
We are looking for an awesome Project Lead to join our team and support our plans for establishing our Business Intelligence and Customer Master solutions. This position is being offered as a 6 month contract role with expectation of extension as further project phases are initiated.
Saje has launched a program to build a cloud based data warehouse/analytics platform which will integrate across all key systems. As part of this exciting program we will also be improving our capabilities to manage and capture Community Member (customer) information in support of providing outrageous service.
Responsibilities
Use your past BI and data project experience to help scope, plan and manage a multi workstream data project
Provide hands-on support through the scoping and design phase to facilitate decisions around key requirements and solution components
Provide the day to day project leadership to the project team - actively jumping in to accelerate progress where appropriate
Work cross-functionally to identify opportunities for collaboration and pursuing shared success in alignment with the project goals
Establish, manage and maintain effective vendor relationships
Run and monitor projects on a day to day basis, maintaining an accurate picture of project status, risks and issues
Efficiently and effectively manage problems and issues around scope creep and/or changes in business requirements to ensure the project stays on task
Perform risk management to minimize potential risks
Applicant Requirements
5+ years Project Leadership and Business Analyst experience specifically on data focused projects such as BI, Data Warehousing, Analytics or Master Data Management
Ability to solve problems quickly, think creatively and thrive in a fast-paced, entrepreneurial environment
Loves being a coach and mentor while proving team members the opportunity to grow
Strong leadership and interpersonal skills, with the ability to communicate at all levels of the organization with clarity and precision
Passionate about fostering cohesion and motivation amongst cross-functional teams
Solid knowledge of Business Intelligence and Data Warehouse concepts
Ability to prioritize tasks and make focused decisions based on brand integrity and company values
Experience working directly with creative and technical teams
Key Relationships
Reporting to the Director of IT, Business Intelligence

EC-03 from $63,428 to $71,769 / EC-04 from $68,468 to $79,234

Who can apply: Persons residing in Canada and Canadian citizens residing abroad.
Apply online
Important messages
We are committed to providing an inclusive and barrier-free work environment, starting with the hiring process. If you need to be accommodated during any phase of the evaluation process, please use the Contact information below to request specialized accommodation. All information received in relation to accommodation will be kept confidential.
Assessment accommodation
When you apply to this selection process, you are not applying for a specific job, but to an inventory for future vacancies. As positions become available, applicants who meet the qualifications may be contacted for further assessment.
The first extraction of applications is scheduled for April 1, 2019. The subsequent extractions will take place on an "as and when needed" basis.
*** INSTRUCTIONS TO FOLLOW ***

You must submit a complete application, consisting of screening questions which clearly demonstrate how you meet the screening criteria (education and experience) and a résumé. The screening questions will be used as the primary tool in the screening process and the résumé will only be used to substantiate the information provided.

Please note that the screening questions may also be used to assess written communication.

Please note that point form, “copy and paste" from your résumé and comments such “refer to my attached résumé” will NOT be accepted. Failure to provide this information in the requested format will result in your application being rejected.

FOR EACH EXPERIENCE CRITERION, please provide concrete examples including the following MANDATORY information:

1. Name of the department or organization where the experience was acquired;
2. Title of the position occupied and duration (including dates) for which you exercised the functions;
3. Specific details of tasks, projects, or accomplishments demonstrating how the experience was acquired.
Intent of the process
A pool of partially or fully qualified candidates may be established which may be used to staff similar positions within the Department of Justice Canada with various tenures, language requirements and/or conditions of employment, which may vary according to the position to be staffed.

The positions are currently located in Ottawa, Ontario, but consideration may be given to staffing positions in Montreal, Quebec.
Positions to be filled: Number to be determined
Information you must provide
Your résumé.
In order to be considered, your application must clearly explain how you meet the following (essential qualifications)
EDUCATION
ED1 - Graduation with a degree from a recognized post-secondary institution with acceptable specialization in economics, sociology or statistics.

Note: Candidates must always have a degree. The courses for the specialization must be acceptable and may have been taken at a recognized post-secondary institution, but not necessarily within a degree program in the required specialization. The specialization may also be obtained through an acceptable combination of education, training and/or experience.
Degree equivalency
EXPERIENCE
EX1 - Significant* experience in the production, analysis and interpretation of complex data sets and statistics from various data sources.
EX2 - Recent** and significant* experience using advanced Microsoft Excel functions, such as macros and pivot tables.
EX3 - Recent** experience using advanced Microsoft Access functions.
EX4 - Experience in researching and organizing data and information in response to a variety of data and information requests, and preparing written summaries and recommendations.

“Significant” experience will be assessed in terms of the depth and breadth of activities, the complexity and diversity of the work handled, as well as the level of autonomy demonstrated.
** “Recent” experience refers to experience acquired during the normal performance of such duties for at least one year in the last two (2) years worked.
If you possess any of the following, your application must also clearly explain how you meet it (other qualifications)
ASSET QUALIFICATIONS

EXPERIENCE
AEX1 - Experience with Visual Basic.
AEX2 - Experience designing queries and writing SQL.
AEX3 - Experience with PeopleSoft, including extracting or manipulating data from various fields and modules.
AEX4 - Experience in using business intelligence software (e.g. SAS, PowerBI, Tableau).
AEX5 - Experience with the Phoenix Pay system, including extracting or manipulating data from various fields and modules.
AEX6 - Experience in analyzing and validating data sets and reporting on results in support of Human Resources Management.
OPERATIONAL REQUIREMENTS
OR1 - Ability and willingness to work overtime on short notice.
The following will be applied / assessed at a later date (essential for the job)
Various language requirements
Bilingual Imperative BBB/BBB / English Essential
Information on language requirements
KNOWLEDGE
K1 - Knowledge of qualitative and quantitative analysis, trend analysis and forecasting.
K2 - Knowledge of advanced Excel functions, such as Macros and pivot tables.
K3 - Knowledge of Human Resources management functions.
ABILITIES
A1 - Ability to analyze and summarize data sets and other information and prepare written summaries and/or recommendations.
A2 - Ability to prioritize workload and to meet deadlines
A3 - Ability to communicate effectively.
PERSONAL SUITABILITY
PS1 - Judgment
PS2 - Effective interpersonal relationships
PS3 - Initiative
PS4 - Thoroughness
PS5 - Dependability
Other information
The Public Service of Canada is committed to building a skilled and diverse workforce that reflects the Canadians we serve. We promote employment equity and encourage you to indicate if you belong to one of the designated groups when you apply.
Information on employment equity
All job applications must be submitted on-line. Persons with disabilities preventing them from applying on-line are asked to contact 1-800-645-5605.

Extractions from this selection process may occur throughout and after the advertisement period.

Results from previous extractions may be deemed valid for future extractions.

Candidates may be required to meet the organizational needs, depending on the requirements of the specific position being staffed.

Other qualifications may be taken into consideration in the selection decision.

Persons are entitled to participate in the appointment process in the official language of their choice. Applicants are asked to indicate their preferred official language in their application.

You must provide proof of your education credentials.

Our means of communication with applicants is via e-mail. Please ensure to include a functional e-mail address, which will accept messages from unknown users (some e-mail systems block these types of e-mails). It is the responsibility of the candidate to ensure accurate contact information is provided and updated as required. We encourage candidates to provide a second e-mail address in their application.
Preference
Preference will be given to veterans and to Canadian citizens, in that order, with the exception of a job located in Nunavut, where Nunavut Inuit will be appointed first.
Information on the preference to veterans
We thank all those who apply. Only those selected for further consideration will be contacted.

ContractAbout Entertainment One
Entertainment One Ltd. (LSE:ETO) is a global independent studio that specialises in the development, acquisition, production, financing, distribution and sales of entertainment content. The Company’s diversified expertise spans across film, television and music production and sales; family programming, merchandising and licensing; digital content; and live entertainment. Through its global reach and expansive scale, powered by deep local market knowledge, the Company delivers the best content to the world.

Entertainment One’s robust network includes international feature film distribution company Sierra/Affinity; Amblin Partners with DreamWorks Studios, Participant Media, and Reliance Entertainment; Makeready with Brad Weston; unscripted television production companies Whizz Kid Entertainment and Renegade 83; live entertainment leaders Round Room Entertainment; world-class music labels Dualtone Music Group and Last Gang; and award-winning emerging content and technology studio Secret Location.

The Company's rights library, valued at US$2.0 billion (as at 31 March 2018), is exploited across all media formats and includes about 80,000 hours of film and television content and approximately 40,000 music tracks.


Position Summary
As a Business Analyst, you will join Entertainment One’s Information Technology team to ensure process mapping, requirement gathering, data analysis, relationship management, and project and/or operational support.
Responsibilities
Create and document Business Requirements, gap analysis and support documents for projects related to Entertainment One’s Strategic Initiatives.
Analyze and synthesize stakeholder requirements into actionable items.
Facilitate stakeholder engagement through interviews, workshops, meetings, and/or training.
Submit technology estimation (cost benefit analysis) documentation and provide to clients in order to facilitate feasibility assessments on project initiatives.
Act as a liaison between business and technology groups.
Provide initiative documentation as deemed necessary.
Ensure business and system requirements are documented in the form of detailed functional and non-functional requirements and business designs, which meet industry best practices and are consumable by clients, development and testing.
Provide operational support following the change management process.
Research existing policies, procedures, methodologies and systems that support the current state and identify changes needed to support revised processes. Work with business and process engineering to identify and build process improvements into design.
Utilize creative thinking to modify or select the most suitable procedure/approach that results in providing eOne with optimum solutions to business and technology challenges
Lead requirement gathering and other sessions with Stakeholders, to capture the requirements and specifications.
Using negotiating and facilitation skills, resolve issues across competing segments and channels to arrive at solutions that meet the needs of all stakeholders. Actively manage client expectations on the BA work package and the initiative overall where providing support.
Work with the technology team to ensure understanding of the business requirements, use cases and business designs, and obtain sign off on the various elements to ensure solution delivery is appropriate and meets the needs of the business.
Support the work packages for the Development, Testing, Communication, Learning, and Implementation teams by conducting walkthroughs, providing clarification and facilitating issue resolution.
Conduct user training.
Business Planning and Tracking - Meet business requests within budget, on time, and within acceptable quality levels. Manage assigned work packages against timelines and within scope and budget; make recommendations on corrective actions if work package deliverables are in jeopardy. Create change requests as required. Document and raise issues for resolution encountered during the requirements definition process.
Work for consensus and contribute to achievement of team/group goals.
Provide support in RFP process and vendor management.
Continuous Improvement - Work to provide continuous improvement of and ensure high level of quality in all deliverables, processes and procedures.
Communication - Create organized and professional presentation material for clients and partner stakeholders, presenting recommendations in a logical, articulate and influencial manner. Facilitate and lead discussions as required, preparing documentation to record discussion and follow-up actions.
Key Competencies
Passionate innovators, creators, collaborators, and leaders who will be delivering solutions that meet our internal clients' changing needs.
At least 5 years of Business Analysis experience.
Well-developed analytical skills with strong attention to detail.
Experience in business requirements documentation.
Experience in Use Case creation.
Strong multi-tasking and organizational skills.
Well-developed writing skills sufficient to create and precisely articulate requirements, ideas, and opinions.
A University degree in business and/or information technology (or equivalent work experience) is an asset.
Certified business analyst professional or equivalent work experience (preferred).
Demonstrated success in delivering initiatives across multiple business units in a matrix environment.
Extensive experience with all aspects of Requirements Management: Business Process Modeling, Use Case modeling, use case specifications, functional and non-functional requirements and interface design.
Demonstrated ability to build relationships, work collaboratively, and resolve problems with people at all levels in the organization, across lines of business and with third party vendors.
Excellent interpersonal, communication, negotiation and mediation skills.
Self-driven and someone who takes ownership.
Advanced proficiency in Microsoft Office including Word, Excel, PowerPoint.
MS Visio experience.
MS SharePoint experience (preferred).
Previous Finance system implementation experience (preferred)
Break time: free snacks, winter holiday office closures, reduced hours in summerParty time: office bar carts, after work drinks, holiday and summer parties, and sometimes just because
Be inspired: regular film screenings, concerts, and opportunity to get involved in industry events
The office: modern facilities, in house screening rooms, more snacks, and swag
Build a better world: transcend entertainment to our corporate social responsibility activities. Plan a social event. Promote healthy lifestyles. Go green. Give back.
Grow: develop your career and shape your future

We thank everyone for their interest but only those candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.

Entertainment One is an equal opportunity employer that is committed to providing accommodations for persons with disabilities, and supporting diversity and inclusion within our work environment. If you are contacted for a job opportunity, please advise us of any accommodation needed to ensure you have access to a fair and equitable process

Everything begins with passion, a legacy from the Saputo family, which offered tasty and quality cheeses to its community. Today, after more than 60 years, the company employs more than 15 000 dedicated employees, proud of their role, who work day after day to deliver quality products to customers and consumers.

Competitive salaries

Full range of group insurance benefits

We support employment equity. Saputo strives to embed diversity and inclusion in its operations and invites candidates from all horizons to join its family.

SUMMARY OF TASKS:
The Sales Analyst reports to the Vice President, Retail Sales, Western Canada and will be an active participant in the Western Retail Key Account Team. The primary responsibility of this role is to assist the Account Team in the analysis and co-ordination of the sales and marketing activities required to profitably grow the business.

The successful candidate will be curious, self-motivated, willing to take on all challenges, and recognize all assignments as learning opportunities. In addition to analytical and administrative duties, a successful candidate will have the opportunity over time to develop further within the Sales Department including potential future roles as a Territory, Key Account, or Trade Marketing Manager.

RESPONSIBILITIES:

Generate customized sales reports upon request as well as weekly/monthly velocity reports
Compile data from Saputo & Customer sales systems and analyze, evaluate and report actionable insights/analytics in support of ongoing business decisions or initiatives
Analyze sales data & trends and identify opportunities to convert them to sales successes
Provide budget variance analysis
Product forecasting and measuring promotional effectiveness
Co-ordinate and monitor pricing changes and ensure accuracy of published price plans
Presentation building
Assist in developing and executing Point of Sales materials and local consumer promotions
Maintain a high level of knowledge and understanding of Saputo and Customer plans, policies, operating procedures and products
Support Key Account Team on administration, sales related issues, procedures and tasks

(eg. booking travel, forms, customer portal management, samples, debit notes/rebates, etc)

Other duties and projects as required

QUALIFICATIONS:

Post-secondary Diploma or Degree preferred
Proficiency with MS Office, advanced Excel skills, and ability to learn new software
Strong organizational and analytical skills with solid financial/accounting competencies
Sound communication and people skills and a proven ability to work well with others
High level of self-motivation and initiative
Strong team orientation, dependable and a proven ability to work well with others
Ability to work efficiently/effectively under pressure in a multi-tasking, high priority environment
Inquisitive mindset and desire to learn

Mission

To remain on the cutting edge of technical and technological information system and due to financial regulation you will have to guaranty its evolution’s agility in today fast-changing environment

Our candidate needs to have the ability to work well within a team, on his/her own initiative in a highly pressurized environment. Also responsive, high-energy, we need him/her to be able to get quickly a fluent understanding of our business needs.
The candidate has to manage the expectations and relationships of users, sponsors and senior management.


§ Production:

§ Help on some post-trade tool specifications thanks to our good business understanding and to our project impact analysis

§ Manage the life-cycle of all problems on Listed Derivatives, Equities (cash/synthetic), FX, Fixed Income and OTC Cleared perimeter.
§ Implement a procedure on how to manage a Major Incident or Crisis at the team level and share it with them

§ Project management :

o For the non-funded projects, manage the yearly base line to avoid an over-consumption

Company Information
Solid reputation, passionate people and endless opportunities. That's Travelers. Our superior financial strength and consistent record of strong operating returns mean security for our customers - and opportunities for our employees. You will find Travelers to be full of energy and a workplace in which you truly can make a difference.

Job Summary
Under general supervision this position is responsible for working individually or in a team environment, assisting claim professionals and claim management carry out project tasks to develop, design, automate, compile, prepare, analyze, summarize and test information used for claim, operational, and/or financial needs and using technology to collect, evaluate and analyze management information in order to provide observations and recommendations.

Primary Job Duties & Responsibilities
Partnering with all lines of business to understand quality objectives, business strategies and key performance indicators in an effort to provide meaningful management information and analysis to help drive line of business performance, including: Providing analytical and technical data analysis as needed; also providing weekly, monthly, annually and ad hoc reporting to assigned area. Developing, creating and implementing report standards, formats and procedures. Gathering information from a variety of sources (policies, claims, sites, etc.), and summarizing data on spreadsheets or other reports, analyzing data and making recommendations based on research and analysis. Evaluating reasonableness of data including the accuracy of underlying financial controls and operational reports. Ensuring compliance to financial standards. Identifying trends, data discrepancies or opportunities (e.g.; financial self assessment results) and providing recommended solutions and effectively communicating to appropriate leadership. Preparing and delivering detailed financial/operational analysis for all lines of business. Assisting with budget analysis to include expenses and staffing. Reviewing operational workflows, documenting findings, and providing recommended solutions for improvement. Resolving standard or complex problems including recommended process improvements. Researching statutory requests and/or financial/operational reporting requirements and providing details to management in an effort to assist with a response. Serving as subject matter expert in data analysis and the use of technology (i.e.; COGNOS, MS Office and Claim Platform applications). Partners with the line of business in the resolution of system issues related to Legal. Precision and other claim applications. Assisting in resolving assigned claim or expense issues as well as completing various special projects. Assisting with onboarding and training of Operations team employees. Enterprise Contributions: Performing quality contacts to assist as a result of catastrophic claim events. Creating efficiencies by recommending alternative workflows

Education, Work Experience & Knowledge
Bachelors degree preferred or equivalent work experience. Skilled in the utilization of appropriate information systems technology to improve the efficiency of data management reporting tools. Solid research, organizational, analysis and summarization skills. Excellent customer service and communication skills. Strong time management skills and ability to prioritize daily assignments. Must be highly organized with ability to handle multiple tasks simultaneously to meet deadlines. Strong attention to detail is a must. Demonstrates strong technical proficiency in analytical skills. Excellent verbal and written communication skills required to manage customer service requests, provide information to Claim Professionals and to respond to oral and written instructions. Strong Microsoft Office (Excel, Word and PowerPoint) skills. Ability to learn new applications in a department with the most advanced and continually improving computer platforms. Working knowledge of Access a plus. Comfortable with newer and emerging technology and tools.

Job Specific & Technical Skills & Competencies
Competencies/Skills: Accountability: Takes ownership and responsibility for actions and outcomes, performance and results. Analytical Thinking: Identifies current or future problems or opportunities, analyzes, synthesize and compares information to understand issues, identifies cause/effect relationships and explores alternative solutions to support sound decision-making. Change Management / Resilience: Remains energized and focused in the face of ambiguity, change or strenuous demands. Communication: Demonstrates effective verbal, written, and listening communication skills. Customer Focus: Provides service excellence to internal or external clients. Judgment / Decision Making: Exercises sound judgment, makes decisions and commits to a position. Leveraging Differences: Works with and includes people from different backgrounds, experiences, cultures, races, etc. and views those differences as assets to be leveraged to accomplish business goals and objectives. Relationship Management: Seeks out, builds, fosters and maintains productive relationships, networks or alliances to meet goals and achieve results. Teamwork: Works together in situations when actions are interdependent and a team is mutually responsible to produce a result.

Equal Employment Opportunity Statement
Travelers is an equal opportunity employer.

We are committed to providing accommodation to persons with disabilities. If you require accommodation during the recruitment or interview process we will work with you to accommodate your needs.

Managing data and information workflows using computerized data entry for internal/external transfers and follow up on tracer actions

Overview
ACCEO Solutions Inc., Retail Solutions division, is a Canada-wide leading provider of Retail Point of Sale Software, and is part of the Constellation Software family. If you derive job satisfaction from data analytics, problem solving, and providing guidance and consultation to others, this could be the opportunity you have been looking for. We are looking for a strong team player for our Customer Onboarding Team to provide a variety of services to our external and internal clients.


We are looking for a dynamic Data Analyst & Reports Specialist for our Markham office to serve our clients. They look to us to provide turnkey solutions, with recommendations and guidance on rolling out their systems. Our clients’ computer skills range from advanced to novice. In this role, the successful candidate understands intuitively how to communicate, coach, and guide the client through their next steps. Every day is different, and challenges us to always bring our “A” game to deliver great service.


Reporting to the Senior Manager, Customer Onboarding; the successful candidate will be an ambassador for our product and company and will provide critical services to deliver our product, and ensure customers implement their new systems on schedule. The experience our customers receive during the onboarding process can shape the long-term post-sales relationship with the client, and is a cornerstone to our product’s success.
Details
This is a permanent full-time position, with regular work hours of Monday to Friday, from 9 a.m. to 6 p.m and will be based out of our Markham, ON Office!
Primary Duties & Responsibilities
Operate as a frontline, primary liaison between ACCEO and our clients on the preparation of spreadsheet data for import into our software, and perform data imports using existing internal software tools and processes
Perform data preparation and configuration for subsequent system implementations using internal software tools and processes
Assess a variety of situations, reviewing software configuration, setup and program functionality and identify the correct resolution or escalate according to departmental guidelines
Report detailed information within the client tracking system and document processes, routines, and programs by following the defined guidelines and team goals & objectives
Prepare weekly Excel reports by updating existing Pivot Table templates, and create new Excel Pivot Table reports and dashboards as needed
Develop and update executive level reports
Coordinate services for clients, and schedule implementation dates to meet deadlines
Perform other duties as assigned by Management
Work closely with other team members as part of a cohesive group in exchanging knowledge through training sessions and peer to peer interaction
Maximize and maintain current knowledge and awareness of applications and related technologies
Qualifications
Frontline customer service experience
Analytical reporting/Excel power user; proficient with conditional formatting, pivot tables and pivot charts, with an advanced knowledge of formulas
Understanding of relational databases, database structure, and referential integrity

ContractOur client is looking for a senior resource with extensive business analysis and change management experience. This senior resource will participate in changes to business structure and processes; information technology (IT), infrastructure and management; and human resources, all of which impact branches .

The Senior Business Analyst will be engaged in the Implementation of Labour Market Transfer Agreements (LMTAs) Project being undertaken by LMDD. There are new federal reporting requirements defined in the renewed LMTAs, including a new Performance Measurement Strategy (PMS) and client referral system called Targeting, Referral and Feedback (TRF) that will require changes to current business processes and IT.

The full-time position will be located onsite at a in Regina, Saskatchewan, Canada.

The requirements for implementation of the Labour Market Transfer Agreements project are to assist LMDD in identifying their functional areas and articulating them in a comprehensive operational framework. As a Senior Business Analyst, the resource will be required to participate as a team member in reviewing, updating, documenting and enhancing the business processes for LMDD. The resource will bring experience in leading organizational and business changes and improvements, with demonstrated experience in creating and managing a robust strategy and plan and in creating, coordinating and implementing changes. The resource will play an integral and strategic role in organizational success, as they are a key player in helping the business to make informed and strategic decisions. They are responsible for managing change and must ensure that deliverables are met and delivered effectively and accepted by both internal and external stakeholders.

LMDD is involved in a related project with the Ministry of Advanced Education entitled “One Client Service Model (OCSM) Business Capability Assessment” which will recommend an IT solution to support the future service delivery, accountability requirements and information management for LMDD and its partners. The deliverables of the “OCSM Business Capability Assessment” project will inform the direction of this project.

Duties of the Resource will include, but are not necessarily limited to:

Identify LMDD’s functional areas and articulate them in a comprehensive operational framework with continuous improvement targets to mature the organization.
Develop and document business processes to support functional areas; assess current business artifacts (such as internal policies, manuals, data sharing agreements, and client disclosure forms); and, identify and prioritize changes.
Develop an Organizational Change Management (OCM) plan to reinforce the new operational framework. LMDD has a number of internal and external stakeholders who may require training on the new reporting requirements and potential IT system changes.
Create, plan and facilitate meetings and workshops with senior internal and external stakeholders.
Prepare and deliver presentations to senior internal and external stakeholders.
Develop and execute a detailed communications plan for internal and external
stakeholders.

Develop training materials and facilitate training for both technical and non-
technical audiences.

As noted above, consideration will need to be given to existing and related
initiatives that LMDD is involved in including the OSCM Business Capability Assessment which is identifying technological solutions to support and enhance the business of LMDD and its partners.

As the Information Company, our mission at OpenText is to create software solutions and deliver services that redefine the future of digital. Be part of a winning team that leads the way in Enterprise Information Management.

Come join the OpenText Data Governance Organization (DGO), the team at the center of OpenText global business operations. Bachelor’s degree or equivalent combination of education and business-related work experience totaling 8+ years. What Is the Prescription For A Great Career?


At Rexall, we are community difference makers. Our hearts skip a beat when we meet talent who sees the bigger picture and wants to make an impact in our communities, our teams, and our business. This means finding even better ways to work, share ideas, and making a material difference in the Rexall journey.


We are leaders in health and wellness and a talent destination for over 7000+ Rexall team members. We are proud to be part of the McKesson family, ranked fifth in the fortune 500. Together, we are defining better health through innovation, service, and living the “ICARE” values. Talk about a dream team!


The road ahead is one of adventure and heart. Are you our next all star?


The Role: Pricing & Promotions Analyst


Reporting to the Manager, Pricing and Promotions, this role will be an integral member of a high-profile, cross functional-strategic initiative focused on optimizing the effectiveness of Rexall’s promotional activities. The Pricing & Promotions Analyst acts as consultants to key Category Management stakeholders, providing fact-based insights and recommendations to improve total sales, margin and overall promotions effectiveness.


Principal Responsibilities:

Will be responsible for accurately forecasting, tracking, and reporting the sales, margin, and promotional impact and effectiveness across a range of front of store categories (eg Cosmetics, Convenience, Beauty and Health etc).
Work directly with Category Managers and Directors to optimize promotional sales and make recommendations based on trends, targets, promotional strategies
Provide proactive recommendations on sales-, margin-, and basket-driving promotions
Monitors and analyzes promotional activities to determine effectiveness, accuracy, and performance relative to forecast and identify trends
Analyze data to calculate baseline sales and margin and estimate incremental sales and margin for promotional within a set of categories.
Own real-time consolidated forecast; measure and provide reporting relative to category targets and other metrics
Ad hoc analysis on promotional response to categories
Support the Manager, Pricing and Promotions to develop and implement product price strategies including segment strategies for the various markets and channels.
Download and organize baseline price information, analyze and report on inconsistencies, and identifies opportunities to optimize sales and profitability through pricing strategies.
Create various reports such as daily trend report, ad reports, period end reports, etc. for various customers in Merchandising.
Perform weekly updates to Ad Reporting Tool and develop promo reports on ad hoc basis.
Update monthly scorecard with new data and present results to team to show performance year over year.
Perform other duties as assigned including ad-hoc analysis on methods to optimize pricing and promotions through market and pricing strategies.
Perform other duties as assigned to support Rexall Pharmacy Group Ltd.

2-3 year College Diploma in a related discipline. University degree is preferred.
Analytical and detail-oriented including; exploring data, discovering patterns, relationships, anomalies and trends.
Excellent organizational, time management and multi-tasking skills.
Customer-focused and a demonstrated team player.
Excellent communication skills both written and verbal.
Strong knowledge of Microsoft Office software, specifically Excel. Access is preferred.

job_description:
Lieu:
1 Presidents Choice Circle, Brampton, Ontario, L6Y 5S5
C’est toute une décision que de se joindre à une entreprise. Nous offrons des perspectives d’emploi à des personnes qui, comme vous, sont travaillantes, dynamiques et fiables.
Pourquoi ce role est-il important?
Job Profile: Sr Analyst, Joint Business Planning and Vendor Services
Reports to: Director, Commodities & Joint Business Planning
Under the leadership of the Director, Commodities & Joint Business Planning, the Sr Analyst, Joint Business Planning (JBP) and Vendor Services is the internal and external team liaison for nearly 30 of the largest vendors to Loblaw, who participate in the JBP or PC Club programs. They coordinate the preparation, production, and distribution of all reporting requirements for the JBP process. They are responsible for supporting the Manager, Analytics on process improvement projects to produce reporting of financial performance for JBP and PC Club vendors. They are the team’s lead for the preparation and execution of the semi-annual JBP and PC Club meetings with participating vendors and internal colleagues
Accountabilities:
Process Improvement
Work with the Manager, Analytics on the improvement of production for periodic financial performance reports
Support the team project on process automation to minimize manual interruption in the production of periodic reports and JBP & PC Club session decks
Work with loyalty, supply chain, finance, and other internal client groups to partner and improve the efficiency of production and accuracy of data that is included in all JBP & PC Club content
Work with the Director, Commodities & Joint Business Planning to engage with merchandising teams and vendors on how to improve JBP & PC Club process. Deliver recommendations on how to develop data driven insights that can be introduced as part of the team’s deliverables
Act as the team lead for the migration of Enterprise Vendor Portal to Open Text
Periodic Reporting
Collect all required reporting content from partner groups within the organization. Consolidate this and prepare it to be published to internal and external stakeholders
Manage user access to reporting SharePoint and Vendor Portal and organize site content for the ease of all users
JBP & PC Club Sessions Content Preparation
Review and validate presentation submissions for completion and compliant content
Consolidate data and other slides into final presentations
Coordinate review of presentations with vendor captains and key stakeholders
Meeting Coordination
Create and manage meeting calendars for Spring, Summer, and Fall JBP & PC Club sessions
Work with BU leads, directors, divisional presidents, and vendors to ensure their availability and attendance for all meetings
Coordinate room bookings and work with service providers to ensure resources and amenities are prepared for all meetings
Maintain internal and external contact lists for meeting invites and content distribution
Requirements:
University degree in business, mathematics, or a related field
1-3 years relevant experience with foundational understanding of retail finance, merchandising, or accounting
Strong analytical skills and comfort in working with large datasets
Advanced Microsoft Excel skills including experience with building and editing macros
Strong written and oral communication, and time management skills
Comment R é ussir:
Chez Loblaw, nous recherchons toujours des personnes formidables pour continuellement renforcer notre culture. Nous croyons que les gens formidables façonnent nos valeurs, sont authentiques, bâtissent la confiance et créent des liens.
Si cela vous ressemble et que vous êtes ouvert d’esprit, que vous avez une bonne attitude face aux changements et que vous aimez les défis d’un environnement de travail aux détails dynamiques, postulez aujourd’hui.
En outre, nous croyons que la conformité aux lois consiste à faire ce qu'il faut. Le respect de la loi fait partie de notre Code de conduite; il renforce ce que nos clients et nos parties prenantes attendent de nous.

Poste régulier
Loblaw considère que la diversité culturelle du Canada est une source de fierté nationale et un symbole de force.
