DEPARTMENT DESCRIPTION
The Private Equity department manages a mature portfolio of approximately $11 billion in global private equity investments. Investments include leading private equity funds as well as direct investments in portfolio companies. The portfolio is expected to grow significantly over the coming years, with an increased emphasis on direct investments.

POSITION DESCRIPTION
Reporting to the Manager, Portfolio Administration, the Analyst plays a key role as a strategic change agent in the Portfolio Administration department. This important role will contribute to the planning of the department’s future operating model and ensure it effectively provides a wide range of private equity asset servicing functions that support the growing Private Equity portfolio. The Analyst also works with the Manager to provide oversight to the day-to-day work of the portfolio administration team.

For the right analytical mind, this opportunity presents significant upward mobility options into portfolio monitoring and analytics roles after gaining several years of experience.

QUALIFICATIONS
Undergraduate degree with high academic standing
Strong analytical, and problem-solving skills
Attention to detail
Ability to manage projects under pressure to meet tight deadlines
Ability to work independently and as part of a team in a high-performance culture
Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal
Strong business acumen and judgment
Experience in audit, financial analysis or financial reporting is an asset
CFA (or working towards), CA, CPA or Master’s degree in business/economics is considered an asset
PRIMARY RESPONSIBILITIES

Defines and implements new portfolio administration operating model including the planning, testing & reporting design of new systems, and establishment of effective controls
Recommends, implements and documents process reengineering and supporting systems architecture
Receives and manages high volumes of financial information from external partners
Interprets third party instructions and prepares financial instructions for financial payments and receipts to/from external managers; ensures compliance with contractual obligations; and manages investment records
Ensures correct and timely posting of transactions to internal systems, including allocation to correct transaction types and client accounts
Reconciles transactions across systems, investigates and resolves discrepancies
Becomes familiar with and adheres to SOC1 report requirements in day to day activities
Reviews financial statements and reconciles capital account information with internal records
Coordinates monthly payments and allocates legal expenses
Works collaboratively with external service providers and partners to process workflows; responds to requests from internal parties for investment information; and prepares information/reports for the team as required
Supports the Investment Team by forwarding relevant information in a timely manner; prepares documentation for signature; and responds to ad hoc requests for information or assistance
Monitors several email inboxes and responds to or redirects information as required
Actively adheres to compliance and risk management policies
Participates in business continuity planning
Participates in special projects as needed
PROGRESSIVE RESPONSIBILITIES

Validates the quality and integrity of data and reporting processes used in generating reports
Works as an integrated member of the Private Equity team, supporting Portfolio Monitoring & Reporting efforts; monitors portfolio exposure by geography, vintage, currency and sector
Prepares recurring and ad-hoc portfolio analytics on investment returns, return drivers, value creation, fund exposures, and external / internal management fees and expenses using Excel; completes ad-hoc projects as assigned
Assists with the co-ordination of the annual investment valuation processes, ensuring consistency, timeliness and accuracy; liaises with the Finance department, external valuators and auditors
Keeps up-to-date on industry and private equity trends
COMPETENCIES
Communications
Effective performers recognize the essential value of continuous information exchange and the competitive advantage it brings. They actively seek information from a variety of sources, synthesize relevant insights, and tailor its dissemination to each audience.

Relationship Management

Effective performers understand that establishing and maintaining productive relationships is a primary factor in success. They devote appropriate time and energy to establishing and maintaining networks internal & external. They initiate contacts readily and maintain them over time. They are able to utilize relationships to facilitate business transactions.

Technical Expertise
Effective performers are knowledgeable and skilled in excel, and are capable or have an interest in developing skills for financial monitoring and modeling, data analysis and portfolio management. They add value to the organization by effectively monitoring the portfolio and investments.

Analytical Skills, Financial Acumen & Decision Making
Effective performers can summarize information and provide well thought-out, actionable recommendations based on value and supported by analysis.

Business Thinking
Effective performers see the organization as a series of integrated and interlocking business processes. They understand how their work connects with and affects other areas of the organization.

Organizing & Planning
Effective performers have strong organizational and planning skills that allow them to be highly productive and efficient. They manage their time wisely and effectively prioritize multiple competing tasks.

Data Management Quality Assurance Analyst - (180000IW)
Description
Move, Build, Grow your career!
As the premier global asset management and disposition company, Ritchie Bros. helps thousands of people around the world buy and sell heavy equipment, trucks, and other assets every month. With our multiple onsite and online selling platforms and commitment to first-class customer service, Ritchie Bros. is trusted worldwide for making buying and selling easy, efficient, fair, and transparent. If you’re an innovator with an entrepreneurial spirit, we want you to join our growing team – employed in a wide variety of positions from sales to operations to corporate functions – as we transform the global used equipment market.
Join us on our journey and move forward with us, build your success, and grow your career.

Are you passionate about getting high quality data into the hands of business leaders? Does test automation make you excited to get up in the morning?


We’re looking for a Data Management Quality Assurance Analyst based in Burnaby, BC.
Reporting to the Data Management Program Manager, the Data Management Quality Assurance Analyst develops, establishes, and enforces quality assurance standards and measures for the Data Management Group. One of the primary responsibilities of this position is to develop, execute, and report on test cases from specified project requirements. Additionally, the incumbent is responsible for the coordination, execution and verification of testing procedures against Enterprise Data Warehouse (EDW) & Data Lake solutions. The incumbent ensures that all benchmarks are being met and reported accurately to the Program Manager.

The Opportunity:
Develop & Execute Test Cases and document results for data-oriented solutions (EDW, Data Lake, etc) including presentation layers (SSRS, SSAS, Tableau, etc)
Develop automated test scripts
Participate in work planning including calculation of testing estimates
Lead the development, establishment, and enforcement of quality assurance processes, measures and testing standards, providing QA expertise and support to developers and other QAs on team

Here’s What You Bring
Undergraduate degree in business, computer science or equivalent
5 years quality assurance experience in a data-oriented environment, including direct hands-on experience with ad hoc query programs, automated testing tools, and reporting software.
2 years working directly with relational databases and SQL, including the ability to write queries to validate data accuracy and quality. SQL Server experience would be an asset.
Tableau experience an asset


What We Offer:

Our success is built on the drive and dedication of our people. As we grow around the globe, there will be many opportunities to advance your career – we’ve proven this throughout our 60+ years in business. And, we'll take care of you along the way. Here’s how:
Base salary + paid overtime
Comprehensive medical and dental benefits.
RRSP and an Employee Share Plan, both with company match.
Ongoing training, professional development and tuition reimbursement.
A multi-award winning LEED gold certified facility, in an exceptional park-like setting, featuring:
A subsidized, multi-award winning childcare centre.
A subsidized cafeteria, car washing and dry cleaning services, and free parking.
A workout facility, featuring advanced gym equipment, bike room, shower and changing facilities, and nutrition and fitness programs.
Proximity to miles of Fraser River walking paths, plus shops, restaurants and services.

The WHY
Why MEC?
MEC is more than a store, and we’re more than a place to buy hats and backpacks. We’re physical and digital hubs for the outdoor community. People connect here, through our stores, online channels, over the phone, or through one of our leading events, clinics or services.
MEC is an equal opportunity employer. We’re proud to work with our people to create a diverse workplace, which accommodates individuals of all abilities, backgrounds and identities. We welcome and encourage applications from people with disabilities. Tell us what you need during the hiring process, and we’ll do our best to accommodate you.

Why YOU?
If you like working with an inclusive, hands-on, collaborative team, who connect people with quality products to encourage active outdoor lives, then this is the team for you. MEC is an awesome place if you’re always learning and trying new things, like bouldering, yoga or trail running!
The lines between retail and supply chain are blurring. You enjoy challenging constraints, figuring out how to delight members while keeping costs controlled and minimizing our environmental footprint.

The HOW
You’re a natural consensus builder and you understand how your work has impacts both up and downstream. You understand that solutions must be intuitive and easy for partners, staff and members to understand. You believe in empowering your teams and those around you to do their best every day.

Support decision making in key processes across the Supply Chain group, such as demand forecasting, inventory management, and replenishment
Implement continuous improvement initiatives such as the automation of low-level, repetitive and error prone work though software tools and data analytics
Create dashboards and analyses that help track company, team, and individual performance, foster accountability, and capitalize on market opportunities
Work collaboratively with various stakeholders as a trusted partner and thought leader throughout MEC on the topic of supply chain, advanced analytics, and industry best practices
Execute on continuous improvement initiative and process mapping
Develop KPIs, analyze and report out all aspect of MEC’s supply chain
Support MEC's supply chain S&OP process with data and recommendations
Forecast inbound volume to balance DC receiving capabilities with the Buying merchandise strategy and forecast cash-flow requirements
Work with MEC Sustainability department to accurately report greenhouse gas emissions due to freight movements
Work with internal stakeholders to share key insights and seek opportunities to improve the effectiveness of MEC’s supply chain
Work with internal and external partners to shorten transit times and optimize freight costs
Manage cross-departmental projects to support continuous improvement of MEC’s supply chain
Provide fact-based recommendations on potential areas of improvement to MEC's supply chain
 What you bring:

Bachelor’s degree. Specialization in Business, Commerce, Economics, Statistics, Industrial Engineering or Supply Chain is preferred
5-7 years of related experience in logistics, supply chain analytics, performance measurement and reporting
Exposure to lean methodology
Advanced knowledge of Visio, Excel, PowerBI and all MS Office applications
Experience in data reporting, including report design and development
Strong analytical skills. You’re really good working with numbers.
Proficiency in the development and tracking of Key Performance Indicators
Excellent attention to detail – some might call you nitpicky – because you know small things matter
Great communication – you listen first, then share knowledge. This goes for both speaking and writing
You’re stoked on something: you love to build trails, log miles, organize hut trips, lean into corners, climb splitters or do something outside every day
What Great Looks Like

Continuous process improvement
 New tools and processes created that saves time, improves accuracy, increases consistency, and supports more data driven decision making
 Supporting key stakeholders and initiatives throughout Supply Chain group

Seamless supply chain execution.
Internal teams love how they don’t have to worry whether a key product will make a key launch date
Members are wow’ed by our supply chain solutions

ABOUT YOU
The Alberta Motor Association (AMA) is on the lookout for a passionate, resourceful Product Owner who is a great communicator, negotiator, and facilitator. You will be a part of the agile delivery team, responsible for gathering requirements from stakeholders, refining vision into clear functional requirements, user stories and acceptance criteria, rationalizing, planning, prioritizing and monitoring the acceptability of stories in a timely manner using the AMA Agile Framework and tools.
If you can focus on the objectives and functionality to be delivered for a feature and within a sprint, then we want to talk to you. You might just be the person we're looking for to join our team.
WHAT MOVES YOU
You're a spirited team player who excels in a fast-paced environment and thrives on challenge.
You manage your time as expertly as you manage your projects. Prioritizing, planning and organizing is part of your DNA.
You strongly believe there's no such thing as an insignificant detail — you keep at it until every 'i' is dotted and every 't' is crossed.
You have the natural ability to reduce a complex concept or task into something that is manageable and can be clearly understood and communicated.
You have an inquisitive mind and love coming up with new ways to tackle a challenge and digging deeper to find the perfect solution to increase value for your customers.
You never sweat deadlines — you've got mad time management skills, so you always deliver on time.
You work well on your own but also enjoy being part of a team.
WHAT YOU'LL DO
Report to the Product Owner Team Lead.
Develop relationships with Business partners to understand their business and provide recommendations and enhancements to solve their strategic and operational needs.
Plan and prioritize stories within a sprint plan.
Participate in daily triage/scrum meetings to resolve issues, addresses changes and report on progress.
Work with scrum team members to ensure the sprints content produces a functional package to leadership and key stakeholders.
Communicate with other agile team members to resolve any issues before escalating to the Product Manager.
Decompose the features into user stories to support priority business value delivery.
Provide and analyze data for the Product Manager to make informed decisions, mitigate risks, or take other actions.
Evaluate a problem/opportunity from both a business and consumer perspective to determine the best resolution approach.
Gather business/user requirements to support the functional or business solution by conducting interviews, requirements workshops, surveys, site visits, business process description, document analysis, uses cases, tasks, and workflow analysis.
Report sprint metrics to the Product Manager to identify any major issues by keeping the AMA tracking tool up-to-date and running metric reports required for regular status cadence meetings.
WHAT YOU'VE DONE
You have post-secondary education/certification, or you are actively pursuing it in an applicable functional or business designation for the specified content area of management.
You have minimum 3 years of industry/functional experience.
You have minimum 3 years' experience under your belt in participating on multiple teams.
You have a firm understanding of agile project delivery methodologies and a certification would be an asset.

Please note, this is a temporary full-time contract opportunity with an expected end date of April 30, 2020. Secondments are welcome.

About Western

Since 1878, Western University has been committed to serving our communities through the pursuit of academic excellence and by providing students, faculty, and community members with life-long opportunities for intellectual, social, and cultural growth. We seek excellent students, faculty, and staff to join us in what has become known as the "Western Experience" - an opportunity to contribute to a better world through the development of new knowledge, new abilities, new connections, and new ways to make a difference.

About Us

In support of the academic, research and service objectives of Western’s community, we:
pursue excellence in financial management and reportingprovide quality support, guidance and consultationpromote effective stewardship of funds

Responsibilities

The Accounting Analyst performs accounting and financial administrative functions with a high level of accuracy and attention to detail for General Accounting. The incumbent supports the goals of the unit and is responsible for fund management, account analysis, reconciliations, data compilation and reporting on capital projects, bank accounts and other general accounting areas. The Accounting Analyst will compile relevant data and provide accurate and timely reports as required. The incumbent will provide a point a contact, providing guidance and accounting support to the Western community to ensure compliance with relevant financial legislation, and University policies and procedures.

Qualifications

Education:
University Degree in accounting or business administrationCompletion of an Accounting Designation (CPA, CA, CMA, CGA)Completion of Canadian Institute of Management (CIM) Designation is preferred
Experience:
3 years' experience in accounting or financial management in a corporate environmentDemonstrated experience working within a computerized financial system environment and with preparing financial reports
Knowledge, Skills & Abilities:
Knowledge of Generally Accepted Accounting PrinciplesFamiliarity with accounting standards for not-for-profits, tax legislation (commodity tax, tax returns) and with complex reporting and accounting issuesIntermediate computer skills with financial systems and software packages (such as PeopleSoft Financials), Microsoft Office Suite (Excel and Word) and with content management systems (such as Cascade Designer)Communication skills with an ability to complete detailed analytics and reports and to clearly and effectively interact with all levels of the organizationAbility to work in a manner that models best practices in confidentiality standardsAnalytical skills to accurately interpret and integrate report data from various sourcesCustomer service skills to understand customer needs and expectations, with a desire to deliver helpful and reliable service to the University communityAttention to detail with an ability to retrieve, analyze and synthesize sizable amounts of data, while ensuring that information is accurate and comprehensiveAbility and willingness to stay abreast of technological developmentsAbility to multi-task and maintain an organized and effective personal work environmentAbility to collect and discern relevant data to create reports and recommendationsAdapts readily and effectively to changing priorities and demandsAbility to take responsibility for own work and ensure that deadlines are met and outcomes are achievedAbility to identify opportunities for improvement, while being open to trying new ideas and working methodsAbility to exhibit a professional, respectful and honest approach to workAbility to work independently and effectively as a member of the team to achieve department goalsInterpersonal skills and ability to communicate clearly and effectively with all levels of the organization with a high degree of tact and diplomacyKnowledge of Western University policies and procedures preferred

Western Values Diversity

The University invites applications from all qualified individuals. Western is committed to employment equity and diversity in the workplace and welcomes applications from women, members of racialized groups/visible minorities, Aboriginal persons, persons with disabilities, persons of any sexual orientation, and persons of any gender identity or gender expression.

Accommodations are available for applicants with disabilities throughout the recruitment process. If you require accommodations for interviews or other meetings, please contact Human Resources at hrhelp@uwo.ca or phone 519-661-2194.

We thank all applicants for their interest; however, only those chosen for an interview will be acknowledged.

RB is the world's leading consumer health and hygiene company. We’re 40,000 entrepreneurs, all inspired by a vision of a world where people are healthier and live better.
At the heart of our rapidly growing consumer health business is a passionate desire to help people feel better. We invest in research and development to find new ways for people to look after themselves, their families, and homes.

What You’ll Do:
As a member of the Business Analytics Function, the Consumer Market Insight Analyst will help create value for RB Health (Canada) through enabling data-driven decision making for strategic and operational planning. The Consumer Market Insight Analyst will assist in our understanding of our target consumers across our key markets, Infant Formula, Child Nutrition, Sexual Wellbeing, Health Relief and Personal Care.

What Are Your Responsibilities?
Production of our quantitative consumer tracking studies, ensuring smooth quarterly production of the survey, supplier oversight, and report production.
Ad hoc statistical analysis of data sets using SPSS or other statistical software.
Support RB Health teams in interpreting results and contribute to action plans indicated by the analyses and reports.
Lead the production of the monthly business performance strategic scorecards, tracking performance of KPIs relative to targets.
Work with channels to help interpret the basis of the performance, and help identify action plans.
Continually search for improvements in measurement technics, with a goal to be agile and improving research turn-around rates.
Leverage new technologies and platforms to ensure best practice for democratization of data and data visualization.
How Do You Know If You’re A Fit?
The successful candidate will hold a university degree or equivalent (social sciences, math, computer sciences or business), with a minimum of 3 years analytics experience.
Excellent analytical, storytelling, and problem solving skills. Ability to translate/communicate analytics recommendations to both technical and nontechnical team members.
Strong understanding of quantitative (univariate and multivariate) analysis techniques. Experience with predictive modelling and machine learning an asset. Experience with statistical software (e.g. SAS, SPSS or R).
Experience with data visualization and business intelligence software.
Ability to challenge the status quo and encourage use of new information and consumer insights.
Ability to work on multiple projects simultaneously demonstrating strong prioritization skills, balancing uncertainties and trade-offs to achieve desired business results. Attention to detail with emphasis on both speed and accuracy.
Strong intellectual curiosity and independent judgment with the desire to understand the basis and drivers of consumer behaviour.
Builds a collaborative, positive cross functional team environment and strong working relationships with senior management, marketing, healthcare and retail sales teams, finance and outside agencies.

Why RB?
We believe there's a better way to do business – we like to call it 'betterbusiness'. Socially, environmentally and financially, we act responsibly and sustainably. We believe passionately in doing things the right way, and we believe the better way helps us deliver high quality products that touch consumers each and every day. Health is no longer just the absence of illness, it’s being able to lead a fitter and happier life. Our responsibility is to help people achieve this, while making the right kind of social and environmental impact. That’s what we call betterbusiness.

In this role you will support all phases of systems development life cycle and implementation projects including hands on development and application support. You will analyze business process reengineering concepts and methods providing documented business requirements on information management projects.
You will excel as you work with all levels of the business, ensuring information technology deliverable align with the business requirements, with measurable results. You will develop and deploy solutions based on industry standard methodologies. You have the ability to tackle technical and strategic challenges using innovative ways.
Fraser Health Authority is growing, the kind of growth you want to be a part of. With over 25,000 employees, 2,500 physicians and 6,500 volunteers providing a wide range of integrated health care services to over 1.8 million people living in Metro Vancouver and the Fraser Valley, Fraser Health is the largest and fastest growing Health Authority in Canada. We want you to join us in our growth as you maximize, improve and expand your skills.
Twelve acute care hospitals, BC’s first dedicated outpatient care and surgery centre and a wide range of services in public health, home health, mental health and residential care facilities. Known as one of the most desirable place to live in the world, these dynamic communities along with inspiring scenery and easy access to an abundance of outdoor activities provide an amazing quality of life.
We are proud of the innovation, dedication, integrity and tenacity of our physicians, employees and volunteers. More than any building or technology, it's our people who make Fraser Health distinct.
Primary Responsibilities:
Provides systems analysis and prepares detailed specifications for development work;
Provides business analysis and objectives, planning, or modifying practical manual and automated business procedures;

In this position you will be challenged daily to better improve the client experience. Two (2) to four (4) years' experience in business and systems analysis.

This is a full time position based at our Central City offices in Surrey , BC, with access to rapid transit, shopping, restaurants, on-site gym and other amenities.
Valued Benefits:
A career with Fraser Health will offer you the opportunity to be a part of a dedicated team of providers in a dynamic and rewarding health care environment. We offer a competitive compensation and benefit package, including comprehensive health benefits coverage.
Are you ready to work with an experienced and dedicated team and join our commitment to provide quality care to our patients and clients? We invite you to apply today and find out why more than 95% of new employees recommend Fraser Health to their friends and family as an outstanding place to work!

job_title: Analyst/Senior Analyst, Risk Analytics, Investment Risk
job_description:
Job Description

We are recruiting for an Analyst/Senior Analyst to join the Risk Analytics team in the Investment Risk Department. The candidate is responsible for executing the daily production process and prepare timely and accurate investment risk reports. The candidate will ensure that risk estimates are calculated correctly by ensuring that analytical reviews, reasonability checks, position reconciliations and established processes are completed and followed in accordance with Investment Risk Management Standards and Methodologies. The candidate is expected to work with internal data governance team in response to exceptions management process with respect to his/her primary supporting areas.
The Analyst/Senior Analyst is responsible for developing a deep knowledge of the current risk infrastructure, identifying opportunities for improvements and may involve in the design of solutions to address shortcomings or enhancement in coordination with the Solutions Engeering team within Risk Analytics, the Investment Risk group and IT. Additionally the candidate will participates or leads ad-hoc Investment Risk projects and autonomously liaises with other departments to satisfy dependencies and acquire source data. The candidate will facilitate where appropriate the integration of tactical and manual solutions into production-grade systems by framing and documenting the functionalities for IT.
This position requires someone with high attention to detail, strong sense of ownership and integrity and strong analytical and problem-solving skills. Depending on experience, some basic understanding of risk measurement principles (i.e. risk factors, Value-at-Risk, stress testing, backtesting) is preferred. The position also requires the ability to work diligently with third party risk applications and internally developed applications.
Position Requirements
Prepare, validate and distribute regular CPPIB Investment Portfolio risk reports satisfying both established time-line and accuracy level
Require to accommodate early work shift (8am to 4pm) to support critical daily compliance monitoring requirement
Analyze risk results at both portfolio and aggregated fund at a detailed level to ensure completeness and accuracy of the results. Carry out risk attribution to individual investment strategies and risk factors using established methodologies and applications
Adhere to established standards with regards to escalation protocols of both limits violations and production operational issues
Assist in developing and executing tests to ensure the accuracy and completeness of information being used to calculate risk measures
Develop and maintain documentation related to Risk Measurement processes and activities
Work with functional teams, in particularly Risk Oversight teams to develop strategy-specific risk reports and to analyze investment department strategies
Provide on-going support function to both management reporting and financial reporting
Work with data service departments and/or IT partner to identify and source necessary position, market and reference data to fulfill risk measurement practices
Develop and foster effective working relationships across the CPP Investment Board and external risk service providers
Other duties as required

Qualifications

0 – 2 years of work experience (Analyst) in financial industry or 2 – 4 years of work experience (Senior Analyst) in financial industry with a focus on Financial/Risk/Management reporting areas
Previous work experience in an operational role would be a strong asset
Undergraduate or advanced degree in Business, Finance, Engineering, Math or other relevant discipline with a strong appetite for quantitative and statistical data
Professional designation; CFA, CA, CAIA, FRM or other would be an asset
Strong analytical skills and problem solving abilities
Solid working knowledge in the use of Excel, Word and PowerPoint
Ability to build/automate solutions and lead initiatives using SQL/Database/VBA skills is an asset
Flexibility and adaptability
Able to deliver in a constantly changing and fast paced organization
Able to partner with different areas of the organization and with different employee levels
Ability to deliver in a high performance culture operating under time-sensitive deadlines
Exemplifies our guiding principles of partnership, integrity and high performance
Additional Information

Visit our Linkedin Career Page or Follow us on LinkedIn. #LI-PM1
At CPP Investment Board, we are committed to diversity and equitable access to employment opportunities based on ability.
We thank all applicants for their interest but will only contact candidates selected to advance in the hiring process.

Disclaimer:
CPP Investment Board does not accept resumes from employment placement agencies, head-hunters or recruitment suppliers that are not in a formal contractual arrangement with us. Our recruitment supplier arrangements are restricted to specific hiring needs and do not include this or other web-site job postings. Any resume or other information received from a supplier not approved by CPP Investment Board to provide resumes to this posting or web-site will be considered unsolicited and will not be considered. CPP Investment Board will not pay any referral, placement or other fee for the supply of such unsolicited resumes or information.

PermanentWho we are

We are an organization comprised of industry thought leaders who are passionate about health data and want to make a difference in the health care field. We are an independent, not-for-profit organization and together with our partners we provide essential information on Canada's health systems, enabling decisions that lead to healthier Canadians. As a valued member of the CIHI team, you and your work will have a pivotal role in the evolution of Canada's health care systems.
CIHI is recognized as an exceptional place to work that embraces diversity, respect, integrity, collaboration and innovation.
At CIHI, we recognize what matters to our employees. Some of the benefits of working at CIHI include
Generous vacation days
Flexible benefits program from your first day on the job
HOOPP Pension Plan (Defined Pension)
Retirement Planning Program
Work-life balance
Career Planning Program
Learning and Professional Development Program
Why is this role important?
The Analyst is responsible for providing assistance in compiling data, information and evidence from a variety of data, literature and other sources to support data analysis, statistical and data quality studies, as well as the production of analytical products, literature reviews and reports. Other activities include participating in the development and calculation of indicators, undertaking data requests as well as preparation of technical documentation. Specifically, the Analyst will play a key role in supporting products and services derived from the Canadian Patient Cost Database (CPCD) and Canadian MIS Database (CMDB). Examples of current products include the update and maintenance of the Patient Cost Estimator and the financial indicators included in the YourHealthSystem website.
What you'll do

Conducts and interprets basic data analysis to support reports and studies. Provides support and assists with broader analysis under the direction of the Senior Analyst and(or) Program Lead, in accordance with the data access policies/processes.
Participates in statistical studies, data quality studies, analytical products, and other activities related to the CPCD and/or CMDB.
Participates in indicator calculations, data requests, and other data related inquiries.
Analyzes research findings and prepares statistical and descriptive reports.
Assists the FSI team in fulfilling analytical requirements, literature reviews, data quality reviews, writing reports, and other duties as required.
Supports the ongoing update, testing and maintenance of MIS-related data contained in CIHI products.
Assists with data quality assurance process, fact checking activities and reports as directed.
Prepares technical notes/definitions to agreed specifications. Drafts written text for CIHI reports or analytical projects within agreed outline under guidance from senior staff (i.e. Senior Analysts, Program Leads).
Responds to client requests with areas of expertise.
Respects privacy and confidentiality of information by adhering to policies in Privacy and Confidentiality of Health Information at CIHI and related procedures and directives.

What you'll bring to the table

Undergraduate degree in health information, mathematics and statistics, business, economics or related field.
2 years experience in the manipulation and analysis of administrative data sets and standard analytical techniques.
Strong ability in SAS and Microsoft Excel.
Conceptual and problem solving skills.
Effective written and verbal communication skills.
Proven ability to work as part of a team, and work with minimal supervision.
Strong organizational skills with a demonstrated ability to prepare, interpret and effectively present key analytical findings.
Knowledge of the Standards for Management Information Systems in Canadian Health Service Organizations (MIS Standards) is an asset.
Knowledge of the MIS Patient Costing Methodology is an asset.
Knowledge of case mix products and theories is an asset.
Knowledge of CIHI’s databases, in particular the Discharge Abstract Database (CAD), or National Ambulatory Care Reporting System (NACRS) an asset.
Ability to communicate in both official languages is an asset.

Closing Statement

To find out more about this role and other exciting opportunities visit our website at www.cihi.ca and check out our 'Careers' section.
We thank all those who apply, however, only candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.
Employment Equity

At CIHI we are committed to fostering an inclusive, barrier-free and accessible environment. Part of this commitment includes arranging accommodations to ensure an equitable opportunity to participate in the recruitment and selection process. If you require an accommodation, we will work with you to meet your needs.

Job Type: Full-Time
Posting Date: February 14, 2019

Who We Are

Who We Are
Gateway Casinos & Entertainment Limited (“Gateway”) is one of the largest and most diversified gaming and entertainment companies in Canada. Across its 27 gaming properties in British Columbia, Ontario and Edmonton, Alberta, Gateway currently employs approximately 8,648 people and boasts approximately 448 table games (including 49 poker tables), 13,887 slots, 85 restaurants and bars and 561 hotel rooms. Gateway is the service provider for the Central, Southwest and North gaming Bundles in Ontario, which includes 11 properties in their portfolio. A multi-pronged growth strategy has seen Gateway diversify and expand its product offering, including developing proprietary casino and restaurant brands, dramatically improving the gaming customer experience while attracting new customers. Some of Gateway's proprietary brands include Match Eatery & Public House, Atlas Steak + Fish and the new Halley’s Club. In 2017, Gateway celebrated 25 years in the business of gaming and entertainment in Canada. Further information is available at www.gatewaycasinos.com.

Why Work For Us

Gateway celebrates and empowers those employees who made it all possible. A career at Gateway means great people, a great atmosphere and career advancement opportunities across our locations. Our employees thrive with ongoing training and leadership programs for all while working in an engaging and fun environment. Join us today!
The Position

Join our growing IT Team! The incumbent will be responsible for leading team(s) of technical specialists/analysts to provide support for all environments within the organization, including all facets of Data Center Operations, focusing on Data Centers, Servers, Backups and Networking components. The Manager will also be required to liaise with Ontario Lottery and Gaming (OLG), third-party vendor management and Disaster Recovery Planning (DRP)/ Business Continuity Planning (BCP). This is an exciting opportunity to collaborate with multiple project/program stakeholders, including the Business Units, Project Managers, Solution Architects, Business Systems Analysts, Quality Assurance, IT infrastructure teams and third-party vendors.
Key Responsibilities

Architect, implement, and maintain network hardware and configurations
Deliver stable and responsive application, server, data storage, and backup services and software for the various datacenter environments
Take a lead role in ensuring the security and compliance requirements of networks and protected data
Lead Disaster Recovery initiative from an infrastructure perspective including documenting recovery procedures of all critical components
Collaborate with business leaders to design solutions that meet evolving company objectives

Legalization has opened up the recreational cannabis market in Canada, and the global demand for medical cannabis continues to expand. In this exciting new environment, Canopy Growth’s mission is to be the No. 1 cannabis company in the world. We’re looking for incredible people to join us on the journey.

The Company

With millions of square feet of licensed cannabis production and operations spanning five continents, Canopy Growth Corporation (“Canopy Growth”) is the largest legal producer of cannabis in the world. It is a listed company on the Toronto Stock Exchange (WEED), the New York Stock Exchange (CGC), and is part of the S&P Composite Index. Its wholly owned subsidiaries — including its flagship, Tweed, and international medical companies operating under the Spectrum Cannabis brand — are leading producers of legal, regulated cannabis.

Headquartered in Smiths Falls, Ontario, Canopy Growth recognizes that employees are at the core of its success, and takes pride in a corporate culture that emphasizes inclusiveness, collaboration, and diversity. Our employees come from a wide range of backgrounds, each bringing their own unique skills and talents to the table, working together to continue and increase our incredible momentum of growth.

The Opportunity

Canopy Growth is looking for a Regional Operations Analyst to join our team. As a Regional Operations Analyst, you will help lay the data foundation of the company to be data driven. You’ll have a chance to collaborate with various teams in the organization to understand different data and reporting requirements.

Responsibilities

Coordinate and standardize inventory procedures to ensure compliance and consistency across all sites
Provide support to the Supply Chain team to ensure sites are compliant with scheduling requirements, report any deviations.
Perform trend analysis to proactively identify deficiencies or opportunities that may arise
Provide data to sites to enable cost management and identify overspends and savings opportunities
Provide oversight to ensure adherence and compliance with production schedules
Support the Finance, Operations, and Grow departments by providing data when available
Support ERP Implementation
Assist with business improvement project initiatives
Other duties as assigned

Experience

Strong computer skills
Attention to detail and a high degree of accuracy
Analytical and able to understand P&L statements
Proficient in MS Office suite – particularly Word, Excel and PowerPoint
Interpersonal skills to include organization, coordination, facilitation and planning
Strong ability to multitask, work under pressure and meet timelines

Other Details

This is a full time position based out of Niagara-on-the-Lake, Aldergrove or Delta.

Job Description
IBM is seeking a Risk Analyst to strengthen the IBM Algo Risk Service and Data Management Teams.

IBM Algo Risk Service on Cloud offers hedge funds, asset managers, pension funds and other buy-side organizations access to an award-winning web-based portfolio construction, financial risk management and reporting service without the costs or challenges of an in-house deployment. Offering bundled data, it provides a wide variety of simulation-based risk analytics that enable portfolio managers, traders, risk managers and senior executives to take a proactive approach to financial risk oversight and investment decision making.

The Role

Risk Analysts work in a multi-disciplinary group (business leads, technical consultants and core Development teams) to support the IBM Algo Risk Service on Cloud framework or to assist in Data Quality and Validation. This framework involves data, analytics and reporting services that employ Risk Analytics Algo One applications. Working from an existing legacy platform, consultants assist in the transformation to a dynamic and flexible Cloud based risk service integrated with a proprietary Data Service.

Our team works collaboratively and members are encouraged to explore and develop unique ways to solve challenges employing advanced quantitative finance techniques. Projects require individuals who are able to research and experiment to develop new ideas and solutions. Working with an open and constructive mindset, guidance and feedback is available from the broader group.


Responsibilities :
Provide subject matter expert advice to internal and external audience for risk management topics including financial markets operations, product valuation methods, scenario based risk analysis and risk reporting standards.
Own functional projects related to feature extensions including interaction with development team (team & core), research and client service teams. Involves independent scope setting, task determination, priority setting and development support
Consulting with sales and pre-sales to present Service capabilities to prospects. Identify and fill gaps where necessary.
Investigation of data sourcing, transformation and storage for use in the risk management process. May involve extensive communication and negotiation with external vendors.
Investigation and remediation of client support issues (3rdlevel support).
Work with Development team to improve the core software offering.
Competencies and Skills :
Theoretical understanding of financial economics, mathematics and statistics.
Practical knowledge of financial markets and risk management standards.
Practical knowledge and experience around financial instrument valuation methods and (stochastic) scenario generation techniques.
Strong research and problem solving skills.
Familiarity with data science languages such as R or Python.
Written and oral presentation skills. Must be able to convey complex ideas to a functional and technical audience.
Technical aptitude including use of computer networks, Linux operating system and client/server applications.
Education :
University degree in the field of Economics, Finance, Mathematics, Statistics or other quantitative discipline.
Advanced degree in Financial Engineering or Mathematical Finance is beneficial.
CFA, PRM or FRM designation(s) beneficial.
**NOTE: the successful candidate will need to work from our 185 Spadina Ave office on a regular basis**

Required Technical and Professional Expertise

At least 5 years of relevant experience in the financial industry working with front or middle office portfolio risk management systems.
Experience in an advanced technical environment – collaborating on or writing scripts or code, integration, testing and deployment.
Experience with financial market data such as Reuters, Bloomberg or Interactive Data applications.

Preferred Tech and Prof Experience

N/A

Reporting to the Senior Manager, CRM Solutions, the Information Management Support Analyst (ISSA) will provide end user support for HSF’s core application, OneCRM and its associated technologies. The ISSA will provide end user support by troubleshooting issues and developing and implementing logical and effective solutions. The ISSA will be responsible for resolving all technical and functional issues and requests in a timely manner. This position will contribute to the overall operational management of OneCRM and its associated technologies lead the change request process and be a key contributor to implementing new OneCRM functionality releases. ISSA will work closely with other HSF teams, external vendors and end users to remediate reported incidents in a timely and professional manner.

Activities include but are not limited to triage, troubleshooting and gathering and analyzing logs to identify the possible cause of incidents. The incumbent will participate in the determination of appropriate course of action to resolve issues with minimal business interruption. The primary focus of this position is to ensure smooth operation of OneCRM and its associated technologies.

Key responsibilities
General Day-to-day Application Support
 Address enquiries and provide support to internal staff and external customers via email and phone. Utilize application knowledge to effectively troubleshoot, diagnose and resolve problems. Ensure requests are completed in a timely and courteous manner while building rapport with their clients. Communicate and escalate issues as needed. Perform post-resolution follow-ups ensuring clients are satisfied with the end results. Interface with the Information Management team, Service Desk, ITS Infrastructure and external vendors to ensure issues are resolved Open support tickets and work with external vendors to address, manage and fix technical issues Manage support queue, assigning work orders via an internal ticketing system according to the tiered support model Proactively act on issues, draw additional support from team members and escalate as required

CRM Operational Management
 Continuously monitor and audit existing data for quality assurance. Analysis and clean-up of existing and incoming data. Compiling, sorting and verifying the accuracy of data before it is entered Research information to complete missing data Perform and verify that scheduled and ad-hoc system processes and data loads are successful and data is accurate Help with user access management (License availability, permissions etc.) Bug/Enhancement identification & testing Develop and communicate a schedule for future OneCRM releases/enhancements Perform related duties consistent with the scope and intent of the position

Training and Documentation
 Record, track, and document the help desk request problem-solving process, including all successful and unsuccessful decisions made, and actions taken, through to the final resolution. Write and maintain help sheets, FAQs, and knowledge database Help develop training plans, materials, and documentation for users and keep materials up-to-date Create and update documents related to application support method and procedures Help provide ongoing product training and refresher sessions to new and existing users Monitor user adoption rates and respond as needed by providing additional training sessions, communication, modifications, or other resources

Analysis and Requirements Gathering
 Assist with analyzing business processes used within business units and recommend technology or process changes that would eliminate unnecessary processes, improve department efficiency and effectiveness, and improve information flow between departments Help gather and document business and system requirements Assist with research and recommendations to update processes Contribute to CRM product evolution and acquire new knowledge to improve support offering

Lateral Relationships
 Work with the internal business solutions application support team and internal program partners to resolve issues and manage pipeline of bugs fixes and enhancements Work with internal training partners to address training needs to the area offices Work with external vendors to manage support requests and technical builds Work with IT Computer and Operations team for systems testing, project work, database management, network operations to gather required information to resolve issues and to provide guidance and expertise about OneCRM Understand & effectively communicate issues and translating requirements to technical team Manage cross-functional users expectations (business, technical and external vendors)

Education
 Bachelor degree or college diploma in computer science, information systems, business administration or related field

Work Experience and Skills
 3 – 5 years working in Information Management / Technical environment 3 – 5 years in tier 1 or tier 2 application support 1 - 2 years with a solid understanding of SQL Server and Microsoft software development environments Bilingual (English and French) required (spoken and written) Strong knowledge of relational databases and database integration for websites Strong analytical skills in application diagnostics, issue isolation and troubleshooting Proficiency with standard MS Office applications, MS Visio, MS Project Strong understanding of systems environments, quality assurance and change management methodologies Ability to work independently and in a team environment Knowledge in financial, ERP, CRM, business support and reporting systems, an asset Strong interpersonal skills in areas such as teamwork, facilitation and negotiation Strong written, verbal and presentations skills, with the ability to tailor information to the audience in a way that establishes rapport, influences others and gains understanding at all levels Strong ability to communicate with technical and non-technical staff Highly self-motivated and self-directed with an attention to detail Proven analytical, evaluative, and problem-solving abilities Ability to conduct research into a wide range of computing issues as required. Ability to absorb and retain information quickly. Ability to present ideas in user-friendly language Keen attention to detail Exceptional customer service orientation

Working Conditions
 Mainly office based. Some travel required (<5%) Evening and weekend work as required

$50,000 - $55,000 a yearAre you ready to infuse your career with excitement? Do you relish the opportunity to use your analytical and data mining expertise to impact and influence success across multiple business lines (financials, marketing and field performance, operations and more) in a highly successful organization?

If this sounds good to you, Steeped Tea is looking for you: our new Data Analyst / Administrator.

You’re an experienced Data Analyst or Administrator, with strong SQL, communications and problem-solving skills, who wants to positively impact a company that’s as driven as you are. You’re passionate about precision, and love generating smart plans from relevant data and maintaining multiple databases.

About Steeped Tea

It all started with a cup of tea. In the last ten years, Steeped Tea (http://www.steepedtea.com/) has turned tea lovers into business owners. Today, Steeped Tea has been recognized year over year as one of PROFIT 500’s Fastest-Growing Companies. We are the biggest success story in Dragon's Den history, partnered with David Chilton and Jim Treliving.

Steeped Tea is a direct-selling company manufacturing, blending and distributing premium loose-leaf teas and accessories through a network of thousands of Independent Consultants across North America. We empower others to start their own business and generate an income by selling Steeped Tea products directly to consumers in their community.

Data Analyst / Administrator

Reporting to the Finance Director, with responsibilities across the organization including IT, you will play a key role in maintaining our databases and running recurring / adhoc reports informing our business on key strategic and tactical insights that support our sales, marketing and financial decisions.

Your main goal is to ensure that the business has accurate and accountable data to maintain historical integrity and that the business has key analytics and reports in order to make smart decisions.

Your contributions will provide the foundation for our short- and long-term goals and build opportunities for business growth and our future success. Your extensive experience with SQL, query writing in MS SQL Server and Excel tools will allow you to mine and analyze data and create reports to facilitate excellent decision processes.

You will be a valued influencer and contributor across all business lines. Succeeding here is as much about relationships, as it is data, and so your communication and listening skills are key. And as we progress towards a more data driven business model, your technical skills will be as important as your eye for detail, passion for problem solving, and aptitude for analysis

Practically speaking, you will:

Maintain Steeped Tea’s consultant database ensuring the accuracy and timely execution of data entry and systems integrations to maintain historical integrity
Report monthly on business financials, marketing and field performance, and operation metrics with insights on efficiency/effectiveness using SQL and Excel tools.
Conduct ad hoc data analysis and reporting for the organization to assist in the data analysis of various user platforms to improve ability to analyze and project trends to monitor business performance.
Run and model sales promotions and marketing programs to provide recommendations that improve cost efficiency/effectiveness and guide future promotions and programs.
Maintain and build an accessible knowledge library of published data dictionary reports as well as data management documentation for communication and education
Assist with the transition and onboarding to a new analytics software platform

This role is deeply involved in all aspects of our business and offers an excellent career building opportunity. If that sounds exciting to you, then we can’t wait to meet you.

Working at Steeped Tea

At Steeped Tea, it’s our goal to create an entrepreneurial and creative environment that is both challenging and rewarding. We love what we do and are inspired to outperform every day. You’ll see the impact of your work on the business every single day.

This is an 18-month contract opportunity with a competitive salary ($50,000-$55,000/year), and comprehensive benefits plan (health, dental, vision, etc.).

Office hours are Monday to Friday, 9:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m. in our Ancaster office.

Qualifications

Here’s what we’re looking for:

Experience in a similar data analytics or administrator role, ideally in a manufacturing, production or distribution environment
Experience providing insights into sales, promotions, and marketing programs
Significant experience with SQL and query writing in MS SQL Server is a must
Experience with Web based hosting service, Azure, HTML, CSS an asset
Expert level knowledge of Excel (VBA, macros, pivot tables, master sheets)
Post-secondary degree or diploma in business, marketing, commerce, finance, or a related field
Experience with any of the following software is an asset: SSRS, WMS, Party Plan Solutions and IDSTC and/or Izenda
Experience in a direct selling organization is an asset

How to Apply

Our online application will give you the option to apply to this role as a complete person – not just a resume. The application will assess your qualifications, personality traits and workplace preferences, and should take 10 to 15 minutes to complete. After submitting, you'll receive an email inviting you to log in and view your assessment results.

We strive to build a team that reflects the diversity of the community we work in, and encourage applications from traditionally underrepresented groups such as women, visible minorities, Indigenous peoples, people identifying as LGBTQ2SI, veterans, and people with disabilities. If we can make this easier through accommodation in the recruitment process, please contact us using the “Help” button.

We will review applications, with priority given to those who have completed the assessment, and look forward to hearing from you.

Job Summary
Positions within this family ensure data is properly managed and leveraged from Source to Storage to Delivery in the most efficient and effective way to benefit the organization. This position is an Entry level role into Data Management field. This position performs accountabilities under general supervision and supervisor provides guidance and examples on how to perform a task but expects the employee to use the new knowledge to independently perform the task. General supervision: the employee is told what to do but not how to do it. The how to is left up to the employee. These jobs have some discretion on work accountabilities.

Primary Job Duties & Responsibilities
Applies data derivations, rules; and data requirements that align with standards and regulatory compliance. Participates in the data governance and metadata processes by preparing artifacts for review and submission (i.e. researching, preparing simple submissions, and data quality metrics). Actively implements Data Management standards and best practices. Acts as data management representative on projects to review data requirements against data standards. Monitors, identifies, investigates, prioritizes, remediates and communicates data quality issues. Performs data profiling, analyzes and communicates results in support of data quality processes. Implements processes to certify data quality for business intelligence purposes. Applies data and data quality definitions and standards, and transformation rules, in daily work. Demonstrates understanding of overall data models, data relationships, mapping lineage and business rules and participates in the creation of data models (e.g. entity design and population). Builds on existing knowledge to learn line of business specific end to end data flow and lineage from capture at source, to storage, to delivery and its business intent at each stage (i.e. capture, transformation, fragmentation and editing). Performs assigned functions to meet goals and objectives of the unit. Data Analysis: For assigned tasks, develop and maintains business data requirements to support data standards, ensuring that solutions (structure, values, relationships, quality standards) meet operational and business needs. Analyzes customer requests (internal or external regulatory, e.g. data calls) for changes/new business data requirements to production system, determines impact on existing systems processes and develops appropriate specifications, enhancements, system table updates and/or procedures to comply. Meet with customer to elicit requirements and conduct fact gathering sessions. Independently conduct root cause analysis; identify data trends, propose and implement approved specification changes to address issue, working with impacted areas. Perform testing and validation of business data requirements, including creation of test strategy and test plans. Perform other duties as assigned.

Minimum Qualifications
Bachelors degree or equivalent education required.

Education, Work Experience & Knowledge
Bachelors degree in STEM (Science, Technology, Engineering, Mathematics) or Business preferred. 1+ yrs. general business experience, Data Management experienced preferred. Insurance knowledge preferred. Understands concepts and applications of business information models. Demonstrates understanding of relationship between data and business rules and functions (i.e. data analysis concepts). Proficient with tools and software to extract and analyze data in the data management function.

Job Specific & Technical Skills & Competencies
Solid knowledge of data practices and principles for data analysis. Demonstrated solid analytic and diagnostic skills. Demonstrated solid interpersonal skills. Demonstrated solid communication skills. Ability to work independently and as part of a team. Demonstrated ability to multi-task. Demonstrated problem solving and diagnostic skills. Seeks opportunities to learn. Solid decision making skills. Intermediate skill/competency level: demonstrates solid knowledge and ability; can apply the competency with minimal or no guidance, in the full range of typical situations. Requires guidance handling novel or more complex situations.

The Data Protection Risk Management professional will develop and deliver solutions for evaluating enterprise IT security practices, identifying and mitigating risks, establishing security policies and practices, implementing controls, and educating stakeholders. Apply standards and best practices in infrastructure and application security.

Working directly with clients and Accenture teams to create and maintain data protection components for client engagements.

2 years of data protection Compliance, risk management and incident management experience
2 years of advance experience with Firewall Management, McAfee, Cisco Firepower FMC (Firewall Management Console) and IAM

About Cognizant
Cognizant is one of the world's leading professional services companies, transforming clients' business, operating and technology models for the digital era. Our unique industry-based, consultative approach helps clients envision, build and run more innovative and efficient businesses. Headquartered in the U.S., Cognizant, a member of the Nasdaq-100, is ranked 195 on the Fortune 500 and is consistently listed among the most admired companies in the world. Learn how Cognizant helps clients lead with digital at www.cognizant.com or follow us on Twitter: Cognizant.

Who we are
lululemon is a yoga-inspired technical apparel company up to big things. The practice and philosophy of yoga informs our overall purpose to elevate the world through the power of practice. We are proud to be a growing global company with locations all around the world, from Vancouver to Shanghai, and places in between. We owe our success to our innovative product, our emphasis on our stores, our commitment to our people, and the incredible connections we get to make in every community we are in.

About this team
Within retail operations, the future retail operations team leads initiatives that transform our retail experience across channels. we create new programs and tools to change guest and educator behavior that elevate guest experience in the physical and digital environment, allowing us to recognize outcomes & opportunities that wouldn’t otherwise exist. We love strategic, resourceful and innovative people that excel at operations recognizing business needs, collaborating and initiating action (read: cool nerds that make the magic happen).

About Omni Channel & Store Technology
RFID is the heart beat that supports our omni-channel and in-store technology programs. Through industry leading inventory accuracy, we’re able to know where our inventory is at all times. Store Technology programs such as digital fixtures and instore transacting allow us leverage accurate inventory look up. Our omni fulfillment programs such as “ship from store” & “buy online, pickup in store” unlock this power of RFID, ensuring we can always find whatever product a guest wants and get it to them to wherever they want, as fast as they want it.

A day in the life:
Drive analysis and insights for our Store Technology programs in North American storesWork in collaboration with our Product Owners to support the prioritization of workSupport our UX designers to help uncover data to drive designPerform ad hoc quantitative and qualitative analyses to support the development of store technology use cases and experiences to engage, inspire, and connect lululemon guestsAudit and evaluate initiatives post-implementationWork with a cross-functional team including E-Commerce, IT, Store Operations, FP&A and ProductAgile in identifying and helping resolve project issues as they arise

Qualifications:
Three to Five years of professional work experienceMinimum BA / BS degree from a four-year accredited universityAbility to collect, analyze, and present complex large data in a simple, digestible wayHungry to learn, problem-solve and make an impact on the organizationDesire and ability to learn quickly and work in an agile environmentResourceful and able to work on time-sensitive deliverables autonomouslyComfortable coordinating with multiple cross-functional stakeholdersHighly proficient in Excel and experience with visualization tools (e.g. Qlik, Power B.I, Tableau)Experience with ecomm analytics tools such as Adobe, Google Analytics, Quantum Metrics a plusUnderstanding of retail and online landscape a plusRFID & store experience a plus

Must haves:
Acknowledges the presence of choice in every moment and takes personal responsibility for their life.Possesses an entrepreneurial spirit and continuously innovates to achieve great results.Communicates with honesty and kindness, and creates the space for others to do the same.Leads with courage, knowing the possibility of greatness is bigger than the fear of failure.Fosters connection by putting people first and building trusting relationships.Integrates fun and joy as a way of being and working, aka doesn’t take themselves too seriously

Learning Management System Analyst-00138334-20190311
Description
One of Husky’s advantages is that we are an integrated oil and gas company. From exploration to development, production, refining and marketing, we’ve got it all! Combine this with a range of learning and development tools and an inclusive work environment, and you are well-positioned for a successful career at Husky.
We have training, mentoring and career development programs and resources to help you develop both personally and professionally – as an employee or a leader. We offer many internal leadership and business skills courses along with tuition reimbursement programs for qualified employees. Every year, a significant number of our employees are able to take on new roles within the company thanks to our strong focus on hands-on learning and development.
Husky is currently looking for a Learning Management System (LMS) Analyst to join their Heavy Oil and Oil Sands (HOOS) Thermal Operations at their Lloydminster, SK location
This position will be instrumental in completion of the Competency Assurance Project (CAP) requirements. Reporting to the Thermal Training Supervisor, the LMS Analyst is responsible for the overall administration and support of Husky’s SuccessFactors LMS and personnel training data. This includes collaboration with Site Trainers, Information Services (IS) and Applications Support groups, as well as vendors to leverage the LMS effectively and efficiently to support learning activities across the organization. The role requires in depth understanding of components, features, and functions of the SuccessFactors LMS.
Specific responsibilities will include:
Transition Thermal Training master data as per CAP requirements
Managing master data for SuccessFactors LMS (define and support master data build, manage personnel data related to training, and test and publish online training (WBTs))
Troubleshooting issues and working with IS / Application Support teams and other stakeholders to resolve technical, system and master data related issues
Managing business processes between LMS and site level training activities
Supporting site level LMS Trainers and end users, including master data build activities and training delivery for system functionality
Liaising with 3rd party online training developers and internal business stakeholders
Participating in testing activities related to configuration changes and regular system upgrades
Receiving and responding to LMS related queries
Supporting a 3rd party vendor LMS (FiLMS) used to manage external contractor training
Generating and distributing reports as required
Enter qualifications into SAP
Plan, source, facilitate and allocate costs for training events and programs
Generate reports as required by managers
Administer tests and deliver certifications
Support and trouble-shoot all training and LMS issues
Work with leaders to establish all training requirements
Responsible to plan, source, arrange and deliver training events, courses and programs to the Lloydminster staff as required or requested.
Build training events and enter qualifications into the Husky Learning Management System (LMS) to ensure accurate training records are maintained.
Work closely with the corporate training department on corporate training initiatives
Administer and correct training exams as required.
Support Thermal and Lloydminster Production Services with various external and internal training websites and platforms.
Provide access and reporting support for external training and orientation databases.
Provide support to the Husky Operational Integrity Management System (HOIMS) element 6 (personal competency and training) stewards network teams
Our ideal candidate will have the following qualifications:
Post-secondary education in Human Resources, Business Administration, Learning and Development, or related field of study
High School Diploma
Valid class 5 driver’s license
Solid understanding of SuccessFactors LMS
A working understanding of Process Operations, Power Engineering, Process Flow Operations and Technical certifications.
Intermediate working knowledge of Microsoft Office – especially Excel
Minimum of 1-3 years’ experience in the Oil and Gas industry
Experience with virtual learning environments would be an asset (e.g. Adobe Connect)
Experience with Authoring tools (e.g. Captivate, Storyline, etc.) would be an asset
Experience with Video-conferencing and using room audio-visual equipment.
Working knowledge of Captivate or other program for building Web based training
Confidential information management experience
Knowledge and experience with Husky and Vendor Software and databases. such as SAP, LMS, HDMS, HuskyLearns, Sask. WCB, and Husky Swift learning would be an asset
Proven communication skills and ability to and liaise with multiple sets of stakeholders
Ability to organize work and prioritize in a fast-paced environment
Willingness to take initiative to improve business processes related to learning activities
Ability to problem solve and troubleshoot issues
Excellent attention to detail
Demonstrated strong customer service skills
This position is based in Lloydminster and requires the successful candidate to live in the Lloydminster area. We encourage all applicants to review the following websites about living and working in the Lloydminster area:
http://www.lloydminster.ca
http://lloydminstertourism.ca
http://www.lloydminstereconomy.ca
For this position you will be required to maintain a Class 5 driver's license, a satisfactory driving record, and adhere to the appropriate Company policies and guidelines. A Driver’s abstract will be one of the background checks requested in the Pre-employment Screening for the final candidate.
Please note that pre-employment background checks are pre-conditions to Husky employment offers and must be completed successfully before you are confirmed to start with Husky.
At Husky, we respect diversity and embrace an inclusive culture. We value uniqueness and different perspectives as they play a critical role in our success. To achieve this, individuals are selected based on qualifications, merit, and abilities and we encourage applications from everyone including visible minorities, Indigenous peoples, women, and persons with disabilities.
Husky Energy is an integrated Canadian energy company. It is headquartered in Calgary, Alberta, and is publicly traded on the Toronto Stock Exchange under the symbol HSE. The Company operates Upstream and Downstream business segments, with operations in Canada, the United States, China and Indonesia.
Husky's balanced growth strategy focuses on consistent execution, disciplined financial management and safe and reliable operations.
Interested candidates must apply online at: www.huskyenergy.com/careers. Only those candidates who apply via Husky's online application process can be considered. We thank all applicants for their interest in our organization; however, only short-listed applicants will be contacted.
