Are you a numbers person? Data wizard? Enjoy working with business leaders to help them bring ideas to life? All in a dynamic and fun environment? If so, we have just the opportunity for you!
Working under the direction of the Total Rewards Manager, the Compensation Analyst provides administrative support on various Total Rewards operational activities and initiatives that are aligned with Prospera’s corporate goals and total rewards philosophy.
What you’ll do:
Researching, gathering and analyzing data on salary trends, compensation surveys, job market data, and more;
Evaluating jobs and making recommendations on candidate compensation;
Creating reports for Payroll, Total Rewards, and the People & Culture department in general.
Assisting in the job evaluation process; including collecting and analyzing job content information, applying job evaluation methodology, and documenting findings and recommendations.
Assisting with the annual performance review and salary increase administration.
Assisting with various compensation related analysis, including cost analysis that may involve various data modeling scenarios and identifies cost impact of program recommendations.
Conducting salary survey activities, including data collection, organization and submission of data to external parties.
Collecting and analyzing survey data to benchmark the company's position; recommending changes to salary and benefit structures as required.
Assisting with the delivery of new compensation related initiatives from project management to implementation while championing change through communication and education of initiatives.
Administering the Prospera PROPS recognition program and identify trends in program usage.
What you’ll need:
Proficient in Microsoft Office with very strong Excel skills
Strong analytical skills with financial modeling and reporting experience
High degree of accuracy and capacity for working with detailed data
Learning agility, and well developed organizational skills
Strong ability to prioritize to meet deadlines with a strong sense of urgency
Ability to maintain highest levels of confidentiality
Ability to work independently and prioritize and manage own time appropriately
Low drama, high emotional intelligence
What’s in it for you?
Flexibility! Just because our head office is in Abbotsford, doesn’t mean you have to be 5 days a week. We allow the variety of office space, whether you work from head office, a branch, your home office or a coffee shop, we want your best work no matter where that is!
Career Advancement! We are committed to our employee’s growth and development and we want to see you soar. There are a number of career pathing options this position leads to, let us be your spring board.
Fun & Camaraderie. We care deeply about our members and our employees and we want the hours you spend with us to be fun, rewarding and sometimes lighthearted. We like to work hard, play hard, have fun and be there for each other.
Show me the money! We also offer a competitive salary, flexible benefits program and a generous defined benefits pension plan
Community Focused: We care about giving back to the communities we live, work and play in. We provide a paid volunteer day and many community minded activities throughout the year.
Grow your dream with us! Be part of exciting growth happening now at Prospera. Vision 2020 and our Vision, Purpose and Values guide our company and we want you to be part of it!
Apply today for our Compensation Analyst opportunity at www.prospera.ca/careers

About JLL –
We’re JLL. We’re a professional services and investment management firm specializing in real estate. As a Fortune 500 company, we help real estate owners, occupiers and investors achieve their business ambitions. We have nearly 300 corporate offices across 80 countries, with a team of more than 86,000 individuals.
If you’re looking to step up your career, JLL is the perfect professional home. With us, you’ll have a chance to innovate with the world’s leading businesses, put that expertise into action on landmark projects, and work on game-changing real estate initiatives. You’ll also make long-lasting professional connections and be inspired by the best. We’re focused on opportunity and want to help you make the most of yours. Achieve your ambitions—join us at JLL!
POSITION OVERVIEW
Do you have experience conducting research to compile market information and statistics to support pitch materials, publications and reports on the local commercial real estate market? Are you able to adapt and prioritize to meet deadlines in a fast-paced environment?
JLL is currently seeking a dynamic individual for the role of Research Analyst to provide reliable, timely, efficient support to the Retail brokerage team in Toronto. The position entails working with a diverse group of internal and external Stakeholders at all levels of the organization, and the individual will require the independent judgment to plan, prioritize, and organize a diverse workload. This role provides a wide variety of support services to the brokerage teams and the successful candidate will be detail oriented with strong organizational skills and a team player attitude.
RESPONSIBILITIES
Work with research and other team members to compile market information and statistics on the local commercial real estate market; conduct research and collect information materials on market fundamentals, ownership, tenants, and economic analysis
Conduct research at a designated level to support pitch materials, publications, reports and deliverables to the Local Practice Leader and/or applicable brokerage team; assist brokerage professionals through the completion of market surveys, data analysis, cash flow analysis, financial modelling and other deliverables
Contribute to the collection of and ensure the integrity of comparable data, new development information, and applicable information on city planning changes/issues; apply technical and analytical skills to disseminate market data and ensure data integrity
Contribute to designated local market research requests: market snapshots, market overviews, quarterly market decks, topic specific research to support pitches and brokerage opportunities
Liaise regularly with other real estate professionals including developers, appraisers, landlords and brokers
Coordinate and manage daily, weekly and quarterly research tasks
Contribute to special initiatives, such as: annual/semi-annual publications, whitepapers, and quarterly reports (Skyline, Look Forward Skyline, Office Insight) as required
Any other reasonable duties and responsibilities assigned
QUALIFICATIONS
Post-secondary education in Commerce, Economics, Business Administration, Urban Economics, Urban Planning, or Urban Geography
1+ years of relevant experience or combination of education and experience
Experience in the commercial real estate sector is an asset
Demonstrated proficiency with all applicable software packages including but not limited to MS Windows; MS Office, including MS Word, Excel, Outlook, and PowerPoint; Adobe Professional, X, or Standard; CRM; MLS; and RECBC
REQUIRED SKILLS
Good verbal and written communication skills in French and English
Able to adapt and prioritize, meeting deadlines, in a fast-paced environment
May require on-call activity after regular office hours
Operates with a sense of urgency, quickly responding to Stakeholders
Professional yet personable demeanor
Excellent time management and organizational skills
Positive and professional attitude and demonstrates professionalism at all times
Detail oriented with strong analytical skills
Able to work well independently with an ability to work collaboratively with others
Proactive and takes initiative
Able to maintain confidentiality, utilize judgment, and work with minimal supervision
JLL Privacy Statement
When you visit JLL websites, JLL may collect information related to those visits, without you actively sending that information. This information may include, for example, the internet browser you are using, your access device’s operating system, the language in which that system presents information to you, your IP (Internet Protocol) address, the web search that took you to the JLL website, the web pages and advertisements displayed to you, and the links you click on.
For additional details please see JLL's Global Privacy Statement or our career site pages for each country.

Position:

Supervisor, Data Governance


Reports To:

Sr. Manager – Data Governance & Analysis


Tier:

Supervisor/Team Lead


Department:

Data Governance & Service Optimization


Company:

GS1 Canada


Location:
Toronto


Status:

Permanent, Full Time


Job Number:

1434



Keys To The Role

Our mission is to generate the greatest possible return on internal data assets by protecting the integrity of enterprise information through data management policies and guidelines. This requires a deep understanding of governance principles and a genuine desire to create, document and audit the conditions which will enforce its robustness.

Reporting to the Sr. Manager, Data Governance & Analysis, the Team Lead, Data Governance will spearhead a team of Analysts to manage organization-wide data governance activities and will have responsibility for improving the quality and maintaining the integrity of subscriber data and information assets. In addition, they will assist in defining indicators of performance and quality metrics and ensure compliance with data related policies, standards, roles and responsibilities, and adoption requirements that aid in increasing cost recovery.

The Team Lead, Data Governance will manage day-to-day activities and workflows by monitoring timelines, allocating resources and ensuring all deliverables are met. This may involve addressing escalations and negotiating deadlines. Data is our asset and thus ensuring Analysts are conducting thorough review of policies and procedures is critical for this role. While being adaptable and responsive to changing priorities, the Lead will also contribute operationally where and when required.

The Team Lead, Data Governance will possess solid understanding of GS1 Canada’s data content across various platforms and will develop and maintain strong relationships with SMEs across the organization to develop this knowledge. The incumbent will be a champion in establishing best practices while maintaining standards and be a pillar of consistency which the team can emulate, and the business can rely on. They will work closely with the Team Lead, Data Analysis to ensure standard operating procedures are clearly documented and reviewed regularly, processes are mapped, and protocols are followed.


Core Responsibilities
Lead day-to-day data governance operations of 2 or more analysts within the GS1 Data Governance & Service Optimization umbrella
Analyze and oversee strategies designed to enhance data reliability and minimize redundancies and complications
Propose and/or establish the policies, standards, rules, processes and technologies to effectively manage GS1 Canada’s data assets.
Create and maintain common data dictionaries and the tools or methods that support data standards for an organization
Work closely with senior business and technology leaders to create programs, disciplines and practices to significantly improve the ownership and quality of critical data assets.
Have a key role in guiding and influencing various stakeholders across the organization to achieve the goals defined in the enterprise data governance and enterprise data management strategies.
Coach Analysts in validating and modeling data with the purpose of defining clear governance protocols.
Triages requests from the business using workflow management tools, prioritize and delegate tasks. Follow-up daily/weekly on request status and ensuring progress is being made and deadlines are met.
Evaluate business requirements gathered from multiple sources and identify underlying business needs vs wants and work with Analysts to prioritize development efforts.
Create process maps which succinctly represents the flow of data and key decision-making steps.
Closely monitor project resources, tasks, risks and milestones. Bring forward blockers and make recommendations on course corrections when necessary. Act as a point of contact to resolve policy, procedure, or technical issues within the scope of Data Governance Team’s responsibilities and ensuring prompt escalation to Sr. Manager or Sr. Director for critical or time sensitive issues.
Champions initiatives to enhance data quality by identifying opportunities for continuous improvement and efficiencies in reporting, analysis and/or product development
Develop data remediation plans: Monitor and track quality issues, identify gaps, and build action plans to remediate gaps
Lead and develop team members in technical proficiencies required for them to succeed in their roles
Assist with screening, interviewing new staff and conducting onboarding/training as required
Ensure ongoing understanding of relevant emerging technologies and services provided by GS1 Canada.


Required Knowledge, Skills, and Experience
University degree or college diploma in business, science, mathematics or a related area of study; or combination of skills and experience in working in high performing teams
A minimum of 2-3 years’ work experience, preferably in data management, governance, reporting and/or analysis
Preferred minimum of 1-year team management experience in supervisory or team lead capacity, or senior analyst with proven ability to lead.
Ability to analyze, understand and effectively communicate/confirm business requirements, technical design and operational implementation of systems and processes
Proven ability to apply critical thinking. Able to read between the lines to extrapolate requirements not explicitly written or identified and anticipates next steps
Proficiency with Excel and advanced capability with other MS Office applications highly desirable
Background in business intelligence (BI) and familiarity with master data management highly preferred.
Knowledge of Data Warehouses, design and/or architecture highly desired
Demonstrated ability to coach and guide others through both technical and situational problem solving
Works with passion and promotes optimism; fosters respect and builds trust; exhibits confidence in self and develops in others
Takes pride in the team’s work and celebrates their success
Validates with vigour to ensure accuracy and correctness; follows-up promptly
Meticulous with high attention to detail particularly when reviewing work of others
Proven ability to work on multiple projects, multitask and prioritize in a fast-paced environment
Entrepreneurial spirit suited for fast-paced, results-based environment, requiring flexibility to ever-changing needs
Demonstrated ability to interact in a professional and courteous manner
Excellent interpersonal skills with ability to positively influence others; communicate with a negotiating standard
Able to speak and present to stakeholders at all levels
Strong organizational focus, with demonstrated analytical, problem solving and planning skills
Working knowledge of Microsoft Dynamic CRM would be an asset

Senior Business Analyst
Information Systems R27

This posting is to establish an eligibility list for future permanent and/or temporary vacancies.
There is currently one temporary opportunity available until April 3, 2020.

An excellent opportunity to apply your analytical expertise

HSIAR sets out to exercise effective governance over data resources, while enabling timely and secure access to data, supporting an integrated, modernized model of information sharing across the health sector. The Division leads the overarching provincial analytic strategy and approach, and performs comprehensive, integrated analysis of health sector performance to ensure a consistent and timely approach health system measurement utilizing a client centered approach.
In the Senior Business Analyst role, you provide business analysis and consulting services and plan ongoing business and technology needs consistent with government and ministry strategic plans, system standards and interfacing requirements. You provide expert advice to senior staff and also lead multiple project teams. The ideal candidate effectively leads in a team environment, while also independently managing projects and tasks. You are a skilled analytical thinker, an effective communicator, have excellent time management techniques, and thrive in a dynamic project environment with evolving priorities. If you are an experienced information management professional with the initiative required for this challenging role, we look forward to your application.

Job Requirements:
In order to be considered for this position, your application must clearly demonstrate how you meet the education and experience as outlined below:
Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Health Science or a related field and 2 years related experience, OR
A Diploma in Computer Science, Health Science or a related field and 4 years related experience, OR

Related experience must include:
Experience with business analysis methodologies, modelling techniques and the application of the software development life cycle.

job_title: Business Analyst LEAD - FRTB, Capital Markets
job_description:
ContractBusiness Analyst LEAD - FRTB

As an FRTB Business Analyst Lead within our banking client's GRM Enterprise Market Risk (EMR) group, you will support the implementation of the BCBS Minimum Capital Requirements for Market Risk, a.k.a. Fundamental Review of the Trading Book (FRTB).
In this role, you will play a lead working with a group of BAs to provide analysis and assistance, ensuring that the strategic build-out of the overall Market Risk platform toward FRTB compliance is complete and robust.

Responsibilities

Provide analysis and support on Market Risk Projects relating to FRTB implementation by:
Ensures overall requirements will achieve business goals and objectives
Manages requirements across a number of sub-workstreams by providing direction and governance to the BAs and engages with Program Management Requirements Lead and Business/Operations Leads
Responsible for compliance to requirements approach, process and tools
Ensures completeness and quality of requirements documents produced
Co-ordinates with workstream QA Manager to ensure requirements are ‘Testable'
Partners with the Business and Solution Architects to define business needs and explore, assess and recommend value-add solution options to satisfy these on the program
Plans, elicits, analyzes documents, communicates and manages High Level requirements to meet business needs
Partners with project management to identify projects interdependencies within the workstreams
Assisting with the analysis of regulatory requirements and related guidance documents;
Assisting with the documentation and reporting of system enhancements, business processes, operational controls, and data flows within the market risk technology platform, ensuring accuracy and consistency with FRTB standards;
Assisting business SMEs with the creation and development of project artefacts, such as detailed business specifications for market risk systems – with the goal of efficiently reaching FRTB standards;
Providing effective User Acceptance Testing, ensuring the appropriate validation has occurred from Quantitative Risk Analytics and/or Model Risk;
Working with Risk IT colleagues and other stakeholders to reach agreeable and effective solutions to often complex technical problems;
Contributing ideas and concerns, and escalating issues for tactical and strategic system solutions and business process improvements;
Assisting with communications and training of staff
Assisting with project reporting and status updates to senior management; and,
Taking on project management responsibilities as required.

Job Specifications

7+ years of experience in capital markets, either in Market Risk, Middle Office / Product Control or Back Office.
Excellent quantitative skills, with MSc / PhD in Mathematical Finance or similar field.
Solid knowledge of derivative pricing, market risk methodologies, systems and processes, and regulatory requirements.
Ability to clearly communicate highly technical concepts to business stakeholders.
Strong quantitative and analytical skills, with attention to detail.
Solid understanding of IT practices and ability to manage and prioritize development tasks.
Ability to work autonomously.
Results oriented with ability to work effectively under consistent time and workload pressures.

Preferred
CFA, FRM or other related professional qualifications.
7+ years of experience in a role within or directly supporting the market and/or counterparty credit risk groups.

At Sun Life, we work together, share common values and encourage growth and achievement. We offer many career paths that attract a wide variety of talent and skills. Follow a path that lets your talents shine.
Job Description:
As a member of the Individual and SLGI Services (ISS) PMO team, the Project Information Analyst provides portfolio planning, reporting and analysis for the ISS Team and supports key tools that are vital to creation of our reports and metrics. The successful candidate will work closely with the ISS Portfolio Manager to compile and analyze data supporting the ISS Portfolio delivery, including tracking the IT Delivery pipeline, reporting status, and budget and forecast information.
The Project Information Analyst coordinates efforts to collect data, manages spreadsheets, and identifies anomalies and trends. Sources of data could be project delivery actuals in days or cost, delivery planning, project status, chargeback to business partner actuals, IT resourcing requests, etc.
This role provides the successful candidate with the opportunity to exercise and develop technical, analytical, and relationship management skills. The Project Information Analyst will support an environment that promotes knowledge sharing, client service, quality, innovation and teamwork.
This position is part of a dynamic, fast-paced team that offers ample challenges and opportunities to support on-the-job learning and skills development.
What will you do?
Populate, maintain and distribute bi-weekly Portfolio delivery reporting to ISS Delivery management.
Support and govern the ongoing delivery pipeline process, to support Resource Allocations.
Participate in Budget and Forecast setting/reporting for pipeline planning and staffing.
Support consistent and effective use of the time tracking tool (Changepoint) set-up and reporting.
Identify reporting requirements, design the solution, and deliver the expected results.
Support vendor contract process by updating P/O’s and eSig routing, and tracking Invoices.
Proactively identify opportunities for process improvements and drive to solutions.
Takes ownership of small initiatives and engages the appropriate resources to reach solution.
What you need to succeed:
University or other Post-Secondary education in a relevant field (Business, Mathematics, Accounting, Finance or related).
2 years of experience in a similar or equivalent role
Expertise with MS Excel is required, including use of complex data formulas, data validation, data sources and linking, Pivot Tables, charting, etc.
Working knowledge of financial concepts such as expense, chargeback, purchasing cycle, total cost of ownership (TCO), capitalization, amortization, etc.
Experience with Sharepoint, OneNote, MS PowerPoint.
Experience with ChangePoint project / time tracking.
Preferred Skills:
Analytical and problem solving skills with keen attention to detail and ability to consistently, produce high-quality deliverables.
Excellent oral and written communication skills.
Initiative and creativity, with the ability to interpret requests even if not always clearly defined.
Ability to work independently, with minimal direction and proven ability to successfully navigate multiple tasks, priorities and deadlines.
Good judgement in knowing when to escalate issues and proactively seek direction as needed to manage competing priorities and peak workload situations.
Ability to build rapport with colleagues and achieve outcomes through influence and collaborating.
Confident nature and comfort-level with following up with management.
What’s in it for you:
Competitive salary and bonus structure influenced by market range data
Pension, stock and savings programs to help build and enhance your future financial security
A common sense dress code, where you dictate how you dress based on your day
An environment of continuous learning and improvement
The Base Pay range is for the primary location for which the job is posted. It may vary depending on the work location of the successful candidate or other factors. In addition to Base Pay, eligible Sun Life employees participate in various incentive plans, payment under which is discretionary and subject to individual and company performance. Certain sales focused roles have sales incentive plans based on individual or group sales results.
Diversity and inclusion have always been at the core of our values at Sun Life. A diverse workforce with wide perspectives and creative ideas benefits our clients, the communities where we operate and all of us as colleagues. We welcome applications from qualified individuals from all backgrounds.
Persons with disabilities who need accommodation in the application process or those needing job postings in an alternative format may e-mail a request to thebrightside@sunlife.com.
We thank all applicants for showing an interest in this position. Only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

Position Overview
The Business Lean Analyst (“BLA”) is responsible for analyzing and modeling existing business processes. The Business Lean Analyst is responsible for facilitating Business Excellence events to improve the key business processes through implementation of various tools, elimination of waste and automation. The BLA will be a core team member of the ERP implementation in CT/KY.

Travel: There will be significant travel with this role for the first 3 – 5 years.
Effective Summer 2019 – the duties will shift to a Core Team Member Role for the ERP implementation in CT/KY. Duties will include pre-foundational work, test script development, implementation and post-live support.
Duties & Responsibilities
Develop a clear understanding of the business processes from an operational and systems perspective
Determine how to improve existing business processes in conjunction with the stakeholders
Work as a change agent and help support lean across the organization

Understands existing and anticipated ERP functionality that meet business demand

Consult with business unit management and personnel to obtain additional information during system development and evaluate alternatives
Process mapping and validation for functional area
Testing of the new system and all integrations
Provide subject matter expertise and day-to-day planning and implementation for the respective functional area(s) and cross-functional impact
Develop, coordinate, and implement plans to test business and functional processes during system development and quality assurance testing
Serve as communication conduit between the project team, functional management, and the functional area being represented
Champion best practices governance of the ERP system
Train end users in the key functional areas.
Skills & Qualifications
Bachelor’s Degree in Accounting or equivalent background is an asset
Financial, analytical and statistical skills to resolve conflicting and complex objectives
Ability to define problems, establish facts, collect data and draw conclusions
Excellent written and verbal communication, with a strong emphasis on technical writing
Ability to produce clear well documented business cases
ERP Implementation experience is an asset
Leadership traits
Six Sigma certification or equivalent (data analytics)
Scrum Agile Project Management
Manufacturing/Operations Experience
High Energy Level
A passion for excellence.

DMC Mining Services is a leading provider of mining services and solutions. As one of North American’s premier underground contractors for over 38 years our comprehensive list of mining services, range from shaft sinking and raise boring, to full mine development and operation.
With one of the lowest incident / accident frequency rates in the industry, DMC has been called upon by many leading mining companies to fill critical roles in their success. Our focus is on applying the expertise of our employees to attractive projects while pledging to deliver leading technology and overriding commitment to safe practices.
Our core values: Zero Harm, Teamwork, Results Driven, Courage and Accountability.
DMC Mining Services is currently looking for an IT Support Analyst for a contract position based from our Vaughan, ON office. As the IT Support Analyst, you will participate in developing, forming, and following information systems policies and guidelines to ensure our IT systems run smoothly and efficiently.
SPECIFIC DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES
Acts as support in setting up and provisioning Desktop and Notebook PC’s and other related systems, as well as mobile devices (e.g. iPhone, Android, and Windows and iOS Tablets).
Ensures that account creation, printer(s), mobile devices, and VPN access are set up for new hires before their start date.
Supports DMC staff with IT issues and liaise with 3rd party technical support.
Hands on support of the user desktop environment including Windows 7, Windows 10, Microsoft Office, Autodesk Products, Adobe Acrobat, etc.
Works with Active Directory on Windows Server 2008 R2 and higher, and MS Exchange Management Console.
Supports and administers Vaughan office Cisco phone system, including CUCM (Cisco Unified Communications Manager).
Performs system backup, monitoring, and recovery. Participate in disaster recovery testing procedures, using various backup systems.
Participates in adhering to and developing corporate standards for selection of hardware and software to optimize standardization, efficiency and performance.
Provides some on-the-job training to new and existing employees.
Works with the IT Manager to define project and operational needs and prioritize accordingly.
Works with IT staff at Corporate and Operations sites to implement, enhance and monitor corporate IT services and initiatives (i.e. email, Skype, desktop management, etc.).
QUALIFICATIONS, SKILLS AND KNOWLEDGE
Formal Education in Information Systems, Computer Science or equivalent; Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science or Business-related field is preferred.
Achieved or working towards an MCP and VCP.
3-5 years IT experience working in an enterprise environment with an emphasis in user support and infrastructure administration (physical and virtual).
Strong oral and written communication and customer service skills.
A highly organized individual with superior record keeping and strong documentation skills.
Ability to maintain confidentiality with regard to the information processed, stored or accessed on the network.
Able to problem solve and quickly provide a “Plan B” alternate solution when circumstances require it.
Ability to prioritize tasks in a busy, fast paced, dynamic environment.
Responsibilities may require evening and weekend work in response to system support.
Experience with the following systems/processes:
Microsoft Windows Servers (2008 R2 and above), and desktop clients (Windows 7 and 10).
Able to administer Active Directory, DHCP, DNS, Exchange, Skype, client VPN, and patch management.
SharePoint design and administration.
Experience with Web site creation and design.
SQL Server database design and maintenance experience.
VMware vSphere (ESXi5 and 6+ including vCenter).
Cisco Call Manager including CUCM (Cisco Unified Communications Manager) experience.
Working knowledge of Veeam Backup and Replication and endpoint backup software.
Securing client end point devices, through the use of anti-virus and malware tools, personal firewall and data encryption.
Proficient at using desktop management tools, such as imaging and hardware/software inventory management.
Knowledge of Cisco Firewalls and Switches would be an asset.

Manager, Data Governance & Data Analytics

Staff

 1435



Company Profile:

We are a member organization of GS1, the world’s leading supply chain standards organization. As a neutral, not-for-profit organization, we enable our more than 20,000 subscribers – organizations of all sizes from over 20 sectors across Canada – to enhance their efficiency and cost effectiveness by adopting electronic supply chain best practices.


What We Do:
We develop standards that improve the way that business is conducted and allow Canadian businesses to compete on a global scale.
We deliver implementation services that enable businesses to implement standards to achieve supply chain efficiency.
We educate industry on how to incorporate collaborative commerce tools and processes into their businesses through seminars, conferences, and published guides and standards.
Watch our video: GS1 Canada Overview (https://youtu.be/3__lBt8SLvw)

Who We Represent:

As a user-driven and governed organization, our subscriber base includes organizations of all sizes across a wide range of industries and sectors located across Canada and around the world.

Keys To The Role
The Data Analyst will support GS1 Canada’s industry exclusive Dashboard. This includes weekly data processing and validation of master data files, quality assurance testing and ongoing product development and process optimization.

The Data Analyst also plays an integral role in supporting Industry Managed Services (IMS) with subscriber and service level reporting and analysis. Working closely with other analysts, the candidate will extract, process and summarize subscriber data and be instrumental in ensuring data quality and integrity throughout the process.

The Data Analyst will assist the Manager of Data Governance & Analysis to translate business requirements into technical and functional solutions that allow IMS to deliver value added services to existing subscribers and promote enrolment of new subscribers which support cost recovery in the not-for-profit model.

Duties and Responsibilities
Execute the refresh of GS1 Canada’s Dashboard – a portal used by retailers to evaluate vendor compliance to services essential for commerce.
Validate retail data against GS1 Canada registries for completeness and perform quality assurance prior to promotion to production
Transforming, validating and modeling data with the purpose of understanding and drawing conclusions.
Liaise with senior and executive level stakeholders to identify criteria for business reporting and execute the technical solution delivery.
Evaluate business requirements gathered from multiple sources and identify underlying business needs vs wants and work with Manager to prioritize development efforts.
Create reports that go beyond presenting the numbers, but tells a story about the data being evaluated.
Validate system integrity through report generation and analysis from various internal databases as required (i.e. CRM, ECCnet Registry and Item Centre).
Assist with conducting full lifecycle data analysis and evolving analysis and reporting capabilities.
Champions initiatives to enhance data quality by identifying opportunities for continuous improvement and efficiencies in reporting, analysis and/or product development
Establish a brand identity by standardizing report processes and generating output with consistent results, accurate information and quality fit and finish.
Engage with Data Governance to document and maintain procedures for data management and reporting standards;
Ensure ongoing understanding of relevant emerging technologies and services provided by GS1 Canada.
Required Knowledge, Skills, and Experience
University degree or college diploma in business or a related area of study, with a focus on problem solving, analytics/mathematics and critical thinking
A minimum of 2-3 year’s work experience, preferably in data management and reporting capacity
Background in business intelligence (BI) and familiarity with master data management highly preferred.
Ability to analyze, understand and effectively communicate/confirm business reporting requirements, technical design and implementation
Meticulous with high attention to detail
Proven ability to apply critical thinking. Able to read between the lines to extrapolate requirements not explicitly written or identified and anticipates next steps
Takes pride in their work and validates with vigour to ensure accuracy and correctness
Displays passion and optimism; inspires respect and trust; exhibits confidence in self and others
Demonstrated ability to interact in a professional and efficient manner
Excellent interpersonal and communication skills with ability to positively influence others to promote engagement
Able to speak and present to stakeholders at all levels
Strong organizational focus, with demonstrated analytical, problem solving and planning skills
Demonstrated and proven high level of proficiency with MS Office (Excel, Outlook, Word, and PowerPoint) with preference given to those with advanced expertise in Excel and familiarity with MS Access or other relational database systems
Working knowledge of Microsoft Dynamic CRM would be an asset
Exposure in coding SQL and/or VBA is desired
Proven ability to work on multiple projects, multitask and prioritize in a fast-paced environment
Entrepreneurial spirit suited for fast-paced, results-based environment, requiring flexibility to ever-changing needs


GS1 Canada is an equal opportunity employer. If selected for an interview, please advise our Human Resources team if you require accommodation due to a disability during the interview and assessment process.

There is never a typical day at Accenture, but that’s why we love it here! This is an extraordinary opportunity to build a rewarding career at Accenture. Working in highly collaborative teams for world-leading clients, we’ll nurture your talent in an inclusive culture that values diversity. Whatever your work and life goals, we’ll help you achieve them. Sooner.

Join Accenture and thrive in a digitally-driven, innovation-led environment where you can help clients shift to the “New” using leading-edge technologies on some of the coolest projects you can imagine.

Accenture Technology provides cross-industry experts with the insights and management and technology capabilities to drive change for the world’s leading companies. Our Technology capabilities enable our clients to design and implement transformational programs across their entire organization to increase productivity and cost optimization.

Working at Accenture is working together with ambitious and talented colleagues from all over the world. Through the trusted relationships you build, you help our clients develop essential capabilities such as Service Integration, Service Automation, Multi-Speed IT operating models, to get the best out of the increasingly complex IT ecosystem clients are operating.

WORK YOU’LL DO

We design, build and automate IT Service Management capabilities for our clients, guide the transition of IT organizations. Additionally, we provide assessments of IT Service Management capabilities and roadmap for improvement.

As an IT Service Management Analyst, you will advise our clients on the organizational and technical aspects of bringing IT Service Management to a next level. You will work on innovative solutions in the context of today’s methodologies using the best of ITIL, Agile, Scrum, DevOps and Design Thinking.

Designing and building federated CMDB architectures and data models
Experience with discovery tooling
Experience with the Asset Management lifecycle
Implementing service management solutions to deliver client value
Designing and implementing ITIL and Operational tools
Experience in project management and detailed technical planning
Generating detailed process and procedure documentation

Minimum Bachelor's Degree
Interest and willingness to get involved and learn to support other Technology experts

Broad understanding of ITIL V3 and its components
Tool and Software enablement for IT Services and Operations (ServiceNow, BMC, HP, and Tivoli tool suites)
Event Management
Service Configuration & Asset Management (CMDB)
Service Request & Fulfillment

Able to communicate and explain technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.

Able to clearly articulate and document key technical designs
Apply critical thinking to break down complex problems into smaller manageable work items.
Proactive learner

Project Planning and Support, especially with Technology projects

WHAT´S IN IT FOR YOU?

At Accenture, we believe in bringing the best to our clients through continuous learning & improvement – from basic skills to industry-specific content – available to all our people.
Career coaching and mentorship to help you manage your career and develop professionally.
Performance Achievement – our performance management process that focuses on your strengths, progress and career possibilities.

We are committed to employment equity. We encourage all people, including women, visible minorities, persons with disabilities and persons of aboriginal descent to apply.

Accenture is committed to providing employment opportunities to current or former members of the armed forces.

MANAGER, ANALYTICS AND DATA SCIENCE

Our Business Intelligence and Analytics department integrates data and develops modern reporting solutions, provides advanced analytics and data science support to all business units across Aurora to generate insights and foster innovation.

As the Manager, Analytics and Data Science, you will work very closely with the business stakeholders such as Marketing, Sales, Operations, Finance, Research and Science etc. You possess well-blended interpersonal skills and technical skills. You have proven ability in leading the data scientist/analyst team whose members are in multiple cities to perform data mining, statistical and predictive analytics.

You will have excellent familiarity of advanced analytics process including identifying the business needs, gathering data from multiple sources, and deliver results. You will lead data science initiatives including machine learning and artificial intelligence. You will purposefully develop partnerships with vendors and universities. You will champion the best practice in data science and develop the center of excellence in analytics at Aurora. You will be a key contributor who enables Aurora to make strategic decisions with insights.

We are looking for a highly effective team leader who keeps the team focused and motivated to deliver on time. Apply if you love analytics, are flexible and self-driven, can work under pressure, and desire to develop a strong team in a new and fast-growing international business.

MAIN RESPONSIBILITIES:
Develop, and maintain strong relationships and work closely with stakeholders to ensure business needs are addressed. Lead the team to identify business objectives, gather requirements from stakeholders, and translate requirements into user stories.
Lead the team to develop dashboards, reports. Extract and merge data from multiple data sources. Perform data cleansing, transformation, exploration, analysis and visualization.
Lead the team to support day-to-day requests for data analysis such as decision support and KPI’s. Use advanced techniques, conduct in-depth analytics for strategic initiatives as directed by the management.
Work side-by-side with the business stakeholders, iterate the analytical work in an agile fashion to deliver insights.
Develop the best practices for advanced analytics and data science.
Develop partnerships with vendors and universities to collaboratively working on data science initiatives.

TGLN is seeking a highly motivated individual who is passionate about health data and wants to make a difference in the field of health care. The Senior Health Informatics Analyst reports to the Manager, Transplant Performance Measurement and Evaluation and is responsible for the analysis and interpretation of data to support decision making, performance measurement, policy development and innovation at TGLN.
Duties & Responsibilities:
Analyses and interprets clinical data to assist decision makers in drawing meaningful conclusions to support decision making such as identifying barriers to high performance and statistical modelling to project policy change impacts.
Interprets analytic findings and provides recommendations to TGLN’s management team, senior executive and external stakeholders to enhance organ and tissue donation and transplantation processes.
Presents results from data analysis in a manner that is clear and easy to understand for a variety of audiences including the TGLN management team, senior executives and external stakeholders such as transplant hospitals, laboratory directors and researchers.
Participates in projects such as transplant wait time analysis, transplant recipient survival analysis and donor epidemiology by providing advanced statistical analysis and reporting.
Ensures analysis is completed, delivered on time and meets client needs.
Manages data analysis portions of projects, which includes collaborating with colleagues on the Transplant and Informatics teams.
Extracts data from data warehouse and other data sources such as web stat reports, vendor dashboards or other available reporting tools using standard and customized processes, tools, and procedures.
Develops data quality audit reports to assess, monitor and improve data quality and makes appropriate recommendations to enhance data quality.
Designs, develops and maintains customized recurring reports.
Performs other duties as required.
Qualifications & Experience:
Bachelor’s degree in related field (biostatistics, statistics or epidemiology) required. A master’s degree is preferred.
Minimum five (5) years of work experience in a health care sector, or a combination of equivalent experience and education.
Experience with health care indicators (e.g. key performance indicators) and working with large longitudinal datasets.
Strong understanding of relational database concepts.
Extensive knowledge of statistical analysis methods and applications.
Demonstrated excellent knowledge of survival and regression analysis.
Extensive experience with PL/SQL, MSSQL, SAS or other data extraction and management tools.
Experience with SQL Server Reporting Services.
Experience with business intelligence tools such as Tableau and Excel.
Demonstrated strong communication and client management skills.
Experience working with internal and external stakeholders required.
Knowledge of medical terminology, clinical information and clinical outcomes to support accurate analysis and interpretation of data.

Please submit your application online by March 27, 2019.

job_title: Business Support Analyst - Functional Business Systems
job_description:
Work Site: Finance Offices - West 8th Avenue

Status: Regular Full Time

Reference#: 112268-ale


JOB SUMMARY:

Reporting to the Manager, Financial Process Integration & Support and Regional Business System (RBS) Sustainment, you will be responsible for ensuring functional business system issues are resolved effectively and in a timely manner and continually looking for opportunities to maximize usage of the system to ensure on-going business process improvement.

As the primary point of contact for designated business area users across Vancouver Coastal Health (VCH) and Providence Health Care (PHC), you will work with stakeholders to streamline and standardize processes and implement best practices as well as troubleshoot system problems, test system solutions, establish clear lines of communication and ensure clear visibility of critical functional issues.

The Business Support Analyst:
Provides expert functional RBS support to ensure that business needs are met and to ensure the application is used to its full potential.
Champions RBS and builds relationships with stakeholders that enable the sharing of knowledge and information and encourage collaboration on issues.
Identifies opportunities and makes recommendations for further engagement of RBS by ensuring system enhancements are developed, tested, deployed and function according to agreed upon requirements.
Maintains up to date knowledge regarding new and upcoming system functionality.
Works closely with key stakeholders in the determination and implementation of best practices including participating in the preparation of business cases, process re-engineering, and improvement initiatives.
Represents the department at system meetings, establishing and maintaining clear lines of communications between user department and technical IMITS team members.
Configures system changes and prepares related documentation for changes impacting on system processing, other RBS modules including changes to common data elements across shared modules, non-RBS applications, and any changes requiring use of the Application Designer tools.
Provides technical guidance and direction to Analysts and/or other team members in all aspects of reporting, auditing and testing. Assigns project priorities to ensure overall timelines are met.
Develops and maintains training materials and reference documentation related to new systems/processes to ensure knowledge transfer and consistent usage by users. Coordinates and facilitates training sessions, drives train-the-trainer activities, and provides one-on-one guidance.
Writes queries to customize reports to meet user needs and conducts system audits to ensure data integrity.
QUALIFICATIONS AND EXPERTISE:

Qualifications:
Bachelor’s Degree in a related discipline supplemented by related Information Systems courses
A minimum of five (5) years’ recent related experience within a large organization with an emphasis on business systems and reporting , health care or information management or an equivalent combination of education, training and experience.
Extensive experience with complex ERP systems, project planning and control.
Experience supporting PeopleSoft’s HCM (Timekeeping, Human Resource, Payroll) module and/or expert knowledge in these areas will be an asset.
Expertise:
Expert ability to apply knowledge of RBS modules relating to the designated business area (Human Resources, Timekeeping, Payroll) and maintain an understanding of interdependencies with other modules.
A solid understanding of business functions and processes in order to enhance business processes and create efficiencies through enterprise application systems.
A strong sense of ownership and a results-oriented attitude to continually improve processes and systems, enhance efficiency and contribute to overall organizational success.
Strong communication skills and the ability to establish and maintain strong communication channels with stakeholders.
Solid technical and troubleshooting abilities in the provision of RBS support.
Strong initiative, self-direction and problem solving abilities to identity gaps and opportunities for improvement.
A strong ability to keep abreast of technological changes, anticipate opportunities and ensure readiness for future technology changes and enhancements.
Superior analytical skills for data, documentation and workflows, including the ability to comprehend, analyze and resolve complex issues and present information in concise meaningful ways.
Highly developed business writing and verbal communication skills with the ability to document work appropriately.
Knowledge of project structures; business case development; contract management; documentation of workflows; health care setting and analytical tools.

Only short-listed applicants will be contacted for this posting.

***Employees of VCH must apply via the Internal Application Process. Refer to the staffpostings.vch.ca site for How to Apply instructions. Current VCH employees who apply to this posting using this external site will be considered as an external candidate. Seniority will not apply.***

Thank you for your interest in Vancouver Coastal Health.

Requisition ID: 56306
Join the Global Community of Scotiabankers to help customers become better off.
Overview
The Manager Business Analyst is responsible, through independent contribution and the management/supervision of staff, for the resolution of complex business problems for the assigned Lines of Business.This includes managing multiple small projects, participating in and/or managing specific sections of large projects, and providing ongoing support to all assigned units worldwide.
What we are looking for?
We are looking for someone who will independently resolve complex, multi-faceted problems to meet the business needs of the assigned Lines of Business, by applying their financial and technological knowledge to the design of methodologies, models, and/or systems solutions. Conduct research and analysis, accurately and clearly defining user requirements and processes, and liaising with the users
Manage multiple small projects and/or manage specific sections of large projects to implement solutions to business problems. This involves planning and scheduling resources, developing detailed project plans, monitoring progress against planned objectives, financial review, and securing consensus and co-operation from users and senior management.
Participate in the systems implementation process by defining business requirements and processes, developing test strategies and test cases, performing testing, defining user procedures and workflows, developing conversion and implementation strategies, verifying conversion, providing user documentation, providing user training, and providing post-implementation support.
Provide business support to all units Globally, including new and existing product and deal structuring, ad hoc queries and MIS, user training, and assisting with the design and implementation of systems enhancements.
Continually acquire and enhance knowledge of the Division's business strategies and policies, risk management practices and methodologies, product offerings, financial markets, financial instruments, regulatory requirements, Back Office processes, and rapidly changing technology to be able to provide effective business solutions and services to the end user business lines.
Effectively manage and supervise business analysis staff by setting performance expectations, monitoring performance, and providing performance feedback including the preparation of performance appraisals, providing counsel and coaching.
Are you the right person for the role?
You Have;
Must have advanced knowledge of financial instruments, including market conventions and valuation methods, risk management methodologies and models including best practices, current and anticipated regulatory requirements, Back Office processes, and the end-to-end workflows among the Front, Middle, and Back Offices, within at least one financial market area (e.g. foreign exchange, interest rate derivatives) and a very good knowledge of at least one other financial market area.
Must be a creative, self-starting, results-oriented, and highly motivated individual with very good analytical skills in order to apply this knowledge to independently resolve complex business problems.
Must demonstrate leadership skills with very good interpersonal, communication, and negotiation skills and good time management and organizational skills.
Must have a very good understanding of current Electronic Data Processing practices, systems development techniques, including requirements specification and testing methodologies, real-time analytical and formal modelling tools, and keep current with rapidly changing technology.
A recognized degree in business, econometrics, mathematics or a related discipline and related work experience of 4-5 years.
Spanish Language skills is a must.
What’s in it for you?
The opportunity to join a forward-thinking company surrounded by a collaborative team of innovative thinkers.
A great opportunity to leave your “stamp” as we are undergoing multiple exciting and forward thinking initiatives.
A rewarding career path with diverse opportunities for professional development.
Internal development to support your growth and enhance your skills.
A competitive compensation and benefits package.
An organization committed to making a difference in our communities– for you and our customers.
We have an inclusive and collaborative working environment that encourages creativity, curiosity, and celebrates success!
Location(s): Canada : Ontario : Toronto
As Canada’s International Bank, we are a leader when it comes to inclusion. We are a diverse and global team, speaking more than 100 languages with backgrounds from more than 120 countries. We value the unique skills and experiences each individual brings to the bank, and are committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible environment for everyone. Candidates selected for an interview will be contacted directly. If you require accommodation during the recruitment and selection process, please let us know. Company Profiles
Weir has been in business since 1871 and our sustainability and success has been built on attracting, retaining, and developing exceptional people.

As a global company, employing around 15,000 people in over 70 countries, we reflect the diversity of our customers in the diversity of our people and ensure everyone is given the opportunity to flourish regardless of their gender, race, beliefs or background.

Weir is an inclusive and innovative organisation where you can be your authentic self. We continually develop our talent and diversity of thought to keep our business relevant, innovative and successful for the future.

Enabling our people to unleash their full potential is central to ‘We are Weir’, our vision, mission, and strategic priorities. We aim to be the most admired engineering business in our markets and we'll achieve that ambition by being the employer of choice in our markets.

We offer a wide range of career opportunities across a variety of technical and business roles in engineering, manufacturing and service locations worldwide.
Business Need / Purpose of Role
The C4S Analyst will be responsible to fully implement the new Weir service portal in Canada. This new tool will change the way we manage our shop and field service activities and requires permanent optimization and control. In relation to service the program manager will support the area manager and operations supervisors in the management of all service activities though C4S. The program manager will also ensure that the total available hours are optimized and attains maximum utilization on a national level for mining and aggregate.
Objectives & Measurement - Key Responsibilities
Including but not limited to:
Fully implement the new C4S system to manage WMC service activities;
Provides day to day first line support with C4S
Train all stakeholder on the system and make sure the training is always current and that all involved are always capable of using the system;
Maintains the data in the system with current install base of Weir equipment, making sure all new equipment is inputted in the system. Also drive the sales team to add to the system all other manufacturers equipment install base;
Takes care of the geo localisation program of the installed base;
Assure total cross functionality between C4S and SAP, as well as with the new CRM, Salesforce;
Assure C4S integration with the data from our Synertrex installed base;
Act as main contact with division for all pertaining optimisation and issues with the C4S system;
When required performs end user testing for ongoing enhancements and projects related implementations;
Support management with all required reporting coming out of C4S;
Using the C4S platform makes sure that the HRM national service schedule is optimized in order to support the total service need, for both shop and filed service;
Links with HRM operations supervisors with the assignment of technicians for specific needs;
Assist all HRM’s AE’s and project managers for the allocation of resources on sales work orders requiring service work, including commissioning;
When needed, manages the sub-contractors orders for larger HRM field service contracts or outages;
Health & Safety : Key Responsibilities & Requirements:
Able to work in a manner that ensures the safety of themselves and others
Able to demonstrate compliance to company safety procedures and legal obligations
Recognise and report and resolve hazards identified
Confidence and ability to intervene on practices deemed to be unsafe
Engage and promote a zero harm culture
Be aware of physical limitations based upon job requirements
Job Knowledge / Education and Qualifications
Eductaion/Experience:
Bachelor Degree in business and or equivalent mixture of technical education (Engineering or Technologist diploma) and experience may also be considered. Project management experience is a plus. Must be familiar with standard concepts, practices, and procedures within a particular field.

Language:
Ability to read and interpret documents such as safety rules, operating and maintenance instructions, and procedure manuals. Ability to write routine reports and correspondence. Ability to speak effectively before groups of customers or employees of organization. Being bilingual is an advantage.

Reasoning Ability:
Ability to apply common sense understanding to carry out instructions furnished in written, oral, or diagram form. Ability to deal with problems involving several variables in non-standardized situations.

Computer Skills:
Intermediate knowledge of Microsoft programs with a strong focus in excel. Candidate must be able to do create spread sheets, create Macro’s, Macro merge spread sheets together, create and manipulate pivot tables, navigate customer portal to submit invoices, type 35 WPM, create and respond to emails, create tables.

Work Environment:
While performing the duties of this job, the employee could be exposed to moving mechanical parts, outside weather conditions, field and mining site conditions. The incumbent will work across regular office environments, manufacturing plants and customer mining sites. Travel is expected for the purpose of visiting customers and/or customer sites, where Personal Protective Equipment (PPE) will be required, including safety footwear and glasses.
Core Competencies
To perform the job successfully, an individual should demonstrate the following competencies:

Problem Solving – Identifies and resolves technical problems/situations in a timely manner, gathering and analyzing information, developing alternative solutions. Works well in group problem solving situations, uses reason even in difficult/emotional situations.

Customer Service – Manages ongoing interactions with customers, responds promptly to customer needs, solicits customer feedback to improve service, responds to service/assistance requests and meets commitments.

Safety and Security – Observes safety and security procedures, determines appropriate action beyond guidelines, reports potentially unsafe conditions, uses protective/safety equipment and materials properly.

Quality – demonstrates accuracy and thoroughness, looks for ways to improve and promote quality, applies feedback to improve performance, monitors own work to ensure quality and correctness.

Dependability – Follows instructions and responds to management direction. Takes responsibility for own actions, keeps commitments, commits to long hours of work when necessary to reach goals and completes tasks on time or notifies appropriate person with an alternate plan.

For 35 years, Silicon Valley Bank (SVB) has helped innovative companies and their investors move ambitious ideas forward, fast. SVB provides targeted financial services and expertise through its offices and innovation centers around the world. SVB is currently growing into Canada to better service the booming Canadian tech and life sciences industries.

As the market leader in providing financial services to the world’s most creative tech and life science companies and investors, SVB has exposure to vast amounts of data covering the breadth of the startup and VC landscape. While data has been integral to SVB’s growth over the past 30+ years, we’re placing an even greater emphasis on being a data-driven organization by establishing the Analytics & Sales Operations team to support all sales focused aspects of our banking practice.

As part of a growing team in the Canadian market, this position offers you the opportunity to apply analytical skills to the private, venture-backed innovation ecosystem and gain a comprehensive understanding of the industry through the firm’s positive relationship management network. It is an opportunity to collaborate with Senior Management, drive the execution and recommendations of sales and market analysis, and work cross-functionally within the organization.

Research and profile targeted prospects, reporting and analyzing portfolios, identifying and aggregating current SVBFG relationships, and identifying cross-selling opportunities for the sales teams to execute.
Develop and drive the performance reporting and tracking of sales team performance and key metrics related to client acquisition, pipeline, product penetration, referral channels, etc.
Seek out areas of operational improvement and recommend development of more efficient and automated portfolio management and prospecting.
Report and synthesizing market trends.
Lead ad hoc business analytics requests as part of strategic initiatives.
Identify opportunities to use proprietary datasets and external company data to extract valuable insights and present these findings to key stakeholders, along with useable data to execute.
Where applicable, take responsibility for the maintenance and accuracy of company data within SVB’s data warehouse, CRM systems and other repositories.
Lead long term projects to improve the underlying data architecture and sales operations.
Establish relationships and information flow across groups within SVB.
Responsibilities:
Prospecting: Prospecting the market opportunity including tracking, reporting and catalyzing sales team’s action on leads, identifying trends to understand client share of early stage fundings and tracking activity of top Accelerator & Incubators to provide recommendations to the channel strategy.
Reporting and Analysis. Own monthly goal reporting and analysis; provide key insights to the sales team to be actioned. Develop dashboards for process flows such as referrals, market share and pitchbook prospecting.
Thought Leadership. Provide thought leadership such as content for events and speaking engagements. Craft internal sector and subsector insights reports.
Lead ad-hoc activities including analytics to support strategies and initiatives, partnering with Marketing, IT, Credit, and piloting process changes.
#LI-86777003_VL1

Qualifications

You will ideally have a combination of consulting experience, strong data analytics background and good interpersonal skills. Experience in forecasting, planning and reporting are an asset. Additionally, you will have the following:

Bachelor’s Degree
Aptitude for framing business questions in analytical terms and translating business requirements into useful datasets and analyses with actionable insights
Experience using and developing reports, metrics and dashboards with data analytics and presentation tools (e.g. Excel, PowerPoint, SQL, Tableau)
Adept at working with a distributed team
Client service oriented, with the ability to partner with individuals at all levels
Strong initiative, ownership, and attention to detail
Effective, clear, and concise communication skills, verbal and written
Interest in technology, entrepreneurship, and venture capital
Analytical mindset
Forecasting skills
Detail oriented
Ability to find opportunities to be pursued
Role is based in Toronto, but requires travel to SVB office in US for training and meetings

job_title: Data Governance Solution Analyst and Data Architect
job_description:
Requisition ID: 16925
Job Category: Information Technology

With over six decades of business and technical experience in the mining, energy, and infrastructure sectors, we understand that challenges are changing rapidly in every industry. We respond quickly with solutions that are smarter, more efficient, and innovative. We draw upon our 9,000 staff with experience in over 150 countries to challenge the status quo and create positive change for our clients, our employees, and the communities we serve.
Hatch is currently seeking a Data Architect and Data Governance Solution Analyst for our Hatch Digital group covering Hatch’s business systems. This opportunity will be based out of our Mississauga office.
Hatch has a number of business systems. The iPas TF Team in Hatch Digital configures, programs, and maintains the SAP enterprise applications including SAP ECC (modules include HCM, Time, FI, CO, SD, PS, CPM and Readsoft), SuccessFactors, C4C, Fiori and Fiori LaunchPad, Business Warehouse, Business Objects as well as some other cloud-based HR solutions.
Agile development teams in Hatch Digital deploy other off-the-shelf systems and develop and maintain custom, Hatch-specific systems.
The complete business systems architecture covers all of these systems with many integrations between them.
The Data Architect and Data Governance Solution Analyst will proactively work with business owners, business representatives, other systems team members, SAP functional consultants, the technical teams and the reporting team to understand business and governance requirements around master data and other key data, and to implement solutions to address these requirements.
You are a team player, yet an independent thinker, comfortable with sharing and accepting ideas in an open manner. You are a hard worker, able to take on demanding and time-constrained tasks.

Duties and Responsibilities
Ensure quality of master data and key data in SAP and the other business systems.
Work with the Business data owners to document data definitions and business rules
Develop or facilitate the development of documentation covering master and key data flows and transformations between systems, including the business rules applied to the data.
Participate in all team initiatives to review early data model designs, integration data flows, data uploads and transformation designs and participate in testing.
Identify areas for data quality improvements and help resolve data quality problems.
Develop processes and procedures for data ownership, data management, integration, replication and uploads to support ongoing data maintenance and data integrity.
Collaborate with the reporting team and understand the design of the data warehouse.
Work with business representatives to gather and understand functional requirements, develop complex queries and provide reports.
Respond to auditors concerning data management processes, improvements and information requests.
Design and implement systems solutions in collaboration with other team members, provide advice to management and stakeholders, recommend a course of action for required solutions: solution scoping, requirements analysis, gap analysis, feasibility, functional design, application configuration, technical specification, testing, production deployment, support and training.
Conduct / facilitate data cleaning to remove old, unused data.
Implement an archiving solution for SAP data.
Provide escalated production support if needed.

Skills / Qualifications
B.Sc. or Business degree or equivalent
4+ years of experience in elements of data governance: quality, analysis, administration, architecture
Strong understanding of databases and data structures
Experience with or understanding of taxonomy management
Experience using modelling tools to convey concepts, architectures and designs
Superior attention to detail
Strong analytical, problem solving and organizational skills
Ability to compare technologies and make recommendations to senior members of the team.
Experience in establishing a project plan and facilitating the setting of priorities
Strong written and verbal communication skills and excellent inter-personal skills
Results-oriented, self-starter, capable of working independently and within a team environment to meet deadlines
Willing to work outside of normal business hours as part of a global team and to travel if required

Nice to have
Qualification in information science, data management, computer science
Experience working with information security practices and security software
Understanding of privacy laws and regulations
Experience with software development
Experience with SAP Master Data Management

We are committed to fostering a workforce in each of our locations that reflects the diversity of the communities in which we operate. Hatch is an Equal Opportunity Employer that considers employment applicants without regard to age, race, colour, national origin, citizenship, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, marital status, disability or any other protected status. If you have any special needs requirements, please let us know. We will do our utmost to accommodate, in accordance with applicable local legislation.

GIS Analyst
 - (19000291)

At Golder, we thrive on challenges.


Golder is not just a place to work, it is a promise of a living, dynamic environment where people collaborate, innovate, build enduring relationships, excel, and grow professionally in a strong culture of ownership.
Do you have the desire to learn? The drive to excel and thrive in an engaged, collaborative environment?


Golder has a new opportunity for a GIS Analyst to join our Information Management team on a 12-month contract based in Calgary, Edmonton or Saskatoon. The successful candidate must have experience working with Geographic Information Systems, strong organizational and problem-solving skills, be focused on providing high quality service, and have a strong desire to complete projects accurately, on time, and in a professional manner. The successful candidate should also have strong interpersonal skills as they will be working with clients and staff at all levels within our company.


An overview of your role will include:
 Work with project managers and clients to complete and manage the GIS portion of projects
 Provide GIS support for a wide range of technical disciplines
 Under the direction of senior GIS analysts, conduct GIS analysis to provide specific GIS solutions to various problems
 Delegate tasks to and supervise junior staff
 Assist with information management problems that require a GIS solution
 Generate cartographic products and datasets supporting multi-disciplinary projects
You will have a background in:
 A technical diploma or degree with 2 to 5 years of related work experience
 Strong oral and written communication skills
 Strong organizational skills and detail oriented
 Ability to prioritize and respond to the needs of clients
 Understanding of quality control measures appropriate for information management and cartography
 Strong understanding of data management concepts
 Project and client focused with regard to timelines, team engagement, communication, and schedules
 Solid understanding and experience of Geographic Information Systems and particularly ESRI products and data formats (ESRI ArcGIS V10.X, Spatial Analyst, 3D Analyst, Model Builder)
 Demonstrated experience of remote sensing data processing and analysis (Satellite Imagery, LiDAR)
 Experience with some or all of the following will be considered an asset: ArcGIS Online, Portal for ArcGIS, Python scripting, FME, PurView, eCognition, AutoCAD, and EQuIS


Your benefits at Golder will include:

 Employee owned structure - own the business, own the result
 Deepen your expertise in a dynamic work environment
 Innovative and collaborative multidisciplinary projects
 On the job training, mentoring and coaching
 Global projects and travel opportunities


One of Canada’s Best Managed Companies, Platinum member status 11 consecutive years


Renowned for technical excellence, Golder is a leading, global employee-owned engineering and consulting firm with over a half century of successful service to its clients. With over 165 offices in over 30 countries, Golder’s 6,500 professionals are driven by a passion to deliver results, offering unique specialized skills to address the ever-evolving challenges that earth, environment and energy present to clients across the infrastructure, mining, oil and gas, manufacturing and power sectors.
Golder is committed to providing equitable treatment and equal opportunity to all individuals. As such, Golder will provide accommodations throughout the recruitment and selection process to applicants with disabilities, upon request.


To learn more about our company and culture click here to view The Promise of Golder video.
