People in the Corporate Function career track contribute to the running of Accenture as a high- performance business through specialization within a specific functional area, and grow into internally focused roles by deepening their skills and/or developing new skills within an internal functional area.
Finance professionals prepare and interpret financial plans and reports, ensuring accuracy and compliance with applicable financial rules and regulations, including internal financial controls, to mitigate risk for the company. Finance professionals may also shape and execute client deals to maximize the use of Accenture's capital and resources, manage cash and/or liaise with the investor community.

Job Description

Responsibilities

Client Financial Management professionals provide their services from the opportunity phase through contract completion in the areas of GAAP compliance, internal controls, budgeting/forecasting, contract profit and loss management, and advisory services to our customer leadership teams and corporate leadership.

Assisting with the preparation of engagement, project, and program reporting as well as Accenture internal financial accounting processes
Executing or assisting with tracking and reporting of third-party out-of-pocket expenses, hardware/software costs, and client time and expenses against program budget, and any other expense charges to program budget
Monitoring or advising on engagement financial status and engagement capital assets and technology rental equipment
Performing or assisting with reconciliation processes, data and report archiving, forecast management activities, and contract compliance tracking
Providing value-added financial management, analysis, and advice to client engagement teams to maximize the profitability of engagements
Ensuring compliance with U.S. GAAP, Accenture finance policies and local statutory requirements
Preparing or assisting in the development of pricing calculations for engagements

Basic Qualifications:

Bachelor's degree in Accounting or Finance OR Other Business Related major with a minimum of 9 credit hours of Accounting
Minimum overall GPA of 3.2 OR one year of relevant experience with a minimum overall GPA of 3.0

Preferred Skills:

Financial accounting experience including reconciliation, invoice preparation, processing financial transactions, and preparing financial budgets, etc.
Strong Analytical Skills
Good oral and written communication skills
Strong organizational, time management and multi-tasking skills
Strong PC skills
PC literate (e.g., working knowledge of MS Office Programs)

Professional Skills:

Ability to work independently
Ability to interact with executives
Attention to detail
Proven ability to work independently and as a team member
Ability to be flexible and work creatively and analytically in a problem-solving environment
Excellent customer service skills
Demonstrated leadership, teamwork and collaboration in professional setting; either military or civilian

Accenture does not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, sex, age, non-disqualifying physical or mental disability, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other basis covered by local law. Accenture is committed to providing employment opportunities to current or former members of the armed forces.

We are committed to employment equity. We encourage all people, including women, visible minorities, persons with disabilities and persons of aboriginal descent to apply.

Accenture is a leading global professional services company, providing a broad range of services and solutions in strategy, consulting, digital, technology and operations. Combining unmatched experience and specialized skills across more than 40 industries and all business functions — underpinned by the world’s largest delivery network — Accenture works at the intersection of business and technology to help clients improve their performance and create sustainable value for their stakeholders. With 469,000 people serving clients in more than 120 countries, Accenture drives innovation to improve the way the world works and lives. Visit us at www.accenture.com.

TemporaryReporting to the Evaluation Lead, CST, the Evaluation Analyst provides guidance and consultation in the evaluation of program design and delivery of acute care services across VCH, PHSA, and PHC. Employs research methods for the identification, collection, analysis and interpretation of process and outcome measures. Carries out reviews of related research and links evidence to the evaluation process. Reviews and assesses impact on services and staff resources; prepares reports and provides evidence-based recommendations related to program and service delivery models.
Skills
Displays comprehensive knowledge of project management principles and methodologies and ability to coach team members on these skills.
Demonstrated knowledge of health research methodology, principles and procedures.
Demonstrated knowledge of performance outcome measurement tools and techniques and program evaluation, e.g., program logic models, impact analysis.
Ability to use advanced, current computer software such as database (e.g., Access), or spreadsheets.
Ability to use quantitative and qualitative data analysis software.
Physical ability to perform the duties of the job.
Education
Master’s Degree in a health science, social science or related discipline with coursework in research methodologies, statistical analysis, and program evaluation. Five (5) years’ experience in related research/evaluation/decision support in public health, community health programs, acute care or other health services. Experience with project management, program planning and evaluation.

Duties
Provides guidance and consultation to program leadership in research and evaluation of program design and delivery of acute care services across VCH, PHSA, and PHC.
Leads planning, research, evaluation, and process and outcome measurement of acute care services and initiatives. Works collaboratively with program Managers and teams to assess, determine, and/or define required information to satisfy specific business requirements. Works with existing and external data sources, as well as, develops new collection processes.
Designs a practical evaluation model that integrates monitoring, self-assessment, planning and evaluation of program or health services (process and outcome measures).
Serves as a consultant to colleagues and works in collaboration with other members of the CST and health organizations to make evidence-based recommendations regarding potential changes to programs, delivery of care and impacts on services and staff resources.
Works collaboratively with programs to support the identification and development of meaningful performance and outcome measures.
Coordinates and/or conducts evaluation and research projects through methods such as reviewing literature, designing methodology and tools, collecting, compiling, analyzing, interpreting, and reporting data.
Facilitates the development, implementation, and maintenance of an ongoing evaluation process for programs.
Provides clearly written interpretive reports based on quantitative and qualitative evaluation analysis to leadership.
Attends meetings on behalf of the CST Evaluation Lead to offer support, guidance, and expertise to others undertaking evaluation processes.
Serves as a subject matter expert on best practices related to program evaluation, assessment, monitoring, study design, and research methodologies. Provides guidance to designated program research staff as required.
Performs other related duties as assigned.

Overview
Cayenta Utilities is seeking talented, motivated Business Analyst to join our R&D team. Someone who can uniquely balance his or her business knowledge, technical skills and strong interpersonal skills. The Business Analyst will interact with our customers, third party software vendors, and our development teams to gather and document requirements, manage change to projects, provide training, and implementation support. The BA’s biggest responsibility is to understand what the customer really wants and to strive for total customer satisfaction.
Details
Assume Business System Analysis responsibility and solution ownership for projects and initiatives related to utilities (electric, gas, water), business process automation, and Smart Meter and MDM (Meter Data Management) solutions
Build and maintain highly effective relationships and become a trusted advisor with clients (business and process owners throughout the organization), partners, vendors, and internal team members.
Gather requirements, design and implement solutions using Cayenta Utilities application products
Serve as liaison between R&D and Implementation teams for requirements analysis, documentation and implementation
Oversee the implementation of new technology and systems as developed and deployed by R&D team
Conduct workshops and training sessions on new technology and systems
Collaborate with the development and QA teams to improve software quality
To meet this challenge you must possess a high level of initiative and energy as required to succeed in a fast-paced team environment, as well as several of the following skills:
Previous experience in the Utilities industry strongly desired
Experience working with Senior Decision Makers
Thorough understanding of the Software Development Life Cycle
Experience working with MS SQL and/or Oracle databases
Experience with bug tracking systems and planning tools such as Jira, Bugzilla, Portfolio
Experience in cost benefit analysis
Experience in business process modeling. Specifically, as a way of identifying potential opportunities for improvements or identifying failures
Accountability, respect, integrity and discipline are core values
Strong communication and interpersonal skills
Strong problem-solving ability
Strong time management skills, and an ability to work independently, but most importantly as a team player
Ability to travel in North America up to 40%
Assets
University degree or college diploma relevant to business analysis or equivalent education and experience would be a strong asset
IIBA or other certification would be a strong asset
Experience in Cayenta Utilities application products would be a strong asset
Ability to lead, delegate and coordinate BA activities to service multiple projects
Demonstrated experience in applying business analysis best practices (BABOK)
Strong facilitation and presentation skills
Experience working with software built using JAVA, JS, UNIFACE or similar technologies would be an asset

PermanentAlberta Pensions Services Corporation (APS) is made up of hardworking, respectful and
talented individuals who understand and invite diversity into their workplace. Our employees bring
financial, business, communications, technology and client service expertise to the table every
day.

To attract and retain employees of the highest calibre, we strive to focus on the people who make
the business successful. By incorporating engagement activities throughout the year, we continue
to strengthen our corporate culture and maintain a positive work environment for our employees.

APS is recruiting for a Director, Analytics and Data Governance.

Reporting to the VP, Information Services and Technology (IST) the Director, Analytics and Data
Governance oversees the Analytics Centre of Excellence (ACE), which provides vision and
leadership on Data Science, Business Analytics, Business Intelligence, Machine Learning, Artificial
Intelligence, Data Governance, and Data Management (Information Management). APS is
currently executing against our three-year Business Intelligence, Analytics and Data Governance
Strategy. We are implementing the Incorta tool suite with the goals to deliver a corporate data hub,
self-serve reporting and self-serve analytics capabilities by the end of 2019.

Within this highly innovative area, the Director is responsible for directing a team comprised of data
scientists, analytics and information technology professionals. The incumbent will lead the
application of end-to-end analysis and insight, pioneering and proliferating leading-edge analytic
techniques. This position is responsible for developing models and frameworks to help guide fact-
based decision making, and tackling hard, open-ended, strategic, business problems.


This position drives the development of the APS data architecture, creates and communicates
data governance and management standards, and executes strategic projects to realize the
enterprise data management strategy. The role requires deep hands-on experience with
developing, deploying and applying analytics solutions to business problems, transforming
analytics into insights, and insights into actions that benefit the business.


The position requires strong communication, leadership and relationship management skills.
As such, a successful candidate would be technically sound and have the ability to be a
proactive internal and external point of contact, adding value to the corporation beyond their
analytical prowess, through their understanding of industry knowledge, and track record of
innovative and impactful decision support.


Responsibilities:

Analytics Strategy & Implementation

Lead and direct the development and implementation of machine learning and artificial
intelligence applications to support pension administration processes, business
process automations and optimizations, improve customer experience, and grow the
analytics value proposition.
Ensure APS’ information/data is effectively managed as a strategic asset, and that its
utilization is effectively governed in accordance with established information
management standards and policies.
Oversee the development and maintenance of the APS enterprise performance
monitoring dashboard (DASH) to ensure effective and efficient service delivery and
optimal business processes.
Lead the development, deployment, maintenance and dissemination of enterprise
reports and dashboards to support pension administration processes and improved
service quality.
Communicate findings of analytics projects and provide recommendations to senior
executives and other key stakeholders through reports and presentations.
Present complex modelling to decision-makers that maximizes knowledge transfer and
bottom-line impact of modelling results.
Track business performance against data analysis models and monitor trends of
critical KPIs, and provide insight for overall business performance improvement.
Direct the compilation and analyses of annual benchmarking surveys, and
communication of results and findings regarding trends and insights to management
and other stakeholders.
Oversees an analytics investment (2018-2020) of over $1 million in support of a well-
defined three-year Business Intelligence, Analytics and Data Governance Strategy.
Demonstrate APS’ leadership position in business intelligence and analytics to plan
boards and other stakeholders, with specific focus on how APS leverages data to
facilitate evidence-based decision making and the realization of our strategic goals.
Employ formal methodologies to forecast business trends and define innovative
strategic choices in response to the potential implications of multiple integrated
business options.

Information and Data Management

• Lead the development and implementation of the Records & Information Governance (RIG)
strategic plan for multi-year APS and IST business plans.
Direct the planning and management of the information life cycle for all information at APS
to ensure information is collected, organized, used, shared, stored and disposed of
appropriately and in accordance with relevant legislation, regulations and policies.
Define and implement an enterprise data management vision, strategy and
management process.
Oversee strategic data management operations, and ensure that standardized data
governance tools (including data requirements documents, data lineage work flows,
metadata repositories, data models, etc.) are used across the enterprise by all relevant
stakeholders.
Create, manage and facilitate a data governance process to identify and understand
the critical data issues in terms of business impact/risk/opportunity, and ensure data
policy enforcement and compliance.

Leadership and Collaboration

• Lead, train and mentor a team of data scientists, business intelligence and information
management specialists, and support decision makers with analytics expertise.

Chair the Business Intelligence Steering Committee that sets the strategic and tactical
direction of business intelligence within the organization.
Build capacity to meet the enterprise’s analytics talent needs through role definition,
recruitment, and development of a team of data scientists and business intelligence
analysts that will jointly move the corporation’s agenda forward.
Drive education and evangelization of advanced analytics throughout the enterprise by
communicating the vision and use cases of advanced analytics.
Integrate deeply with leadership team as a trusted and influential contributor to data-
driven decision making, ensuring maximum impact of analytics outputs.
Liaise and consult with the executives, directors and managers in creating the data
management roadmap in support of data governance across the enterprise and
improving the overall business performance.
Serve as a trusted advisor to the leadership team in the creation and deployment of
business-critical insights that inform and activate business strategies across the
enterprise.
Coordinate with different business functional teams to implement analytics models and
monitor outcomes, and collaborate with business stakeholders to establish a vision and
create a culture that treats analytics as a corporate asset.

Qualifications:

Undergraduate degree in business, management, computer science, data science,
operations research or another relevant field.
Plus:

Subject matter knowledge in business intelligence, data engineering and data science
would be an asset.
Experience with leading the development of advanced analytics solutions for business
applications.
Experience with Data Warehousing, Data Hubs, and other Information Management tools.Experience with all facets of data management including data architecture and modeling,
data quality, data warehousing, business intelligence, and metadata management.
5+ years of management experience identifying, hiring, managing and motivating a team.Experience working in a pension or benefit environment would be an asset.

Skills and Abilities:

Demonstrated ability to apply advanced analytics techniques to solving real business
problems.
Advanced level knowledge of data quality management, data governance and metadata
management techniques and processes.
Familiarity with relational databases and SQL.Understanding of current trends and best practices around business intelligence and
analytics capabilities, tools, and resources.
Expert level knowledge of Operational Research (optimization and scheduling of resources)
is required.
Strong verbal/written communication skills and able to communicate with levels across the
organization and translate complex technical topics into business solutions and strategies.
Possesses a strong presence, and is able to engage with senior stakeholders to
understand business needs and to confidently influence through collaboration.
Collaborates effectively with technical and non-technical stakeholders.Able to organize, interpret, analyze and strategically translate plans into phased actions
within a fast paced, high pressure environment and shifting priorities.



APS offers a comprehensive and flexible benefit package.


How to Apply:
If you are interested in this position, please submit your resume to Human Resources at
recruitment@apsc.ca. Each submission needs to clearly indicate the competition number of the
position you are applying for.

Please Note: If you are submitting a resume for multiple positions, please send a separate
submission for each competition. The successful candidate(s) will be required to undergo a
security screening as a condition of employment. This job posting may be used to fill current and
future vacancies within APS at the same or lower classification.

Thank you for your interest in Alberta Pensions Services Corporation (APS). Only those
candidates selected for interviews will be contacted.

The Pro Business Analyst will support key processes geared to improve sales and processes within the Canadian division. The successful candidate will be required to collect and synthesize causal factors from vast amounts of information and be required to develop and present several recommendations for implementation with little to no guidance. The successful candidate will also be required to support and maintain the implementation of new processes and/or systemic enhancements through the application of basic project management frameworks. This will require the development of strong relationships with stakeholders and their teams across the organization.

Responsibilities:
Develop and apply/update forward looking judgment on sales forecasts based on weekly analysis of planned events, promotions, marketing campaigns, merchandising strategies, etc

Maintain a strategic fact base (market, competitors, trends, etc.) that shapes executive decision-making.
Attend meetings to collect information on planned demand influencing activities
Develop sensitivity analyses across multiple dimensions associated with changes to policies, constraints, etc.
Preparation of weekly and of ad hoc performance reporting coupled with analysis/commentary on opportunities, risks and emerging trends for the purposes of operational decision making
Collect operational facts, data, etc. to support the design and implementation of processes
Support business project leads in the development, design, and implementation of new processes and/or technical enhancements
Engage business partners to ensure the timely execution of key data points related activities
Provide data driven analysis on strategic planning process and investments
Organizing and attending joint sales calls with Vendors and clients
Solution based decision making
Keeping up to date on new products, services, procedures and tools by attending training and departmental meetings

Experience / Knowledge Required:
Internal Candidates: Must fulfill minimum time-in-position (1 year) and performance management code requirements (M+, Meets expectation, Consistently demonstrates).
2 years of sales experience
Project Management Experience
Knowledge of CRM/SAP tools
Computer Skills – Microsoft
Demonstrated success in influencing key stakeholders
Customer, quality and sales driven
Highly developed communication skills, both written and oral

TemporaryJob Description

Title: Infrastructure Manager, Epic Implementations
Status: Temporary Full Time - Approx 18 months
Dept/Health System: Information Services
Posted: March 23, 2019
Internal Deadline: April 7, 2019
Trillium Health Partners (THP) is one of the largest community-based acute care facilities in Canada. Comprised of the Credit Valley Hospital, the Mississauga Hospital and the Queensway Health Centre, Trillium Health Partners serves the growing and diverse populations of Mississauga, West Toronto and surrounding communities and is a teaching hospital affiliated with the University of Toronto.
Our Mission: A New Kind of Health Care for a Healthier Community
When we set out to build our vision and future, we connected with our community - patients, families, visitors, physicians, staff and volunteers. The foundational goals of our new strategic plan - quality, access and sustainability - anchor everything we do. Our mission for a new kind of health care is built on an inter-connected system of care organized around patients - inside and outside the hospital.
At THP, we are relentless in providing high quality, compassionate care to our communities and take great pride in fostering an inclusive and accessible environment and we are all accountable for contributing to a healthy, safe and respectful environment for healing and promoting excellence in patient care though advancing patient and staff safety. If you are passionate about what you do, motivated to improve the health of the community, committed to excellence, quality and patient safety we would like you to join our Better Together team!
The Role

We are looking for an experienced leader with an extensive technology background to lead all technology infrastructure activities in THP’s HIS project. Reporting to the HIS Director of , Technology, the Manager will be part of the project leadership team and is accountable for ensuring all technology infrastructure requirements are fulfilled for the HIS project.

Technology subject matter scope includes: hardware (server, storage, network, data base ), operating systems and virtualization, application presentation and client devices, database administration, system hosting and disaster recovery and release management.
The manager will work with the HIS vendor, internal stakeholders and external vendors and contractors to develop the technology and project plan to fulfill the infrastructure requirements of the HIS project. The Manager will maintain scope, schedule and quality for the project plan while ensuring close alignment with Integrated HIS Project plan, working closely with the Project Control Officer, and will oversee an interdisciplinary project team of technology analysts who will execute all the activities identified in the implementation plan.
Responsibilities:
Developing the technology and project plan to fulfill the infrastructure requirements of the HIS project including their procurement, installation and configuration – as part of the overall Integrated HIS Project Plan.
Maintaining scope, schedule and quality for the project plan and oversee an interdisciplinary project team of integration analysts who will execute all the activities identified in the implementation plan.
Setting clear expectations for team members, including defining what they should do at each phase of the project.
Working closely with the Technology Project Director and Project Control Officer to coordinate activities.
Ensuring clinical and business stakeholders are engaged in the project.
Advising and coaching team members by providing guidance on project issues, key success factors of the project and lessons learned.
Organizing resources to complete project tasks on time and within budget.
Appropriately matching team member skills to team responsibilities.
Managing the project from an organizational perspective while attending to detailed tasks.
Identifying and troubleshooting issues as required.
Serving as a liaison between the HIS project team and Epic for all infrastructure activities.
Maintaining regular communication with Epic representatives including participating in project team meetings.
Reviewing the status of projects and issues on an ongoing basis with leadership and leads from other streams including Project Control Officer.
Holding weekly communications with team members to discuss the status of deliverables, shared issues, end-user concerns, budget and upcoming milestones.
Advising and coaching staff by providing guidance on project issues, key success factors of the project, and lessons learned.
Ensure the flow of information among staff regarding current priorities and project status.
Reinforcing the importance of the project together with the executives and the project executive and providing consistent communication to the project team.
Communicating with peers within the project and leaders in the hospitals.
Other duties as required.
Obtain training on the vendor application
Experience:
The successful candidate will have an extensive technology background and at least ten years of related information technology working experience and leading project teams. The candidate will have an expert understanding of hardware (server, storage, network), operating systems and virtualization, application presentation and client devices, database administration, system hosting and disaster recovery and release management tools and technologies.
You will have a proven track record for:

Leading infrastructure technology implementation projects.
Designing, building and implementing technology infrastructure solutions.
Managing and maintaining technical services.
Project management including building, maintaining and implementing project plans.

Key Criteria:

Ideal candidate should have completed a University degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics or related degree or have equivalent work experience.
Technology certifications, for example MCSE, CISSP, ITIL, etc. are asset .
Comprehensive knowledge and hands-on experience with infrastructure hardware including server, storage systems and networking technologies is required.
Comprehensive knowledge and hands-on experience with Operating Systems (Windows and Linux), application virtualization presentation technologies (Citrix and VMWare) is required.
Comprehensive knowledge and hands-on experience with Operating Systems (Windows and Linux), Directory Services (MS Active Directory), application virtualization presentation technologies (Citrix and VMWare), and databases (MS SQL) is required.
Practical knowledge and experience with Information Technology Infrastructure Library standards, processes and techniques is required.
Possess knowledge of current electronic health record technology, health information systems and healthcare applications is an asset.
Demonstrated management with effective interpersonal and negotiations skills including written and verbal communications skills is required.
Demonstrated leadership skills with experience in building consensus are a must.
Demonstrated management in a complex environment with effective interpersonal and negotiations skills including outstanding written and verbal communications skills.
Able to work in a fast paced environment with quickly changing priorities to ensure superior customer satisfaction and business results.
Ability to travel to the United States is required

job_title: Business Intelligence Financial Analyst, 12 month term
job_description:
TemporaryWith close to 50 years of physician-focused experience, MD has one main goal: to help Canada's physicians and their families achieve financial well-being. Our commitment to work/life integration, employee well-being and ongoing learning are key factors that contribute to our overall success.
For the sixth consecutive year, MD Financial Management has been recognized as one of the Achievers 50 Most Engaged Workplaces in North America. The annual award, given by Achievers, an industry-leading provider of employee recognition and engagement solutions, commends top employers that display leadership and innovation in engaging their workforces.
MD Financial Management’s Corporate Financial Analytics (CFA) team is looking for a talented, curious, and motivated Business Intelligence Financial Analyst. This team is responsible for all financial-driven analysis across the company, producing financial models, data analytics and client reporting including building, designing, and maintaining data visualizations. In this role you will collaborate with members of the Corporate Financial Analytics team, the Enterprise Data Warehouse and Client Insight teams to generate unique insights which support and advance enterprise strategy.

We are a dynamic, highly involved team of data professionals who love what we do! If you are a strong communicator with great interpersonal skills, have hands-on experience with data analytics, and enjoy learning both new business and technical concepts, this may be the right challenge for you!

What You Will Do:

Answer tough analytical questions in an intuitive and understandable way, and confidently communicate the results to a variety of audiences
Be a key player in more complex data science projects involving large-scale data analysis, algorithms, and predictive modeling
Master our business and data environment to become an expert problem-solver using advanced modelling techniques
Organize and research economic trends, industry developments, industry benchmarks, MDF revenue and cost structure and, by considering internal priorities and the results of the research, identify opportunities for growth, enhanced revenue, greater expense effectiveness and profitability margins
Manage crucial aspects of organizational data quality: contribute to data documentation, quality assurance, and sharing of best practices across the enterprise
Lead the creation and maintenance of compelling data visualizations and dashboards to deliver insights about the business

What You Need:

You are an outstanding communicator: you actively listen, use a minimum of jargon, and are easily understood even when speaking with non-technical people
You drive change and momentum; you finish what you start and aren’t shy about sharing your work
You are inherently curious, have a passion for what you do, and actively seek new ways to improve
You LOVE learning new tools, techniques, and concepts
You make ‘getting things done’ a priority
You enjoy the collaborative process and look forward to partnering with other teams to get things done

What You Bring:

An undergraduate degree in a related field: Economics, Statistics, Business, Computer Science, Statistics, or equivalent work experience
3-5 years of analytics experience: you are skilled at using data to answer tough questions and can demonstrate this
4+ years of business experience: you have experience relating data to business operations and you understand the link between business goals and corporate results and KPIs
Experience with BI and data wrangling tools outside of the standard Microsoft suite (Excel/Access), such as SAS, Tableau, PowerBI, Crystal Reports, Cognos BI, etc.
Experience working with complex data across a variety of data sources, such as relational databases, data warehouses, text files, and web data (APIs)
Assets include:

Ability to speak both English and French
Experience working with senior leadership teams
Applied experience with other areas of data analysis: text mining, machine learning, predictive modeling, etc.
Hands-on experience with Tableau and/or open source tools/web libraries (Pandas, Shiny, D3, etc.)
Experience with open source tools like Python and R
An advanced degree in a related field: Masters/PhD mathematics, IT, economics, stats, etc.
Financial industry knowledge and experience

What Success Looks Like:

You take great pride in the effective and thorough working relationships you have developed across MD.

You are constantly learning and honing your skills.

You are technology savvy and endeavor to find new and exciting ways to use technology.

You feel rewarded and recognized in a way that inspires you to do your best work.

You are engaged, enthusiastic and clearly understand how what you do contributes to MD’s overall success.

job_title: Senior Business Analyst - Real Estate Asset Management
job_description:
Are you looking for unlimited opportunities to develop and succeed? With work that challenges and makes a difference, within a flexible and supportive environment, we can help our customers achieve their dreams and aspirations.
Job Description
Manulife Real Estate is the global real estate arm of Manulife Financial Corporation with fully integrated in-house capabilities and 70 years of experience as an active investor, owner, developer and asset manager of commercial real estate. Diversified by both geography and asset type, the portfolio consists primarily of prime office and industrial properties, as well as select retail and multi-family residential properties, in key metropolitan centers throughout Canada, Asia and in the United States through Manulife's U.S. division, John Hancock. In addition to equity real estate, Manulife Real Estate manages the space requirements and own use facilities for Manulife’s operations around the world.
The Asset Management team is generally responsible for helping to add value to the portfolio through executing property-level strategies in collaboration with Managing Directors of Regional Offices across Canada and the United States.
Reporting to the Director, Asset Management, the Senior Business Analyst will be responsible for assisting the Director in preparing and providing analysis and insight to senior management. Specifically, regarding portfolio and asset specific performance, strategic initiatives of the general account and third-party fund businesses. As well as, ongoing new developments and portfolio repositioning, and ad hoc quarterly presentations, market research and analysis as needed.
Responsibilities
Work closely with Director and branch offices to provide direction for and oversight of business plans, budgets, forecasts, leases, renewals, analysis and approvals.
Prepare management reporting where currently lacking.
Implementation of capital review, parking revenue review.
Expense management; and coordination of allocation of expenses.
Coordinate with regional offices to coordinate total return for assets through the analysis of property efficiencies and identifying value-add opportunities for improved performance.
Involvement in coordination and strategy on developments.
Work on behalf of Asset Management team on accounting system integration.
Understand cash flow, distribution analysis and develop investment projections.
Work with director to assess impact of prospective tenant leases and capital improvement projects on building valuation.
Support LEED certification.
When required, provide pre-acquisition input and assistance in due diligence process, including review of financial and operational assumptions.
Other duties and special projects as required.
Qualifications
Post-Secondary education in Business/Finance/Accounting.
Minimum 4-7 years in a real estate leasing sales/finance/analyst role, preferably in the real estate industry.
Understanding of accounting concepts related to leasing, building expenses and capital expenditures.
Knowledge of real estate portfolio and administration, procedures.
Financial ability - development of financial reports, variance calculations, journal entries etc.
Ability to juggle competing priorities and work under pressure to meet demanding response times, all while paying strict attention to detail.
Skills in troubleshooting, understanding the theory of database systems and the ability to access building financials and information from accounting/real estate systems.
Good communication skills - verbal and written.
Strong analytical skills (both quantitative and qualitative).
Strong risk assessment skills. Ability to compile, monitor, examine, and audit various financial, performance, and/or data reports for accuracy, integrity, and conformance to performance benchmarks. Ability to draw conclusions and prepare written findings and presentations. Ability to evaluate and determine property valuations and asset performance under a variety of scenarios. Strong oral and written communications skills in order to present to and work with senior management and external clients.
Ability to juggle competing priorities and work under pressure to meet demanding response times, all while paying strict attention to detail.
Focused and self-motivated team player who balances independent thinking with the execution capabilities and core competencies of the rest of the organization.

If you are ready to unleash your potential it’s time to start your career with Manulife/John Hancock.

About Manulife

Manulife Financial Corporation is a leading international financial services group that helps people achieve their dreams and aspirations by putting customers' needs first and providing the right advice and solutions. We operate as John Hancock in the United States and Manulife elsewhere. We provide financial advice, insurance, as well as wealth and asset management solutions for individuals, groups and institutions. At the end of 2016, we had approximately 35,000 employees, 70,000 agents, and thousands of distribution partners, serving more than 22 million customers. At the end of 2016, we had $977 billion (US$728 billion) in assets under management and administration, and in the previous 12 months we made almost $26 billion in payments to our customers.


Our principal operations are in Asia, Canada and the United States where we have served customers for more than 100 years. With our global headquarters in Toronto, Canada, we trade as 'MFC' on the Toronto, New York, and the Philippine stock exchanges and under '945' in Hong Kong.

Manulife is committed to supporting a culture of diversity and accessibility across the organization. It is our priority to remove barriers to provide equal access to employment. A Human Resources representative will consult with applicants contacted to participate at any stage of the recruitment process who request an accommodation. Information received regarding the accommodation needs of applicants will be addressed confidentially.

The primary role of a Marketing Science Analyst is to support the day-to-day work with supervision from a manager. This requires solid contribution to at least two (2) of the five (5) sub-disciplines (tracking and measurement, data visualization, testing and evaluation, data integration and statistical modeling.) This position should have an understanding of how at least one of the other sub-disciplines fits into clients’ business and should continue to learn and develop in the other areas. The analyst will work closely with a manager that will have more experience to train him/her on daily work responsibilities, teach project delivery, and explain other sub-disciplines in Marketing Science.
Responsibilities:
Constant curiosity for what the data means and where it fits into the clients’ business
Assessing performance of website, leads generated
Collecting relevant data and translating it into daily and weekly dashboards and reports
Well organized approach to a variety of project work
Detailed-oriented work style
Strong time management skills to ensure accurate delivery
Good communication skills with Marketing Science team members as well as across other disciplines
Logical approach to analysis process that demonstrates how data lead to conclusions
Consistent drive for collaboration with others to provide support, share skills, and learn more
Requirements:
Experience with the clickstream data tool Adobe Analytics
Experience with Adobe Dynamic Tag Manager
Experience with Tableau
Experience in digital performance measurement and analysis (website, social, media)
Strong attention to detail, organizational skills, and time management is key
Top notch communication and collaboration skills are also key to success in the analyst role
Expectations of Management: a successful analyst will communicate quickly and accurately about delivery and delay, and follow up
Intellectual Curiosity: analyst should ask the next question, and understand where our work fits in the big picture
Logical Approach: cut a path that others can follow, and make sure your conclusions follow your evidence
Skills Enhancement & Sharing: Keep learning, offer support, grow your comfort zone, and help the team grow and learn

job_title: Love Data? Apply to become a Research Data Centre Analyst!
job_description:
$81,858 - $94,219 a yearStatistics Canada - Microdata Access Division

Calgary (Alberta), Edmonton (Alberta), Lethbridge (Alberta), Burnaby (British Columbia), Prince George (British Columbia), Vancouver (British Columbia), Victoria (British Columbia), Winnipeg (Manitoba), Fredericton (New Brunswick), Moncton (New Brunswick), St. John's (Newfoundland and Labrador), Halifax (Nova Scotia), Guelph (Ontario), Hamilton (Ontario), Kingston (Ontario), London (Ontario), North Bay (Ontario), Ottawa (Ontario), Toronto (Ontario), Waterloo (Ontario), Windsor (Ontario), Montréal Island (Québec), Québec (Québec), Sherbrooke (Québec), Saskatoon (Saskatchewan)

EC-05

$81,858 to $94,219
Closing date: 31 May 2019 - 23:59, Pacific Time
Who can apply: Persons residing in Canada and Canadian citizens residing abroad.
Apply online
Important messages
We are committed to providing an inclusive and barrier-free work environment, starting with the hiring process. If you need to be accommodated during any phase of the evaluation process, please use the Contact information below to request special accommodation. All information received in relation to accommodation will be kept confidential.
Information on accommodation for persons with disabilities
When you apply to this selection process, you are not applying for a specific job, but to an inventory for future vacancies. As positions become available, applicants who meet the qualifications may be contacted for further assessment.
Do you love leading-edge data?
Are you very curious?
Do you want to enrich your knowledge by learning about research in multiple disciplines?
Do you enjoy sharing knowledge about research and data methods with others?

If you answered yes to all these questions, we believe that a Research Data Centre Analyst position would be an exciting choice for you! You will have the opportunity to explore the research questions of researchers in many different faculties. You will also be able to contribute to the research process by providing guidance on data, methodological techniques and software.

You will have the chance to grow in this position, as you learn more about new data,
software, techniques and disciplines. You will be part of a strong research community!
Duties
Below you will find the main duties and responsibilities you would have the chance to assume!

Administers the operation of the Research Data Centre (RDC) for its clients and ensures
that the activity is consistent with Statistics Act. This includes activities such as assisting
researchers with project preparation, administering RDC access (security checks and contracts), orientating new researchers into the RDC secure computing environment and liaising with the program management.
Responsible for maintaining the integrity of the secure computing environment by ensuring that physical, technical and legal requirements for the operation of an RDC are within standards used by Statistics Canada. This would include assigning tasks to local IT staff as required.Coordinates and participates in consultations, meetings, committees or working groups.Provides consultation on research methods and data concepts to the RDC researchers in a client service oriented environment while fostering a culture of confidentiality.Analyzes all interim and final research outputs that leave the RDC to ensure that they respect Statistics Canada’s confidentiality protection requirements.Maintains a liaison between the RDC network and Subject Matter Areas responsible for the Statistics Canada household surveys or administrative data.Participates in various program wide projects which include a range of activities, such as
recommending, documenting, developing and providing advice based on areas of specialization such as confidentiality vetting, use of administrative data, and survey data concepts and methodology.
May have to supervise local and/or other RDC staff.
Work environment
Statistics Canada is a world-renowned leader in its domain, and its employees are proud to fulfill its mission: to serve Canada with high-quality statistical information that matters. We want to help Canadians better understand their country, so they can make more thoughtful decisions. Be part of this mission by applying for this position!

In January 2018, Statistics Canada received the National Capital Region's Top Employers Award for 2018. A week later, we were also awarded a spot in Canada's Top Employers for Young People competition.

That's not it!

The advantages of a strong workplace cannot be understated. Diverse. Accommodating.
Nurturing. Rewarding. For employees to reach their full potential, a workplace MUST be meet all of these criteria. Well ours is! Statistics Canada provides you with the tools you need to succeed. Our job opportunities provide you with a unique chance to:
expand your existing knowledge and knowhow;strengthen your team spirit and extend your network;strengthen your project management skills;propose innovative ideas and participate in modernization;and so much more!
We support talent. Let your talents and interests shine and come discover new ones. If you’re looking for a place to build a career, you’ve found it!
Intent of the process
The intent of this selection process is to staff part-time determinate positions with the
possibility of extension, indeterminate positions and/or full-time positions. A pool of qualified candidates will also be established and may be used to staff identical or similar positions with different tenures, various linguistic profiles, and various security profiles at various Research Data Centres across Canada.
Positions to be filled: 1
Information you must provide
Your résumé.
In order to be considered, your application must clearly explain how you meet the following (essential qualifications)
EDUCATION

Graduation with a Master degree* or a PhD** from a recognized university with an acceptable specialization in Economics, Sociology or Statistics.

OR

An acceptable combination of education, training and/or relevant experience in a health-related field of study such as epidemiology, health sciences or health services research, or in a social-related field such as psychology, geography or demography.

Alternative to the Master degree, we accept:candidates that are currently enrolled in a PhD Direct-Entry Program and has completed Master degree level requirements or PhD course work and comprehensive exams; ORcandidates that have completed all of the program requires sufficient for graduation (confirmation from the university will be required).
**Alternative to the PhD, we accept candidates that have completed all of the program requires sufficient for graduation (confirmation from the university will be required).
Degree equivalency
EXPERIENCE

EX1. Experience using census data, administrative data or complex surveys, such as but not limited to the Statistics Canada Household Survey data.
EX2. Experience conducting advanced quantitative analyses at the level taught in graduate-level statistics courses.
EX3. Experience in the use of Statistical Analysis System (SAS), Statistical Package for Social Sciences (SPSS) or STATA, in the conduct of a social science research project.
EX4. Experience in making presentations to client groups, peer groups or scientific meetings, such as presenting research findings at a conference or teaching a class.
If you possess any of the following, your application must also clearly explain how you meet it (other qualifications)
ASSET - EDUCATION

AEd1. Graduation with a Master level degree from a recognized university.
AEd2. Graduation with a Ph.D. from a recognized university.

Other education assets may be used as needs arise.
Degree equivalency
ASSET - EXPERIENCE

AEX1. Experience with Statistics Canada's Research Data Centres Program.
AEX2. Significant* experience using individual or household census data, administrative data, or complex surveys, such as but not limited to the Statistics Canada Household Survey data.
AEX3. Significant* experience using business, organizational survey or administrative data, such as but not limited to Statistics Canada Business Microdata.
AEX4. Significant* experience in the use of SAS, SPSS or STATA, in the conduct of a social science research project.
AEX5. Experience using Statistics Canada microdata.
AEX6. Experience working with confidential or sensitive statistical information.
AEX7. Experience supervising employees, including the responsibility of their work objectives.
AEX8. Experience screening or vetting statistical output for confidentiality and data protection.
AEX9. Experience with administrative procedures and handling legal documents (for example, that are related to access to secure work space), with an emphasis on details and organizational skills.
AEX10. Experience in writing procedural documents for a variety of audiences.
AEX11. Experience with providing Information Technology (IT) support (for example, in a virtual computing environment, such as but not limited to VMware).

Significant experience is defined as the depth and breadth of experience normally associated with the equivalent of full-time performance of duties for approximately two (2) years working or studying in one of the domains.
Other experience assets may be used as needs arise.
The following will be applied / assessed at a later date (essential for the job)
Various language requirements
Bilingual Imperative BBB/BBB
English Essential
French Essential
Information on language requirements
KNOWLEDGE

K1. Knowledge of statistical methods associated with the analysis of social survey data with complex sample design.
K2. Knowledge of the major social surveys or administrative data sources maintained by Statistics Canada, or comparable surveys or administrative data.
K3. Knowledge of current and emerging challenges relevant to social science research in Canada.
ABILITIES AND SKILLS

A1. Ability to advise clients on advanced analytical methods, construction of custom data files and creation of variables, using statistical software.
A2. Ability to prepare material and deliver presentations to a variety of audiences.
A3. Ability to work effectively in a client service environment.
A4. Ability to communicate effectively orally.
A5. Ability to communicate effectively in writing.
PERSONAL SUITABILITY

PS1. Effective Interpersonal Skills
PS2. Initiative
PS3. Reliability
PS4. Judgment
The following may be applied / assessed at a later date (may be needed for the job)
OPERATIONAL REQUIREMENTS

Below you will find the current or future requirements of the organization for the proper
functioning of the work unit or the organization.

1) For these positions, scheduling flexibility is limited as operational requirements
necessitate the Research Data Centre (RDC) adhere to agreed upon hours of
operation.
2) Employees who hold employment elsewhere or who are otherwise engaged in outside
activities are required to give priority to the requirements of their Statistics Canada job.
3) The candidate may be required to travel occasionally.
4) Employees working part-time must be able to increase their hours and/or change their
schedule with reasonable notice due to training or workflow demands.
Conditions of employment
Reliability Status security clearance
Other information
The Public Service of Canada is committed to building a skilled and diverse workforce that reflects the Canadians we serve. We promote employment equity and encourage you to indicate if you belong to one of the targeted groups when you apply.
Information on employment equity

$72,444 - $94,964 a yearThe Senior Policy Analyst is responsible for conducting research, analyzing data, and developing policy options required to develop the Department of Energy's upstream mines and minerals policies. The position plays a critical role in ensuring that policy options are well thought out, relevant data are analyzed, all stakeholders are engaged, and research is properly conducted for policy and regulation development. The work environment is complex and the position must consider a wide variety of energy and non-energy issues affecting Alberta's mines and minerals royalty and tenure systems. The position leads and/or coordinates in-depth policy development processes and works with multidisciplinary teams.


This position will require strong verbal and written communication skills in producing briefings, presentations, cabinet reports, and communications materials on a broad range of energy-related issues. Your highly developed consultation/engagement, facilitation and interpersonal skills will help you coordinate working groups; liaise extensively with operations, legal, agencies and policy representatives; and participate on departmental, cross ministry, and industry committees related to upstream energy development. The work undertaken by the Senior Policy Analyst ranges from well-organized work plans to exploratory, emergent research and strategy development in the development of energy information, policy, program, and regulations. Since the work covers the full range of Crown-owned mines and minerals, curiosity, mental flexibility, and interpersonal skills are fundamental attributes for the position. Communication, teamwork, and building relationships are essential for success. Having a strong analytical and data processing capabilities are an asset for this position.


The competencies that are critical for success in this role are:

Build Collaborative Environments: Excellent interpersonal and communication skills to influence and enable consensus. Experience leading or facilitating projects or ongoing activities dealing with complex, multi-disciplinary challenges. Demonstrated ability to build and leverage a personal network of relevant professional contacts. Comfort working with remote colleagues is necessary.

Creative Problem Solving: Advanced problem solving and critical thinking skills are required to develop recommendations for management, founded on excellent research and analysis skills and the input of multiple stakeholders and/or data sources.

Systems Thinking: Ability to map and synthesize knowledge of Alberta Government business goals, economic and environmental policies, challenges, and potential roles for the Alberta Government and other jurisdictions to address these challenges.

Agility: Demonstrated ability to develop creative and durable recommendations to address complex issues involving multiple stakeholders with various responsibilities and areas of influence. Ability to work with minimal supervision is required


Qualifications

University degree in a related field (e.g., law, business, economics, finance, or natural resources sciences) plus a minimum of 4 years of progressively responsible related experience is required. Equivalencies will be considered. Experience with project management and policy development is required. A master's degree, knowledge of upstream energy resource development, and/or knowledge of Canadian and global energy industries and systems would be considered assets.


Salary

$2,775.64 to $3,638.48 bi-weekly ($72,444 to $94,964 annually)


Notes

This competition may be used to fill permanent or temporary positions at an equal or lower level across the Government of Alberta.

Alberta Energy is currently utilizing competency evaluation in the recruitment process. Competencies are behaviors that are essential to reach our goals in serving Albertans. We encourage you to have an in depth understanding of the competencies that are required for this opportunity and to be prepared to demonstrate them during the recruitment process. For more information on the APS Competency Model and how it is used, please visit the CHR Competency page.


How to Apply

Job Description

The Senior Business Analyst is responsible for working with Clients and Valtech Project Teams to drive the project vision, objectives and take ultimate ownership for delivering impactful Content Management and Digital Portal solutions with the project team.
 The BA works and negotiates directly with the client stakeholders to analyze and transform business objectives into a backlog of prioritized user stories based on market data, internal needs and business value. He/she then guides and supports one or more cross-functional project teams by owning the vision for a release, deciding the priority and details of features to build, accepting features after implementation, and accepting the release.
The BA must have experience in delivering web-based solutions of varying complexity, and must deeply understand the nuances of complex technical, user experience-driven web projects within the an iterative context. The BA must have a knowledge of data and content modeling.

Key Accountabilities :
Be passionate and knowledgeable about our products and the possibilities in our market; specifically around:
Content management and digital marketing platforms
Marketing optimization and automation
User experience and customer experience management
Customer and membership portals
Education, non-profit and B2B verticals
Generate ideas for how our solutions can make our customers more successful.
The Product Owner must have a knowledge of data and content modeling in a web context.
Collaborate deeply with the Scrum Master/Project Manager to continually manage scope, budget and expectations. Maintaining an intimate knowledge of the budget/scope burndown and its impact on release expectations is mandatory.
Works closely with the technical lead to define work for the developers via acceptance criteria on the user stories
Work with the client and project team to formulate a release vision and high-level epics
Constantly manage client expectations on release scope
Present and justify a product release to the project stakeholders.
Participate in project process including Release Planning, Sprint Planning, Backlog Grooming, Daily Scrum, and Sprint Review.
Work with customers and stakeholders to understand their needs and manage expectations.
Define and prioritize a backlog of work. Maintain a well groomed product backlog at all times.
Be the customer's voice and provide perspective on business value on a day-to-day basis.
Continuously evaluate and prioritize user stories based on market data and business needs.
Write user stories and acceptance criteria.

Qualifications

Must have experience having delivered implementations meeting typical web project success factors, including improved SEO, improved conversion and engagement, improved publishing workflow and internal visibility of ROI.
Prefers working in a highly collaborative environment.
Highly developed organization and time management skills.
Excellent interpersonal and client-handling skills.
Ability to contribute towards a team effort.
Ability to work with ambiguity.
Initiative and self-confidence, adaptable and able to cope with changing and evolving priorities while being able to identify new opportunities.
Excellent presentation skills.
Excellent oral and written communication skills.
 Understanding of Agile methodologies (preferably Scrum) and knowledge of the full project lifecycle.
1+ years working on software projects following Agile methodologies
Nice to have experience with Digital Marketing/Content Management/Customer Experience Management solutions for public facing websites and portals (for example, Sitecore)
Additional Information

Some travel is required as part of this position.
We offer a chance to work with an amazing team, global clients, competitive salary, medical and dental benefits, life and disability insurance, as well as work from home options.
If you would like to join our growing company please apply today!

We welcome and encourage applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.

*** We do not accept unsolicited candidate profiles from recruiting firms***

This role encompasses conducting assessments and analysis of the current state of operational processes, as well as proactive collaboration with internal stakeholders and Operations leadership to define new processes.

Acts as a liaison with respect to operations and its knowledge base, communicating effectively within and outside the organization with clients and internal stakeholders, such as the QA Team. Investigates issues, addresses concerns, provides insights and influences outcomes for the good of operations and the larger organization.
Makes recommendations for process improvements to facilitate project implementations on time and on budget
Qualifications and Requirements
3+ years in a similar role
University degree preferred
Strong experience with supporting/building new processes for large and medium scale projects, including the required supporting documentation
Excellent communication skills to actively listen to departmental needs and communicate complex requirements to internal departments and across all levels of the organization
Strong analysis skills to break complex issues into smaller parts to understand the whole
Technical writing experience
Reporting and Metrics expertise
Inventory Management
Workflow Diagrams
Business Optimization and Process Improvement
Proficiency in MS Office applications
Knowledge of LSS, SQL & PMOBK principles and best practices and asset
Experience working in a Market Research environment and/or familiarity with market research principles and techniques an asset
Values: Integrity, Accountability, Collaboration, Innovation, Customer Centricity

Build your career with us.

It is an extraordinary time to be in business. As digital transformation continues to accelerate, CGI is at the center of this change—supporting our clients’ digital journeys and offering our professionals exciting career opportunities.

At CGI, our success comes from the talent and commitment of our professionals. As one team, we share the challenges and rewards that come from growing our company, which reinforces our culture of ownership. All of our professionals benefit from the value we collectively create.

CGI is an equal opportunity employer. In addition, CGI is committed to providing accommodations for people with disabilities in accordance with provincial legislation. Your future duties and responsibilities

Perform daily "hands-on" tasks, such as updating ads, PowerPoint presentations, as well as providing general support to broader team.
Utilizing an exceptional problem-solving and analytical skillset to update changes in the system.
Assist communications with different business units to understand needs and work out how you can best help them in an empathetic manner.
Professionally answer questions and queries whilst generating the best solutions.
Collaborate with internal business teams to help resolve issues.

Required qualifications to be successful in this role

Outstanding command of the English Language - written and spoken.
Must be a detail-oriented, organized self-starter who can work well within a team, and excel in a fast-paced corporate environment, whilst being able to manage multiple priorities and deadlines.
Resourceful, quick-thinking and tech-savvy should be some of the adjectives used to describe you.
You are detailed-oriented and loves to make sure data is input accurately.
Confident and proactive team player. You will also be self-motivated and able to think on your feet when dealing with customers.
Highest degree of initiative, courtesy, and professionalism to build valuable client relationships that you will leverage to generate a positive feel in the market and contribute significantly to the revenue and company growth.
You will be able to articulate with superb customer communication skills, both over the phone and via email.
Proficiency with the Microsoft Office suite, especially Excel

Overview
You provide the vision, set the pace and inspire success.
There’s one thing you do that’s exceptional: lead. You formulate a plan and focus your team to solve the unsolvable, beat the unbeatable and come out on top. Your capacity to creatively strategize, motivate sales professionals, and elicit achievement makes you the right fit for a National Business Director role with Syneos Health.
Why Syneos Health? Join a game-changing global company that is reinventing the way therapies are developed and commercialized. Created through the merger of two industry leading companies - INC Research and inVentiv Health - we bring together more than 23,000 clinical and commercial minds to create better, smarter, faster ways to get biopharmaceutical therapies to patients. Teaming with some of the most talented professionals in the industry, you'll gain exposure and work in a dynamic environment where you'll be supported with comprehensive resources including emerging technologies, data, science and knowledge sharing. Grow your career with a global company committed to shortening the distance from lab to life.
Syneos Health has launched more than 120 sales teams in the last 5 years across all major Therapeutic Areas – more than the top 25 pharma companies combined. We offer you more than just one job. The diversification and breadth of Syneos Health creates a multitude of career paths and employment opportunities. Our client roster consists of more than 550 organizations including all 50 of the largest global biopharmaceutical companies.
Responsibilities
The National Business Director will be the primary contact for the designated client on all matters related to the project and provide leadership, management, operations and financial support and oversight that aligns to client strategy and business goals. Primary partnership lead to link strategy to execution in order to deliver client value and accelerate growth of aligned business objectives. The scope and scale of the role will adapt to meet the expanding needs of the client partnership.


Duties may include, but are not limited to the following:
Understand the strategy and key priorities of the client
Integrate with client leadership and collaborate across multi-functional teams to ensure collaborative approach to support field sales success.
Proactively recommend solutions to enhance the client’s performance, leveraging Selling Solutions capabilities and other services as appropriate to support client competitiveness
Identify opportunities to complement client’s capabilities with Syneos Health capabilities to further strengthen the partnership
Function as the primary liaison between client and internal Syneos operational elements, ensuring Syneos employees working with client understands strategy and incorporates that into their recommendations
Facilitate a culture of accountability through ongoing cadence discussions with Syneos Field Leaders (SLLs, FLLs), Syneos Health internal partners (Business Analytics, HR, Commercial Capabilities, Client Services) and client stakeholders (Brand, Sales Leadership, Commercial Operations) to identify scalable business practices and to problem solve potential field barriers to effective execution.
Responsible for overall P&L of the contract
Ensure contracted services, information flow and all other deliverables are completed on time
Collaborate on development of performance goals and objectives at all levels and appropriate measures to ensure achievement
Collaborate with Analysis & Reporting to design reports and tools to monitor attainment of goals established in the client agreement
Oversee the recruiting, interviewing, hiring, training and staffing of the management, sales and account team
Minimize regrettable turnover through selection process and ongoing leadership actions. Leverage performance management tools to quickly identify performance level and direct resources to manage appropriately in a timely fashion
Provide frequent, ongoing performance feedback to all direct reports and foster a team oriented, supportive working environment.
Collaborate on incentive compensation plan design and oversee plan administration
Establish performance expectations and oversee activity of direct reports within field management and Client Services structure, including adherence to policies
Conduct regularly scheduled meetings with the client to discuss and address business issues
Recommend positive solutions toward increasing productivity and improved operational efficiency
Oversee performance management process for all team members and ensure fair, timely resolution of disciplinary process
Conduct regular meetings with the account and field sales management teams as well as periodic interaction with representatives to discuss program issues, training needs and personnel development
Assess training needs and recommend solutions, as appropriate
Maintain or expand business opportunities within existing Client base to include additional services
Foster an environment that rewards accomplishment and encourages the advancement and retention of productive employees
Job Requirements
Along with demonstrated initiate, resourcefulness and a results-oriented mindset, the ideal candidate has:
Minimum Bachelor’s degree, MBA preferred (Majors preferred – Sciences, Business, Healthcare Fields)
Minimum 10 years of commercial pharmaceutical experience with at least 5 years of second level management leading a Regional or National Field Sales force.
Credibility and extensive industry relationships to draw upon, based upon 10+ years of work in the pharmaceutical industry, ideally in the specialty pharmaceutical space.
Possess a minimum of 2 years of home office and operations background. i.e. Training, Incentive Compensation, Recruiting, Analyst etc.
Must have strong understanding of Client account management and sales operational functions.
Strong verbal and written communication skills
Proven, successful history in leadership and motivational role
Full Syneos Health Selling Solutions benefits
Make your work matter everywhere. Be a driving force in the evolution of healthcare sales.
Syneos Health companies are affirmative action/equal opportunity employers (Minorities/Females/Vets/Disabled)

job_title: Junior Business Analyst, Accounting and Finance
job_description:
If you're looking for a workplace where employees are passionate about their work environment, then read on. What sets Equitable Bank apart from other companies is its culture. We celebrate and embrace the fabric of diversity, the employee engagement process and collectively take pride in our business successes. Our commitment to our customers, our partners and our employees creates a stimulating and exciting atmosphere that generates innovative products and outstanding service quality.

Equitable Bank is Canada's ninth largest independent Schedule I bank, serving Canadians coast to coast. It offers a diverse suite of residential lending, commercial lending and savings solutions, including high-interest savings products and GICs. Through its proven branchless approach and customer service focus, Equitable Bank has grown to approximately $25 billion in assets under management. Most recently, Equitable Bank launched a digital banking operation, EQ Bank, and introduced the EQ Bank Savings Plus Account. Equitable Bank currently employs over 600 employees across the country.

Within Equitable Bank's Core Lending business, Single Family Lending Services funds mortgages for owner-occupied and investment properties across Canada, while Commercial Lending Services provides mortgages on a variety of commercial properties on a national basis.Equitable's Securitization Financing business originates and securitizes insured residential mortgages under the Canada Mortgage and Housing ("CMHC") administered National Housing Act.Equitable Bank also offers a range of deposit products including short-term, long-term and Cashable GICs, available in non-registered or Tax Free Savings Account ("TFSA") across Canada. And it offers a High Interest Savings Account, available from authorized investment advisors through the FundServ network.

Equitable Bank is a growing Canadian financial services business and a wholly owned subsidiary of Equitable Group. It was founded in 1970 as The Equitable Trust Company.

Job Title: Junior Business Analyst, Accounting and Finance
Department: Finance and Accounting
Reports To: Director, Finance Projects & ICOFR

Purpose of Job

A member of the Finance Projects team, the Junior Business Analyst represents the team on SIT PPlus and other system enhancement projects to ensure accurate, timely and relevant financial accounting and reporting processes. The candidate will work closely with the Accounting and Finance and Business Analysis teams, as well as other departments, to assist with production support, testing, roll out of upgrades & enhancements, and to document system processes.

Main Activities:
1. New Projects (20%)
Assist with status reporting, change control, issue and risk management, quality assurance frameworks, artifact review, sign-off and archiving, regulatory compliance
Document requirements, write test cases and execute testing to ensure delivered solution results match expected outcomes
Track project milestones
Ensure project issues and risks are identified, quantified, managed and tracked

2. System Enhancement Projects (40%):

Conduct interviews to understand business requirements and system capabilities
Document requirements and write test cases to ensure requirements are met
Evaluate current processes and recommend changes for improvement
Develop and execute test plans in order to roll out new enhancements

3. Production Support (20%):

Provide support to the SIT PPlus user base by troubleshooting system issues
Track financial system-related issues (e.g. general ledger, transaction processing, or system reporting)
Determine the root cause of core system issues, i.e. system limitation/configurations, user training, or process & controls
Assist with technical and/or qualitative analyses to diagnose identified issues and develop recommendations to solve them with applicable resources
Analyze data and financial/operational processes to identify, research and provide recommendations
Execute project plans to remediate identified issues

4. Documentation (20%):

Responsible for maintaining up-to-date documentation of processes & functionality as well as end user manuals

Knowledge/Skill Requirements:

Strong verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to communicate clearly and concisely with Accounting and Finance, Business Analysis and IT teams
Understanding of financial accounting and reporting systems with relevant experience performing system enhancements, upgrades, troubleshooting issues, and system implementations
Good understanding of technology from network, file system, database to software development concepts
Bachelor’s degree in Information Technology or Business Administration
