Financial (Data) Analyst – Business Data Analytics| Financial Planning & Analysis


Financial Planning & Analysis

FP&A is responsible for planning and managing lululemon’s overall financial performance. We are an amazing team of passionate, active and dedicated leaders who are counted on as a key business partner in strategic and operational decisions. We provide a tremendous opportunity to learn about the various operations within lululemon, working often in cross-functional teams on a variety of projects. You will be able to add value immediately, see the big picture, and develop a business and finance skill set that you can leverage in your future roles within the organization. We are a stand for high quality work, driving high quality results and living a high quality life.


Summary

Reporting to the Manager of Reporting & Analytics, FP&A, the Financial (Data) Analyst – Business Data Analytics is responsible for financial performance analysis of the North American selling channels. Working with large amounts of financial and operational data from multiple data sources, he/she turns complex statistical observations into succinct and clear messaging for senior leadership. The Financial (Data) Analyst proactively identifies performance trends, business insights and solves questions from senior leadership in an objective and timely manner. Additionally, he/she is responsible for providing analysis and insight into day-to-day operations and strategic priorities, through financial modeling, business case support, analytics & reporting.


Key Responsibilities of a Financial (Data) Analyst – Business Data Analytics
 Perform quantitative analysis of business performance, using SQL, MS Excel, OLAP cubes, Qlik, Power BI and other tools Provide deep dive analyses to explain changes in trend and translate results into actionable insight Leverage quantitative methods to improve accuracy of financial forecasts Perform financial modelling/simulations, sensitivity analysis, hypothesis creation and testing in data models that are easily understood and replicated Create management reporting, presentations, dashboards and business commentary Provide quantitative support and analytical leadership to the North America FP&A team


Skills, Experiences & Educational Requirements
 4+ years of Finance / FP&A experience with a focus in advanced quantitative methods. Bachelor’s degree in Commerce, Business Administration, Statistics, Business Data Analytics, Engineering or a related field MBA, CFA or CPA is an asset. Management Consulting or Investment Banking Analyst experience is an asset. Highly proficient with MS Excel, including pivot tables and complex logic-based formulas. Hyperion, Oracle or large financial planning software knowledge is a plus. Demonstrates strong communication skills / can present to functional teams and management. Can distill and summarize large and complex data sets in a simple and concise way and present it clearly without losing sight of the big picture. Able to work with limited direction, can understand and link strategy to the underlying drivers of the business. Extremely organized, thorough and takes pride in quality Strong analytical and problems solving skills Proven ability to prioritize and handle multiples task in a time sensitive manner. Excellent team player as well as the ability to work independently.

Results driven

$30.86 - $34.19 an hourSystems Programmer/Analyst 2 - Business Systems
Hours of Work: Full-Time Position; Days
Wage: $30.858- $34.194 per hour
Union: CUPE
In accordance with Article 9.05, where the previous incumbent returns to this position within the thirty (30) day trial period this position shall be deemed not vacant and the posting will be cancelled. Should the vacancy be cancelled, applicants to this posting shall be notified.
PRIMARY FUNCTION:
Works with the client and/or project team to establish project scope and objectives. Develops the work plan and resource plan for small to moderately complex information systems projects. Conducts analysis and prepares detailed specifications related to system implementation. Designs, codes, configure, tests, debugs and documents system applications. Capable of working on all phases of systems analysis, development, delivery and support. Works under general supervision of the Manager and with the technical direction of more experienced analysts.
Within this role the employee is accountable for contributing to the delivery of the Kingston General Hospital strategy. As an employee, one must demonstrate an awareness of and be responsible for actively promoting and supporting patient and family centered engagement and care in all we do.
PRINCIPLE RESPONSIBILITIES:
Project Tasks : Executes detailed application system tasks for all phases of the systems development lifecycle and application administration: problem definition, feasibility study, analysis, outline design, detailed design, implementation, and maintenance. For example:
Acts in conjunction with the client to establish the project and produces the statement of requirements.
Works with the client and/or team to define what constitutes a solution to the opportunity/problem and produces a logical model of the solution. Conducts workshops and presentations to validate business processes and system solutions with the functional area and/or the user community in conjunction with the project team members.
Determines ways of implementing a solution and makes recommendations based on analysis
Produces detailed system and technical design specifications
Develops system deliverables such as configuration setup, programs, enhancements, reports, forms, interfaces, and conversions required for the system solution. Ensures that proper quality, integration and standards in relation to development objects are maintained.
Creates the unit test plan and executes unit testing; works with the project team to identify mission critical business process scenarios; identifies transactions and data to be tested; manages expected results versus actual results; assigns follow up tasks to re-configure and retest; tracks error resolution.
Works to provide application administration system monitoring /tuning and configuration; application instance maintenance; installation of notes; data management / optimization; application architecture; general application administrative tasks
Assists in end user documentation, training materials development, and training
Project Management: Evaluates opportunities and establishes objectives and scope, in conjunction with the client. Develops the project work plan and resource plan working with the Project Management Office (PMO), and is responsible for the detailed planning, coordination and ultimate outcome of the project.
Production Support : Provides production support and on-call service as required; coordinates problem resolution related to production system issues or errors.
Education : Maintains a good working knowledge of KGH applications and their interrelationships with other systems; maintains knowledge of technological advances; maintains knowledge of how the hospital conducts its business; acts as trainer and mentor to junior IM staff.
Other: Develops and documents procedures, guidelines and project communications for IM; identifies opportunities for improvement in hospital operations; participates in staff performance evaluations. Provides other duties as assigned in support of the IM business systems.
Workplace Health & Safety : Adheres to the worker responsibilities as set out in the Occupational Health & Safety Act, hospital safety policies, and dept/unit established procedures at all times. Where possible, take corrective action to address a hazard, otherwise report the unresolved hazard, dangerous circumstance, unsafe situation to self, other co-workers or the community, to their supervisor. Should the employee suffer a workplace injury or illness, he/she will advise their supervisor; actively participate in identifying and resolving the underlying cause(s), and participates in early and safe return to work as per Workplace Safety & Insurance Act.
Workplace Conduct: Understands and is familiar with all pertinent KGH policies and procedures including those relating to workplace conduct. Complies with the KGH Commitment to uphold the Workplace Conduct and Reporting of Inappropriate Conduct policy and behaves in a manner that is consistent with the guiding principles and expectations.
QUALIFICATIONS:
University Degree in Computer Science, Health Informatics, Commerce or related discipline or Equivalent combination of education and experience.
3 years systems development experience in a corporate systems setting including 2 years recent experience in the development and support of business systems applications within large-scale commercial systems.
Knowledge and application of project management methodologies.
Knowledge and application of the principles of systems development methodology.
Good communication skills in both written and oral forms as demonstrated through preparation of technical, training or project documents and presentations to IM staff.
Ability to lead technical project teams.
Ability to identify issues relating to systems development, systems operation or project completion and provide solutions.
Ability to prepare/implement plans, designs or specifications in accordance with established departmental standards.
Excellent prioritization and organizational skills as demonstrated by the ability to manage own time and successfully complete multiple tasks or projects assigned simultaneously.
General Functional knowledge plus two or more years’ experience in technical maintenance of enterprise business system applications i.e. fully integrated solutions like SAP, Oracle E-Business Suite, PeopleSoft, etc This includes, but is not limited to, the functional areas of:
HCM (i.e. personnel administration, personnel development, personnel time, employee scheduling, and payroll);
Finance and Controlling;
Sales and Distribution (SD) - Billing and Receivables;
Supply Chain Management (SCM) (i.e. Inventory, Purchasing, Accounts Payable, and Supplier Relationship Management (SRM));
Clinical (i.e. Patient master data, case, visit, encounter, movement, and service / procedure / provider / diagnosis information);
Decision Support Systems/Data Warehousing i.e. SAP BI, Cognos, Informatica
Mobile Enterprise Applications Platforms (MEAP) i.e. SAP MI, Oracle MEAP
Knowledge of HL7 Clinical Document Architecture (CDA) and HL7 Reference Information Model (RIM).
General Functional Knowledge of Graphical Design concepts and software i.e. CorelDRAW, Adobe Photoshop.
Knowledge of Portal technologies i.e. SAP Netweaver Portal, Microsoft Sharepoint
Knowledge of Database Management Systems (dbms) and relational database concepts in a client server environment, including knowledge of SQL.
Understanding of Object Oriented programming concepts and at least one Object Oriented programming language.
Knowledge of Web technologies and Web applications.
Knowledge of MS-Office products (Excel, PowerPoint, Word, Access).
Proven ability to attend work regularly.
Satisfactory criminal reference check required.
PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS:
The applicant must be able to meet the physical demands of this position.

job_title: Lead Business System Analyst - ERP Solutions
job_description:
At SNC-Lavalin, we believe the world-class expertise and unwavering commitment of our employees are the reasons for our success. We value teamwork, respect and openness above all else, and we empower our people to grow and learn. Join us, as we work to become the world’s most sought-after engineering and construction firm.
Reporting to the Manager Business Solutions, the Lead BSA engages directly with business users, process owners and management alongside IT/IS team to develop solutions that meets business needs.
The lead BSA is responsible for leading solutions application design through understanding business needs and ensuring fit with enterprise architectural standards and roadmaps. This individual works closely with clients, business leaders and process owners to take our industry-leading operations to new levels of innovation, efficiency and flexibility. The lead BSA is responsible for managing business process changes, specifications, configuration, testing, training and for providing business consultancy and system support in ERP JD Edwards platform and integration with other software applications and solutions such as BI tools (OBIEE /QliKView) and Sharepoint)
Responsibilities
Engages Business Leaders, providing consultation, gathering their requirements (project or support related) and translating them into functional - technical specifications
Develop project plan for implementation of enhancement/upgrade or new projects
Manage resources assigned to the project and coordinate tasks and activities for development and configuration of the solution
Monitors and reports on progress of tasks and activities
Review cross-functional business processes, identify gaps and propose remediation.
Maintains business process documentation and identifies areas for process improvement opportunities.
Facilitating business change in support of solution design and implementation. Documents systems and their interdependencies.
Evolving and maintaining design documents to reflect changes introduced by new implementations.
Analyzes and problem solves system issues in respective application portfolio to determine the best course of action to correct the situation.
Facilitates cross-functional meetings/presentations with various levels of management.
Maintains domain Application-System knowledge and keeps abreast of new technology developments in key area of responsibilities.
Leads the quality assurance testing. Translate business requirements and use cases into test plans and test scenarios. And assists the business in UAT.
Ensures the integration of all aspects of technology solutions and the compliance to established standards.
Works with Business across the organization to document and obtain requirements, supporting the creation of prototype solutions such as analytics, KPI dashboards, etc.
Providing technical assistance to the business in the use of information and data.
Qualifications
Bachelor’s Degree in computer science, information technology management, business management administration or finance related major
5+ years of experience in an JD Edwards EnterpriseOne ERP system with significant hands-on business experience working in the capital asset management, procurement, finance, job cost , payroll and change management modules
Solid knowledge of project management frameworks (PMBoK)
Experience with full software life cycle implementation and project management, planning and delivery
5+ years of functional analysis experience in ERP solution implementation including process design, configuration, support and problem solving (such as JD Edwards EnterpriseOne , Oracle EBS or SAP, etc.)
Experience in data conversions and master data management as well as implementing integrated ERP solutions with 3rd party applications
Organized and task oriented. Ability to work on multiple initiatives and projects concurrently ensuring that timelines are balanced with resource constraints and resulting deadlines are met
Previous experience in business process re-engineering or process improvement, involving multiple information systems is desired
Solid technical knowledge and ability to express complex technical concepts in terms that are understandable to the business
Strong oral and written communication skills, including technical writing and developing business presentations and power user training materials
Experience in construction would be an asset
Bilingual French and English an asset
Worker Type
Employee
Job Type
Regular
At SNC-Lavalin, we seek to hire individuals with diverse characteristics, backgrounds and perspectives. We strongly believe that world-class talent makes no distinctions based on gender, ethnic or national origin, sexual identity and orientation, age, religion or disability, but enriches itself through these differences.

PermanentHelp us boldly shape retail in Canada

Canadian Tire Corporation’s (CTC) rich heritage of serving Canadians from coast-to-coast dates back to 1922. Our vision is to become the #1 retail brand in Canada by 2022 and we are focused on innovating and making important investments in our business, especially when it comes to our people. To reach our goal, we need the best talent to help us evolve and drive change across the business – and boldly help shape Canada’s retail industry. As we strive to be at the forefront of a complex and vastly changing retail industry, it is an exciting time to join the Canadian Tire family of companies.

The purchase analyst’s primary mission is to assist the purchase teams in a company's purchasing department. Its contributions, in close connection with the teams of buyers, are divided into three areas: purchasing procedures organization; supplier monitoring; administrative and logistical governance of purchases. They work to support the teams of buyers, facilitate the realization of the various stages that surround the procurement process. In addition, its role is to assist and support the buyer by performing data entries, distributions, special projects, preparing tables and various clerical tasks. Reports directly to the buyer.

What you'll do

Prepare placement and close-out purchase orders in addition to distributing them. Follow up on deliveries with suppliers. Request for comparative reports and sales analysis of the “core, margin builder, close-out” program as well as the overall sales of the category by banners. For different banner advertising events.

Work with the buyer to develop banner advertising programs.

Follow up with suppliers to ensure that purchasing presentations operate correctly. Integrate products for various presentations, corrections and product card printing. Prepare the pub product list (photo and other samples). Follow up on deliveries to the Mississauga warehouse and with various suppliers.

Welcome members, give out data entry terminals during presentations. Request reports and rankings in their respective records. Print purchase orders for suppliers.

Contact suppliers to obtain samples for photo sessions. Prepare advertised product descriptions for various advertising events and for the Web. Be able to verify and approve various advertising events when the buyer is absent.

Fill and update the close-out product lists for the various banner advertising events.

Who you are

We are looking for individuals who are:
Creative and courageous, with the ability to manage in an environment of change and ambiguity to help us take bold, strategic moves in this rapidly evolving retail environment

Action oriented, and comfortable taking calculated risks to better serve our customers and business

Outcome focused, critical thinkers with the ability to analyze and visualize, to ensure continuous improvement across our entire business

Collaborative team players with superior influencing skills, who build relationships easily across various stakeholder groups to move initiatives forward

Inclusive leaders who build and develop teams that effectively anticipate and respond to disruption, while consistently delivering strong performance

If you’re curious, ready to take on new challenges and open to doing things differently to help us evolve rapidly, then this is definitely the place to be.

What you bring

3 to 5 years of experience in the retail industry

Ability to work with minimal supervision

Ability to work on more than one project at a time

Attention to detail and the ability to take initiative

Strong organizational skills and ability to effectively prioritize workload, ability to work under pressure

Knowledge of Excel, Word, PowerPoint, AS400, BSWP, Outlook

Collaboration with other departments (marketing, operations, distribution centre, Calgary office)

Availability to work evenings and weekends occasionally

Ability to work as a team and good written and verbal communication

Stress management and adaptation to contingencies are also needed

Bilingual, French and English (spoken and written)

About Canadian Tire Corporation

Canadian Tire and its family of companies are boldly shaping retail in Canada and we continue to deliver a positive experience for our customers. As one of the most trusted brands in Canada, our employees take pride in the work we do across the country. It’s more than the iconic triangle that keeps our employees around. From benefits and perks, to learning and development opportunities, to our commitment to Jumpstart – these are some of the many reasons why Canadian Tire Corporation is one of Canada’s Top Employers.

To learn more about this team and the Canadian Tire family of companies follow us on LinkedIn.

Canadian Tire is an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace for all. We recognize that our future success depends on the perspectives and contributions of all our employees -- their diverse backgrounds, abilities and experiences make our business stronger. If you are contacted for a job opportunity, please advise us of any accommodations needed to ensure fair and equitable access throughout the recruitment and selection process. All accommodation information provided will be treated as confidential and used only for the purpose of providing an accessible candidate experience.

job_title: Junior Analyst, Market Access - Montreal, Canada
job_description:
About Analytica Laser, a Certara company
Analytica Laser is a global market access research consultancy, committed to providing the highest level of scientific evidence on the real-world value of medicines and health technologies. Every day our work directly benefits millions of patients in advancing access to new therapies that are safer, more convenient and more affordable.
Our group is widely considered to be a pioneer in leveraging evidence-based methodologies in health systems throughout Europe, North America and MEA. Our regional teams excel at assessing the value of medicines and health technologies through an unmatched combination of research expertise, sophisticated analytics, public health intelligence, health economics and proven experience in pricing and market access strategy.
The goal of this position is to support is to provide timely, high quality research support as part of a project team.
Responsibilities include but are not limited to:
Performing literature searches
Literature screening and data extraction
Data analysis and quality control
Data synthesis
Maintenance of literature databases
Education
Bachelor degree in a biomedical discipline
Knowledge and skills required
2+ years of experience in literature reviews, screening and synthesis
Skill in critical analysis, clear and coherent technical writing and organization
Dedication to detail and precision
Excellent spoken and written English communication skills
Bilingualism (oral fluency in English and French) is an asset
Experience in graphic design an asset
Computer literacy (at minimum, a solid knowledge of Windows, MS Word/Excel/ PowerPoint); knowledge in database management an asset
About Certara

Certara is a growing company that provides a novel and exciting place to work. Our purpose is to assist in accelerating the development of meaningful medicines that make an impact on our society and the people that need them most. Innovation and creativity are highly valued, and everyone is given the opportunity for training and continuous development. Our portfolio spans the discovery, preclinical, clinical and post-marketing phases of drug development, working with 1,200 commercial companies, 250 academic institutions, and numerous regulatory agencies.
We offer:
A career path combining business with world-class science
Hands-on experience on a variety of projects in different therapeutical indications with both leading pharmaceutical companies and pharmaceutical start-ups
Steep learning curve and possibility to progress fast depending on the demonstrated abilities
Stable employment in a friendly and supportive international working environment
Flexible work arrangements can be negotiated
We are an equal opportunity employer

company_name: Old Republic Insurance Company of Canada
job_description:
The Programmer Analyst’s role is to analyze, define, develop, test and maintain software applications
in support of the achievement of business requirements. This includes coding, testing, and analyzing
software programs and applications. The Programmer Analyst will also research, design, document
and modify software specifications throughout the system development life cycle.
Responsibilities

Collaborate with a team of programmer analysts, system architect and department

management in conceptualizing and development of software programs and applications.

Liaise with network administrators, systems analysts, and software engineers to assist in

resolving problems with software products or company software systems.

Analyze and assess existing business systems and procedures and make recommendations for

improvements.

Assist in the definition, development, and documentation of software business requirements,

objectives, deliverables, and specifications on a project-by-project basis in collaboration with
internal users.

Conduct research on emerging application development software, languages, and standards in

support of procurement and development efforts.

Assist in defining software development project plans, including scoping, scheduling, and

implementation.

Consistently write and maintain software programs and applications according to specifications.
Design, run and monitor software performance tests on new and existing programs for the

purpose of correcting errors, isolating areas for improvement, and general debugging.

Administer critical analysis of test results and deliver solutions to problem areas.

Recommend, schedule, and perform software improvements and upgrades.
Manage and/or provide guidance to junior team members.
Responsible for self-development in corporate technology direction.

College diploma or university degree in the field of computer science, information systems, or

software engineering, and 1-5 years equivalent work experience.

Proficiency in a variety of programming languages, including Microsoft .NET stack, C#,

JavaScript, jQuery, MS SQL Server, MVC, MS Reporting Services.

Knowledge of and experience in object-oriented programming and related techniques,

patterns, industry standards and best practices.

Pride in creating attractive and intuitive UIX.
Excellent understanding of relational database and experience with MS SQL Server.
Solid working knowledge of current Internet technologies, including IIS, web services and

secure web processing.
Prior experience interviewing end-users for insight on functionality, interface, problems, and/or
usability issues.

Ability to communicate effectively with non-technical staff and with members of crossfunctional teams.
Hands-on experience developing test cases and test plans.
Flexible and adaptable in regards to learning and understanding new technologies.
Knowledge of applicable data privacy practices and laws.
Strong written, oral, and interpersonal communication skills.
Ability to conduct research into software-related issues and products.
Highly self-motivated and directed.
Keen attention to detail.
Proven analytical and problem-solving abilities.
Ability to effectively prioritize and execute tasks in a high-pressure environment.
Experience working both independently and in a team-oriented, collaborative environment.

The role:
Reporting directly to the Category Manager, the Category Analyst provides support to the Category Manager by providing analysis and assisting in the introduction of new products and reviews, supporting all aspects of the administration of marketing/promotional activities and preparing store communications.
Success in this role will require a highly organized, detail-oriented (accurate and thorough), excellent communicator who can effectively collaborate cross-departmentally, who is solutions-oriented and who thrives in a high-tempo, dynamic and changing environment.

What you will do:
Collect and complete New Product Listing forms
Manage all aspects of new item setup and item maintenance. This includes vendor data, life cycle and listing types, item descriptions, web info and appropriate duty classification & import permits are in place
Generate and analyze data concerning item performance and provides recommendations to Category Manager and Vendors concerning possible changes or improvements
Collaborate with Marketing & Category Manager to execute marketing/promotional activities e.g., promotional schedule, samples, fulfilment of vendor support agreements, shelf talkers and product imagery
Assist Category Manager with evaluation of cost changes with additional analysis and review of cost change templates
Coordinate all levels of pricing with the Pricing Team, preparing cost change templates, promotional pricing and clearance pricing
In collaboration with Inventory Management, support Category Manager with analytics to support inventory initiatives, including new product and promotional forecasting and solutions to service level/fill rate issues
Prepare store communications for new products, promotions and sales information
Coordinate product samples and content for the monthly store Call-to-Action
Assist in design and communication of planograms to store teams
Maintain image database
Produce new product launch and product knowledge training presentations
Work cross functionally with web site team to ensure correct product content, copy and images
Perform general administration and other duties and projects as assigned
Serves as back-up for the Category Manager when unavailable

What you will need to succeed:
3-5 years supporting a purchasing/buying department, preferably in retail
Post-secondary education with a focus in Business/Retail (preferable)
MUST HAVE - Advanced Excel skills, and intermediate skills in MS Word & Power Point
Very customer service oriented
Solid critical thinking skills (confirmed in a test)

Selected candidates will be asked to complete testing to confirm proficiency in the above skills.
We thank all candidates however only those selected will be contacted.

At J.D. Irving, Limited, you are part of an energetic team of professionals who lead with integrity and are passionate about achieving results. With a culture that nurtures talent and creates an inclusive workplace, you can grow your career across our diverse operating divisions.


Founded in 1882, J. D. Irving, Limited is a large diversified enterprise based in Saint John, New Brunswick with a team of over 16,000 (FTE) in Canada, the United States, and select international jurisdictions. Our operations span the forestry, transportation, retail, shipbuilding, food & agriculture, consumer products, and construction industries.


As a Marketing Analyst with our new Corporate Branding team, you will contribute to the growth of our affiliate companies’ brands by implementing marketing campaigns across digital, social and traditional channels. The diversity of our businesses offer an exciting marketing career opportunity.


Qualifications:
Education Required: Bachelor’s Degree with a preference for a major in Computer Science, Business Finance or Marketing
2+years of Business Analytics work experience considered an asset
Tableau or other visualization tools an asset
Expert MS Excel skills – formulas, data analysis, report writing ability
Strong communicator and collaborator, with the ability to translate data into commercial actionable plans.
Excellent project management skills and attention to detail
 Job Responsibilities:
Responsible for Web Analytics and optimization solutions and systems
Analyze and report on marketing analytics; qualitative and quantitative analysis using multiple data sources; research, tools and databases
Concept testing; link tests, ad-tracking and brand positioning
Understand and implement segmentation such as Lifetime Value, Behavioural analysis and Model behaviour
Accurate implementation of visitor and lead analysis across multiple platforms.
Responsible for social media analytics and some community management
Present key findings of reports, including actionable insights for key stakeholders, including customer profiling data to feed into marketing strategies.
Recommend and implement data modelling techniques for forecasting and insight for the business, including A/B or multivariate testing.

At JDI you will be rewarded with a competitive benefit and salary package as well as the opportunity to take part in job related training and development. You will be given the opportunity to grow and develop in your current role as well as being able to progress within the division and entire company.


To Apply for this Career Opportunity: Please apply online!
We appreciate your interest in our company! The initial review of applications will begin on the deadline date for applying. Applications received after the deadline may not be considered. Only those candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.

Job Description:
Summary
Serves as the functional product/system expert for one or more modules in an ERP product or for one module in multiple products. Understands the business strategy of one or more functional areas and works with client and team to define business requirements. Leads or acts as subject matter expert and participates in the gathering and analysis of business requirements, configuration of product, implementation, maintenance and/or upgrade of ERP modules. Participates in developing problem solving strategies, problem resolution and investigation resulting from test environment outcomes. Works with technical team to offer solutions.
Essential Job Functions
Leads project or acts as subject matter expert with client to gather and analyze user business requirements and processes. Understands client requirements, needs, and functionality, as it relates to client, of ERP product. Defines and documents business requirements and validates solutions with the client.
Applies knowledge of product platform functionality and the configuration toolkit to translate business requirements into functional design specifications, configuration changes or initial settings, module-relevant security settings and reporting options.
Understands all relevant levels impacted by the ERP system including business processes and reporting requirements, user interface, ancillary technologies, configuration toolset and a strong understanding of tables, fields and the function of source code. Applies, modifies, and/or recommends change as appropriate.
Understands the integration of the software platform and implication of module changes on other module functionality, master data impacted, security and development solutions. Provides ongoing ERP functional system support. Communicates and interacts with technical team and client to resolve functional issues to meet the client's requirements.
Provides and/or develops end-user training for product module(s).
Provides leadership and work guidance to less experienced personnel.
Basic Qualifications
Bachelor's degree or equivalent combination of education and experience
Bachelor's degree in business administration, information systems, or related field preferred
Nine or more years of ERP business solutions, business analysis or management analysis experience
Proficient with multiple ERP modules within one or more product lines
Experience assisting users with business process changes and improvement initiatives
Other Qualifications
Strong communication and analysis skills to listen to client and articulate back for feedback and solutions
Strong verbal and written communication skills
Strong problem solving skills to identify, analyze and solve complex business application problems in an ERP environment
Strong presentation skills to present to management and customers
Good leadership skills to coordinate, oversee and lead team/project members
Good personal computer and business solutions software skills
Ability to publicly represent company with internal and external clients
Ability to convey a strong presence, professional image, and deal confidently with complex business problems
Ability to communicate technical and business matters clearly in lay terms for comprehension by multiple audiences
Ability to work in a fast paced environment with multiple shifting priorities
Ability to manage competing priorities in a complex environment
Work Environment
Office environment
May require evening or weekend work

job_title: Senior Financial Analyst, Energy & Project Finance
job_description:
Position Summary
The Senior Financial Analyst’s primary responsibility will be to support lead analysts in their responsibilities to manage global portfolios of various credits, including the ongoing analysis and surveillance of specific credits. The general sectors that comprise the portfolios include: pipelines, utilities, oil and gas, power developers and project financings. Analysts will be expected to have or to develop a solid understanding of each of the credits they are assigned to work on, perform financial statement analysis, use financial models, draft written reports including compilation of rating committee material, press releases and rating reports and build proficiency in overall credit analysis. In addition, the Senior Financial Analyst will also be expected to maintain a broad knowledge of industry issues and data in certain sectors. This role reports into the Managing Director of Energy & Project Finance and the respective lead analyst on rating assignments to which they are assigned for the duration of such assignments.
Responsibilities:
Perform financial statement analysis
Demonstrate a well-developed understanding of the industries
Provide consistently accurate credit analysis with minimal guidance and errors
Assist with the preparation of rating committee materials, rating reports and press releases
Spreadsheet modelling of debt issuers historic results and financial projections
Develop understanding and experience with required legal documentation
Develop client-communication skills with increasing client interaction over time
Track key economic indicators and various asset performance indices
Provide analysis of major industry trends affecting the credit of various sectors
Research industry and asset class commentaries and reports
Support IT initiatives for management, tracking and documentation of rating work
Ensure compliance with regulatory and company policies and procedures
Examine and analyze financial records and data to ensure accuracy in internal systems
Requirements:
Undergraduate or Master’s Degree in business, finance or a related analytical field of study
CFA Designation or enrollment in the CFA program is preferred
Minimum of 2 years related experience
Strong analytical abilities and extensive knowledge of financial statements
Detail-oriented research abilities
Understand the rating methodology of each sector, including relevant credit metrics
Advanced knowledge of Microsoft Excel
Bloomberg and online research skills
Working competency in a European language (i.e. Spanish, French, German) would be an asset

job_title: Supply Chain & Logistics Analyst (1 yr Contract)
job_description:
Temporary, ContractLocation:
243 Consumers Road, Toronto, Ontario, M2J 4W8
The decision to join a company is a big one. We have opportunities for hard working, energetic and reliable people just like you.
Why is this role important?
Overview
Reporting directly to the Supply Chain and Logistics Director, the incumbent provides analytical support for all aspects for the Distribution Centre (DC) operations. The incumbent analyzes and monitors the inbound and outbound flow of all products in to the DC, out of the DC and in to the stores.
Primary Responsibilities
 Develops, prepares and monitors event import and replenishment purchase orders including container plans, letters of credit, transfer payments, load booking reports, amendments, customs clearance and seasonal schedules to ensure each program event is planned accordingly and to avoid delays. Completes all necessary documents and distributes to appropriate key stakeholders.
 Monitors shipment status and event tracking reports to liaise between Category Management, Global Procurement, DC’s and vendors and ensure products are received in time for event releases.
 Reviews and monitors DC activities through various inventory systems to provide status, adjustment and no ship reports etc. as required.
 Reviews, enters and prepares invoices for payment to ensure appropriate signing authority is obtained prior to submitting invoices to accounting for payment.
 Monitors and responds to email and telephone inquiries to resolve issues or concerns such as event releases, shipment status, inventory management systems and transportation etc.
 Reviews and monitors excess inventory from seasonal event stock to ensure DC’s maintain a pick accuracy of 99.7%, identify excess inventory and arrange overstock to be shipped to appropriate stores promptly.
 Reviews events and orders for new or closing stores with Operations and Retail Concepts to ensure stock is transferred and cancelled accordingly.
 Compiles data to review and prepare various reports for internal and external review.
 Monitors and responds to Marketing Call Centre inquiries and concerns
 Review of claims submitted by stores in the Store DC claims.
Skills, Experience & Education
Skills
This position requires a demonstrated level of initiative and judgment in order to organize and prioritize tasks, workload and projects. Courtesy, tact and diplomacy are required in dealing with colleagues in every day working relationships.
 Requires an understanding of basic duties and tasks to carry out straight forward procedures.
 Capacity to follow directives and fulfill requests with minimal supervision and takes limited discretionary action as required.
 Professional manner, tact, diplomacy and discretion in dealing with others.
 Ability to identify problems and draw upon a range of choices to formulate solutions.
 Adaptable to set and prioritize work with occasional exceptions. Able to work with diverse personalities and styles.
 Communicates with clarity, verbally and in one on one or group situations, or over the telephone.
 Computer skills to maintain databases and spreadsheets and produce accurate reports and documents.
 Knowledge of inventory management software and systems and logistical procedures such as customs clearance, shipping and tracking.
Experience
Greater than two years, but less than or equal, to three years logistics or equivalent experience.
Education
Post secondary education equivalent to a college diploma in business, supply chain, or related field.
Certificates, Licenses or Registration
N/A
Working Conditions
* Incumbents are required to exert the following physical effort; however, reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
Physical Effort
Much of the time is spent sitting in a comfortable position with the frequent opportunity to stand or move about. The incumbent may be required to occasionally kneel, reach, bend, or stretch and carry light objects consistent with usual office materials such as, paper, files and other office supplies.
Physical Environment
Work is mainly performed in a comfortable office environment where there is minimal exposure to dust, fumes, temperature variance and other sensory attributes. Level of noise at any given time is mild to moderate and may experience frequent interruptions
Sensory Concentration
There is a frequent need to give close attention, much of the time requiring the use of two or more senses simultaneously.
Mental Stress
The incumbent may be exposed to situations which may cause mild mental stress. There are some pressures from meeting deadlines, multitasking, or producing accurate work. The stress levels felt would not be noticeably disruptive to the work nor would the unpleasant reaction be strong or persistent
Note: This job profile indicates the general nature and level of work expected of the incumbent. It is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities required of the incumbent. The incumbent may be asked to perform other duties which may be assigned from time to time.

PermanentPosition Summary
This role is responsible for analyzing new existing systems, documenting requirements for new systems and new features and provide training on existing Financial applications. The Business Analyst is experienced in quickly understanding the capabilities in complicated interconnected systems, and in finding ways to document them and train users so they can be easily understood by business client. Then, when building something new, you excel in asking probing questions to understand the reasons why people are asking for certain requirements, and then finding efficient ways to explain to technical teams what to build to meet those needs.

The Business Analyst (BA) will be reporting directly to the Program Director, and working closely with Business clients, service groups and other stakeholders. The Business Analyst (BA) will provide a detailed understanding on the features and functionality of sub-ledgers being used from the user and technical aspect. The Business Analyst will apply proven communication, analytical, and problem-solving skills to support train implement new and enhanced applications through the Solution Delivery Life Cycle.

Certifications in business analysis or software development processes are an asset

Advanced Microsoft Excel skills

Knowledge of accounting guidelines and principles.
Experience in gathering and analyzing business requirements; ability to read and write user documentation as well as strategic technology documents; ability to understand and interpret business processes, workflows, and systems to identify solutions or opportunities for application improvements (e.g. utilizing application functionality or improving application system performance); ability to leverage application technology functionality to resolve complex business issues. This will include using out-of-the-box functionality as well as custom-developed functions from previous implementations.
Breadth of experience in use and applicability of subledger and related systems to meet business financial needs.
Deep understanding of intersection of business and technology to readily engage in issue resolution and investigation for complex financial challenges related to integration and reporting.

$74,529 - $93,166 a yearPermanentJob Description
As the IT Security Analyst your role contributes to the overall IT security of Strathcona County’s information and technology assets. You would perform the core function of day-to-day operations of the in-place security solutions while the second is the identification, investigation and resolution of security breaches detected by those systems. The second core task may include involvement in the implementation of new security solutions, participation in the creation and or maintenance of policies, standards, baselines, guidelines and procedures as well as conducting vulnerability audits and assessments. You would also be responsible to contribute to the overall operating health of the county’s computing infrastructure. You are expected to be fully aware of the enterprise’s IT security goals as established by its stated policies, procedures and guidelines and to actively work towards upholding those goals.
Responsibilities
Day-to-day operations of in-place security solutions while working on the identification, investigation and resolution of security breaches detected by those systems
Contribute to the overall operating health of the county’s computing infrastructure
Involve in the implementation of new security solutions, participate in the creation and or maintenance of policies, standards, baselines, guidelines and procedures as well as conduct vulnerability audits and assessments
Audit authentication activities and use tools to identify and investigate anomalies in authentication attempts
Remediate inappropriate authentication attempts
Implement and monitor technology and process to ensure that authentication occurs as intended particularly for higher risk assets (i.e. ensure Multi-Factor authentication is used when/where appropriate)
Audit access and ensure appropriate levels of access are provided to appropriate people and no inappropriate access is provided
Ensure that where appropriate Conditional Access based rules are applied and adhered to
The role may be expected to backfill for the other portfolio
Skills and Abilities
In-depth understanding of network operations and configuration, including routers, wireless infrastructure, and firewall configuration and monitoring
In-depth knowledge of server technologies, including Microsoft Server operating systems, Active Directory, File/Print, Exchange, MDM, O365, Azure AD, Azure Hosting, etc.
In-depth knowledge of Enterprise Class Storage Management and system/file backup/restoration services
Detailed knowledge of Data Center Security (Physical and Virtual)
Detailed knowledge of Cloud Security with a focus on O365
Proficient at managing time and multiple concurrent priorities; effective planning, organizational and leadership skills
Proven interpersonal and verbal/written communication skills; ability to maintain professional working relationships
Able to demonstrate leadership within a work group
Able to work with technology vendors and business partners
Aware of project management concepts
Able to lead technical projects with oversight and status reporting
Qualifications
Degree in Computing Science with a minimum of two (2) years of directly related infrastructure IT experience; or Post-Secondary Information Technology related Diploma with at least four (4) years related experience
Related Microsoft certification is desirable as well as any of the following;
CompTIA Security+
GIAC Information Security Fundamentals
Microsoft Certified Systems Administrator: Security
Associate of (ISC)2
Equivalencies of education and experience may be considered.
This competition may be used to fill future vacancies for similar positions within the next 6 months.
Competition #095-2019-EXT-ITS closes March 24

About Nielsen:
Nielsen N.V. (NYSE: NLSN) is a global performance management company that provides a comprehensive understanding of what consumers Watch and Buy. Nielsen’s Watch segment provides media and advertising clients with Total Audience measurement services across all devices where content — video, audio, and text — is consumed. The Buy segment offers consumer packaged goods manufacturers and retailers the industry’s only global view of retail performance measurement.
By integrating information from its Watch and Buy segments and other data sources, Nielsen provides its clients with both world-class measurement as well as analytics that help improve performance. Nielsen, an S&P 500 company, has operations in over 100 countries that cover more than 90 percent of the world’s population. For more information, visit www.nielsen.com

POSITION SUMMARY :
The primary function of the Information Specialist is to understand, recommend and extend the use of Business Systems (primarily the SAP system) functionality to optimize its use at Kingston Health Sciences Centre. Shared services and regional initiatives are an evolving and significant consideration in system and business process design.
Supplementing the interaction with the SAP system is the requirement to advise on, understand, recommend, change and enhance Business Processes and Business Systems functionality to optimize processing, data recording and information reporting within and for KHSC. Consideration for regional need and support, as well as provision of services under shared-service agreement is also a component.
This position acts as resource to the individuals working in Finance, individuals throughout KHSC, as well as to regional partners and external service recipients. The Information Specialist works with Business Unit Managers to determine requirements identify issues and prioritize work. The Information Specialist liaises with information Management Analysts and Project managers (internal and external) to establish requirements, project scope, timelines, and objectives, identify and assess alternatives, and implement solutions.
Within this role the employee is accountable for contributing to the delivery of the Kingston Health Sciences Centre strategy. As an employee, one must demonstrate an awareness of and be responsible for actively promoting and supporting patient and family centered engagement and care in all we do.
RESPONSIBILITIES & DUTIES INCLUDE :
Provide expert knowledge regarding functionality of SAP and integrated supporting systems to users and end-users.
Provide expertise and enhance expansion of SAP and Integrated Supporting Systems to meet the needs of the hospital.
Liaise with Information management regarding SAP and Integrated Supporting Systems functionality, configuration and development.
Lead the implementation of new modules of SAP and coordinate the integration of SAP development and process change.

Doxim is a leading provider of Customer Engagement Software solutions for Financial Service Organizations. Our software helps financial institutions transform their client experience, communicate effectively throughout the client lifecycle and improve cross-sell and upsell activities that drive increased wallet share. With 7 locations across the US and Canada, we are growing very fast, and seeking this role to help drive and accelerate our growth.

JOB DEFINITION:

As a Business Systems Analyst, you are expected to be an advanced professional in the systems & process design and implementation space and have experience on low, medium and high software implementation projects. The Business Systems Analyst will work with clients to understand their financial technology needs and identify opportunities to improve the document output for their end clients. You will solicit, understand, and document business requirements, processes and workflows developing both written and visual depictions of requirements and process flows.

You will work closely with business stakeholders to ensure the integration of business and functional requirements into plans.

Key Responsibilities:
Work independently with minimal supervision, establish priorities, and use strong communication, analytical and problem solving skills to add value to each project,

 Data mapping, logic and business rules

Complete a handover to development including well documented and clearly defined requirements that satisfy client business needs Assume an ownership role, on behalf of the client to ensure deliverables meet business/end-user requirements Build and maintain positive working relationships by effectively communicating and sharing knowledge with your team/peers Continuously enhance knowledge/expertise in own area and keep current with leading-edge technologies trends/developments and develop expertise in analytical tools and techniques that can contribute to effective solution development/delivery Scope change requests (add, change, move requests) Assist with enforcing project goals and direction in order to support the strategic business objectives Ability to take ownership and lead by example Travel 25%

Strong analytical, problem-solving, negotiation, and decision-making skills; able to evaluate information gathered from multiple sources, reconcile conflicts, and decompose high-level information into requirements.
Excellent communication skills (both written and verbal) with the ability to adjust communication style to present technical and non-technical information to a wide variety of clients with differing levels of knowledge.

Ability to create requirements document in an environment with some ambiguity or unknowns and get them signed off
Strong ability to work independently and meet project timelines, and drive stakeholders to delivering within determined timelines

As part of the hiring process at Doxim, job candidates MUST complete The Predictive Index® Behavioral and Cognitive Assessments. Please set aside 5-10 minutes for the Behavioural Assessment completion, although you have unlimited time to complete the assessment once it is started. The Predictive Index Behavioral Assessment does not measure intelligence, education or experience. It simply measures work and communication needs. Please use the link provided to take the assessment.

https://assess.predictiveindex.com/zPE96

Once you have completed the Predictive Index Behavioural Assessment you will be sent an email containing a link to complete The Predictive Index® Cognitive Assessment. The Cognitive Assessment is a timed assessment that includes Verbal, Numerical and Abstract Reasoning questions. Respondents are instructed to answer as many questions as possible in the allotted 12 minutes. The score of the PI Cognitive Assessment is a scaled score based on the number of correct responses and is a measure of general cognitive ability, or the ability to quickly learn and grasp new information. Please set aside 12 uninterrupted minutes for completion and complete within 48 hours. The Predictive Index Cognitive Assessment does not measure intelligence, education or experience. It simply measures a person’s capacity to learn, adapt and grasp new concepts.

Doxim company encourages applications from all qualified individuals. Applicants with disabilities may notify us of any accommodations needed to support your participation in the recruitment process. We wish to thank all applicants for their interest and effort in applying. Please be aware that only candidates selected for interviews will be contacted for this position.

The AML System Analyst is accountable for providing data management support within AML This support includes maintenance of the following data related inventories: a) Data Intake and pipeline, Inventory of Data sources, inventory of Balance and Control coverage, and inventory of data management dashboard users. The role requires working with various stakeholders from AML Financial Investigations Unit (FIU), AML Model Management, AML Compliance, AML Project Management, and Technology & Operations, to ensure important and mandatory data is available to AML for monitoring & regulatory compliance.
Key Accountabilities
Creating and maintaining a data request intake and pipeline to track data requirements and progress.

The ability to drill down to understand key/critical data elements, where and how they are used within AML.
Work within AML to understand data requirements and pipeline in the context of AML’s strategic vision and planning.
Work with project teams to communicate AML needs and requirements with respect to data acquisition, quality and availability.
Ensure quality of deliverables through user acceptance testing and ongoing production quality assurance.
Coordinate with T&O and end users on post implementation testing to ensure smooth project implementation.
.

ABOUT VEGA
Vega is a high-growth, natural health food and supplement company on Profit Magazine’s Profit 100 list of fastest growing companies the last five years with a passion for people. Our premium, award-winning brand is at the forefront of the plant-based, whole food revolution. Vega has been named one of the Best Workplaces in Canada and has been recognized as one of the Best Workplaces for Women. We honor a triple bottom line approach to business placing emphasis on people, planet and performance. Join a great team atmosphere with a driven, vivacious group of people.

OVERVIEW
An exciting and challenging position exists as a Business Intelligence (BI) Analyst at Vega’s head office in Burnaby, BC. In this role, you will be responsible for ongoing corporate reporting across several data sources. Reporting includes measuring and monitoring our brands and relevant competitors’ performance through in-depth analysis of large amounts of data using a data warehouse, syndicated databases and reporting tools. As part of the BI team, the analyst will work cross-functionally with Sales, Marketing, and Finance to assist with forecasting, promotional assessment, and preparation of presentations for multiple uses. The BI Analyst will provide support to senior leadership on projects such as pricing, customer presentations, market trends, & promotional analysis.

You take customer service seriously, but still have fun at work with your Vega team. You show initiative in everything you do and are always looking for ways to improve. You are open to new ideas, and you know that feedback from others helps you grow and allows you to thrive. As a performance-driven individual, you create solutions for your team and show up every day ready for a new adventure. You believe in contributing to culture – not just talking about it – and you live (and love) the Vega culture: health, fitness, and striving for always better.

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES
Be the expert in syndicated and point-of-sale (POS) sales data for Vega (IRI, SPINS, Nielsen, Stackline, RetailLink)
Timely and accurate pulling of ongoing corporate reporting data, manipulation via Excel, and publishing of reports
Analyze, with high accuracy, large datasets in order to report on trends in both Vega and our competitors’ products
Work with the sales, marketing, and finance teams to assist on promotion assessments, customer performance, and recommendations
Work with IT to make improvements in our data warehouse and develop reports and dashboards in Tableau that will highlight trends and provide visualizations to be used by senior management as well as customer facing presentations
Assist in creating monthly presentations specific to market trends and customer performance
Educate the marketing, sales, and finance teams on customer and market trends through monthly presentations
May be required to assist in other areas not specifically outlined in this job description
SKILLS AND QUALIFICATIONS
Undergraduate degree preferred
2-3 years of CPG or Category Management experience will be considered a strong asset
Experience in data analysis & marketing analytics
Experience working with syndicated POS data is preferred (IRI, SPINS, Nielsen, Stackline and RetailLink)
Strong Microsoft Excel and Powerpoint knowledge a must
Experience with reporting tools, Tableau experience a strong asset
Ability to effectively communicate complex ideas to internal stakeholders across sales, marketing, and finance
Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written
Strategic thinking skills
Detail oriented, highly organized, and able to work independently
VEGA Must-Haves

You have an unrelenting desire to achieve
The outdoors isn’t just the place between your car and house
You have a sense of humor and passion for health and wellness
You love to have fun, but take your responsibilities seriously
You live the Vega brand
Benefits of Working for VEGA

Competitive compensation plan
Open Book Management
Annual Bonuses
Alternative refreshment options that go beyond coffee
On-site kitchen with in-house Vegan Chef offering plant-based food and snacks
An optional plant-based lunch program
In-house gym and meditation room
Dogs in the office – Woof!
Bi-Monthly product to try so that you can perform at your best and promote the Vegatopian lifestyle
MSP – 100% coverage
Employee assistance program (EAP)
Flexible Extended Health/Dental Plan
Green Transit incentives
Referral bonus program incentive
Fitness Subsidy
Employer matching RRSP Program
Education Fund
Let your journey begin!

If you smiled and are motivated by this posting, we want to hear from you. Send us your application at careers@myvega.com with “Business Intelligence (BI) Analyst” on the subject line and let your journey begin!

About Us
At the City of Kamloops, we are focused on creating the highest levels of service excellence, based on an organization-wide community culture that celebrates the employees who make it all happen. We offer many advantages including ongoing training and professional development opportunities, coupled with exceptional benefits, all in the beautiful natural setting of the BC Interior. Kamloops provides abundant recreational possibilities for residents and visitors alike, as well as education and culture opportunities and activities.

Title
Finance Analyst (Temporary, Full-Time)
Job ID
1499 (External)
Pay Class
Salary
Days of Work
Monday to Friday
Hours of Work
8:00 a.m. - 4:00 p.m. (Summer) 8:30 a.m. - 4:30 p.m. (Winter)

Position Overview
Please note that this is a temporary position until approximately April 30, 2020, or return of incumbent. Performs skilled accounting and clerical tasks of a relatively complex nature under the limited supervision of a Finance Supervisor or Manager. The incumbent is responsible for exercising judgment in matters of technical detail and maintaining the confidentiality of all corporate information, while exercising courtesy and diplomacy in explaining procedures and policies and communicating effectively to members of the public and staff. The work generally involves preparing and analyzing financial information such as business analytics, supporting the development and analysis of business cases, ad-hoc reports and analysis, providing information for cash forecasting, and preparing correspondence and answering inquiries. Errors are not easily detected and could result in the provision of incorrect information to staff or members of the public. The incumbent acts as a liaison between the Corporate Services Department and other staff or members of the public and provides assistance and training as required. The incumbent must be self-motivated, take initiative, and work independently. A high degree of organizational skills for determining work routines is required. Occasional pressures of volume of work and deadlines may occur on the job.

Responsibilities
Assists Finance Coordinators and other stakeholders in financial matters including budgets and various finance projects. 2. Prepares and provides information and interpretation of City finance procedures to internal and external customers.
Verifies documents and records for completeness and accuracy, identifies and investigates discrepancies, and takes corrective action when necessary.
Checks and verifies source data for entry into accounting records and assists with and completes the maintenance and reconciliation of several complex subledger accounts across all finance departments.
Assist with problem solving and makes recommendations regarding changes to the accounting system and procedures.
Reviews and verifies general ledger, project, and budget variance reports to ensure they are in balance and the information is accurate and complete.
Prepares individual account and project reconciliations from the general ledger and applicable subledgers as requested.
Prepares various financial reports and statistical returns for government agencies and other City departments, including monthly, quarterly, and year-end working papers for the annual audit.
Proactively identifies opportunities to enhance operational reporting and organizational understanding of various financial conditions.
Prepares journal entries and works with data to create inter-departmental charges.
Creates, reviews, and updates process documents as required to existing and new departmental processes.
Performs accounting related to assets, including the recording of additions, disposals, and amortization.
Assists and provides input into the set-up and maintenance of accounting systems, business units, and object codes.
Assists in the coordination of accounting programs such as corporate purchasing cards, work orders, grant allocations, capital resource allocations, collections, etc.
Assists in researching, testing, troubleshooting, and documenting set-up changes and upgrades of various financial software packages.
Provides training for managers and staff in the use of various financial software applications, processes, and procedures.
Provides relief for various Finance Analyst and Finance Coordinator positions in the Corporate Services Department, which may involve working at other City locations.
Performs related duties as required.
Requirements

REQUIRED SKILLS, ABILITIES, AND KNOWLEDGE
Considerable knowledge of financial accounting practices and department regulations and procedures.
Considerable knowledge of financial and accounting software for the purpose of performing testing, training others, and integrating other software programs used by municipal organizations.
Considerable knowledge of the operation and use of office equipment such as calculators, computers, printers, photocopiers, etc.
Ability to interpret and understand data and produce journal entries as required.
Ability to maintain sustained attention to detail.
Ability to interpret legislative and legal documentation as applicable to work.
Ability to deal tactfully and diplomatically with the public and members of staff.
Ability to tailor communications effectively across multiple levels of the organization both verbally and in writing.


PREFERRED TRAINING, EXPERIENCE, ETC.
Accounting designation - Chartered Professional Accountant (CPA).
Previous experience in document and records management, large enterprise resource programs (ERP), and public sector work, including working with software applications.
Previous experience with municipal financial and accounting processes.
Previous supervisory experience.


REQUIRED EDUCATION, CERTIFICATES, EXPERIENCE, ETC.
Completion of senior secondary school or its equivalent.
Completion of a business-focused degree from an accredited university or post secondary institution, including the completion of management accounting, financial accounting, statistical, and economic courses.
Completion of computer courses or experience in advanced Word and Excel as demonstrated through testing. 60% pass rate required.
Minimum two years’ previous accounting experience that includes ensuring compliance with policies and procedures and working with electronic applications and software programs.
Experience in advanced alphanumeric data entry skills as demonstrated through testing.

job_description:
TemporaryThe Salvation Army is an international Christian church. Its message is based on the Bible; its ministry is motivated by love for God and the needs of humanity.

Mission Statement

The Salvation Army exists to share the love of Jesus Christ, meet human needs and be a transforming influence in the communities of our world.

Core Values

The Salvation Army Canada and Bermuda has four core values:

Hope: We give hope through the power of the gospel of Jesus Christ.
Service: We reach out to support others without discrimination.
Dignity: We respect and value each other, recognizing everyone’s worth.
Stewardship: We responsibly manage the resources entrusted to us.

Position Purpose summary: The purpose of this role is to provide expertise in research, data management and analytics for prospective donors and volunteers and ensure timely and accurate implementation of gathered research and analysis of its significant donor database. The Data and Research Analyst will provide support to staff and volunteers engaging in fundraising activities in the area of prospect management towards donor identification, research, cultivation, solicitation and stewardship for The Salvation Army Ontario Central East Division for individual major giving ($100,000) and principal giving ($5MM+).
Responsibilities
Prospect Research


Conducts biographical and financial research on major and transformative donor prospects (individuals, corporations, and foundations) using online resources and reference materials
Prepares written profiles and briefing materials on these prospects, making recommendations for engagement for the identified capital and program needs of ministry units.
Actively participate in prospect clearance to ensure coordinated and collaborative approaches within the division and within the territory.
Pipeline Development


Develop a pipeline of 120 potential funding partners; identifying transformative donors ($5MM+) to build an additional $100,000,000 in potential revenue in Major Gifts in less than five years.
Initiate and manage projects related to the analysis of internal and external data, and provide conclusions, recommendations, and information to inform data-driven decisions.
Deliver value-added information and analysis that supports campaign efforts by developing and implementing analytic data models to inform fundraising and campaign initiatives.
Strategy Development and Ministry Unit Relationships


Analyze individual wealth indicators, including salary, stock, real estate and other assets, to determine overall financial capacity and solicitation potential including interpreting liquidity events and their relevance to solicitation strategies and timing.
Develops, implements and manages systems and procedures to ensure donor strategies and prospect moves management processes are appropriately documented within the Raiser’s Edge system.
Database System


An understanding of fundraising CRM (Raiser’s Edge NXT), tracking all funder engagement in the system.
Update and track all prospect information, assignments and engagement within Raiser’s Edge NXT.
Qualifications
Undergraduate degree, Post-secondary degree with a Master’s in Library and Information Science required (MLIS)
MBA, CFRE, preferred
Minimum of 5 years prior related experience in research and prospect management, with demonstrated mastery in the collection, analysis, interpretation and evaluation of information.
Demonstrated track record of project management and problem-solving. Ability to organize, manage, prioritize and multi-task a diverse range of assignments and projects with high efficiency, accuracy and timeliness.
Knowledge of Raiser’s Edge or fundraising CRM preferred.
Exhibit a positive attitude with a demonstrated ability to be adaptable to change by focusing on solutions and identifying opportunities for improvement.
Familiarity with fundraising CRMs and prospect research tools (e.g. iWave, LexisNexus, DonorSearch, PRO, SEDAR and SEDI, CRA). Understand basic financial principals including corporate financial reports, securities and private company valuations.
Exemplary computer, information management and data retrieval skills. Expertise with a variety of analytical and database software, including Excel, Access. Strong understanding of data mining and predictive modeling tools and techniques.
Experience using data visualization packages, dashboards and business intelligence solutions. Ability to present information in formal and informal settings and impart understanding of complex ideas to others, connecting the science of research with the art of relationship building.
Discretion and confidentiality required.

A clear Criminal Record Check
Participate in our online Armatus Abuse Training and Health and Safety training required upon hiring, as well as updated annually
