Business Process Analyst

Reporting to the Vice President of Information Technology(VPIT), the Business Process Analyst is responsible for identifying and improving the outcomes of operational processes to increase efficiency and customer satisfaction as well as reducing cost. The candidate will also be responsible for leading continuous improvement initiatives for all departments in the organization, as well as evaluating, planning and implementing the improvements in the business processes and practices. Other aspects of the job include group facilitation, compiling and tracking data,preparing training materials and documenting processes.

The Business Process Analyst must be prepared to explain and defend any proposed changes to the current system.

Responsibilities
Identify, plan and implement key projects to improve quality, reduce cost, increase productivity and improve cycle time by reducing wasted time, scrap, rework, etc. resulting in significant business improvement and customer satisfaction.
Identify and facilitate process improvement projects, training/workshops to drive cultural change
Drive value stream mapping to define “As-Is Analysis” and the transition to Future State
Develop and conduct compliance audits, program evaluations and reviews to drive results with the fortitude to ensure change is permanent
Provide executive management with project status updates, feedback, and appropriate reporting on key responsibilities and objectives.
Receives input and coordination of information from various parties, and prepares and presents such information for management review.
Strong understanding of Continuous Improvement concepts, principles and practices.
Job requires a willingness to lead, take charge, and offer opinions and direction.
Support/change management plans and training plans to ensure new processes are implemented in an optimal fashion, supporting the organization through the various stages of change.
Work with the training department to develop training programs for the broader team related to the tools and solutions created.
Participate in training facilitation of key process enhancements where applicable.
Qualifications
Bachelor’s degree preferably in Industrial Engineering from an accredited University
3+ years’ experience in process improvements, cross-functional collaboration and workflow generation
Exceptional communication skills, both verbal and written, problem solving and analytical skills
Strong leadership skills, ability to learn and apply new concepts and overcome obstacles with change
Strong work ethic that is able to work independently but also works well in team environment
Results driven with an ability to effectively multi-task in a fast-paced environment
Experience in Six Sigma, Reengineering or other Continuous improvement methodologies would be an asset
Technical Competencies
Advanced knowledge of Microsoft word, excel ,Visio and ERP applications
Lean Six Sigma Organizational training and certification would be an asset.

What can you expect at Innotech-Execaire Aviation Group :

Competitive Salary, full benefit plan, RRSP, reduced gym membership, free parking,
and a great dynamic team!

job_title: Analyste intelligence d’affaires des TI / IT Business Intelligence Analyst
Sales Operations and Incentive Compensation Analyst
job_description:
The Sales Operations and Incentive Compensation Analyst is responsible for: (1) supporting the administration and analysis of the sales incentive compensation programs including calculation, reporting, and documentation administration; (2) general month end accounting and internal control monitoring; (3) Performance to Quota tracking; and (4) preparation of key metrics and analysis on sales reps, territory and regional performance to support informed decision making by Division and Canada leadership. This individual must serve as a contributing member of the Finance team while championing Stryker’s Mission and Values.
Responsibilities
Individual Responsibilities:
Proactively collaborates with internal teams/departments to promote a culture of inclusiveness and cooperation.
Work with the business to establish a clear understanding of products, sales channels, key accounts, marketing and selling strategies.
Consistently meets service delivery expectations based on input from the business.
Responsible to live and exemplify Stryker’s Values: Integrity, Accountability, People, and Performance.
Functional Responsibilities:
Provides supports to Sales Compensation team, accurately calculating incentive compensation payments and accruals.
Performs regular analysis and audit of information to ensure accuracy and data integrity with outside third-party provider, FORMA.
Manages Danube sales alignment tool to ensure customer, sales rep, sub-territory and territory configuration in Danube is aligned with FORMA.
Maintains and communicates the compensation calendar of events to ensure timelines are consistently met.
Prepare journal entries for monthly commissions and sales rep bonuses.
Responsible for FORMA ticket management system, dealing with HR, Sales Rep, RSM, BUD, Customer Service, Sales and Marketing teams on validating tickets related to:
Customer Alignment
Payment Issues
Payout Adjustments
Reporting Issues
New Employee set-up
Set-up and maintenance of quotas, change processing and PTQ report troubleshooting for all Divisions.
Validate monthly PTQ and FORMA dashboards display accurate PTQ calculations. Troubleshoot discrepancies working with BU and Forma to resolve.
Gather annual award measurement criteria from BU. Work with Forma to ensure proper measurement of metrics for awards is setup and produced for BU review and approval prior to deadline.
Assist in the modeling and roll-out of the annual sales compensation plans for each Division.
Able to conduct sophisticated and creative analysis of complex data and translate the results into actionable deliverables, messages and reports.
Identify opportunities to use proprietary datasets and external company data to extract valuable insights and present these findings to key stakeholders, along with useable data to execute.
Seek out areas of operational improvement and recommend and own the development of more efficient and automated portfolio management and support.
Works with Financial Compliance team to maintain annual Sarbanes Oxley program and audit of internal controls.
Responsible for ad-hoc analysis and information requests from business unit leaders.
Other duties as assigned.
Conduct & Compliance
Abide by and support the policies set forth in the Stryker Code of Conduct.
Understand that compliance with the Code of Conduct, as it may be amended by Stryker Corporation from time to time, is a condition of continued employment with Stryker.
Conduct work in compliance with all laws, rules, and regulations and in accordance with Stryker’s high ethical standards.
Report any violations of these policies and procedures to Stryker management or in the manner outlined in Stryker’s Ethics Hotline Policy.
Knowledge & Skill Requirements
Strong Microsoft Excel skills (designing, building and maintaining files) and analytical mindset.
Good understanding of accounting principles, procedures and their applications.
Knowledge of compensation planning and processes including modelling compensation programs.
Capable of analyzing and resolving complex accounting issues of a broad scope using independent judgment.
Strong organizational skills with a proven ability to handles multiple priorities and manage projects to timely conclusion.
Strong written and oral communication skills.
Excellent interpersonal skills; comfortable dealing with all levels of management and maintaining relationships with divisional personnel.
Strong initiative, ownership, and attention to detail.
Possess the ability to think ‘outside the box’ in relation to process improvement and data integrity.
Education & Qualifications
Degree required, Business, Finance or Human Resources preferred.
Interested in completing a professional designation such as Certified Sales Compensation Professional (CSCP)
Minimum 2 to 3 years of experience in sales compensation plan design and commission analysis or sales operations is required
Internal applicants with an equivalent combination of education, experience and performance over time at Stryker will be considered
Work From Home: No
Travel Percentage: None

About Home Experience
HomeX is building the future of Home Services.
Our unique service and technology platform has been engineered to make next generation experiences for both consumers and service providers come to life.
Reinventing our industry requires creating end-to-end solutions. This is why HomeX is combining a managed service network, a technology platform for providers and full service experiences for consumers. Together, these efforts put us in a unique position to deliver differentiated, fresh, simple and highly personalized solutions making dream experiences come true.
Founded in 2016 by industry veterans and headquartered in Chicago, HomeX (Home Experience LLC) is determined to be a positive force and help the industry evolve from the inside, creating, for the first time, value and magical experiences for customers and service providers nationwide.
About the Job
HomeX is seeking a product analyst to become a key member of our team with the desire to do more than just analyze data. At HomeX we believe decision making across the entire organization should be driven by data and as such we are seeking a product analyst that will collaborate directly with our cross-functional teams to drive key strategic initiatives.
Responsibilities include:
Champion: Build a metrics-driven culture within the Tech organization to promote accountability and rigorous decision-making grounded in data
Define: Co-lead the creation of company-wide KPI’s, goals, reporting cadences and tools
Explore: Constantly look for trends and insights to identify future opportunities and provide direction for the overall product roadmap
Collaborate: Be a key member of cross-functional teams to drive various strategic initiatives and present findings, recommendations and progress to senior management
Launch: Partner with initiative owners on launching new products and features including defining success metrics, reporting tools, tracking and testing.
Iterate: Leverage AB testing and analysis to deep dive into the performance of your projects and products, with an eye towards continuous improvement on key product and experience metrics
Voice of the Customer & Competitive Landscape: Establish a deep understanding of competitors, our customer and their needs, evolving your business intuition and the HomeX product the more you learn
Requirements
About You
The right candidate for this role is always looking to push the envelope in creating differentiated experiences, while also being dedicated to operational excellence to ensure we can deliver. We’re looking for someone who can help us transform an industry.
Analyst Athlete: Be comfortable working across all different data types, data tools and cross-functional teams.
Team-Oriented: You excel at collaborating across the company, including with Business, Marketing, and Engineering teams as well as your fellow Product stakeholders.
A Believer: You understand that technology can simplify, delight and enhance our lives and hope to build transformative innovation as part of your career.
A Thought Leader: You bring unique experience to push our thinking and strive to be in the know of the latest and greatest tools of the trade.
Startup Mentality: You thrive in a fast-paced, high-intensity environment where you balance multiple projects and can prioritize your work both short and long term.
Self-starter: You thrive in an ambiguous environment where you have the power to establish your own timelines, process and project plans.
Driven: You are motivated to achieve success both at work and in your personal life.
Forward-Thinking: You are constantly looking for new and better ways to do things. You also follow trends in the market with an interest in what might come next.
Courageous: You think big and aren’t afraid to fail.

Key qualifications:
3 to 5 years experience in a quantitative analysis role at a tech company and/or consulting firm
Advanced SQL skills (bonus if you have Tableau experience)
Advanced knowledge of experimentation and statistical methods
Experience building new databases, testing methods, data standards
Experience leading entrepreneurial efforts, collaborating with cross-functional teams and project management to drive ideas forward.
A passion for the HomeX mission

Our Productivity Stack
Proficiency in the following technologies is desired:
Microsoft SQL Server
Tableau
Microsoft Excel & Powerpoint
G Suite
Slack
Benefits
Why Work With Us?
How many chances will you get to impact an entire, massive industry by building something from the ground up? Working at HomeX means collaborating with experienced, people-first leaders with a clear vision and a track record of success, and the close-knit camaraderie of a team of highly talented and motivated coworkers. It also means working in a fun and positive working environment - we encourage our employees to balance productivity with the need to recharge the batteries. And of course, you get paid pretty well - we offer competitive compensation packages, including performance-based incentives and full health care benefits for full time employees.
HomeX values diversity in the workplace and is an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to providing an inclusive and accessible work environment. We thank all candidates who apply, but only those selected for a personal interview will be contacted. If you request accommodation, please let us know. We will work with you to meet your needs.

As partners in innovation, Tier1 continually engages with our clients and industry partners to help envision the future state of capital markets and bring it to life. Our dynamic team brings together expertise spanning capital markets, product management, technology and other corporate disciplines to ensure our clients can optimize their client relationship data and translate it into greater engagement and efficiency. We deliver the tools, connectivity, and workflows to power collaboration, transparency, and communications between capital markets participants.

In all that we do, we put our clients’ needs first, working closely to proactively address their pain points and help them clear the path toward opportunity, efficiency and profitability.

Technical Business Analyst

We are currently looking for technical business analysts to join our Professional Services team to serve as a Tier1CRM evangelist to a growing list of customers. Our Professional Services team is responsible for all aspects of an implementation from requirements gathering to end user training. As a technical business analyst, you will be involved in all these exciting activities such as: participate in or lead workshops with our customers to gather requirements for their Salesforce & Tier1CRM implementation, configure Salesforce & Tier1CRM solutions to meet those requirements, deploy changes into sandbox and product environments & run training sessions on how to use Tier1CRM products.

Work with project managers to lead workshops with the customers to gather requirements
Recommend solutions to meet customer requirements by leveraging Salesforce & Tier1CRM best practices
Participate or lead efforts to develop and execute testing, training, and documentation
Participate in or lead deployment of Salesforce & Tier1CRM changes to sandboxes or production environments
Assist customers with their data analysis, data migration, and reporting requirements
Analyze root cause of issues to ensure a permanent resolution is implemented
What we look for:

At least 2 – 5 years of experience in a software development company or a bank/investment bank, preferably with CRM experience or Salesforce experience
Salesforce.com Administration Essentials for New Admin (ADM 201) Certification or prior Salesforce work experience
Degree in computer science/engineering/mathematics/business
Excellent oral and written English communication skills
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Ability to explain complex topics in simple terms to project stakeholders
Be able to learn quickly with minimum guidance
Write simple SOQL queries or Apex triggers
Experience working in an agile environment
Knowledge of the capital markets industry
May require up to 25% travel to United States, Europe, APAC
What we offer?

Competitive salary
Career development & growth at Tier1CRM
Health and dental benefits
Corporate discount for Goodlife Fitness
Exciting social & fundraising events (departmental & company wide)
Tier1CRM is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We are committed to equal treatment of all employees without regard to race, national origin, religion, gender, age, sexual orientation, veteran status, physical or mental disability or other basis protected by law

This is an exciting opportunity for an energetic, positive self-starter with an interest in research and advocacy working as a Policy and Research Analyst. This position is for you if you have exceptional time management, organizational and people skills, experience in government relations, public policy or politics, a passion for creativity, and a degree in political science, public administration or equivalent. You are comfortable and competent working with diverse individuals and groups. You thrive in a challenging position and adapt well to change.
The Policy and Research Analyst is a support position shared between the Vaughan Chamber of Commerce and the Newmarket Chamber of Commerce, reporting directly to both Chambers though the Manager of Government Relations and Policy. This individual will play a significant role in coordinating the Chambers' public policy research and development initiatives to further the interests of members. The successful candidate must be aware of current trends and capable of reacting quickly to changes within the business landscape or within York Region. Highly developed communication, relationship building, and conflict resolution skills are required as there will be recurrent interactions with external stakeholders.

Organizational Overview:
The Vaughan Chamber of Commerce is the premier membership and networking association in Vaughan. The VCC proudly represents business from all sectors of the economy including large corporations and small-to-medium enterprises (SMEs). Our core member offerings include facilitated networking, large-scale signature events (Business Achievement Awards, Women's Symposium, Mayor's Luncheon), and exclusive member-to-member products and savings. VCC members also benefit from business leads, learning seminars, professional peer groups, and co-branding opportunities. The VCC is a strong voice on public policy issues of importance to the local business community, such as infrastructure, transportation and opportunities for business growth.
The Newmarket Chamber of Commerce represents the interests of business in a variety of ways, including advocacy and development of public policy. The Chamber offers programs, events, resources and connections to help member companies learn, connect and thrive. It promotes trade and commerce and leverages the skills and knowledge of its network to increase the vibrancy of the Newmarket community.
HOURS: 37.5 hours per week
LOCATION: Vaughan Chamber Office (with travel throughout the area)
REPORTING TO: Manager of Government Relations and Policy

Job Duties:
Conducts background policy research and analysis to support existing projects as well as proposals for new bodies of work; segments and synthesizes research findings to identify and recommend best practices.
Extracts, collects and aggregates data across databases, information sources, survey responses, and other data sources; ensures data quality; cleans and checks exiting data for consistency and accuracy.
Assists in the research, development and implementation of a policy research program that addresses the needs and issues of the membership and addresses the strategic plan objectives.
Assists with researching, analyzing, developing policy positions, papers, briefs, resolutions and other policy communication tools.
Works closely with Manager of Government Relations and Policy to advance public policy positions of interest to the Chambers by building partnerships and coordinating with members, key stakeholder groups, levels of government, and elected officials.
Applies advanced critical thinking skills and experience to conceptualize and define policy challenges and opportunities and recommend innovative policy solutions using the best available evidence.
Helps build community consensus on public policy issues through coordinating workshops and consultations, and represents the Chamber at public policy events.
Assists with one-pagers and topic briefs to support both the Newmarket and Vaughan Chambers' work as a business advocate.
Assists with creating and maintaining a policy manual of Chamber issues, positions and internal policies.
Monitor Municipal and Regional council meetings, community meetings and legislative activity to assess and identify advocacy opportunities for the Chambers.
Assists in coordinating content for Chamber publications, articles and other communications.
Assists in planning and executing media events and briefings.
Assist in the preparation of articles for inclusion in various mediums; prepare speeches, speaking notes, key messages, letters to the editor, etc.
Takes minutes at committee meetings.
Other related duties as assigned.
Core Competencies:
Superior research skills
Strong communicator
Innovation
Negotiating
Networking and relationship building
Strategic and critical thinking
Political aptitude
Requirements:
University degree in Political Science, Public Administration or Policy, Commerce, Business Administration, Journalism, Communications or a related field.
A minimum two years of directly related experience including volunteer work.
Experience working in the not-for-profit sector and/or for a membership-driven organization is desirable but not required.
Highly effective project management, prioritization, multi-tasking, and time management skills to meet deadlines.
Strong portfolio of writing samples required.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills along with proficient computer skills.
Valid driver's license and use of a reliable personal vehicle.
Ability to work well with others, and handle direction and constructive criticism in a positive manner.
Energetic, self-motivated, and results-oriented.
A well-defined sense of diplomacy, including solid negotiation, conflict resolution, and people management skills as well as political and cultural sensitivity.
Strong problem identification and resolution skills.
High level of critical and logical thinking, analysis, and/or reasoning to identify underlying principles, reasons, or facts.
Preference will be given to candidates with regional knowledge and connections.
Must have background in creating and monitoring social media.
Works ethically and with integrity; follows policies and procedure. Maintains a commitment to privacy.
Consistently at work and on time; ensures work responsibilities are covered when absent.
Working Conditions:
Some travel is required.
Ability to attend and conduct presentations; may be outside regular office hours.
Overtime as required
Some event set-up required, including lifting and carrying up to thirty (30) pounds.

job_title: Senior Business Analyst - Group Customer Technology
job_description:
The Senior Business Analyst, Group Customer Technology, is responsible for end-to-end analysis of issues that affect business processes and systems.
This role will respond to issues reported by users and customers that could not be resolved by first level support areas such as the Contact Centre. Initial triage, recommendations and subsequent reporting fall within the incumbent’s scope of responsibility and influence. Having a strong business knowledge contributes to business planning, enhancing the current systems and a decrease in production support issues.
The key measures of success are:
a) focused and quick response to and remediation of reported issues
b) effect support for system enhancements and projects
c) being an effective point of contact who provides timely reporting

Accountabilities:

Continuously devises ways to improve team operations.

job_title: Junior Analyst (Co-op Student), Credit Risk Management
job_description:
CMLS Financial is looking for a motivated self-starter to join our Toronto team as a Junior Analyst (Co-op Student) for the Summer 2019 semester (May-Aug). You will be responsible for assisting in the underwriting of credit applications and submissions, with summaries and recommendations regarding risk assessment for commercial mortgages. We are looking for a talented and dedicated addition to our team – join us!

Job Description:
In this role, you will provide timely and proactive support by:
Conducting appropriate due diligence and investigation to gain solid understanding of the borrower, analyzing and interpreting financial data and credit information, assessing the value of security, and underwriting commercial mortgage presentations and annual reviews within the guidelines of lending policies and procedures
Maintaining ongoing interaction with clients (including performing site visits if applicable) and internal stakeholders to ensure thorough underwriting and funding of the loan
Working as part of a team in the completion of mortgage presentations, meeting pre-funding conditions and third party instructions to meet all funding requirements within tight deadlines
Staying current with market information and commercial mortgage market trends
Performing other duties in keeping with the purpose and accountabilities of the job, such as preparing reports, assisting with compliance-related tasks and completing department projects as assigned
Qualifications:
This role is for you if:
You have a keen interest in working in the Commercial Real Estate industry
You have excellent communication skills, both written and verbal, and are able to work well independently as well as within a team environment
You have experience creating and delivering business presentations and strong technical writing skills
You are very results-driven and possess strong organizational skills with a high attention to detail
You take ownership of your work and demonstrate a high degree of accountability and commitment at all times
You are completing an undergraduate degree in one of the following concentrations: finance, economics, urban land development, accounting or business administration
You are an intermediate to advanced level user of Microsoft Office (Excel, Word, PowerPoint, SharePoint)
You have a passion for real estate combined with an understanding of financial and statement analysis
About Us:
We are Canada’s Mortgage Company. Founded in 1974, CMLS Financial is one of Canada’s largest, independently owned mortgage services companies. Over 40 years, 10 000 customers and 20 billion in assets. Business is booming, which means our employees get valuable exposure, new learning opportunities, and can truly have an impact on our business. We are committed to providing our people with a challenging and rewarding career because our employees set us apart and we know it.

Meet Your Team!
Reporting to the Director, Credit Risk Management, you will be joining a hardworking and dynamic team of Analysts, Risk Managers and Originators. At CMLS Financial, our Analysts love the versatility that the role affords:

“I like my job because I have had the chance to work on a variety of different asset classes and loan types. CMLS’ unique collection of investor relationships allows analysts to formulate a deep understanding of the Canadian mortgage market and provides a chance to establish relationships with a variety of stakeholders. Using these investor relationships, I have had the chance to learn how to structure debt, tailored to the investor and borrower needs.” –Analyst, Credit Risk Management

We Want to Hear From You!
If you are confident that you would be a strong asset to our team, submit both a cover letter and resume, along with your academic transcripts today! We thank all applicants for their time in applying, however we will only contact those selected for an interview. Consideration of applications will begin immediately and continue until the position is filled.

Why join the Metrie Team?
Since 1926, Metrie Canada has been a leading manufacturer and distributor of interior finishings. We are a family-owned and private company with multiple locations across North America, striving to inspire designers, architects and homeowners. Our dedication to creating high-quality, finely crafted architectural elements has helped us grow to become the largest supplier and manufacturer of solid wood and composite moulding in North America.

We strive to be a talent-advantaged organization. As a member of the Metrie team, you'll see attainable goals that call upon your talents and skills. Metrie offers a great mix of total rewards for your contributions and exciting opportunities to collaborate with smart and passionate colleagues. Come join our team and help us continue our history of success!

What will you be doing as an IT Support Analyst?
Based out of our distribution office in Milton, ON, the IT Support Analyst reports to the Director, IT Operations. S/he will be a key member of a high-performance IT Operations team including other Business Analysts and the IT Infrastructure team. Additionally, s/he will be responsible for working effectively with IT vendors who provide outsourced IT services and support including the IT Service Desk, data center operations, WAN monitoring and management, network infrastructure support, and mobility services.

The IT Support Analyst is an IT generalist whose primary role is to deliver responsive, stable, secure, and cost-effective IT support services to the Metrie business. S/he will be responsible for:
On-site and remote IT support operations at various Metrie branch locations (ie. Tier-2 support) within a specified region; in this case, Central and Eastern Canada based out of Milton, Ontario.
Working with the Metrie IT Service Desk (ie. Tier-1), the Business Systems Group (ie. Tier-3 and core infrastructure support teams (ie. Tier-4) to ensure IT service issues are logged, managed, and resolved effectively – while tracking performance versus established targets; and,
Leading and / or supporting various IT projects in the annual IT plan.
Continual training of Metrie employees to improve IT systems usage, and to reduce repetitive support issues.
Key Accountabilities and Responsibilities
The most critical outcomes for this role are to:
Work effectively with the IT Operations team including IT Service Desk, Business Analysts, and core infrastructure teams to deliver effective IT support services to the Metrie business
Understand Metrie’s core business, and help Metrie employees leverage IT systems to drive business efficiencies and / or effectiveness
Help establish IT priorities – based on business value – that can / should be considered in the development of IT plans
As needed, manage relationships with key IT partners, including outsourcing relationships
Embrace and / or adopt industry best-practices in IT operations and support processes (e.g. ITIL)
Working with the rest of the IT Operations Team, monitor and measure IT operations performance indicators that link to the IT Scorecard and corporate objectives
Travel of up to 25% within Central and Eastern Canada
Professional Qualifications
The education and background experiences desired for this position include:
Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Management Information Systems, or equivalent education and experience
Must be bilingual English/French
Experience providing IT support services in a medium-large organization operating in multiple locations and time zones
Excellent leadership, interpersonal and communication skills
Creative at problem solving, and a disciplined, detailed and diligent approach to IT project management
Passionate about delivering results, and determined to be the best in your field
Technical requirements (nice to have):

Familiarity with the application of ITIL concepts in IT Operations
Experience with Windows, Exchange, Active Directory, Citrix, Printing, and mobile device management at the End User experience level
Experience managing IT vendors that provide outsourced IT services
Experience with IP-based telephony, and collaboration / communications tools (ie. Unified Communications)
How to submit your interest?
To apply for this exciting opportunity at Metrie, please submit your resume and cover letter to our Human Resources team in confidence by clicking the “Apply Now” button below. While we greatly appreciate your interest and application, please be advised that we will only be responding to candidates selected for further consideration.

As part of the hiring process at Doxim, job candidates MUST complete The Predictive Index® Behavioral and Cognitive Assessments. Please set aside 5-10 minutes for the Behavioural Assessment completion, although you have unlimited time to complete the assessment once it is started. The Predictive Index Behavioral Assessment does not measure intelligence, education or experience. It simply measures work and communication needs. Please use the link provided to take the assessment.

https://assess.predictiveindex.com/zPE96

Once you have completed the Predictive Index Behavioural Assessment you will be sent an email containing a link to complete The Predictive Index® Cognitive Assessment. The Cognitive Assessment is a timed assessment that includes Verbal, Numerical and Abstract Reasoning questions. Respondents are instructed to answer as many questions as possible in the allotted 12 minutes. The score of the PI Cognitive Assessment is a scaled score based on the number of correct responses and is a measure of general cognitive ability, or the ability to quickly learn and grasp new information. Please set aside 12 uninterrupted minutes for completion and complete within 48 hours. The Predictive Index Cognitive Assessment does not measure intelligence, education or experience. It simply measures a person’s capacity to learn, adapt and grasp new concepts.

Doxim company encourages applications from all qualified individuals. Applicants with disabilities may notify us of any accommodations needed to support your participation in the recruitment process. Athena Software is hiring a Senior Business Data Analyst to join our expanding team!

Athena makes Penelope, a case management software system for social service agencies and non-profits around the world. We have hundreds of clients on five continents - we estimate that more than 20,000 people use Penelope every day, and that our clients help over 1 million people each year.

About Athena

We are a group of 85, with employees located in Canada, United States, Australia, and the United Kingdom.

Our product is a unique, flexible and comprehensive solution for social service agencies, and this spirit is also reflected in our company culture of collaboration and commitment to community.

At Athena, we promote a team atmosphere, and believe very strongly in fostering a true work / life balance. Our company is owned and run by people with families - we know how important it is to spend time away from the computer and phone, and we hope you feel the same way.

What You’ll Do

As Senior Business Data Analyst, reporting to the Manager of Tailored Services, you will work with Athena Software’s clients and product team to develop common reporting data sets for Athena’s market sectors as well as custom client reports. You will tailor solutions to meet these needs by querying a Penelope (PostgreSQL) database, creating custom views and functions to facilitate updating and designing reports and creating data visualizations and/or data exports in multiple formats.

You gather and document requirements, and provide informed quotes for estimated effort.
You write SQL queries and create visual representations of data in third party tools such as Excel, Tableau, and XML.
You communicate with Athena’s clients regarding process and change requests, understanding the business issues and data challenges of their organization and industry.
You liaise with project and business leaders to interpret analytical requirements.
This position is permanent, full-time, and located in our Waterloo, Ontario headquarters.

Who You Are

You are a problem solver by design; analytical and client-oriented, you possess at least five years related experience in Mathematics, Computer Science, or Programming.

You have experience creating dashboard reports in Tableau (a Tableau certification is preferred).
You have strong knowledge of SQL and relational database management systems, with experience in querying databases with complex relationships between tables.
With outstanding written and verbal communication skills, you are able to succeed in a dynamic, driven environment, trail-blazing creative solutions to complex challenges.
You are able to learn new applications swiftly, independently, and with confidence.
You have expert knowledge of Microsoft Excel.
You have an Undergraduate University Degree or equivalent experience in Mathematics, Computer Science, Data Science or Programming
Does this sound like you? If so, please apply with Resume and Cover Letter to the link provided.

What Douglas Offers
DO what you love. Be good at it. That’s how Douglas College defines a great career. It’s a philosophy that resonates through our classrooms, our offices and our boardrooms. It inspires our students and drives us to make Douglas College one of BC’s Top Employers. We love what we do. And we’re looking for passionate, motivated people to join us in making one of Canada’s best colleges even better.

The Role
The Business Systems Analyst works across departments and teams to scope, to design and deliver enterprise technical solutions that support the business vision of the College. They perform as a solution specialist; they find solutions to business problems by maximizing the use of features in our current technology and minimizing creation of special cases and once-only custom solutions. They focus on gathering requirements and converting this into the architecture and design that will provide the solution. They perform as a technical solution architect pertaining to the College’s enterprise architecture

They perform as a development team lead; as such, they provide guidance to the development team to deliver on the design of the solution. They ensure that the development team delivers the correct solution in a timely manner. They ensure that the designs are reusable and fit in the broader enterprise architecture of the College. They ensure the effective use of internal and external resources.

They provide exceptional client-centered service on a consistent basis to all stakeholder groups.

Responsibilities
1. Provides leadership and supervision to appropriate team members and external resources.
a. Supervises coding and release of code into production. May need to write code when necessary.
b. Applies the BCGEU Collective Agreement to the daily decision-making, including but not limited to scheduling work hours, vacation and overtime.
c. Participates in hiring and evaluations as assigned, including providing orientation and ensuring the provision of appropriate training and professional development.
d. Provides input into staff job descriptions.
e. Manages the work queue, assigns work and manages the velocity of work done.
f. Collaborates with manager to ensure adequate coverage for areas.

2. Designs and leads the delivery of technical solutions to support the College’s business vision.
a. Conducts business analysis planning and monitoring.
b. Performs requirement gathering, management and analysis.
c. Collaborates across departments and teams to develop Application solutions.
d. Facilitates workshops to gather both functional and technical requirements.
e. Develops documentation of plans and designs from interviews with users.
f. Researches and analyzes existing practices and procedures.
g. Creates test plans and conducts system testing.

job_title: Project and Procurement Analyst - 1 Year Contract
job_description:
ContractQuestrade Technology Group (QTG) acts as the back-bone for Questrade. They act as strategic partners with each business unit to help Questrade leverage technology to gain competitive advantage. The team is comprised of very skilled, very committed individuals working collaboratively. They collectively create a unique work environment that is fast-paced and challenging, but also very open and supportive. So are they the serious, geeky-types? No way! Fun, freedom, flexibility is how QTG members describe the work culture here.

And where does the Project and Procurement Analyst fit into this?
The purpose of the Project and Procurement Analyst is to assist in every aspect of PMO (Project Management Office) tasks and projects as well as providing support to planning, execution and closure of projects within prescribed timelines and in accordance with Questrade’s business requirements. In addition, this role will provide day to day support to procurement and vendor management function at Questrade.

Are YOU our next Project and Procurement Analyst? You are if...

?You have are proficient in data analysis using Excel including PowerQuery and PowerPivot (expertise with PowerBI is a great advantage)

?You have experience in the financial services industry and having knowledge of types of investment products.
?You have strong interpersonal, communication and documentation skills
?You have understanding of business, data, process, and object-oriented analysis and modeling techniques.
?You have knowledge of requirements management, the software development lifecycle, QA methodologies and Agile, Scrum and Kanban.
?You have good familiarity with MS Office tools such as Word and PowerPoint
?You are comfortable with drawing diagrams using MS Visio
?You are familiar with project implementation methodologies and project management
?You have basic understanding of web technologies

Inventory Cost Analyst
Fort Garry Industries is a leading Distributor of Aftermarket Heavy Duty Truck and Trailer Parts and Service, Trailers and Equipment. Established in 1919, Fort Garry Industries operates 16 locations from Ontario to British Columbia. Fort Garry is a dynamic, growing organization dedicated to providing great Customer Service in a positive work environment.
We are looking for hard working, courteous and motivated individuals who can work in a fast- paced environment. We offer competitive wages, a comprehensive benefit plan including employer funded DPSP Program.
Fort Garry has an opening for a Full-Time Inventory Cost Analyst in our Winnipeg Corporate Office. Reporting to the Purchasing Manager, the Inventory Cost Analyst is responsible for the management and upkeep of Fort Garry Industries’ Supplier price files and contract pricing.
As the Inventory Cost Analyst, you will be responsible for assisting with the handling of the day-to-day inventory cost processes including a timely review of conditions that require price changes, update and review supplier price files, and troubleshoot and resolve acquisition price issues.
Duties & Responsibilities
Assist in managing and implementing all supplier price files and updating in FGI system.
Manage and prioritize large volumes of information from suppliers regarding up-coming price changes, surcharges and tariffs.
Format vendor price files and ensure pricing data base is accurate and contains required fields before uploading
Responsible for basic pricing analysis. Must be able to conduct accurate and independent analysis in a timely matter. Determine impact of new price files or quotes and report to Pricing and Purchasing Managers
Communicate impact of price file changes to Inventory group and Buyers.
Work closely with suppliers to confirm correct program, discounts and price file formats
Review daily cost exception reports for accuracy and work closely with suppliers to resolve any discrepancies.
Address pricing-related inquiries from several sources, such as buyers and managers
Work on pricing and purchasing related projects as assigned
Qualifications, Education and/or Experience
Previous office experience and the implementation of price files an asset
Understanding of general business practices including external factors that impact the business, industry, product strategy and pricing.
Demonstrated proficiency with Microsoft Office Suite, especially Excel (V-lookups, Pivot Tables, etc.)
Strong analytical and communications skills, both written and verbal
Effective problem-solving skills are vital in this role
Previous experience with manipulating and analyzing large amounts of data
Be able to communicate effectively to suppliers and internal customers over the phone and email
Good time management skills to ensure assigned responsibilities are completed in an efficient manner; able to work independently
Able to handle a multitude of tasks and work in a fast-paced environment
Other Duties as assigned

Under the guidance of the Customer Sales Director, and in close collaboration with customer Business Development Managers (BDM)-Walmart, the Sales Analyst is responsible for providing analytic and insight support to deliver the joint business plan goals. Areas of focus are consumption and share development, retail margin tracking, pre & post promotion analysis, major event management, and competitive monitoring & response proposals. The Sales Analyst works collaboratively with business partners including sales strategy, sales operations, replenishment, retail development and key customer contacts to proactively manage the implementation and monitoring of customer sales plans. The ideal candidate thrives in a fast paced, energetic, and highly interdependent work environment.

Report and analyze on planned vs. volume variances by utilizing trade event analysis reporting
Propose display assortment and quantities based on sales fundamentals and store cluster analysis, to improve customer acceptance and maximize sales potential

Lead communication and coordination with Retail Development and Replenishment to evaluate and improve in-store conditions, item availability, planogram and secondary display compliance for our brands
Ensure 100% accuracy of new store opening executions
Ensure new product plans are flawlessly implemented, distribution objectives and speed to floor are met, with appropriate performance metrics and tracking in place

Working knowledge of AC Nielsen products, facts, and tools

_______________________________________________________________________________
Analyste des Ventes – Wal-Mart (contrat de 6 mois)
Sous la supervision du directeur – Ventes auprès des clients, et en étroite collaboration avec les chefs du développement commercial, l’analyse des ventes fournit du soutien en matière d’analyse et de perspectives afin de contribuer à l’atteinte des objectifs du plan commercial commun. Ses domaines prioritaires sont la croissance de la consommation et de la part de marché, le suivi des marges de détail, l’analyse préalable et subséquente des promotions, la gestion des événements importants, et la présentation de proposition pour surveiller la concurrence et y réagir. L’analyste des ventes travaille en collaboration avec les partenaires des équipes des Stratégies de vente, des Opérations des ventes, de l’Approvisionnement et du Développement des ventes au détail et les représentants clés des clients afin de gérer de façon proactive la mise en œuvre et le suivi des plans de vente des clients. Le candidat recherché est efficace dans un milieu de travail dynamique, énergique et très interdépendant.
Analyse commerciale
Participe à l’élaboration, à l’exécution et au suivi du plan commercial commun du client
Établit un lien entre les données sur les points de vente du client, les données de Nielsen et d’autres données groupées afin de repérer des occasions ratées et de proposer des mesures correctrices
Fait l’analyse comparative des promotions des concurrents et en magasin de façon continue
Travaille en collaboration avec les chefs du développement commercial et l’équipe des Stratégies de vente afin de mettre en œuvre des idées qui améliorent la compétitivité en magasin
Fait l’analyse de la clientèle afin de soutenir au besoin les initiatives des équipes des Stratégies de vente, des Ventes nettes et de la Logistique client
Analyse de la planification des promotions
Évalue les occasions saisonnières pour les activités en magasin afin d’assurer la présence optimale des produits de PSS
Analyse les écarts entre le volume prévu et le volume réel et les présente en utilisant des rapports d’analyse des événements commerciaux
Propose diverses options de présentoirs et de quantités reposant sur des principes de vente de base et une analyse de groupes de magasins afin d’améliorer l’acceptation par le client et de maximiser le potentiel de vente
Assume la responsabilité des analyses subséquentes aux promotions et fournit des commentaires et des recommandations, notamment sur le RCI, à des fins de planification future
Effectue des analyses des prix de détail et propose des ajustements, s’il y a lieu
Travaille de près avec les partenaires des équipes du Développement des ventes au détail et de l’Approvisionnement afin de s’assurer que les plans de promotion sont parfaitement mis en œuvre
Conditions en magasin
Supervise les communications et la coordination avec les partenaires des équipes du Développement des ventes au détail et de l’Approvisionnement afin d’évaluer et d’améliorer les conditions en magasin, la disponibilité des articles, le planogramme et la conformité des présentoirs secondaires pour nos marques
Vérifie si les ouvertures de nouveaux magasins sont exécutées de manière entièrement conforme
S’assure que les plans pour les nouveaux produits sont parfaitement exécutés, que les objectifs de distribution et de vitesse de placement de l’entrepôt à l’étagère sont atteints et que des paramètres de rendement assortis d’un suivi sont en place.
Exigences
Baccalauréat en administration des affaires ou dans un domaine connexe et au moins 2 ans d’expérience en analyse de produits de consommation courante ou de vente au détail
Solide esprit d’analyse et connaissance des principes de base de la vente au détail
Grande expérience en création d’analyses et de rapports ponctuels et capacité à intégrer des données provenant de diverses sources dans des propositions cohérentes s’appuyant sur des données
Aptitudes démontrées pour la résolution de problèmes et attitude axée sur l’amélioration continue à long terme
Solides aptitudes organisationnelles, sens des priorités, capacité à accomplir simultanément plusieurs tâches et à équilibrer plusieurs priorités et projets afin de respecter des échéances
Solides aptitudes en communication écrite et verbale et capacité à présenter des recommandations claires et succinctes
Capacité démontrée à travailler efficacement en équipe et excellentes aptitudes interpersonnelles
Personne motivée faisant preuve de maturité professionnelle, d’énergie et de passion dans un environnement en évolution rapide
Maîtrise de divers logiciels de Microsoft et aptitude à apprendre des nouvelles applications
Connaissance pratique des produits, des données et des outils d’AC Nielsen

$39 an hourPosition: Crime Analyst II – Training Opportunity (Permanent, Full-Time)
Closing Date: March 22, 2019

About Us
At the City of Kamloops, we are focused on creating the highest levels of service excellence, based on an organization-wide community culture that celebrates the employees who make it all happen. We offer many advantages including ongoing training and professional development opportunities, coupled with exceptional benefits, all in the beautiful natural setting of the BC Interior.

Kamloops is Canada’s Tournament Capital, a family and business-friendly community committed to providing great customer service, enhancing community partnerships, and supporting economic growth. Our 700 employees provide customer services and programs to a local and regional population of 125,000 people. Kamloops provides abundant recreational possibilities for residents and visitors alike, as well as education and culture opportunities and activities.

Title
Crime Analyst II -Training Opportunity (Permanent, Full-Time)

Job ID
1493 (External)

Pay Class
Salary

Days of Work
Monday to Friday

Hours of Work
8:00 a.m. - 4:00 p.m.

Position Overview
Crime Analyst II - TRAINING OPPORTUNITY

Applicants must have the following prerequisites:
Completion of senior secondary school or its equivalent.
Completion of a Bachelor of Technology in Forensic Investigation, Crime and Intelligence Analysis from British Columbia Institute of Technology OR Completion of a post secondary degree in Social Sciences, Criminal Justice or Criminology and a minimum of one year experience within the last five years in crime and statistical analysis and research.
Completion of post-secondary courses or experience in intermediate Word and intermediate Excel as demonstrated through testing. A 60% pass rate is required.
Minimum of one year experience working in an office environment that includes data entry and administrative duties.
Shortlisted applicants must successfully pass a National Test for Intelligence Analysts administered by the RCMP Intelligence Standards and Program Development (ISPD) Section in order to proceed to the interview stage.
Ability to obtain and maintain RCMP Top Secret Level Security Clearance.


Awarding of Training Opportunity:
To be successful for this training opportunity, senior applicants must meet the above requirements. Applicants are able to participate in a maximum of three training opportunities within the Department.

On-the-Job Experience and Training:
The most senior qualified candidate for this opportunity will be gaining experience towards becoming a fully qualified Crime Analyst II. The exact length of the training opportunity may vary based on the previous experience of the successful candidate and the length of the position, but will be a maximum of two years.

Pay Rate:
The successful applicant for this training opportunity will receive the pay rate of Pay Grade 13 (inside), $38.99 per hour until the full qualifications have been reached. After successful completion of the Training Opportunity, the incumbent will move to a Pay Grade 14 (inside), $39.65.

TRAINING OPPORTUNITY TERMS & CONDITIONS
The City of Kamloops encourages career development and professional growth for its employees. Training postings (including training opportunities and "in-training" postings) allow staff the prospect of moving into an area of the City operations that they may not otherwise have the experience or qualifications to bid into.

To support this, the parties have adopted the following terms and conditions for training postings.
MANAGEMENT/EMPLOYEE RESPONSIBILITIES
City recognizes that there is a joint responsibility for the development and success of the trainee. It is management’s obligation to regularly monitor and assess the trainee’s work to ensure that he/she is completing the requirements of the training. It is the employee’s obligation to meet the commitments of the training posting, attend any training or educational sessions required and to participate in applicable duties at the workplace.
TRAINING TERMS
Training terms may vary in length, based on the amount of experience that the successful qualified applicant brings to the position.
ACCESS TO TRAINING
Employees will be allowed to access a maximum of two of the training types (training opportunity and/or in-training) during their employment with the City. The third training type, apprenticeship, will have a maximum of one opportunity.
Where the situation exists for an employee to pursue multiple opportunities related to a particular career path within a Division, consideration will be given on a case by case by the Employer to waive the access restrictions.
EMPLOYEE COMMITMENTS
Employees must commit to the training term stated on the posting (two years).
After completion of the training term, employees must remain in the position for the commitment term stated on the posting (two years).
For a period of two years after completing the training term, employees (unless they are otherwise employed full time outside of the classification), must accept any vacant shifts that should arise in the classification they have been trained in if that shift remains vacant after a posting or bid meeting process. Any employee who does not fulfill the commitments of a training posting through his/her own actions will not be allowed access to any other training types in the future.
SENIORITY FOR TRAINEES
New employees hired for a training position will not obtain seniority during the training term. If confirmed in the position, seniority will be calculated as per the Collective Agreement and given to the employee at that time.
LAYOFF AND RECALL FOR TRAINEES
The trainee will be laid off before junior, fully qualified incumbents in the classification. The trainee will be recalled last after junior, fully qualified incumbents in the classification.
TRAINEE PROBATIONARY PERIODS
The probationary period for externally hired employees will be equivalent to the training term. As per Article 10(d), the employment of these employees may be terminated at any time during the probation period at the absolute discretion of the employer, provided however, that such discretion is not used in an arbitrary, perverse, or capricious manner.
Employees with seniority who do not fulfill the commitments of a training posting or who are deemed unsuccessful after passing probation will forfeit the right to return to his/her former position but will be allowed to use his/her seniority for one year to bid on another position.
The Union has agreed to consider requests for longer probationary periods based on the length of the training term and/or a trainee's progress.
OVERTIME CALL OUT
In the event of an overtime call out, fully qualified staff will be called first. Trainees may be considered at management’s discretion.
FULLY QUALIFIED CRIME ANALYST II JOB DESCRIPTION

The Crime Analyst II performs complex, highly skilled, specialized research work that involves the application of research techniques to support relatively complex criminal investigative activities, operational programs, and crime reduction strategies under the limited supervision of the Client Support Services Supervisor. The work involves providing statistical, tactical, and strategic crime analysis services to the RCMP and management. The work also involves determining which research methodologies to utilize for each project and assisting in the design and planning of projects relative to specific developments or detailed investigations. The position is responsible for providing statistical information and advice on crime analysis and research to RCMP members and outside agencies. Through specialized research in demographics, crime data, and social issues, the incumbent is responsible for the identification of evolving or existing crime patterns and trends to forecast future crime occurrences and is responsible for presenting these findings to various clients and organizations. The work involves exposure to graphic images of violent offences, crime scenes, and victims of crime. The incumbent is responsible for setting up new databases and advising RCMP members on the methods and techniques of the compilation and extraction of data. The incumbent is responsible for the accuracy and quality of the work and attention to detail as errors are not readily detected or corrected and could cause major loss of service or delays involving operations or investigations. The position requires a considerable degree of judgment, initiative, and discretion in order to implement data collection strategies, interpret a wide variety of data, and produce various analytical products that assist team members in providing operational direction. Frequent deadlines and/or emotional strain are recognized parts of the job. The job involves inside work with very good working conditions. The incumbent is required to exercise considerable courtesy, tact, and diplomacy when dealing with other staff, RCMP members, and external agencies.

Responsibilities
FULLY QUALIFIED CRIME ANALYST II RESPONSIBILITIES
Collects, assembles, analyzes, and interprets a wide variety of investigative and intelligence data to support ongoing investigations.
Reviews police occurrence files to determine immediate crime problems and patterns of criminal activity.
Prepares suspect and victim profiles, suspect lists, maps, and other graphic representations of criminal activity.
Evaluates and validates intelligence information gathered from various closed and open sources, including web-based programs, automated databases, manual files, and electronic devices such as cell phones and tablets.
Develops and maintains comprehensive files, records, and documentation.
Prepares reports and recommendations for implementing strategies to address identified problems and trends.
Trains, coordinates, and organizes the workflow of Crime Analyst Is.
Participates on project teams to monitor and identify the nature and scope of emerging and persistent crime problems, trends, and socio-economic or demographic factors related to the problem and assesses the probability of future crime problems and trends.
Establishes and maintains working relationships with RCMP members, staff, and external agencies.
Provides statistical information and crime analysis and trains RCMP members, staff, and external agencies as a subject matter expert on methods, tools, and techniques for the compilation of data.
Delivers presentations, briefings, and situation reports on crime trends and related matters, and provides court testimony as required.
Provides ongoing recommendations with regard to policies, procedures, and operations, and keeps abreast of developments in the field of crime analysis.
Utilizes a variety of computer systems, database software, and search strategies to generate information.
Assists other staff in performing their duties and performs other job-related duties as required.


Requirements
FULLY QUALIFIED CRIME ANALYSTN II REQUIRED SKILLS, ABILITIES, AND KNOWLEDGE
Thorough knowledge of research, statistical, and analytical principles, practices, procedures, methods, and techniques.
Thorough knowledge of query syntax and retrieval techniques for researching and extracting information from a variety of computer databases, commercial databases, and the Internet to conduct searches for information.
Thorough knowledge of RCMP computer systems (ROSS, CPIC, PRIME, TEAM, JUSTIN, etc.), and basic knowledge or understanding of police investigation techniques.
Thorough knowledge of statutory regulations, federal acts, and the Criminal Code as they relate to the release of information
Thorough knowledge of relevant computer office equipment, applications, and software.
Considerable proficiency in administration procedures and practices.
Ability to analyze information, solve problems, and provide statistical data and crime analysis services.
Ability to provide recommendations with regard to policies, procedures, and operations.
Ability to create and conduct presentations, briefings, and training to RCMP members, staff, and external agencies, including the use of projectors and other audiovisual aids.
Ability to provide court testimony as required.
Strong ability to communicate effectively orally and in writing.
Excellent interpersonal, multi-tasking, and organizational skills.
Ability to stay abreast of developments in the field of crime analysis.
Demonstrated ability to work effectively in a team environment, maintain trust and confidentiality of information at all times, and deal with stressful situations and work under pressure of deadlines.
Ability to exercise independent judgment in performing the duties of the position.
Ability to organize and prioritize workloads.


PREFERRED TRAINING, EXPERIENCE, MEMBERSHIPS, ETC.
Knowledge of the RCMP and departmental regulations and procedures in addition to RCMP terminology.
Previous work experience that includes the interpretation of statutory regulations, federal acts, and the Criminal Code as they relate to the work performed.


REQUIRED EXPERIENCE, LICENCES, CERTIFICATES, ETC.
Completion of senior secondary school or its equivalent.
Completion of a Bachelor of Technology in Forensic Investigation, Crime and Intelligence Analysis from British Columbia Institute of Technology, OR
Completion of a post secondary degree in Social Sciences, Criminal Justice or Criminology and a minimum of one year experience within the last five years in crime and statistical analysis and research.
Completion of post-secondary courses or experience in intermediate Word and intermediate Excel as demonstrated through testing. A 60% pass rate is required.
Minimum of three years’ experience within the last five years working in a police municipal support environment using information and intelligence database systems such as, but not limited to, ROSS, CPIC, PRIME, JUSTIN, ArcGIS, and open source systems.
Shortlisted applicants must successfully pass a National Test for Intelligence Analysts administered by the RCMP Intelligence Standards and Program Development (ISPD) Section in order to proceed to the interview stage.
Ability to obtain and maintain RCMP Top Secret Level Security Clearance.


For new hires, and for those working in designated positions of trust, including those working directly with vulnerable persons, no formal offer of employment will be made until an applicant completes and passes a criminal record check.

#ItsAboutPeople
We’re here to help people, businesses and society prosper in good times and be resilient in bad times. We’re focused on what matters to our customers. We listen and connect. Join our dynamic digital strategy team and be a key contributor to innovative strategic initiatives that will influence a new era of customer experiences for Canada’s largest property and casualty insurer.
This opportunity will have you working at the heart of the organization as a member of IFC’s National Marketing. A key player in the Marketing Analytics team, you will use your strong analytics skills to support cross-brand segmentation and audience strategies and advance our data-driven marketing initiatives. The ideal candidate will have a proven track record of performing complex analytics and statistical modelling on large data sets to present their findings as actionable recommendations to deepen business knowledge and inform both operational and strategic decision making.
Key Responsibilities :
Uncover actuarial, operational and consumer insights that can be actioned through our marketing mix to maximize profitability.
Develop models, tools and processes to leverage these insights and models on IFC’s internal and external platforms (websites and apps, Google, Facebook and other partner platforms).
Contribute to multiple strategic data projects in conjunction with the Data Lab.
Provide leadership to the Marketing Analytics team with the design/methodology to better leverage 1st party data for audience creation.
Contribute to the development of IFC’s strategy and framework for Online Behavioral Advertising.
Leverage new tools such as the Data Management platform (DMP) for advanced analytics and modeling.
Develop informative and well-organized presentations showcasing insights and recommendations supported by data; know how to tell a "story" with data and insights.
Present findings and actionable recommendations to senior leadership.


Your Skills


Programming knowledge (SAS, VBA, R) with the ability to manipulate, validate, visualize and summarize data.
Knowledge of market research and marketing principles, concepts, techniques, and applications.
Strong communication skills both verbal and written, with the ability to explain complex concepts to nontechnical audiences.
Strong interpersonal and collaboration skills, with the ability to network with internal business partners across the organization.
Drives efforts to completion setting and managing personal goals. Proactively seeks out opportunities to ensure successful outcomes.
Strong problem-solving skills.
Minimum bachelor’s degree in finance, economics, applied math, or related field required
3 + years of experience in actuarial or data science
Proficient in MS Office
Keen interest in marketing and technology

A career in Insurance has never been this exciting.

The Business Analyst (BA) is responsible for identifying and supporting new initiatives including business process improvements, software and/or systems development for CEL and its related functions. The BA determines and validates business requirements for internal CEL and multi-department projects within the University, ensuring that change initiatives and development projects accurately represent end-user, unit and University needs and goals, and provide good value to all clients and stakeholders. The BA manages change initiatives and development projects, ensuring they are completed successfully.

Continuous Improvement

Create a continuous improvement environment by providing input and best practice recommendations regarding improvements to processes/procedures to course development/delivery activities

Every day, our software is used by millions of people around the world, and we are looking for individuals who share in our excitement and passion for transforming the way the world learns. At D2L, we believe that learning should be accessible and engaging. Our goal is to create easy, flexible, and smart software that ignites the desire to learn in everyone. JOB SUMMARY:
The Market Intelligence Analyst will be responsible for tracking the trends and events happening across the corporate learning market to help inform our product, marketing, and sales strategies. As the expert in the market, you'll work to arm decision-makers across our organization to make more informed choices, and help shape our go-to-market strategy. Reporting to the VP, Corporate Product Management, you'll have a prominent role in driving strategy and direction, including recommendations for partnership or acquisitions.

HOW WILL I MAKE AN IMPACT?

What will you do day-to-day? Everything from participate in industry analyst briefings, support sales conversations, prepare market update slides or decks for a variety of audiences, create competitive debriefs on specific companies in the market, summarize market news and events, attend conferences to collect market intelligence...all activities to build and share your market expertise and insights.

Specifically, you'll engage in activities such as:

Manage the creation and implementation of market intelligence supporting executive decision-making, the identification of emerging opportunities and threats, and monitoring competitors, potential partners, prospects, and consumers
Provide analytical, project, systems and data support by creating and distributing numerous tactical and strategic market intelligence reports based on primary and secondary sources of learning technology trends and competitive activity to inform short-term and long-term business decisions, goals, plans, and outcomes
Analyze industry trends, patterns, early warnings and forecast. Utilize syndicated and other data sources weekly, monthly, quarterly and yearly to assess demand, addressable market size and consensus forecast outlook
Routinely interface with sales, product, and marketing teams and other stakeholders by sourcing and analyzing business and market data in scheduled and ad-hoc meetings to make fact-based recommendations to optimize our go-to-market strategy
Cultivate shared edtech competitive market understanding in every corner of the organization with interactive workshops and courses and support sales enablement.
Embrace the strategic and tactical planning and support our field teams by contributing to and developing sales enablement.
Participate in and lead analysis of client interviews.
Contribute to the development of cost impact models to support the value proposition of the organization by routinely reviewing all components of the marketing mix such as product offering and pricing on a territory by territory basis, including internationally to support purpose-driven learning
Recommend and present changes to go to market strategies by assessing all-source intelligence based on ground rules and working principles reflecting the organization's values and mission to enable the organization to capitalize on novel opportunities, mitigate risks from emerging threats, and drive dominant market share
Present analysis and recommendations to senior and executive leadership.
Challenge assumptions or the status quo and how things have been done to bring new ideas or innovations to bear on existing efforts. 
Verify accuracy and reliability of data and recommend corrections or adjustments in the collection, assessment, and dissemination of intelligence
Implement efficient processes to capture and analyze market intelligence data while acting with a sense of urgency to deliver critical reports and analyses both proactively and on-demand.

WHAT YOU'LL BRING TO THE ROLE:

Deep knowledge of the corporate learning technology market
Ability to spot trends and evaluate emerging technologies
Passion for communicating within all levels of an organization, from senior leadership and across our teams
Curiosity, pattern-recognition, creativity, and drive
Knack for telling the story of the corporate learning market, the competitive landscape, and our position in the market
Skills at creating impactful data visualizations, slides, and slide decks for a multitude of audiences

EDUCATION RECOMMENDATIONS:

Bachelor Degree or equivalent

WHY WE ARE AWESOME:

Flexible work hours
Health and wellness programs
Collaborative work environment
Dog Friendly office
Snacks and food trays!
Foosball and Ping-Pong tables
Showers on site
Centrally located in downtown, close to restaurants and pubs, easily accessible by public transit

YOUR MISSION
You are responsible for the strategic as well as tactical control of purchase and sales prices as well as quantities using our pricing systems
You monitor continuously and analyze the business development of international markets and platforms such as momox and medimops as well as Amazons and eBays
You identify opportunities for additional sales and margin improvements
You conceptualize pricing algorithms and test them
You are actively involved in the development of our pricing strategy
You work closely with our software development teams and assume responsibility in cross-functional projects, e.g. with Marketing or Logistics
YOU SHOULD HAVE
Understanding complex systems and algorithms is a child’s play for you
You successfully graduated in economics or a comparable department
You have min. three years professional experience in pricing and / or revenue management or another highly analytical position
You have excellent analytical skills and a strategy- and data driven working style
You are communicative, self-organized and demonstrate a high level of initiative
You have expert knowledge in Excel and are proficient in SQL
You are fluent in English
THIS IS WHAT MAKES MOMOX ATTRACTIVE
Exciting tasks and challenges in the center of Berlin
Motivated, open-minded teams with openness for new impulses
Lounge with table football and PlayStation
Work-life balance with flexible working hours
Fit on the job through running groups, cooperation with the Urban Sports Club and healthy lunch from smunch.co
Employee benefits such as discounted public transport ticket, shopping vouchers for our medimops shop, free drinks, fruits and much more
