$70,368 - $98,508 a yearPermanentThe Business Process Advisor works with internal and external stakeholders to enhance and improve business applications and processes by assisting in the development and design of future state applications and processes that align with SaskEnergy’s strategic plan and Corporate vision. The role acts as a liaison between subject matter experts, Information Management & Technology, senior management and external stakeholders to facilitate development of desired business outcomes by conducting process reviews, gathering, validating and communicating requirements, while providing expertise, guidance, recommendations and leading stakeholders to a common focus and optimizing efficiency.


Core Responsibilities

Facilitating Business Outcomes
Work as a liaison with stakeholders to facilitate the understanding and expected outcomes of the multiple stakeholders for key corporate initiatives, assisting the business to envision the future while optimizing operational efficiency. This includes:
Identify current and future state business processes and facilitate process reviews.
Conduct research, evaluate and compare metrics, perform business process analysis and analysis of results, troubleshoot and challenge business processes and recommend resolutions.
Create use case models, business visions, process maps and models and other deliverables in support of project initiatives and process reviews.
Develop and document recommendations, key performance indicators, workplans and other supporting documentation.
Create test cases and test scripts as part of an overall test strategy and test plan. Lead and support testers to ensure requirement/test case traceability.
Work closely with other groups (such as Solution Architecture, Organizational Change Management, Data Analysis) to ensure information is appropriately integrated and clearly communicated.


Business Knowledge and Process Expertise
Participate in knowledge sharing, maintaining strong communication channels for providing current and timely information, to acquire a strong understanding of business practices and goals and to ensure progressive realization of process improvements.
Participate in peer reviews to support high quality deliverables and standard approach.
Provide thought leadership to business units for process re-engineering and the development and documenting of business outcomes.
Provide expertise, guidance and support to business units in the development of request for proposal (RFP) requirements, strategic planning, business planning and key business initiatives.
Administration
Provide regular status reports and updates identifying areas that may impact project deliverables and propose options to mitigate areas of concern.
Develop and maintain documentation on technical tools leveraged by the Project Delivery Office and participate in software upgrades and implementation of new tools.


Qualifications

Education & Experience

Degree in Computer Science, Engineering or Business Administration.
Certified Business Analyst Professional (CBAP) or other formal Business Analyst training is considered an asset.
Five (5) years experience working on IT projects with a solid understanding of mainstream project management methodologies; with experience working with varying level of stakeholders and within tight timeframes; with experience facilitating and documenting business requirements and/or performing and documenting process reviews; and with experience working with mainstream modeling software, information sharing platforms and group facilitation products.
Practical experience with testing software would be considered an asset.
Alternative Education/Experience:

An equivalent combination of relevant education and experience may be considered.


Additional Information

Travel, including overnight stays away from bid headquarters is required on occasion.

JOB DESCRIPTION

Title: Senior Business Applications Analyst Position #: NU91
Department Corporate Services Division: Information
Technology Services
Date Created: January 2, 2019 Revision Date:

Reports To: Manager of Information Technology Job Grade: 6
Services
Direct Reports: Co-operative Education Students; Contractors
Indirect Reports: Systems Support Analysts
Employee Group: Non-Union
(CUPE 905.03 CUPE 905.13; GPFFA; Non-Union; Management; Seasonal; Sessional; Temporary; Student)
Position Summary


This position is responsible for the implementation, enhancement and maintenance of various
enterprise-level business applications and providing advice and technical expertise to support
efficiency, effectiveness and improvements in organizational business processes, including analyzing
requirements, designing or evaluating automation and business workflows, recommending
alternatives, preparing development and implementation plans and providing general project
management support.
As part of the IT team this position also supports ITS Division operations and assists the Manager in
undertaking responsibilities in accordance with legislation, Town’s policies and procedures and the
Corporate Information Technology Strategic Plan.
Responsibilities


Strategic Planning Functions:
 Works with the IT management team to deliver on the Corporate Information Technology Strategic
Plan
 Assists in managing the strategic planning of the Information Technology Services Division and
carrying out business plans in accordance with management and Council approval/direction

ITS Administration Functions:
 Ensuring implemented solutions and the use of information technology complies with business
standards and legislative standards with respect to the security of the information and the
protection of the financial assets of the Town
 Plans for the implementation of technologies, business system integrations and methods for use
within the operations of the organization
 Delivers efficient IT services by identifying and implementing continuous improvement and
innovative practices that position the corporation as a leader in service delivery, value and customer
service.
 Prepares business plans, implementation, risk and impact assessments, cost-benefit analysis
regarding IT projects and initiatives for cost justifications; recommends approval/denial of
projects based upon the analysis/evaluation, conformity with the IT strategy and plans of the
Corporation and technical considerations prior to selection and implementation.
 Manages vendors and business partners by establishing strategic relationships with key IT
business application suppliers and consultants, tracking and managing vendor contracts,
establishing vendor performance metrics and measuring vendor’s performance
 Represents the ITS Division in inter-departmental initiatives to ensure technology and business
processes are considered as a viable option for different business solutions; works with other
departments to maintain corporate IT objectives

Business Planning, Budget and Financial Management Functions:
 Acts as a project lead in planning, coordinating and controlling automation related projects for the
municipality, including submitting project milestones and status reports, post implementation
reviews and project conclusion reports.
 Recommends policies, assesses division-level operating policies, procedures, work systems,
methods and standards and reports on division performance taking corrective action where
necessary
 Prepares, obtains client approval and executes detailed project implementation plans fulfilling user
requirements, including liaising between the client department and client agency, budgetary and
scheduling responsibilities of the projects, milestones and status reporting.

Communication, Liaison and Customer Service Activities:
 Participate in Technology Steering Committees for the purpose of directing the use of technology
within the organization; and facilitating Ad Hoc Committees as required for the planning and
implementation of specific initiatives
 Develop a constructive and trusting partnership with stakeholders by providing guidance,
communications, advice and decision support on the delivery of corporate service initiatives,
including risks and impact assessments.
 Formulates recommendations, prepares reports, and attends Council, Committee, community,
public and/or other meetings and functions as required.
 Provide visible and positive leadership to staff developing and nurturing a work environment that
is inclusive, respectful, and motivating for staff.

Other Responsibilities
 Assists the Manager in conducting investigations and preparing documentation regarding
legislatively mandated requests (i.e. e-discovery, legal, police investigations, audits, freedom of
information requests, etc.) involving highly sensitive or confidential information involving staff at
all levels, data handling and information processing.
 Participates in projects involving change management, process improvement and use of business
applications and technological tools.
 Oversees and directs the work of special projects personnel/staff including monitoring work
progress. Makes recommendations on the hiring of special projects personnel and/or consultants.
Assists with recommendations regarding promotion, demotion and termination of special project
staff.
 Ensures compliance of the Occupational Health and Safety Act and other applicable legislation
 Enforces the Town’s Health and Safety Program, procedures and best practices
 Implements, conducts, and ensures due diligence of all health and safety matters including but not
limited to training, risk assessments, workplace inspections, investigations, procedures and
correcting hazards
 Supports the Emergency Community Control Group, initiates and implements the activities
assigned in the Corporate Emergency Plan to support response efforts during community
emergencies
The foregoing is intended to outline the general description of the duties and responsibilities for this
position. It is not intended nor should it be interpreted as a complete description. The Town of
Georgina reserves the right to amend this position description at any time provided that such change
does not represent a substantive change in the purpose or essential nature of the position.

Minimum Qualifications


Education and Training:
 Four year University Degree in Computer Science or related discipline, including specialized training
in business analysis, database administration, software development lifecycle, application support
and project management
 Certification in IT project management (eg. PMI, CIPS, PRINCE2, EC-Council, GAQM, IAPM, etc.) and
business analysis (eg. PMI, IIBA, etc.) required.

Experience:
 Four (4) years’ experience in a complex information technology portfolio including project
management, business analysis, enterprise resource planning solutions, enterprise geographical
information system, support services, web/e-government solutions, and supervisory duties;
 One (1) year on the job for the period of adjustment, orientation, and adaptation.

Knowledge:
 Good understanding of municipal and provincial legislative, regulatory and policy framework, and
administrative functions and responsibilities
 Good understanding of IT security, network administration, data centre management, data
governance, change management and project management
 Demonstrated knowledge and understanding of IT risk management frameworks and mitigation
practices (eg. ISACA COBIT, etc.) and service management (eg. ITIL TIPA, etc.)
 Knowledge of ERP (enterprise resource planning) and enterprise geographical information systems
(GIS)
 Knowledge of industry standard practices, guidelines, benchmarks, and safety policies and

About Manulife
Manulife Financial Corporation is a leading international financial services group that helps people achieve their dreams and aspirations by putting customers' needs first and providing the right advice and solutions. We operate primarily as John Hancock in the United States and Manulife elsewhere. We provide financial advice, insurance, as well as wealth and asset management solutions for individuals, groups and institutions. At the end of 2017, we had approximately 34,000 employees, 73,000 agents, and thousands of distribution partners, serving more than 26 million customers. As of December 31, 2017, we had over $1.04 trillion (US$829.4 billion) in assets under management and administration, and in the previous 12 months we made $26.7 billion in payments to our customers. Our principal operations are in Asia, Canada and the United States where we have served customers for more than 100 years. Auto req ID: 153164BR

Job Description
Nationwide Opportunities- Please Read:

Just because this role looks like it's located in Purchase, NY doesn't mean it is! At PepsiCo we place Campus Interns/ Full- Time and Graduate hires in roles nationwide across both field and headquarter locations. Field based roles will only be placed in the field.


We are PepsiCo

PepsiCo is a global food and beverage leader operating in more than 200 countries with a product portfolio that includes 22 world-famous, billion-dollar brands. From Gatorade to Quaker, to LIFEWTR, to Lay’s, we make hundreds of enjoyable foods and beverages that are loved throughout the world.

Innovation is a critical way we impact the market, as well as communities around the globe. We believe there is value in products, people, and planet. And we strive to make a difference by creating solutions that leave a lasting positive footprint.

Our culture is driven by our employees. No two days are the same; we’re dynamic and full of passionate teams embracing new ideas through our collaborative spirit. At PepsiCo, What Makes You Unique, Makes Us Better!


Functional Description:

PepsiCo is the only company with three major trademarks in carbonated soft drinks – Pepsi, Mountain Dew, and Mist Twist. When it comes to non-carbonated soft drinks, we have world class equities across every category – Aquafina in water; Tropicana and Naked Juice in juices; Pure Leaf and Brisk in ready-to-drink teas; AMP in energy drinks; Gatorade in sports drinks and Starbucks products in ready-to-drink coffee. In addition to our core powerhouse brands and products we are continually launching successful innovation and expanding our product portfolio. Examples of recent product launches include premium water brand Life WTR, Mountain Dew Label Series, Pepsi 1893 series, Teahouse Collection, and the Gatorade Flow Series.

The Commercial Sales Organization leads strategic planning and directs national account retail selling for the beverages division. The organization brings strategic focus and enhanced communication by providing sales and promotional support to PepsiCo’s national customer accounts and bottlers. They seek to develop the beverage category and identify key priorities for increasing sales. Sales interns will be offered positions within the Customer or Commercial team of the Commercial Sales Organization.

The Customer team includes general managers who operate sales teams that are directly responsible for developing the annual account strategy and operating plan, delivering the sales P&L, and managing relations with our largest and most strategic customers. The Commercial team serves as a conduit between sales and marketing teams to ensure that innovation receives the appropriate financial and program support.

What you can expect:

The intern program provides a rich developmental experience in National Sales and Strategy over the course of a 10 week period between the months of June and August. Each intern is presented with a real business challenge and is tasked to think critically and engage with cross- functional partners to provide a meaningful recommendation. At the conclusion of the internship, interns will have the opportunity to showcase their project results and overall experience in a presentation to the senior leadership team. Interns have autonomy as well as full support, guidance, and feedback from their managers and the broader Sales organization throughout the internship.

In addition to core project work, the internship program provides interns with opportunities to learn the business, build functional knowledge, gain exposure to the global PepsiCo organization, and build their network. This is accomplished through an immersive orientation and onboarding program, day-to- day team activities, career development initiatives, mentorship, networking opportunities, and community service events. The internship serves as a main pipeline for full time Sales Associate Analyst positions and can offer a full time opportunity upon graduation.

Previous intern projects include:
Quantifying opportunities in non-traditional retail outlets and recommending appropriate products
Identifying opportunities to improve sales forecasting for new product launches
Working cross functionally with brand teams and revenue management to create regionally focused marketing strategies
Issuing packaging recommendations to meet needs of small business customers
Constructing a revenue model for national account managers that optimizes product and package mix
Developing merchandising standards for primary national accounts
Assessing channel pricing to make a recommendation for a new pricing strategy
Qualifications/Requirements
What we’re looking for:
Demonstrated interest in pursuing career in sales
Strong analytics skillset with the ability to translate data into innovative strategies and solutions to complex problems
Ability to identify areas of opportunity and offer meaningful recommendations
Project management skillset demonstrated through classwork, part-time jobs and/or academic clubs.
Demonstrated initiative and a strong drive for results
Demonstrated time management and detail orientation
Proven ability to learn and adapt in a dynamic and ambiguous environment
Computer skills in Excel and PowerPoint
Proven leadership and interpersonal skills as demonstrated through part-time jobs, academic clubs or volunteer experiences.
Strong relationship building and teamwork skills as demonstrated through part-time jobs, academic clubs or volunteer experiences.
Strong oral and written communication skills

Minimum Qualifications - Each candidate is expected to:
Graduate with Bachelor’s degree within one (1) year of internship completion.
Pursuing a Bachelor’s Degree in preferred majors such as Business, Sales, Retail Sales, Economics and/or other related discipline prior to start date.
Be legally authorized to work in the U.S. without the need for current or future work authorization or visa sponsorship for employment
Pass a drug screen and background investigation
Relevant customer service, retail, or sales experience (on or off campus through part-time job and/or internship)
Submission of resume and cover letter
Have a minimum GPA of 3.0 overall
Include GPA (unless your school has a non-disclosure policy)
Geographically flexible and ability to relocate
Ability to complete a 10-12 week full-time internship between of June and August
Relocation Eligible: Not Eligible for Relocation



All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, or disability status.


PepsiCo is an Equal Opportunity Employer: Female / Minority / Disability / Protected Veteran / Sexual Orientation / Gender Identity

Company Description
RedMane Technology Canada is an application software consulting and systems integration company in British Columbia, Canada. We deliver software solutions that improve the lives of people in need throughout Canada, the United States, and Caribbean by means of building new applications, implementing cloud and packaged systems, and/or modernizing legacy systems. We are focused on helping Indigenous communities across Canada use technology to transform how they support their most vulnerable citizens.
RedMane has earned an exemplary service reputation. Our primary objective is to ensure the solutions we design and implement meet or exceed the needs of our clients for their mission critical systems.
We are a problem-solving company. Technology is just our tool.

The Role
RedMane has several full-time opportunities for Business Analysts to join our team as we grow and take on more impactful Human Service projects across Canada. Candidates must have an interest in and an ability to learn a variety of technologies and ideally a passion for improving the lives of people in need. This is a great opportunity to join a company with a long and successful history of building and deploying business applications that make a difference.

Lead requirement gathering sessions, develop requirements that support the collection, integration and transformation of large volumes of data with relational data structures ranging from simple to complex
Design complex SOA solutions using the WebSphere suite of products
Participate in systems analysis and gap analysis for building quality interfaces, analyze and modify existing programs, debug programs, write specifications, conduct code review for junior programmers, develop and execute testing
Analyze requirements and specify/implement necessary modifications using solid understanding of Cúram database design concepts including tables, fields, attributes and relationship cardinality to create application modules, consider security protocols, design solution strategies and enable interface mechanisms

Participate in project planning with application owns, legacy technical leads, application leads, and IT management in building interfaces between applications
Provide status reporting, quality assurance monitoring and ensure adherence to procedures
Produce deliverables required in standard project development from functional requirements though final implementation and interface production support
Must have experience using Cúram Business Application Suite and WebSphere Suite
Experience in planning and leading JAD sessions and creating design documents
Excellent interpersonal skills
Cúram certification preferred
Understanding of design and development concepts and familiarity with design patterns and the SDLC
Excellent interpersonal skills and the ability and interest to learn about the human services domain.
Related university degree required.
Experience with database design a plus.

Required Qualifications
All professionals at RedMane are expected to possess these skills:
A strong ethical foundation, capable of thriving in an environment and culture where honesty, integrity, and accountability are core values.
A collaborative spirit, a team orientation, and a willingness and desire to contribute to the success of others.

Travel Requirements
The position offers the opportunity to travel, ranging from 35% to 75%. The position is based at our office in Burnaby, BC and our projects are located across western and central Canada and the United States, and the Caribbean.

We Offer You
RedMane has a great working environment, offering challenging and interesting work, a place where you can have fun and express your talent and creativity. A chance to make a significant contribution that will be recognized and valued. You will be working side by side with like-minded peers in a non-bureaucratic environment where sharing knowledge is the norm.

Improve reporting by implementing visually effective tools for data, highlighting trends and variances

Excellent analytical and communication skills

Federated Co-operatives Limited (FCL) is a diverse business operating in the agriculture, food, energy and home and building sectors. Based in Saskatoon, Sask., FCL is owned by independent retail co-operatives from across Western Canada that are committed to local investment, community mindedness and lifetime membership benefits. FCL is involved in wholesaling and manufacturing, including refined fuels and lubricants. It also provides administrative and marketing support to its member-owners. For more information, visit www.fcl.crs.
The Co-operative Retailing System is a network composed of Federated Co-operatives Limited (FCL) and over 200 independent retail co-operatives that help build, feed and fuel individuals and communities in Western Canada. From Vancouver Island to northwestern Ontario and into the Arctic, retail co-ops serve 1.8 million active members and many more customers at 2,500 locations. FCL centrally supplies and supports these retail co-ops. By working together under the CO-OP® brand, we are all committed to local investment, community mindedness and lifetime membership benefits. For more information, visit www.coopconnection.ca.
FCL invites applications for the position of Business Analyst-Human Resources in our home office located in Saskatoon, Saskatchewan.
As a systems subject matter expert, the Business Analyst – Human Resources is responsible for improving and maintaining operations, delivery of key projects, and plays a lead role in enabling the change management process for assigned business initiatives. This includes the review and analysis of current processes, business needs/requirements, and system capabilities, and providing recommended solutions. This position acts as the key liaison between the technology, application, and business support teams, Human Resources (HR), and retails.
Responsibilities:

Reporting to the Business Analysis Manager, responsibilities for this position include the following:
Provide system subject matter expertise in improving and maintaining operations, delivery of key projects and/or completing the project life cycle for assigned initiatives.
Plan, organize, and conduct business process improvement projects and/or management reviews of the HR Department.
Conduct business readiness assessments prior to implementation and plan/execute as per customer selected deployment work streams to generate specific deliverables.
Analyze and critically evaluate information from multiple sources and determine a solution for competing stakeholder views and needs.
Prepare impact analysis and analyze the feasibility of, and develop requirements for new systems/system enhancements to ensure the system design aligns with user needs.
Act as the key liaison for technology initiatives that impact HR processes and/or financial and management reporting.
Communicate with HR business unit leadership and team members about upcoming changes, project scope, schedule, issues, and recommendations and facilitate the delivery of decisions to evolve and move the business forward
Lead a review of existing HR business processes and develop “as is” and “to be “process models.
Lead and act as a change agent for assigned initiatives, including identifying and communicating change impact.
Develop end user training and education materials, and contribute to the development of webinars, eLearning, and manuals.
Provide leadership and guidance for training on new systems, including consolidating information into understandable correspondence.
Provide analysis, alternatives, and recommendations for required software customization.
Other duties as assigned.
Qualifications:

The successful candidate will have a Bachelor Degree in Business/Commerce, Computer Science, IT Mathematic of Finance. Additionally, a candidate with broad business acumen with 5-7 years of experience working with information technology and HRIS applications, including 1+ years of experience in data integration and analysis. A proficient knowledge in business process development and implementation as well as quality assurance processes is also required. IIBA certification or equivalent training and experience is considered an asset.
A combination of relevant education and experience may be considered.
Additional Information:

FCL offers a competitive salary, ongoing personal and professional development, and the opportunity to work with one of western Canada's most successful organizations.
You may be required to undergo a background and substance test in accordance with FCL policies.
We thank all candidates for their interest, however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

PermanentHuman Resources and Corporate Services Branch
File #18-105
The Ontario Securities Commission (OSC) is the statutory body responsible for regulating Ontario’s capital markets in accordance with the mandate established in the provincial Securities Act and the Commodity Futures Act. The Commission’s mandate is to provide protection to investors from unfair, improper or fraudulent practices, to foster fair and efficient capital markets and confidence in capital markets, and to contribute to the stability of the financial system and the reduction of systemic risk.
Human Resources and Corporate Services Branch is comprised of Human Resources, Administration, Knowledge Services, Records and Information Management, and the Business Continuity Function. The mandate of the Branch is to ensure the responsible stewardship of OSC resources, contribute to enterprise-wide workforce productivity, and lead the design and implementation of a positive employee experience. The Administration department is responsible for the Corporate Expenses budget, Facilities, Safety & Security, Office Services, Mailroom, Reception, Procurement and Contracts Administration.
The Records and Information Management team supports the full spectrum of OSC employees' information needs, ensuring that the organization can effectively regulate Ontario's capital markets. Specifically, Records and Information Management staff are responsible for records and information management services, training and support. The Records and Information Management team works collaboratively with business areas to develop solutions that both streamline operations and consolidate efforts to best effect across all points of information management.
The Records Information Analyst is responsible for launching and leading initiatives that improve the management of records, information and data at the Ontario Securities Commission. The Records Information Analyst develops strategic ways of managing records in all formats in OSC information systems. The individual in this role deploys traditional techniques in the field of records and information management, and also designs and tests new and innovative ways of analyzing information, business processes, and technology to support the implementation and expansion of the OSC records and information management program. The Records Information Analyst also works with business areas to ensure their information and records management needs are met while remaining aligned with various legislative, policy and business requirements.
Key Duties and Responsibilities
Assists the Manager, Commission Records and Information in the development of RIM products and tools, to provide the OSC with consistent, compliant, and practical direction on the management of information assets
Develops RIM products and tools, including, but not limited to, strategic documentation, business process maps, corporate recordkeeping policies, metadata standards, records retention and disposition authorities, procedures, and business rules
Leads the creation, implementation and management of an enterprise document management system
Proactively conducts research on industry and government RIM standards, techniques, trends, and methods, and analyses practicality and effectiveness for OSC use
Creates and manages the structure, content, format, and distribution of associated documentation
Provides expert advice and consultation on a wide range of RIM-related matters to support institutional goals and objectives and to ensure RIM principles and practices are appropriately applied to new and emerging situations
Liaises with internal stakeholders, including General Counsel, Information Technology, Knowledge Services, Internal Audit, Risk Management and business owners on behalf of RIM Manager to represent OSC RIM mandate
Liaises with external stakeholders, including Archives of Ontario representatives, in order to support compliance with provincial legislative and policy requirements and guidelines, and represents the OSC RIM group on behalf of RIM Manager in RIM communities of practice and other forums
Assesses the implications of new technology to business processes and makes recommendations pertaining to the adoption of new technology
Leads RIM projects, monitors and reports on established performance targets and tracks progress of planned deliverables
Serves as the primary contact to respond to ad hoc requests for advice and guidance on RIM practices and principles and interpretation of relevant legislation
Assists with the development and delivery of training and communication packages to create institutional awareness and compliance with regulatory and internal policies
Assesses the institution’s training and educational needs; develops associated tools and training materials
Communicates approved policies, standards, and best practices through the delivery of presentations and the development of communication packages
Prepares background reports, briefing memos, presentation materials on records and information management issues for review by appropriate stakeholders
Assists with the development and update of RIM enterprise risk register and mitigation strategies
Mentors and oversees work product of students and contract staff
Qualifications
Education: Master’s Degree in Library, Archival or Information Studies, or Records Management
Minimum years of experience required: 3-5 years’ related experience in records and information management environments
Designations/Certification, Registrations: Certifications in Project Management, Change Management, Business Process, or Business Analysis would be considered an asset
Other Qualifications:
Comprehensive and current knowledge of records management procedures, standards, function-based methodology, classification system design, metadata standards, thesaurus development and use, records retention criteria, records preservation and protection approaches
Ability to interpret and extract recordkeeping requirements from legislation and other sources
Strong interpersonal, written and oral communication skills, including facilitation skills for eliciting business requirements from stakeholders
Demonstrated knowledge of the use of RIM-based technology for the management of information content and context in all media and formats
Familiarity with FOIPPA legislation and related policies and procedures
Ability to work independently, establish priorities, think critically, problem-solve and make decisions
Excellent communication (verbal and written), facilitation, and organizational skills, including the ability to make presentations to all staff levels
Understanding of business concepts and service delivery in a public sector environment
Self-directed research skills - to explore the professional literature for best practices and to find out how other jurisdictions are handling similar issues
The incumbent works with a minimum of direct supervision and operates with a high degree of self-confidence and personal integrity.
As a representative of the Records and Information Management unit, the individual has acute judgment and diplomatic skills. The individual has a thorough knowledge of the records life-cycle and archives management, and familiarity with the creation, access, management, preservation, and disposition issues of records and information in all formats.
Grow your career and make a difference working at the OSC.

Apply online at by March 22, 2019.

Comment R é ussir:
Chez Loblaw, nous recherchons toujours des personnes formidables pour continuellement renforcer notre culture. Nous croyons que les gens formidables façonnent nos valeurs, sont authentiques, bâtissent la confiance et créent des liens.

Temps plein

Poste régulier
Loblaw considère que la diversité culturelle du Canada est une source de fierté nationale et un symbole de force. Join our team

Supply Operations leads and distributes all materials and services across TELUS, from infrastructure to consumer mobile, through over 1,000 points of presence and direct to our customers. Our customers and our team deserve the best. That’s why we’re dedicated to creating innovative, leading-edge supply chain solutions. Here’s the impact you’ll make and what we’ll accomplish together

Unito.io is a work collaboration tool based in Montreal and one of BetaKit's top startups to watch in 2018 (https://betakit.com/10-montreal-tech-companies-to-watch-in-2018/). We're a VC-backed SaaS company that makes people happier, organizations more productive, and software more powerful, all over the world.
We are looking for a Data Analyst to join the team. That person will work closely with the marketing, sales and product departments in order to instrument and analyze the data around every touch points of the customer journey, from the discovery of Unito to the platform's usage.
Her/his mission will be to leverage data to realize a cohesive customer journey and user experience. The Data Analyst will maintain, educate and enforce standard data terminology and best practices across the company.
What you will do
During your first few months at Unito, you will mainly focus on helping the marketing team improve conversion rates through data analysis with responsibilities like...
Identify missing data sets in the conversion funnel
Setup a signup funnel dashboard per traffic source with conversion rate goals
Perform website audit, compare it to previous websites, identify issues and opportunities to improve user engagement
Your other responsibilities will involve working with various departments. Here are some of the responsibilities you'll have:
Audit current product data sets
Identify missing data points to improve instrumentation
Identify Customer Journey KPIs with stakeholders
Work closely with dev team to improve tracking
Build dashboards to communicate about KPIs and unify terminology within the company
Provide insightful analysis to support recommendations for the Customer Journey
Refine taxonomy and build glossary
Participate in implementing customer research protocols
Implement product usage & usability dashboards
Level up the data analysis skills of everyone in the company
You are
B.Sc. in Management, Business Technology Management or equivalent
1-3 years experience in an operational role
Excellent knowledge of data analysis tools, from good old spreadsheets to query languages to modern data tools
Proven ability to develop flows and building new processes that simplify and facilitate the data journey
Solid ability to develop models for accurate reporting and analysis
Strong attention to detail and commitment to accuracy
Excellent time management and organization skills
Ability to work independently and drive towards an answer
Confidence with communication and presentation
Experience working with external stakeholders
Knowledge of statistics and experience using statistical techniques for analyzing datasets
It'd be nice if you
Have experience with Hubspot (or equivalent CRM system)
Have experience with analytics and tracking tools (Google Analytics, Amplitude, Keen, Segment)
Have experience in the B2B SaaS sector
Have experience mapping sales processes
Have experience in customer research
Are fluent in French
Who we are
We're taking on a major problem that people are passionate about solving: we make it easier to collaborate across teams. We don't make users learn new tools and change the way they work. By connecting work management tools, we allow managers, cross-functional teams, departments, and entire companies to benefit from seamless collaboration and improved communication. We sync projects across a number of tools, but our main focus is on Trello, Asana, JIRA, GitHub, and Wrike. This is a hard problem of semantics, synchronization, and APIs.
Our software is changing the collaborative work landscape and is the only software of its kind on the market. We pride ourselves in having one of the most talented and motivated teams in town. We've acquired tens thousands of trial users, hundreds of paying customers, hired 20 people, and connected 9 different applications together. We're on a mission to change how collaboration works between teams for almost any company in the world, and we've shown so far that we've got what it takes to succeed.
Culture
Our team is a family of humble and hungry individuals, varying in age (our founders span 3 decades), gender (almost at parity!), cultures, and backgrounds (11 countries). We prefer to focus more on the quality of our work, and less on things like policies or rules. We trust our team and encourage them to make independent decisions, ask questions, share ideas, and voice opinions. Everyone's voice is heard.
Here at Unito, we're huge on transparency, honesty, and execution. We have no tolerance for politics or hiding mistakes, and value flexibility, autonomy, fairness, and respect. We share achievements, all company metrics, and learn from failures together as a team.
Our team operates through areas of of responsibility that make everyone own of a part of the business. We are inclusive and welcoming, and dedicated to building a team of high performers. We want every employee to maximize his or her potential, learn, and grow within the company.
Benefits
Dental, health and travel insurance
Wellness spending budget for self-improvement purposes
Gorgeous new downtown office space located by metro Champs de Mars and Berri UQAM, plus reserved parking
Join our groups of runners, walkers, hikers, soccer or basketball players
If this position sounds like a good fit, we'd love to hear from you!
To know more about our hiring process, here's a blog post (https://unito.io/blog/the-modern-guide-to-hiring-millennials/) detailing how we go about it and what to expect when you apply for a job at Unito.

Requisition ID: 56523
Join the Global Community of Scotiabankers to help customers become better off.
Overview

Required to carry a beeper and be available at all times to provide support to the system during overnight processing runs.
Implement new systems or enhancements by reviewing programs written by team members, establishing and executing system test procedures, developing implementation plans, developing the required program and system documentation and ensuring all functionality has been delivered as required. Required to provide post implementation support and training to the computer operations staff on the production processing functionality.

In addition, the incumbent is required to provide leadership and specialized consultation in defining, planning and maintaining a strategy for the architecture, development and implementation of technology, systems and MIS within the Division to provide effective technical consulting and support services to the Division.
Are you the right person for the role?
You Have;
Must have an extensive knowledge of most aspects of Information Technology and industry practices as well as a detailed understanding of systems architecture, business systems analysis and application development.
Must have excellent analytical, problem solving and trouble shooting skills in order to quickly and effectively resolve problems in a demanding environment.
Must have a specialized knowledge on most aspects of technologies within a client/server and multi-tier environment.

In-depth experience in design and development of Mainframe Application using COBOL, DB2 and JCL/ PROC’s. Experienced with CA-7 Scheduling and IBM Utilities
Good Knowledge in using File-Aid, Endeavor, SPUFI
Provide day to day support for problem determination and resolution of system software related to incident and problem tickets raised.

Must have good interpersonal and communication skills in order to deliver proposals, provide consultation to development staff.
A post graduate degree in a computer science, math or engineering related discipline is desirable, along with at least 5-7 years of practical experience in developing and deploying complex technology is essential.
What’s in it for you?
The opportunity to join a forward-thinking company surrounded by a collaborative team of innovative thinkers.
A great opportunity to leave your “stamp” as we are undergoing multiple exciting and forward thinking initiatives.
A rewarding career path with diverse opportunities for professional development.
Internal development to support your growth and enhance your skills.
A competitive compensation and benefits package.
An organization committed to making a difference in our communities– for you and our customers.
We have an inclusive and collaborative working environment that encourages creativity, curiosity, and celebrates success!
Location(s): Canada : Ontario : Toronto
As Canada’s International Bank, we are a leader when it comes to inclusion. We are a diverse and global team, speaking more than 100 languages with backgrounds from more than 120 countries. Why LoyaltyOne?
Are you passionate about leveraging your analytics experience to help more than one hundred of the world’s leading brands improve marketing outcomes and deliver differentiated performance? Are you looking to build an extraordinary career and expand your analytics expertise in one of the most respected analytics companies in Canada? If so, join LoyaltyOne’s analytics practice to become a part of a team comprised of industry leading, business oriented analytics thought leaders. Our team translates data into analytics, insights, strategy and results for our clients. For six consecutive years, LoyaltyOne has been recognized by Hewitt Associates as one of the 50 Best Employers in Canada, demonstrating LoyaltyOne's continued commitment to providing a great work experience for its associates and a great service experience for its clients. Don’t miss this opportunity to take your career to a whole new level with LoyaltyOne.
About the Opportunity
The AIR MILES Reward Program Analytics & Insights practice is looking for a well-rounded Analytics & Insights Analyst to join our team in Toronto. We are looking for an analytics practitioner with a blend of proficient technical skills and strong business acumen. The Analyst plays an key role in the application & execution of consumer data and analytics to support the development of customer-centric business strategies and Loyalty Marketing for our clients.
Qualification:
Responsibilities
Subject Matter Expert in Loyalty & Marketing Analytics for the assigned client portfolio
Contribute to all phases of campaign management (ideation, planning, targeting, measurement, recommendation) with a focus in pre-analysis and post-analysis
Work collaboratively with internal and external business partners to understand external client’s business needs and maximize team impact
Work collaboratively with internal business partners to clearly define analysis / campaign scope, objectives, targeting & measurement strategy for client’s loyalty marketing initiatives
Conduct timely customer analysis and campaign measurement to identify opportunities for clients to maximize the use of AIR MILES Reward Program to drive incremental sales
Present analysis results and recommendations in business language in different forums/meetings
Automate and make process and tool improvement suggestions to drive operational efficiency
Balance the demands of multiple concurrent projects while maintaining a high level of diplomacy
Bachelor’s degree, preferrably in any of the following: Statistics, Economics, Computer Science, Engineering, Math
Problem solving skills coupled with the “can do” attitude
Hands-on proficient experience with SQL, Python, and Tableau an asset
Knowledge in direct marketing, campaign management, experimental design, customer analytics, CRM, segmentation, modeling
Retail and merchandising industry knowledge a definite advantage
A strategic/analytical thinker who can link assigned tasks to the bigger picture
Strong organzational, time management and communication skills (verbal and written)
About LoyaltyOne

LoyaltyOne is part of the successful Alliance Data family of companies that provide the full range of data-driven loyalty, marketing and credit solutions in more than 80 locations across the globe.

Working with more than 100 leading brands in the retail, financial services, grocery, petroleum retail, travel and hospitality industries to profitably change customer behavior. Through a team of businesses, including one of the leading coalition loyalty programs in the world, the AIR MILES® Reward Program, LoyaltyOne designs, delivers and manages a suite of services focused on consumer data, customer-centric retail strategies, direct-to-consumer marketing, loyalty consulting and more.

LoyaltyOne has broadened its horizons geographically by growing Precima in the European market. With the recent acquisition of BrandLoyalty in the Netherlands, LoyaltyOne has gained the expertise of a global leader in short-term loyalty campaigns, along with a client network that extends throughout Europe and Asia.

About ADS

Alliance Data® (NYSE: ADS) is a leading global provider of data-driven marketing and loyalty solutions serving large, consumer-based industries. The Company creates and deploys customized solutions, enhancing the critical customer marketing experience; the result is measurably changing consumer behavior while driving business growth and profitability for some of today's most recognizable brands. Alliance Data helps its clients create and increase customer loyalty through solutions that engage millions of customers each day across multiple touch points using traditional, digital, mobile and emerging technologies. An S&P 500 and Fortune 500 company headquartered in Plano, Texas, Alliance Data consists of three businesses that together employ more than 16,000 associates at approximately 100 locations worldwide. http://www.alliancedata.com/

Alliance Data is an Equal Employment Opportunity employer. Accordingly, we will make reasonable accommodations to respond to the needs of people with disabilities in accordance with legislation.

Alliance Data participates in E-Verify.

CLEAR transforms what is uniquely you – your fingerprints, your face, your eyes – into a secure, biometric key to frictionless experiences. We are creating a world where travel is effortless, where accessing your office building is as simple as walking in, and where shopping is as easy as walking in and out of a store—without ever once showing an ID or credit card. CLEAR currently powers secure, frictionless customer experiences in nearly 40 U.S. airports and venues. With over 3 million members so far, CLEAR is the identity platform of the future, today.

The Operations Business Analyst will report to the SVP, Operations and will be a significant player in driving CLEAR's growth: You will create financial models, communicate with stakeholders, generate pitch decks and identify trends and opportunities via the data.

Perform bi-weekly analysis
Prepare spreadsheets and analyze data
Review and analyze client, market data, and industry research

You are a data evangelist
A self-starter who can listen, form insight, drive strategic vision
You posses strong at risk management and prioritization skills
Embody CLEAR leadership principles, including a bias for action, indefatigability, a high moral code, and are service minded
Passionate about identity technology and a willingness to challenge the status quo
B.S. or B.A. or Equivalent Experience Required
3+ years' experience in financial or relevant market analysis
Familiarity with tools for Data Collection and Reporting
Demonstrated evidence of excellent written and verbal skills

Ready to grow a new business and transform an entire industry?

Join our team

TELUS is entering the SmartHome & Security market in a big way, transforming an industry while we make our customers’ homes and businesses safer and bring convenience and peace of mind to their lives. By using our premier networks, technology, and services, TELUS is bringing the power of SmartHome & Security Solutions to life for our residential and business customers in new ways with creative product and service offerings. We are seeking forward-thinking individuals with a passion for continuous improvement and delivering success to join our SmartHome & Security team as we continue to grow and rapidly evolve our business.

Here’s the impact you’ll make and what we’ll accomplish together:

This is a career-shaping opportunity that will truly develop you into a business athlete by working in and across our end-to-end SmartHome & Security business. We operate in an ambitious start-up environment and collaborate with teams across multiple functions including Marketing, Product & Service Development, Contact Centers, Field Technicians, Application System Development, and Technology Strategy. With members of these teams, you will work on projects and support operations across multiple segments including residential, small business, and consumer health customers to deliver extraordinary customer experiences. This is a career shaping journey that will set you apart from many as you will play a critical role in building and growing a world class SmartHome and Business Security business at TELUS. Your primary responsibility as a Business Systems Analyst II will be to support key strategic post-acquisition integration initiatives via reporting, analysis, and insights that will enable decision making for the growth and operations of our SmartHome & Business Security organization. Don’t miss this opportunity to join a fast paced, high performing, entrepreneurial team.
Here's how:

As a Business Systems Analyst II on the SmartHome & Security - Post-Acquisition Integration team, your primary responsibility will be driving the successful migration of acquired customers into the TELUS ecosystem. You will ensure that we deliver on our business objectives while delivering a best-in-class customer experience. Key responsibilities include:

Use your talent to translate raw information into actionable insights to drive strategies and initiatives in this new line of business
Define key success metrics and deliver analytics to support operational readiness and our end-to-end customer experience including equipment repairs and upgrades, customer care, technical support and loyalty & retention
Analyze and solve business problems by developing insightful, practical, and sustainable solutions to complex and/or broad challenges/opportunities
Build relationships across teams to support project delivery and cross-functional collaboration
Manage data by merging and linking information from multiple diverse sources to support reporting and analysis required for internal decision making
Synthesize analytics and insights and ensure it is clearly communicated to stakeholders in business context to resolve customer/business issues and deliver on objectives
Qualifications

You're the missing piece of the puzzle
Proven problem-solving, strategic, and analytical capabilities with a convincing track record of setting and delivering against key metrics
Strong communication skills and an ability to extract and present business insights from raw data
Advanced abilities to translate data into meaningful visual insights using analytic and reporting tools (e.g. Excel, Domo, Tableau, etc.)
Proficiency with database sources and querying languages such as SQL, PSQL, etc.
Passion for working in a dynamic, high performance culture
Innovative and excited about pioneering a new line of business for TELUS

Unsatisfied with the status-quo and constantly be on the lookout for industry best practices, technology trends, and customer experience opportunities to find and lead the next best transformation

Systems integration experience especially scope related to Cutover and Data Conversion
University degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Business Technology Management or equivalent experience

job_title: Accounting & Reporting Costing Analyst - Guelph, ON
job_description:
Cargill operates five Canadian facilities located in Ontario, Alberta and Quebec. In Alberta, the High River plant is a fully integrated beef processing facility where over 2,300 employees process 4500 head of cattle per day, and the Calgary Case Ready facility has over 350 employees serving national retailers and food service customers. In Ontario, the fully integrated Guelph beef facility employs over 820 employees and processes 1,800 head of cattle per day, while the Guelph Case Ready facility has over 600 employees. In Quebec, the Chambly Case Ready facility has over 500 employees serving national retailers and food service customers.

Position Purpose

The Accountant will work directly (partner) with all local management at the beef processing facility and be a key player with the sales and distribution centers. Duties that the Accountant will be directly or indirectly involved in include inventory control, expense management, capital project management, operational performance analysis, ensuring the necessary control framework is in place, yearly budget setting, partnering with production management to identify areas where efficiency gains can be captured, and projects as assigned. This position will report to the BOSC A&F Lead based in High River, AB.



Principal Accountabilities

30% Fiduciary & Controls –
Participates in day-to-day accounting operations required to support the businessMonitors and measures inventory compliance to the internal global control frameworkBe a champion of internal inventory controls by maintaining awareness and analyzing processes to identify any fiduciary risks.Understands key accounting processes that are done by CBS and other centralized groups and works with them to ensure accuracy and efficiencyFreezer inventory

Seeking an analytics, data, and optimization maniac for digital products!
We are a digital product consultancy that plans, produces and manages digital products for clients, who operate in a diverse and broad range of industries and digital product types. Measure, monitor, predict

Consulting and business development

Experience connecting multiple data sources to construct a 360 degree understanding of digital product performance
Experience working with Business Intelligence Tools an asset (i.e. SQL database, Google Data Studio)
Experience using predictive (AI/ML) methods an asset
Committed to using methodical approaches to problem solving
Proven data instincts and clear understanding of the common pitfalls of digital analytics
Performance and results-oriented
Perceptive, a creative enthusiast, have a great sense of empathy for customers and users
Appreciates the importance of effective communication and presentation skills
Genuine passion for digital strategy and digital products
Takes initiative and proposes new ideas and solutions before asked
Flexible and productive when juggling multiple priorities
Highly collaborative; team player

Robust Medical, Optical, Dental, and Extended Health Benefits plan

Growth in your role alongside the company's growth

Move, Build, Grow your career!
As the premier global asset management and disposition company, Ritchie Bros. helps thousands of people around the world buy and sell heavy equipment, trucks, and other assets every month. With our multiple onsite and online selling platforms and commitment to first-class customer service, Ritchie Bros. is trusted worldwide for making buying and selling easy, efficient, fair, and transparent. If you’re an innovator with an entrepreneurial spirit, we want you to join our growing team – employed in a wide variety of positions from sales to operations to corporate functions – as we transform the global used equipment market.
Join us on our journey and move forward with us, build your success, and grow your career.

The Opportunity:

The Oracle Functional Analyst will support the existing Oracle Financials functionality and participate in new initiatives and projects. The Functional Analyst will work with the business users to analyze the business problems; understand the requirements and objectives; perform Functional Analysis and Design; perform Application configuration; liaise with the IT team, vendors, and Oracle Support; adopt best practices and deliver documented solutions. The Functional Analyst will also work with Software Developers and Testers to ensure that the functional requirements and design are clearly understood, and software components are adequately tested.

Work with the business users to analyze business problems; understand the requirements and objectives; liaise with IT team; adopt best practices and deliver documented solutions.
Understand end to end business processes, provide routine troubleshooting, support, and user training as well as analysis and solution development for functional and technical issues.
Participate in the implementation of new Oracle modules, roll-outs to new user groups, and major application upgrades.
Design new Oracle reports, interfaces, data conversions, extensions and workflows (RICEW) to satisfy business requirements.

Minimum 2 years of experience implementing or supporting Oracle e-Business Suite (EBS) and/or Oracle Cloud Financials modules.
Hands on experience configuring and implementing at least 2 core Oracle Financials modules such as AP, AR, GL, Fixed Assets, Cash Management, Project Costing or Purchasing
Good understanding of contemporary systems, development methodologies and integration concepts in a large corporate setting.
Experience working in a team-oriented, collaborative environment.
Experience with Financial Consolidation systems or AP Automation systems an asset.

We are looking for a highly motivated Analyst, Finance & Treasury to join our Finance & Treasury team based out of our Head Office in downtown Toronto. In this role, you will report to the Manager, Operational Banking and will be responsible for executing day to day banking operations globally. In this role, you will conduct bank account openings and closings, establish and maintain banking relationships and carry out signatory updates for all bank accounts. The Analyst will work collaboratively across several lines of business with Oxford, ensuring that appropriate policy support is provided and that decisions are implemented effectively. The successful candidate will interact with internal and external stakeholders and will demonstrate our priorities, “The Oxford Way”.


You will be a key member of an engaged, high-reaching team—part of a world-class, winning culture that prioritizes people development and focuses on long-term growth. This is an opportunity rich in exposure to superior treasury practices and the chance to connect and mentor with best in class industry professionals. We take great pride in leading the industry by earning respect through every interaction, every day. We go above and beyond to protect and grow relationships by anticipating needs, being honest and considerate and valuing customers as genuine partners.
As a member of this team, you will be responsible for:
The opening, closing, modifying and maintenance of bank accounts globallyPreparing the know your client (“KYC”) and legal documentation for all bank account mattersCollaborating with Corporate Legal to update and prepare banking resolutions and general banking agreementsResponding to and resolving day-to-day internal enquiries regarding the banking operationsParticipating in the yearly audit confirmation processAssisting with the review of, alongside the Manager, Operational Banking, and various legal documentation related to bankingPreparing and analyzing bank fees and identifying cost savingsSupporting the maintenance of the process and procedure documentation for the Kyriba Bank Account Management (“BAM”) moduleConducting General Kyriba BAM system maintenance, including: data update and integration, onboarding, data mapping and other ad hoc requestsContributing to project development with a focus on driving and enhancing operational banking efficiencies, and maintaining of banking process and procedures guidesFostering and maintaining strong relationships with key bank contactsAssisting with the establishment of treasury controls, procedures, and policiesEnsuring familiarity and adherence with all Oxford and Treasury policies, process, and controls at all times and acting as a backup to fellow Treasury colleagues
To succeed in this role, you:
Have university or college degree with a focus in business/finance/accountingHave 2 - 5 years of relevant accounting, finance, banking or treasury experienceIdeally have knowledge of a Treasury Management System and/or banking platform, particularly Kyriba would be an assetHave an understanding of domestic and international bankingHave advanced Excel knowledge including lookups, pivots and are at ease building spreadsheetsPossess excellent attention to detailHave strong interpersonal, communication and organizational skills and the ability to work within various group settings and with contacts at varying levelsHave sound logic and reasoning skills, with the ability to analyze an issue and evaluate and present various options for solutionEmbrace collaborative sharing of knowledge within a teamwork environmentAre driven to achieving results and continuously striving to deliver the highest performance through creative thinkingThrive in organizations that constantly evolve and adapt
Our story:
ABOUT OXFORD PROPERTIES GROUP
Oxford Properties Group connects people to exceptional places, and is the owner, developer and manager of some of the world’s best real estate assets. Established in 1960, it manages over C$58 billion of assets across the globe on behalf of its co-owners and investment partners. Oxford’s portfolio encompasses office, retail, industrial, hotels and multifamily residential and spans over 100 million square feet in global gateway cities across four continents. A highly disciplined and thematic investor, Oxford invests in properties, portfolios, development sites, debt, securities and platform opportunities across the risk-reward spectrum. With regional head offices in Toronto, New York, London, Luxembourg, Singapore and Sydney, its long-term approach to real estate investment aligns Oxford’s interests to its customers and the communities in which it operates. Oxford is the global real estate arm of OMERS, the AAA credit rated defined benefit pension plan for Ontario’s municipal employees. For more information on Oxford, visit www.oxfordproperties.com.

ABOUT OMERS
Founded in 1962, OMERS is one of Canada’s largest defined benefit pension plans, with $97 billion in net assets as at December 31, 2018. A jointly sponsored pension plan, with 1,000 participating employers, OMERS invests and administers pensions on behalf of almost half a million active and retired members. OMERS members include union and non-union employees of municipalities, school boards, transit systems, electrical utilities, emergency services and children’s aid societies across Ontario. Contributions are funded equally by members and employers. OMERS has employees in Toronto, London, New York, Amsterdam, Luxembourg, Singapore, Sydney and other major cities across North America and Europe – originating and managing a diversified portfolio of high-quality investments in public markets, private equity, infrastructure and real estate.

$74,733 a yearProvides financial and business advice to assigned clients by reviewing and analyzing departmental and corporate historical and statistical, cost and revenue information; assesses operational performance and assists clients in preparing their assigned operating and capital budgets. Develops various financial reports in order to support the business units achieve their enterprise objectives.

KEY ACCOUNTABILITIES

Provides consolidated financial data and related resources for the development and reporting of annual operating budget, capital program, 10-Year Investment Plan and quarterly forecasts; identifies opportunities to enhance financial outlooks, and other financial analysis tasks and projects.
Advises department / project managers on financial issues and assumptions that will impact budget and capital requirements; develops detailed budget instructions; provides guidance and direction to relevant staff members on operating and capital related matters.
Identifies opportunities to enhance financial outlooks, other tasks and projects; forecasts and plans resources for complex projects or initiatives and prepares various monthly reports and executive dashboards to assist in insightful decision making. Develops various reports such as those related to projects, programs and other corporate financial reports in order to support the business units achieve their enterprise objectives.
Works closely with business units / Project Managers on their submitted financial information and other data ensuring accuracy, completeness and compliance with corporate guidelines and determining reasons for change from previous year’s budget; provides ongoing support to the units by responding to their financial data requests and addresses any related matters.
Analyzes financial impacts of opportunities for improving efficiencies; creates financial models to analyze and track key business drivers and initiatives and prepares recommendations to relevant managers; reviews and analyzes financial and performance metric variances against historic trends, strategic plan, budget and forecast to develop business cases for process improvements.
Prepares executive briefing material; assists in preparing drafts for the annual operating budget, quarterly forecasts, and capital reports to the Board; participates in special projects, including providing financial analysis services to various project teams.

Qualifications
Education and Experience:

The competencies for this position is acquired through a university degree in business administration or commerce along with a Professional Accountant designation (CA, CPA or CMA), combined with 5 years progressive experience in accounting, capital projects and financial planning in a large preferably unionized organization.

Other Requirements:

Intermediate to advanced analytical and financial modeling skills using Excel and other modeling tools (Longview, etc.)

Sound business acumen and experience with developing or reviewing business cases with strong presentation skills

General understanding of project management practices (Gantt charts, work breakdown structures, project governance)

Working knowledge of PSAB accounting standards and preferably general understanding of TransLink’s governance legislation

Strong written and verbal communication skills as well as interpersonal skills

Solid time management skills with ability to multitask during tight project deadlines

Other Information
Recruitment Process: An applicant will be required to demonstrate their suitability for this position by meeting the minimum level of qualifications and experience in order to be invited into the selection process. A standard interview format will be used including general, scenario and behavioural descriptive interview questions.

Work Schedule
37.5 hours per week.

Rate of Pay
Grade: 05

Salary starting at $74,733 per annum

of the page or go to http://www.translink.ca/careers to apply for this position and view instructions on the process.

job_title: Operational Business Systems Analyst - 9 month Contract
job_description:
TemporaryAbout the role:
In this 9 month Contract role, you will work independently on various projects and operational initiatives in support of Investment Management business. You will work closely with the business and Investment Operations team to deliver solutions involving various Investment Management systems, including Eagle Investment systems, Trade Order Management, Analytics and Fund/Investment Accounting systems, and any other interfacing systems.
Your Responsibilities
Facilitate with the elicitation, planning and documentation of (but not limited to) the following deliverables:
Current state analysis including full documentation of the current application state and operational workflow, file transfer processes and interfaces to third parties.
Recommendations on future state.
Detailed business and reporting requirements.
Functional specifications as a hand-off for development, including data mapping and interface requirements
Test strategy, test plan and test cases.
Scope documents and project objectives: based on both user needs and a thorough understanding of business systems, technology, and industry requirements.
Major features of the business systems from the perspective of the business owners and sponsors and in terms that are meaningful to business people.
Risk and risk mitigation plans.
Deployment to production plans, including change management procedures, SLAs (Service Level Agreements) and support documentation.
Facilitate the following activities:
Liaising and co-ordinating activities between the business areas, Investment Operations and external vendors to help translate requirements into specifications.
Translate specifications to define test plans and test scripts.
Execute testing across several environments, and work with users and development teams on issue identification and resolution.
Co-ordinate assigned project activities, provide accurate estimates in order to consistently meet the project deadlines with the expected quality.
Facilitate and lead sessions to gather and document functional and non-functional requirements
Analyzing and mapping of existing processes to future "to-be" processes
Working with vendors to provide appropriate requirements, use cases and specifications
Identifying areas of opportunity that distinguish this business and represent its core competencies. Some of these processes may represent opportunities for competitive advantage
Your Qualifications
Must have undergraduate degree
Preferable to have post graduate training in financial markets or investments, Canadian Securities Course, CFA, etc.
Must have a minimum of 7 years working as a Business Analyst
Must have Investment Management business knowledge
Working knowledge of General Accounting practices in particular Fund Accounting processes and methodology
Experience with Eagle Investment systems (Eagle PACE, Eagle Star and Eagle Datamart).
Must have experience with various systems supporting the Investment Management business, such as Bloomberg AIM, Market Data and Fund/Investment Accounting systems
Experience in writing SQL queries (selects, joins, groupings etc.).
Strong data knowledge, specifically in Financial Industry Security Master Data / Analytics Data.
Thorough understanding of security types, including derivatives, and associated data.
Able to work effectively with minimal supervision & adapt quickly to changing requirements.
Must have excellent written and verbal communication skills and proven documentation skills.
#INDS
No unsolicited agency referrals please.
