job_title: ISL 27R - Senior Wholesale Business System Analyst
job_description:
Senior Wholesale Business Systems Analyst
Information Systems R27
Vancouver, Regular, Full Time

STEP into a career with one of BC’s Top Employers since 2009.

The Liquor Distribution Branch (LDB) is one of the largest distributors and retailers of beverage alcohol in Canada, generating a net income of approximately $1.08 billion on annual sales of approximately $3.3 billion in fiscal 2016/17. LDB has a workforce of approximately 4,000 full and part-time employees, operates 197 retail stores across the province, oversees the operations of approximately 220 Rural Agency Stores and has the role of wholesaler to approximately 700 private liquor retail outlets and 10,000 licensed establishments.
The LDB is a unique government entity that operates with similar independence to a Crown Corporation under the direction of a General Manager and CEO.
In February 2018, the LDB was assigned to distribute, wholesale and sell non-medicinal cannabis inclusive of a government owned online channel with a mandate to support government’s key priorities of protecting children and youth, ensuring health and safety standards, and keeping the criminal element out of the supply chain. Effective October 17, 2018 the LDB has added wholesaling and retailing of non-medical cannabis –named LDB Cannabis Operations to the existing business of wholesaling and retailing of Liquor.
LDB’s Information Technology Division (IT) provides reliable, responsive and secure systems and services to support LDB in operational excellence and delivering superior customer service.
The LDB’s Information Technology Division consists of six departments and 23 distinctive units, with 200+ FTEs. IT has adopted a multi-sourcing strategy and leverages a combination of internal and external expertise, including outsourced services, contracted services and shared services, to deliver the IT mandate of supporting current operations and future business needs. Strategic plans, governance of standards and risk management are all developed internally to support Divisional and Corporate goals.
The Senior Business Systems Analyst (BSA) leads the analysis and provides consulting services to plan on-going business and technology needs consistent with BC Liquor Distribution Branch’s strategic plans.
Serves as a liaison between lines of business community and the IT organization in order to provide technical solutions to meet user needs. Possesses expertise in the business unit(s) they support, as well as, an understanding of the IT organization’s systems and capabilities. Analyses lines of business operations to understand their strengths and weaknesses to determine opportunities to automate processes and functions. Assists in the business process redesign and documentation as needed for new technology. Educates the IT organization on the direction of the business. Negotiates agreements and commitments to business partners by facilitating communication between business unit(s) and IT from initial requirements to final implementation. Possesses an understanding of technological trends and uses this knowledge to bring solutions to supported business units to improve operations and enhance the LDB’s competitive edge. May make recommendations for buy versus build decision.
This position evaluates business systems varying in complexity and business significance and ensures clients requirements and priorities are understood and met throughout the systems development life cycle. This position is responsible to know and understand industry best practices and approaches to business challenges and their relation to systems solution. The position is responsible for completing detailed end-to-end business analysis, obtaining clear definition of business requirements and translating them into functional specifications, developing cost-benefit/alternative analysis, risk assessments, recommendations, and preparing branch standard documentation. The position also identifies time frames, resources/ budget requirements and presents findings to both IT and Business Leaders.
To be considered for this opportunity, applicants must submit a cover letter and resume clearly identifying how they meet the qualifications necessary for this position. This information will be used as part of the selection process.

For complete details about this opportunity, including accountabilities, please refer to the attached job profile. For specific position related enquiries, please contact Hector Wong, Manager, Wholesale Systems by phone at 604 252-2976. For more information about how to complete your job application, add/edit your resume and for more useful tips when applying for jobs, please refer to the Your Job Application page on the MyHR website. If you are still experiencing technical difficulty applying for a competition, please send an e-mail to BCPSA.Hiring.Centre@gov.bc.ca, before the stated closing time, and we will respond as soon as possible to assist you.

An eligibility list for temporary or permanent future opportunities may be established. A criminal record check is required.

NOTE: Applications will be accepted until 11:00 pm Pacific Standard Time on the closing date of the competition.
Only applications submitted using the BC Public Service Recruitment System on this website will be accepted.
Visit Careers at: www.bcldb.com
Qualifications
Education and Experience
Degree or diploma in a related discipline and/or certification in business analysis (e.g. Certified Business Analysis Professional, Certified Competency in Business Analysis) combined with a minimum of six years of recent, related experience*. An equivalent combination of education, training and experience may be considered.

Recent, related experience must include:
Business analysis including working with business users and subject matter experts to produce requirement, gap analysis, business process design, business rules and other analysis work products.
Experience with each phase of the project management life cycle and systems development life cycle.
Experience with several of the following business systems and processes are required:

Wholesale - Demand Planning, Forecasting, Warehouse Management System, Transport Management Systems, Labour Management, Replenishment, Inventory Management, Customs, Excise.
Experience with one or more of the following business systems and process is preferred:
Retail - POS, Inventory, Pricing, Markup/Promotions, Marketing, Merchandising, Replenishment, Workforce Management, Space Planning, Assortment Planning.
Corporate - Finance (A/R, A/P, G/L, Data Management, Audit, Purchasing), HR (Recruitment, Payroll, Training & Learning, Labour Relations, Occupational Health & Safety).
Knowledge
Expert knowledge of the following tools: MS Office, MS Project, VISIO
Knowledge of the software development lifecycle process and methodologies.
Knowledge of IT systems and trends in information technology
Knowledge of business modeling tools and techniques
Knowledge of cost-benefit analysis methodology
Preference may be given to those candidates with knowledge of:
Branch and Government business systems and processes (i.e. RFP, Budgeting) preferred.
Skills/Abilities
Strong time management and organizational skills to manage concurrent activities and meet timelines.
Strong negotiation and interpersonal /relationship management skills to gain acceptance from all levels within the organization of planning strategies, recommended solutions and getting agreement on priorities and requirements.
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills and demonstrated ability to communicate complex information effectively at all levels within an organization.
Demonstrated ability to apply critical thinking skills and analysis/problem solving skills to make appropriate business recommendations.
Strong ability to produce detailed written documentation.
Working Conditions
Travel may be required to visit BC LDB Distribution Centre’s in Richmond, Delta, Kamloops.

The Functional Analyst will be responsible for business requirement analysis, solution design and development of functional specifications. The ideal candidate will work with Super users and other internal IT application teams.
Responsibilities
Partner with HR/Payroll business units to understand requirements, propose new processes, and help with day-to-day activities including recurring and year-end processes.
Primary support for Oracle HR/Payroll applications.
Create and maintain Fast Formulas, Forms and Reports.
Debug production issues and resolve them quickly with permanent fixes.
Identify areas for business process improvement and efficiencies; make recommendations to improve existing processes or system functionality.
Maintain process flow, configuration, operations and user documentation.
Provide functional support for both application and business process issues
Document all requests and ensure that the project management process methodology is adhered to including submission/updates to the client board as required
Develop and execute system testing and test plans as required as well as coordinate and conduct internal user support and training
Identify and document application integration requirements
Develop and test solutions in collaboration with end-users, execute production migration and post-install support
Improve process flow and user documentation for Oracle ERP and enhance user knowledge and competency
Maintain a stable and accurate Oracle Applications production instance that meets customer needs in line with compliance and audit policies
Create and manage Oracle Support Service Requests as and when required
Design and manage the delivery of program specifications based on consultations with supervisor, programmers, external contractors and end users
Document, propose and optimize Oracle ERP applications configuration to provide best usability and information availability
Cross train internal IT on Oracle ERP new features, functionality and integrations
Desired Job Experience:
Bachelors in Computer Science, Engineering or equivalent
3-5 years functional experience in Oracle modules (HR, Payroll, GL, AP, AR, PM and PC) including requirements gathering, design, configuration, unit testing and integration testing
Experience with Oracle E-Business Suite R12+ required
Strong analytical, design and documentation skills
Strong verbal and written communication skills
Oracle design, configuration and hands on experience
Worker Type
Employee
Job Type
Regular
At SNC-Lavalin, we seek to hire individuals with diverse characteristics, backgrounds and perspectives. We strongly believe that world-class talent makes no distinctions based on gender, ethnic or national origin, sexual identity and orientation, age, religion or disability, but enriches itself through these differences.
SNC-Lavalin cares about your privacy. SNC-Lavalin and other subsidiary or affiliated companies of SNC-Lavalin (referred to throughout as “SNC-Lavalin”) are committed to protecting your privacy. Please consult our Privacy Notice on our Careers site to know more about how we collect, use and transfer your Personal Data.
By submitting your personal information to SNC-Lavalin, you confirm that you have read and accept our Privacy Notice.

LOCATION: Calgary, Alberta (CA-AB)
JOB NUMBER: 27996

Why you should join us:
Looking to join a high-energy and creative Workforce Planning and Strategies team where you can use your talent for conceptualizing and visualizing data in compelling ways that tell a story? Reporting to the Workforce Planning Team Lead, you will be accountable for supporting Suncor’s annual workforce planning processes and helping our Human Resources Strategic Partners (HRSPs) and leaders sustain those plans throughout the year. You will also be directly involved in the team’s continuous improvement efforts in process effectiveness and efficiency.
You will use your expertise to:
Partner with various internal groups to support the HRSPs and leaders to optimize workforce complement and costs and look at opportunities to provide workforce analysis to support workforce planning decisions
Identify, analyze and act on continuous improvement opportunities for workforce planning processes
Perform audits to ensure accurate and timely management of employee position and vacancy data in the workforce plan
Oversee and ensure standardized processes and procedures are documented, understood and followed
Actively participate and/or lead additional team projects
We’d like to review your application if you have…
Must-haves (minimum requirements):
Three years of experience in workforce planning, organizational management, and/or general Human Resources
A post-secondary degree in Human Resources Management, Business Administration, Statistics, Mathematics or a related discipline
Knowledge, experience and passion for data science and the core pillars (data analysis, data modeling, data engineering)
Exceptional reporting and analytical skills combined with the ability to combine, cleanse and analyze multiple data sources
Advanced proficiency with Microsoft Office; specifically Excel, Word and PowerPoint
Prioritize work appropriately while working on multiple projects to meet tight timelines
Exceptional communication skills and you are able to build strong relationships across an organization to accomplish shared outcomes
Alignment with our values of: safety above all else, respect, raise the bar, commitments matter and do the right thing
Preference for:
Experience in Business Intelligence (e.g. Power BI) reporting
Significant tactical experience working within HR technology platforms such as SAP, SuccessFactors and Business Intelligence platforms such as Power BI, Tableau
Experience with advanced programming functions, specifically visual basic for application (VBA)
Where you’ll be working, your work schedule, and other meaningful information:
You will work out of our Calgary head office, located in the Suncor Energy Centre at 150 – 6th Ave S.W.
Hours of work are a regular 40-hour work week, Monday to Friday
Why Suncor?
We are Canada's leading integrated energy company with a business portfolio that includes oil sands development and upgrading, offshore oil and gas production, petroleum refining, and product marketing under the Petro-Canada brand. Our global presence offers rewarding opportunities for you to learn, contribute, and grow in a variety of career-building positions. We live by the value of safety above all else – do it safely, or don’t do it. Our strong track record of growth and a focus on sustainability mean tremendous potential for the future. Learn about our mission, vision and values.
In addition to rewarding job opportunities, we offer an attractive employee package, including:
Competitive base salary, compensation programs, and an annual incentive program
Flexible benefits package
Rewarding pension and savings plans
Stay connected to us:
Follow us on LinkedIn, Facebook and Twitter for the latest job postings and news
Join our Talent Community and sign up to receive customized job alerts
Read our Suncor Connections newsletter to see what we’re doing in the communities we live and work in
We are an equal opportunity employer and encourage applications from all qualified individuals. We are committed to providing a diverse and inclusive work environment where every employee feels valued and respected. We will consider accessibility accommodations to applicants upon request.

Intent of the process
To staff vacant positions in the Innovation, Information and Technology Branch within Employment and Social Development Canada. This process will be used to staff similar positions with various language requirements and profiles. These positions may be staffed for an indefinite or temporary period.

Once a qualified candidate has been selected and appointed on an indeterminate basis from the established pool, they will be removed from the pool. If a candidate is selected for a term or acting appointment, they will remain in the pool for future offers.
Positions to be filled: Number to be determined
Information you must provide
Your résumé.
In order to be considered, your application must clearly explain how you meet the following (essential qualifications)
EDUCATION
Successful completion of two years of an acceptable post-secondary education program in computer science, information technology, information management or another specialty relevant to the position to be staffed.

Notes:
1. Indeterminate period incumbents of positions in the CS group on May 10, 1999, who do not possess the education prescribed above, are deemed to meet the minimum education standards based on their education, training and/or experience. They must be accepted as having met the minimum education standard whenever this standard is called for when staffing positions in the CS group.

2. It is the recognized educational institution (e.g. community college, CÉGEP or university) that determines if the courses taken by a candidate correspond to two years of a post-secondary program at the institution.

3. At the manager’s discretion, an acceptable combination of education, training and/or experience may serve as an alternative to the minimum post-secondary education stated above. Whenever the minimum education is met using this alternative, it is met for the specific position only and must be reassessed for other positions for which this alternative has been specified by the manager.
Degree equivalency
EXPERIENCE
1. Significant** and recent*** (SAP) OR extensive* and recent*** (PeopleSoft) experience in the development and maintenance of at least one of the following:
a. analyzing, programming, testing, debugging, documenting and maintaining SAP or PeopleSoft, and/or;
b. defining and maintaining SAP or PeopleSoft roles and authorizations, and/or;
c. Service Management processes, tools and techniques in an SAP or PeopleSoft context, and/or;
d. System administration and technical operations in an SAP or PeopleSoft context, and/or;
e. Solution architecture in an SAP or PeopleSoft context, and/or;
f. Application configuration in an SAP or PeopleSoft context.
2.Experience providing information management and information technology (IM/IT) advice, assistance and recommendations.
3.Experience in the analysis, investigation and resolution of IM/IT system issues.
4.Experience contributing to at least two (2) IM/IT projects or activities with multidisciplinary **** teams.

Extensive experience is defined as the breadth, depth and complexity of experience normally associated with full-time performance of the duties for a period of at least three (3) years.
** Significant experience in the context of essential qualifications is defined as the breadth, depth and complexity of experience working in an environment with a complex and leading edge SAP footprint.
*** Recent is defined as within the last five (5) years.
**** A multidisciplinary team is defined as a team composed of members with varied expertise;

Architecture, Business, Data Management, Development, Infrastructure, Project Management, Security, Testing, etc.

Various language requirements
Bilingual Imperative (BBB/BBB)
English / French Essential
Information on language requirements
KNOWLEDGE
1.Knowledge of ERP Application Processes in SAP or PeopleSoft context.
COMPETENCIES
1.Demonstrating integrity and respect;
2.Thinking things through;
3.Working effectively with others;
4.Showing initiative and being action-oriented.
ABILITIES
1.Ability to communicate effectively in writing.
2.Ability to communicate effectively orally.
PERSONAL SUITABILITY
1.Client Service Orientation.
The following may be applied / assessed at a later date (may be needed for the job)
Asset qualifications may be applied in screening, depending on the needs of the positions that arise.

ASSET QUALIFICATIONS:
1.Experience in IT Security, including security documentation and GC security policies.
2.Experience in IT Service Management processes, such as Change Management and Release Management.
3.Experience in system or application architecting.
4.Experience in Data modelling.
5.Experience with testing methodologies and best practices.
6.Experience using test automation tools, such as Load Runner and testing tools, such as UFT and QTP.

9.Significant ** and recent *** experience giving advice and recommendations to management **** on technical issues and/or strategic advice regarding IM/IT services or solutions.
10.Extensive * experience in working with Government of Canada (GoC) IT standards, infrastructure standards and the various IT technical groups in GoC and Shared Services Canada (SSC).
11.Extensive * experience in UNIX/Linux operating systems.
12.ITIL Certification.
SAP-Specific Asset Qualifications
1.Experience with SAP ASAP methodology.
2.Experience in SAP Portals.
3.Experience with SAP Solution Manager.
4.Experience with ABAP WebDynpro, BRFPlus, MDG, PSCD, Workflow, etc.
5.Experience using SAP HANA tools (HANA Studio, HANA cockpit, etc.).
6.Experience in using SAP Identity Management (IDM).

We are committed to providing an inclusive and barrier-free work environment, starting with the hiring process. ***ATTENTION*** this job advertisement will be active for 1 year; that’s because it’s an INVENTORY. What makes this different from other job advertisements? Applying to an inventory means you are not applying on a specific position, and furthermore, we will be continuously accepting resumes and conducting assessments for the duration of this advertisement. However, you only have to apply once to be considered for multiple opportunities within the IT Client Service team at the CS-01 and CS-02 level.


Apply now, as we have immediate needs to be filled and we are planning to conduct our first pre-selection of candidates from this inventory in the week of March 25th and as required by operations for the subsequent pre-selections.


We will only be accepting candidate applications from the link "APPLY ONLINE". Applications submitted by email will not be accepted. Should you have any questions about the application process, feel free to reach out to us using the Contact Information listed at the bottom of this job advertisement.
Duties
Due to the critical role technology and emerging digital platforms play within the unique work happening at Agriculture and Agri-food Canada (AAFC), this presents continuous opportunities for IT professionals to build their skills.

IT Client Service (ITCS) plays a key role in supporting the IT needs of thousands of AAFC employees by providing services ranging from standard desktop support to helping with emerging science-specific technologies within our research centers.

IT Client Services is divided into four teams, all of which will be drawing from this inventory to fill multiple vacancies across Canada:

1. IT Centre (service desk). This is the largest ITCS team and is the first line of support for all AAFC users. The team resolves IT requests/issues by phone and email and assigns more complex tickets to other ITCS teams. Responsibilities include: fulfilling user IT requests, desktop troubleshooting, ticket triage, responding to requests and questions stemming from a wide range of standard technical issues. Services are delivered remotely to users across the country. Working for this team provides the critical foundational IT support knowledge and experience required to advance in your career to positions in the other ITCS teams.

2. National IT Client Support Services (NITCSS). This team consists of science and local IT support experts and are located across the country. NITCSS provides support for scientific equipment networking & connectivity and location-specific/in-person access management. Responsibilities include: creating accounts, assisting with network access requests, performing email account administration, deploying laptops, activating and setting up cell phones, and troubleshooting more complex issues. Additionally, this team supports non-standard environments such as specialized science equipment that are housed in AAFC Research and Development Centers.

3. National Desktop Lifecycle Management (NDLM). The team of IT specialists is responsible for defining the national strategy for managing and deploying end-user hardware and software (e.g., provides guidance and expertise for major upgrades and deployments of end-user technologies). This team is also responsible for large-scale IT process and tool definition in line with industry and government standards and trends. This includes architecture and standards, asset planning, acquisition and reporting, as well as patch management activities related to the end-user computing environment.

4. IT Service Management (ITSM). The ITSM team supports the tools and processes used within ITCS. They are the department’s technical authority on the adoption and implementation of strategic process approaches under the ITIL (IT Infrastructure Library) methodology performed by the IT service provider teams. In addition, this team manages change, designs services, maintains the service portal, and performs data analysis and statistical/trend reporting used by AAFC executives for strategic business decision making.
Work environment
At Agriculture and Agri-Food Canada (AAFC) we grow a lot more than you may think. As you might expect, AAFC helps Canadian farmers and the Agri-food industry feed our country, but this is just the tip of the iceberg lettuce! An army of professionals contribute to help and support the growth of Canada's exports, while providing leadership in the growth and development of a competitive, innovative and sustainable Canadian agriculture and agri-food industry.

AAFC offers great benefits, competitive salaries, retirement pension, opportunities for advancement, and so much more!”
Intent of the process
This continuous intake inventory will be used to match talented individuals to our IT Support Technicians and IT Support Analyst positions for permanent and temporary vacancies at the CS-01 and CS-02 level, with various linguistic profiles, in multiple work locations, for immediate or future needs.

Education Requirements :

The minimum requirement is the successful completion of two years of an acceptable post-secondary educational program in computer science, information technology, information management or another specialty relevant to the position to be staffed.

The recognized educational institution (e.g. community college, CÉGEP or university) will determine if the courses taken meet the criteria of a two year a post-secondary program at the institution.

Notes:

They must be accepted as having met the minimum education standard whenever this standard is called for when staffing positions in the CS group.
2. It is the recognized educational institution (e.g. community college, CÉGEP or university) that determines if the courses taken by a candidate correspond to two years of a post-secondary program at the institution.
3. At the manager's discretion, an acceptable combination of education, training and/or experience may serve as an alternative to the minimum post-secondary education stated above. Whenever the minimum education is met using this alternative, it is met for the specific position only and must be re-assessed for other positions for which this alternative has been specified by the manager.

Let’s fast forward to the flow of this process; you will want to read this part for sure!

Step 1 – click “Apply Now” and complete your on line candidate profile.


Step 2 – Education and QUALIFICATIONS will be used to conduct our initial evaluation of candidates. We will consider your responses to the complementary online questions and your resume. In addition, you will be asked to provide information about locations you would be willing to reside and work from and if you wish to be considered for bilingual or English only positions.

Remember, QUALIFICATIONS can be acquired in more ways than one, and could include project or course work, co-op term work, volunteer or work experience.
Don't know how to complete your online complementary questions? Here’s a few tips:

Stating that you “meet the qualification” and/or listing past or current responsibilities does not represent an acceptable response. Rather, we are looking for concrete detailed examples that clearly illustrate how you meet the qualification.Résumés may be used as an additional source to validate the statements you've provided.Comments such as "refer to my attached résumé" will not be deemed acceptable responses.
Step 3 – Matching candidates with the right team is important, therefore, candidates who are successful in the initial evaluation (step 2), will be asked to complete a questionnaire on their ASSET qualifications. We wanted to keep this step easy for candidates, so will send you the questionnaire via email and you can complete it at home.

Step 4 – If you’ve expressed interest in bilingual positions, we will be asking you to complete a Second Language Evaluation. If you already have valid results, please provide them to us. If you need to be retested (reading, writing or oral) you will be contacted to make arrangements.

Step 5 – Following the previous steps, if you are shortlisted, we will be assessing candidates based on the COMPETENCIES as listed in the poster. We will provide more information on how to complete this step at the appropriate time.

Step 6 – Candidates moving forward following the last step, will be invited to an interview with our IT hiring managers.


Step 7 – References and other Conditions of Employment will be completed, including the security clearance.

Step 8 – Job Offers

Senior Vice President, IMS

Staff

 1437


Key Role
The Industry Managed Solutions team requires a Solutions Analyst to assist in managing the ongoing growth and transformation of the team. The Analyst will play a critical role on the IMS team, helping to consolidate the various streams of data and information from throughout the organization. In addition, the Analyst will help create and maintain a comprehensive set of metrics and reports which will help describe the current state of the business, identify trends and measure key vendor performance. In addition to the data-oriented responsibilities, the Analyst will be required to conduct industry research, perform industry scans, partake in vendor reviews and assist in vendor selection.

In addition to these responsibilities, the Analyst will assist in the day-to-day operation of the department which will include managing the departments SharePoint site, assisting in budgeting, resource tracking and overall administration of the team.


Duties and Responsibilities
Develop and manage reports to identify trends and opportunities within key business areas
Collect, organize and maintain information from various sources throughout the organization (incl. subscriber feedback, business requirements, sector board feedback, etc) and deliver regular status updates regarding progress within various project assignments
Conduct industry research and communicate finding to leadership;
Manage departmental communication and document SharePoint site;
Act as a conduit between the Industry Managed Solutions team and other key stakeholder in the organization
Maintain key vendor information, and monitor reporting on vendor performance against service level agreements and Key Performance Indicators
Assist with budgeting, time tracking and general administration of the IMS team


Required Knowledge, Skills, and Experience
Bachelor’s degree in Business, Technology or Engineering
2-5 years of experience in a similar role
Experience with developing and managing reports, and conducting analysis to provide insights to team members and senior leadership
Strong analytical and statistical knowledge with an ability to combine quantitative and common-sense problem-solving skills
Ability to read, comprehend, summarize and report on various sources of information such as industry articles, websites, periodicals, etc. and present findings in a succinct and professional manner
Excellent knowledge of Microsoft Office suite of products; must have exceptional Excel skills and working knowledge of MS Access (or other database management system).
Understanding of simple programing languages (such as SQL, VBA, Python)
Ability to independently gain insight into and develop process / system changes and improvements.
Self-starter, able to manage and prioritize multiple complex tasks with minimum supervision and strong attention to detail
Desire to learn and succeed in a challenging fast-paced environment
Understanding of six sigma tools and methodologies would be an asset
Strong organizational, planning and time management skills
Strong work ethic, a high respect for confidentiality and sound professional judgment

About Precima

LoyaltyOne is part of the successful Alliance Data family of companies that provide the full range of data-driven loyalty, marketing and credit solutions in more than 80 locations across the globe.
Working with more than 100 leading brands in the retail, financial services, grocery, petroleum retail, travel and hospitality industries to profitably change customer behavior. Through a team of businesses, including one of the leading coalition loyalty programs in the world, the AIR MILES Reward Program, LoyaltyOne designs, delivers and manages a suite of services focused on consumer data, customer-centric retail strategies, direct-to-consumer marketing, loyalty consulting and more.
Furthermore, LoyaltyOne has broadened their horizons geographically by growing Precima in the European market. With the recent acquisition of BrandLoyalty in the Netherlands they have gained the expertise of a global leader in short-term loyalty campaigns, along with a client network that extends throughout Europe and Asia.
Precima applies shopper insights derived from advanced analytics to help retailers and manufacturers drive sales growth and boost profitability. Using comprehensive fact bases of purchase data, their team of experts help improve marketing and merchandising by identifying opportunities for growth and align both internal teams and external partners to best meet shoppers' needs.
Precima tailors the scope and pace of its solutions to the unique priorities of each client. The overall goal is to achieve not just tactical wins but long term strategic gains, encouraging retailers to broaden the marketing agenda and fully explore the potential of sophisticated shopper insights.
Their roster of past and current clients includes many leading Fortune 1000 brands, among them some of the top high-frequency retailers in North America. Backed by first-hand experience with leading retail and manufacturing organizations, the Precima team brings a remarkable blend of expertise in loyalty, analytics, marketing and management to help you make more informed and profitable business decisions.

$37.07 - $42.13 an hourReporting to the Supervisor, Spatial Solutions Services, the GIS Data Analyst is required to maintain and assist in administering the City’s Corporate GIS database (i.e. data entry, editing, manipulation and quality control). Performs information product generation tasks (i.e. queries, geo-processing, tabular summaries and reports), and provides customer service to internal staff and external clients. Assists in the development of methodologies for database input and maintenance by staff
QUALIFICATIONS & REQUIREMENTS:
University Degree or College Diploma in Geographic Information Systems, Engineering, Land Surveying, Geography and Urban Planning or related disciplines including Library Science, Computer Science, Information Systems. Five (5) to seven (7) years of demonstrated experience and proven knowledge in mapping and spatial database analysis and user support, including practical experience working with GIS technology (Esri suite of products preferred), preferably in a municipal environment.
Must have knowledge of standards and methodologies for GIS data management including, integration, conversion, manipulation, transfer, compatibility, valuation, storage and maintenance, data security and quality controls for data entry to manage the data life cycle. Demonstrated experience and proven knowledge in designing and implementing spatial database technology, preferably in a municipal or related environment. Working knowledge and experience with a range of GIS products, processes, and principles (e.g. Esri ArcGIS), GIS databases (e.g. ArcSDE, Oracle 12c, SQL Server), GIS terminology, GIS methods and techniques, scripting languages (eg. FME, Python), cartography procedures, coordinate systems and projections, geo-spatial digital imagery, digital equipment (e.g. survey, GPS, data collectors) on-site users GIS and tool support and trouble-shooting, managing GIS software and databases.
Working knowledge of relevant legislation (i.e. Freedom of Information and Protection of Privacy Act, etc), and procedures related to information management, data standards, intellectual property rights, data security, copyright license data sharing agreements and privacy to ensure data is maintained in a secure environment and that the City's interests are met and value gained.
Must have good attention to detail and demonstrate analytical, problem solving and technical skills to manage, maintain, update and prepare database records (spatial & tabular formats), manipulating, analyzing and managing tabular and spatial data; and to resolve technical problems and information requirements by gathering/analyzing data, selecting/designing desired file and record format requirements, documenting revisions undertaken.
Knowledge of project management methodologies, including capacity to monitor projects, track work and provide input into work planning; and working knowledge of office software applications (e.g. Outlook, Word, Excel, PowerPoint) in support of communications, reporting, presentations and training.
Good written and oral communications skills including experience preparing reports, technical instructions, and data share agreements. Good interpersonal skills to effectively deal with requests and concerns of clients/partners.
Ability to work both independently as well as in a team environment, work under pressure and meet deadlines.

Join the Global Community of Scotiabankers to help customers become better off.
The Senior Business Analyst is responsible for the identification and timely execution of process improvement project initiatives which will assist the HR Service Centre to reduce structural costs and enhance the customer experience. Analyzing current processes and complete data analysis to identify potential process enhancements

Create training guides and process documents to promote accuracy and consistency across the project and team members
Participate in team meetings
Maintain confidentiality of information

Assist with existing process documentation
Share learning and insight with team members
Promote a friendly atmosphere, good morale and cooperation within and beyond own team or unit
Provide assistance with other duties as assigned

Assist with the creation of key reporting metrics and key performance indicators to communicate project milestones and measure project success

Good Microsoft Excel and Access skills.

Analytical skill to identify process improvement opportunities.
Strong organization and problem solving skills
Strong communication skills, both written and verbal
Ability to work as part of a team and High attention to detail

Why is this role important?
Reporting directly to the Delivery Lead and supporting the Loblaw Brands business unit, the successful candidate will be to be the portfolio application expert to support the business in application capability and lead the development projects.
WHAT YOU WILL DO:
Reporting directly to the Delivery Lead, the successful candidate’s role will support Loblaw Brands business through demonstrating knowledge of the application landscape functional capabilities. The Expert will work with internal stakeholders and vendors to refine and translate solution requirements into effective software applications. This Expert will be accountable to document application functional designs and maintain expert knowledge of the application landscape and the enterprise applications system flow, integration, and data elements. The Expert will also communicate functional and technical requirements to other IT teams for successful solution delivery and support.
Accountabilities
As a senior IT representative, the Expert is accountable to deliver either the overall E2E application functional design, the detailed component functional design, or both, based on a solution blueprint.
Specific accountabilities include:
Application software subject matter expert (SME) and effectively communicate current state of the application to business stakeholders , Loblaw IT and external vendors
Interpret business needs and define technical solutions for other technical teams for optimal application delivery and sustainable support
SME for technical support teams to assist in determination of root cause of application issues
Accountable for application systems technical specifications, system design collaboration, and application gap analysis, application system flow charts and data mappings
Collaborate with solution architecture for alignment with enterprise architecture and vision
Conduct code reviews when necessary
Participate in RFx activity with the Business SMEs as the functional IT lead
Support project go-live as delivery SME
Work with IT Business Leads on annual project planning
WHAT YOU WILL NEED:
Analytical skills in gathering system requirements, logical data & process modeling
Superior hands-on troubleshooting
Ability to successfully engage in multiple initiatives simultaneously
Ability to effectively communicate and negotiate
Build and maintain strong relationships
Be proactive, results-oriented, customer-focused and attentive to details
Ability to lead multi-functional discussions
Strong documentation skills
Ability to lead functional teams
Seamlessly interact with business stakeholders, gain trust, communicate effectively, interact professionally with executives, managers, and subject matter experts equally
Product Lifecycle Management experience is an asset
Food Safety experience or working in a regulatory environment is an asset
Retail experience is an asset
Experience with SQL (querying, writing scripts)
SAP PLM, QM/QIM an asset
Education and work experience
Undergraduate degree in a Business relate field or Computer combined with related experience and a strong ability to maintain good working relationships
How You’ll Succeed:
At Loblaw, we seek great people to continually strengthen our culture. We believe great people model our values, are authentic, build trust and make connections.
If that sounds like you, and you are open-minded, responsive to change and up to the challenges provided in a fast-paced retail environment, apply today.
In addition, we believe that compliance with laws is about doing the right thing. Upholding the law is part of our Code of Conduct – it reinforces what our customers and stakeholders expect of us.

Full time

Service New Brunswick is seeking individuals to join the Infrastructure Operations Branch within the Technology Services Division as a Technical Analyst.
As Technical Analyst, you will work as part of a team of professionals responsible for the continuous development, operation and support of the infrastructure for the Government of New Brunswick. The Technical Analyst team will ensure that the appropriate technology to address business and operational requirements is recommended, acquired, installed, configured and used in an efficient and effective manner.
Your responsibilities will include but are not limited to:
Providing service to SNB clients and ensuring processes and procedures are aligned to the SNB shared-services delivery model
Providing operational support of the corporate infrastructure and maintaining various systems with the primary focus on the government's line of business applications
providing system setup, installation, configuration and maintenance including but not limited to hardware, operating systems and applications
Testing and implementing updates including but not limited to firmware, system patches and application upgrades
Troubleshooting and resolving hardware, software, application and various IT equipment problems potentially engaging internal or external resources for solving complex problems
Monitoring overall performance of the IT environment and make recommendations for improvement
Responding to incidents, requests for service and support, and potentially coordinating resolution with internal or external resources
Acting as a technical resource on various IT-related projects and initiatives
Documenting and maintaining current systems, processes, and procedures
Ensuring that ITIL methodologies including Change, Incident and Problem Management are an aspect of all infrastructure and system support
ESSENTIAL QUALIFICATIONS: A university degree in Computer Science and a minimum of four (4) years of related experience.
Subject to the response to this competition, an equivalent combination of training, education and experience may be considered, or the required years of experience may be increased.
Written and spoken competence in English is required.
Applicants must clearly demonstrate the essential qualifications to be given further consideration. Please state your language capability on your application and ensure that preferred language for assessment is clearly identified.
ASSET QUALIFICATIONS: Preference may be given to candidates who demonstrate they have training or experience in one or more of the following areas:
Enterprise Operating Systems - Microsoft Windows Server 2012/R2/2016, Oracle Linux, Red Hat Linux
Middleware Applications - Apache, IIS, JBoss, Tomcat
Server Management/Monitoring tools - SCOM, SCCM
Active Directory, Group Policy administration
Patch Management strategies
Backup solutions - NetBackup, EMC Networker, Veeam, EMC Data Domain
Enterprise Servers - Cisco UCS, Dell, HP C-Class
Enterprise Storage Environments - EMC VNX, EMC Isilon, Brocade and Cisco MDS FC switches
Disaster Recovery Planning and Implementation
VMWare products - ESXi, vCenter, VROPS
Experience with networking, data center technologies, physical and virtual servers
DNS, DHCP, Digital Certificates Management
Experience with the technical implementation of client/server and three-tiered custom applications, and infrastructure management and monitoring software
Subject to the response to this competition, candidates may be required to demonstrate on their application one or more of the asset qualifications in addition to the essential qualifications in order to be given further consideration.
OPERATIONAL REQUIREMENTS: This position requires flexibility in working hours, which includes evenings and weekends. The successful candidates will be required to be on call for after-hours support.
Candidates will be required to undergo a Criminal History Clearance prior to appointment and must be willing to obtain a security clearance.
BEHAVIOURAL COMPETENCIES: The successful candidate will possess the following behavioral competencies:
Analytical Thinking/Judgment
Client Service Orientation
Effective Interactive Communication
Teamwork and Cooperation
TECHNICAL COMPETENCIES: The successful candidate will possess the following technical competencies:
Specialized Subject Matter Expertise and Knowledge
Planning & Organizing Skills
Consulting Skills
Resumes should be in chronological order specifying education and employment in months and years including part-time and full-time employment.

Customer Service & Logistics Analyst(Job Number: 18000849)
Description

Good Food, Good Life is the very essence of Nestlé. This philosophy can be traced back to our beginnings. The Nestlé Company was founded in 1867 by Henri Nestlé, who developed the first milk-based baby formula. Today, over a century later, we are recognized as the world’s largest Food and Beverage Company employing around 280,000 people and have factories or operations in almost every country in the world. Nestlé Canada has a wide variety of food, beverage and nutrition products to help you and your family live happier and healthier lives including: Gerber and Good Start, Nescafé, KitKat, Smarties, Aero, Delissio, Häagen-Dazs, Boost, Purina, and Nestlé Waters. Nestlé Canada supports your personal growth with a people-focused culture and a flexible and diverse working environment. Find out why, There is more to Life at Nestlé…

We offer you:
Great comprehensive benefits package including Health and Dental benefits that start on day one.
Excellent training and development programs as well as opportunities to grow within the company.
Comprehensive Total Rewards Package and Company Matched Retirement Plan.

The successful incumbent will be responsible for enhancing the day to day operational effectiveness of the Customer Service Logistics Operations (CSLO) team by supporting and leading CSLO initiatives that focus on building analytical capabilities to drive operational improvements and maximize business results. The job requires liaison with all facets of the Nestlé supply chain and commercial functions (as required) in order to drive operational effectiveness.

Major Responsibilities:

Build Capabilities and Talent
Provide guidance and training to functional groups related to report development, execution and analytical approach to problem solving. drive team to deliver insights and recommendations from problem solving and analysis.
Provide guidance and training to functional groups on various systems / utilities (MS Excel; SharePoint; CIC, etc.).
Drive continuous improvement by leading, coaching and participating in cross functional Nestle Continuous Excellence (NCE) projects
Support and develop solutions for CSLO related to NCE.
Continually challenge self and team on the status quo to improve decision making and problem solving.

Drive a Consumer Focused Value Chain to deliver Growth
Drive improvements and innovations to the CSLO Dashboard.
Continuously review / analyze data, and identify trends driving corrective action and modifying procedures as required to meet CSLO objectives.
Work with CSLO team to deliver value added propositions to our customers
Active participation in CSLO continual improvement projects


Optimize and Innovate processes and tools to reduce complexity
Initiate and/or support workgroup initiatives designed to identify and deliver more efficient ways of working
Enhanced use of Globe Solutions and technology to drive Best Practices; Support development and validation of new CSLO reporting solutions
Support development and execution of standard process and performance indicators that will allow for targeted opportunities to enhance results.
Organize, analyze, and synthesize facts into targeted, formatted end products to support internal and external requests.
Validate and analyze data and determine root cause and effects.
Use NCE tools to Identify opportunities in CSLO and work with the team to drive focused improvement.
Qualifications:
Minimum 3-4 years of Decision Support (Business Analytics) business experience.
Completion of a University Degree in Business Administration or Management Information System or other related field is required.
Supply Chain experience (principles and processes; knowledge of distribution, warehousing and logistics and asset) along with in-depth knowledge of SAP would be considered an asset.
Results focused with a strong service orientation, organizational and planning skills.
A results and detail-oriented professional, with exceptional verbal communication and strong analytical skills.
An assertive, well-organized self-starter with demonstrated customer service skills.
Must be comfortable working in a demanding, fast-paced, time-sensitive environment.

Please note; Education Verification, Reference Checks and Criminal Background Checks will be administered on suitably qualified candidates. If you believe you have the profile we are looking for and you want to make your mark in the World’s Largest Food and Beverage Company, we look forward to hearing from you!

Company
The City of Vancouver is striving to become the greenest city in the world, and a city powered entirely by renewable energy before 2050. We are proud to be one of BC's Top Employers, Canada's Best Diversity Employers, and one of Canada's Greenest Employers. With employees that have helped Vancouver consistently rank as one of the world's most livable cities, the City values a diverse workforce which represents the vibrant community we so proudly serve.
Consider joining our committed team of staff and being part of an innovative, inclusive and rewarding workplace.


Main Purpose and Function
The Planning Analyst provides a range of professional and technical services as part of the Research and Data team in City-Wide and Regional Planning. The emphasis is on data collection, data management, research and analysis to support the development of public policy. The Planning Analyst is responsible for conducting policy and technical analysis on a range of city-wide issues related to housing, industry, employment, transportation, and sustainability. The incumbent will work with staff across the organization, consult and liaise with staff from other agencies and levels of government as well as the development industry.

Specific Duties and Responsibilities
The successful candidate, as part of team, will provide a wide range of technical, analytical and graphic support including research and analysis; monitoring industry trends; developing visual materials and mapping. Technical planning work will include the collection, management, and interpretation of various sources of data, including the regular use of GIS, MapInfo and ESRI software. The incumbent will compile and report on technical data for the use in policy initiatives, deliver presentations and production-ready materials for senior management related to data analysis & interpretation.

The Planning Analyst is required to have broad experience with data research and analysis in urban planning and a good knowledge and understanding of quantitative methods applied to analysis and forecasting.

The Planning Analyst must exercise independent judgement in identifying, planning and executing technical functions and analysis under the general supervision of a manager. The Planning Analyst will create informational and graphic materials for public open houses and workshops, including presentations and display boards. Other duties include technical writing, research, and the preparation of material for the City’s website, fact sheets and other public documents.

Qualifications
Education and Experience:
A university degree in Planning and some professional planning experience or related university degree with experience related closely to the duties involved, or an equivalent combination of education and experience
The following is preferred or would be considered an asset:
A technical diploma in GIS and/or working experience with GIS software.
Experience in SPSS or statistics in general.
Experience with internal databases such as PRISM, POSSE, Property Tax, and Business Licenses.
Experience with external data sources such as Statistics Canada, BC Stats, and BC Assessment general knowledge of City by-laws, processes and policies.

Knowledge Skills and Abilities
Considerable knowledge in one of the areas of social, pure or applied science, or sound theoretical knowledge of urban planning.
Considerable knowledge of the current literature, trends, and developments in own area of specialization.
Some knowledge in areas adjacent to own field of specialization.
Demonstrated initiative in identifying and anticipating data research needs is desirable.
Strong organizational and project management skills.
Strong working knowledge of GIS software such as MapInfo, ArcGIS, FME is required
Demonstrated advanced graphics skills and computer skills in Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, Access, PowerPoint), Adobe Creative Suite (Illustrator, InDesign, Photoshop) or other similar graphic software and, use of the internet as a research and communication tool, are required.
A proven ability to self-manage workload, take initiative with respect to work planning, respond to changing priorities and to meet tight timelines.
Strong interpersonal and communication skills, written and verbal, and must be able to demonstrate sound research and analytical abilities and experience.
Ability to work independently, as an effective member of a team, and in collaboration with staff from other departments and the ability to complete assignments.
Experience in planning related research, monitoring, policy analysis, and communicating data findings is required.
Understanding of City and Regional planning and land use policies, knowledge of office and development trends, experience with the City’s corporate information systems or other municipal systems, and demonstrated experience with census and other external data sources is essential.
A current and valid BC Driver’s License is preferred. The license must not include any restrictions that would affect the ability to legally and safely carry out job responsibilities. Transportation arrangements must meet operational requirements of the Department

As part of the Business Intelligence Services department, the Data Analyst is responsible for the design, development, implementation and support of enhanced reporting and analytic visualizations and dashboards to continuously enhance ASEBP's ability to fulfill its mandate. This position will be responsible for developing reports, and conducting analyses on a wide variety of issues using various sources of business data and communicating findings and related interpretations/observations with primarily, but not exclusively, an internal audience. The Data Analyst will work closely with internal business customers and subject matter experts.
Your Key Responsibilities
Enhanced reporting
Develop solutions to reporting and information requirements by analyzing information needs and developing reports for ASEBP's internal and external clients.
Respond accurately and in a timely manner to ad hoc requests for data analysis and reports.
Develop visualization and dashboard reports.
Conduct analyses that identify and assess business opportunities and address key business challenges.
Provide advice on and interpretation of business data.
Provide support to plan design.
Recommend potential visualized Board report options.
Develop solutions based on information requirements.
Create queries to support ad hoc requests for data and reports that integrate a full view of the business need into actionable information.
Provide demographic and claims utilization information to the Plan Actuary for use in premium rate setting, including experience adjustments; update the historical overview of experience adjustment standings using the Plan Actuary's results.
Assist with operational reporting
Responds to reporting requests from business areas.
Action day-to-day report requests as they relate to visual data.
Assist data warehouse team
Participate in data warehouse initiatives.
Identify any data issues with the data warehouse and other source systems.

Completion of a two-year technical or community college certificate in Computer Science, Business, or a related discipline.
Three to five years of related experience.
Demonstrable experience working with:
Microsoft Reporting Services (SSRS)
Data Models
Database design & SQL Server
Other Microsoft programs.
Advanced working knowledge of data visualization tools.
Strong knowledge of data analysis and presentation tools such as Power BI or other similar BI tools.
Experience working with data warehouse facts and dimensions.
A strong understanding of the structure of relational databases and their implementation.
Your Abilities
Proven ability to work effectively with large volumes of data, business lines and plans.
Analytical abilities, attention to detail and problem solving skills.
Strong SQL, T-SQL, query writing abilities.
Ability to work independently.
Ability to organize workflow and priorities.
Strong customer service focus with the ability to meet varying client needs.

Effective time management skills with the ability to manage multiple projects over varying time lines.
Strong communication, presentation & interpersonal skills.
About the Alberta School Employee Benefit Plan
The Alberta School Employee Benefit Plan (ASEBP) is a health and welfare trust governed by ten Trustees, five of whom are appointed by the Alberta School Boards Association and five of whom are appointed by the Alberta Teachers' Association. ASEBP promotes programs that sustain healthy lifestyles and workplaces for over 60,000 covered members in almost 60 school jurisdictions across Alberta.
Working for ASEBP is about more than supplying great benefits. ASEBP offers:
a team-focused culture that supports people and performance
competitive compensation that goes far beyond a paycheque
an exciting chance to make an impact in the lives of Alberta's school employees
advancement opportunities in a stable, growing organization
a wide range of health and wellness initiatives that encompass mental, physical and nutritional health

The Demand Planning Analyst is accountable to generate and maintain an accurate operational forecast by item by customer team by distribution center on a timely basis to drive production and inventory management in the Oracle Demantra forecasting system with the objective of maximizing inventory turnover while ensuring customer service targets are achieved.
The DP Analyst will use information obtained from Sales, Marketing and Customer while applying Supply Chain planning information as input into the forecasting process. Proficient use of the Customer’s data sharing tools combined with collaboration between the Customer, Sales, and Marketing will be used to drive efficiencies throughout the entire supply chain.
This role is also responsible for facilitating the Demand & Supply Review and Consensus meetings within the S&OP/IBP process - driving effective process discipline and assisting the business to maximize Operating Income performance through effective gap management.
The DP Analyst is a primary collaboration contact with the Customer’s Replenishment department and is a key internal collaboration partner with Sales and Customer Fulfillment (CSR and/or Supply Planning). Key performance indicators for this position include, but are not limited to Forecast Accuracy, Bias, Fill Rate, and Event Performance.
ESSENTIAL JOB FUNCTIONS SUMMARY
Use collaborative Demand Planning processes to develop and maintain an operational forecast.
Leverage Customer data and collaboration to develop a robust forecasting model for turn and promotional volume.
Manage Customer forecast exceptions to eliminate forecast error.
Build and maintain customer and internal stakeholder relationships that will ultimately drive supply chain efficiency and business influence
Lead Supply Chain collaboration process with Customer and internal partners.
Conduct regular category meetings with Sales and business partners.
Monthly/Quarterly collaboration with Customer replenishment and supply chain stakeholders.
Assist with the management of store changes as communicated by Customer for modular updates (changes to planograms).
Assist with the development of exit strategies for store declines or complete item delisting, minimizing write-offs or markdowns.
Develop replenishment strategies and demand plans for new items and increased distribution (new store listings and new product introductions).
Review and resolve operational forecast issues and communicate resolution throughout the Supply Chain and Customer Logistics.
Develop strong relationships with Customer Replenishment teams, internal sales, trade marketing and finance teams to drive collaborative planning.
Collaborate with KAMs on a continuous basis to understand and anticipate market and product evolution, planned activities and then accurately adjust the forecast accordingly.
Collaborate with Marketing and Trade Marketing to forecast new product launches, discontinuation, delists, and promotions.
Manage and facilitate the monthly consensus forecast process with Trade Marketing and Sales.
Identify any sales volume gap of actual sales versus planned volume as stated in the financial plan and consensus, discuss volume gap and establish plan to close it.

Cubic Field Services Canada, LTD. (CFSC) is the wholly owned Canadian subsidiary of Cubic Global Defense (CGD) Inc., based in San Diego.
CGD provides world-class training, readiness, and communications solutions for military, security, and public safety forces. In Canada, CFSC has a long standing presence with the delivery and support of Live Training Systems.Today, CFSC is headquartered at 45 O'Connor St. Ottawa, Ontario, Canada K1P 1A4, and operates five field sites throughout Canada.
The Areas Weapon Effect System (AWES) project is in support of British Army training, and is related to its sister site in the Salisbury Plain, United Kingdom. The AWES provides state-of-the-art simulation of combat operations at the British Army Training Unit Suffield (BATUS) located at CFB Suffield in Alberta. The AWES gives the British Army an objective means of measuring troops' performance during large-scale military exercises.

Who We Are

Founded in 2010, BEworks is an unconventional management consulting firm that applies scientific thinking to transform the economy and society. Our team of experts in cognitive and social psychology, neuroscience, and marketing answer our clients' most complex business questions, execute disruptive growth strategies, and accelerate innovation. Part of the kyu collective of companies since January 2017, the firm's client list includes Fortune 500 companies, not-for-profit organizations, and government agencies. BEworks was co-founded by Dan Ariely, renowned behavioral scientist, Kelly Peters, the firm's CEO and BE pioneer, and top marketing scholar Nina Mažar.

Culture is Really Important to Us

We’re a small but mighty team that loves to work hard and play hard. We operate as a collective, bringing some of the best practices from academia to life in our day-to-day work. Our Think Tanks provide a forum for peer review; our academic advisors provide guidance on research directions and experiment design. Our ongoing “lunch and learns” include Visiting Scholars sessions with amazing scientists, our Lab provides a channel for the pursuit of primary research, and our collaboration framework provides an opportunity for the ongoing development of your scientific knowledge and skills.

Job Description

BEworks is seeking a Data Analyst who subscribes to the vision of the importance of scientific thinking and is keen to apply it to real-world challenges. In this position, you play a key role in the planning and delivery of the BEworks Method, which is a fusion of the scientific method with management consulting. As a Data Analyst, you are detail-oriented, meticulous, and an analytical team player. You ask the right questions, effectively communicate across teams, and want an opportunity to help shape what data can offer to our clients.

Main Responsibilities:

CONDUCT RIGOROUS SCIENTIFIC RESEARCH by…

Gathering, analyzing, and synthesizing existing scientific research, including insights drawn from BEworks’ proprietary IP database as well as the scientific literature

Critically evaluating existing literature to identify how the research can be applied to client contexts, as well as identifying any research gaps (i.e., what has not been studied before based on psychological concepts or behavioral economic theory)

SUPPORT MANAGEMENT CONSULTING PROJECTS by…

Evaluating client data, uncovering client assumptions, and understanding their knowledge, intuition, and priors; auditing their experimental capability

Supporting the design and execution of both large and small scale randomized control experiments

CONDUCT STATISTICAL ANALYSIS by…

Cleaning and sorting raw data for analysis

Assisting with conducting statistical analyses

Interpreting and translating results from experiment outputs

Investigating and learning new analytic methods that can be applied to experimental data

COMMUNICATE OUR INSIGHTS by…

Writing and communicating scientific ideas and summarizing experiments in a clear and accessible way

Preparing business proposals to emphasize scientific experimentation and the importance of behavioral economics

HELP US SOLVE PROBLEMS by…

Participating in group sessions where we tackle business challenges using behavioral economics tactics

Qualifications

A masters degree in any applied quantitative discipline (preference for candidates with knowledge in psychology (preferably social, cognitive, or consumer), marketing (consumer behavior focus), judgment and decision making, or economics

Strong background in statistical analysis and experiment design with the ability to handle and clean large datasets

Candidate must be able to demonstrate proficiency in R programming (proficiency in other languages i.e. Python, SPSS, etc. are beneficial but not strictly required)

Ability to create data visualizations

Ability to meaningfully interpret analyses to a business audience is a must

Demonstrated ability to interpret data from both RCT and quasi-experimental trials

Demonstrated ability to work with complex econometric models

We are looking for individuals who have:

A passion for empirical behavioral research and continuous learning

The ability and desire to work in a highly collaborative (and frankly, sometimes noisy) team

A willingness to go the extra mile

Obsessive attention to detail

The conscientiousness to be deadline driven, organized, and able to prioritize multiple competing responsibilities

Strong verbal and written skills

A willingness to travel

We welcome and encourage you to apply even if you do not think you might meet all the specified qualifications above. Though we thank you in advance for submitting your application, only qualified, selected candidates will be contacted.

You must be legally eligible to work in Canada to apply.

company_name: CHC Helicopter Corporation and Divisions of CHC
job_description:

CHC provides unmatched helicopter services that enable our customers to reach beyond – to work in remote and challenging destinations that limit others – and come home safely. We are dedicated to our purpose of getting our customers where they need to be, when they need to be there, anywhere in the world – safely and reliably.


Heli-One has an opportunity for a Senior Business Systems Analyst. The Senior Business Systems Analyst is a member of Heli-One’s global process improvement team. Reporting to the Manager, Global Production Planning and Control, the Senior Business Systems Analyst interacts with all major functional groups and applies proven technical, analytical and problem-solving abilities to help identify and communicate critical business information.


Assigned projects require this role to collaborate on cross-functional teams to design and implement more effective and efficient processes and programs. The ideal candidate possesses strong technical abilities, is comfortable working independently, in intercultural environments and adjusts easily to changing business requirements.


Responsibilities:


The Senior Business Analyst supports senior management by providing analysis, decision support, solutions and insights by:
Demonstrating analytical and problem solving capabilities through the development and implementation of efficient reports, using multiple data sources.
Understanding the interactive nature of core business activities and provides recommendations for sustainable continuous improvement of information systems.
Assimilating data from Sales, Commercial, Supply Chain, Operations and Finance teams to ensure that lifecycle reports are reflective of the entire value chain.
Using multiple research methods to interpret complex qualitative and quantitative data to develop and promote business models and frameworks.
Eliciting, validating, and documenting functional and non-functional specifications and requirements using interviews, document analysis, workshops, and surveys.
Creating, publishing and tracking operational metrics.
Conducting Ad-hoc analysis using multiple systems and business intelligence support networks.
Developing work instructions for desired processes in collaboration with Safety and Quality.
Maintaining iterative improvements to short and long run forecasts.
Establishing and maintaining relationships with internal and external stakeholders.
Providing superior communication when delivering training, technical support or mentorship to multiple levels and business units.
Employees must comply with and adhere to all company policies
May perform other duties as assigned.
International travel may be required.


Required Qualifications:


Essential
Post-secondary education in computer science, business, engineering, related discipline or a combination of education, training, and experience.
Minimum of 5 years of Business Analyst or System Analyst experience.
Security clearance and passport is required.


Skills/Experience:
Proficient intermediate-advanced practical experience with Excel, SQL Server, Salesforce, Tableau, SharePoint, AMOS (ERP or equivalent) and statistical software applications.
Possesses strong ability to manage multiple projects within short deadlines.
Demonstrated ability to define business requirements and solution designs.
Working technical knowledge of programming languages.


Attributes/Behaviors:
Ability to balance a varied and demanding workload.
Excellent written and oral communication skills.
Excellent listening and interpersonal skills.


Please apply ONLINE at www.chcheli.com to be considered for this position.


CHC welcomes and encourages applications from all qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin or disability. If required we are able to provide reasonable accommodations for persons with a disability throughout the selection process. We fully comply with all local, national and regional regulations governing employment practices. Alternate formats are available upon request to EmploymentEquity@chcheli.com.

You are well organized and passionate about finance and accounting. LIFE AT BRP
At BRP, we have a visceral connection to our consumers, one created from a shared passion for the Ultimate Ride. Our teams have a unique ability to develop market-shaping products and services that move people physically and emotionally.
Distributed throughout more than 100 countries, our product line-up includes Ski-Doo and Lynx snowmobiles, Sea-doo watercraft, side-by-side all terrain vehicles, Can-Am Spyder roadsters, Evinrude marine propulsion systems, marine propulsion systems and motors for Rotax karts, motorcycles, and small planes, as well as a full line-up of parts, accessories, and clothing.
Our 10 000 employees make up a big family of diverse cultures who all share a common value: innovation. Our people are passionate and qualified; by joining BRP, you will evolve at the heart of an experienced team that will welcome you with open arms.
www.brp.com.
