LinkedIn @BRP
Twitter@BRPnews
YouTube @CommunicationsBRP
The Marketing Data Quality Analyst is a new position within the Market Intelligence team. You will develop a deep understanding of all the marketing data we collect, perform effective data quality analysis, validation and troubleshooting, with the support of our partners. You will implement quality control measures, define and document best practices to reduce and resolve data anomalies, and maintain data integrity by proactively analyzing data to support organizational goals.
You will be highly involved in defining Consumer data governance rules and best practices, as part of the BRP Master Data Management Committee, as well as assist in reporting, dashboard creation and participate in the development and implementation of new projects involving Consumer Data.
Interested? We are looking for a bright individual who loves data and analytics and who demonstrates a willingness to go the extra mile, takes on the responsibility of doing what needs to be done, has a positive attitude and rolls with changes. This person will have a great opportunity to join a committed and talented team of data enthusiasts.
YOUR KEY RESPONSIBILITIES
Ensure data integrity, accuracy and consistency across Brands and Regions for both online and offline data through data quality analysis.
Prepare, manipulate and manage extensive databases.
Develop metrics and measures for quality control on an on-going basis through data visualization and manipulation tools.
Manage the testing and work on bug fixing or data improvements as needed.
Ensure scorecards and reports get accurately updated, review business rules, support the team with data connectivity and investigate discrepancies.
Promote productive relationships between stakeholders and external partners, providing clarity and ensuring processes are streamlined.
Be actively involved in the Enterprise data governance and develop data dictionaries that adhere to corporate data standards.
YOUR QUALIFICATIONS AND SKILLS
Four (4) to seven (7) years of related experience (SAP, SQL Server, Oracle, Salesforce, etc.)
University degree in computer science, business intelligence or another related field
Technical experience with customer marketing technologies and tools is a huge plus
Knowledge of Power BI is a plus
Excellent communication (both verbal and written)
Strong analytical skills
Passion for data and flexible, creative approach to problem solving
Strong organization skills and ability to prioritize multiple tasks with tight deadlines, changing priorities and occasional urgent matters while managing time efficiently and communicating to business and other stakeholders accordingly
Strong teamwork skills with ability to work in a matrix team environment with both internal and external counterparts
The selected candidate will work either in Montreal or Sherbrooke. He/She may have to travel occasionally to other BRP offices (Valcourt, Montreal or Sherbrooke offices - carpooling available).
AN EXCEPTIONAL AREA!
The Eastern Townships, located at the very south of the province, shares a border with the United States over close to 300 km (186 mi). The charm comes on thick as you forge your way into this paradise of mountains, hills and valleys. The architectural heritage, evidence of the Anglo-Saxon legacy, has transformed the towns into the most picturesque of places. 80% of the territory is covered by forests. Come the fall season, an abundance of colour covers the branches. To the sheer delight of outdoor enthusiasts, four national parks, including Parc national du Mont-Orford, and many other natural areas provide their share of activities, no matter the season: hiking, biking, camping, skiing and so much more. A favourite vacation destination, the Eastern Townships offers a good selection of B&Bs and inns, not to mention spas and health centres. Agritourism completes the region’s circle of charm, with five different circuits exploring vineyards, orchards, country-style dining, terroir delights and sugar shacks. In fact, the region counts several vineyards, all very different from one another, such as the Vignoble Le Cep d’Argent where you can discover the pleasure of their palatable wine.

job_title: Technical Business Analyst Specialist- Toronto, ON
job_description:
Requisition ID: 45575
Join the Global Community of Scotiabankers to help customers become better off.
Job Purpose
The Business Analyst Specialist will lead and be responsible for the effective analysis, design, development, implementation of reporting in order for Scotiabank's compliance with OTC Derivatives Reforms such as Dodd Frank, EMIR and similar rules in Canada, and Asia. The candidate will need to interact with various stakeholders including Business Analysts from other systems, business stakeholders, developers, vendors, infrastructure and Compliance. The incumbent will influence the technological solution in relationship to architecture, design and development and leverage common components and enterprise technologies as part of delivering the solution.
Key Accountabilities
Contribute to projects being on schedule and meeting regulatory reporting requirements.
Design strategic solutions for new regulatory initiatives.
Identify user requirements by working with a number of key individuals from the business and IT, producing high-level business requirements and liaising with development to take these through to a detailed functional specification.
Follow the Software Development Life Cycle methodology and prepare test plan and test cases for IST testing.
Manage business testing through the quality assurance team for key projects.
Build relationships and communicate effectively with colleagues in all region.
Act as the project lead on future regulatory projects.
Lead on the stand-ups in daily scrum meetings.
Functional Competencies
The incumbent must be a creative, self-starting, results-oriented and highly motivated individual with very good analytical skills in order to apply this knowledge to assist in the resolution of complex business problems and work in an Agile Environment.
The incumbent must possess very good interpersonal and communication skills in order to effectively work with end users and members of the BAU team. The incumbent is expected to use diplomacy, judgement and persuasion to secure agreement and cooperation from departments involved in a project.
Have functional knowledge of OTC derivatives products and related regulations
Experience working across multiple teams and functions to ensure alignment
Ability to adapt quickly to new processes and standards, with a strong commitment to providing exceptional customer service
Experience of managing projects that span change in multiple front-office systems and teams
Proven ability to translate business requirements into technical specifications and deliver working results.
Background in client on-boarding processes/procedures preferable
Understanding of regulations and implementation of regulations
Understanding Operational policy, procedures and control implications as a result of the regulation
Education/ Experiences
A recognized under-graduate degree in business, mathematics, computer science or a related discipline.

Working knowledge of Agile Project Management, Risk Management and Change Management skills
Advance Excel/Visio skills
Working knowledge of FpmL, Python, SQL, JIRA, Confluence is an asset
Minimum 3-5 years of related experience in either technology, compliance or regulatory area.

We will work with you to provide as seamless a recruitment experience as possible.

Business Analyst
Winnipeg, MB

Are you?
...passionate about process improvement?
... A motivated analyst with strong reasoning abilities and sound technical skills?
... Results-oriented professional, with good communication skills?

Then we have the opportunity for you!

The Business Analyst (BA) is a key contributor to the implementation of process and systems improvement initiatives within the Continuous Improvement (CI) department. The BA is responsible for identifying opportunities and managing requests for systems and process change, and managing projects to implement those changes. This includes gaining an understanding of current processes and systems, identifying potential solutions, organizing working groups and communicating with software developers. The BA is also responsible for planning the implementation of solutions and supporting the training of users as needed. As a member of Bison's overall Systems group the BA is committed to providing quality solutions through delivery of timely changes to, and complete support of, existing tools and processes.

Key Responsibilities:

Gaining an understanding of and documenting current processes through participation in and/or facilitating of brainstorming sessions, root cause analysis or other discovery practices with stakeholders.
Performing analysis of business processes, highlighting issues and challenges, then assisting in the definition of the challenge and recommending improvements.
Project management; consistent build out of plans, act as liaison between the customer and the CI/developer teams, ensuring completion of projects.
Implementation of projects; Driving to implementation on projects, coordinating with L&D (Learning & Development) for training of users. Including support on creation of documentation as required.
Monitoring the implemented solution to ensure continued adoption of the tool or process change.
Report writing and analysis.
Benchmarking and innovation.
Qualifications:

Post-secondary education with a focus on any combination of Business Analysis, Economics, Supply Chain, Logistics, Management Information Systems (MIS) or demonstrated experience.
Pursuit of a formal certification in Project Management or Business Analysis is an asset.
Strong analytical, problem-solving and conceptual skills.
Strong written and oral communication skills.
Strong interpersonal skills.
Demonstrated experience in gathering, working with and coordinating teams.
Demonstrated facilitation skills.
Strong organizational skills, with the ability to oversee projects.
Strong interviewing skills, effective data gathering.
Ability to perform analysis and present information with clear conclusions and recommendations.
Possess a strong desire to "do things better" with a willingness to get involved at the base level to make that happen.
General understanding of the programming process.
Project management, business process management, or business analysis experience is an asset.
Knowledge of Six Sigma or Lean methodologies is preferred (experience or education).

job_title: Supply Chain Analyst - SD Key User
job_description:
Our purpose is simple and compelling: To release the natural power of stone to enrich modern living.
ROCKWOOL products save energy and water and reduce CO2 emissions, protect buildings from the spread of fire; reduce waste; improve acoustic comfort, building performance and aesthetics; and enhance Precision Growing, thereby improving the efficiency of fresh food production.
While the stone we use may be millions of years old, what we do with it is cutting-edge. Every day, ROCKWOOL colleagues are developing and applying new technologies to release yet more potential of stone wool to enrich modern life.
Would you also be proud to enrich society like we do? now to join us as we improve modern living conditions for millions of people worldwide.
POSITION: Supply Chain Analyst
The ROCKWOOL Group’s main business area is building insulation, providing thermal comfort along with fire safety and acoustical comfort for all types of buildings.
This is the Role:
Responsible for gathering data and conducting analysis with the goal of improving the organizations’ s supply chain
operations.
Sets and or, works within the guidelines of decision authority
Respects, listens, learns and challenges others thinking in a constructive manner to help all to improve in everything that we do.
Produces solutions to various challenges and problems, and able to connect one issue with the bigger picture.
Analyses and structures information and communications to meet audience’s needs.
Seeks new opportunities and ways to improve.
Develops innovative products, processes, ideas and solutions.
Utilize computer systems and software in order to research, analyze and document failures and inefficiencies in the supply chain in order to improve overall supply chain effectiveness.
Supply Chain Reporting – Create and generate reports as required by Supply Chain Management using Business Warehouse and Rockbis queries.
Maintain Price records in SAP
Coordinate Online Price List updates.
Maintain external Customer data bases.
Generate monthly Claims report
Analyse Customer issues to develop tools and process to improve customer satisfaction.
Execute SD related projects, including testing, documentation, and analysis

Liaise with GRIT EDI support team, perform system testing

Computer literate (Word, Excel)
5+ years’ experience in a related functional area

Good communication skills,
Passionate and values driven and will embrace the company’s core values including integrity, honesty and trust
Problem solving abilities
Practical business sense

Interested?

ABOUT ROCKWOOL North America
At the ROCKWOOL Group, we are committed to enriching the lives of everyone who comes into contact with our solutions. Our expertise is perfectly suited to tackle many of today’s biggest sustainability and development challenges, from energy consumption and noise pollution to fire resilience, water scarcity and flooding. Our range of products reflects the diversity of the world’s needs, while supporting our stakeholders in reducing their own carbon footprint. Stone wool is a versatile material and forms the basis of all our businesses. With approx. 10,500 passionate colleagues in 38 countries, we are the world leader in stone wool solutions, from building insulation to acoustic ceilings, external cladding systems to horticultural solutions, engineered fibres for industrial use to insulation for the process industry and marine & offshore. We encourage you to join our team!

PermanentWhat is the opportunity?
As a Digital Insight Analyst you will work closely with Product Owners and development teams, to promote the growth and continuous improvement of RBC’s digital channels through in-depth analytics. Ranked among the top digital experience across North America, RBC is always looking for ways to delight and improve the user experience through improved use of analytics at the point of client interaction.

In this role you will work alongside a RBC product owner, and be responsible for analyzing the digital behavior of clients and providing modeling and execution support to assist in personalizing experiences. Digital Insight Analysts will provide objective, value-added insights and analysis to help drive optimization across products KPIs (i.e increased usage and sales recommendations). The person in this role will build critical understanding of our customers and how they use our products and help the team be a strong internal voice for the power of analytics as a driver of business value. The delivery of business value in this role comes from a combination of knowledge transfer to key stakeholders and the provisioning of data services and tests to client facing applications (Public websites, Online Banking, Mobile apps).

What will you do?
Analyze large data sets and representing the behavior of digital product users to provide insights about user actions that help owners optimize on KPIs (i.e. conversions, attribution models, path analysis, cohort analysis, conversion analytics, etc.)
Consult with digital team leaders to understand goals and identify potential analytics projects or solutions to further the objectives of the Digital Product teams
Support Multivariate and A/B testing by exposing core insights from the data to suggest, create and execute multivariate or a/b/c tests that drive fundamental improvements to the site experience.
Responsible for managing and developing business relationships with Digital product owners and key partners, including conducting regular monthly business reviews
Deliver clear, concise and timely analysis with team members and stakeholders identifying trends, issues and opportunities, performance analysis, dashboards, benchmarking, sales reports, customer profile/segmentation, etc.
Work closely with developers to dynamically modify digital content based on business rules and models


Prepares and delivers presentations to Digital product owners and Senior Leaders

What do you need to succeed?
 Must-have
4+ years' experience in related digital product development or data mining role
BA/BSc or above in mathematics, statistics, economics, computer science, software engineering or related quantitative field
Advanced knowledge of R, Python, SQL or SAS
Understanding of marketing analytics, data mining, experimentation and measurement
Knowledge of web and mobile development processes
Ability to multi-task and prioritize/complete projects in a timely manner
Strong team player with track record of collaboration and experience working as part of an agile team
Excellent verbal, written, communication and presentation skills
Highly detail oriented and comfortable with large amounts of data
Proven analytics and problem solving skills
Strong drive and desire to understand relationship of organizational components

Nice-to-have
Familiar with online tools such as Google Analytics Premium and Tableau,
Knowledge of graph analytics (Neo4j, DataStax, Neptune)
Experience with the deployment of APIs and services for front-end personalization
Ability to code in Scala
Knowledge of statistical modeling and forecasting

DAI

About RBC
Royal Bank of Canada is Canada’s largest bank, and one of the largest banks in the world, based on market capitalization. We are one of North America’s leading diversified financial services companies, and provide personal and commercial banking, wealth management, insurance, investor services and capital markets products and services on a global basis. We have over 80,000 full- and part-time employees who serve more than 16 million personal, business, public sector and institutional clients through offices in Canada, the U.S. and 37 other countries. Le Consultant Fonctionnel supporte (support de niveau 1, purement fonctionnel) les utilisateurs client tout au long de la mise en œuvre du projet et du déploiement.
Principales responsabilités:

Analyser et documenter le fonctionnement des processus PLM en place chez le client lors de la phase initiale de l’intervention
Procéder à l’identification des besoins fonctionnels de l’organisation conformément au protocole établi dans le cahier de charge du projet.
Participer, sous la supervision de l’Architecte de solutions, à la définition de l’architecture fonctionnelle de la nouvelle solution ainsi qu’au développement du modèle de données associé.
Rencontrer les parties prenantes au projet pour effectuer la cueillette des besoins spécifiques et bien circonscrire les attentes en termes de livrables.
Réaliser une analyse concordance-écart (fit/gap analysis) à partir des données colligées pendant les phases préliminaires de diagnostic et de cueillette des besoins
Identifier et recommander des solutions pratiques aux problèmes d’efficacité organisationnelle du client.
Produire les spécifications fonctionnelles et la documentation technique associées à la nouvelle solution PLM. Coordonner et superviser la phase de configuration/paramétrage de la nouvelle solution PLM.
Supporter les membres de l’équipe de projet tout au long du processus d’implantation et/ou d’intégration de la solution (Analystes d’affaires, développeurs, clients internes, Architecte logiciel, etc). Supporter la mise en production de la nouvelle application.
Produire un plan de test en bonne et due forme et planifier le calendrier des activités de test (Test unitaire, test performance, test systèmes/intégration, test acceptation)
Supporter le gestionnaire de projet dans le design de la stratégie d’implémentation.
Participer, au besoin et à la demande de l’Architecte logiciel, à l’évaluation de la viabilité technique de la solution.
Produire le matériel pédagogique destiné à la formation des utilisateurs. Encadrer et former les différents utilisateurs
Effectuer toutes autres tâches connexes pouvant aider à la réalisation du projet.
Compétences recherchées:

** IMPORTANT DE POUVOIR VOYAGER AU CANADA ET AUX ÉTATS -UNIS **

Détenir un baccalauréat en génie mécanique, génie logiciel ou toute autre formation jugée équivalente.
2 à 5 ans d'expérience pertinente à titre d’analyste fonctionnel dans l’industrie du PLM (Product Lifecycle Management), Connaissance fonctionnelle de la plate-forme ENOVIA V6 et/ou 3DExperience.
Antécédents vérifiables en implantation PLM dans le secteur manufacturier (Biens de consommation) considéré comme un atout
Grande capacité à synthétiser un fort volume d’information.
Capacité à gérer des situations complexes/ambìgues d’une manière claire, professionnelle, cohérente et concise
Sens de l’initiative, souci du détail
Capacité à travailler en équipe
Excellente communication tant à l’oral qu’à l’écrit
Bilinguisme

Job description:

Working under the supervision of a Solution Architect or Project Manager, the Functional Consultant supports the Solution Architect in documenting the use cases, the functional specifications, test plans and scenarios and assist in the execution of the acceptance and integration testing. The Functional Consultant understands the solution; the application modules they are implementing.

The Functional Consultant supports (level 1support) the customer’s end-users throughout the project implementation and deployment.

Main responsibilities:

Analyze and document the performance of the client’s existing PLM processes during the initial intervention phase.
Identify the organization’s functional needs in accordance with the protocol established in the project management book.
Participate ¾ under the solutions architect’s supervision ¾ in defining the functional architecture of the proposed solution as well as in developing the associated data model.
Meet with project stakeholders in order to collect and document specific needs and clearly define expectations in terms of deliverables.
Complete a fit-gap analysis from the data collected during the preliminary diagnostic and needs-related data collection phases.
Identify and recommend practical solutions to the client’s organizational efficiency issues.
Produce functional specifications and technical documentation associated with the new PLM solution. Coordinate and supervise the configuration/settings definition phase of the new PLM solution.
Support the project team over the course of the entire implementation process and/or integration of the solution (business analysts, developers, internal clients, software architect, etc.). Support the production of the new application.
Build a comprehensive testing plan and prepare the testing activities schedule (unit testing, performance testing, systems/integration testing, acceptance testing).
Support the project manager in designing the implementation strategy.
Participate, as needed and at the request of the software architect, in assessing the technical viability of the solution.
Produce educational material aimed at training users. Guide and train different users.
Handle all related tasks aimed at project completion.
Desired qualifications:

** IMPORTANT TO BE ABLE TO TRAVEL TO CANADA & USA **

Bachelor’s degree in mechanical engineering, software engineering or other equivalent training.
2 to 5 years of relevant experience working as a functional analyst in the PLM (Product Lifecycle Management) industry. Functional knowledge of the ENOVIA V6 and/or 3DExperience platforms.
Verifiable history implementing PLM in the manufacturing sector (consumer goods) is considered an asset.
Strong ability to synthesize big volumes of information.
Ability to manage complex/ambiguous situations in a clear, professional, consistent and concise manner.
Initiative and attention to detail.
Team player.
Excellent oral and written communication skills.
Bilingualism.

We are currently seeking motivated and knowledgeable professionals to provide exceptional internal customer service in the areas of financial reporting and processes, budgeting, forecast and analysis, as well as internal controls and procedures.

Main Responsibilities
As a member of the Finance team and reporting to the Financial Business Analyst, you will provide financial support to City departments in the areas of:
Financial reporting and analysis
Procurement
Revenue and expenditure
Payroll (scheduling and processes)
Management of assets and reserves
Accounting for capital projects
Priority Based Budget (PBB) support in the areas of:
Preparation, analysis and forecasting
Development, monitoring and reporting of Performance Measures and KPI's
In addition, you will be looked upon for the implementation and monitoring of standard internal controls, processes and procedures, business process improvement support, data analysis and resulting recommendations for the purposes of mitigating risks and pursuing opportunities. You will also be providing on-going training to various levels of staff throughout all City departments.

Qualifications
The successful candidate will be a resourceful, approachable team member who thrives on people and professional challenges in a progressive and constantly advancing environment. You will have a University degree with a minimum of two years related experience, as well as preference will be given if you hold a professional designation as a CPA or are currently enrolled in the CPA program as a student.
Additionally, you will have experience in public accounting and/or local government accounting and finance, experience with financial analysis, computer information processing and financial system experience.

The City of Grande Prairie is proud to be an Employer of Choice!

City Hall

40 Hours per week

Starting at $41.88/hour

Expert, Data Quality
Expert, Data Quality

At CN Rail, we work together to move our company—and our country—forward. We invest more than $100 million every year on projects and infrastructure. We harness the power of information to guide our decisions, and the Enterprise Architecture team is a critical part of the engine that keeps us in motion.
CN’s Enterprise Architecture Team is transforming our organization and is focused on building the future of rail technology. We are looking for the brightest, collaborative and most innovative minds in the industry to help us achieve our goals. If you are passionate about Artificial Intelligence, Deep Learning, Industrial Internet of Things, big data platforms and enjoy solving complex problems, CN is looking for you.
Want to know more about the Enterprise Architecture team, and the meaningful work we do in Information & Technology?

ABOUT THE ROLE

As part of the Enterprise Architecture organization, the Expert, Data Quality will act to align technology strategy and expenditure with business priorities and objectives. He/she will be responsible for translating business strategy into a fit for purpose business and technology architecture that ensures stable, reliable, resilient and efficient service delivery that meet customer needs and enable innovation. Further, he/she will define and drive best-in-class Enterprise Architecture principles including a common service-oriented architecture, consistent technical frameworks and guidance, and a loosely coupled agile architecture across the organization.

The Expert, Enterprise Architecture will provide technical oversight for Specialists, Enterprise Architecture and for other participants who are assigned in supporting the above tasks.

The discipline of data quality management ensures that data is "fit for purpose" in the context of existing business operations, analytics and digital business scenarios. The purpose of this role is to be responsible for the implementation of data quality at CN in the context of a project or support to a business area.

RESPONSIBILITIES

Data Quality Management at CN involves the tasks for data discovery, data improvement and data quality monitoring using the best tools in the market. In this role your will execute the following activities:

Data Discovery:
Profile data sets making use of data visualization, quality and sql tools.
Identify and document data quality issues.
Prepare a data quality assessment with recommendations for high quality data.
Work together with data governance to elaborate a data readiness assessment.
Work together with information architects to elaborate source-target data mappings and data migration strategies.
Work together with solution architects to analyze and document data flows and integration specifications.
Data Improvement: Data Quality Rules Definition and Enforcement:
Design of data quality rules using as inputs data defects, business rules and data governance policies.
Maintain the enterprise data quality rules catalogue.
Work together with business leads/users to identify and validate data quality requirements are complete, consistent and achievable; and ensure decisions are documented.
Work together with data governance to define the enforcement of data quality rules within the organization.
Work together with internal and external software delivery teams to implement and deploy DQR
Data Quality Monitoring:
Design of data quality metrics and scorecards.
Design and build data quality monitoring dashboards.
Work together with data governance to define monitoring frequency and ownership.
Participate in data defects root-cause analysis with business users and data governance.

Other Tasks:
Coordinate with the project team and members of other data practices (IA, DG, BI) to clarify the tasks, scope and deliverables
Support the presentation the data quality practice to Project Sponsors and other stakeholders
Coach junior team members
REQUIREMENTS
Bachelor's degree in computer science, information systems or a related study (such as library science), or equivalent related project experience.
5-10 years understanding, designing and implementing data quality standards that enable well-integrated transactional, collaborative and analytical systems
Experience with various data profiling and data quality assessment techniques
Experience with various aspects of Information Management at the enterprise level (data governance, data quality, master data management, information life cycle, etc.)
7-10 of Experience with business intelligence, data warehousing, relational database and other data structures
Significant and proven experience in applying a structured approach to problem resolution.
Ability to derive technical requirements from vaguely formulated business needs.
Strong analytical and conceptual skills
Strong communication skills - ability to create material for a variety of stakeholders.
Experience with TOAD or similar database management tool
Experience with Qlik View or similar data visualization tool
Experience with Informatica Data Quality Analyst or similar data profiling tool
Experience with Informatica Data Quality Developer or similar ETL tool (an asset)
Experience with Informatica MDM or similar MDM tool (an asset)
Assets
Knowledge of rail, transportation or logistics industry
Knowledge of best practices and latest trends in the enterprise architecture practice and emerging technologies (service-oriented-architectures; data-centric design; cloud technologies and containers; advanced analytics; AI; Industrial IoT;, networking infrastructure; mobile technologies; etc.)

CN is an employment equity employer and we encourage all qualified candidates to apply. We thank all applicants for their interest, however, only candidates under consideration will be contacted. Please monitor your email on a regular basis, as communication is primarily made through email.

job_title: Formulary Program's Analyst / Analyste, programmes formulaires
job_description:
Résumé du poste
Relevant du Chef, programmes formulaires, l’Associé, programmes formulaires, coordonne, analyse et communique les activités qui ont une incidence sur les programmes formulaires volontaires des clients. Le ou la titulaire du poste aide les équipes de stratégie d’approvisionnement et des opérations d’approvisionnement et soutient activement les négociations dirigées par le directeur, programmes formulaires et analytique commerciale. Le ou la titulaire du poste doit communiquer avec vigueur et de façon efficace en traitant avec les bannières de détail et de nombreuses agences provinciales qui gèrent les listes de médicaments.
Section A – Responsabilités spécifiques
Génération de revenus (50 %)
Analyser les mises à jour des programmes formulaires et en évaluer les conséquences pour les participants aux régimes et la génération de revenus.
Cerner les risques et les problèmes possibles relatifs aux modifications apportées aux listes de médicaments et proposer des solutions aux principaux intervenants touchés (équipes de stratégie d’approvisionnement et de détail).
Communiquer l’information sur les molécules récemment couvertes par les listes provinciales aux équipes de stratégie d’approvisionnement et de planification de la demande pour veiller à ce que les prévisions soient ajustées en conséquence.
Recueillir l’information pertinente sur l’introduction des nouvelles molécules, l’information sur la concurrence et d’autres renseignements et préparer des rapports pour appuyer la mise en œuvre d’initiatives stratégiques.
Recenser les chutes de prix antérieures pour trouver des solutions pour les participants aux programmes et fournir des rapports sommaires aux principaux intervenants au besoin.
Collaborer avec l’acheteur-planificateur pour surveiller les niveaux des stocks, l’exactitude des données sur les molécules, la couverture provinciale, les fournisseurs choisis, l’établissement des prix et pour communiquer l’information pertinente aux participants aux programmes et aux intervenants internes, en assurant l’exécution sans faille des programmes formulaires.
Cerner les principaux problèmes des fournisseurs, chercher une solution de façon proactive et assurer un suivi approprié des demandes de renseignements des clients.
Analyser l’information sur les produits de remplacement qui ont une incidence sur les programmes formulaires et évaluer les répercussions financières.
Soutien à la gestion des pénuries de marché et des performances fournisseurs.
Maintenance du système (25 %)
Collaborer avec les équipes responsables de l’information sur l’approvisionnement pour appuyer les modifications au système de substitutions automatiques au besoin.
Travailler directement avec les solutions technologiques pour les pharmacies pour éviter ou corriger tout écart dans les bases de données et en documenter les causes au besoin.
Soutenir les clients en répondant aux questions sur les spécifications techniques du système relatives aux programmes formulaires et à toute autre question relative aux listes ou à l’établissement des prix.
Maintenir le calendrier des versements des clients et coordonner les paiements directement avec les principales personnes-ressources des clients.
Gestion des relations (20 %)
Travailler directement avec les fournisseurs et les agences provinciales pour transmettre l’information pertinente relative à la période estimée de couverture des molécules.
Valider la faisabilité des demandes pour soutenir l’équipe des opérations d’approvisionnement lors de l’introduction d’une nouvelle liste.
Participer activement à l’harmonisation des programmes entre les clients de McKesson.
Créer et entretenir de solides relations avec les fournisseurs et les principales personnes-ressources des gouvernements provinciaux.
Contribuer aux projets nouveaux et existants relatifs aux programmes formulaires.
Entretenir une excellente connaissance des règlements provinciaux et de l’interchangeabilité des molécules.
Section B – Responsabilités générales
Autre (5 %)
Maintenir une connaissance commerciale pertinente des catégories de produits et rester au courant des tendances et conditions du marché et de l’industrie.
Agir à titre d’ambassadeur ou ambassadrice de McKesson en incarnant les valeurs de l’entreprise.
Section C – Exigences du poste
Expérience de travail
Minimum de 5 à 7 années d’expérience dans l’industrie pharmaceutique et la pharmacie de détail.
Formation en sciences (atout).
Excellente compréhension des agences provinciales qui gèrent les listes de médicaments.
Éducation
Baccalauréat en administration des affaires.
Formation en sciences de préférence.
Compétences générales et en perfectionnement personnel
Excellentes compétences en communication.
Aptitude au travail d’équipe.
Compétences analytiques.
Orientation sur les solutions.
Excellente capacité à collaborer avec les différents niveaux de gestionnaires et d’employés
Compétences techniques
Bilinguisme, tant à l’oral qu’à l’écrit.
Excellentes connaissances des logiciels MS Office (PowerPoint, Word, Project et Visio), Excel est un nécessaire; PowerBI un atout majeur.
Connaissance des processus d’approvisionnement et de la gestion de projet.
Compréhension des systèmes de commandes au détail.
Autres compétences et capacités
Expérience solide à travailler avec la haute direction.
Capacité à travailler au sein d’équipes multifonctionnelles.
Grande attention aux détails.
Capacité à cibler les enjeux qui ont des répercussions sur les finances et le service et à mettre en place des solutions de manière proactive.

Job Summary
Reporting to the Manager, Formulary Programs, the Analyst, Formulary Programs, is responsible for coordinating, analyzing and communicating activities impacting customer formulary programs. The role assists the Procurement Strategy and Procurement Operations teams, and actively supports negotiations led by the Senior Manager, Formulary Programs & Business Analytics. The incumbent requires strong and effective communication when dealing with retail banners and numerous provincial formulary agencies.
Section A – Specific Responsibilities
Revenue Generation (50%)
Analyzes provincial drug formulary updates and evaluates the impact on formulary program participants and on revenue generation.
Identifies potential issues and risks related to formulary changes and proposes solutions to key stakeholders impacted (Retail and Procurement Strategy teams).
Communicates information on molecules newly covered by provincial formularies to the Procurement Strategy and Demand Planning teams to ensure forecasts are adjusted accordingly.
Gathers relevant information on new molecule introduction, competitive information and other insights, and prepares reports to support the implementation of strategic initiatives.
Identifies past price drops to determine solutions for program participants, and provides key stakeholders with summary reports as required.
Collaborates with the Buyer-Planner to monitor stock levels, molecule data accuracy, provincial coverage, selected vendors, pricing and to communicate relevant information to program participants and internal stakeholders, ensuring seamless execution of formulary programs.
Identifies and proactively addresses key vendor issues, and ensures appropriate follow-up for customer inquiries.
Analyzes alternative product information affecting formulary programs and assesses the financial impacts.
Support market shortage management and vendor score cards
System Maintenance (25%)
Collaborates with Procurement Information to support auto-substitution system changes when required.
Works directly with Pharmacy Technology Solutions to avoid and/or correct any discrepancies with databases, and documents causes as required.
Supports customers by answering questions on technical system specifics related to the formulary program and any other formulary/pricing matters.
Maintains the customer payout schedule and coordinates payments directly with key contacts of customers.
Relationship Management (20%)
Works directly with vendors and provincial agencies to transmit relevant information related to estimated molecule coverage period.
Works directly with the customer to support formulary program maintenance and trouble shooting.
Validates request feasibility to support the Procurement Operations team when introducing a new formulary.
Actively participates in the harmonization of programs among McKesson customers.
Builds and maintains strong relationships with vendors and key provincial government contacts.
Contributes to existing and new projects related to formulary programs.
Maintains strong knowledge of provincial regulations and on molecule interchangeability.
Section B – General Responsibilities
Other (5%)
Maintains relevant business knowledge of product categories and stays abreast of market and industry trends and conditions.
Acts as a McKesson ambassador of corporate values.
Section C – Position Requirements
Working Experience
Minimum 5-7 years of experience in retail pharmacy and pharmaceutical background.
Background in sciences is an asset.
Strong understanding of government formulary agencies.
Education
Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration.
Background in Science preferred.
Personal Development and Soft Skills
Excellent communication skills.
Team player.
Analytical skills.
Solutions driven.
Ability to collaborate with various levels of management and employees.
Technical skills
Perfectly bilingual, both written and spoken.
Extensive knowledge of MS office products (Power Point, Excel, Word, Project and Visio); Excel is a must, Power BI a strong asset.
Knowledge of procurement process and project management.
Understanding of retail ordering systems.
Other Skills and Capabilities
Solid experience working with senior management.
Ability to work as part of multi-functional teams.
Detail oriented.
Ability to identify issues that impact financials, impact service and proactively drive solutions.

GardaWorld is the largest Business Solutions Company in security services with private capital closed, in the world. Every day, our 48,000 employees solve complex problems. We ensure secure trade and protect people, assets and reputation of our customers.
We are looking for a Business Analyst, National Account for our Security Services division. The position will be based in our Mississauga Office.

Your mission at GardaWorld
The National Account Analyst supports a National team of Portfolio Directors, Senior Director of National Accounts, Vice President of National accounts and all Canadian branches in ensuring timely analysis, reporting and development of tools and measures to support the growing needs of the business.

What you will be doing
Provide analytical support for GardaWorld’s daily, weekly, monthly, quarterly and annual reporting to customers
Assist in collecting national business analysis and insights on a regular basis from regions and branches across the country
Provide critical support in the implementation and development of new planning and analysis tools, including creating and maintaining various models
Support presentation development and materials for customer reviews, and monthly/weekly ad hoc analysis to support the national team
Produce consolidated key KPI’s metrics and reports to coincide with reporting requirements of National Customers
Assist in the development of standardized reporting templates
Consult with the business to understand its goals and objectives for a specific initiative or project and advises on the functionality, applicability, and usability of alternative technology and reporting
Responsible for owning the solution to satisfy the business needs in coordination with the National team
Elicits, analysis, documents and manages business and solution requirements
Acts as a primary requirements management contact on projects
Recommends process improvements
Builds relationships and works collaboratively with stakeholders to identify solutions and resolve variance from requirements and specifications
Participates in post implementation/event reviews and processes (e.g. lessons learned, reviews, etc.)
Supports other team members in achieving projects/ business objectives and providing client services

Your profile
University degree/college diploma
2+ years of progressive business analysis/business consulting experience, supporting large national teams
Solid problem solving and analytical skills
Ability to multi-task in a multi-faceted role within a high-paced environment
Advanced Excel, database and Microsoft Office skills and technical capability
Strong relationship management, communication, and interpersonal skills
Solid understanding of requirements/scope development, analysis and documentation
Ability to apply techniques associated with data and process modelling
Familiarity with business assessment tools (e.g. feasibility studies, business cases, cost/benefit analysis, project sizing and costing) is an asset
Experience in the Security or Service Business to Business industry is an asset

What we offer
Competitive salary
Full-benefit plan
Dynamic team
International company offering many growth opportunities

Overview
About Aramark
Aramark (NYSE: ARMK) proudly serves Fortune 500 companies, world champion sports teams, state-of-the-art healthcare providers, the world’s leading educational institutions, iconic destinations and cultural attractions, and numerous municipalities in 19 countries around the world. Our 270,000 team members deliver experiences that enrich and nourish millions of lives every day through innovative services in food, facilities management and uniforms. We operate our business with social responsibility, focusing on initiatives that support our diverse workforce, advance consumer health and wellness, protect our environment, and strengthen our communities. Aramark is recognized as one of the World’s Most Admired Companies by FORTUNE, as well as an employer of choice by the Human Rights Campaign and DiversityInc. Learn more at www.aramark.com or connect with us on Facebook and Twitter.
Description

1-3 years’ experience in an analytical role
Advanced Excel skills
Experience with databases/SQL is an asset
Skills :-
Strong analytical and problem solving skills
Ability to collaborate and communicate with all levels of organization
Strong written and verbal communication skills to articulate issues, analysis and solutions
Ability to understand processes and the impact within the organization
Critical thinker who is inquisitive and seeks to find solutions and make recommendations

We’re on a mission to build the relationship-focused bank of the future and we’re looking for the passionate collaborators, innovators, advisors, and leaders who can get us there. Our distinct culture is built on a shared commitment to do what’s right for our clients, our people, and our communities, and we strive for excellence in everything we do. Because life at CIBC is not only what you do, but how you do it.

To learn more about CIBC, please visit CIBC.com

What You’ll Be Doing

The Portfolio Systems Analyst (PSA) will work within a matrix to support the day-to-day functions and activities of the Croesus portfolio management system. They will work with the team Supervisor to improve the overall efficiency and effectiveness of the department. The incumbent will work in conjunction with the Croesus Project team under the Senior Manager and will assist with documentation and procedures as required.

The PSA Team supports the Croesus portfolio management system that is used by Wood Gundy Investment Advisors, branch staff, and ISI. The role is to provide assistance, guidance and knowledge to resolve difficult and complex problems.
How You’ll Succeed
Investigate and Resolve Client Issues - Provide guidance and assistance to the team towards the resolution of difficult and complex problems. Identify problems, extract information and perform detailed analysis.Assist with any issues or situations requiring intervention by either the business and/or technology division and ensure issues are tracked and managed until resolved.
Project Support – Perform pre/post implementation testing of application fixes/enhancements to ensure resolution and user satisfaction following Croesus (Vendor) bundle releases. Assist with projects, initiatives and act as a testing resource as required. Assume a SME role on the Croesus portfolio system and participate as SME when required during training and development sessions.
Administration Support – Prepare and maintain documentation on procedures/processes for the PSA manual. Review and provide statistical reporting to the Supervisor. Develop and maintain communication opportunities with other Operations departments to assure data is accurate (e.g. BFS, CID, Re-organization, RRSP, Entitlements, ICS, Training and Development etc). Monitor and develop methods to improve and enhance SLA measurements. Identify, correct issues related to Broadridge data, resolve portfolio management issues and assist the Supervisor with capacity planning.

Who You Are
You have a post-secondary degree/diploma in business and/or information technology systems (or equivalent work experience).
You are a certified professional. Completion of Canadian Securities Course (CSC) or experience in the Brokerage industry.
You have knowledge of CIBC WG branch structure.
You have advanced computer skills with an excellent working knowledge of Excel.
You have knowledge of financial markets including Stock, Option, Fixed Income and Mutual Funds.
You have working knowledge of financial product concepts and calculations (bond amortization, accrued income, expected income, yields).
It’s an asset if: you are bilingual in French and English.

What CIBC Offers

At CIBC, our people are our greatest asset. You’ll become part of a diverse community that acknowledges everyone’s unique talents, and empowers teams to do what’s right for the client, and to do it well. As part of our team, you will:
Thrive: Benefit from an open and approachable culture that provides the flexibility and support you need to integrate your life at work and at home
Connect: Work in a place where the right technology and infrastructure fosters innovation, collaboration and creativity
Develop: Grow your skills and career through our best-in-class onboarding experience, ongoing learning opportunities, individual development planning, and comprehensive product training
Prosper: Share in our collective success with a competitive salary, incentive pay, banking benefits, health benefits program, and employee share purchase plan
What You Need to Know

CIBC is committed to creating an inclusive environment where all team members and clients feel like they belong. We seek applicants with a wide range of abilities and we provide an accessible candidate experience. If you need accommodation during the application or interview process, please contact Mailbox.careers-carrieres@cibc.com
You need to be legally eligible to work in Canada at the location(s) specified above and, where applicable, must have a valid work or study permit.
This is a full-time role with a schedule of 37.5 hours each week, you may be required occasionally work outside of business hours.

Job Description Summary
As a Financial Analyst, you will be working under the direction of the Manager, FP&A. You will be responsible for supporting financial forecasting, financial analysis, and contributing to management reporting activities. This would include discovering and documenting workflow processes, data gathering and generating reports for other Departments within the company, drafting and maintaining new financial models. This position is based at our West Pender office in Vancouver and reports to the Manager, Financial Planning and Analysis.

Gather data from various sources to prepare monthly, quarterly, and annual forecasts, and provide key analytics, analyses, and summaries as directed for management reports
Liaise with department leads to obtain or analyze data and other information
Provide initial recommendations for continuous improvements to financial planning and management reporting processes
Assist senior team members with reporting that measures the performance of the department’s objectives, projects and initiatives

Research, present, and document new efficient methods to extra data from various sources to use in financial forecasting and analysis

Participate in developing and managing financial tools that provide visibility and transparency into department costs
Work closely with the Accounting to ensure financial information is accurate
Other duties as required

Bachelor's degree in relevant field (finance, accounting, business); accounting or related professional designation

Clear, concise, articulate, professional verbal and written reasoning and storytelling skills to communicate effectively to audiences at all levels of the organization
Comfortable conceptualizing and logically applying concepts to concrete user cases
Ability to translate previous experience into applications that fit the current organizational needs
Self-starter and active listener with a keen interest in and commitment to personal growth and continuous learning
Flexible, genuinely curious, and able to continuously adjust/adapt in order to thrive in a fast-paced, rapidly changing environment

STEMCELL Technologies Inc. is a privately-owned biotechnology company based in Vancouver that helps power leading-edge life science research around the world. Scientists performing stem cell, immunology, cancer, regenerative medicine and cellular therapy research are among those who rely on our cell culture media, cell separation products, instruments, ancillary reagents and contract assay services. We create novel, useful, standardized products of unfailing quality and deliver them to more than 70 countries via our many regional offices plus distribution centres in Vancouver, Seattle, Grenoble and Singapore. Driven by our love of science and our passion for quality, we see ourselves simply as “Scientists Helping Scientists” – standing by our customers to provide outstanding products, technical support and training. We have over 1000 science-oriented employees globally, including 250 PhDs/MScs, with most others holding a BSc or engineering degree. STEMCELL is proud to be the largest Biotechnology employer in Canada.
This is an opportunity to work with highly motivated colleagues in a science-oriented, creative and dynamic environment. We offer a competitive salary, excellent benefits and significant career development opportunities.

$72,444 - $94,964 a yearThe Policy Analyst is responsible for conducting research, analyzing data, and developing policy options required to develop the Department of Energy's upstream mines and minerals policies. The position plays a critical role in ensuring that policy options are well thought, relevant data are analyzed, all stakeholders are engaged, and research is properly conducted for policy and regulation development. The work environment is complex and the position must consider a wide variety of energy and non-energy issues affecting Alberta's mines and minerals royalty and tenure systems. This position leads and/or coordinates in-depth policy development processes and works with multidisciplinary teams.


This position will require strong verbal and written communication skills in producing briefings, presentations, cabinet reports, and communications materials on a broad range of energy-related issues. Your highly developed consultation/engagement, facilitation and interpersonal skills will help you coordinate working groups; liaise extensively with operations, legal, agencies and policy representatives; and participate on departmental, cross ministry, and industry committees related to energy development. The work undertaken by the Policy Analyst ranges from well-organized work plans to exploratory, emergent research and strategy development in the fields of energy information, policy, program, and regulations. Since the work covers the full range of Crown-owned mines and minerals, curiosity, mental flexibility, and interpersonal skills are fundamental attributes for the position. Communication, teamwork, and building relationships are essential for success. Having strong analytical and data processing skills are also a critical asset for this position.


The competencies that are critical for success in this role are:

Drive for Results - Knowing what outcomes are important and maximizing resources to achieve results that are aligned with the goals of the organization, while maintaining accountability to each other and external stakeholders.

Creative Problem Solving - Advanced problem solving and critical thinking skills are required to develop recommendations for management, founded on excellent research and analysis skills and the input of multiple stakeholders and/or data sources.

Systems Thinking - Ability to map and synthesize knowledge of Alberta Government business goals, economic and environmental policies, challenges, and potential roles for the Alberta Government and other jurisdictions to address these challenges.

Agility - Demonstrated ability to develop creative and durable recommendations to address complex issues involving multiple stakeholders with various responsibilities and areas of influence. Ability to work with minimal supervision is required


Qualifications

University degree in a related field (e.g., law, business, economics, finance, political science, engineering, or natural resources sciences) plus 4 years of progressively responsible related experience is required. Demonstrated experience with policy development and implementation OR demonstrated understanding of Canadian and global energy industries and systems is required. Project management experience and a related master?s degree will be considered as assets. Additional assets include a master's degree. Equivalencies will be considered.


Salary

$2,775.64 to $3,638.48 bi-weekly
($72,444 to $94,964 annually)


Notes

This competition may be used to fill future vacancies across the Government of Alberta.


How to Apply

Online applications are preferred. Applicants are advised to provide information that clearly and concisely demonstrates how their qualifications meet the advertised requirements, including education, experience and relevant examples of required competencies.


Note: As only one file can be uploaded, please ensure your cover letter, resume and any other related documents are submitted in one file. Please ensure that this document is saved using the following naming convention (Last name, First name_Job ID Number). Applicants who apply online will be able to track the status of this competition.

It is recommended that applicants who have obtained educational credentials from outside of Canada and have not had them previously assessed, obtain an evaluation of their credentials from the International Qualifications Assessment Service (IQAS) - http://work.alberta.ca/immigration/international-qualifications-assessment-service.html It is recommended that applicants include the assessment certificate from IQAS or any other educational assessment service as part of their application.


Closing Statement

We thank all applicants for their interest. All applications will be reviewed to determine which candidates' qualifications most closely match the advertised requirements. Only individuals selected for interviews will be contacted.

If you require any further information on this job posting, please call (780) 427-2111. If this competition is closed as per the closing date noted above, please continue to check http://www.jobs.alberta.ca for a listing of current career opportunities with the Government of Alberta.

Please follow us on LinkedIn: http://www.linkedin.com/company/government-of-alberta

job_title: Data Analyst (internally known as Business Analyst)
job_description:
$36.17 an hourTemporaryMake a difference
Are you passionate about data analysis and looking for an opportunity to positively impact your community? If so, the Business Analyst (Data Analyst) position at Toronto Community Housing may be for you!
The Business Analyst (Data Analyst) will be part of the Data Governance team, reporting to the Data Governance Manager within the Information and Technology Services (ITS) department.
The main focus will be on supporting various initiatives under the Data Governance program, including, but not limited to, establishing best practices in Master Data Management and Data Quality areas. Initially, the Business Analyst (Data Analyst) will be focusing on understanding and modeling TCHC’s current state data in collaboration with the Data Governance and Data Management teams. Also, the Data Analyst will be one of the key resources as part of data conversion effort to consolidate TCHC data into the new business solution.
This role will be actively engaged with different business divisions as part of the Data Governance program to identify data requirements and to ensure that data governance will address various business data needs.
What you’ll do
Data Analysis
Identifies data requirements for enterprise data throughout whole data lifecycle
Performs research and analysis on a regular and ad hoc basis to support data governance activities
Ensures the integrity, quality and accuracy of data while collecting data from internal and external sources supporting data governance activities
Collects, interprets and analyzes data and provides ongoing reporting
Supports and enforces established data standards and guidelines
Manages master data, including creation, updates, and deletion
Proactively monitors data accuracy and facilitates required data corrective actions with business owners
Provides assistance and analytical support to ensure that decision-making processes are aligned with values, policies, and organization-wide business
Data Governance Strategy support
Assists with new initiatives and projects by understanding impacts on data flows, business constrains and requirements
Provides support to data owners/ data stewards in performing data validation
Participates in the creation of data standards, drafting of data and governance policies and management of related documentation
Partners in troubleshooting and resolving master data transactions, SLA impacts, or other operational challenges affected by master data issues
Develops and implements governance oversight and KPI metrics to successfully complete data governance objectives
Collaborates with division and other staff to interpret data, identify trends, communicate meaning and develop recommendations based on findings
Research
Maintains up to date knowledge of information technology products and methodologies as well as government and TCH data policies and standards
Contributes to ideas and actions towards continuous improvement of processes within master data and data quality
Participates in research projects with external and internal partners
 What you’ll need
University Degree in computer science, MIS or other relevant specialty/discipline
University degree in computer science, MIS is preferred
3 years - Previous experience in data analysis and data modeling, 3-5 years’ experience is preferred
Knowledge of data modeling tools
Working experience of SQL
Exposure to data architecture best practices
Previous experience in Data Governance, MDM and / or Data Quality initiatives
Has participated in data conversion activities
Excellent written and verbal communication skills, interpersonal and collaborative skills, and the ability to communicate architectural concepts to technical and nontechnical audiences
Excellent analytical skills, work well in a demanding dynamic environment and meet overall objectives
Nice to have:
Previous experience in data conversion initiatives
Ability to manage multiple demands within tight timelines
Demonstrate good problem-solving abilities, and have initiative and show sound judgment
Attention to detail and ability to work effectively under time constraints are required
Ability to exhibit maturity, reliability and stability by adhering to commitments is critical in order to maintain business credibility
High level of personal integrity, and the ability to professionally handle confidential matters and show an appropriate level of judgment and maturity
High degree of initiative, dependability and ability to work with little supervision
What’s next
Once you apply, we’ll review your resume and cover letter to determine if your skills and experience match the qualifications for the role. Only qualified candidates will be contacted to move forward in the hiring process. If you are contacted, the process will include one or more interviews and/or assessments and reference checks.
Candidates for unionized positions must score a minimum of 70% to pass any interview or assessment and be considered for the next stage of the recruitment process. Successful candidates will be determined based on score and where applicable, union seniority. Note: not all candidates who score 70% or higher will automatically proceed to the next stage of the recruitment process as this will be dependent on the number of candidates and number of available roles.
Please note: This temporary position may be extended or become permanent in order to meet business needs. If this occurs, the position may not be reposted.

Cannabis Compliance Inc is the leading Canadian owned, consulting firm of choice for manufacturers and Licensed Cannabis Producers in North America. As our clients are driven to excellence and exception, we provide complete support from product and facility design through to registration, manufacturing, testing, marketing, distribution, and beyond.

Founded in 2017, we built a strong foundation by guiding North American’s leading consulting firm through Canada’s challenging regulatory climate for cannabis products. We are a specialized consulting firm offering full international compliance services for the cannabis, natural health product, supplement, pharmaceutical, food, cosmetic, medical device, and associated industries worldwide.

Opportunity

We are currently recruiting for a Director, Research & Development – Cannabis for our client who is rapidly growing. This person would be responsible for method validation of existing methods that have been developed and validated on a limited level, and drive the long-term strategy, to ramp up method validation as it relates to cannabis edibles. To also be client facing at trade shows and have the opportunity to market as a Technical Leader in the industry.

The Director, Research & Development – Cannabis will be leading an agile team of technical analysts and will need to complete a department skills assessment and start to outline further development of the department.

You should possess a high level of drive, energy and executive presence and will continuously improve method efficiencies, laboratory processes, procedures and personnel in all areas of responsibility to keep pace with growth of company.


Responsibilities
Determines the scope and strategy for all R&D projects and allocates work and resources accordingly
Consults all internal stakeholders to project strategy is scientifically sound, technically feasible and will comply with SOP's and GMP's prior to committing to commercialization.
Provides technical staff with adequate instructions and coaching to ensure the correct execution of assigned tasks.
Responsible for project management, determining timelines and negotiating resource requirements for project work and assignment of resources to ensure the timely completion of work and delivery of results.
Reviews the compilation, evaluation, interpretation and reporting of experimental results to ensure the objectives of each project are met.
Manage scientific component and sourcing of partnership strategy and execution.
Set platform priorities for development in conjunction with our operation leadership.
Provide scientific leadership, advice, oversight and coordination in developing the product specification and generating data for intellectual properties.
Ensure high levels of stakeholder engagement throughout the process and ensure high degree of communication is maintained.
Responsible for the management of direct reporting personnel, including regular performance reviews.
Assist Marketing department with new product feasibility assessments and building business case and other evaluations prior to initiating new product development activities.
Report regularly to cross-functional and leadership teams on key project indicators - schedule, budget, and quality.
Attend Industry Trade Shows and represent the company as a Technical Leader.
Other duties and responsibilities as assigned.


Skills and Qualifications

Masters or PhD, background in Analytical Chemistry or closely related field.
10+ years of experience in Research & Development, product development, formulation, innovation, or related roles – preference to, cannabis, food, natural health products or pharmaceutical industries.
5+ years of experience leading, coaching and guiding high preforming, senior, diverse teams.
Demonstrated track record of execution; proven history of taking new products to market.
Experience with regulations and requirements such as cGMP, Cannabis Act, ISO 17025 would be an asset.
Enthusiasm for research and hands-on experimentation and formulations.
Executional excellence, customer focus and personal leadership is a must.
Self-motivated problem solver and the drive to deliver objectives in a complex environment.
Ability to learn new products and processes quickly.
Exceptional communication skills are mandatory.
Solid practical experience in using GC-MS/MS, LC-MS/MS, ICP-MS, HPLC-RI and ELSD.
Successfully work in a team environment, interact with external clients and vendors.
Excellent time management and organizational skills to meet the deadlines in a fast paced, changing environment.
Experience in the analysis of foods, natural products and pharmaceuticals.
Assist in training and development of other chemists.
Active member of AOAC and ASTM would be an asset.

job_title: Business Analyst, Transcription and Health Information Exchange
job_description:
TemporaryReporting to the Service Director, Transcription Services, the Business Analyst supports the reconfiguration of the current dictation/transcription service and implementation of Front End Speech Recognition. The position identifies, develops and implements strategies designed to assist with reconfiguration of the M*Modal Fluency for Transcription and Fluency Flex/Fluency Direct software and business processes. Responsibilities include assisting in the development, maintenance, and rollout of the system. Develops, maintains, and disseminates applicable system and user documentation and communications. The Business Analyst also provides support on documenting processes and liaises with members of the Transcription Services Team and the FESR Project Team, other organization areas and stakeholders to support program service delivery and initiatives.
Skills
Comprehensive knowledge of policy and standards for transcription services.
Knowledge of project management methodologies and techniques, principles and practices.
Competent in using Microsoft Word office suite include Excel, PowerPoint and Word.
Understanding of systems analysis and design, related tools and techniques (e.g. data flow diagrams, etc.), and continuous quality improvement.
Knowledge of hospital operations and health care administration requirements.
Demonstrated verbal and written communication skills including strong business writing skills and the ability to effectively communicate technical information to a variety of audiences.
Ability to analyze operational problems and identify innovative solutions.
Ability to work effectively with people from various disciplines with varying degrees of functional and technical experience.
Demonstrated ability to manage effective relationships with vendors and external organizations.
Effective interpersonal and facilitation skills including the ability to work effectively with diverse user community.
Ability to coordinate and lead work groups.
Ability to manage own work activities to achieve maximum efficiency.
Ability to effectively utilize related hardware and software.
Education
Bachelor’s degree in the area of Health Information Management/Technology, Science (Finance, Mathematics, etc.) or Business Administration, plus a minimum of three (3) years’ recent, related experience or an equivalent combination of education, training and experience.
Duties
Collects and translates business requirements into functional specifications and assists with detailed test plans. Assists with preparing documentation such as Business Requirements, Business Rules, Solution Blueprint, workflow diagrams, etc.

Communicates the business directives, goals and needs to the project & technical team and serves as an interface between operations department and technical team in order to assist the technical team in translating business requirements into application functionality / architecture and the production of a system functionality document.

Participates and defines business requirement changes and subject matter expertise in the regulations, standards, policies and software behaviour that guide the use of client administration applications in process redesign and improvement.

Assists the Transcription Services Team, on operational and project implementation issues by methods such as compiling data, developing indicators that summarize the issues by department/site along with summarizing improved data quality, assessing where improvements can be made, and making recommendations in order to focus on the areas that need further support.

Compiles and analyzes various information sources such as system and user data, stakeholder feedback, regulatory and policy requirements and industry best practices.

Provides recommendations to Transcription Leadership team on standardizing transcription processes for the LM Health Information Management.

Consults with and serves as an interface with integrated systems to ensure product awareness is thoroughly understood and to identify existing gaps between product functionality and client business need based on use case definition and analysis.

Builds effective relationships with Information Management Information Technology Systems (IMITS), Health Record Services, and other key resources to successfully assist with management of the transcription application.

Performs post-implementation and quality improvement reviews related to new application software and/or enhancements.

Prepares reports, presentations, and notices to inform stakeholders and/or for internal documentation purposes on changes in departmental policies, procedures, and standards, status of projects, or other information needs.

Performs other related duties as required.

Position Title: Project Coordinator
Department: Research – HR Division
Reports to: Manager, Organizational Effectiveness
Location: London/Toronto, ON
McLean & Company, a division of Info-Tech Research Group, is an HR research and advisory firm providing practical solutions to human resources challenges by providing executable research, tools, diagnostics, and advisory services that have a clear and measurable impact on our members' businesses.
McLean’s research practice offers a truly unique work experience. Our analysts spend their days consuming and distilling data, new ideas, and member needs into practical resources and advice that our clients can actually use. See your impact across small businesses right up to global corporations. No matter where you are in your career, each day will bring a new set of diverse problems to solve and something new to be learned. Are you up for the challenge?
McLean is a place where your voice will be heard – a place where you see the impact of your work on our members. It is a place where you will find community and collaboration, where you will work with diverse individuals with their own unique stories and experiences. McLean is a place where success is celebrated by the whole team – a place where you are encouraged to stretch and grow.
Position Summary
The Project Coordinator, Organizational Effectiveness is responsible for the launch and delivery of a full range of HR diagnostics that drive measurable value for McLean & Company client organizations. The Project Coordinator will manage the diagnostic survey process from the initial scoping call up to report delivery and will have the opportunity to foster personal relationships with a wide variety of HR leaders.
Major Responsibilities
Responsible for the successful launch and delivery of a full range of HR diagnostics, including McLean & Company’s Employee Engagement, New Hire, Exit, Stakeholder Management and Management & Governance.
Lead client scoping calls to gain an understanding of client goals and requirements
Build and test surveys
Launch surveys and respond to participant questions and/or issues.
Understand and work with proprietary survey software to determine how to deliver on the diagnostic needs of clients.
Maintain quality assurance/control processes.
Address client questions and manage client expectation while maintaining a high standard of customer service.
Identify opportunities for process improvement.
Education and Experience
Required
Undergraduate degree, ideally in Business or Psychology
High proficiency with the Microsoft Suite, specifically Excel, Word, and PowerPoint
Desirable
Experience with employee engagement surveys and/or research
Experience with survey software
Experience with quality assurance practices
Experience with Jira and/or Salesforce
Experience with agile project management practices
Experience or exposure to HR
Skills
Organization and Attention to Detail: Scopes and manages the implementation of multiple surveys at one time. Effectively prioritizes to ensure that timelines/due dates are met. Reviews client data, spreadsheets, and reports for errors and makes corrections.
Problem-Solving Skills: Able to trouble shoot technical issues to try and identify the root cause.
Customer Service: Resolves a variety of client issues and escalates as necessary. Demonstrates agility to go where the client wants to go. Builds rapport. Balances professionalism and friendliness.
Verbal and Written Communication: Effective in communicating how we can meet clients' needs, and managing client expectations. Communicates frequently over the phone and through email with clients.
Project Management: Manages the delivery of multiple surveys at any time.
Teamwork and Collaboration: Work with other members of the Organizational Effectiveness team to balance workloads and share ideas/learning experiences.
Change Management: Adapt to process changes and improvements on an ongoing basis.
