Informed decision-making is at the heart of any successful company. As a member of Best Buy Canada’s Accounting and Finance Team, you’ll get to put your knowledge of best practices into practice and play a crucial role in helping to grow our business.
The Financial Analyst – Financial Planning & Analysis will participate in the budgeting, forecasting, and reporting functions to provide corporate leaders with better visibility into the organization’s results, to help drive informed decision making. The Financial Analyst has a keen interest in technical knowledge of finance methodologies and reporting/business intelligence tools, and leverages these skill sets to deliver effective reporting, accurate forecasts, and insightful analyses.
As a Financial Analyst you will…
Prepare monthly internal financial reports to compare actuals to budget, forecast and prior year, and investigate any drivers of significant variances
Build KPI reports to assist in tracking & monitoring the business results at a consolidated, business unit, channel or location level, and create monthly presentations for Senior Canadian and Enterprise Leadership
Support the financial planning process by assisting with long-term planning (5 Year), annual budgeting and monthly forecasting
Bring business meaning to financials by synthesizing financial data, and identifying variances & trends to provide insightful commentary
Contribute to overall Finance team objectives by supporting ad-hoc projects as required
We hope you are passionate about…
Intricate work – proficiency with numbers and high attention to detail & accuracy are key whilst having an ability to produce concise and complex financial reports
Time management – remarkable ability to work under pressure and meet deadlines in a fast-paced environment is vital
Communication – strong written and oral communication with an ability to compile, analyze and interpret information, and communicate in a simple and succinct manner
The experience we need…
Bachelor’s Degree in Commerce, Accounting, Finance, Economics, Engineering, Math, and/or related field
Prior business experience and proven experience with Excel, financial analysis, and financial planning
Bonus points…
2+ year of experience within an accounting or finance role preferred
Intermediate to Advanced Excel/VBA
Experience with various BI tools preferred, e.g., MS SSAS (OLAP), SSRS, MS BI, Qlik, Tableau, Cognos, TM1
We believe we have the unique opportunity to help customers enrich their lives and pursue their passions with the help of technology.

job_title: Analyste Collaboration & Présence Digitale / Collaboration & Digital Presence Analyst
job_description:
Role and Responsibilities
(English will follow)
L'analyste collaboration et présence digitale:
Participe à toute les étapes du processus de livraison, y compris la création, la conception technique, le développement, la mise à l'essai et la mise en œuvre de solutions de collaboration et de gestion documentaire;
Travaille à plusieurs tâches/projets en tant que membre de l’équipe, à des solutions multifonctionnelles de complexité moyenne à élevée en matière de TI et de collaboration, de gestion documentaire et de présence digitale (Internet et applications mobiles);
Assume parfois le rôle de gestionnaire fonctionnel;
Peut à l'occasion participer au processus d'estimation de la gestion de projet.
Besoins d’affaire et analyse:
Travaille avec les clients internes et externes et les partenaires de TI pour cerner et analyser les besoins en matière de collaboration, de gestion documentaire et de présence digitale (Internet et applications mobiles);
Interprète les exigences opérationnelles et détermine les solutions optimales en matière de collaboration, de gestion documentaire et de présence digitale (Internet et applications mobiles) afin de répondre aux besoins;
Détermine et fournit des données relatives aux nouvelles possibilités technologiques qui auront une incidence sur les systèmes de collaboration, de gestion documentaire et de présence digitale (Internet et applications mobiles) dans l'ensemble de l'entreprise;
Elabore des solutions de collaboration et de gestion documentaire à l'échelle de l'entreprise, des sites personnalisés ainsi que des analyses pour une grande variété de demandes
Essais:
Élabore, exécute et documente les plans de tests utilisateurs et offre un soutien aux équipes d’essais;
Résout les problèmes en fonction des résultats des essais;
Peut mener ou diriger la planification, la définition et l'exécution des efforts des utilisateurs;
Éffectue l'examen des plans de tests et surveille le processus afin d'assurer que les besoins d'affaires sont rencontrés.
Politiques, normes et procédures:
Respecte les normes en vigueur;
Fournit des données servant à l'élaboration des normes, des politiques et des procédures quant à la forme, à la structure et aux attributs liés aux outils et aux systèmes de collaboration, de gestion documentaire et de présence digital (Internet et applications mobiles).
Formation:
Conçoit et présente la formation à l'intention des utilisateurs finaux et prépare le matériel de formation connexe;
Montre aux utilisateurs comment transformer les données en renseignements axés sur l'action, et comment utiliser ces renseignements correctement.
Études/expérience typiques:
Baccalauréat en informatique, en systèmes informatiques ou en gestion des affaires, ou formation spécialisée/certification. Ou expérience de travail équivalent;
Généralement de 7 à 10 ans en collaboration et en gestion documentaire (SharePoint, SharePoint On Line) ou expérience technique connexe;
Expérience avec des gestionnaires de contenu (CMS)
Expérience dans le cycle de vie de création et maintien de solutions mobiles
Connaissance d'un ou plusieurs domaines fonctionnels (finances, chaîne d'approvisionnement, commercialisation, fabrication, etc.)
**********************
The Collaboration & Digital Presence analyst should:
Participates in work stream planning process including conception, technical design, development, testing and delivery of collaboration, documents management and digital presence (web sites and mobile apps) solutions.
Works, as a team member, on multiple medium to complex and cross-functional IT and collaboration, documents management and digital presence (web sites and mobile apps) solutions and projects.
Sometimes works as a functional lead
May participate in project management estimation process.
Business Requirements & Analysis:
Works with internal and external customers and IT partners to develop and analyze collaboration, documents management and digital presence (web sites and mobile apps) needs.
Interprets business requirements and determines optimum collaboration, documents management and digital presence (web sites and mobile apps) solutions to meet requirements.
Identifies and provides input to new technology opportunities that will have an impact on the enterprise wide collaboration, documents management and digital presence (web sites and mobile apps) solutions.
Designs enterprise wide collaboration and documents management, custom sites and performs analysis for a wide range of requests.
Testing:
Develops, executes, and documents user test plans and provides support to test teams.
Resolves issues based on test results.
May lead or provide direction for the planning, designing, and execution of user efforts.
Reviews test plans and monitors testing process to ensure that business results are tested.
Policies, Standards and Procedures:
Adheres to current standards.
Provides input to standards, policies and procedures for the form, structure, and attributes of the collaboration and documents management tools and systems.
Training:
Designs and delivers end-user training and training materials.
Trains users to transform data into action-oriented information and to use that information correctly
Typical Education/ Experience:
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Business Management or specialized training/certification. Or equivalent work experience.
Typically requires 7-10 years of collaboration and documents management analysis (SharePoint, SharePoint On Line) or related technical experience.
Content Management System (CMS) experience
Creation lifecycle and maintenance of mobile apps experience
Knowledge of one or more business functional areas (Finance, Supply Chain, Marketing, Manufacturing, …)
Position Type
Regular

ContractJob description
As our organization grows, we seek a Business Analyst to help us implement technology solutions in a cost-effective way by determining the requirements of a project or program, and communicating them clearly to stakeholders, facilitators and partners.
You will drive the planning and implementation of various small to medium sized IT projects with national and international scope. This role will suit a confident, communicative Business Analyst with a strong business development background, adept at working with a wide variety of project stakeholders in a high volume, entrepreneurial environment. Strong business acumen and the ability to remain nimble while managing multiple time sensitive IT projects will be core to success in this role.
Responsibilities Implement advanced strategies for gathering, reviewing and analyzing data requirements Prioritize requirements, and create conceptual prototypes and mock-ups Master strategic business process modeling, traceability and quality management techniques Apply best practices for effective communication and problem-solving Partner with IT, Sales, and other departments as required Validate that system changes meet stakeholder requirements Provide system support to internal/external users Conduct system demos to clients and internal users Other duties as required.
Qualifications: 2-4 years’ experience working in an entrepreneurial environment with complex projects Excellent communication skills - verbal and written fluency (Spanish/English), including technical writing skills Understanding of systems engineering concepts Ability to conduct cost/benefit analysis and develop business cases Knowledge of modeling techniques and methods Data analysis experience is beneficial Experience in the mortgage and/or banking industry is an asset Familiarity with JIRA. Knowledge of Scrum methodology is a nice to have Ability to shift gears and reprioritize with constantly changing demands Proficient in MS Excel, Word, Visio, Power Point, Outlook and able to learn new technologies quickly Familiar with prototypes and mock-up tools such as Balsamiq or NinjaMock. Strong organizational skills and high level of attention to detail and accuracy.

job_title: Supply Chain Analyst (Systems and Analytical Management), P2 Intermediate
job_description:
Project/Program Overview
The Systems and Analytical Management Analyst (Supply Chain Management - SCM) will work to optimize the effectiveness of Supply Chain tools and systems by working with the Supply Chain, Manufacturing Operations, and Program teams to identify and action system deficiencies and improvement opportunities. The Analyst will also identify, develop/automate, and maintain key metrics and status reports to increase SCM efficiency and improve business execution performance. The Analyst will help identify trends, and work with the Supply Chain, Manufacturing Operations, and Program teams to take action to implement correction.

The Systems and Analytical Management Analyst will act as the Supply Chain subject matter expert for the systems and software suite. The Analyst will help provide innovative solutions to manage data, understand trends, and further develop the tools.

In this role the Analyst will have a significant input into continuous improvement activities.
Responsibilities
Maintains Supply Chain systems and software including;
IFS,
SharePoint,
PDMlink,
Power BI,
Risk Methods,
and Rapid Ratings.
Represents General Dynamics Mission Systems-Canada within Mission Systems for Supply Chain system and software implementations.
Represents Supply Chain in new software and system implementations within Canada.
Works as the subject matter expert for system and software related tools in Supply Chain.
Ability to review processes and make recommendations on how to monitor progress and trends.
Ability to independently develop metrics.
Analyze data to identify trends and make recommendations.
Responsible for the quality of data in the Supply Chain tools.
Management of information on the Supply Chain web-site.
Participates in continuous improvement activities.
Qualifications
Understanding of systems and software.
Advanced desktop skills.
Analytical thinker.
Excellent understanding of key performance indicators.
Apply best industry practice.
Practice a strict code of personal and business ethics.
Coordinate process improvement.
Champions new ideas and calculated risk-taking; communicates vision.
Facilitates problem-solving; resolves conflicts.
Advanced written and verbal communication skills; excellent presentation skills.
Address issues in a timely fashion with adherence to deadlines.
Translates business strategies into concrete actions.
Applies experience in making decisions and judgements.
Responsible for continuous improvement; anticipates changing customer needs and; demonstrates vision in advancing tools.
Education
University degree or 3 year College Diploma (Business Administration, Computer Sciences).
Related experience in a high technology, defence, government or manufacturing environment.
Typically requires undergraduate degree and some experience, or equivalent.

Minimum 10 year consecutive residence in Canada – for Canadian Secret Security Clearance
Applicants will be required to obtain/hold a valid and current Canadian security clearance to gain access to the classified spaces, information and equipment in order to perform the work associated with this position.

General Dynamics Mission Systems–Canada is committed to employment equity and diversity in the workplace. Workplace accommodations are available.
Company Overview
At General Dynamics Mission Systems–Canada, Canada’s premiere defence company, innovation happens on a daily basis. We develop and deliver highly-complex leading edge technology, products and systems that make important contributions to our customer’s success in land, airborne, maritime, cyberspace and public safety applications. The challenges and opportunities are endless.The results – incredible.

Our employees are exceptional. We are proud to employ more than 1,100 talented individuals across Canada. Working in a collaborative environment, our employees are encouraged daily to contribute their technical knowledge and expertise. Our employees are passionate, dedicated, and conscientious about the work they do which results in our ability to deliver the highest value, customized solutions in order to meet the most demanding requirements.

RBRO Solutions is seeking a Quality Assurance Analyst to join our team at our head office in Pickering, Ontario.

The Company

RBRO Solutions, a leading business solutions provider, is dedicated to helping organizations get the greatest value from their business content and work processes. The company, trusted globally with over 400,000 business application licenses in use, has also worked with over 500 medium, large and Fortune 500 companies. RBRO was established in 2003 at the forefront of the enterprise content management, big data and document management era.

We are working on disruptive solutions that transform the way professional services organizations work. If you are looking for an opportunity to put your superior analytical skills to the test, then look no further. As a QA Analyst, you will be responsible for performing in all areas of Quality Assurance on a motivated SCRUM team with high expectations to deliver high quality software continuously.


THE OPPORTUNITY

As a Quality Assurance team member, you will be expected to contribute, analyze, review, and improve processes and tools used to ensure growth and success of the organization. Your responsibilities will include but not limited to the following:

Participate throughout the requirement analysis, design and development process, analyzing features to point out weaknesses or inconsistencies.
Support all test activities, enhance, develop and execute manual and automated test scripts, record and track software deficiencies
Participate in the creation and execution of test plans and test cases.
Write new automated tests, and modify existing tests to account for functionality changes.
Develop automated tests in partnership with developers for continuous regression testing.
Investigate, report, validate, and track bugs to resolution.
Actively participate in test automation initiatives.
Report regularly on testing progress and results.
Identify and escalate issues related to requirement gathering and product quality.
Ensure that all domain knowledge and test cases are articulated and structured well to enable swift execution by any other members of the QA team.
Actively participate to improve quality in all processes.
Do exploratory testing and acceptance of new features as part of a story-driven Agile development process.
Identify bugs through systematic testing, help developers reproduce errors, and ensure that defects are fixed.
Work with project stakeholders and developers to ensure that all aspects of the system have proper testing coverage and overall system reliability, performance and quality.
Other duties as assigned.
WHAT WE’RE LOOKING FOR:

College or university graduate in minimum 3-year related program
3-5 years of experience in a Quality Assurance role
Knowledge of one or more automated testing tools (Selenium preferred)
Working knowledge of SDLC and STLC methodologies
Knowledge and experience working in Agile/SCRUM teams
Experience in using bug-tracking tools
Experience in an Object Oriented environment
Strong knowledge of SQL Server
Skills:

Solid experience in designing and implementing test plans, scripts and scenarios
Solid experience in software testing and quality assurance
Superior skills in problem solving, planning, organizing and implementing testing efforts
Proficient knowledge of structured methodologies for the development, design, implementation and maintenance of applications
Experience in automated tools and version control systems on one or more platforms
Goal oriented to achieve project deadlines through self-motivation, persistence and determination
Excellent written and oral communication skills
Ability to work independently and deliver with minimal supervision
Must be a team player, and work well under tight deadlines


Apply today! Come build your career with us!

Please no phone calls. Only those candidates selected for an interview will be contacted directly by RBRO. You must be legally eligible to work in Canada. RBRO Solutions is an equal opportunity employer and will accommodate individuals with disabilities through the recruitment and selection process based on the Ontario Human Rights Code. Please advise us of any needs when your interview is booked.

$64,323 a yearPlease Note: If you are a current Energy Ottawa employee with access to Workday, apply to this job via the Workday application.
By generating and distributing power, each person at Energy Ottawa is part of empowering the lives of people in the communities we serve.
Our work means all the activities that make up our lives – at home, at work, at play – are there when we need them.
That purpose unites us and fuels our work. And if joining us in this essential work energizes you too, we may have the opportunity for you.
JOB SUMMARY
The Programmer/Analyst, Integrations is responsible for improving the efficiency of various information systems and establishing reliable communication between systems. The Programmer/Analyst, Integrations acts as the technical lead to project teams and manages various aspects of technical analysis, system modifications and integrations. The successful candidate must be a self-motivated team player with the ability and passion to see enhancement initiatives through from design to completion within prescribed time frames.
MAJOR RESPONSIBILITIES
Lead all technical activity, including working with internal and external resources, as it relates to assigned IT projects and/or ongoing operational work.
Understand and translate business requirements into detailed solution requirements to form technical scope of project.
Develop system integrations and messaging standards to support required data flows across systems while adhering to service oriented architecture (SOA) principles.
Act as a liaison between the project team and other functional groups on technical matters relevant to the project deliverables.
Participate in the architecture review process and contribute to the formation and implementation of the IT application roadmap.
Assist in leveraging technology and use knowledge of IT solutions to maximize opportunities, support business process design and drive organizational change.
Investigate and troubleshoot problems, including impact analysis of change on all systems and business areas in order to recommend appropriate remediation.
Perform both unit and integration tests to delivered solutions and monitor accordingly after implementation to ensure requirements are satisfied.
Provide direction to end users and assist in the effective and efficient resolution of issues.
Create, edit and maintain documentation, such as but not limited to, process mapping, interface mapping, entity relationship diagrams, database schemas and test cases.
Other duties as required.
EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE
Post-secondary education in a related field such as Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Data Engineering.
Minimum 3 years’ experience in the Information Technology field.
Experience with databases such as Oracle (SQL, PL/SQL, ODA), SQLServer.
Experience with integration and extract transform load (ETL) tools (such as Oracle Data Integrator, Boomi, Jitterbit, Kafka, AWS integration solution).
Minimum 3 years’ experience integrating systems with web services and cloud based solutions such as Okta, Workday, Salesforce and other principles such as e.g. REST, API.
Experience with application development and source control.
Experience with cloud in general including cloud-based data solutions considered an asset (AWS, Oracle, Microsoft, Google).
Experience with full project lifecycle including estimating, design, and development.
Experience with web servers and middleware (e.g. Web Logic, Java, Apache ecosystem).
Experience with Linux and scripting languages (Python, Shell scripts, Perl).
Broad knowledge of technologies and applications and gathering and interpreting data.
Utility experience considered an asset.
Experience with data warehousing solutions such as AWS Redshift, Oracle Warehouse, Snowflake considered an asset.
ADDITIONAL REQUIREMENTS
English essential, both oral and written; Bilingual (English/French) considered an asset.

Customer Experience
Best Buy Canada is committed to world class customer experience in all customer facing fronts.
The Business Analyst is mainly responsible for two experience areas (1) creating an optimized and seamless customer escalations process for our Executive Resolution team (2) identifying pain points caused by system process issues/gaps and work with multiple departments (including but not limited to IT/Ecomm/Multi Channel Logistics, Home Delivery, Retail Operations, Marketing, etc) to uncover root cause and apply remedy or streamline in the form of small to large size projects or enhancements. Total Rewards Analyst
 - (18002311)

At Golder, we thrive on challenges.


Golder is not just a place to work, it is a promise of a living, dynamic environment where people collaborate, innovate, build enduring relationships, excel, and grow professionally in a strong culture of ownership.
Do you have the desire to learn? The drive to excel and thrive in an engaged, collaborative environment?


Golder has a new opportunity for a Total Rewards Analyst to join our HR team on a full-time basis based in Calgary or Mississauga.


Reporting to the Regional Director of Human Resources, Canada, this role will see you responsible for performing compensation analysis, fully supporting the annual compensation management process. You will also contribute to the development, implementation and administration of total compensation policies and programs, aligned with supporting Golder’s achievement of our strategic business initiatives and HR strategy.


An overview of your role will include:

Ensure issues and root cause of incidents and problems are understood, and ensure appropriate actions are taken to resolve and prevent recurrence.
Manage contractors for projects delivery and application support.
Maintain leading-edge business and technical knowledge.

Excellent written and verbal communication skills

Bilingual

Specialist, Configuration & Asset Management
ABOUT I&T AT CN
CN annually transports approximately C$250 billion worth of goods across our network. To transport these goods with increasingly better reliability, efficiency and safety, CN harnesses the power of information every minute of every day to make better decisions. Almost every aspect of our business relies on technology; this is why CN invests around $100 million every year on I&T projects and infrastructure. And with close to 1,000 in-house employees, CN’s I&T team is more than a first-class technology shop – they’re railroaders, dedicated to helping our people work smarter and our trains run safely.
WHY YOU WANT THIS JOB

The Specialist, Configuration & Asset management is responsible for identifying, baselining, controlling, reporting and auditing CN Configuration Items (CIs). This process is responsible to provide a model of the CN services and related CIs. CIs and their corresponding relationships are maintained in the Configuration Management Database (CMDB), which contains the baseline of authorized configurations controlled by the PTC Change Management process. This process is key to CN Operations as it support all other processes (Incident, Change, Problem, Release management, Service Level Management and event management)

The Specialist, Configuration & Asset management is responsible for ensuring the integrity of the data contained in the CMDB. This is achieved through automated audit/verification process, change control compliance, establishing configuration baselines as well as corrective actions when issues are found by the audit processes. He will be part of a larger configuration management team, working closely with the Configuration Management Process Manager and the Configuration Specialist. Within the ITIL configuration management framework, the Configuration Analyst will act as a “Configuration Administrator” role.

RESPONSIBILITIES

As a Specialist, Configuration & Asset management , you are accountable for the integrity of the CMDB, this includes:
Be a Subject Matter Expert for Configuration Management
Ensures that all CIs are recorded in the CMDB and that the information is complete and accurate
Reviews and validates updates to the CMDB and creates exception reports when applicable.
Validates the compliancy of CI changes to CMDB from automated sources with Configuration Management process policies
Carries out manual changes to CMDB by documenting and validating CI updates using approved excel load file template + requesting CI loads from CMDB System Administrator
Handles, analyses and correct any data incident
Carries out CMDB update task in the change management workflow
Maintains baseline structures and approves baseline updates
Initiates actions following non-compliant CMDB changes
Executes configuration audits, initiates and tracks corrective actions for non-compliant CIs.
Updates and publishes the audit report to CM Domain Owners
Responsible for the various reports of the Configuration Management function.

REQUIREMENTS

Bachelor degree in computer science or equivalent
10 years working experience in IT operations
Knowledge of ITIL service management frame work
Excellent verbal, written and technical communication skills to interact with individuals from various levels and departments.
Working knowledge of Microsoft Office suite
ASSETS

Working knowledge of fundamental operations of IT service management relevant software (ex: HPSM, UCMDB)
Configuration Management tools in complex distributed environment
Experience in data modeling, asset and inventory management.
Knowledge of corporate organization structure: operational environments & processes

CN is an employment equity employer and we encourage all qualified candidates to apply. We thank all applicants for their interest, however, only candidates under consideration will be contacted. Please monitor your email on a regular basis, as communication is primarily made through email.

Perform advanced data discovery and profiling, in order to establish suitability to meet needs

Investigate and analyze problems and business processes and requirements, including impact analysis of change and all systems and business areas for projects up to high complexity in order to recommend appropriate solutions. Facilitates and functions as a liaison between business and technical units and works with analysts to design solutions to meet business requirements. Identifies opportunities for continuous improvements for process and applications development to ensure high quality in all deliverables. Plans, tracks and communicates activity status to stakeholders and management as required. Plan, prioritize and deliver system enhancements by understanding and assessing business value, features, functionality and support the teams to deliver new and innovative solutions. Support user acceptance testing efforts when delivering projects or enhancements
Policies, Regulations and Standards
Ensuring compliance and maintaining confidentiality with regard to information being processed, stored and accessed. Interprets complex requirements from stakeholders and gaming legislation.
Incident Management
Assist, troubleshoot and help resolve systems related issues in conjunction with other departments. The understanding is that this person would not escalate unless it has deep player and integrity impacts. Ensuring communications and updates on incidents are completed to the appropriate stakeholders.
Qualifications
Bachelor's degree in a Business, Information Science, or Computer field plus four (4) years of related experience
Excellent organization, planning and prioritizing skills.
Proactive approach to problems and issues, working ahead of potential "glitches". Skill in performing structured business analysis on medium to large projects.
Skill in analysis, problem solving, critical thinking and decision making.
Skill in teamwork, communication (Collaboration and Tact), innovation, adaptability and decision making, along with a customer focus, results orientation, and business sense.
Skill in User Acceptance testing.
Skill in business or technical writing as evidenced by previous work-related experience.
Ability in using logic and reasoning to identify the strengths and weaknesses of alternative solutions, conclusions or approaches to problems.
Ability to effectively participate in multiple major projects or project roles or lead a variety of project team activities/tasks.
Ability to perform objective analysis and re-engineering of business processes to maximize quality service and cost-effectiveness. Ability to meet deadlines and communicate the status of assignments.
Comprehensive knowledge of the existing automated business applications and their relationships to each other and interfaces to outside systems.
Candidate is responsible to look for business opportunities to streamline processes with automated solutions, both internally and externally.
Knowledge and/or experience of gaming and/or gambling industry.
Work With Us
There are many reasons why we choose to work at Atlantic Lottery (AL) and one of the most important is feeling a sense of belonging and pride in being part of a company that exists to make Atlantic Canada a better place. Requisition ID: 54474
Join the Global Community of Scotiabankers to help customers become better off.
Purpose of Job
The candidate will be responsible for supporting the Exchange Traded Derivatives (ETD) business initiatives of Scotiabank’s Global Banking & Markets within the Confirmations Utility of the Global Wholesale Operations Division.
The candidate will ensure daily processes are followed, implemented and reported in a timely and accurate manner. in addition, the candidate will provide support to other departments in respect to margining, reporting, balancing, reconciliation and other product lifecycle control activities.
The incumbent will be expected to develop subject matter expertise, providing guidance and counsel to co-workers, partner areas, trading desks, Middle Office, Risk Management, Fund Accounting, Finance and various other functional units within the Bank for all topics related to the Exchange Traded Derivatives / Confirmations business.
Contribute to the Bank’s initiative to maintain self-clearing memberships on the North American and European derivative Exchanges, including, but not limited to documenting workflows, operations policy and procedures, preparation for and the execution of user acceptance testing, etc.
Accountabilities
Due to binding deadlines, effective and efficient execution of daily responsibilities is vital.

The incumbent will be expected to adhere to and implement appropriate levels of control to ensure the production support of the derivatives confirmations group, such as effective trade capture & management, reconciliation of all settlement needs and to assist in the accurate and timely delivery of daily position reporting externally to Exchanges, and total equity reporting to Scotia internal partners.
Contribution to the protection of the Bank from exposure to loss by ensuring compliance with Bank policies, procedures and limit controls.
Ensuring the prompt and efficient investigation of all exceptions and ad-hoc inquiries are brought to the group’s attention and effectively communicated to areas such as: Front Office, Execution / Clearing Brokers, Exchanges, Technology groups and downstream users of relevant source data.
Ensuring the ETD team responsibilities are completed on a timely basis and that open issues are properly escalated.
Develop a full understanding of the functions of a Futures Clearing Merchant work-flow model, including, but not limited to: Trade Management, Reconciliation, Control, Data Integrity and Regulatory Reporting.
Provide production back-up for other colleagues due to absences and / or interim increases in transaction volumes.
Other duties as assigned may include, but are not limited to, providing back up for other colleagues within the team due to absences and/or interim increases in transaction volumes and participation in on-going process re-engineering, project work and cross-training within other GWO Utility functions.
Skills, Experience and Functional Competencies
2-7 years minimum Exchange Traded Derivatives experience (or similar capital markets asset class)
Working understanding of capital markets, Exchanges, settlement and regulatory requirements is an asset.
Understanding of accounting principles and practices related to Exchange Traded Derivatives a plus
Strong experience with at least one of the major asset platforms from a “Books and Records” perspective – GMI, RISC, ADP, Broadridge, etc.
Ability to work within and maintain a strong team environment and develop working relationships with partner areas
Education and other Requirements
University degree in accounting, business or finance and / or comparable work experience is preferred.
CSC Securities course completion or similar studies and / or licenses an asset.
Location(s): Canada : Ontario : Toronto
As Canada's International Bank, we are a diverse and global team. We speak more than 100 languages with backgrounds from more than 120 countries. Who We Are:
HBC is a diversified global retailer, focused on driving the performance of high quality stores and their all-channel offerings, growing through acquisitions, and unlocking the value of real estate holdings.

Founded in 1670, HBC is the oldest company in North America. Our portfolio today includes formats ranging from luxury to premium department stores to off price fashion shopping destinations, with more than 480 stores and over 66,000 employees around the world.

Our leading banners across North America and Europe include Hudson’s Bay, Lord & Taylor, Saks Fifth Avenue, Saks OFF 5TH, Galeria Kaufhof, the largest department store group in Germany, and Belgium’s only department store group Galeria INNO.

We have significant investments in real estate joint ventures. HBC has partnered with Simon Property Group Inc. in the HBC Global Properties Joint Venture, which owns properties in the United States and Germany. In Canada, HBC has partnered with RioCan Real Estate Investment Trust in the RioCan-HBC Joint Venture.

A truly global corporate citizen, HBC is committed to responsible business practices to bring about positive change, and we work hard to shape a sustainable future for people and the planet. Our philanthropic initiatives help create healthy families, strong communities, and sport excellence in the cities and countries in which we operate around the world, while striving to create innovative programs and resources that provide flexibility for work-life balance in order to maintain a positive working environment.

What This Position Is All About:

You get things done by engaging in high level teamwork and flexing your interpersonal skills

Bachelor's degree

A mutually rewarding experience.
Work. Realize your ambitions. And realize there’s more to being in business than just making a profit. That’s the Mars philosophy. And the opportunity we offer every one of our Associates. An opportunity to take what you do and make it mean more for you, for those around you and for the planet. What you get here is challenging, interesting work. You get the tools you need to do a great job and you get to have the best possible people on your side to help you do it. And at the same time as getting to find ways to do business better today than we did it yesterday and driving a great career, you also get to build a more enlightened business and drive sustainability.
Because it’s never just about a single person, a single project or a single brand. It’s about how you can grab everything that’s within your reach here and use it to pursue mutual, long-term gain. It’s about having ideas. And ideals. Being prepared to risk failure because the promise of success means we’ll all be a little better off. It’s that mix of integrity and ambition that makes Mars such a special place to work. And why working here is always about more than just a job.

About Mars, Incorporated
Mars is a family-owned business with more than a century of history making diverse products and offering services for people and the pets people love. With almost $35 billion in sales, the company is a global business that produces some of the world’s best-loved brands: M&M’s®, SNICKERS®, TWIX®, MILKY WAY®, DOVE®, PEDIGREE®, ROYAL CANIN®, WHISKAS®, EXTRA®, ORBIT®, 5™, SKITTLES®, UNCLE BEN’S®, MARS DRINKS and COCOAVIA®. Mars also provides veterinary health services that include BANFIELD® Pet Hospitals, Blue Pearl®, VCA® and Pet Partners™. Headquartered in McLean, VA, Mars operates in more than 80 countries. The Mars Five Principles – Quality, Responsibility, Mutuality, Efficiency and Freedom – inspire its more than 100,000 Associates to create value for all its partners and deliver growth they are proud of every day.

Mars Canada is a subsidiary of the US family-owned business known as Mars, Incorporated, one of the leading global manufacturers of branded products. Established in the late 1940's, our three segments – Petcare, Mars Wrigley Confectionary and Food help Canadians celebrate life everyday through food experiences. We are an organization that is guided by our Five Principles: Quality, Responsibility, Mutuality, Efficiency and Freedom. It is putting these principles into action that allows us to make a difference to people and the planet, through our performance.
Purpose of Role:
The principle role of the Customer Logistics Analyst is to ensure on-shelf in stock excellence of Mars products (through Collaboration, Planning, Forecasting & Replenishment - CPFR), thereby providing our consumers with the ultimate enjoyment of our products.

The Customer Logistics Analyst is the primary point of contact for Wal-Mart Replenishment Managers and is a secondary point of contact for Wal-Mart Buying personnel. The role is critical to developing a high quality relationship with this supply chain driven customer, and plays a vital internal role supporting sales growth and driving operational efficiencies while working collaboratively with Supply and Demand Planning. As an embedded vendor the individual is the face of Mars Canada.

The Customer Logistics Analyst is responsible for supporting critical decisions and providing recommendations impacting both the customer and Mars finished goods inventory. Working 1-2 days a week from the Wal-Mart office the individual must balance maximizing in-stock goals while minimizing inventory levels within both Mars Canada and our customer’s supply chain network. Influencing the customer, our account team, and our internal supply teams is critical to the effectiveness of this role.

The Customer Logistics Analyst will be required to assess proposed promotional activities from your account team members. You will be utilizing Mars and WalMart system in order to build your case for product flow recommendations. Your strong analytical skills coupled with the ability to provide an influential business case will be essential for you to successfully gain support from the WalMart replenishment team for implementing your product supply recommendations.

The success of the Customer Logistics Analyst is measured by exceeding 98.5% on both in-stock and product fill rate goals while delivering target return on inventory investment, supporting sales growth, accurately predicting future demand forecasts, and effectively identifying and resolving any supply chain disconnects between our internal planning process and our customer’s inventory requirements.

Achieving these goals will deliver customer satisfaction and maximize sales for both Mars Canada and our customer.

Principal Accountabilities
Accountable for building and maintaining a collaborative relationship with the Wal-Mart Replenishment team. You should be effective in influencing the Wal-Mart Replenishment team as necessary, gain support for replenishment policies that maximize product availability at store level, all the while minimizing inventory in the customer’s supply chain network.

Responsible for meeting customer in-stock target (98.5%) at store level with no out-of-stocks at the distribution centers. This is accomplished by proactively analyzing inventory levels using Wal-Mart’s proprietary Retail Link system, identification of any forecast behaviors or in-stock issues, followed by implementation of action steps to resolve them.

Forecasting
Use judgment to balance risk of “over forecasting”, the impact inventory levels will have on our business cash versus “under forecasting” and missing out on potential sales opportunities.
Create and be accountable for all forecasting inputs to National Office including:
Item Level Forecasting Template – “bottom’s up” development with our account team’s annual operating plan.
Provide input to Demand Planning - detailed communication to Demand Planning of all promotional and new item activity plans.
Period forecast revisions and review of 30/60/90 day forecast projections.
Item-level deployment requirements for all promotions and new item introductions.
Research and resolution to all checkpoint questions from national office
Subject Matter Expert (SME) for the checkpoint process on the account team

Role Expectations
Be the point-person for operational execution of all modular changes (new item introductions), working jointly with Wal-Mart replenishment team.
Create execution plans and coordinate internally with account teams, demand planning, operations planning, and category leadership to ensure a seamless transition to a new Walmart modular.
Communicate progress on key customer scorecard measures to all internal and customer stakeholders. Accountable for recommendations and action plans for improvement.
Collaborative Planning process – Provide input and recommendations for the planning process integrating customer specific data for sales trends, new items, modular changes and promotion performance trends.
Manage the supply chain inter-dependencies between Sales, Demand Planning, Customer Service, Inventory Management, Operations Planning and the Customer.
Responsible for all Retail Link replenishment activities including:
CPFR events to support promotional and seasonal activity.
 Ensure numerous Retail Link item settings are properly maintained to ensure appropriate store level product replenishment.
Recommend CPFR policies to customer replenishment team.
Utilize Retail Link data to provide analytical support to Account Managers and Wal-Mart Canada Buyers and Replenishment Managers.
Effectively leverage Retail Link reporting capabilities
Retail Link - Subject Matter Expert (SME) on the account team, providing analytical support.
Communicate impact of any Retail Link replenishment policies to all key stakeholders including Demand Planning, Supply, Physical Logistics, Customer Care, and the Account Teams.
Develop and implement on-going improvements for collaborative planning, forecast and replenishment process.
Working knowledge of pipeline systems and procedures with an emphasis on physical distribution and logistics.

Knowledge and Skills
Strong interpersonal skills and leadership ability
Demonstrated ability to work collaboratively with cross-functional teams
Strong planning, project management skills.
Strong internal/external customer centric focus
Good communication skills, written/oral
Expert in Retail Link
Strong Microsoft Excel skills

Minimum Requirements:
Bachelor’s Degree in Commerce, Mathematics, and Engineering or related.
3+ years’ experience in Supply Chain Management, Operations Management and/or Sales having worked directly on Wal-Mart business.
Strong working knowledge in Microsoft Excel.
Willing to travel 1-2 days to Wal-Mart Headquarters.

Preferred Requirements:
1+ years’ experience in Collaborative Planning, Forecasting, and Replenishment Analysis.
Preferred work experience in the CPG industry.
Strong working knowledge with Retail Link.
Working knowledge of SAP.
A criminal records check will be required for this position.

The business analyst works with multiple stakeholders in to elicit, analyze, document and validate requirements for business or project processes, policies and systems. The business analyst interprets business issues and opportunities in the context of the requirements to recommend solutions that enable the business or project to achieve its goals.
Require a degree in a related area and 2-4 years of experience in the field or in a related area. Familiar with database concepts, client-server concepts and cloud computing concepts. Rely on experience and judgment to plan and accomplish goals.

Responsibilities:
Determine operational objectives by studying business functions; gathering information; evaluating output requirements and formats
Construct workflow charts and diagrams; studying system capabilities; writing specifications
Improve systems by studying current practices; designing modifications
Recommend controls by identifying problems; writing improved procedures
Define project requirements by identifying project milestones, phases and elements; forming project team; establishing project budget
Monitor project progress by tracking activity; resolving problems; publishing progress reports; recommending actions
Maintain user confidence and protect operations by keeping information confidential
Prepare technical reports by collecting, analyzing and summarizing information and trends
Contribute to team effort by accomplishing related results as needed
Validate resource requirements and develop cost estimate models
Conduct and coordinate financial, product, market, operational and related research to support strategic and business planning within the various departments and programs of the client group
Interpret, evaluate and interrelate research data and develop integrated business analyses and projections for incorporation into strategic decision-making
Plan and coordinate the development of primary and secondary market research studies in support of strategic planning and specific marketing initiatives, as required and presents findings of studies to client committees
Perform daily, weekly and monthly reviews and analyses of current processes using operational metrics and reports
Review a variety of areas including operations, purchasing, inventory, manufacturing, distribution, transportation and facilities
Understand and communicate the financial and operational impact of any changes
Suggest changes to senior management using analytics to support your recommendations. Actively participate in the implementation of approved changes
Create informative, actionable and repeatable reporting that highlights relevant business trends and opportunities for improvement
Conduct insightful, ad hoc analyses to investigate ongoing or one-time operational issues
Attributes:

Transportation and GPS positioning systems experience strongly preferred
Ability to impact operations and effect change without being confrontational
Detail oriented, analytical and inquisitive
Ability to work independently and with others
Extremely organized with strong time-management skills
Business Analyst top skills & proficiencies:
Systems Design
Analysis
Teamwork
Software Maintenance
Process Improvement
Big Picture Thinking
Work Well Under Pressure
Communication
Problem Solving
Critical Thinking
Relationship Building

job_title: Risk and Controls Analyst- Independent Validation
job_description:
GENERAL ACCOUNTABILITY:
This includes conducting self-assessments against the Principles, identifying gaps, presentation to the steering committee, and participation within a broader team of the development of detailed action plans to remediate gaps and metrics for measurement. . The complexity of the work is high, with elements of technology, process improvement, change management, policy refreshment over a broad scope within the credit risk line of business.
The Risk & Controls Analyst is responsible for coordinating and facilitating the execution of Independent Validation processes and routines, refresh of guidelines and procedures as it relates to ongoing RDARR Compliance of the Enterprise Credit Risk reporting and Portfolio Management business unit. This role collaborates across the US and Canada Credit Risk Reporting teams, including Consumer stakeholders during the Self-Assessment review process
The role will ensure that Testing and Monitoring reviews are completed in a thorough, timely manner, in compliance with Independent validation and operational requirements. The Risk & Controls Analyst is also responsible for reporting on the status of the RDARR compliance with multiple stakeholders.
SPECIFIC ACCOUNTABILITIES:
Responsibility
Support risk efforts to continue to meet compliance for Credit Risk under the BCBS Principles for effective risk data aggregation and risk reporting and/or get regulatory agreement for phased-in compliance beyond that date.
Semi-annual updates to Board and regulator and an annual detailed action plan
Quarterly confirmation of Credit Risk RDARR compliance and actions if required
Support communication development strategies across the organization in support of the change agenda including with meeting with senior business and risk leaders.
Participate in the ongoing support of the Credit Risk work stream governance framework to maintain compliance.
This will include:
Creating and maintaining an Inventory of all regular board, senior risk committee and regulatory reporting to determine the critical data elements, determine project scope assess against current remediation projects.
Refreshed process mapping leading to streamlined manual processes that can be automated
Maintain the control framework across all critical data elements with robust monitoring and reporting
Key resource in the independent validation and for testing compliance processes.
Client Contact
This role is internal to Central Credit Risk Reporting , ERPM and provides support
Qualifications
Bachelor’s degree
Knowledge and understanding of business unit compliance and risk management principles
Expert Microsoft Office Suite Skills with Word, Excel and PowerPoint as key strengths
Strong organizational and interpersonal skills
Strong communication and writing skills
Ability to prioritize workload
Strong troubleshooting/problem solving abilities
We’re here to help
At BMO we have a shared purpose; we put the customer at the centre of everything we do – helping people is in our DNA. For 200 years we have thought about the future—the future of our customers, our communities and our people. We help our customers and our communities by working together, innovating and pushing boundaries to bring them our very best every day. Together we’re changing the way people think about a bank.

As a member of the BMO team you are valued, respected and heard, and you have more ways to grow and make an impact. We strive to help you make an impact from day one – for yourself and our customers. We’ll support you with the tools and resources you need to reach new milestones, as you help our customers reach theirs. From in-depth training and coaching, to manager support and network-building opportunities, we’ll help you gain valuable experience, and broaden your skillset.
To find out more visit us at https://bmocareers.com/
BMO is committed to an inclusive, equitable and accessible workplace. By learning from each other’s differences, we gain strength through our people and our perspectives. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.

We currently have an opportunity for a Regular Full-time Analyst, Imaging Informatics position inthe Medical Imaging department located at our Bayview Campus.
Summary of Duties
The Informatics team within the Department of Medical Imaging at Sunnybrook Health Sciences Centre provides technical and analytical support to operational and clinical areas of the hospital. The focus of the Informatics team is to systematically support evidence-based process decisions and performance monitoring for the service provision of all our imaging modalities (including but not limited to ultrasound, X-ray, CT, MRI, PET, nuclear medicine etc). Informatics team also supports the medical imaging team with any IT related needs including managing PACS, RIS and other ancillary applications. The Clinical Analyst will report to the Manger of Informatics.
Job Duties and Responsibilities
Perform and present data analysis on multiple data sources for analytical and modeling purposes and evaluates key performance metrics and trends.
Develop models including data visualizations.
Perform data mining, such as anomaly detection, classification, regression, clustering, and summarization/recommendation analysis.
Identify opportunities and solutions to better meet business needs to drive performance and optimization
Validate the implementation of improvement solutions via data collection and analysis
Effectively communicate the findings and benefits to present to various stakeholders.
Provide support to the technical team to ensure daily operations in the department run smoothly
Qualifications/Skills
Bachelor’s Degree in Engineering, Data Sciences or Healthcare Informatics
Preference for Master’s Degree in Engineering, Healthcare Informatics
Healthcare and/or clinical imaging experience is an asset
Familiar with informatics applications including PACS and RIS
Experience working with data related to LHIN, MOHLTC, CCO, ATC
Experience with languages; Python, PHP, Java
Experience with relational databases SQL, MySQL, Postgres
Knowledge of statistical modeling tools (e.g., SAS, R), experience with BI tools
Proficient with HL7 data exchange
Experience using simulation software (Simio, SIMUL8 or equivalent)
Experience with MS Office (specifically Word, Excel, PowerPoint)
Strong project management, quality improvement and change management skills
Strong communication skills to deal effectively with stakeholders and the ability to work collaboratively in a team as well as independently
Qualified candidates are invited to submit their resumes and cover letters, quoting file 190527 to:

Human Resources
Sunnybrook Health Sciences Centre

The Saskatchewan Teachers' Federation invites applications for the position of Senior IT Analyst at our head office in Saskatoon. Under the leadership of the Senior Manager, this position will work collaboratively with team members and stakeholders throughout the organization to develop technical solutions to meet the business requirements. The primary purpose of this position is to ensure the soundness and integrity of the business applications and environments.
Primary Responsibilities
Applications
Work collaboratively with the Business Analyst, program areas, and partners to develop technical solutions to meet the business requirements.
Serve as project manager/lead within applications projects.
Support internal- and public-facing business applications across the organization.
Inform and assist with the design and assessment of infrastructure strategies to ensure organizational needs are met.
Inform and assist with security measures to protect the information, assets, and reputation of the Federation.
Inform and assist with operational planning.
Plan, coordinate, install, upgrade, migrate, and maintain all databases and application servers.
Ensure daily backups of database and all other highly critical data to the STF are taken and tested on a regular basis.
Develop and maintain software solutions to meet the needs of the Federation.
Responsible for rigorous quality and assurance testing of all software applications.
Provide staff with proper training to effectively work with all software applications.
Recommend and install appropriate tools and software
Provide knowledge transfer of application design and support to team members through proper documentation.
Supervise staff to ensure high levels of motivation and productivity.
General
Regularly meet with stakeholders to support, troubleshoot, and communicate technical solutions to meet business requirements for the project.
Provide appropriate stakeholder training as required.
Assist with the development of policies and procedures for all IT systems.
Keep manager/supervisor informed about major concerns or problems.
Develop and maintain knowledge and application of people services and other organizational policies and procedures.
Develop and maintain knowledge of the Federation’s vision, mission and values.
Participate in organizational development and professional growth activities as directed and/or required.
Perform other related duties as required from time to time.

Qualifications
The successful applicant will have an undergraduate degree in computer science, information systems or closely related field; plus 5-7 years of experience implementing, maintaining and supporting relational database applications with a proven ability to build relationships and engage with stakeholders from across the organization. English language proficiency with excellent written and verbal communication skills is a definite requirement. Supervisory experience is an asset. Other skills, knowledge and abilities include:
Knowledge and experience in administering Oracle databases, SQL Server databases, and Oracle WebLogic Server/Application Server.
Proficient in Java or similar object-oriented programming languages and SQL coding with SQL Server and Oracle databases.
Knowledge and experience with application development in Oracle ADF/Forms/Reports.
Strong overall technical skills in a Windows-based environment.
Experience with identity and access management (IAM) solutions is preferred.
Experience with cloud computing services or solutions is preferred.
Highly motivated.
Strong communication skills, including the ability to articulate complex information to a non-technical audience.
Strong interpersonal and collaboration skills.
Skilled at anticipating, assessing, and responding effectively to the needs and expectations of clients.
Proven ability to work independently, or in a team environment dealing with people from various disciplines to achieve goals, and to identify and resolve problems.
Ability to develop, maintain and build positive relationships with partners while demonstrating tact and diplomacy to impact and influence at all levels of the organization.
Ability to prioritize and manage multiple initiatives to meet deadlines and ensure quality and efficiency while demonstrating flexibility to adjust to changing work priorities.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.

Salary and Benefits

Application Procedures

Full-time
TGLN is seeking a highly motivated individual who is passionate about health data and wants to make a difference in the field of health care. The Senior Health Informatics Analyst reports to the Manager, Transplant Performance Measurement and Evaluation and is responsible for the analysis and interpretation of data to support decision making, performance measurement, policy development and innovation at TGLN.
Duties & Responsibilities:
Analyses and interprets clinical data to assist decision makers in drawing meaningful conclusions to support decision making such as identifying barriers to high performance and statistical modelling to project policy change impacts.
Interprets analytic findings and provides recommendations to TGLN’s management team, senior executive and external stakeholders to enhance organ and tissue donation and transplantation processes.
Presents results from data analysis in a manner that is clear and easy to understand for a variety of audiences including the TGLN management team, senior executives and external stakeholders such as transplant hospitals, laboratory directors and researchers.
Participates in projects such as transplant wait time analysis, transplant recipient survival analysis and donor epidemiology by providing advanced statistical analysis and reporting.
Ensures analysis is completed, delivered on time and meets client needs.
Manages data analysis portions of projects, which includes collaborating with colleagues on the Transplant and Informatics teams.
Extracts data from data warehouse and other data sources such as web stat reports, vendor dashboards or other available reporting tools using standard and customized processes, tools, and procedures.
Develops data quality audit reports to assess, monitor and improve data quality and makes appropriate recommendations to enhance data quality.
Designs, develops and maintains customized recurring reports.
Performs other duties as required.
Qualifications & Experience:
Bachelor’s degree in related field (biostatistics, statistics or epidemiology) required. A master’s degree is preferred.
Minimum five (5) years of work experience in a health care sector, or a combination of equivalent experience and education.
Experience with health care indicators (e.g. key performance indicators) and working with large longitudinal datasets.
Strong understanding of relational database concepts.
Extensive knowledge of statistical analysis methods and applications.
Demonstrated excellent knowledge of survival and regression analysis.
Extensive experience with PL/SQL, MSSQL, SAS or other data extraction and management tools.
Experience with SQL Server Reporting Services.
Experience with business intelligence tools such as Tableau and Excel.
Demonstrated strong communication and client management skills.
Experience working with internal and external stakeholders required.
Knowledge of medical terminology, clinical information and clinical outcomes to support accurate analysis and interpretation of data.

POSITION DESCRIPTION

The Senior Business Analyst is responsible for reviewing, assessing, developing and optimizing the business processes. Analyze and translate business requirements into system deployments and/or business process changes. Work closely with business users and stakeholders capturing requirements including process opportunities, needs for new or enhanced capabilities, training and reporting needs. This role acts as a liaison between the business users and project team. The business analyst uses knowledge of business applications and processes to develop and recommend appropriate solution and process engineering based on user needs and business priorities.

RESPONSIBILITIES

Planning Responsibilities

Participate in the continuous improvement of the business processes by researching best practices, devising improvements, piloting new techniques, and creating more effective processes.
Participate in the preparation of business case documents, project plans and other information needed by management to select and prioritize business initiatives, working with business project managers.
Assist in project planning and project scope sessions to ensure compliance with the project charter, implementation plan, and client agreements.
Operational Responsibilities

Document business objective, scope, benefits in appropriate document templates such as the Business Case.
Elicit and document the business requirements of multiple stakeholders.
Facilitate the negotiation of requirements amongst multiple stakeholders.
Identify business priorities based on assessment of business needs.
Conduct change impact analysis to assess the potential implications of changes and documents business rules, functions and requirements.
Assess the risks of various solutions.
Obtain key inputs from enterprise architecture teams and identifies solution interdependencies.
Create an improvements deployment road map.
Provide training and support to business for processes, procedures, application functionality, enhancements, upgrades and improvements, as required.
Leadership and People Responsibilities

Liaise effectively with the business systems analyst or developers assigned to the project, to ensure proper transition of requirements from business requirements through to technical (system) requirements.
Act as liaison between the stakeholders and project team to facilitate implementation of business solutions that enable the organization to achieve its goals.
Build a strong working relationship with both business units and external business partners.
Responsible for planning, coordinating, and documenting user acceptance testing, performing quality tests, and participating in the resolution of problems.
Finance/Budgetary Responsibilities
Conduct Cost-Benefit analysis.
Technical Responsibilities

Provide technical assistance in training, mentoring and coaching business team members.
Recommend and promote best methodology practices to adopt.
Proactively search for improvements to business processes and propose best-in-class solutions and services.
Possess an understanding of systems engineering concepts and the enterprise application ecosystem.
QUALIFICATIONS

Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Management or a related field is required
10 years experience as a Business Analyst
5 years in a consulting or client relationship management environment
5 years experience with ERP systems and their standard processes covering Finance and HR sectors
10 years experience in the development and implementation of process improvements including technology solutions
Familiarity with Agile solution delivery methodology
Excellent analytical, synthesis and problem-solving skills
Strong knowledge of MS office suite: Vision, PowerPoint, Excel and Word
Knowledge of databases that capture existing information and demonstrate the use of data sources
Leadership and ability to coordinate projects
Ability to communicate and influence different levels of management
Bilingual (English and French) both written and oral is preferred
IIBA certification is an asset

Role
Reporting to the Manager, Financial Planning, Budgeting and Purchasing, the Cost Management Analyst is vitally involved in preparing the Cost Management Program for the organization, focusing on the development of contribution margin for each line of business and overseeing the maintenance of the Activity-Based Costing system to meet the MOL requirements as changes arise. Working collaboratively across divisions, the Cost Management Analyst will analyze financial data to help answer key business questions, including how to better understand, create, and deliver value to the customer. The Cost Management Analyst will support key financial indicator reporting requirements to evaluate organizational financial performance as well as year-end preparation.
Key Responsibilities
Note: Percentages refer to approximate % of time spent on each area, over the course of a given year
1. Cost Management Activities And Internal Support & Administration (100%)
Prepares and performs cost management activities as per the direction of the Manager, Financial Planning, Budgeting and Purchasing, including:
Reviews all lines of business to determine their respective fixed and variable costs;
Coordinates the performance of pricing for all lines of business; collaborates with the client services department and IRPD department to recommend the pricing strategies for the organization.
Conducts contribution margin review for each major line of business for the organization (training, consulting services, product sales, safety group, system conference, regional conferences, strategic alliance, volunteer services, strategic support services (i.e. HR, IT and Finance), etc., and collaborates effectively with internal clients services and various levels of management to develop the appropriate benchmark of each contribution margin for all services.
Plans, gathers data, conducts and implements cost and time studies to analyse and establish benchmarking contribution margin on a regular basis to ensure the costs components are reflected at the current realistic and achievable levels.
Develop and maintain contribution margin tools related to the various lines of business for the Customer Acquisition and Retention division teams.
Reviews historical information for different revenue streams and provide analysis to set appropriate targets and goals for the organization. Reviews and monitors revenue generation and provides effective forecast of revenue generation on a quarterly basis.
Using activity cased costing, develop and analyze CM outputs and provides effective recommendations and plan of actions to improve cost management program, add-value for the end process/products, improve processes and determine the cost of customers and develop the pricing strategies
Develops and produces timely, quality reports on revenue, cost and contribution margin and profit margin analysis on a regular basis to support WSPS Senior Management Group's decision making process.
Act as a consultant to internal divisions on customer/contract profit and loss analysis for new/existing business.
Work with the product development team on various projects as the finance lead and various teams across the organization on cost reduction initiatives, including recommending ways to control costs within the budget and CM with the goal of achieving increased efficiencies.
Audit and validate the system data integrity for financial reporting purposes as IT system changes and upgrades are performed. Collaborate with IT and other divisions to investigate in any identified issues and recommend solutions in a timely manner to ensure the efficiency and accuracy of system generated reports.
Actively participates in departmental projects that contribute to the vision and mission of the organization by establishing appropriate Contribution Margin for each project.
Any other duties as assigned.
2. Contributes to a Healthy And Safe Work Environment (at all times)
Adheres to WSPS policies, procedures, process fact sheets, guidelines and business rules established in the WSPS Quality Management system which ensures the achievement of our quality goals.
Contributes to promoting a healthy and safe culture, and links efforts to the WSPS quality management system approach (Plan, Do, Check, Act, Continuous Improvement Cycle).
Acts as a role model internally and externally by demonstrating knowledge of health and safety and wellness practises.

Enrolled at the mid to senior level towards achieving a public administration or finance degree (BA or BBA) or professional accounting designation program considered an asset.
5-7 years demonstrated experience in strong and effective financial analytical skills.
3 years demonstrated experience in cost management preparation techniques/modeling and analysis.
Proven ability to proactively identify risks and opportunities and recommend supported solutions where action is required to be taken or decisions need to be made.
Ability to handle sensitive financial information in strictest confidence.
Exemplary customer service skills, excellent organizational abilities, attention to details, accounting knowledge gained through experience and education, strong report writing skills, and verbal communication skills.
Project management skills, with the ability to lead multiple projects and work under pressure to meet tight deadlines when necessary.
Ability to work independently under minimal supervision as well as in a team environment to share/transfer knowledge.
High level of proficiency in applicable software programs such as Excel, Great Plains (including project accounting), Microsoft Dynamics (CRM), SalesForce etc.
Competent in using Windows, Word, Access, Power Point and Outlook programs.
Valid Driver's License.

Job Description

The PMO Analyst reports to the IT PMO Manager, Portfolios. Within the Ubisoft IT department, the Project Management Office acts as the hub for all information relating to project and portfolio management (PPM). The PMO also supports IT governance by introducing PPM guidelines and best practices and encouraging their adoption by the organization.
The incumbent will need superior analytical skills to identify issues and opportunities in the IT portfolio, and an aptitude for solving complex problems quickly and effectively. A keen eye for detail and a passion for quality is essential. Great communication skills will be required to positively influence and lead the organization towards maturity.
Responsibilities:
The main and routine tasks of the IT PMO Analyst are to:
Analyse project and portfolio data, monitor and improve its quality, and provide insightful reporting

Critical functions

 Participates in business analysis activities to gather required reporting, ETL and dashboard requirements.

Job Requisition: Sourcing Analyst
The Challenge
Reporting directly to the Sourcing Director, the Sourcing Analyst provides support to the Sourcing Team by providing analysis and assisting in routine business and financial data tracking and business systems management. The Sourcing Analyst works in conjunction with the Sourcing Team providing a strong & effective exchange of information between Vendors, Accounting, Facility Managers and other Operations support groups.
Specific duties
Maintain and manage a comprehensive database of current contracts and insurance certificates in an electronic format accessible to all team members. Minimize risk by reviewing monthly contract and insurance terminations.
Analyze spend data and report on trends, determine the need to reforecast and or change vendors, renew or terminate the existing contract(s).
Manage vendors PO requests and monthly follow up for invoices for completed work.
Support Accounting in managing and keeping the PO open amounts to minimum.
Prepare contract documents, PO requests and ensure proper contract terms and conditions and insurance are in place and maintained in accordance with the Management Agreement and established legal requirements.
Interface with Jones Lang LaSalle national procurement to access preferred supplier and national contracts programs and collaborate with Jones Lang LaSalle peers to exchange best practice procedures.
Manage electronic reporting tools for cost savings and value add accomplishments across the entire team.
Collaborate with Sourcing Specialists & Contracts Administrators with analytics to execute sourcing and vendor management activities
Assist with evaluation of cost changes with additional analysis and review of cost change templates
Work cross functionally with other teams to handle vendor questions/issues/problems on an as needed basis
Perform general administration and other duties and projects as assigned
What you bring to this role
2-5 years supporting a purchasing/buying department
Post-Secondary education with a focus in Business and IT database management
Demonstrated strong knowledge and experience in Microsoft Word, Excel, Access, PowerPoint
Strong quantitative skills
Attention to detail
Sense of urgency
Excellent follow up skills
Strong written and verbal communication skills
Ability to adapt to constant changes in priorities
Solid critical thinking skills

Pega Application Analyst
About the Business

Through innovation and collaboration, we're striving to continually find new and better ways to bring value to Sun Life. Enterprise Services has employees in Canada, Ireland, the U.S. and Asia.
