Our Pega Application Analyst will have overall responsibility for the design, development, technical delivery and overall quality of Pega solutions. They will contribute to agile team goals by collaborating with other functions in the team, as well as developing specifications, code, and documents in order to ensure successful implementation and maintenance of solutions.
What will you do?
Perform and coordinate complex application programming activities
Contribute to agile team goals by collaborating with other functions in the team, actively participating in Scrum ceremonies
Develop specifications, code, and documents in order to ensure successful implementation and maintenance of solutions
Participate in scope definition workshops and owns delivery of the completed work.
Share complexities as an input into costs for a project and helps estimate work effort.
Collaborate with architects, designers/developers, business system analysts and testing specialists to deliver high quality solutions
Produce both high-level and detailed-level designs and implement Pega solutions based on business requirements and defined architectures
Contribute to defining timelines and project plans; analyze and estimate feasibility, cost, time and scope
Ensure information security standards and requirements are incorporated into all solutions
Contribute to the ongoing support, stability and performance of application systems in production including problem analysis, resolution, and escalation and reporting as necessary.
Coordinate with both onshore and offshore teams to ensure coding, testing, debugging and implementation activities are completed as required
Analyze, define and document requirements for data, workflow, logical processes, interface design, internal and external checks, controls, and outputs
What do you need to succeed?
3 years’ experience designing and delivering complex Pega case management projects
Demonstrated experience in solution design for Pega based solutions encompassing internal facing and external facing applications
Advanced knowledge of BPM concepts, techniques, tools and delivery approaches
Minimum 3 years of progressive information technology experience with full application development life cycle and systems integration experience
Knowledge of the PRPC Architecture, as well as PRPC design & implementation features.
Strong data modeling experience
Excellent written and verbal communication skills and can explain concepts to both business and IT stakeholders
Experience working in Agile and Waterfall environments
University Degree or College Diploma in a related discipline.
Pega Certified System Architect (CSA).
Preferred Skills: Technical working experience with Java/J2EE (JSP, Servlets, EJB, XML); relational databases (Oracle/DB2/MS SQL Server). Knowledge of the financial and insurance industries including Group Benefits / Retirement products and business domains.
Special Notes:
Occasional weekend / after-hours work may be required to support project implementations, system upgrades and support for production environments
IT supports internal business clients in Waterloo, Toronto (North York) and Montreal. Occasional travel between these locations may be required.
What’s in it for you?
A collaborative and interactive team environment
Access to our Global Learning Centre, available 24/7 for your learning needs
The opportunity to give back to the communities in which we live, work, and do business
The opportunity to move along a variety of career paths with amazing networking potential
When a new position becomes available which matches your background and experience, the base pay range will be disclosed and correspond to the opportunity Sun Life will consider you for.
In addition to Base Pay, eligible Sun Life employees participate in various incentive plans, payment under which is discretionary and subject to individual and company performance. Certain sales focused roles have sales incentive plans based on individual or group sales results.
Diversity and inclusion have always been at the core of our values at Sun Life. A diverse workforce with wide perspectives and creative ideas benefits our clients, the communities where we operate and all of us as colleagues. We welcome applications from qualified individuals from all backgrounds.

The Business Intelligence (BI) Analyst works closely with internal teams to turn data into critical information and knowledge that can be used to make sound business decisions. BI Analyst understands how data is turned into information and knowledge and how that knowledge supports and enables key business processes


KEY RESPONSIBILITIES


Analyze and document business requirements and priorities to develop key performance indicators (KPI), and the business intelligence and data warehouse strategy
Educate and train internal staff on the use of data as an analytical tool, displaying the information in new form and content
Work with and educate our business development, marketing, finance, and program teams to design and develop dashboards, reports and visualization of customer trends through quarterly presentations
Provide leadership and take initiatives to facilitate information gathering, structure documentation and presentation of findings to all levels of management
Establish processes and controls to store and maintain clean data records that can be used as source data for reporting
Make improvements to our data warehouse and ensure that data is managed in a way that is easily available to users for direct consumption or integration with other systems
Lead projects in the implementation and use of new BI software tools and systems
Provide subject matter expertise for key BI core functions
Develop and maintain technical specifications and documentation
Troubleshoot issues quickly and to stay up-to-date on current and emerging technologies, standards and trends
Other duties as assigned


TRAINING:


Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Systems or equivalent
EXPERIENCE:


5+ years of experience as a business intelligence analyst designing and implementing data warehouses using enterprise business intelligence software such as Microsoft Power BI or equivalent as well as visualization tools such as Tableau
ESSENTIAL SKILLS:


In-depth experience with data warehouse design, modeling and data mining
In-depth knowledge of database management systems, online analytical processing and ETL processes
Experience using SQL/TSQL and Microsoft SSRS/SSIS/SSAS
Demonstrated problem solving and analysis skill set to map, report and analyze data trends


OTHER SKILLS:


Strong written and oral communication skills
Ability to work effectively in a team environment
Exceptional time management skills
Ability to deal with stressful situations with professionalism and to periodically work overtime and outside normal business hours

Trillium Health Partners (THP) is one of the largest community-based acute care facilities in Canada. Comprised of the Credit Valley Hospital, the Mississauga Hospital and the Queensway Health Centre, Trillium Health Partners serves the growing and diverse populations of Mississauga, West Toronto and surrounding communities and is a teaching hospital affiliated with the University of Toronto.
Our Mission: A New Kind of Health Care for a Healthier Community
When we set out to build our vision and future, we connected with our community - patients, families, visitors, physicians, staff and volunteers. The foundational goals of our new strategic plan - quality, access and sustainability - anchor everything we do. Our mission for a new kind of health care is built on an inter-connected system of care organized around patients - inside and outside the hospital.
At THP, we are relentless in providing high quality, compassionate care to our communities and take great pride in fostering an inclusive and accessible environment and we are all accountable for contributing to a healthy, safe and respectful environment for healing and promoting excellence in patient care though advancing patient and staff safety. If you are passionate about what you do, motivated to improve the health of the community, committed to excellence, quality and patient safety we would like you to join our Better Together team!
Job Description:

We are looking for a Senior Analyst to join the Partnership Projects team within the Strategy, People and Corporate Affairs Division to support Project Zero (PZ). PZ is a cross-sector mental health initiative aimed at eliminating death by suicide for children and youth through improved prevention and care delivery across Mississauga. Preliminary partners include Peel District School Board, Peel Children’s Centre, Peel Public Health, Trillium Health Partners, the Dufferin Peel District Catholic School Board, and the Mississauga Halton LHIN. As a member of the team, the ideal candidate will support the Senior Project Manager and Director to drive forward this strategic partnership project to improve the mental health of children, youth, and families in our community.
Here’s what you will get to do:
Participate in the planning, coordination, communications and engagement processes for core partners, affiliate partners, project committees and working groups, and children, youth, and families;
Support a project team and leadership through all aspects of the various phases within the project;
Contribute to the development of materials such as reports, presentations, briefing notes, requests for proposals, data analyses and communications throughout all levels of project governance structure;
Support project research, literature reviews and data / information gathering to enhance subject-matter knowledge relevant to the project;
Engage in data analytics, reporting and critical thinking to support project deliverables and planning;
Contribute to the development and dissemination of project control documents, including status reports, risk / issue analyses, and project plans, and;
Monitor and report on progress, problems and solutions of the project to project management team and escalate issues as appropriate.

Accountabilities:
Engage with external project partners, affiliates, and supports as appropriate;
Support key committees working groups that are integral to the success of the project as required including meeting scheduling and coordination with multiple project partners;
Support the Senior Project Manager in the planning, development and coordination of complex project work plans, timelines, and deliverables related to project mission;
Engage and communicate with stakeholders and project partners on an ongoing basis and ensure changing resource and project requirements are met and understood;
Liaise with project partners to ensure the successful completion of project deliverables; and
Other duties assigned, as required to meet timelines and deliverables.

Qualifications:
All candidates must have an undergraduate degree.
Masters degree in public, business administration, or healthcare administration or equivalent experience considered an asset.
Minimum 3-5 years of experience in a healthcare or partnership environment working with complex and dynamic teams.
Excellent organizational, time management and project management skills.
Strong understanding of Trillium Health Partners strategic plan.
A strong understanding of Health, Education, Community and Social Service sectors is an asset.
Strong analytical, problem solving and systems-thinking abilities.
Strong adaptability, collaboration, and relationship building skills are essential for this role.
Experience effectively engaging with and managing third-party partners and delivery partners required.
Ability to work under pressure and tight timelines.
Demonstrated effectiveness at working with teams as well as working independently.
Experience in human-centred design thinking, planning, and engagement is an asset.
Superior writing and PowerPoint design skills.
High proficiency in Excel and Microsoft Suite is a must.

Internal Candidates who believe they possess the necessary qualifications and experience for this position and who have been in their current position for at least six (6) months are encouraged to apply.

To pursue this career opportunity, please visit our website: www.trilliumhealthpartners.ca

Trillium Health Partners is an equal opportunity employer committed to fostering a healthy, safe and respectful environment for healing, based on our values compassion, excellence and courage. To be Better Together, we commit to fostering a respectful workplace culture that promotes a safe and supportive environment for everyone who provides care, supports caregiving, receives care or visits the hospital.
In accordance with the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act, 2005 and the Ontario Human Rights Code Trillium Health Partners will provide accommodations throughout the recruitment and selection process to applicants with disabilities. Reporting to General Counsel, the Risk Analyst will be part of the Corporate Legal and Risk Group and responsible for contract review, risk management and risk reporting in support of a client group. They will also coordinate the procurement and administration of all bonding and subcontractor default insurance.


This position is based in the Calgary, AB office.


Responsibilities

Leadership

Demonstrate the Promise and contribute to it becoming embedded across the organization.

Risk Management

Oversee and perform the contract review process to identify contract risks, risk tolerances, and act as a liaison between all branches and legal for risk mitigation and contract approval.

Act as a liaison between operational teams and legal to coordinate and corporate matters in the tender process such as certified resolutions, incumbency certificates or corporate guarantees.

Participate in the contract kick off process and set up to ensure contractual risks are known, tracked and managed throughout a project, and coordinate proper SAP set up.

Maintain and update a central depository of all contracts.

Coordinate reporting of key risk indicators and other ad hoc reports.
Insurance and Contract Surety Boards

Respond to questions from internal and external sources regarding the corporate insurance program.

Provide assistance to the project teams in the procurement of project specific insurance coverage and surety bonds.

Maintain records of new claims and track the progress existing claims.

Support the gathering and compilation of insurance renewal information and submission packages.

Coordinate prequalification for subcontractor default insurance, HSE prequalification and through the Compass subcontractor prequalification programs.
Relationship Management

Develop and maintain strong working relationships and open communication with project teams to reinforce responsible risk management practices and ensure compliance with corporate policies and procedures.

Cultivate collaborative relationships with subcontractors/suppliers with a strong emphasis on confidentiality, tact and diplomacy.
Stuart Olson Corporate
Participate in corporate initiatives.


Qualifications

Undergraduate degree or diploma in business, risk management, or insurance

CIP, FCIP or CRM designation

Combination of 3+ years’ experience with risk management, commercial contracts, and electrical subcontracting

Aptitude for analysis and interpretation of data

Understand the value of continuous improvement recommending new approaches, methods or technologies to increase efficiencies

Demonstrates a willingness to learn new ways to accomplish work activities and objectives

Ability to forge, grow and maintain positive relationships with multiple groups

Ability to manage multiple priorities simultaneously and meet the time demands of unpredictable activities; capable of handling pressure and challenges in a dynamic business environment

Ability to work within tight deadlines and prioritization of work to achieve them

Strong analytical, critical thinking, problem-solving skills, and a high degree of accuracy and attention to detail

Highly developed interpersonal, communication, and organizational skills

Demonstrated sense of urgency and strong commitment to achieving goals; ability to work in challenging, fast paced and steadily changing environment

Ability to work collaboratively with a positive attitude

Highly developed written and verbal communication skills

Supportive of a culture that encompasses the highest ethical standards aligned with the Company Promise


Why Choose Stuart Olson?

Safety, Sustainability, Collaboration, and Integrity are core Company values that encourage innovation and make a lasting difference in meeting the goals of our stakeholders and the communities in which we operate. Stuart Olson strongly supports and encourages employees to get involved and give back in their local communities. We expect our employees to bring their best to work every day and in return, management recognizes and rewards employees for their valued contribution through competitive compensation, robust benefits, health & wellness programs, and learning development opportunities. At Stuart Olson we are committed to creating a culture built on a passion to do great things.


Who We Are?

Stuart Olson has been positively impacting the businesses we serve, the communities in which we operate, and the lives we touch since 1911. Our rich history demonstrates our reach and diversity as an integrated, full service organization serving the commercial and industrial markets.


We are a $1 billion+, fully integrated commercial construction and industrial services provider with offices in British Columbia, Alberta, Saskatchewan, Manitoba, and Ontario. We deliver confidence through a client-centered approach that ensures the highest quality of service, reduces risk and delivers results.

job_title: Brother Emerging Talent Analyst program, Data Analyst - Programme de développement des talents émergents de Brother, Analyste de Données
job_description:
Are you known for bringing the notion of analytics and critical thinking to another level?
Are you obsessed about details and nuances that are commonly overlooked? Can you pin point the not so obvious patter ns ?
Are you passionate not only about analysing & discovering a gap , but equally enjoy the translation of what that gap actually means and communication of your findings/recommendations ?
Do you have the guts to go up against the status quo? Are you looking for a company that invests in its people and promotes from within?
If you answered yes to these questions, we MUST meet since Business Management Analytics - Data Analyst will be the main objective of this role!
Join us at Brother, as the Brother Emerging Talent Analyst, where you will have the rare opportunity to directly contribute to the defining, predicting and improving the overall business performance. Help us take a deeper dive in order to help us make the best business decisions!
We’re Brother Canada and we’re looking for recent university graduates to work with us as associates for a year at our Dollard-Des-Ormeaux , Montreal office – the kind who are obsessed with the latest business trends, who are great leaders and who genuinely care about the people they work with.
The Brother Emerging Talent Analyst Program- Data Analyst is designed to expose you to different aspects of our business by analyzing & solving complex problems within various departments.
The Brother Emerging Talent Analyst program- Data Analyst is similar to a free agent rookie tryout in that you have the opportunity to prove what you’re made of and get placed in a department anytime throughout your 1 year contract.
This is not an internship!
We are investing in your rapid development to help build our talent bench strength and make you a successful, long term member of the family!

When people think Brother, they think of our motto: great people delivering a superior customer experience. They think of quality office products and innovative sewing and embroidery machines – and you could play a key role in delivering that superior customer experience. How? By mapping out processes, deeply analyzing how we do things, proposing and implementing improvements and striving to increase departmental and organizational efficiency: People, Marketing, go-to-market, Finance, Operations – we are a whole lot of opportunity.
This is your chance to develop your business skills, work with various departments and learn the ins and outs of our business.
We want your drive, ask you to challenge the status quo and we give you the autonomy to make recommendations!
On a more official note, here's what you'd be doing :
Conduct business analysis and present key findings and recommendations that will ultimately impact the performance of the company
Document and analyze business processes
Work closely with stakeholders to gather data requirements, build analysis & experimental designs, draw conclusions and present findings
Use predictive analytics to influence decisions
Produce project plans and report on execution status
Participate and initiate projects to improve the efficiency and effectiveness of our strategies
Recommend and implement business improvements
Contribute to instill a culture of Continuous Improvement
 Build and improve reports according to business needs and specific requirements
What we look for:
Proven academic and/or professional experience with data analysis is a must
Graduated with a Masters in Management Analytics, Masters in Economics, Masters in Supply Chain Management, Masters in Decision Science, MSc of related discipline that touches upon enterprise decision management is an asset
Have 0-3 years’ experience in a related field
Have experience in research methods (quantitative and qualitative)
Have a strong base in statistics
Have a solid working knowledge of Microsoft Office and strong computer skills in general
Are flexible and can adapt quickly to an ever-changing environment
Learn quickly and are highly motivated, resourceful, analytical and detail-oriented
Are an excellent communicator in both French and English
Are capable of understanding departmental needs
Have experience with SAP- an asset
What you need to know:
Brother Canada has 3 offices (Dollard-des-Ormeaux (QC), Brampton (ON) and Richmond(BC))
You will be reporting to the Manager, Corporate Planning who is located at the Dollard-des-Ormeaux (QC) office, this role is for our Dollard-des-Ormeaux (QC)
The projects are linked to all aspects of the organization
Here's what Brother has got to offer:
Great people who work hard, play hard and look out for each other because we’re a team—it’s that simple!
An animated work place in the West Island of Montreal and a rich social life where Brother people at all levels take social responsibility and giving to the community very seriously
High profile employee recognition program that includes financial rewards
Benefits
Hurry, and apply now!
____________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________
Êtes-vous connu pour amener la notion d' analyse et de réflexion critique à un autre niveau?
Êtes-vous obsédé par les détails et les nuances qui sont généralement négligés? Pouvez-vous identifier les tendances moins évidentes?
Êtes-vous passionné non seulement par l’analyse et la découverte de lacunes , mais aussi par l’étude de ce que ces lacunes signifient réellement et la communication de vos résultats/recommandations ?
Avez-vous le courage de remettre en question le statu quo? Êtes-vous à la recherche d'une entreprise qui investit dans ses employés et la promotion à l'interne?
Si vous avez répondu oui à ces questions, nous DEVONS vous rencontrer puisque l’ analyse de la gestion des affaires sera l’objectif principal de ce rôle!
Joignez-vous à nous chez Brother, en tant que nouveau talent Brother, où vous aurez l'occasion rare de contribuer directement à la définition, à la prévision et à l'amélioration du rendement global de l'entreprise . Aidez-nous à mieux comprendre afin de prendre les meilleures décisions d'affaires!
Nous sommes Brother Canada et nous cherchons de nouveaux diplômés universitaires qui travailleront avec nous en tant qu'associés pendant une année à nos bureaux de DDO, à Montréal - ceux qui sont obsédés par les dernières tendances commerciales, qui sont de grands leaders et qui se soucient vraiment des gens avec qui ils travaillent.
Le programme BETA (Brother Emerging Talent Analyst)- Analyste de données est destiné à vous exposer à différents aspects de nos activités en analysant et en résolvant des problèmes complexes au sein de différents services.Le programme BETA- Analyste de données est semblable à un essai pour débutants en ce sens que vous avez la possibilité de prouver ce dont vous êtes capable et d’être placé dans un service à tout moment tout au long de votre contrat BETA d’un an.
Il ne s’agit pas d’un stage!
Nous investissons dans votre développement rapide pour nous aider à renforcer nos compétences et faire de vous un membre de la famille à long terme!

Quand les gens pensent à Brother, ils pensent à notre devise : « des gens formidables qui assurent un service remarquable ». Ils pensent à la qualité de nos produits de bureau et de nos machines à coudre et à broder innovantes – et vous pourriez jouer un rôle clé dans la prestation de ce service remarquable. Comment? En schématisant les processus, en analysant en profondeur la façon dont nous faisons les choses, en proposant et en mettant en œuvre les améliorations et en s'efforçant d'optimiser l'efficacité organisationnelle et départementale : gestion des talents, marketing, commercialisation, finances, opérations – nous offrons énormément d’opportunités.
Voici votre chance de perfectionner vos compétences en affaires, de travailler avec plusieurs services et d'apprendre les rouages des affaires.
Nous voulons votre motivation, nous vous demandons de remettre en question le statu quo et nous vous donnons l'autonomie de formuler des recommandations!
Sur une note plus officielle, voici ce que vous feriez :
Procéder à une analyse opérationnelle et présenter les principaux résultats et recommandations qui auront ultimement un impact sur la performance de l'entreprise.
Documenter et analyser les processus opérationnels.
Travailler en étroite collaboration avec les intervenants pour recueillir les données nécessaires, élaborer des analyses et des plans expérimentaux, tirer des conclusions et présenter les résultats.
Utiliser l’analyse prédictive pour influencer les décisions.
Produire des plans du projet et présenter des rapports sur l’état d’exécution.
Participer et initier des projets visant à améliorer l’efficience et l’efficacité de nos stratégies.
Recommander et mettre en œuvre des améliorations de processus.
Contribuer à l’instauration d’une culture d’amélioration continue.
 Préparer et améliorer les rapports selon les besoins de l’entreprise et des exigences spécifiques.

Certification / diplôme en analyste de données ou domaine pertinent est obligatorie
Est titulaire d’une maîtrise en analyse de la gestion, d’une maîtrise en économie, d’une maîtrise en gestion de la chaîne d’approvisionnement , d’une maîtrise en sciences de la décision, d’une M.Sc. dans une discipline connexe qui touche à la gestion des décisions d’entreprise est une option
Possède de 0 à 3 ans d'expérience dans un poste similaire
A de l’expérience avec les méthodes de recherche (quantitatives et qualitatives)
A une solide base en statistique
Possède de solides connaissances pratiques de la suite Microsoft Office et d'excellentes aptitudes informatiques en général
Est flexible et peut s'adapter rapidement à un environnement en constante évolution
Apprend rapidement et est très motivé, débrouillard, analytique et soucieux des détails
Est un excellent communicateur à la fois en français et en anglais
Est capable de comprendre les besoins du service

Brother Canada a 3 bureaux (Dollard-des-Ormeaux (QC), Brampton (ON) et Richmond (C.-B.))

Des gens formidables qui travaillent fort, associent sérieux et plaisir et s’entraident parce que nous sommes une équipe—c’est aussi simple que cela!
Un milieu de travail dynamique et une vie sociale très riche où les gens de Brother de tous niveaux prennent très au sérieux leur responsabilité sociale et l’entraide communautaire

Hi! We're ecobee.

We are pioneers and innovators in the fast-emerging connected home and IoT industries. ecobee products are beautifully designed and incredibly smart. They are connected devices which automate your home while helping you save energy and money. We're headquartered in Toronto, and play on a North American scale.

We're growing. In fact, we're growing really fast. And, we're looking for great people to join our hive.

Your Impact:
We are looking for a driven and diligent financially-minded Business Analyst to support data driven decision making at ecobee. As a Business Analyst on our Strategic Analytics team you will have the opportunity to work with our management team and will be responsible for partnering with business leaders to drive insights and actions that can be leveraged to improve business performance.

The ideal candidate will be highly analytical and will play a supporting role by providing financial, analytical, and decision support across the organization. We are looking for a self-starter with exceptional analytical and modeling skills, excellent communication and interpersonal skills and can work with individuals and teams at all levels of the organization.

Ways you can contribute day one:

Support business leaders in preparing for monthly business reviews, including the maintenance of monthly P&L statements for each business function
Implement and maintain a financial analysis system, which models the impact that business decisions have on the company's future financial performance
Coordinate and lead the budget and forecasting process
Create ad-hoc analysis and models for business leaders that provide insights into areas of opportunity and risk that influence business strategies and investment decisions
Develop valuation models that are tailored to start up organization dynamics
Support the integrity of ecobee's data including customer, product, services and pricing information to ensure accuracy

Who You Are:

You have an educational background in Business, Finance or Accounting, ideally you have or are working towards your CPA designation
3 - 5 years of experience in Finance or Accounting
Highly organized with demonstrated problem solving and decision-making ability
Exceptional analytical and critical thinking abilities
Excellent interpersonal, communication, and presentation skills, you have experience and are able to present to non-experts at both the management and non-management levels
Excellent knowledge of analytical tools (spreadsheets, relational databases, and statistical packages)
High level of proficiency in statistical analysis, research, data mining, and data querying in SQL
Proven ability to effectively handle and prioritize multiple and complex projects, adapt to changing priorities, and meet deadlines in a fast-paced environment
Just so you know: The hired candidate will be required to complete a background check.

What we are offering:

An opportunity to grow with a dynamic company, personal and professional growth
Truly meaningful work that affects our planet
Small collaborative teams where you can impact both product and culture
Learning opportunities supported by an education fund for every employee
Community support through our ecobee acts program

Are you the one we need? If so, we would love to hear from you.

Are you an IT Triathlete?
Are you passionate about creative problem-solving at the intersection of People , Processes and Technology ?
Our client is on an exciting journey of unprecedented transformation and growth: if you are ready to leverage everything you’ve learned in your career to date with a team that is changing the Facilities Management industry landscape in Canada and beyond, then come put your signature on the next chapter.

What you’ll get to do:
Officially titled “ Solutions Consultant ”, you will move with ease between technical and business worlds, translating and distilling complex concepts to audiences in both directions, at multiple levels.
You will use every skillset within your multi-discipline expertise to enable elegant and innovative business solutions:
o Business Systems Analysis
o Project Management
o Product Management
o Customer Relationship Management

As a facilitator, you will be both catalyst and enthusiast to draw out needs, problems, opportunities, obstacles, solutions, success criteria and ultimately, consensus and approvals.

As a communicator , you will build and use a broad rapport on many fronts to gather and disseminate incisive, decision-grade data to all relevant stakeholders in your ever-evolving communications molecule.
As a keen observer of company and industry trends, you are constantly monitoring and fostering continuous improvement and best practice opportunities and going to bat for technical innovation and efficiency ideas.
As a creative problem solver, you will apply your ever-growing scope of awareness of the organization’s moving parts to assist with troubleshooting insights when production questions or issues arise.

What you’ve done:

If your experience on many projects, wearing many hats, means everyone asks to have you on their team, now is the time to leverage all that effort you’ve invested to date - this could be the pivotal role where you get to truly shine and re-frame your career path!

$28.93 an hourJob Specification

The Quality Assurance Analyst is accountable for maintaining data and software quality within the organization. This includes writing and executing test scenarios to fully test issues, enhancements, applications and corresponding data to make sure the results are reliable, fully functional, and user-friendly. Additionally, the QA analyst is responsible for daily system administration, configuration and maintenance.

Responsibilities
Job Duties
May include but not limited to:
Technical expert and end user support for customer information systems, advanced metering systems, bill design applications, payment transfer processes, field tools and reporting tools.
Configuration, administration and maintenance of all systems based on business and regulatory requirements.
Analyze vendor-driven release notes, feature specs and upgrade change lists and create/execute custom test scripts with an understanding of impact to business.
Responsible for troubleshooting, analysis, issue reproduction, issue logging, testing and validation of fixes and enhancements for all systems.
Perform bill print quality assurance for production issues, enhancements or as a result of project work.
 Collaborate with business, product and development teams to determine what to test for production issues, enhancements and projects. Create, execute, validate and document tests for reported issues and enhancements.
Recommend and perform batch updates to ensure data integrity.
Responsible for all data mapping efforts including analysis and documentation.
Other duties as assigned.

Requirements
Special Skill Requirements
Excellent written and verbal communications skills to properly document issues/enhancements and work directly with both the business and IT for resolution.
Excellent prioritization skills, focusing on the most important / time sensitive tasks.
Excellent time management skills with the ability to multi-task deadline-driven tasks.
Strong investigation and analytical skills, utilizing both black and grey box testing.
Strong attention to detail with focus on ensuring the delivery of high quality accurate and reliable data.

Knowledge and Experience Requirements
Graduation from a recognized post-secondary institution in computer science, quality assurance or software-related diploma and 2 years’ experience with testing including test strategies, executions of tests and issues tracking or the equivalent combination of education and experience.
Proficient with computer systems and related programs including Microsoft Office, Access and Visio.
Demonstrated knowledge of customer information systems, advanced metering systems, bill design applications, payment transfer processes, field tools and reporting tools.
Understanding of change control and auditing standards.
Understanding of querying using SQL an asset.

job_title: Intern Opportunity- Business Intelligence and Analytics Co-Op
job_description:
InternshipJob Field:
Facility/Property Management
Job Type:
Internship/Co-op
Length of Assignment:
Summary of BGIS

BGIS, A Brookfield Company, is a leading provider of real estate management services, including facilities management, project delivery services, energy and sustainability solutions, building performance management, workplace advisory and management, and real estate services. With a combined team of over 7,000 team members globally, BGIS inspires better business performance across its client's real estate portfolios by developing and implementing real estate and facilities management strategies. Globally, BGIS manages over 300 million square feet of client portfolios across 30,000+ locations in North America, Europe, Middle East, Australia and Asia.

SUMMARY:

As part of the Analytics West team, you will be engaged and ready to support the Senior Manager, Strategic Information with data collection, data mining and analysis tasks, and will support data managers and analysts.

The Analytics team’s role is to address complex business problems using cutting-edge tools and techniques. Artificial Intelligence is a rapidly expanding field which is critical in enabling companies to remain competitive, or to differentiate themselves. The intern will have the opportunity to get immersed in various aspects of the Analytics and AI fields through the acquisition and analysis of data.

The co-op intern will be reporting to the Senior Manager, Strategic Information and will work cross-department on advanced analytics and data mining work. The student will be engaged in various stages of the end-to-end delivery of analytical models. A sample project may be supporting equipment behaviour overtime through work order analysis and predicting equipment failure. This role is an exciting opportunity for students interested in entering the field of Data Science/Artificial Intelligence/Analytics post-graduation.

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:

Acquire data from internal and external sources
Extract, transform and clean data from internal data systems and from external data sources, including sensor data
Perform exploratory data analysis (EDA) on the data and identify areas for deeper investigation using tools which can handle larger data volumes (e.g. PowerBI, Tableau, Access etc.)
Data Engineering – adding value to collected data by engineering features
Provide input and recommendations on in-house data management/ data governance
Highlight process improvement areas to enhance team productivity
Develop analyses to understand opportunity areas for further exploration, for example
Create dashboards for disseminate information to business audiences using tools such as PowerBI or Tableau
Partner with the in-house IT team to develop data extraction queries
Support data managers and analysts with analytical tasks
Presenting findings and recommendations internally

Important messages
Although women make up 60 per cent of all graduates in Canada, they are still underrepresented in IT positions globally and seem to be declining – according to the Canadian Labour Force Survey, women represented almost 30 percent of the IT workforce in 2011, whereas they represented just slightly over 27 per cent in 2016.

The Government of Canada would like to help attract and develop women to grow their careers within the technology landscape, with jobs and opportunities for career advancement across a broad range of specializations, throughout Canada and internationally.
The Government of Canada offers meaningful and influential careers with opportunities to work on social, technological and economic topics that matter to Canadians. We also believe in continuous learning through onboarding, on-the-job training, coaching, mentoring, interdepartmental placements, and other opportunities. We offer a collaborative and horizontal work culture facilitated by the Government’s digital collaboration tools.

The technology industry needs more women – submit your application today!

DEPARTMENT DESCRIPTION

The Public Markets Group manages a portfolio of fixed income and equity investments representing approximately $90 billion utilizing both index and active management strategies. The Group invests in Canada, the U.S. and Internationally in both the Developed and Emerging Markets. Assets are managed using both internal management and external managers. The Group uses a diverse mix of financial instruments including bonds, equities and derivatives. In addition, the Group is a leader in Responsible Investing actively integrating environmental, social and governance factors into our investment analysis and decision-making.

POSITION DESCRIPTION

Based in our offices in Victoria, British Columbia, and reporting to the Manager, Operations, Public Markets, the Analyst will be part of a small and growing team supporting the execution of Public Markets’ strategy. The Analyst will be responsible for Portfolio Management and Trading support such as analytics, execution support, and investment support. They will assist in the implementation of new technology solutions and initiatives, and work with internal and external BCI partners to execute on Public Markets’ strategy.

QUALIFICATIONS

Required:

University or College degree in a relevant discipline
2-4 years of relevant experience successfully working in project management and business analysis, preferably within large institutional investment organizations
Strong preference for technical competencies in front-office technology solutions (Charles River, Bloomberg AIM), SimCorp Dimension, and service-oriented architecture
In-depth knowledge of public markets products, derivatives and trading processes is required
Strong technical expertise including familiarity with programming (R, Python, SQL) and business intelligence tools (Tableau, Power BI) would be preferred
Demonstrated ability to collaboratively engage staff and stakeholders
Ability to manage multiple and competing priorities to meet tight deadlines
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Energetic and enthusiastic team player, capable of working both independently and in a team environment
Strong attention to detail for accuracy and initiative to follow up on items and get things done
PRIMARY RESPONSIBILITIES

Assist in the project assessment, design, delivery, monitoring, and governance of new tools, business solutions and infrastructure to support Public Markets strategy
Apply investment and technological knowledge in design of business solutions
Gather business requirements, develop solutions with internal and external stakeholders, review and conduct testing, implement solutions, and conduct user training and provide ongoing support
Support the review and continuous improvement and re-engineering of existing processes and procedures and the implementation of new processes as applicable
Provide portfolio management and trading support including customized reporting, analytics, and execution support
Continually acquire and enhance knowledge of Public Markets investment strategies, processes, and changing technologies to be able to provide effective business solutions and support
Interface between Public Markets, external service providers and internal business partners and stakeholders
COMPETENCIES

Relationship Management

Effective performers understand that a primary factor in success is establishing and maintaining productive relationships. They devote appropriate time and energy to establishing and maintaining networks. They initiate contacts readily and maintain them over time. They are able to capitalize on relationships to facilitate business transactions.

Communicativeness

Effective performers recognize the essential value of continuous information exchange and the competitive advantage it brings. They actively seek information from a variety of sources and disseminate it in various ways. They use modern technologies to access and circulate information.

Analytical Skills

Effective Performers have strong analytical skills; they are able to provide well thought out recommendations based on a rigorous process of collecting, organizing and analyzing data. As timelines, can often be short or uncertain, analysis must be done in a timely manner, balancing the need for detail and requirement for action.

Problem Solving

Effective performers are able to identify problems, solve them, act decisively and show good judgment. They isolate causes from symptoms and compile information and alternatives to illuminate problems and issues. They involve others as appropriate and gather information from a variety of sources. They find a balance between studying the problem and solving it.

Initiative

Effective performers are proactive and take action without being prompted. They don’t wait to be told what to do or when to do it. They see a need, take responsibility, and act on it. They have a strong results orientation and make things happen.

Job Overview
As a team member in our global, high growth environment, you will be challenged, inspired, and appreciated. Our knowledge was built on the legacy of several great businesses, and today we are one of the fastest growing companies in North America. Be a part of something more. Grow your career with us, and be a part of a unique culture that’s proud of its integrity, innovation, and growth.
Position Summary
The person in this role will be part of the growing Insight team and be working with some of the best marketers in Canada. The right candidate brings an understanding of marketing research methods combined with a natural curiosity to find meaning behind numbers. This is an opportunity for someone to leverage their growing experience working in either the supplier or client side of marketing research and looking to take the next step in their career. You will play a role in making sure our Insights are actioned and translated into meaningful business decisions throughout the organization. This role reports into the Sr. Manager, Insights.

RESPONSIBILITIES :

Manage purchased Syndicated research services and ad hoc reports
Interact with our proprietary consumer panel from survey writing, programming through to reporting
Support the Insight team’s various internal requests, helping to coordinate projects, design studies and build reports
Managing relations with multiple internal stakeholders including, Brand Marketing, Innovation, Commercial Strategy and Sales
Collaborate with the US Insights team to leverage opportunities and ideas
Requirements
REQUIREMENTS :
Minimum of 3+ years professional experience in consumer insights, marketing research; client and supplier experience considered an asset
Bachelor Degree in Marketing, Business Administration or equivalent
Post graduate Marketing Research training and certification is ideal
Experience in working as part of a cross-functional team
Experience with SPSS is desirable. Advanced Excel and PPT required.

SKILLS :

Good knowledge and understanding of the Canadian CPG/FMCG industry
Strong project management, time management and organizational skills
Good communication and presentation skills
Market research survey design
Ability to analyze and synthesize data
Capacity to deal with ambiguity with the ability to work efficiently in a fast-paced, changing environment.
Sense of customer service
Strong interpersonal skills and a proven ability to build relationships internally

This person will be part of a dynamic, dedicated team within a fast-growing organization. In addition to a competitive compensation package including benefits, an RRSP and employee stock option plan, and vacation time, we also offer tuition reimbursement, discounts on coffee products, and 52 hours every year for volunteer work in the community!
Company Overview
Keurig Dr Pepper (KDP) est une importante entreprise de café et de boissons en Amérique du Nord, engrangeant des revenus annuels de plus de 11 milliards de dollars et dont les deux sièges sociaux sont situés à Burlington, au Massachusetts, et à Plano, au Texas. KDP occupe une position de choix dans les marchés des boissons gazeuses, des thés et cafés de spécialité, de l’eau, des jus et boissons à base de jus, et des préparations pour cocktails, et commercialise la plus importante marque de cafetière une tasse à la fois aux États-Unis. L’entreprise exploite un réseau de distribution sans pareil pour son portefeuille comptant plus de 125 marques – incluant des marques maison, sous licence ou partenaires – afin de servir tous les consommateurs, où qu’ils soient. KDP offre une grande variété de boissons chaudes et froides pour combler tous les besoins, notamment les produits des marques Keurig®, Dr Pepper®, Green Mountain Coffee Roasters®, Canada Dry®, Snapple®, Bai®, Mott’s® et The Original Donut Shop®. L’entreprise est aussi le principal fournisseur de services de café au Canada, grâce à sa division des Services de café Van Houtte, offrant diverses solutions à travers le pays. Elle emploie plus de 25 000 personnes et exerce ses activités dans quelque 120 bureaux, usines de fabrication, entrepôts et centres de distribution en Amérique du Nord.

Keurig Dr Pepper (KDP) is a leading coffee and beverage company in North America with dual headquarters in Burlington, MA and Plano, TX, with annual revenue in excess of $11 billion. KDP holds leadership positions in soft drinks, specialty coffee and tea, water, juice and juice drinks and mixers, and markets the #1 single serve coffee brewing system in the U.S. The Company maintains an unrivaled distribution system that enables its portfolio of more than 125 owned, licensed and partner brands to be available nearly everywhere people shop and consume beverages. With a wide range of hot and cold beverages that meet virtually any consumer need, KDP key brands include Keurig®, Dr Pepper®, Green Mountain Coffee Roasters®, Canada Dry®, Snapple®, Bai®, Mott’s® and The Original Donut Shop®. The company is also the leading coffee services provider in Canada with its Van Houtte Coffee Services division offering diversified solutions across the country. The Company employs more than 25,000 employees and operates more than 120 offices, manufacturing plants, warehouses and distribution centers across North America.

job_description:
At Rogers, we connect Canadians to a world of possibilities and the memorable moments that matter most in their lives. Every day we wake up with one purpose in mind. To bring loved ones together from across the globe. To connect people to each other and the world around them. To help an entrepreneur realize her dream. A sports fan celebrate a special moment.

Because we believe connections unite us, possibilities fuels us, and moments define us.

The Senior Analyst, Capacity Planning provides expertise on workforce capacity planning in their line of business. Working closely with Demand Planning, Site leadership and Finance to bring a fact-based highly analytical approach to all recommendations. The individual must maintain an intimate knowledge of all drivers of call centre capacity planning, avoiding potential road blocks, in achieving our long term goals.

Please note- This is a 12 month Contract

What you will be doing:

Leadership
Leverage skills to influence and make recommendations to site primes and business stakeholders to achieve common objectives
Consult with and provide recommendations that will deliver on customer service objectives whilst managing Expense budgets, that are aligned to strategic objectives
Provide direction and insights with cross functional teams to ensure excellence in execution
Analytics
Analyze complex information, uncover trends, provide data driven insights and conduct strategic initiatives to inform business actions and drive performance
Identify and deliver recommendations against opportunities and risks
Provide proactive consultation and analysis to drive superior business performance
Track, report on and lead action plans across all queues.
OPEX Management
Work closely with Demand Planning and Finance to ensure that accurate OPEX forecasts that pertain to internal and vendor capacity, are submitted to enable the achievement of Service Levels
Monitor and provide insights on a daily basis to ensure that workforce KPI’s are balanced and OPEX commitments are met
Efficiency & Growth
Deliver on short (weekly/monthly) and mid-term (quarterly/yearly) commitments by actively evaluating trends and pre-emptively engaging with relevant primes on gap closure tactics when forecasting performance gaps
Identify process improvement measures to maximize efficiencies and productivity across workforce metrics
Identify and monitor all key drivers for workforce productivity and capacity planning
Collaborate with Operations’ teams to share and implement best practices across all sites

What you bring:

3+ years of progressive workforce experience
Excellent analytical and problem solving skills with ability to define critical issues
Confident, transparent and concise communicator
Comfortable with detail and ability to summarize information into key insights, establishing linkages to business strategy and objectives while generating ideas to improve business performance
Self-starter with ability to solve ambiguous / open ended business challenges
Effective project management skills and ability to progress multiple projects simultaneously

Schedule: Full time
Shift: Day
Length of Contract: 12 Months
Work Location: 333 Bloor Street East (012), Toronto, ON

O2E Brands is seeking a Business Intelligence Manager to lead a talented team and partner with business leaders by providing accurate and timely information and data analysis to give insights to drive our business forward.

What people say about you:
I love helping business leaders make sense of data and information to support them in making decisions to drive the business forward. I have a passion for data and information and want to lead and educate others about the power of business intelligence! Along with my strong business acumen and communication skills, I am also savvy with technology and work well with technical teams. I am passionate about leading and growing other data and analytics professionals and I’m always keen to share my knowledge and experience to enable and empower others. I want to help shape the strategy for business intelligence in a fast-paced and growing organization!

Who we are:
With our four uniquely branded home service franchises - 1-800-GOT-JUNK?, WOW 1 DAY PAINTING, You Move Me and Shack Shine - we make the ordinary businesses of junk removal, painting, moving and house detailing exceptional by being leaders in customer experience and innovation. It’s all in our name: O2E = Ordinary 2 Exceptional!

And it’s not just our brands that are exceptional, our team is too! We foster a culture people want to be a part of. We strive to make work rewarding and fun. We’ve been continuously recognized as one of Canada’s top employers and one of the country’s most admired cultures.

A day in the life:

Lead and drive discussions and decisions around business intelligence tools, reports and solutions
Responsible for the architecture and governance of our data and information
business intelligence
Work closely with the EVP, Customer and Strategy to build out BI competency model for organization with a view to increasing organization’s competency and maturity related to analytics
Implement Tableau across the organization as a primary tool for enabling decision makers to access and understand business intelligence
Lead data governance council to drive data continuity, integrity and alignment across key technology platforms.
Manage, maintain, refine and evolve the data dictionary to ensure consistent use of metric definition with all enterprise reports and analysis
Manage, maintain, refine and evolve the data monitoring systems to ensure system stability and business continuity
Identify opportunities to improve data management capabilities across groups through data profiling and mapping data flows through business processes.
Work with stakeholders and team members to identify data needs to develop broader data strategy in support of the current and future programs.
Advise on the best practices and improvements.
Development and refinement of ongoing reports and dashboards.
Architecting, designing, implementing and monitoring ‘best practice’ framework in Business Intelligence
Deliver a “One Version of the Truth” approach to all data used within organization
Create and deliver relevant reports and information to our leadership team to help optimize business decisions
Work in collaboration with our database administrators and analytics team
Mentor, manage and lead data and reporting analysts
Lead training and education efforts related to business intelligence on behalf of the organization

What you bring to the table:

Hands-on experience in a business insights and/or business intelligence role ideally with Salesforce experience
Experience with SQL, R, Python, PHP, business intelligence tools such as Tableau (preferably), Power BI, BusinessObjects, Cognos, or similar
Experience working in a fast-paced and entrepreneurial environment while creating a structured environment for your team
Comfortable managing efforts in data warehouses and/or developing large scale reporting solutions
Proven experience leading a team of analysts and/or data engineers
Experience managing communications and deliverables with multiple stakeholders at various levels throughout an organization
Deep knowledge on BI architectural elements such as ETL, Warehousing, Visualization
Strong project management skills, including the ability to take initiative, multi-task, prioritize and manage multiple projects simultaneously
Strong business acumen

Do you have a vendor contract administration background with a specialty in IT supplier relationship management? We're looking for a service level management analyst to support our IT managers in the development, implementation, and maintenance of our IT vendor contracts to ensure business deliverables are met. If you'd like to join an IT contracts management team that strives to integrate continuous improvement in the service level management practice to ensure optimized supplier value, then we'd like to hear from you.
What you'll do
As an IT service level management analyst you will:

Facilitate the development of service level requirements to ensure supplier performance meets IT stakeholder expectations
Conduct ongoing supplier management activities including ensuring supplier compliance with reporting and contract terms
Be the first point of contact with business managers to resolve supplier issues
Coordinate the supplier review processes including data collection, analysis, and formulating recommendations
Prepare and present supplier performance reports and dashboards and escalate unresolved issues
Monitor vendor contracts across the division to find ways to gain efficiencies and recommend cost effective improvements

Is this a good fit for you?
We're looking for someone who can:

Lead meetings and facilitate conflict resolution, using tact and diplomacy
Ask pertinent questions, summarize and verify data, analyze technical, statistical and financial information, and make recommendations based on the information and data
Create and deliver presentations and communicate complex technical information (verbally and in writing) to a wide variety of audiences
Establish and maintain collaborative working relationships with individuals and teams, displaying professionalism, discretion, and patience

Your experience and educational background:
A bachelor's degree
A minimum of six years of experience in supply chain, procurement, or other business experience that includes the fundamentals of supplier relationship management, preferably in an IT environment
Specialist knowledge of service level management including contract elements, support, maintenance, pricing, and costing
Knowledge of IT functions including software, hardware, licensing, and support maintenance processes
Knowledge of project management principles and practices
Supply Chain Management Professional (SCMP) designation from the Supply Chain Management Association (or equivalent body from outside of Canada) is an asset
Proficiently use spreadsheet and presentation software

Who are we?
At WorkSafeBC, we're dedicated to promoting safe and healthy workplaces across B.C. We partner with workers and employers to save lives and prevent injury, disease, and disability. When work-related injuries or diseases occur, we provide compensation, and support injured workers in their recovery, rehabilitation, and safe return to work. We also work diligently to sustain our workers' compensation system today and for future generations. We're honoured to serve the 2.3 million workers and 231,000 registered employers in our province.
What's it like to work at WorkSafeBC?
It's challenging, stimulating, and hugely rewarding. Our positions offer tremendous diversity and excellent opportunities for professional growth. Every day, the work we do impacts people and changes lives. What we do is important and so are the people we do it for.
Our benefits
Being part of WorkSafeBC means being part of a strong, committed team. Along with a competitive salary, your total compensation package includes vacation, optional leave arrangements, health care and dental benefits, and contributions toward your retirement pension. As a member of our team, you'll have access to services and benefits that can help you get the most out of work — and life. Learn more about our what we offer.
WorkSafeBC is an inclusive and accessible employer committed to employment equity objectives and invites applications from all qualified individuals. Only those under consideration will be contacted. If you're unsuccessful, please accept our appreciation for your interest.
This position is restricted to those legally entitled to work in Canada.

PermanentWhat is the opportunity?
The Senior Analyst will be responsible to execute tools and procedures required under RBC’s stress testing program (includes annual Internal Capital Adequacy Assessment Process (ICAAP), enterprise-wide, reverse and ad hoc stress test exercises). This individual will provide internal and external stakeholders with insightful and robust analyses of RBC’s portfolios under stressed conditions. The Senior Analyst will develop, improve and implement stress-test tools, procedures and methodologies, often in collaboration with various cross-functional teams across RBC.

What will you do?
Implement and execute tools, procedures, and methodologies required for stress test production and analysis of RBC’s exposures and portfolios.
Provide insightful analysis of stress testing results.
Document RBC’s stress test results, methodologies, frameworks, and practices.
Collaborate in specification and development of stress testing scenarios.
Collaborate in review and challenge of stress testing results for several risk areas (such as market / trading; retail credit; structural interest rate; liquidity), with appropriate consideration of cross-platform relationships and correlations.
Collaborate with team leadership in achieving a transformation of enterprise stress testing capabilities and frameworks. This includes building the requisite infrastructure and/or supporting data systems to execute on the group’s stress testing mandate.
Provide approaches tailored to timelines and data availability, utilizing detailed or 80/20 solutions, and quantitative and/or qualitative approaches, as appropriate.
Cross-functional participation and support in Group Risk Management, Stress Testing projects; keep abreast of advances in credit risk analytics and stress testing.

What do you need to succeed?
Must-have
Strong programming skills in VBA, Python, SQL. Experience with MS Access
Strong conceptual, analytical, and problem solving skills.
University degree in an analytical discipline such as quantitative finance, economics, business or mathematics, and/or a relevant professional qualification. 1+ years of analytical experience with a financial institution. Other industry experience will be considered based on applicability.
Exposure to at least one of the following risk methodology areas is an asset: credit, market/trading, structural interest rate, and/or liquidity risk. Knowledge in the areas of stress testing, macroeconomics or international finance is an asset.
Ability to communicate, verbally and in writing, complex concepts to a non-technical audience.

What’s in it for you?
We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.
A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation
Ability to make a difference and lasting impact
Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team
Opportunities to take on progressively greater accountabilities

Royal Bank of Canada is Canada’s largest bank, and one of the largest banks in the world, based on market capitalization. We are one of North America’s leading diversified financial services companies, and provide personal and commercial banking, wealth management, insurance, investor services and capital markets products and services on a global basis. We have over 80,000 full- and part-time employees who serve more than 16 million personal, business, public sector and institutional clients through offices in Canada, the U.S. and 37 other countries. Reporting to the Manager, Career Support and Lead, Accessibility Technology, the Coordinator, Data Analyst and Participant Engagement will support the data management needs for various Programs in the GTA region and connect with participants to conduct surveys and collect service quality information. You are a sharp, disciplined individual who has a passion for mobile games. Your experience helps to demonstrate your superior quantitative analytical skill and a scientific thought process. Your expertise paves the way for working with our game team to optimize every facet of player retention and monetization to ensure the continued success of our games. Large datasets are your playground and you can’t wait to join the fun!

Sound like a match? Kabam Vancouver is looking for a Data Analyst to join us!We don’t just make games, we play and love them too.

You will contribute by:

Providing support to cross-functional teams across the organization to understand overall business goals, improve reporting, and assist with larger scale projects as needed
Finding answers to business questions via hands-on exploration of data sets using SQL, dashboards, statistical analysis, and data visualizations
Generating and maintaining a suite of dashboards and reports for teams throughout the organization
Creating and managing multiple A/B tests to gain valuable insights on KPIs including retention, acquisition, and monetization
Measuring the success of product features after release and optimize their performance through rapid, data-driven iteration
Aiding in task prioritization and general project management within the data team
At Kabam, we’re constantly raising the bar of excellence in free-to-play mobile gaming. We hire for passion and diversity so that together as a team we can triumph in our collective skill. Our teams are made up of a fusion of personalities and interests bound together by a collaborative nature, fun-loving culture and drive to do what it takes to make great games. And that’s where you come in…

Your background includes:

2+ years of industry data analysis experience, with solid knowledge of statistical methods
Bachelor’s Degree, preferably in a STEM discipline
Expert SQL skills and experience querying very large data sets
Proven ability to thrive using multiple mixed, varied, and inconsistent data sources
Fundamental knowledge of project management methodologies
Comfort presenting complicated material to diverse audiences
It would be nice to have:

Experience with Google BigQuery, Tableau, JIRA and/or other project management software
Experience working for a social or mobile game developer
Understanding of game design concepts and principles
MBA or Master’s Degree
Joining a team of highly-motivated individuals inquisitive spirits who are always searching for the answers to hard questions. With an inquisitive spirit, you will provide meaningful insights into how Kabam’s games operate and contribute to setting them up for continued success.

Excited by this opportunity? We invite you to apply and start the conversation with us.

Together, we can create some of the best games ever made.

About Kabam
Kabam is a world leader of massively multiplayer games for mobile devices. Console quality graphics and next generation technology are the hallmark of Kabam games. Kabam merges the art of game design and the science of consumer behaviour to create immersive games enjoyed by players around the world. Kabam’s games have generated hundreds of millions of downloads including Marvel Contest of Champions and Transformers: Forged to Fight and won several awards including Apple Editor’s Choice and Google Play’s Best Game of the Year. Kabam has studios and offices in Vancouver, San Francisco and Austin. Kabam is a wholly-owned subsidiary of Netmarble Games.

We manage a large number of high traffic websites that provide digital goods to people around the world. We take pride in the optimization of our web content, and are constantly looking for ways to grow while improving what we bring to the table.
Dynamo Media is looking for a talented Data Analyst to join our growing team.

As a successful candidate, you will be expected to help the company make more sensible actions through analysis of key metrics as set by management. As web and technical projects are deployed, you will be involved in determining and quantifying criteria that will identify the level of success of a project.
You will need to have excellent communication skills in order to liaise with your own team, as well as other departments in order to learn the structure of the business and its key functions. You will will also be communicating with other teams to identify opportunities for analysis, as well as to understand the different groups’ measurements for success.
A successful candidate must also be comfortable making presentations with visual aids to management to explain the underlying raw data in layman’s terms, as well as provide suggestions for a course of action based on the results of the completed analysis.

Responsibilities:
Identify and measure key performance indicators
Create documentation to help all departments understand data flow

Reporting to the Manager, Business Analysis the Senior Business Analyst will be a critical enabler of cross-team collaboration and project success at the organization. The Senior Business Analyst will be charged with leading the project definition process with clients, including definition and documentation detailed functional and business requirements, facilitation of communication between cross-functional teams, and contributing to the overall improvement of our products, projects and process. As a key owner of the end product, the Senior Business Analyst will be a highly engaged individual invested in the successful delivery of transformative digital solutions.
You Are:
A strategic thinker, thinking strategically about the improvement of the client’s business through the use of digital and non-digital applications
Customer focused , being a believer in the customer experience, and acting as the bridge between technology solutions and customer needs.
Innovative , recommending new approaches to digital applications based on data driven insights provided by Analytics Specialists and Strategists
An effective communicator , ensuring an understanding the complexities of a digital project and ensuring a common understanding within the internal and external project teams
A collaborator , collaborating on the development of a standard set of tools and formats to communicate business and technical requirements to both technical and non-technical audiences
A master facilitator , interviewing the client’s key stakeholders to gather and document business and technical requirements
Extremely detailed , leaving no stone unturned when mapping out complex interactions between users and digital systems
Your Key Responsibilities:
Here’s what you’ll be doing day to day…
Collaboration: Working closely with client/team to understand objectives, scope, timing, and budget
Workshop Facilitation: Conduct stakeholder interviews and client workshops to uncover the business goals and objectives that a solution must address ; capture and present ideas, through white-boards, sticky notes, process maps – ensuring that every data point in brainstorms and workshops is identified and mapped
Visual Presentation: Produce information architecture diagrams, use cases and process maps, visually representing how information, users and processes flow
Requirements: Own the requirements gathering process, both in the Discovery of a solution (writing Business Requirements), as well as the Technical Definition & Delivery of a solution (writing Functional Requirements)
Process Improvement: Analyze and assess processes at the project level, with the goal of documenting and designing process improvements where gaps or bottlenecks are identified
Clear Communication: Ensure collaboration, and clear communication of ideas across teams – utilizing the requirements as the benchmark that Project, Strategy, Creative, Technology and QA teams are working towards
Technical Knowledge : Carry a keen understanding of technical knowledge and software development lifecycle best practices; support technology teams through the development phase of the project, triaging tickets and questions on the requirements as they arise
Change Management: Communicating changes to requirements in order to ensure a common understanding of the final product
Quality: Assist QA teams in developing their test cases, providing the guidance and support needed for a polished product delivery; manage the UAT phase of projects, leading the client through approvals of the final product, ensuring that the build is up to the standards designed initially conceived in the requirements
Mentorship: Coaching and mentoring junior BA staff to ensure a consistent process, and high quality of deliverables
Your Experience & Intangible Traits:
The ideal candidate for a Senior Business Analyst position will possess the following competencies:
Strong technical background in understanding how software and hardware systems interconnect, and how databases and information architecture is designed (via SQL, HTML5, CSS, XML, CMS, etc.)
Demonstrate experience in developing and owning Business & Functional Requirements documents, as well as managing requirements within JIRA, Teamwork, or other such project management tools
Exceptional knowledge of the software development lifecycle, while working in both Agile and Waterfall methodologies
Superior ability to manage short- and long-term projects simultaneously, managing time and prioritizing effectively across multiple initiatives
Incredible attention to detail, thoroughness, and precision in all deliverables
Excellent verbal, writing, and presentation skills
Skilled in troubleshooting and problem-solving
Engaging team player, excited to collaborate and self-start new ideas and solutions
5+ years of experience in Digital Strategy, Business Analysis, Information Architecture or UX for digital projects
Bachelor’s degree and/or diploma in Engineering, Technology, Computer Science or similar
Why you’ll love working here:
Full health benefits (100% dental coverage, prescription, vision, massages, life insurance and short term/ long term disability)
Generous vacation and retirement plans
Employee support program
A brand new cell phone, with upgrades every 24 months (we’ve got your phone bill covered, too)
Ongoing training and development opportunities, peer-taught lunch and learns and outside workshops like Ladies Learning Code
Catered Friday lunches
Loaded snack cupboards
Office-ping pong and foosball tables, plus the latest and greatest video games
Friendly community with lots of social events – from boat cruises to volleyball tournaments
Participation in charity initiatives

The Heart and Stroke Foundation
Life. We don’t want you to miss it.™

That’s why Heart & Stroke leads the fight against heart disease and stroke. Powered by donors and volunteers, we fund life-saving research and help Canadians lead healthier lives.
Heart & Stroke is a health charity active in communities across the country. We are sustained by the commitment and generosity of more than 100,000 volunteers and more than 1.4 million donors.
