Reporting to the Senior Manager, CRM Solutions, the Information Management Support Analyst (ISSA) will provide end user support for HSF’s core application, OneCRM and its associated technologies. The ISSA will provide end user support by troubleshooting issues and developing and implementing logical and effective solutions. The ISSA will be responsible for resolving all technical and functional issues and requests in a timely manner. This position will contribute to the overall operational management of OneCRM and its associated technologies lead the change request process and be a key contributor to implementing new OneCRM functionality releases. ISSA will work closely with other HSF teams, external vendors and end users to remediate reported incidents in a timely and professional manner.Activities include but are not limited to triage, troubleshooting and gathering and analyzing logs to identify the possible cause of incidents. The incumbent will participate in the determination of appropriate course of action to resolve issues with minimal business interruption. The primary focus of this position is to ensure smooth operation of OneCRM and its associated technologies.

Key responsibilities
General Day-to-day Application Support

Address enquiries and provide support to internal staff and external customers via email and phone.
Utilize application knowledge to effectively troubleshoot, diagnose and resolve problems.
Ensure requests are completed in a timely and courteous manner while building rapport with their clients.
Communicate and escalate issues as needed. Perform post-resolution follow-ups ensuring clients are satisfied with the end results.
Interface with the Information Management team, Service Desk, ITS Infrastructure and external vendors to ensure issues are resolved
Open support tickets and work with external vendors to address, manage and fix technical issues
Manage support queue, assigning work orders via an internal ticketing system according to the tiered support model
Proactively act on issues, draw additional support from team members and escalate as required
CRM Operational Management

Continuously monitor and audit existing data for quality assurance. Analysis and clean-up of existing and incoming data. Compiling, sorting and verifying the accuracy of data before it is entered
Research information to complete missing data
Perform and verify that scheduled and ad-hoc system processes and data loads are successful and data is accurate
Help with user access management (License availability, permissions etc.)
Bug/Enhancement identification & testing
Develop and communicate a schedule for future OneCRM releases/enhancements
Perform related duties consistent with the scope and intent of the position
Training and Documentation

Record, track, and document the help desk request problem-solving process, including all successful and unsuccessful decisions made, and actions taken, through to the final resolution.
Write and maintain help sheets, FAQs, and knowledge database
Help develop training plans, materials, and documentation for users and keep materials up-to-date
Create and update documents related to application support method and procedures
Help provide ongoing product training and refresher sessions to new and existing users
Monitor user adoption rates and respond as needed by providing additional training sessions, communication, modifications, or other resources
Analysis and Requirements Gathering

Assist with analyzing business processes used within business units and recommend technology or process changes that would eliminate unnecessary processes, improve department efficiency and effectiveness, and improve information flow between departments
Help gather and document business and system requirements
Assist with research and recommendations to update processes
Contribute to CRM product evolution and acquire new knowledge to improve support offering
Lateral Relationships

Work with the internal business solutions application support team and internal program partners to resolve issues and manage pipeline of bugs fixes and enhancements
Work with internal training partners to address training needs to the area offices
Work with external vendors to manage support requests and technical builds
Work with IT Computer and Operations team for systems testing, project work, database management, network operations to gather required information to resolve issues and to provide guidance and expertise about OneCRM
Understand & effectively communicate issues and translating requirements to technical team
Manage cross-functional users expectations (business, technical and external vendors)
Qualifications
Education

Bachelor degree or college diploma in computer science, information systems, business administration or related field
Work Experience and Skills

3 – 5 years working in Information Management / Technical environment
3 – 5 years in tier 1 or tier 2 application support
1 - 2 years with a solid understanding of SQL Server and Microsoft software development environments
Strong knowledge of relational databases and database integration for websites
Strong analytical skills in application diagnostics, issue isolation and troubleshooting
Proficiency with standard MS Office applications, MS Visio, MS Project
Strong understanding of systems environments, quality assurance and change management methodologies
Ability to work independently and in a team environment
Knowledge in financial, ERP, CRM, business support and reporting systems, an asset
Strong interpersonal skills in areas such as teamwork, facilitation and negotiation
Strong written, verbal and presentations skills, with the ability to tailor information to the audience in a way that establishes rapport, influences others and gains understanding at all levels
Strong ability to communicate with technical and non-technical staff
Highly self-motivated and self-directed with an attention to detail
Proven analytical, evaluative, and problem-solving abilities
Ability to conduct research into a wide range of computing issues as required.
Ability to absorb and retain information quickly.
Ability to present ideas in user-friendly language
Keen attention to detail
Exceptional customer service orientation
Working Conditions
Mainly office based. Some travel required (<5%)
Evening and weekend work as required

Job Description Summary
Reporting to the Manager, Global Services Canada BRM, the Business Technology Analyst will lead and manage IT business analysis for Global Services initiatives in Canada and will be based out of the Mississauga head office. Collaborating closely with Canadian regional, functional and business stakeholders, the Business Technology Analyst is accountable for working with various groups to elicit, gather and define business requirements, and analyze, define and recommend functional solutions. Other primary responsibilities include defining implementation approach, functional testing and change management planning. This associate is also responsible for driving and supporting various digital transformation efforts in the Canadian region. This role will challenge the associate to think outside the box, interact with new technology, and use BD innovation solutions to advance business capabilities in the organization.
Job Description
Excited to grow your career?
We value our talented employees, and whenever possible strive to help one of our associates grow professionally before recruiting new talent to our open positions. If you think the open position you see is right for you, we encourage you to apply!
Our people make all the difference in our success.
BD has a strong presence in Canada, with four locations and more than 640 employees in the region. As the head office for Canada, the Mississauga location employs Corporate Shared Functions and eight Business Units.
Reporting to the Manager, Global Services Canada BRM, the Business Technology Analyst will lead and manage IT business analysis for Global Services initiatives in Canada and will be based out of the Mississauga head office. Collaborating closely with Canadian regional, functional and business stakeholders, the Business Technology Analyst is accountable for working with various groups to elicit, gather and define business requirements, and analyze, define and recommend functional solutions. Other primary responsibilities include defining implementation approach, functional testing and change management planning. This associate is also responsible for driving and supporting various digital transformation efforts in the Canadian region. This role will challenge the associate to think outside the box, interact with new technology, and use BD innovation solutions to advance business capabilities in the organization.

Responsibilities:
In collaboration with Functional, Business and Global Services partners, define, document, analyze and prioritize existing and emerging business requirements.
In collaboration with stakeholders, drive consensus and approval of requirements and proposed solutions.
Provide subject matter expertise in the design of business processes and system integration and use of innovation technologies that will support BD’s digital transformation
Partner with the Business Process Network and Process Managers to help drive digital initiatives, while maintaining and promoting end to end process integration as well as identification and understanding of key areas of change impact. Support the change readiness to adopt digital process initiatives.
Partner with stakeholders and Global Services teams to drive exceptional customer experience:
Process mapping and modeling (as-is/to-be)
Master data guidance and integration
Project execution, business acceptance of solutions
Change management- impact analysis, readiness, and effectiveness
Cutover, go-live support
Facilitate knowledge transfer to stakeholders, super users, business users
Design and develop solutions leveraging low-code/no-code platforms.
Become a subject matter expert in Global Services processes and aid regional stakeholders traverse the global process landscape (Idea to Realization, Infrastructure Tower Lead collaboration, Incident and Request Management)
Skills and Competencies:
Demonstrated involvement in all aspects of the Software Development Life Cycle
Proficiency in IT portfolio management processes and business case development required
Project management skills a plus
Demonstrated end-to-end business process thinking; knowledge of present or “as is” processes and ability to lead improvements that will constitute a desired “future state”
Customer centric focus and global orientation
Adept at working within a complex virtual team environment; ability to lead and influence teams both directly and indirectly
Strong written and verbal communication skills with the ability to influence outcomes and gain team member and stakeholder buy in
Consulting mindset
Experience and Education:
Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Information Systems, or other relevant degree
Minimum of 5 years of relevant experience
Intermediate knowledge of IT project and portfolio management principles and methodologies
Experience with ERP (i.e. SAP, Oracle) and CRM/Commercial enablement solutions such as Salesforce.com, Contract Lifecycle Management
Knowledge of data warehouse concepts including: data modeling, data quality, ELT\ETL, reporting, analytics, designing and developing Data Visualizations (intermediate to advanced experience with MS products, Qlik View and/or Qlik Sense is an asset)
Experience with SharePoint workflow development is considered an asset
Proficiency in SQL including the use of SQL editors, stored procedures, and optimizing SQL statements.
Programming experience will be considered an asset: VB.NET, C#, Java, Python, SQL Scripting
Automation and/or data lake experience will be considered an asset

Work Shift

About Us

Proudly Canadian and Independently Owned, We are Coke Canada.

We are a family business that unites more than 6,000 employees working together to support one another, our customers, consumers and our communities. Our heritage of manufacturing, marketing, selling, and distributing Coca-Cola brand products, and other allied brands in Canada runs more than 120-years deep!

We are the face of Coca-Cola and its Partner Brands to Canadians. We produce and deliver the beverages and experiences that delight them at every occasion in their life. We are the bottler for an entire nation with a vision and commitment to becoming “the greatest” in our industry.

About our People

We believe our people are the DNA of our organization. With an unwavering commitment to do their best every day, we also share values which define how we work:
Safety First - For all of us safety is non-negotiable and must come first
Integrity - We nurture trust and keep our word
Accountability - we all take ownership and responsibility for our actions and the parts of the business that we impact
Quality – we focus on quality in every aspect of our business. Our products refresh families across Canada, including our own, so we work to deliver the best for them, every time.
Entrepreneurial – A mind set of being results focused, sharing improvements & innovations towards a better future

About You

If you often find yourself saying “this can be done” or are often questioning “is there a better way?” then Coke Canada has opportunities that will encourage you and your teams to step forward. We offer a variety of opportunities that will enable you to develop your skills, challenge yourself and progress your career.
About This Opportunity

The Senior Total Rewards Analyst is an excellent opportunity to work with a great team in all aspects of total rewards including retirement, benefit and compensation programs. The role has a heavy emphasis on managing our retirement programs but is an opportunity to be involved in broader rewards programs. This position is located at our downtown Toronto office and will support multiple site locations in Canada.

Key Accountabilities include:
Retirement Plans
Technical resource responsible for managing the administration of all retirement programs including Defined Benefit (DB) pension plans, Defined Contribution (DC) plans, Multi-Employer Pension Plans (MEPP) and savings plans (RRSP, TFSA, and non-registered plans).
Perform administrative and analytical tasks related to pension and retirement programs including required annual pension filings, auditing related to eligibility & contributions, and supporting the retirement committee meetings.
Review data, forms, and standard letters used by the third-party administrator to ensure accuracy and compliance with plan design.
Manage projects related to the retirement programs (i.e. development of educational campaigns, revising plan documents, beneficiary reviews, and preparing for retirement programs).
Partner with HR Business Services and Global Reporting teams to perform analysis related to pension and savings programs.
Proactively partner with Labour Relations and HR teams on changes to retirement programs.
Manage inquiries from HR partners, employees and third-party suppliers.
Review current processes and practices and suggest improvements to improve client satisfaction.
Monitor third-party service level agreements and resolve customer service and delivery issues.
Ensure programs are administered in compliance with all applicable laws and regulations.

Benefits
Work with third-parties to ensure timely, accurate, and compliant delivery of flexible and traditional benefit programs for non-union & unionized employees.
Monitor third-party service level agreements and resolve customer service and delivery issues.
Assist with development and implementation of new programs and changes to existing programs.
Manage and resolve Total Rewards case escalations on a timely and ongoing basis.

Compensation
Conduct analysis of both internal equity and external competitiveness to determine pay level and pay mix recommendations.
Perform incentive plan cost analysis and modeling.
Assist with the development, preparation and distribution of Total Rewards communication materials.
Collect, organize and report data for participation in compensation surveys.

What you will need to succeed in this role
Education & Experience
Bachelor degree/college diploma in Human Resources Management, Business Administration, Finance or other analytical discipline.
5 - 7 years total rewards experience with emphasis on retirement plans; experience with compensation and benefit programs is also an asset.
Experience working in a unionized environment is preferred.
Experience in manufacturing or consumer products industry an asset.

Skills
Strong knowledge of Canadian pension environment including practices and provincial pension and tax legislation related to retirement programs.
Expertise using Excel to analyze large data sets (i.e. basic formulas, pivot tables, VLOOKUPs)
Strong communication and interpersonal skills to explain pension provisions to all levels of the organization from front line employees, to union leaders, to the executive leadership team.
Experience working with HRIS and benefits administration systems (SAP skills preferred).
Strong problem-solving skills.

The Sr. Research Analyst, Data and Analytics develops methodology research content, and helps grow the scope of advisory services that we provide to our research members.

Major Responsibilities

Contribute to Info-Tech’s Research Agenda planning activities by identifying trends in Data Governance, Data Management, and Data Architecture, proposing research topics, and developing Research outlines and scoping documents.
Develop research content centered around best practice methodologies, practical case studies, and industry research.
Provide guidance and advice in the Data and Information Management space, including Enterprise Content Management, over the phone.

Support business development activities for Consulting services participating in proposal writing, project scoping, and client presentations
Develop keynote presentations that will be delivered in client events organized by Info-Tech Research Group.

Minimum 5 years of experience in business advisory within Information Management.

 Data GovernanceData ManagementBusiness Intelligence and AnalyticsData Architecture, Big DataEnterprise Content Management

BC Women’s Hospital & Health Centre (BCW) is the only facility in British Columbia devoted primarily to the health of women, newborns and families. It provides a broad range of specialized women’s health services that address the health needs of women of all ages and backgrounds. BC Women’s is one of the largest maternity facilities in Canada, with over 7,000 births a year, and is both the major primary and secondary maternity services provider in the Lower Mainland and the cornerstone of the provincial tertiary care system. As an academic health centre BCW’s mandate includes providing strong leadership in research and the education and professional development of health care professionals in areas related to the health of the populations we serve.
BC Children's Hospital (BCCH) cares for the province's most acutely ill or injured children and youth, provides developmental and rehabilitation services to children and youth throughout BC, and offers a broad range of health services. Sunny Hill Health Centre for Children (SHHC), a leading provincial facility offering specialized services to children and youth with developmental disabilities from birth to age 19, works collaboratively with BCCH. SHHC focuses on the child and their family while supporting health care professionals in their community. BCCH also operates a wide number of specialized health programs, is a leading acute care teaching facility, and conducts research to advance health and care through the Child and Family Research Institute and in partnership with the University of British Columbia.
BCW and BCCH are agencies of the Provincial Health Services Authority (PHSA) which plans, manages and evaluates specialty and province-wide health care services across BC. PHSA embodies values that reflect a commitment to excellence. These include: Respect people • Be compassionate • Dare to innovate • Cultivate partnerships • Serve with purpose
Children's & Women's Health Centre
BC Women's Cesarean Task Force
Project Coordinator
Reference #78787
Temporary Part-Time (0.60 FTE)
Start Date: As soon as possible
End Date: May 14, 2020
Vancouver, BC
In accordance with the Mission, Vision and Values, and strategic directions of Provincial Health Services Authority patient safety is a priority and a responsibility shared by everyone at PHSA, and as such, the requirement to continuously improve quality and safety is inherent in all aspects of this position.
Reporting to the Program Lead, the Project Coordinator coordinates a diverse array of projects including those of the Best Birth Clinic, the Power to Push Campaign and the “Your Best Birth” Committee, whose aim is to support physiologic birth and women-centered care. The Project Coordinator is actively involved in the planning, development, implementation, and evaluation of such projects, and maintains primary project coordination responsibility. The position supports team efforts with internal and external partners on ongoing programs and initiatives to improve the quality and accessibility of health services, health promotion and prevention efforts, and in related research and knowledge exchange activities.
This position operates under provincial mandate relating to the quality agenda and data for decision making including the broad areas of knowledge exchange, information dissemination, and education for key stakeholders including the public, service providers, and relevant policy/decision makers; and/or research, health system support, and academic development.
A flexible work schedule is available in consultation with project leadership.
Key Accountabilities
Coordinates the execution of projects, assuring they are done in an efficient manner, that they adhere to project protocols, that they conform to applicable institutional and ethical policies and procedures and privacy legislation, and that they are completed within the required timelines.
Identifies, collects, and analyzes relevant information relating to current projects, and provides input and recommendations to project/program team for development, implementation, analysis, dissemination of findings, and policy/practice implications.
Presents project updates to internal stakeholder groups, external agencies, organizations, and other stakeholders. Assists with the dissemination of information and knowledge related to projects and key programs and initiatives under the identified mandate areas through a variety of vehicles.
Actively supports the management and facilitation of time-limited projects and programs to identify best practice-grounded strategies and activities for health professionals, policy/ decision makers, and the public in research, practice, and policy.
Contributes to the monitoring of budgets and core activities in collaboration with program leadership to ensure that funds are spent as planned and within budget and that program objectives are achieved.
In collaboration with program leadership, coordinates the implementation of approved recommendations resulting from research, best practice, and policy reviews.
Qualifications
A level of education, training and experience equivalent to a Bachelor’s degree in Health or Social Sciences plus experience in a responsible research assistant, project coordinator, or policy analyst role in a health, social services, government, or community organization.
Knowledge of research, quality improvement and clinical practices relevant to maternity care; health systems and policy; population health, prevention, and health promotion; and knowledge exchange.
Understanding of and practical skills in project coordination/management, research and evaluation; relevant computer software applications; Internet search engines, websites, and navigation; funding structures and application processes; training and education; policy review and analysis; and facilitation, community development, and partnerships.
Related experience in conducting literature searches and reviews, best practice reviews, policy analysis, working collaboratively with a wide range of internal and external stakeholder groups.
Qualities including: creativity and innovation; sound judgment; tact and diplomacy; ability to work effectively and collaboratively in a demanding and dynamic environment; sound negotiation, conflict management and consensus-building skills; excellent oral and written communications skills.

job_title: Intern - Investment Analyst, Strategy & Risk (4 month contract)
job_description:
TemporaryThe opportunity
April – August 2019
Do you want to get exposure to asset management and cutting edge analytics while working with financial data and implementing business logic using SQL?
We are always investigating new topics such as machine learning and big data analytics, with a view on how they can be practically applied within a pension plan.
You will supply financial data and help develop analytic tools used by researchers to address practical topics for managing the total fund portfolio
You will learn about asset classes and their risk and return characteristics
You will work with modern web-based technologies and architectures
Who you’ll work with
Working in a team with 5 other quants and/or software developers
The work is project based, with projects ranging from half a day to the full term
Reporting to Director of Research & Analytics in the Strategy & Risk department
Immediate clients are the researchers using the tools and data you develop
Work location is Toronto head office in our hoteling work space
Hours are reasonably flexible with no additional travelling involved
What you’ll do
Depending on the candidate’s skill level in SQL, the role will either be primarily SQL development with some data management or primarily data management.
Programming business logic in SQL
Implementing new analytics in web-based UI
Updating financial time series data in an Oracle database using SQL
Investigating and resolving spikes, gaps, and overlaps in time series data
Interpreting financial and accounting data by applying investment knowledge
Trouble-shoot in-house software applications for performance and functionality
Perform research on other investment managers such as endowments and sovereign wealth funds
What you’ll need
Must have working knowledge of SQL programming
Must have familiarity with asset classes and their distinct characteristics
Must have solid mathematical background, particularly in statistics
Concentration in Mathematics, Computer Programming, Statistics, finance or related field.
Knowledge of object-oriented programming is an asset.
Preferred knowledge or interest in machine learning or AI
Previous work term experience preferred
Must be enrolled in 3rd / 4th year or related Master’s program
You must be enrolled in a co-op program or returning back to your studies after the work term is completed
What we’re offering
We operate in a pay for performance environment that offers competitive salary and numerous opportunities for professional growth and development.
At Ontario Teachers’, diversity is one of our core strengths. We are a globally minded organization and take pride ensuring that the people we hire and the culture we create reflect and celebrate diversity of thought, background and experience.
Accommodations are available upon request for candidates with a disability taking part in the recruitment process and once hired.

Cover letter

Festival Hydro is a distribution company serving 20,000 customers in the municipalities of Stratford, St. Marys, Seaforth, Hensall, Zurich, Dashwood and Brussels. Festival Hydro is a progressive utility looking for an incumbent that supports our ongoing commitment to customer and operational excellence.

The GIS Analyst role is a full-time position reporting to the Engineering Manager and includes a comprehensive benefits package. Work is conducted in a standard office environment however some field work may be required.

Primary Duties & Responsibilities

Participate in projects involving the development, implementation, design and maintenance of all aspects of the GIS
Aid in the migration of Festival Hydro’s Asset and Geospatial Records including the electrical distribution system assets, associated records and the electrical network connectivity within the GIS
Maintain geospatial data such as digital Ortho land-base mapping, land parcel, centerline information, and maps from various vendors to update and ensure accurate land base
Interpret engineering plans, maps, sketches, drawings and legal descriptions for GIS database development
Assist in the development of Geospatial Technologies through application, product and process innovation
Leverage scripts and models to automate GIS workflows
Assist with the integration of GIS with other internal systems
Support field data collection activities
Assist other employees in preparing detailed drawings
Support GIS consultants, vendors and suppliers
Develop and implement applications related to GIS data for internal/external stakeholders
Aid in high level system planning processes through the development of GIS data analysis and reporting
Assist Engineering department with other duties as required
Qualifications

Education and Experience

Post-secondary degree or College diploma in Geomatics or GIS related field, and/or Engineering Technician or Technologist College diploma
Equivalent combination of education and experience will also be considered
Candidates with distribution system knowledge and work experience in an electric utility environment will be given preference
Knowledge/Skills and Abilities

Proficient in ESRI ArcGIS software including ArcGIS Enterprise, ArcSDE, ArcGIS On-line, ArcFM Solution and SQL Database
Basic knowledge of electrical distribution systems or other utility networks and the concept of asset management is preferred
Experience in database design, database management as well as system integration between GIS and other engineering or business software systems
Proficiency in Python, Model Builder and knowledge of other programming languages is preferred
Ability to work from engineering prints (electrical and civil construction drawings), sketches, technical manuals, specifications and reports
Ability to analyze systems and procedures accurately and logically and to grasp new technical concepts quickly
Experience with AutoCAD, SCADA, Microsoft Office, Other Databases & Open Source GIS Software
Excellent interpersonal, organizational, communication, analytical and time management skills
Ability to establish and maintain effective working relationships with co-workers, managers, municipal employees, external agencies, and external engineering consultants
Self-motivated while working independently, with the ability to prioritize work and make necessary adjustments throughout the day
Valid Class G Driver’s License in good standing

The joint venture between SNC-Lavalin and Aecon has been awarded a contract with Ontario Power Generation (OPG) to carry out the Darlington Retube and Feeder Replacement (RFR) project. The project involves refurbishment of all four reactors at the Darlington Generating Station and consists of two phases – a Definition Phase and an Execution Phase. The Definition Phase includes the construction of a full-scale reactor mock-up to simulate key elements of the refurbishment work, and the development, procurement and testing of specialized tooling required for the project.


The Execution Phase involves refurbishment of the reactor cores using the tools and methods that were developed and tested during the Definition Phase.

job_title: Team Lead, Business Analysts - TELUS Health and Payment Solutions
job_description:
We are a team of high-performing professionals who make TELUS Health the biggest Canadian supplier of complete, integrated solutions for the forwarding, settlement and administration of health care claims (drugs, dental care and extended health coverage).

We are at the forefront of the latest industry trends that aim to provide clients with greater value.

Over the past 10 years, we have invested over 1.8 billion dollars in the acquisition and development of innovative technological solutions that make it easier to share information among health care professionals, insurers, plan sponsors and plan participants.

We have earned our place as a leader in the health care market through the quality of our solutions and our team of experienced professionals, not only because we are committed to our clients’ success but also because we support them by respecting TELUS values and our Customers First commitment.

Manage and guide the business analyst team responsible for analyzing and resolving anomalies identified by internal teams and external clients for all of our products. Assess requests for change when necessary and take part in projects.

Responsibilities:

Create and update documents for insurers

Analyze, create and maintain the dental codes for each association on an annual basis (including attributes, descriptions, mappings, plans and rules) as well as the codes and rates for extended health coverage (R&C, plans and rules)
Assist the UAT team in testing the electronic submission of claims (EDI)
Assist the Project team (with rules, plans, messages and Production processes and procedures) as needed

Canadian Tire Corporation’s (CTC) rich heritage of serving Canadians from coast-to-coast

dates back to

1922. Our vision is to become the #1 retail brand in Canada by 2022 and we are focused on innovating and making important investments in our business, especially when it comes to our people. team players with superior influencing skills, who build relationships easily across various stakeholder groups to move initiatives forward

Canadian Tire and its family of companies are boldly shaping retail in Canada and we continue to deliver a positive experience for our customers. RB is the world's leading consumer health and hygiene company. We’re 40,000 entrepreneurs, all inspired by a vision of a world where people are healthier and live better.
At the heart of our rapidly growing consumer health business is a passionate desire to help people feel better. We invest in research and development to find new ways for people to look after themselves, their families, and homes.

What You’ll Do:
As a member of the Business Analytics Function, the Consumer Market Insight Analyst will help create value for RB Health (Canada) through enabling data-driven decision making for strategic and operational planning. The Consumer Market Insight Analyst will assist in our understanding of our target consumers across our key markets, Infant Formula, Child Nutrition, Sexual Wellbeing, Health Relief and Personal Care.

What Are Your Responsibilities?
Production of our quantitative consumer tracking studies, ensuring smooth quarterly production of the survey, supplier oversight, and report production.
Ad hoc statistical analysis of data sets using SPSS or other statistical software.
Support RB Health teams in interpreting results and contribute to action plans indicated by the analyses and reports.
Lead the production of the monthly business performance strategic scorecards, tracking performance of KPIs relative to targets.
Work with channels to help interpret the basis of the performance, and help identify action plans.
Continually search for improvements in measurement technics, with a goal to be agile and improving research turn-around rates.
Leverage new technologies and platforms to ensure best practice for democratization of data and data visualization.
How Do You Know If You’re A Fit?
The successful candidate will hold a university degree or equivalent (social sciences, math, computer sciences or business), with a minimum of 3 years analytics experience.
Excellent analytical, storytelling, and problem solving skills. Ability to translate/communicate analytics recommendations to both technical and nontechnical team members.
Strong understanding of quantitative (univariate and multivariate) analysis techniques. Experience with predictive modelling and machine learning an asset. Experience with statistical software (e.g. SAS, SPSS or R).
Experience with data visualization and business intelligence software.
Ability to challenge the status quo and encourage use of new information and consumer insights.
Ability to work on multiple projects simultaneously demonstrating strong prioritization skills, balancing uncertainties and trade-offs to achieve desired business results. Attention to detail with emphasis on both speed and accuracy.
Strong intellectual curiosity and independent judgment with the desire to understand the basis and drivers of consumer behaviour.
Builds a collaborative, positive cross functional team environment and strong working relationships with senior management, marketing, healthcare and retail sales teams, finance and outside agencies.

Why RB?
We believe there's a better way to do business – we like to call it 'betterbusiness'. Socially, environmentally and financially, we act responsibly and sustainably. We believe passionately in doing things the right way, and we believe the better way helps us deliver high quality products that touch consumers each and every day. Health is no longer just the absence of illness, it’s being able to lead a fitter and happier life. Our responsibility is to help people achieve this, while making the right kind of social and environmental impact. That’s what we call betterbusiness.

The opportunity


As an Experience Management (EM) Analyst you will be responsible for supporting the Canadian Experience Management team by creating reporting and commentary around deployment; entering and ensuring accuracy of data in our resource management system; supporting projects and initiatives in the Advisory practice and capacity management optimization. You will receive regular supervision on a day-to-day basis to set appropriate priorities.

Your key responsibilities

Act as a subject matter resource on Experience Management tools/enablers
Create routine reports using existing templates that show utilization performance, availability forecasts, and variances between actual and forecasted utilization
Create/maintain accurate client-serving profiles in EM systems (i.e. roster updates, new hire records, etc.)
Partner with Talent/HR on headcount reconciliation and with Learning & Development to ensure schedules accurately reflect learning assignments and maintain relevant reporting
Assist with deployment activities by conducting skill and bio/CV searches that focus on matching project need(s) with required skills, development opportunities and project risk
Assist with the creation/maintenance of accurate personnel and client project schedules
Partner with deployment EMs to proactively identify resources that will become available in short term (i.e. next 2-3 weeks)
Partner with deployment EMs to proactively monitor and highlight unassigned resources in order to minimize unassigned time
Demonstrate effective teaming with Canadian EM team by proactively/creatively responding to analytics requests
Participate in ad hoc projects as required (i.e. task forces, reporting, process improvement committees, training manuals etc)
Identify ways to improve Experience Management processes and contribute to EM team initiatives
Participate in the orientation of new hires by providing an overview of the Experience Management function and operating model
Partner with the Talent Team (i.e. HR) on Performance Management initiatives
Actively support Experience Management and EYU enablers including Retain/ARMS; My Competencies; EY Discover; Mercury, etc.
Work with peers across the Americas Advisory EM by contributing to EM priorities; task forces; and/or projects


Skills and attributes for success
The individual in this role must have strong reporting, deployment and collaborative attributes.
To qualify for the role you must have

1-3 years of experience in a professional services firm desirable
Intermediate to advanced Microsoft Excel skills
Proficient in other Microsoft applications
Strong analytical skills, with attention to detail
English language skills - very strong written and verbal communication
French language skills a plus
Proven client service focus, with an ability to resolve issues quickly, with a sense of urgency
Strong problem-solving skills
Flexible in adapting to constantly changing priorities
Outstanding teamwork and interpersonal skills
Confident at working independently and a self-starter
Adept at handling multiple tasks with strong organizational skills
What working at EY offers


At EY, our Total Rewards package supports our commitment to creating a leading people culture - built on high-performance teaming - where everyone can achieve their potential and contribute to building a better working world for our people, our clients and our communities. It's one of the many reasons we repeatedly win awards for being a great place to work.


We offer a competitive compensation package where you’ll be rewarded based on your performance and recognized for the value you bring to our business. In addition, our Total Rewards package allows you decide which benefits are right for you and which ones help you create a solid foundation for your future. Our Total Rewards package includes a comprehensive medical, prescription drug and dental coverage, a defined contribution pension plan, a great vacation policy plus firm paid days that allow you to enjoy longer long weekends throughout the year, statutory holidays and paid personal days (based on province of residence), and a range of exciting programs and benefits designed to support your physical, financial and social well-being. Plus, we offer:

Support and coaching from some of the most engaging colleagues in the industry
Learning opportunities to develop new skills and progress your career
The freedom and flexibility to handle your role in a way that’s right for you
About EY


As a global leader in assurance, tax, transaction and advisory services, we’re using the finance products, expertise and systems we’ve developed to build a better working world. That starts with a culture that believes in giving you the training, opportunities and creative freedom to make things better. Whenever you join, however long you stay, the exceptional EY experience lasts a lifetime. Recognized as one of Canada's top employers, EY continually strives to be a great place to work and with a commitment to hiring and developing the most passionate people, we’ll make our ambition to be the best employer by 2020 a reality.


If you can confidently demonstrate that you meet the criteria above, please contact us as soon as possible.


Make your mark. Apply today.


EY is committed to inclusiveness, equity and accessibility. We encourage all qualified candidates to apply.

job_title: Business Intelligence and Analytics Manager- Essex, New Role
job_description:
Building a career at Libro puts you at the centre of a movement to grow prosperity in southwestern Ontario. You become part of a team that is creating change and making a positive impact – socially, economically and environmentally. Libro has an opening for a passionately accountable Business Intelligence & Analytics Manager, in our Essex Administrative Office, responsible for providing direction and leadership to the Business Intelligence (BI) team in support of business intelligence activities.This Manager is responsible to design and implement a set of theories, methodologies, processes, architectures, and technologies that transform raw data into meaningful and useful information for business purposes. The BI team handles large amounts of data and information to identify and develop new opportunities. Common functions of BI technologies are data sourcing, acquisition, integration, warehousing reporting, online analytical processing, analytics, data mining, process mining, complex event processing, business performance management, benchmarking, predictive analytics and prescriptive analytics. The Manager is responsible for shaping relationships and defining objectives with internal and external stakeholders that help transform Libro into a best-of-breed knowledge management organization. - Could you be Libro? The Epic Human we are looking for will:
Work with stakeholders to define business and systems requirements for new information technologies, particularly in the areas of BI, analytics, and data warehousing.
Work with different business units to align the business and IS
Manage a team of business analysts, database analysts and contract resources
Develop strategies and Governance for effective Data Quality
Develop strategies for effective data analysis and reporting
Select, configure and implement analytics solutions
Data preparation (sourcing, acquisition, integration)
Reporting, analytics, data exploration
BI center of excellence
Information delivery (portals, mobile)
Oversee all analytics operations to correct discrepancies and ensure quality
Build systems to transform raw data into actionable business insights

A minimum of a post-secondary degree/diploma, with 7-10 years of work experience in the fields of BI, management information and/or data management
Understanding of data and systems engineering concepts to effectively integrate and analyze data to develop actionable business information deliverables
Demonstrated experience in ensuring work product is dynamic, scalable, documented and accurate
Experience with BI, data manipulation & data science tools and their application (Tableau, Power BI, SQL, etc.)
Experience with data architecture, data integration/ETL, data warehousing, and/or BI deployed in a complex environment

Experience with relational – SQL – and multidimensional – MDX – query languages
Experience with business driven / self-service BI
A solid understanding of data security and privacy technologies
Excellent technical, analytical and organizational skills. Project management skills desired

Staff accounts and Staff rates on products and services
Staff appreciation programs and awards

TemporaryJob Details
Description
Dream Office Management Corporation is looking for a Data Analyst.

Are data privacy and data protection topics that you are passionate about? Are you focused on securing user and business data using a variety of tools and technologies? Do you enjoy architecting solutions and implementing changes that will have a positive effect on our business, users, and stakeholders? If so, read on. We want to hear from you.

Who are you?

You’ll be part of our Infrastructure & Technology Operations group, which is focused on providing top notch computing services to Dream’s 1,000 employees. Working with the security, network, communications and support teams, you will be responsible for supporting our data privacy initiatives at our Canadian and International offices. You are not afraid of change and serve as a change agent. You will explore ideas and are always driving forward rather than settling for the status quo. You’ve worked in fast-paced environments and understand how to juggle big-picture thinking with day-to-day deliverables. You have experience understanding and articulating technology risk in a business environment, and working with a team to remediate those risks. You are respectful of current operating processes, but look to develop new ideas to bring better results. Still interested? Read on!


Who are we?

Dream Unlimited Corp. is a real estate investment, development and management company that creates value at every stage of the real estate cycle. Since the business was created in 1994, Dream has grown substantially, becoming one of Canada’s leading and most consistently innovative real estate companies with over $14 billion of assets. Dream Office Management Corporation provides technology, human resources, and facilities support to the Dream group of companies, currently 5 publicly traded entities.

While on the surface we may not seem that different from our competitors, it’s our attitude and approach that truly set us apart. We are guided by our entrepreneurial spirit; we seize unconventional opportunities and try new things, approaching every project with passion and purpose.

We care about our employees. We want everyone to have a rewarding career and to work and have fun with people they like, so we provide exciting work opportunities, open work environments, and fun events. Once you join us, it won’t take long to figure out why your colleagues like it so much here.


And the Infrastructure & Technology Operations team?

Our goal is to provide the best possible user experience by ensuring our users have the technical tools and infrastructure in place to perform their job functions efficiently. We are continually upgrading and driving our initiatives, processes and goals in order to respond to changes in our business needs and ensure that the appropriate infrastructure is in place to support the business.

We strive to stay at the cutting edge of technology to be prepared for Dream’s continued growth in the coming years. All we’re missing is an enthusiastic Data Protection Analyst – are you ready?

What will you do?

You will be responsible for the organization and privacy of data that our five business lines rely on every day. Here are some specifics of your role to give you some scope:

Work with the Manager, IT Security to oversee the ongoing development of the data protection strategy and implementation across all lines of business
Author and audit, privacy, security, and data protection policies
Implement technical standards / data protection frameworks such as GDPR, PIPEDA ,NIST, etc.
Translation of privacy legislation knowledge into technical solutions to protect the privacy of employee and customer data
Managing and auditing technology solutions that support data privacy
Conduct data and privacy risk assessments, and articulate the outcome as business risk
Perform data classification across a variety of system types and storage methods, including identification and tagging of both structured and unstructured data
Collaborate with both technical and non-technical teams in order to implement solutions and privacy controls
Monitor compliance of data privacy against best practices
Be available for inquiries from data subjects and business stakeholders relating to data protection practices, and data subject rights
Communicate effectively with all levels of the business
Create and maintain documentation that supports data and privacy activities
Be available after hours when needed to assist with incident response, should the need arise
Perform related duties and tasks as assigned by the Manager, IT Security


What type of experience do you have?

We’ve listed just a few select qualifications that we consider to be very important for this role. We can cover the rest when we chat.

Degree, diploma, or certificate in Information Security, Computer Science, or related discipline.
Minimum 5 years’ experience in an information security or audit role
Minimum 5 years’ experience with technologies that support data management (classification tools, Data Loss Prevention tools, data tagging tools)
Experience with implementation and use of data classification standards
Knowledge of organizational privacy controls
Experience with technical standards / data protection frameworks such as PIPEDA, GDPR, NIST, and ISO
Experience with both security and privacy risk assessments, with DPIA experience a plus
The ability to translate technology risk into business risk
A deep understanding of data classification, including identification and tagging of both structured and unstructured data
A strong track record of being able to interface and collaborate with both technical and non-technical teams to implement solutions and privacy controls
Experience authoring or auditing privacy, security, and data protection policies
Operational experience with incident response and breach notification processes
Experience in managing projects and large scale enterprise wide roll-outs.
A self-starter with the ability to work independently under minimal supervision.
Exceptional organization and time management skills.
Ability to work in a fast paced and dynamic environment.
Strong change management skills; change agent
With your manager and the security team, you set clear goals and objectives, and then you and the team deliver!
Knowledge in the following is considered a significant asset, so let us know what you know!

Data collection, storage, and processing privacy best practices
Information security or audit certifications, such as CISSP, CISA, SSCP, CIPM
Experience with frameworks, such as ISO 27001/27002, NIST SP 800-37,
Experience with cloud email technologies (Office 365, Mimecast) and filtering mechanisms
Experience with document management solutions leveraging OneDrive, Sharepoint, and Teams
McAfee endpoint DLP experience a plus
Palo Alto Networks firewalls / SSL decryption and data filtering
Management and implementation of access controls
When you come in to meet, we’ll want to hear about your previous security and privacy, but also about your business interaction experiences. What are your strengths? What areas are you looking to grow? We’ll also be asking you to demonstrate your knowledge given various real world scenarios.

This is your invitation to make a difference. We’re looking forward to helping you grow.

Dream Unlimited is committed to workplace diversity and provides accommodations to applicants with disabilities throughout our hiring process

Company presentation
World leader in gases, technologies and services for Industry and Health, Air Liquide is present in 80 countries with approximately 65,000 employees and serves more than 3 million customers and patients. Oxygen, nitrogen and hydrogen have been at the core of the company’s activities since its creation in 1902. Air Liquide’s ambition is to be the leader in its industry, delivering long-term performance and acting responsibly.
Entity and activity description
Founded in 1911, Air Liquide Canada has over 2,200 employees and serves over 80,000 customers in Canada’s aeronautics, automobile, agri-food, chemical, defence, electronics, energy, metallurgy, metal fabrication, mining and healthcare industries from our sites located in key industrial regions from coast to coast.

InvestorCOM is a leader in providing financial technology and outsourcing services to Canada’s largest banks, asset managers, insurance companies and investment dealers. Our innovative FinTech solutions help our clients meet their growing investor communications, regulatory and compliance obligations. InvestorCOM has locations in Toronto and Brantford, Canada and serves over 50 enterprise clients.

About the Role

Reporting to the Supervisor, CCM Business Operations, the Data & Project Analyst is responsible for managing client data projects with a specialty in InvestorCOM publishing projects through the data onboarding, document composition and filing stages leveraging InvestorCOM's automated publishing solution, while also interacting and supporting our clients directly as required.

The Location

The role is based in our Brantford Office, with some travel to our Toronto, Ontario office as required.

Responsibilities

The Data & Project Analyst is accountable for:

Preparation of digital versions of clients’ regulatory financial documents.
Acceptance and loading of client mailing data into systems for use in the CCM and CDM client projects
Problem solving of data and composition issues in client provided source files for the Publisher platform.
Onboarding new clients: thoroughly analyzing client data, finding and understanding business rules for data processing, document layout and creation of new documents in the Publisher platform.
Executing the established programming to manipulate client provided data and upload it to the Publisher database.
Proof document content against client provided source material.
Organization of large quantities of client spreadsheets in folders, following strict rules for folder structure and file naming conventions
Troubleshooting of final documents to determine most accurate and efficient method to correct missing data or visual anomalies with the documents
Communication with Project Coordinator who is responsible to ensuring all client activities are completed within the agreed upon, regulatory timeline
Participate in client meetings, as required
Respond quickly and precisely to issues with spreadsheet content or format to enable successful import into the Publisher system.
Working with the Publisher platform to update documents and assist clients with required updates on the self-serve platform
Document Publisher processes, update Publisher product manuals, training materials and other client support materials.
Education

University degree or equivalent (completed or in progress) a major asset.
Finance, accounting or financial industry‐specific education an asset.
Experience

Experience using complex Excel spreadsheets in the above situations, with knowledge of running and editing/maintaining complex formulas.
Experience in financial services, particularly the investment industry, is an asset.
Accounting or other finance experience valuable.
The successful candidate will have strong self‐starter and self‐management skills and attributes that will enable them to succeed in a hands‐off, results‐driven environment.
What You'll Bring to the Role

Extremely keen on investigative troubleshooting of data related issues with a strong desire to determine the solution and/or gain efficiencies in processes.
Excellent Excel skills and strong all-round Windows and Office skills.
Strong organizational skills.
Ability to perform tasks quickly and with attention to detail, while thoroughly following documented processes
Strong teamwork ethic AND individual work ethic
Excel in a fast-paced cyclical environments, using off cycle times for process documentation and improvement
Good verbal and writing skills.
Ability to excel in a lean environment with limited staffing resources.
Knowledge of /experience with VBA and SQL are valuable but not required.
Ability to read and understand French valuable but not required.
Hours of Work:

InvestorCOM hours of operation are 8:30am – 5:00pm Monday to Friday. Additional hours may periodically be required.

Working Environment:

We are a growing, highly entrepreneurial services company. The successful candidate will be a self-starter who will “own” operations, knows inherently what is required to be successful in the role and has the leadership skills to engage others within the organization to help drive our business forward.

What’s in it for you?

At InvestorCOM, we define our success by what we help others achieve. We were created to support our clients and through our products, services and solutions to protect and strengthen their brands. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual. InvestorCOM offers:

Work in a dynamic, collaborative and high-performing team
A strong focus on personal learning and development to help you reach your professional development goals
A platform to build strong professional working relationships with clients, fellow associate and management

LIFE AT BRP
At BRP, we have a visceral connection to our consumers, one created from a shared passion for the Ultimate Ride. Our teams have a unique ability to develop market-shaping products and services that move people physically and emotionally.
Distributed throughout more than 100 countries, our product line-up includes Ski-Doo and Lynx snowmobiles, Sea-doo watercraft, side-by-side all terrain vehicles, Can-Am Spyder roadsters, Evinrude marine propulsion systems, marine propulsion systems and motors for Rotax karts, motorcycles, and small planes, as well as a full line-up of parts, accessories, and clothing.
Our 10 000 employees make up a big family of diverse cultures who all share a common value: innovation. Our people are passionate and qualified; by joining BRP, you will evolve at the heart of an experienced team that will welcome you with open arms.

We are passionate about bringing cool, authentic restaurants to airports that reflect a taste of place.

The Culinary Systems Analyst is responsible for the input, administration and analysis of culinary-related data for SSP America’s menus, recipes, ingredients, food cost, food safety and nutrition. The position is under the supervision of the Director of Culinary Systems. The position will report to the Director of Culinary Systems.
 Essential Functions

Analyze recipe cooking techniques, ingredient quantities, assembly procedures and recipe yields to identify potential errors in recipes
Review menu & recipe nutritional analysis using Crunch Time software solution in compliance with USDA and FDA guidelines and regulations
Review and analyze recipe & menu theoretical costs for commercial viability
Professionally write culinary specific preparation methods and HACCP procedures for food service style recipes
Culinary Data Input:Recipes, ingredients, costs, cooking procedures and nutrition into multiple software systems (Excel, My Inventory, Crunch Time Restaurant Management Software)
Assist with the preparation, development and testing of SSP recipes in coordination with SSP’s Research & Development Chef
Ability to travel as needed
Regular attendance as required by SSP America attendance policy
Performs any other duties as assigned by manager


Minimum of five (5) years’ experience as a working Chef or Kitchen Manager required
Formal Culinary Education or equivalent professional experience required, with a background in nutrition preferred
Excellent communication (verbal and written), the ability to read and understand information and ideas presented in writing, organization, project management, time management, and follow-up skills
Proven analytical, technical, and problem solving skills; capable of critical thinking
Proficient in Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, and Outlook) advance experience in Excel with the ability to manage spreadsheets and other software as needed
Exceptional interpersonal skills and the ability to interface effectively with all levels of management in the field and at the SSP America corporate offices, as well as the SSP Group parent company offices in the United Kingdom
Proven ability to handle conflict, work under pressure/deal with high stress situations, and resolve uncomfortable situations with clients, customers, peers and direct reports, and do so while exercising sound judgement and decision making
Ability to maintain a dynamic and positive attitude to support our culture and work environment and foster positive and effective working relationships with others in the organization, clients, vendors, etc.; Must be open to feedback and criticism and adjust performance/behavior accordingly
Capable of critical thinking and problem solving
Demonstrated ability to work both independently and among cross-functional teams with minimal supervision; ability to juggle multiple tasks, work in a fast-paced environment, successfully manage multiple projects, and effectively prioritize assigned job duties to meet deadlines and objectives
Strong business acumen with a desire to make a positive impact on the business; highly motivated to take ownership of assigned roles and to improve upon current processes and procedures
Effective organizational maturity to prioritize daily, weekly, monthly, and yearly activities
Competencies

Commercial Influence…Quality Conscious…Drive & Tenacity…Leading Change…Guest Focus…Communication & Impact…Working with Others…Planning & Analysis…

Administrative Responsibilities

This position works directly for members of senior management within the organization and will require the exercising of discretion and independent judgment with respect to matters of significance to the organization. These include, but are not limited to analyzing techniques, ingredients, and recipe specifications and making and/or recommending changes that could affect the financial performance of the organization; making and/or recommending changes to recipes, production standards, or menus that could have an effect on the companies compliance with FDA, USDA, and HACCP regulations, and other responsibilities listed within this job description.

Position Type / Expected Hours of Work

This is a full-time position. Days and hours of work will vary, Wednesday through Tuesday and are dependent upon the hours mutually agreed upon with manager and based on the needs of the business. However, the position will work with multiple sites across the United States and Canada, so flexibility to early morning and evening hours is expected to compensate for the change in time zones, or as job duties demand. Work and travel on weekends and holidays and trips that require overnights may also be required.

Work Environment

This job functions independently, and/or in conjunction with cross-functional teams, with little or no direct supervision in an office setting, or may be home-based at the discretion of the manager. If travel became necessary, job duties would be performed in an airport environment, both pre and post-security, both within an office setting and in a restaurant, warehouse, and/or production environment. This role routinely uses standard office equipment such as computers and multiple computer programs, phones, smart phones, video conferencing and/or web conferencing, photocopiers, filing cabinets and fax machines.

Physical Demands

SSP America, Inc. complies with the Americans with Disabilities Act (ADA), as amended by the ADA Amendments Act, and all applicable state or local law. Consistent with those requirements, SSP America, Inc. will reasonably accommodate qualified individuals with a disability if such accommodation would allow the individual to perform the essential functions of the job, unless doing so would create an undue hardship. The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by a team member to successfully perform the essential functions of this job.

 While performing the duties of this job, the team member is regularly required to communicate with fellow team members and be able to accurately exchange information in these situations; resolve difficult situations and effectively manage and deal with stressful situations and areas of ambiguity within the functions of the job; while working within the office setting, will remain sedentary 100% of the time; while working out in the field, will be required to be mobile and move about to the company’s location(s) within the airport environment 100% of the time, to include standing, walking, bending, kneeling, stooping, and crouching; operate a computer and other office equipment.

Work Authorization/Security Clearance

Must be able to establish eligibility to work in the United States. This position requires successful completion of a criminal background check.
Other Duties

Please note this job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of the employee for this job. Duties, responsibilities and activities may change at any time with or without notice.

SUMMARY

The Project Controls Analyst is responsible for supporting the overall Project Delivery Services (PDS/OPDS) for the Public Works and Government Services Canada (PWGSC) RP1 Contract. Serving as key representatives for the Centre of Excellence, provide on-going management and oversight of processes, work instructions, forms and tools developed through the Service Delivery Regime (SDR) while driving continuous improvement to project delivery. The Project Delivery Analyst will be accountable for ensuring national consistency in the implementation of client contract requirements and deliverables, as well as the application of comparative analytic skills to support project delivery. As a member of the National Project Support team led by the Director of PMO, Project Delivery Analysts will support PDS in meeting internal and client objectives through the following measures

KEY DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES

Contribute to benchmarking studies and comparative analyses – not financially focused. This applies to assessment of project delivery data, timelines and targets.
Assist in the analysis and development of solutions to improve and condense project delivery to achieve efficiencies and meet identified performance and delivery targets.
Support the production of internal national management reporting to support RP1 project delivery.
Ensure national consistency of application for SDRL /DID’s / SOW / SDR
Support the ongoing management of RP1 IMIT system requirements for PDS delivery, including management of changes /updates to systems and tools.
Assist in the creation and modification of processes, work instructions, forms and tools.
Adhere to the Change Management protocols for Service Delivery Regime (SDR) changes to processes, work instructions and forms.
Provide training and manage roll-out of new processes / tools and related changes.
Cover for peer responsibilities among all Analysts and NCM during vacation / absences.
Other duties as required.
KNOWLEDGE & SKILLS

Community College in a related discipline with 3 to 5 years’ experience
High proficiency in Microsoft Access Database and Excel.
Previous experience with facility and/or project management services
Knowledge of Maintenance Management and procurement strategies for the acquisition facilities management services
Excellent skills in developing internal reporting systems, benchmarking and target setting
Excellent verbal/written communication, interpersonal and presentation skills
Excellent analytical and problem solving skills
Excellent computer skills including a strong understanding of Oracle Financials and Computerized Maintenance Management Systems
Strong Process mapping and documentation skills
Familiarization with ISO documentation standards
Financial and costing appreciation
Knowledge of invoicing structures
Some project management experience
Strong organizational skills
Strong skills in business administration


Licenses and/or Professional Accreditation

None required

Reporting to the National Director of Government Relations, the Government Relations Analyst role will collaborate with management in coordinating legislative efforts with all levels of government and further monitoring, analyzing and presenting any new legislative changes that present impacts on business operations. The successful candidate should be self-motivated, able to handle multiple issues and tasks at any given time, have a very positive and upbeat attitude and enjoy working in a team environment.

Collaborate with the National Director of Government Relations and Government Relations Manager in coordinating legislative efforts by working with local, provincial, and federal governments

Respond to external stakeholder requests in a timely manner and brief management as required
Coordinate and attend government relations stakeholder meetings
Identify, analyze, and track legislation and regulations throughout the provinces and countries for which our business operates
Participate in industry groups focused on federal and provincial legislative activity

Minimum 2 years’ experience in a related role, or an equivalent combination of education, training and experience

Excellent communication skills (oral, written and presentation)
Proven ability to work collaboratively in a team environment and collaborate on projects

Company:
Opta Information Intelligence Corp.
Full-time Intermediate Data Analyst (Markham)
Job Description:
Reporting to the Manager of Business Systems, this person will be a key contributor to Opta’s big data and AI expertise. The incumbent will be responsible for building, analyzing, and reporting on large and sample data assets. Using his/her strong statistical techniques, will apply the right analysis strategy to deliver insight, relationships and repeatable queries or processes. Working closely with the Professional Services team, the individual will be responsible for the fulfillment of customer requests. The individual will work closely with Business Analysts to articulate production system requirements for Opta’s data assets. In addition, the individual will be responsible for sourcing, evaluating, submitting recommendations on data sources that support Opta’s data driven strategies and financial objectives.
Accuracy and attention to detail is critically important. The incumbent will utilize multiple technical tools on a daily basis. Technologies that will be used include Access, Excel, SQL and other similar related data management tools, as well as tools to build on data-mining and predictive analytics logic. The incumbent must have the ability to create worksheets, databases, basic program scripts / macros / select criteria to accommodate requests and evolving needs. This person will work closely with the IT, Operational, Professional Services, and R&D teams to deliver and optimize analytical products and solutions.
Key Responsibilities:
Review existing data and current techniques to ensure its integrity, identify new data management and translation methods resulting in data integration improvements.
Maintain and improve data integrity and accuracy of assets identifying ways to eliminate recurring data issues.
Working closely with the Opta’s Enterprise Data Architect, lead the maturity of the data governance process
Articulate data requirements for production systems
Load, validate, compile and analyze available data assets.
Produce reports based on business objectives and strategic requirements.
Engage with third parties in data acquisition and supporting sourcing decisions.
Aide in the setup, process improvement and maturing of an analytics practice with in the organization.
Prepare, coordinate and analyze customer data set and deliverables, working closely with the Professional Services team.
Work with stakeholders on strategic research and development of Opta’s product lines.
Provide summary reporting to management on his/her ongoing work, analysis and projects.
Education, knowledge and experience required:
Written and oral fluency in English.
Completion of a post-secondary degree such as Math, Computer Science, Economics, Actuarial or Commerce and a minimum of 4 years of related work experience that includes developing database queries, statistical analysis and analytical tasks.
Strong analytical and problem solving skills with the capability to look for solutions outside existing boundaries.
Adept at statistical analysis, trending and very detail oriented.
Highly proficient in some of the following: MS Access, Excel, Access, SQL, R, SAS with a strong understanding of computer systems.
Familiarity with data mining techniques, ETL practice and solutions within a Data Warehouse environment.
Confident in creating and comprehending advanced spreadsheets, databases, data structures, etc.
Experience effectively identifying (non-technical) user requirements, develop and execute a plan to deliver those requirements.
Insurance industry knowledge would be an asset.
Environment/Work Conditions

SCM Insurance Services and affiliates welcome and encourage applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available on request for candidates throughout the recruitment and assessment process.
