At Golder, we thrive on challenges.


Golder is not just a place to work, it is a promise of a living, dynamic environment where people collaborate, innovate, build enduring relationships, excel, and grow professionally in a strong culture of ownership.
Do you have the desire to learn? The drive to excel and thrive in an engaged, collaborative environment?


Golder has a new opportunity for a Global HRIS Analyst to join our Human Resources team on a full-time basis based in Vancouver, Calgary or Mississauga. This role will join a global HR systems team that actively supports both legacy HR systems and a new global HCM platform (Oracle HCM / Taleo – Fusion).
An overview of your role will include:
 Support legacy HR systems until they are decommissioned
 Support the implementation of a Global HM platform
 Coordinate and/or participate in user acceptance testing and integration testing
 Maintain data integrity in system by running queries to validate interfaces, talent management processes and talent data
 Generate regular and ad-hoc reports by collecting, manipulating and auditing employee-related data from a variety of internal databases
 Maintain processes, systems, procedures, logs, and materials to support all talent management program administration
 Support the set-up and maintenance of the Talent Management, Benefits, Absence, Compensation, Learning, Manager & Employee Self-Serve modules
 Support the Human Resources Team in the configuration and maintenance of the ongoing performance, compensation and other annual processes within each of the above modules.
 Maintain and update content on the learning module within HCM as well as coordinate and monitor course enrollment
 Support the set-up and maintenance of Taleo
 Address and trouble shoot ad-hoc queries and issues from employees, internal HR stakeholders, business leadership, vendors and third party consultants


You will have a background in:
 Minimum of 2 - 3 years of experience in transactional Human Resources
 Minimum of 2 - 3 years of technical experience in systems administration of human resource systems
 Degree or Diploma in Information Management, Business Administration, human resources or a related field
 Experience using Oracle HCM is essential
 Experience with Oracle modules including: Cloud Learn, talent modules, compensation tool, benefits or absence management is highly desirable
 Proficiency at various computer skills, including Microsoft Word, Excel, PowerPoint, general knowledge of human resources related systems
 Ability to work independently, remotely and co-operatively with business and technical resources
 Customer service experience; demonstrated capabilities in providing a business partner service including key communication skills of influencing, negotiation and compromising.
 Proficiency in one of the following languages in addition to English: Spanish, French, Portuguese, Italian.


Your benefits at Golder will include:

 Competitive benefits and remuneration packages
 Option to purchase shares in Golder
 Employee owned structure - own the business, own the result
 Deepen your expertise in a dynamic work environment
 Innovative and collaborative multidisciplinary projects
 On the job training, mentoring and coaching
 Global projects and travel opportunities


One of Canada’s Best Managed Companies, Platinum member status 11 consecutive years


Renowned for technical excellence, Golder is a leading, global employee-owned engineering and consulting firm with over a half century of successful service to its clients. With over 165 offices in over 30 countries, Golder’s 6,500 professionals are driven by a passion to deliver results, offering unique specialized skills to address the ever-evolving challenges that earth, environment and energy present to clients across the infrastructure, mining, oil and gas, manufacturing and power sectors.

Since our inception in 2010, OAK + FORT has curated collections that reflect our design philosophies. OAK + FORT is a belief that fashion should be uncomplicated and thoughtfully designed. We are not distracted or fettered by trends. We will continue to provide attainable luxury to like-minded individuals.


POSITION SUMMARY

As the Supply Chain Inventory Analyst, you will be responsible for supporting, facilitating and ensuring the effective rollout of various supply chain projects. This is a unique opportunity for an individual who is looking to be a key player in a new department within a fast-paced fashion retailer.
RESPONSIBILITIES
AUDITING (20%)
Plan and implement supply chain optimization projects (e.g. warehouse-slotting, route planning)
Collaborate with IT professionals to implement effective systems
Assist with the development of inventory analysis reports
Complete 3-way inventory matching for import/inventory systems
Conduct daily analysis to anticipate and resolve potential inventory problems
Assist with Distribution Centre duties as required
DISCREPANCY ADJUSTMENTS (25%)
Investigate and resolve inventory discrepancies
Generate monthly Vendor Discrepancy report
FINANCIAL REPORTING (20%)
Generate, maintain and organize monthly and annual inventory reports
Assist with the reconciliation of inventory
Report on Key Performance Indicators for cost & service
Assist with internal accounting duties, such as creating invoices for internal company transfers, reconciling inventory accounts to the general ledger
DATA ENTRY (25%)
Upload inventory on incoming shipments and outgoing transfers in ERP
COMMUNICATION (10%)
Communicate with Retail Operations & Loss Manager on daily, weekly and quarterly inventory count and transactions
Create and maintain SOP's of existing Supply Chain processes and recommend improvements

REQUIREMENTS
1+ years of experience in supply chain, inventory control, logistics or related field; retail or apparel industry an asset
Working knowledge of MS Office, relational databases and ERP systems; Netsuite an asset
Ability to thrive in a computerized and fast-paced environment
Detail-oriented and with strong communication, organizational and time management skills
Proven ability to collaborate and work cross-functionally with different levels of the business
Data-driven
Flexibility to be based both at our Distribution Centre in Coquitlam and Head Office in Vancouver

COMPETENCIES
Leadership
Ability to influence, secure confidence and support others through: building credibility and presence; asserting your own ideas in an effective and appealing way; listen and collaborate effectively with team members and taking accountability.
Business Skills
Organization: Ability to maximize productivity for oneself and for employees by providing structure, systems, clarity, frameworks and focused objectives as well as managing time and priorities effectively
Demonstrates acute business acumen (i.e., analyzing, problem solving, planning, negotiating and persuading to make smart business decisions)
Communication Skills
Ability to clearly express ideas verbally and in writing, both in individual and group situations
Adjusts language, terminology and approach to meet the needs of the intended internal/external audience
Relationship Building
Ability to build constructive and effective relationships with the store team, peers, customers, and relevant partners; team-oriented.
Professionalism

Who we are:

IIBA or other certification would be a strong asset

job_title: Senior Analyst, Strategy and Corporate Development
job_description:
The decision to join a company is a big one. We have opportunities for hard working, energetic and reliable people just like you.
The George Weston Limited (GWL) Strategy and Corporate Development team is responsible for supporting the development and execution of the organization’s strategic agenda. From a strategy standpoint, this includes providing thought leadership to address critical business challenges and identify and assess future opportunities. From a corporate development standpoint, this includes supporting GWL and its operating businesses with assessing and executing acquisitions, divestitures, and strategic partnerships that drive shareholder value.
Reporting to Vice President, Strategy and Corporate Development, the Senior Analyst will assist with analysis and execution within key business strategy and M&A projects.
Responsibilities:
Assist in the development and evaluation of strategic plans and projects for the operating businesses, including analysis, research, and preparation of presentations
Analyze and synthesize data and information from various internal and external sources, including financial statements
Support assessment of M&A transactions including research, diligence and financial analysis
Develop robust financial models, including acquisition and valuation models
Interact effectively with internal team members, leaders from the operating businesses and external advisors and consultants such as bankers, lawyers and accountants
Qualifications:
Bachelor of Commerce/Business Administration (or a similar degree)
2+ years of relevant work experience
Demonstrated M&A experience in any of the following sectors: private equity, advisory services within an accounting firm or an investment bank, management consulting, corporate development
Completion of, or progress towards professional designations/degrees (e.g. CFA, CA, CBV, MBA) considered an asset
Strong financial modeling and valuation experience
Strong critical thinking and problem-solving skills
Proficiency with Microsoft Office (Excel, PowerPoint, Word) to create financial models, and develop presentations for senior executives
Confidence and maturity to interact and collaborate with team members and business leaders
Polished demeanor and a high degree of maturity and professionalism
Effective time management skills
High attention to detail
Self-motivated to produce quality work with minimal supervision
Personal Attributes:
Confidence and maturity to interact with managers and senior business leaders.
Self-motivated to produce quality work with minimal supervision.

Job Description
Citi is embarking on an exciting initiative to transform Capital Markets to the world class Digital institution. Our goal is to digitize/electronify all forms of interactions, starting with the work for Sales and Traders.
We offer you to join us in in defining, ideating and developing innovative financial solutions for our global client base, This means collaborating with the keenest minds in data science, big data, software engineering, web development, UX design and more.
We are looking for an experienced and highly motivated Business Analyst/ Project Manager to help Capital Markets technology with digital projects, moving away from sound-bytes to clear measurement.
The role will focus on driving and delivering digital projects through to completion
If you are as excited as we are to be part of this incredible journey in innovation then we want to hear from you!
Key Responsibilities:
Partner with the business and partner systems to understand strategies and identify underlying business needs, and with development, to propose and design technology solutions, transform them into clear business and design requirements, and collaborate with development to realize successful implementation
Track all deliverables between partner systems & development teams and ensure timelines & milestones are met in all project phases
Negotiate and establish priorities with business and development managers
Communicate continually with business and IT project managers as to status of deliverables and potential risks to successful completion of all projects

Produce detailed use cases to guide the design and development of applications

Provide support across the full software development lifecycle (analysis, design, estimation, planning, development, unit test, user test, coordination, release and pre/post implementation support)
Conduct demos to prospective users, developers or stakeholders.
Take initiative to engage teams that deliverables have dependencies on.
User feedback management
Documents requirements that span across multiple teams and asset classes.
Produce detailed use cases to shape the product’s future.
Establish priorities with business stakeholders and development managers
Key Relationships/Stakeholders:

IT Project Managers

Bachelor’s degree
Strong relationship building skills
Self-motivated and Independent thinker
Astute analytical skills
Superb written and verbal communication skills. Must have presence and communicate with clarity, impact, purpose and authority with partners, peers, management and business

Good team player and also be able to work independently.

Experience within financial services & agile is a plus
Good knowledge of financial products is a big plus
7-10 years’ Business Analyst / PM experience
Must have strong IT background
Atlassian Tools Jira, Confluence
Agile Methodologies

Microsoft business suite of tools

Responsible for assisting the Regional Business Partner in all aspects of financial and operations analysis to aid in business decisions that will impact overall profitability for operations. Models, budgets and tracks financial progress, inventory control, and production related data to support decision making by operations and executive staff. This role works in all facets of the organization, with wide-ranging responsibilities. This role will be depended upon to understand and learn all parts of the business in order to provide support to the organization. The Regional Business Partner will offer guidance, and support for a candidate willing to learn and ask questions. A problem-solving, fast learner, and independent candidate will be most successful in this role.
Requirements
Bachelor’s degree in Accounting, Finance or related field
Proficient in MS Excel, Word, and PowerPoint
Knowledge of accounting principles
Superior oral and written communication skills
Ability to operate independently and “self-manage” project timelines
Strong planning, organizational, and process oriented skills
Ability to identify, research and create Excel models to solve problems
Self-starter with desire to constantly improve on existing tools
Ability to create complex models that utilize simple input for management
Willingness to learn and improve on any qualifications not acquired
Pivot Tables, PowerPivot, and Power Query knowledge a plus
Ability to occasionally travel to other facilities within the region
Benefits
We are a hardworking group of people committed to providing a challenging, respectful place to work and have lots of fun while doing so!

Who we are
Although not a household name, State Street is one of the world’s largest and most important financial services institutions, providing round-the-clock services to the global investment community. We touch $33 trillion in assets every day and are the world’s third largest investment manager with over $2.8 trillion in assets under management. To do this we manage as much data as one of the internet giants on nearly as large a technical footprint.
In 2018, we launched one of the industry’s largest technical transformation projects, in effect building a new bank from the ground up. This project isn’t greenfield in the way most banks claim projects are; we’ve started with a blank sheet of paper both operationally and technically. We’re using the same technologies that Silicon Valley giants are using: use of multiple public clouds, building our own private cloud to achieve even better performance, transforming our industry through distributed ledger technology and machine learning.
This isn’t a traditional banking role. This is a chance to push your technical skills with people more comfortable in a technology firm than an investment bank, though solving real problems that affect anyone with any form of savings worldwide (not just trying to get people to click on ads).
What you will do
As a Jnr. Business System Analyst, your deep understanding of ITIL based processes system coupled with public cloud provider APIs enable you to design solutions enabling seamless interactions across the key SDLC ‘moments of truth’. You will be a key influencer in shaping the end to end ‘NoOps’ flow using cutting edge perspectives from our patent holding architects, process specialists. In addition, you will help shape the toolchain needed to deliver the desired experience. This role will require critical thinking necessary for diligent research into inherent tradeoffs around feasibility, cost, compatibility, etc.
Collaborate with product owners, scrum masters and architects in refining stories for proposed epics
Define end user ‘journey maps’ through process specifications and key interaction points, using ITIL processes to aid alignment with public cloud based capabilities
Map capabilities needed for journey mapping to application components and define approach for managing interim workarounds and process exceptions
Write design specifications with input from developers to aid configuration and development in a verifiable manner
Develop test cases to aid in verification of enabled processes
Who you are
General knowledge of agile software development concepts and processes (e.g., scrum, Kanban, etc.)
Understanding of DevOps principles (e.g., continuous integration and continuous delivery concepts)
Familiarity in journey mapping concepts and developing processes flows focused on addressing prioritized pain points
Ability to clearly translate business requirements into technical requirements
Ability to analyze and document complex business processes and propose redesigns or areas for improvements
Demonstrated ownership of test plan development and iteration-level testing
Understanding and comfort with the latest technologies used in the development, testing and monitoring of custom applications within a cloud environment
Bachelor’s degree in a Computer Science or related field
Our promise to maintain an environment where every employee feels valued and able to meet their full potential infuses our company values. It’s also part of our commitment to inclusion, development and engagement, and corporate social responsibility. You’ll have tools to help balance your professional and personal life, paid volunteer days, and access to employee networks that help you stay connected to what matters to you. Join us.
State Street is an Affirmative Action/ Equal Opportunity Employer/Vet/Disability.

The Sr. Business Analyst provides Application expertise and is responsible for the customization, support, maintenance, and problem resolution of Financial Systems / applications in a high availability mission critical environment. This position requires detailed working knowledge of the underlying data flow and structure of a variety of systems including Oracle Order to Cash, ESO (Electronic Sales Order), SFDC (Sales Force Dot Com) and other supporting systems such as Datawarehouses (ESDB/CCDB) and supporting implementation systems (Estart primarily), experience in Project Management and working with the broader Sales, Finance and Implementation teams.

Duties and responsibilities:

Analyse product gaps and business needs using high level interpretative skills. Map requirements to existing Application features, determine business, technical fit, and document proposed set up change, system change or detailed business and functional specifications as appropriate to achieve required results.
Propose solutions that will meet the business need in the context of the minimal customization on common platforms between Canada and the US to enable Canadian functionality in the required timeframes.
Ensure the highest level of quality is delivered in upgrades, changes, releases and implementations by supporting the build and use of test environments. Create test strategies and plans, write specific test cases, and build transactions to run tests and verify results. All variances must be adequately explained and documented prior to implementation.
Provide operational support to business teams as required through the implementation phases of the various systems.
Build and document processes - final and interim to support business timelines
Analyse data, document data definition between existing and new systems; build report requirements where required, document reporting/data processes where needed.
Provide ongoing support and expertise of products and systems, diagnosing problems and assisting in the development of solutions. Coordinate with the users and applicable technology teams to ensure the timely resolution of daily processing difficulties and issues. Maintain a high level of quality service with minimum impact to the Business and our clients.
Facilitate and participate in project prioritization plans, adding valuable input to deliverables, impact, scope and project schedules weighing benefits vs. costs.
Plan deliverable implementation and change management ensuring sufficient lead time and communication to modify business processes, prepare impacted associates, maintain set up documentation and adhere to change control standards.
Build and manage a long term client relationship, anticipating and addressing underlying needs, proactively adding value to products, services and processes.
Mentor and train team members and peers in the Financial Systems Group in order to build bench strength within the department.
Build and share knowledge of Sales, Order to Cash and associated reporting processes, interfaces, relationships. Facilitate Project Planning activities with internal and external partners, locally and internationally
Build and manage close relationships with Development partners through fostering a win-win approach to project management and accountability.
Qualifications:

Excellent knowledge of Oracle systems (ESO and OTC) with specific emphasis on data structure, workflow, set-up and implementation

works in the public interest by protecting public safety and the environment, conserving natural resources and ensuring
equitable participation of regulated parties in resource development and production.

The Security & Emergency Management Summer Student position is entry level and developmental, designed to provide

presentations.

Your stakeholder management skills, as much as your knowledge of Information Technology (IT) policy best practices in the IT and government sectors, and project methodology, will drive your success in this permanent, full-time position as a Senior Policy Analyst, with the City of Toronto.


Reporting to the Manager, Strategy, Policy and Issues Management, you will play a lead role in developing and delivering the corporate IT policy program for the City of Toronto. As a Senior Policy Analyst, IT, you will use a best practices approach in providing leadership and coordination in the design, development, implementation, management, monitoring and evaluation of the divisional IT policy program.


Major Responsibilities:

Your primary responsibilities as Senior Policy Analyst-IT will be varied. Specifically, you will:

Implements detailed plans and recommend policies and procedures regarding program-specific requirements.
Manages the day-to-day operation of all assigned staff on a project basis, including supervising, motivating and training staff, as well as encouraging and ensuring effective teamwork, high standards of work quality and organizational performance, continuous learning and innovation.
Manages the design, development, implementation, monitoring and evaluation of IT policies.
Secures compliance with sensitive legislation such as privacy laws and with general information and technology “best practices” and strategies in knowledge and information management through the appropriate research, analysis and development of policies, standards and procedures.
Provides advice on complex and possible controversial positions to senior management and Council through the development of papers, briefing notes and staff reports.
Manages IT Policy processes in conjunction with Information Technology Subject Matter Experts across the City.
Plans and implements the City’s corporate IT Policy program based on “best practices” in the IT and government sectors.
Conducts “best practices” research on topical IT Policies and emerging trends and related issues affecting the City of Toronto’s architecture.
Provides professional IT consulting and advisory services to the City’s business divisions and other Information & Technology (IT) work groups, as well as eCity projects.
Provides advice to senior management through the development of position papers, strategies, briefing notes, presentations and staff reports.
Facilitates and negotiates agreement between and among various parties and stakeholders to achieve common goals for delivery of IT Policy processes across the organization.
Manages the relationship with internal and external stakeholders in order to benchmark the City’s standards, including standards and practices against external organizations, as well as to achieve internal consensus where needed.
Key Qualifications:

Your application for the role of Senior Policy Analyst, should describe your qualifications as they relate to:

Post-secondary education in Public Policy, Business Administration or a related discipline and/or the equivalent combination of education and/or experience with relevant information technology or business systems experience.
Considerable experience providing strategic advice, policy/program development, research and evaluation in a large scale public or private organization.
Considerable experience consulting and establishing effective working relationships with all stakeholders including clients, management and staff at all levels.
Considerable experience in the development and deployment of research methodology, and policy particularly in the analysis and assessment of a broad range of IT issues, trends and directions.
Considerable experience in project leadership by mediating, negotiating and facilitating projects and work teams.
Strong stakeholder management, partnership and relationship-building skills to initiate and nurture strong working relationships with colleagues throughout the IT Division, corporation and external community, to achieve mutual goals and objectives. Highly developed interpersonal skills and demonstrated proficiency in conflict resolution in complex, multi-stakeholder situations.
Strong oral and written communication skills to prepare and present detailed research proposals, methodologies, standards, project plans, and reports.
Superior project management and team leadership skills to provide project planning and leadership on concurrent standards development projects and to manage deadlines and competing priorities
Excellent strategic, analytical and conceptual thinking skills.
Strong analytical thinking skills to apply several analytical techniques to break apart complex problems into component parts, identify several solutions, and weigh the value of each.
Technical skills to operate various software programs to prepare own materials.
Ability to be strategic to understand and assess the external impact of trends and issues on internal standards and planning.
Knowledge and understanding of: Project methodology, IT governance structure, decision-making processes and service management (including COBIT and ITIL).
Knowledge of the City's legislative framework and decision-making processes would be an asset.
Knowledge and understanding of: IT standards (hardware, software, telecommunication, security, data, ISO, ANSI, IEC, IEEE, ISACC, INCITS, etc.) would be an asset.
Equity, Diversity and Inclusion:
The City of Toronto is committed to fostering an inclusive, accessible environment where all employees and members of the public feel valued, respected and supported. We are dedicated to building a workforce that reflects the diversity of the public and the communities in which we live and serve.


Accommodation:

If you are an individual who requires accommodation to apply to this position, due to disability under the Ontario Human Rights Code, please email us at application.accomodation3@toronto.ca, quoting job ID #2320757 and the job title. The City is committed to providing Code-protected accommodation throughout its hiring process. Please visit Hiring Policies and Statements for further details.

Analyst, Performance & Attribution Reporting
Connor, Clark & Lunn Financial Group Ltd.
Vancouver
Interested in joining one of Canada’s top performing asset managers? We are looking for an Analyst – Performance & Attribution Reporting to join our Vancouver-based team. The Performance & Attribution Reporting (PAR) team resides in the middle office and is responsible for providing post trade analytics to all the various internal and external stakeholders. This includes calculation of performance, attribution analysis; holdings based analytics and risk measures. We are the experts in this world and the expectation is to have an understanding of the products that our affiliates manage and ensure it is accurately communicated through the data we provide whether it be for client reports, client presentations, sales material, or for internal analysis.
We place high value on maintaining an entrepreneurial spirit and creating a culture where each of us has opportunities to succeed. We are a solution orientated and collaborative team seeking likeminded individuals who thrive in a challenging and dynamic environment.
What will you be doing
The PAR team works closely with all business units within the Financial Group primarily focused on portfolio analytics. We are used to processing large datasets and providing insightful information for our end users. The job will typically have a good balance between scheduled tasks, ad hoc requests/problem solving and continuous process improvement in both an independent and a collaborative setting. Our analysts are empowered to thrive as process owners with both the creativity and responsibility that comes with delegation. Key responsibilities include:
Performance calculations, attribution analysis, and portfolio risk reporting across all asset classes
Support sales and marketing requests and provide data for RFPs
Research, propose, and maintain performance measurement and attribution methodologies for existing and new products
Develop and manage relationships with both internal and external clients
Provide analytical problem solving and troubleshooting
Identify process improvements and leverage best practices across the team
Understand new products and ensure proper reports are in place
About You
Problem Solver – You possess an analytical mindset and can detect patterns to solve problems.
Collaborative – You have a collaborative spirit that helps you to work well with others and you communicate effectively.
Self-Motivated – The ideal candidate has a passion for advancing the quality, scale and efficiency of data processes and is able to take ownership of multiple processes with keen attention to detail
Continuous Process Improvement Mindset – You constantly take a critical eye to processes with the goal of finding improvement opportunities and bring an ability to manage multiple projects.
Technology Savvy– You are able to pick up new Systems and tools quickly. You have moderate to advanced computer skills with an emphasis on MS Excel and have a desire to learn basic programming languages.
Education – You have an Undergraduate degree in business, mathematics or a related field. You are also enrolled (or considering enrollment) in the CFA or CIPM program.
Industry Knowledge – 1 to 3 years’ experience in the investment management industry or comparable. Any direct experience with Investment analytics or performance measurement would be considered an asset.
About Connor, Clark & Lunn Financial Group

Connor, Clark & Lunn Financial Group manages on behalf of institutional and individual clients. We believe that success in asset management is an outcome of attracting, retaining and motivating the most talented individuals in our industry.
This is best achieved by the delivery of:
A High-Quality Environment: To work with people who we hold in high regard; to enjoy the time that we spend at work; to focus on productive activities without the distraction of politics and bureaucracy; to treat each other with respect.
An Opportunity to Succeed: To do work that has value and which presents the opportunity for professional growth and development.
Recognition and Reward: To recognize each person's contribution and to align compensation with contribution.
Our business comprises eleven institutional investment affiliates that are responsible for investment decision making and client service, Connor Clark & Lunn Private Capital which provides multi-asset class investment solutions and Connor, Clark & Lunn Funds which distributes mutual funds. Connor, Clark & Lunn Financial Group partners with each of its affiliates by contributing world class operations, product development expertise, broad distribution and business management. We have grown from $29 billion in assets and 200 people in 2008 to and people today and this has been accompanied by a high level of change in technology, types of assets managed, trading activity and geographic growth. As we look forward we can see both challenges and opportunities for further growth that only reinforce our commitment to attracting, retaining and motivating the most talented people in our industry.
Contact Information:
To apply for this position, email your cover letter and resume to careers@cclgroup.com. Please reference, “Analyst – Performance & Attribution Reporting," and your name in the subject line.
We thank all applicants in advance for their interest, but only those candidates short-listed for interviews will be contacted. No telephone calls or recruitment agencies will be accepted.

Scope:

Egg Farmers of Canada (EFC) is seeking a Market Research Analyst to join the Operations team in a fast-paced, challenging, and exciting work environment. The ideal candidate for this position will have 5-8 years’ of experience in market research analysis and will be responsible for providing market analysis and forecasting expertise in relevance to the Canadian egg industry. Working in a team of four, the Market Research Analyst will be comfortable working with Excel and other statistical software and analyzing data to understand and solve business problems.

Duties and Responsibilities:

Perform environmental scanning tasks to assess relevant industry trends in Canada, the US and internationally
Conduct market forecasting for egg production, demand, and prices
Provide analysis, calculations and ongoing reports relevant to management of production focused programs at EFC
Produce reports and presentations outlining market expertise
Lead EFC to be a Canadian centre for egg market expertise for the Canadian, US, and international markets. This includes production, demand, and pricing factors
Maintain relationships with industry organizations in both Canada and the US
Interpret information and data sets to assess current market trends
Lead for the development of new programs and projects as directed by the manager
Contribute to the management of crisis or emergency situations, specifically in regards to market intelligence and analysis
Qualifications/Skills:

Advanced knowledge of MS Excel (pivot tables and advanced formulas for example if and lookup statements)
Proficient statistical and mathematical skills including methodologies and techniques (e.g. advanced regression analysis, ARIMA models, Monte Carlo simulations, etc.)
Ability to prepare estimates and forecasts using programming languages (e.g. STATA, SPSS, etc.)
Ability to apply logical and evaluative thinking to problem identification and resolution
Ability to multi-task, take initiative and be results-oriented
Excellent attention to detail
Strong presentation skills
Experience in project management considered an asset
Education and Experience:

Bachelor degree in Economics, Business or a related discipline
Master’s degree considered an asset
5-8 years of relevant work experience
About Egg Farmers of Canada


Egg Farmers of Canada is a not-for-profit national organization that helps hard-working farmers supply Canadians with fresh, local, high-quality eggs. Our team manages the national egg supply and promotes the benefits of eating eggs while representing the interests of over 1,000 regulated egg farmers in all ten provinces and the Northwest Territories. We also administer national on-farm programs, carry out government and media relations, run national marketing and nutrition programs, fulfill our commitment to research, and manage the national Industrial Products Program. Egg Farmers of Canada is the proud recipient of Waterstone Canada’s Most Admired Corporate Cultures and has been named one of National Capital Region’s Top Employers. To learn more about us, visit eggfarmers.ca, follow us on Twitter (@eggsoeufs) and like us on Facebook (facebook.com/eggs).

Now in its fifth decade as one of Canada’s leading agriculture organizations, Egg Farmers of Canada manages the national egg supply and promotes egg consumption while representing the interests of regulated egg producers from coast to coast. We are very proud to announce that Egg Farmers of Canada was named one of Canada’s 10 Most Admired Corporate Cultures and we have again been selected as one of the National Capital Region’s Top employers for 2018! For more information about Egg Farmers of Canada, visit eggfarmers.ca.

Egg Farmers of Canada welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.

AGL is currently seeking a Junior Systems Analyst. This is a full-time position located in Guelph, Ontario. Occasional travel within Canada and possibly internationally is required.

Position Overview

The Junior Systems Analyst will work closely with our Senior Systems Analysts in liaising with our client accounts to assess their internal processes and implement our operations management software solutions (i.e. Asset and Work Management). We are open to applicants from different backgrounds, recent grads or experienced professionals.

This is a job for a self-motivated, innovative person with excellent written and verbal communication skills. It helps to be a strong problem solver, a good listener, diplomatic and attentive to detail. Our staff members take ownership of the projects they’ve been assigned and once up-to-speed will often work with little or no supervision.

We are looking for someone who wants to do more than programming and designing software. This job is for someone who is interested in experiencing a broad range of software related challenges with a “can do” attitude.

Primary Responsibilities

Implementation

Business process review (analyze client’s internal work processes in order to efficiently transfer their processes into the software solution).
Software system set-up and data review/load.
Develop new code to meet client’s needs.
Support system integration initiatives.
Perform client training sessions (in-person or over the internet).
Provide follow-up support to the client account after system implementation.
Client Support

Day-to-day support and issue resolution for your client accounts.
Perform regular follow-ups with your designated clients.
Provide upgrade and software release support to designated clients.
Qualifications

Bachelor’s degree in a related field
SQL is a must have skill
IT development experience (.NET, JavaScript, HTML5, JQuery)
Excellent problem-solving skills
Able to think analytically
Able to work independently
Excellent communication skills (written and verbal)
Able to travel on occasion, less the 20% of the time.
We offer a comprehensive benefits package and very competitive compensation.

Please send all applications to careers@appliedgeologics.com ; Attn: Ed Shewen. Please quote the position title in your email.

Mammoet Canada is currently looking for a dynamic and results driven individual to join our regional Procurement team, Americas in our Guelph, Ontario branch. Mammoet helps clients improve construction efficiency and optimize the uptime of plants and installations. For that purpose, we provide solutions for lifting, transporting, installing and decommissioning large and heavy structures.

Our services are focused on the petrochemical and mining industries, civil engineering, power generation and offshore projects. The logistic challenges in these industries are growing daily. Engineered lifting and transportation servicesLifting, transportation and installation of modular constructionsFactory-to-foundation projectsPlant turnaround logisticsSalvage and wreck removalDecommissioning of onshore and offshore installationsTrading in new and used equipment worldwide

Their confidence inspires 5,000 Mammoet professionals to give it their all each day and truly make a difference in projects all over the world.

This position is a Full-time position based out of the Guelph Branch with working business hours from Monday through Friday. There will be international travelling and visits to branches across the region.

PermanentCan you bridge the gap between the business of forestry and the information/data/analysis required to support informed decision making? Are you analytical by nature and understand data, statistics, and a range of analytical tools?

Forsite is looking for a Senior Forest Analyst (Location can be flexible - BC, AB, ONT) with solid communication skills to support our clients across Canada. The successful applicant will become a key team member supporting the delivery of strategic planning and landbase analysis projects. The position requires a minimum of 5 years of related experience, a post-secondary education with a natural resource management focus and professional forester accreditation (or eligibility).

Forsite is a dynamic forest management services company serving government and industry clients since 1987. We are a collaborative project-focused organization that strives to provide opportunity for our employees and value for our clients.

Working within Forsite’s Resource Management and Technology business area you will lead and work with project teams to provide forestry business knowledge and technical analysis that offers cost effective, innovative, and meaningful solutions. You will have exceptional problem solving, written and oral communications skills with an ability to translate complex analysis results into practical knowledge that supports informed decision making.

Potential project types include forest management planning, timber supply analysis, cumulative effects analysis, landbase reporting for timber and non-timber resource values, carbon reporting / management strategies, economic viability and operability, inventory projections, growth and yield analysis, strategic silviculture investment analyses, etc.

The ideal candidate will have a background in operational forestry, strategic planning, timber supply, growth & yield tools, and GIS analysis. You must have excellent data manipulation skills using databases, geodatabases, and scripting languages (SQL, Python, etc).

You will be expected to produce clear written and verbal communications to document project inputs and explain project results.

Only candidates selected for interviews will be contacted.

Analyst

Who we are
We are an organization comprised of industry thought leaders who are passionate about health data and want to make a difference in the health care field. We are an independent, not-for-profit organization and together with our partners we provide essential information on Canada's health systems, enabling decisions that lead to healthier Canadians. As a valued member of the CIHI team, you and your work will have a pivotal role in the evolution of Canada's health care systems.
CIHI is recognized as an exceptional place to work that embraces diversity, respect, integrity, collaboration and innovation.
At CIHI, we recognize what matters to our employees. Some of the benefits of working at CIHI include
Generous vacation days
Flexible benefits program from your first day on the job
HOOPP Pension Plan (Defined Pension)
Retirement Planning Program
Work-life balance
Career Planning Program
Learning and Professional Development Program


Why is this role important?
The Analyst is responsible for providing assistance in compiling data, information and evidence from a variety of data, literature and other sources to support data analysis, statistical and data quality studies, as well as the production of analytical products, literature reviews and reports. Other activities include participating in the development and calculation of indicators, undertaking data requests as well as preparation of technical documentation. Specifically, the Analyst will play a key role in supporting products and services derived from the Canadian Patient Cost Database (CPCD) and Canadian MIS Database (CMDB). Examples of current products include the update and maintenance of the Patient Cost Estimator and the financial indicators included in the YourHealthSystem website.

What you'll do
Conducts and interprets basic data analysis to support reports and studies. Provides support and assists with broader analysis under the direction of the Senior Analyst and(or) Program Lead, in accordance with the data access policies/processes.

Participates in statistical studies, data quality studies, analytical products, and other activities related to the CPCD and/or CMDB.


Participates in indicator calculations, data requests, and other data related inquiries.

Analyzes research findings and prepares statistical and descriptive reports.

Assists the FSI team in fulfilling analytical requirements, literature reviews, data quality reviews, writing reports, and other duties as required.

Supports the ongoing update, testing and maintenance of MIS-related data contained in CIHI products.

Assists with data quality assurance process, fact checking activities and reports as directed.

Prepares technical notes/definitions to agreed specifications. Drafts written text for CIHI reports or analytical projects within agreed outline under guidance from senior staff (i.e. Senior Analysts, Program Leads).

Responds to client requests with areas of expertise.

Respects privacy and confidentiality of information by adhering to policies in Privacy and Confidentiality of Health Information at CIHI and related procedures and directives.

What you'll bring to the table
Undergraduate degree in health information, mathematics and statistics, business, economics or related field.
2 years experience in the manipulation and analysis of administrative data sets and standard analytical techniques.
Strong ability in SAS and Microsoft Excel.
Conceptual and problem solving skills.
Effective written and verbal communication skills.
Proven ability to work as part of a team, and work with minimal supervision.
Strong organizational skills with a demonstrated ability to prepare, interpret and effectively present key analytical findings.
Knowledge of the Standards for Management Information Systems in Canadian Health Service Organizations (MIS Standards) is an asset.
Knowledge of the MIS Patient Costing Methodology is an asset.
Knowledge of case mix products and theories is an asset.
Knowledge of CIHI’s databases, in particular the Discharge Abstract Database (CAD), or National Ambulatory Care Reporting System (NACRS) an asset.
Ability to communicate in both official languages is an asset.

Closing Statement
To find out more about this role and other exciting opportunities visit our website at www.cihi.ca and check out our 'Careers' section.
We thank all those who apply, however, only candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.


Employment Equity
At CIHI we are committed to fostering an inclusive, barrier-free and accessible environment. Part of this commitment includes arranging accommodations to ensure an equitable opportunity to participate in the recruitment and selection process. If you require an accommodation, we will work with you to meet your needs.




Analyste

Notre organisation
Notre organisation regroupe des leaders d'opinion de l'industrie qui sont passionnés par les données et veulent faire bouger les choses dans le domaine de la santé. À titre d'organisme autonome et sans but lucratif, nous collaborons avec nos partenaires pour fournir de l'information essentielle sur les systèmes de santé au pays, favorisant la prise de décisions éclairées qui visent à améliorer la santé des Canadiens. À titre d'employé de l'ICIS, vous jouerez un rôle déterminant dans l'évolution du système de santé canadien.
Nous offrons un milieu de travail exceptionnel qui favorise la diversité, le respect, l'intégrité, la collaboration et l'innovation.
L'ICIS, sachant ce qui importe à ses employés, leur offre une gamme d'avantages, dont les suivants :
une structure salariale concurrentielle
un régime d'avantages sociaux flexible dès le premier jour de travail
l'adhésion au régime de retraite HOOPP
un programme de planification de la retraite
un équilibre travail-vie personnelle
un programme de planification de carrière
des programmes d'apprentissage et de perfectionnement professionnel


Pourquoi ce rôle est-il important ?
L’analyste contribue aux principales activités de collecte et de préparation des données de la Base de données canadienne SIG (BDCS) et de la Base de données canadienne sur les coûts par patient (BDCCP) destinées aux intervenants internes et externes. De plus, il participe à la planification, à l’élaboration et à la tenue à jour de produits visant à soutenir la mise en œuvre et la qualité des données des Normes et information financières (NIF) déclarées à l’ICIS par l’intermédiaire de la BDCS et de la BDCCP. L’analyste contribue à l’adoption d’approches novatrices visant à améliorer et à simplifier continuellement la gestion des données et d’autres processus et produits d’analyse au sein de la Division des NIF.

Quelles seront vos responsabilités ?
Faire des analyses et favoriser l’adoption de pratiques exemplaires pour une collecte rapide et efficace des données de la BDCS et de la BDCCP.

Favoriser la soumission et la qualité des données en contribuant à la production de rapports sur la qualité des données qui auront une valeur ajoutée et que les clients pourront utiliser.

Collaborer avec les analystes principaux à la simplification des rapports et processus touchant la qualité des données (p. ex. code SAS) pour que le travail soit le plus efficace possible.

Offrir son soutien aux analystes principaux dans le cadre de la production, de la tenue à jour et de l’assurance de la qualité des fichiers de données qui seront utilisés pour diverses analyses internes et externes.

Participer aux activités relatives au système de la BDCS et de la BDCCP, notamment la mise en correspondance des comptes provinciaux, la révision des rapports provinciaux, et la définition et l’élaboration de modifications opérationnelles.

Trouver et proposer des façons d’améliorer les produits et processus de la BDCS et de la BDCCP.

Participer à l’établissement de relations solides avec les intervenants et à la surveillance des activités provinciales liées à l’utilisation et à l’amélioration des données financières et statistiques.

Jouer un rôle actif dans certaines analyses et d’autres projets de la Division des NIF.

Que mettriez-vous à profit ?
Diplôme de premier cycle en information sur la santé, en mathématiques et statistique, en administration des affaires, en économie ou dans un domaine connexe, ou combinaison équivalente de formation et d’expérience.
Un à trois ans d’expérience de la manipulation et l’analyse de séries de données transversales et des techniques d’analyse standards.
Excellentes connaissances de SAS et de Microsoft Excel.
Aptitudes pour la conceptualisation et la résolution de problèmes.
Aptitudes manifestes pour la communication écrite et verbale.
Capacité manifeste à travailler au sein d’une équipe avec un minimum de supervision.
Connaissance des Normes sur les systèmes d’information de gestion dans les organismes de santé du Canada (Normes SIG), un atout.
Connaissance des théories et des produits liés aux groupes clients, un atout.
Connaissance des bases de données de l’ICIS, en particulier la BDCP ou le SNISA, un atout.
Maîtrise de l’anglais essentielle; maîtrise du français un atout.

Declaration
Pour en savoir plus sur cette offre ou sur d'autres excellentes possibilités, visitez-nous au www.icis.ca et parcourez notre section Carrières.
Nous remercions tous les participants, mais nous ne communiquerons qu'avec les candidats retenus.


Équité en emploi
L'ICIS s'engage à offrir un milieu de travail inclusif, sans obstacle et accessible. Il s'engage entre autres à prendre les mesures d'adaptation nécessaires en vue de favoriser une participation équitable aux processus de recrutement et de sélection. Par conséquent, si vous avez des besoins spéciaux, nous nous efforcerons d'y répondre.

job_title: Business Analyst (Business Intelligence) – Information Technology Department
job_description:
YVR is made up of a team of diverse people who are working collaboratively to reach our goal of 29 million passengers by 2020! Safety is at the core of everything we do; we’re innovative, fun, and we invest in our people. We’re a BC Top Employer for 13 years standing, with high engagement scores, an abundance of learning and development opportunities, and a holistic approach to wellness! And we’re looking for someone to join our team.
We have an opportunity for a permanent, full-time Business Analyst in the Information Technology Department. Reporting to the Manager, Technology Services, the successful candidate will have a strong background in business intelligence (BI), reporting, data quality and data governance practices.
Key responsibilities include:
Provide subject matter expertise in core business intelligence functions (including but not limited to: process improvement, data mining, data gathering, data quality assessments, reporting, data governance, data stewardship, reporting and data visualization)
Manage and maintain all data governance related documentation such as data definitions, data models, business rules, security rules, and process maps
Coordinate with application business analysts and business owners to resolve of data integrity gaps and implement appropriate controls to mitigate future data issues
Build upon our newly established enterprise data governance implementation roadmap including delivery of strategic priorities for development of information-based capabilities
Roll out an enterprise wide data governance framework, with a focus on improvement of data quality and the protection of sensitive data through modifications to organization behavior policies and standards, principles, governance metrics, processes, related tools and data architecture
Define roles and responsibilities related to data governance and ensure clear accountability for stewardship of the company’s principal information assets
Serve as a liaison between Business and Functional areas and technology to ensure that data related business requirements for protecting sensitive data are clearly defined, communicated and well understood and considered as part of operational prioritization and planning
Facilitate the development and implementation of data quality standards, data protection standards and adoption requirements across the enterprise
Define indicators of performance and quality metrics and ensure compliance with data related policies, standards, roles and responsibilities, and adoption requirements
Identify opportunities for improvement within the system, including making recommendations on how users can best utilize our BI tools to accomplish their functional objectives; research and utilize new features of our BI application
Interface with functional users to define and document functional requirements for business intelligence and reporting needs
Coordinate and communicate status, functional requirements, project priorities, operational impacts
Developing and maintaining positive relationships with our internal and external customers
Key qualifications include:
5+ years of Business Analyst experience (intermediate to senior level) with demonstrated ability in analyzing business requirements, building business cases, managing change, and applying technology, supplemented by a bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Management/Business Information Systems or a related field; or an equivalent combination of training and experience
Demonstrated working knowledge of notable BI reporting tools, concepts and approaches
Knowledge of industry leading data quality and data protection management practices
Knowledge of data governance practices, business and technology issues related to management of enterprise information assets and approaches related to data protection
Strong project management skills, including proven on-time, on-budget delivery of medium scale projects
Ability to understand data and information and convert this into insight
Strong analytics manager which includes the ability to understand a business problem and determine the relevant data needed to derive the necessary information to make a recommendation or decision
Solid relationship building skills with all levels of an organization, both internally and externally
Motivated self-starter
This position is open to both Airport Authority employees and external candidates. Previous job performance will be taken into consideration for all internal candidates that apply for this position.
Vancouver Airport Authority welcomes applications from all qualified candidates, including women, Aboriginal peoples, persons with disabilities and members of visible minorities. If you require support applying online because you are a person with a disability, please contact us at 604-303-3152 or careers@yvr.ca. We welcome the opportunity to discuss accommodation of your disability and ensure fairness in our hiring process.

Business Analyst, Retail

Job Overview
 The role of Business Analyst, Retail will shape, influence and design solutions to fit business objectives in the Retail Merchandising and Planning domain. This role engages with stakeholders to plan, strategize, analyze, document and optimize system requirements.
What you will be doing:
Requirements Analysis: Evaluate business processes, anticipate requirements, uncover areas for improvement in planning, inventory replenishment, demand forecasting, inventory optimization and allocation
Develop and implement solutions
Document and communicate the results of your analysis
Coordinate and facilitate ongoing reviews of business processes and developing optimization strategies

Construct workflow charts and diagrams; studying system capabilities; writing specifications
Improve systems by studying current practices; designing modifications
Recommend controls by identifying problems; writing improved procedures
Monitor project progress by tracking activity; resolving problems; publishing progress reports; recommending actions
Maintain user confidence and protect operations by keeping information confidential

Position Title: FACILITIES SERVICES ANALYST

Organizational Relationship: Chief Facilities Officer


Summary:

Under the direction of the Chief Facilities Officer and the Senior Manager of Facilities Services, responsible for the accumulation of School Condition Assessment data compilation/analysis, facilities efficiency and effectiveness analysis, maintenance of the School Facilities Inventory System, updating of the VFA system and eBase and providing accounting assistance for all areas within Facilities Services.


Duties and Responsibilities:

1. Provide leadership with the accumulation of School Condition Assessment information as well as continuing to develop improved methods of providing information to senior administration and stakeholders.

2. Liaise with departments throughout the Board to gather, synthesize and present accurate information.

3. Develop multi-year analysis of facility condition and improvement information to facilitate the identification of future funding requirements and expenditures.

4. Develop tracking and reporting structures that will provide management with trending information of productivity of the Facilities Services Department’s key performance indicators.

5. Through project review and accounting analysis, prepare on-going updates, as well as a final audit binder of construction and major projects. This would also include facilitating updates to the SFIS system as well as the VFA system (a Ministry coordination software program).

6. Coordinate and implement the necessary updating processes to the Ministry of Education’s School Facilities Inventory System and VFA, to ensure the accuracy of information.

7. Prepare, develop and co-ordinate monthly financial reporting of various departments within Facilities Services, including facilitating the Board’s year end accounting process.

8. Assist with the preparation of the annual budget of the Facilities Services Department; including revenue analysis.

9. Provide training and assistance to Facilities Services staff to ensure that the Board’s accounting procedures are followed.

10. Perform account(s) analysis and prepare reports (including feasibility studies) as required, such as costing of vandalism.
11. Maintain and update new construction and major projects data in eBase.

12. Perform VFA reporting required in conjunction with Ministry Financial reporting periods.

13. Prepare statistical information and reports for Senior Management and Trustees as required.

14. Perform other duties as required.


Qualifications:

1. Post-secondary degree/diploma in Business Administration/Accounting or equivalent, plus five years progressive experience including project leadership, or an equivalent combination of education and related experience.

2. Knowledge of building systems and facility management is an asset.

3. Technical understanding of Ministry of Education reporting requirements, funding models (including capital, school condition improvement and school renewal), and Capital Asset requirements.

4. Proficient with computerized financial systems, software applications and spreadsheets.

5. Excellent communication and interpersonal skills; ability to work independently as well as part of a team.

6. Prior school board sector experience is preferred.

The Health & Benefits Analyst will help in the plan design, financing, valuation, pricing, and administration of group benefit plans including health, dental, life, and disability.

Support the development and maintenance of in-house tools and initiatives

POSITION: Distribution/Allocation Analyst
EMPLOYMENT STATUS: Exempt
REPORTS TO: Demand Planning & Distribution Manager
LOCATION: Sephora Field Support Center (FSC) – Toronto

POSITION SUMMARY:
The Distribution/Allocation Analyst works in partnership with the Category Merchant, Supply Chain, Operations, Merchandise Planning and Demand Planning Teams to achieve optimal store inventory levels while maximizing profitable sales and bottom line results. The Distribution/Allocation Analyst applies analytical skills to distribute product to multiple store formats across Canada.

POSITION RESPONSIBILITIES:

Determine optimal store allocation and replenishment based on the Merchant strategy, merchandising plan, store size and sales performance
Provide data and recommendations to influence the development of department/class level plans
Assist in the development of department/class level allocation strategies
Ensure allocations and replenishment is completed by the required timelines for DC processing to ensure product arrives to pre-defined store set-up dates.
Manage the inventory levels for product categories through analysis of trends, exceptions, rate of sale, minimum order quantities and minimum presentation quantities.
Store level in stock and sales analysis with the goal to increase in stocks
Maintain a well-balanced inventory in each assigned classification to maximize sales while minimizing obsolescence
Partner with Planning/ Merchandising team to identify and communicate sales and inventory trends or issues.
Monitors and manages store side forecasts for newness and core SKUs to ensure in stock targets are met.
Management of all Hotline Online Store Requests for respective brands.
Provide inventory analytics with information to maximize sales and profits
Share responsibility with the merchants, merchandise planning and demand planning team for Weeks of Supply, age of stock, and stock to sales (category and store) provide analysis and provide recommendations as required.
Analyze and report all in-season sell through results. Evaluate performance of promotions and key programs to extract learnings. Complete ad-hoc analysis or reports as required in a timely matter as it relates to allocations, sell-through, and inventory
Compile store grading analysis based on required timelines and liase with merchandising, merchandise planning and demand planning teams to review proposed store clusters/grades.
Collaborate with operations, districts store specialists, to ensure timely product allocations to new and/or renovated stores or any special store request or concerns.
Effectively communicate expected store delivery flow to DC Operations and Operations team and troubleshoot any issues
Provide feedback and recommendations for various processes and applications to improve efficiencies in everyday tasks and assigned projects.
Ad Hoc Analysis, Projects/ Reporting as requested.

CORE COMPETENCIES:
Analytic Skills: Ability to think objectively and interpret meaningful themes from quantitative and qualitative data
Financial and Business Acumen: Ability to evaluate financial and business indicators and translate data into actionable information to drive results; proficiency in retail math
Problem Solving & Decision Quality: Able to use rigorous logic and methods to solve problems with effective solutions
Influencing & Negotiation: Can present ideas and directions that lead others to action
Systems and Tools Acumen: Advanced proficiency in Microsoft Excel, and have aptitude to learn technical applications quickly
Collaboration: Able to build constructive and effective relationships with a broad and diverse group of business partners
Possess strong organizational and time management skills

REQUIREMENTS:
Post-Secondary Education in Finance, Supply Chain and/or Business preferred
1 – 2 years of Allocation and/or Supply Chain Experience required
Strong numbers aptitude; able to compile statistical reports

COMPANY OVERVIEW:
SEPHORA has been changing the face of prestige cosmetics since its debut in 1970s Paris. Sephora was acquired by luxury group Moët Hennessy Louis Vuitton (LVMH) in 1997 then launched stateside in 1998, and is currently home to 200 world-class brands - including its own private label, SEPHORA COLLECTION. Sephora's curated assortment features more than 14,000 products including makeup, skin care, perfume, hair care, body, professional tools and more. Sephora is the beauty education hub, offering consultations at the Beauty Studio, a variety of complimentary classes, one-on-one service from Personal Beauty Advisors, and exclusive retail technology SKINCARE IQ, COLOR IQ, and FRAGRANCE IQ. Sephora is an international force in beauty, and its award-winning website and ever-growing presence on social-media make it the world's premier digital beauty destination.

RBC’s Global Trading Client Management Team is looking for an Analyst to assist in the management and administration of authorized credit and transactional risk limits for various real money asset manager relationships and pension funds. This role involves the development of transaction solutions and assistance in the preparation of credit requests while contributing to the firm’s revenue generation and relationship building efforts.

What will you do?
Preparation of credit requests in support of RBC Capital Markets' credit intensive trading activities with global asset managers on behalf of the funds they manage( including regulated mutual funds, pension funds, trusts and endowments etc.)
Understand and assess client investment strategies from a risk perspective.
Undertake a variety of portfolio maintenance activities including compliance data monitoring and limit excesses
Maintain accuracy of trading credit limit data within bank systems via daily checks and Annual reviews
Completion of assigned projects and other duties in an efficient and effective manner that support business initiatives
Maintain a strong understanding of Royal Bank’s trading policies and guidelines
Initiate and maintain contact with trading professionals, Group Risk Management, Trading Documentation Group, RBC Legal and clients

What do you need to succeed?

A completed Undergraduate Degree in Business, Finance, Accounting or a related quantitiative field.
Strong Excel Skills and experience working with large data sets
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Strong time management and organizational skills- must be able to prioritize and re-prioritize tasks in order to meet demanding fact paced needs to the trading businesses
Advanced data and computer management skills including proficiency with Excel

Nice-to-have:
CFA Designation.
1-2 years of experience working within the Financial Services
Understanding and knowledge of fund industry and securities regulations governing funds

What’s in it for you?
We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual
A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits plus competitive compensation.
Opportunities to do challenging work and learn about CM products and Credit
Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team
Opportunity to interact with different CM groups and build a comprehensive network
Opportunities to take on progressively greater accountabilities

Royal Bank of Canada is Canada’s largest bank, and one of the largest banks in the world, based on market capitalization. The Senior Business Analyst is responsible for working with Clients and Valtech Project Teams to drive the project vision, objectives and take ultimate ownership for delivering impactful Ecommerce solutions with the project team.

Maintaining an intimate knowledge of the budget/scope burndown and its impact on release expectations is mandatory.Works closely with the technical lead to define work for the developers via acceptance criteria on the user storiesWork with the client and project team to formulate a release vision and high-level epicsConstantly manage client expectations on release scopePresent and justify a product release to the project stakeholders.Participate in project process including Release Planning, Sprint Planning, Backlog Grooming, Daily Scrum, and Sprint Review.Work with customers and stakeholders to understand their needs and manage expectations.Define and prioritize a backlog of work. Maintain a well-groomed product backlog at all times.Be the customer's voice and provide perspective on business value on a day-to-day basis.Continuously evaluate and prioritize user stories based on market data and business needs.Write user stories and acceptance criteria.

Here’s what it’s like to work for us:

We’re advisors, visionaries, creative and techies…with an agency mindset. We believe in working together, and that the best results come when we pool our knowledge and brainstorm the right solution for our customers.

We embrace all things digital.
Our ambition is to become a global leader in the digital space. No more, no less. Our customers look to us to help them succeed in the digital landscape. We deliver work that makes them the leaders in their industries, based on a thorough understanding of their business and a close collaboration with their employees.
We talk to each other.
We work in an open environment, with business developers, web technologists, strategists and creatives sitting side-by-side, pooling their collective wisdom in order to come up with the best solution for our clients.
We have fun.
We don’t believe in boredom. We do work hard, and we put in the hours we need to get the job done, but we also have a vibrant, dynamic atmosphere with passionate colleagues who enjoy what they do.
We love our clients.
Seriously! They are the reason why we are here. And why wouldn’t we? We are working with some of the biggest and most interesting brands in the world, along with a lot of other companies that all have great ambition to succeed in the digital space.
We’re looking ahead.
We are driven by a visionary mindset, and that means there is plenty of room for initiative and for talented people to shape who we are tomorrow.
Up for the challenge?
Then we will be more than happy to hear from you. We have on-going interviews so send your application as soon as possible via the apply button.

$70,000 - $85,000 a yearCrafting something unique takes more than good ideas: it takes a group of dedicated professionals who aren’t afraid to try something new, make it better, and then make it perfect.

If you’re looking for a job that stretches your creative muscles, and gives you the chance to be better every day, this is the opportunity for you.

At VISO, we’re always searching for ways to innovate. Whether in our groundbreaking custom lighting designs, our company culture, or our business strategies, we know that being better is the only way forward. That spirit has fueled our success for over 25 years, and has driven us to be unique, uncompromising, and exceptional in everything we do.

Now we’re looking to add a new member to our analytics team: someone with expertise, technical ability, and a positive, collaborative attitude.

That’s where you come in

As our new Business Analyst, you’ll be responsible for a range of financial duties: things like reporting, data management, costing and analysis.

A big part of this role involves working with our new ERP software, EPICOR. Here you’ll manage end to end business processes, and identify, define, and analyze business requirements. You’ll also support our software transition by being a resource for EPICOR, and contribute to change and product management.

Succeeding in this role means always looking forward to new opportunities, whether that involves improving our systems for efficiency, finding new applications, or furthering our business goals.

Business analysis is an integral role in our company, and you’ll learn all about our core operations as you gain experience with us. If you can deliver on and exceed the expectations of this role, there will be plenty of chances to grow into more senior positions and responsibilities.

Along with relevant experience, we’re seeking someone who:

Takes initiative – you have the drive and independence to finish projects and tasks on your own, and know how to meet deadlines.
Loves learning – constant improvement is your motto: you are an innovator who’s always looking for a better way.
Excels in group settings – you’re as good with people as you are with analysis, and can use strong interpersonal skills to collaborate with anyone who can lend a hand.
Thinks creatively – you’re strategic and excel in problem solving. You aren’t afraid to try different approaches, and know how to switch tactics when things aren’t working.
Working @ Viso

This will be a full-time, permanent position with hours from 9-5, Monday to Friday. We offer a competitive compensation package, which includes a salary between $70,000 and $85,000 per year, commensurate with your experience. You’ll also get full medical and dental after a trial period, as well as free parking, and potential for bonuses.

We do work culture a little bit differently at VISO. Or office is pet friendly, and we encourage people to be themselves at work. As a group we love collaboration, and maintaining the fun, positive, family-like environment of our workplace is a top priority.

If you want to join a team that’s supportive and always looking to do better, we want to hear from you.

Qualifications
Experience in business analysis, preferably in manufacturing or a related industry
Bachelors degree in business or a related field
Strong business communication skills, and ability/interest in working directly with clients
Proficiency with ERP software, including EPICOR
Demonstrated ability to implement new software/systems related to business analytics
We value diversity and inclusion and encourage all qualified people to apply. If we can make this easier through accommodation in the recruitment process, please contact us with the “Help” button in the application.

We will review applications, and look forward to hearing from you.
