We look forward to receiving your resume!

The opportunity

The People Reporting Analyst will be very closely aligned to the Talent team stakeholders and will support all geographies to the EY common reporting standards and metrics. This is a full time role which will require strong working relationships with a diverse people client base primarily focused on the Talent and service line leadership. Training of end users from the Talent teams and working with the Global Shared Services (GSS) People Reporting team based in Bangalore, India is an important part of this role.

Your key responsibilities

This role will have responsibility for providing deep subject matter expertise in the consultation, design, creation and management of reports. Reporting support will be primarily with management, operational and dashboard report requests which will enhance the way decision making takes place in the Talent teams. The incumbent will work closely with clients including Service Line Leaders and Regional Talent Leaders to understand reporting requirements. A key component of this role is a deep understanding of HR functions like core hr, recruiting, learning, performance management process, data and systems.

Successful candidates will build key partnerships with talent leaders to understand and deliver on business needs.Work closely with clients to understand reporting and dashboard requirements; lead and facilitate discussions within work streams at Global, Area, and Region levelsProduce specific and complex management reporting with people data from EY Talent systemsDedicated point of contact for nominated Area and/or Global Service Line and other colleaguesWork closely with Regions including articulating a clear understanding of scope of services to provide a complete and clear understanding of EY people reporting support.This role includes delegation of work and partnership with the Global Shared Services (GSS) including enforcing clear quality measurements.Maintain strong business relationships with key stakeholders to resolve data and reporting challenges, including interpretation and quality.Understand customer requirements for new report requests, and advises on best practice approaches to report development including use of direct accessContribute to the successful delivery of projects through leading efforts in project management, UAT, training and deployment focused activitiesBuild and own management reporting processes and procedures in conjunction with recruiting, learning, performance management and other HR reporting functions.Daily operations of a reporting utilizing a report request tracking toolTrain and educate others (both clients and team) on the methods and value of reporting

Skills and attributes for success

Good operational experience or knowledge with HR processes and systems related to core hr, recruiting, learning, performance management and overall people dataExtensive reporting experience including knowledge of process and data usage. Knowledge of standard metrics and key performance indicatorsKnowledge of HR data privacy laws, information security and quality principles.Strong relationship and communication skills across multiple countries and culturesExcellent teaming skills required to work in a virtual work environment A self starter, self motivated and able to work with specific but minimal direction.Extensive technical experience in Success Factors, SAP Cloud Analytics, Business Objects, Microsoft Excel, MS Sharepoint – SSRS, Power BI, Oracle Business Intelligence, SQL, and technical knowledge for report production. Advanced Excel skills required such as vba, automation, power pivot, power query, interaction with SQL, programmability.Ability to build strong working relationships with diverse client base, including senior leadershipProven track record of working with managing a senior stakeholder population

To qualify for the role you must have

Bachelor's degree preferredMulti-language skills advantageous (English, French, Spanish)Occasional travel may be required for global team meetings/projectsFrequent meetings with others across global time zones will require some calls to be made outside of standard business hours

Ideally, you’ll also have

The ability to work independently in a fast-paced, dynamic team-oriented environment

What we look for

We are looking for candidates who are highly motivated, analytical, logical thinkers and have a very strong attention to detail. Being a strong team player is critical with the ability to adapt to changing requirements or deadlines.

What working at EY offers

At EY, our Total Rewards package supports our commitment to creating a leading people culture - built on high-performance teaming - where everyone can achieve their potential and contribute to building a better working world for our people, our clients and our communities. It's one of the many reasons we repeatedly win awards for being a great place to work.

We offer a competitive compensation package where you’ll be rewarded based on your performance and recognized for the value you bring to our business. In addition, our Total Rewards package allows you decide which benefits are right for you and which ones help you create a solid foundation for your future. Our Total Rewards package includes a comprehensive medical, prescription drug and dental coverage, a defined contribution pension plan, a great vacation policy plus firm paid days that allow you to enjoy longer long weekends throughout the year, statutory holidays and paid personal days (based on province of residence), and a range of exciting programs and benefits designed to support your physical, financial and social well-being. Plus, we offer:

Support and coaching from some of the most engaging colleagues in the industryLearning opportunities to develop new skills and progress your careerThe freedom and flexibility to handle your role in a way that’s right for you

About EY

As a global leader in assurance, tax, transaction and advisory services, we’re using the finance products, expertise and systems we’ve developed to build a better working world. That starts with a culture that believes in giving you the training, opportunities and creative freedom to make things better. Whenever you join, however long you stay, the exceptional EY experience lasts a lifetime. Recognized as one of Canada's top employers, EY continually strives to be a great place to work and with a commitment to hiring and developing the most passionate people, we’ll make our ambition to be the best employer by 2020 a reality.

Job Description
The Day & Ross Transportation Group is currently seeking a full-time Operations Analyst for our Freight division in Hartland, NB.

Day & Ross Freight is committed to an exceptional customer experience. We achieve this by being: authentic, committed, caring, trusted, and enthusiastic.

As an Operations Analyst, you are the owner of data collection, analysis and presentation for the Operations Team. It is your responsibility to ensure your work is completed in an accurate and timely format.

This position is all about data collection, analysis and presentation to support improvement initiatives.
To be successful in this position, you will be able to do the following (not an exhaustive list of responsibilities):
Own the collection and analysis of operations KPI.
Identify potentially inaccurate points within the data, validate source of data and confirm accuracy to ensure understanding of the data.
Create awareness, identify issues, problems, opportunities.
Use a data analysis method to support the determination of root cause solution as related to gaps in performance measures. The data analysis prepared will be used to impact efficiency and improvement, therefore accuracy and presentation becomes a key component.
Recommend solutions when it comes to the measurement process and collection of data. Bases decision on how their actions impact by understanding the impact that data they are presenting plays within business decisions.
Prepares all dash-board reports and display in a user friendly format. Presentation of data to department with explanation to support findings. Quality based on mutual respect, friendly, customer focused.
Provides accurate data/presentation and translates the relevant data to achieve business objectives.
Provides support with change initiatives by providing relevant data to the team to demonstrate the requirement for change.

To be qualified for this role, please ensure your resume clearly displays some or all of the following:
Computer skills – accuracy, MS products, data and statistical analysis, exposure to Operations Management techniques is preferred
Advanced communication skills (written and verbal)
Superior time management skills
Manage multiple tasks with the ability to focus and work independently on projects with appropriate guidance
Deadline driven environment
Team player focused
Results focused
Education – University or technical training with a focus on data analysis
Previous experience in similar data analysis roles required; within the transportation industry an asset

Please apply directly on our website at www.dayandrosscareers.com or send your resume to yourcareer@dayandrossinc.ca and note the job title and location in the subject line.

Please note that the successful candidate will be subject to reference and criminal background checks prior to employment.

Job Summary

Who we are:
CIHR is the Government of Canada's health research investment agency. CIHR's mission is to support a healthier Canada by leading investment in innovative and collaborative research and helping to solve our health care challenges today and in the future.

Why work for the Canadian Institutes of Health Research?

The Canadian Institutes of Health Research (CIHR) is dedicated to creating a healthy and stimulating work environment; promoting synergies and a collaborative culture across the organization, including with its institutes and external stakeholders.

CIHR is located in the heart of downtown Ottawa at 160 Elgin Street, close to transit and many shops and restaurants.

Intent of Process:
The intent of this process is to staff various term and indeterminate positions by creating a pool of pre-qualified qualified candidates to also staff future similar positions within CIHR with various tenures (assignment, specified period or indeterminate), various security clearance levels and bilingual linguistic profiles.

Job Summary:
Reporting directly to the Project Lead, the incumbent is responsible for supporting the business operations of an assigned set of funding related business systems and business processes; as well as supporting integrated projects to design, test, and assess the impact of business system changes.

The incumbent will be required to be collaborative while consulting extensively with multiple internal and external stakeholders, to achieve consensus. The outcome will be developing project work plans, documenting business needs, identifying issues and risks, and proposing mitigations to keep the project on track. Additionally, the incumbent will support and maintain change control procedures and makes recommendations to continuously improve processes and tools.

Our ideal candidate will be able to build relationships, manage multiple requests, and be innovative while working with our team to support the design, implementation, and continuous improvement of CIHR’s funding-related business systems and business processes that support the delivery of CIHR’s core programs and services.
Essential Qualifications

EDUCATION:
Bachelor’s degree from a recognized university or a combination of education, training and experience.

EXPERIENCE (generally acquired through a minimum of 2 years experience):


liaising with different stakeholders to support the planning, design, development, and testing of business system and process enhancements
preparing project plans, reports, briefing notes, and presentations that were widely distributed and/or presented to a variety of audiences and/or used to support organizational decision-making.
with business process mapping as well as capturing, scripting, and managing business requirements

KNOWLEDGE

Expert knowledge of business analysis, requirements capture and management, and requirements scripting and change control.
Expert knowledge of process design and management principles.

COMPETENCIES

Communication (Written and Oral)
Working with others (Collaborating, Relationship Management)
Adaptability
Planning and Organizing
Initiative
Critical Thinking
Judgement

Asset Qualifications

EDUCATION:

A graduate degree in either: the life/health sciences or in business.
Business Analyst training and/or certification.

EXPERIENCE:

manipulating and analyzing data and information.
health research.
using data visualization techniques and tools.
project management (using tools, methodologies and best practices).

Important Notes
1) The intent of this selection process is to establish a pool of pre-qualified candidates to staff future identical positions or similar positions within CIHR with various tenures (assignment, specified period or indeterminate)

2) Application must be received through the ATS (process number: J0219-0647)

3) Acknowledgement of receipt of applications will not be sent; we would like to thank all candidates who apply. Only those selected for an exam/interview will be contacted.

4) An interview will be held. A written examination may be administered.

5) CIHR is committed to the values and principles of employment equity. If contacted in relation to a job opportunity or testing, please inform us of accommodations (i.e., an alternative method of assessment, a technical aid, accessibility requirements, etc.) required at any stage of the assessment process, so that we can take the appropriate measures to facilitate your full participation.

6) From amongst those candidates that meet the essential criteria of education and experiences; CIHR may select a certain number of candidates that most closely meet the position requirements to participate in the next selection phase.

7) CIHR is a federal agency (separate employer) and does not fall under the Public Service Employment Act.
CIHR
The Canadian Institutes of Health Research (CIHR) is the Government of Canada's health research investment agency. CIHR's mission is to create new scientific knowledge and to enable its translation into improved health, more effective health services and products, and a strengthened health care system for Canadians. Composed of 13 Institutes, CIHR provides leadership and support to more than 13,000 health researchers and trainees across Canada.

Description

Passionate about fostering cohesion and motivation amongst cross-functional teams

Reporting to the Director of IT, Business Intelligence

Grow with the best. Join a smart, creative, and inspired team that works behind the scenes to support operational excellence. Our functional services teams (FSTs) provide services to 22,000 employees in over 400 locations worldwide. Your Opportunity
Have you seen the new Stantec Tower? If not, take a look here at https://www.stantec.com/en/projects/canada-projects/s/stantec-tower-edmonton . Come work in this bright, new, and innovative downtown space: the hub of excitement and energy of Edmonton!
We want you to join a truly best-in-class human resource business partnering team!
Our Canada Prairies and Territories HR Client Services (HRCS) team serves the Edmonton Capital, Alberta North and Territories, Saskatchewan and Manitoba regions. We’re proud of our successes and results with our clients. In our first ever Client Satisfaction Survey, 80% of leaders have told us that their Human Resources Business Partner (HRBP) responds to their business needs in a manner that provides added value, and 77% of leaders say their HRBPs are influential and trusted advisors to them and their business
.
Sound exciting? Well read on. . .
This is truly career changing and an opportunity to take your HR career to the next level. We’re on the hunt for a developmental HR Business Partner to join our passionate, high performance and results-driven team. This hybrid HR Business Partner role will be accountable for delivering a combination of HR business partnering services and analyst/coordinator responsibilities.
You will wear several hats: trusted advisor, consultant, analyst and coordinator. You will regularly engage in business conversations, with an assigned client portfolio, with the goal of influencing and equipping people leaders to lead their teams and foster a highly engaged, inspiring and inclusive workplace. The rest of your time, you’ll be accountable for important human resource analysis and coordination work to support your fellow HR Business Partners and Regional HR Manager which will enable your growth and learning as a HR professional.
As the successful candidate, you will be professional, resilient, pragmatic, humble, proactive and possess a great sense of humour. Your counsel and every day work are logical, accurate, analytical and strategic, and you have a natural curiosity and appreciation that failure and vulnerability are healthy ways to learn and grow. Your passion to make a difference will contribute to the success of our internal clients in creating better outcomes for our Stantec clients.
Source: HRCS Client Satisfaction Survey, May 2018
Your Key Responsibilities
Analyst/coordinator:
Initiates and completes various HR analysis and coordination projects in support of fellow HR Client Services’ teammates and your assigned client portfolio.

A subject matter expert leading the government grants application process for the Prairies & Territories geography.

Supports varying annual data and analysis processes such as seasonal workforce management.

Initiates and leads various geographic specific HR data or metrics reports always designing with the client in mind including reports for leadership consumption.

Designs and prepares varying executive-ready PowerPoint presentations.

Work with human resource service representative(s) to ensure accurate completion of ad-hoc employee changes.

May coordinate large team-specific events.

Business partner:
Proactively partner with clients to identify issues, workforce planning or organizational design challenges and provides advice and expertise to help develop creative solutions.

Serves as a trusted advisor to leaders by presenting multiple perspectives and challenging the status quo.

Practices effective relationship management to elevate working relationships with internal client groups, including managers, senior leaders and employees along with our “home team” of global HR specialists.

Demonstrates and effectively scales the application of the HR generalist disciplines including data/analytics, employee engagement, retention and talent development, succession planning, change, conflict and exit management, employment legislation, employee relations, performance management, investigations, job evaluation, compensation management, internal communication, coaching, policy interpretation, career coaching, facilitation, workforce planning, and inclusion and diversity to positively impact Stantec’s culture of performance and safety.

Fosters a continuous improvement mindset and continually looks for opportunities to increase the return on investment of human resource programs for employees and leaders.

Performs other duties, of a similar nature, as assigned.

Have some fun!

Your Capabilities and Credentials
Valued as a consummate professional, exercising confidentiality, discretion, sound judgment as well as possessing critical thinking in ambiguous situations.

Respected for your agility, flexibility and ability to manage multiple priorities simultaneously and having a focus for action-orientation on results and the competing needs of internal customers across three time zones.

Self-directed with a sense of urgency. Strong ability to balance operational and strategic tasks, originating from multiple sources, with strong organizational and time management skills.

Regarded as a developing communicator and able to influence a broad and diverse range of stakeholders through effective relationships, verbal and written communication.

Noted for your ability to identify and anticipate operational business and human capital problems, then providing and executing innovative solutions with attention to small but critical details.

Distinguished as a developing business partner who learns the business and takes an active interest in continually enhancing your business acumen.

Developmental skills in coaching managers, facilitation, conflict resolution and relationship management.

Distinguished for an interest in continual personal development and keeping current in human resource best practices through external resources and building a strong HR network.

Prior experience successfully operating within a matrix global organization and within a geographically dispersed team is an asset.

Education and Experience
Bachelor’s degree in commerce, business or management.

A minimum of one to two years of HR analyst or coordinator-level experience, including exceptional, proactive internal customer experiences.

Certified (or are eligible to register) as a CPHR Candidate.

Advanced skills in MS Office Excel and PowerPoint.

Some professional-level HR business partnering experience (as a HR business partner, HR specialist or recruiter at a consultant or advisor level) is an asset.

Typical office environment working with computers and remaining sedentary for long periods of time. Minimal travel may be required on an infrequent basis.

Stantec is a place where the best and brightest come to build on each other’s talents, do exciting work, and make an impact on the world around us. Join us and redefine your personal best.

Who is Financeit?
Financeit is a market leading point-of-sale payment plan provider, servicing the home improvement, vehicle and retail industries. About the role:
We are looking for a self-motivated and energetic Credit Analyst to join our Lending Department. This role will support various teams within the operations division: funding, underwriting, collections, sales and service. You have a proven track record of working independently in a fast-paced and changing environment. You have a strong credit background and are able to identify trends to improve portfolio performance. You take the initiative to ensure credit and fraud related risks are minimized.
The responsibilities of the Credit Analyst include disbursing all applications, auditing loan quality, reporting portfolio performance, monitoring partner activity, assisting with compliance management and performing secondary review on all loans.
The ideal candidate will have experience in a credit or underwriting role within a financial institution, have a proven track record to improve efficiency, and the ability to maintain focus in a fast-paced and changing environment.
What you’ll do:
Reviewing & Funding Applications
Review underwriter and funding officer tasks on all applications that are in ready for funding state
Request additional adjudication on loans that contain errors on: Proof of Income calculation or Funding Documentation.
Escalate and interrupt the disbursal of a loan that contravenes any funding and disbursal policies as outlined in the underwriting guideline and Red Flag Requirements
Adhere to all compliance measures as outlined in the Compliance Management Program and Consumer Law Policies
Monitor and flag any applications that are suspected of Fraudulent Activity up to and including Identity Theft to the risk and lending management team for further action.
Work closely with Customer Service, Underwriting, Risk, Sales and Tech teams in ensuring excellent customer service levels and product integrity.
Evaluate existing partners on an ongoing basis and their current state of credibility, profitability and potential fraud or risk assessment
Review escalations from the Funding, Underwriting, Sales and Risk team
Work with Sales and Operations managers to provide feedback and training opportunities for staff development
Run ad hoc training sessions based on trends identified during audits
Reporting
Analyze existing credit and reporting trends to identify opportunities, gaps, and areas of concern/improvement for the lending team.
Provide general assistance with ad hoc reporting as necessary
Support the loan auditing process by reviewing and evaluating a set of funded loans on a quarterly basis.
Other Tasks
Brainstorm and create various new insightful research projects using available data and share with key stakeholders
Understand and use our UAT environment to test new product changes as required by the business
Crossed trained to assist in underwriting, funding and partner application approvals as required across CAD and US business.
Be the liaison between Sales, Merchant Approval, Merchant Activation and Risk team and other departments as required by the business.
Requirements
Minimum 2 years of credit analysis or related industry experience
In-depth knowledge of Risk Management and Credit Evaluation
Strong analytical skills and extreme attention to detail
Strong problem solver
Solid planning, organizing and time management skills
Excellent oral and written communication skills
Ability to work with minimal supervision
Ability to multi-task and can adjust priorities on-the-fly
Proficiency in MS Office
Bachelor’s degree

Winner of Canada’s Most Admired Corporate Culture in 2018, we offer more than just the basics. Take advantage of:
An award-winning culture with regular social events + team lunches
Competitive pay
Comprehensive medical, dental and vision coverage + fitness reimbursement
RSP Contribution matching

job_title: Senior Business Systems Analyst - Six Month Contract

job_description:
JOB PURPOSE/ROLE
Project Management is used to transform the business through change, by using the management of workstreams and projects which collectively are closely aligned to achieve benefits as defined by the business. The Project Analyst will take total accountability for planning, structuring, leading and executing smaller projects and/or workstreams on bigger projects with low risk and complexity. Ensuring that the alignment of the three organizational elements Corporate Strategy, Delivery of the mechanisms for change and a Business as usual environment is maintained.

Provide the framework that will integrate and reconcile the competing demands for resources. Recognize the effect of the project transformation changes has on the culture, style and character of the Organization and accommodate for this to ensure success. Define, lead and manage smaller projects and/or workstreams across AGCS. Work in collaboration with the Business Lead for the projects to secure effective business engagement in taking forward the agenda and agree benefits. Ensure the delivery of new products or services from the portfolio are to the appropriate levels of quality, on time and within budget, in accordance with the projects plan.
KEY RESPONSIBILITIES
Project Management and Integration

Be responsible for overall Program Scope Management, whilst the individual project teams will manage the respective scope of an individual project you will be wholly responsible for the adherence to the overall plan, SOW and other associated documentation.

Actively performance manage the project to ensure initiatives and supporting workstreams together with enabling projects are delivered and to escalate appropriately the situation if progress is delayed.

Maintain knowledge in all areas of the program/projects includes processes that are required to ensure all components are coordinated. This knowledge area may include the project plan development processes, project plan execution processes, and integrated change control processes. Use a high quality of PM methodology and constantly drive more methodology improvements in alignment with PMLC.

Responsible for the management and analysis of issues. Manage the projects budget, monitoring the expenditures and costs against delivered and realized benefits as the project progresses. Identify, analyze and interpret relevant global and local activity data in order to define, challenge and secure best practice underpins the project. In addition using the information to set standards and use for decisions making for specific projects.

Manage third party contributions to the project as appropriate. Manage both the dependencies and the interfaces between projects within the project. Manage the risks to ensure the projects successful outcome.

Change Management

Stakeholder Management
Ensure early engagement with Stakeholders and manage this engagement throughout the project, keeping them informed of progress and issues throughout the project. Develop and positively influence key, strategic position holders across locations and functions. Willingness to support project delivery colleagues where interdependencies demand collaborative action and team work.

Communication and Project Reporting

Ensure provision of timely and transparent program / project information to provide the Program Sponsor and other stakeholders with accurate, relevant decision support material. Providing accurate progress reports, identifying risks and issues in a timely manner.

Standards & Methodology

Be responsible for directing and leading initiatives and supporting workstreams that will support the delivery of this project ensure adherence to Portfolio Governance and control.

Use PM Methodologies to best assess the risks and issues that may threaten the successful delivery of your program.

Validate new standards and methodology elements in internal projects and initiatives.

(Project) Team Leadership

Build, manage and motivate the project team, this will be virtual teams across multiple projects which will include workstream leads, project support staff and team members from other departments.
KEY REQUIREMENTS/SKILLS/EXPERIENCE

Calgary Recreation’s Golf and Sport Development (GSD) division provides affordable, quality golf services and city-wide sport opportunities to citizens. Reporting to the Lead of Sport and Business Development, the Business analyst will support division strategy and policy development while also contributing to enhanced service delivery and business performance. Utilizing strong analytical skills with a clear understanding of operations, practices, research and strategies the Business Analyst will work as part of team to identify areas of improvement and implement creative solutions to achieve business goals. The successful candidate will be results oriented possessing highly developed reasoning skills along with a keen sense of financial and social return on investment and an aptitude to identify and execute innovative ideas. Primary duties include:
Responsible for pricing strategies as well as developing, implementing and leading projects that optimize revenue, increase site utilization and broaden the market for GSD services.
Identify opportunities, options and recommendations for the GSD leadership team based on engaging staff and outcomes of detailed data analysis. The incumbent will also provide input supporting strategy and policy development as well as workflow and service delivery improvements.
Evaluate the feasibility of potential opportunities (products and services) by assessing revenue and expense implications, defining operational impacts and articulating social benefits.
Identify, prioritize, plan and monitor GSD data collection and research needs while assuring coordinated approaches and alignment with corporate initiatives. Recommend appropriate frameworks, tools and approaches enabling the division to respond to customer needs and a changing environment.
Responsible for the creating and disseminating strategic insights, reports and presentation materials to assist in decision making and used to effectively communicate information to a broad range of audiences.
Develop and sustain strategic working relationships with internal stakeholders as well as external industry peers such as sport properties and associations.

Advanced experience using Microsoft Office Suite for data analysis, presentation and documentation.
Access to personal vehicle for occasional business use.
Preference will be given to candidates that are familiar with business intelligence and reporting software used to build reports and dashboards.

Successful applicants must provide proof of qualifications.

job_title: Senior Business Analyst, Production Accounting Systems (PAS)
job_description:
PermanentWe are currently searching for an experienced Senior Business Analyst within our Oil & Gas business unit in Calgary. The O&G / Energy BU works with 5 primary products: “PAS” (Production Accounting Solution), “RMS” (Royalty Management System), “PVR” (Production Volume Reporting), “LandMan” (Land & Asset Management) and enVision (O&G Financial Management). CGI is well known in the industry as a leader in the Energy field for providing custom tailored, high quality and high impact systems.

This position will work on our PAS team; the PAS product is very large, extremely complex and offers continued challenge to our Agile based Development team. As a business analyst on this team you will be working with a team of business analysts, developers and Subject Matter Exports on multiple projects for various clients that are large in scope and involve complex functionality enhancement and creation. You will work closely with CGI’s product development and support team, off-shore development team and the clients. This position has very strong potential for career growth within CGI and the Energy sector.
Build your career with us.

It is an extraordinary time to be in business. As digital transformation continues to accelerate, CGI is at the center of this change—supporting our clients’ digital journeys and offering our professionals exciting career opportunities.

At CGI, our success comes from the talent and commitment of our professionals. As one team, we share the challenges and rewards that come from growing our company, which reinforces our culture of ownership. All of our professionals benefit from the value we collectively create.

Be part of building one of the largest independent technology and business services firms in the world.

Learn more about CGI at www.cgi.com.

No unsolicited agency referrals please.

CGI is an equal opportunity employer. In addition, CGI is committed to providing accommodations for people with disabilities in accordance with provincial legislation. Please let us know if you require a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during any aspect of the recruitment process and we will work with you to address your needs.
Your future duties and responsibilities

Gathering, analyzing and documenting functional business requirements to assist in the software development
Compiling data into actionable requirements specifications
Working with multiple clients to come up with functional requirements
Participation and facilitation of business design meetings with clients
Managing the scope, timeline and deliverables of development features
Performing quality assurance tasks – create test cases/test matrix and carry out the testing
Generating use cases to document business process flows
Conducting internal and external demos
Reviewing regulatory documents
Mentoring or coaching junior business analysts and the offshore business resources
Able to work independently and as part of a team

10+ years of experience with production accounting and production accounting systems
A good knowledge of the Oil & Gas domain
2 – 5 or more years of experience in positions requiring analysis, documentation and client interaction combined with training and/or designation related to Business Analysis techniques or as a Business Analyst
Ability to develop and execute test plans – Quality Assurance experience
Excellent interpersonal, oral and written communication skills
Post-secondary education in a relevant discipline or equivalent work experience

Attributes

PAS or comparable production accounting system knowledge
Able to multitask effectively
Critical eye for detail
Have excellent time management, task planning and prioritization skills
Able to adapt quickly to changing requirements
Able to work effectively with minimal supervision
Ability to build strong relationships with team member
Excellent written and oral communications in English

Nice to Have

Experience working in an Agile Development environment
Formal training and/or designation related to Business Analysis and/or Project Management
CAPPA designation

What you do at AMD changes everything
At AMD, we push the boundaries of what is possible. We believe in changing the world for the better by driving innovation in high-performance computing, graphics, and visualization technologies – building blocks for gaming, immersive platforms, and the data center.
Developing great technology takes more than talent: it takes amazing people who understand collaboration, respect, and who will go the “extra mile” to achieve unthinkable results. It takes people who have the passion and desire to disrupt the status quo, push boundaries, deliver innovation, and change the world. If you have this type of passion, we invite you to take a look at the opportunities available to come join our team.


Business Analyst – Software Project Management Team (Machine Learning)

AMD is seeking a business analyst to assume a key role in software project management for our machine learning software engineering team. This role will involve:
Creation, management, and administration of tools and data for project management, resource management, Machine Learning Software Engineering operations
Operations management duties including general reporting and budgeting
Creating and maintaining processes and standards for project management and operations

You will have an opportunity to:
Be involved in day-to-day activities on creation and administration of project management models and tools with the purpose of tracking and reporting on enterprise resources, projects, project tasks, resource planning, budget planning, collecting actuals, and reporting.
Be responsible for budgeting and cost tracking for the machine learning software engineering team.
Contribute to the development of best practices in a growing project management team by developing and maintaining project management templates and documentation, operational data and reports, as well as metrics related to execution of Machine Learning Software Engineering project, within a dynamic environment and with an Agile mindset.
Interact with software management, development and validation teams, business units and other program and resource management functions across departments, including corporate reporting and budgeting teams.
Be engaged in reporting on project management activities, resource and budget status to executive management as a strategic tool in keeping implementers and decision makers moving toward consistent, business or mission-focused goals and objectives.

The successful candidate will have an advanced knowledge of business analysis and project management principles, excellent working skills with the entire range of MS Office products, especially Excel, experience with MS Project client and server, and a flexible and Agile mindset to thrive in a dynamic environment.

Project management background/interest

Financial Business Analyst

Cooke is a global seafood company with operations in North America, Europe, and South America. Our company’s success is driven by our dynamic, highly-skilled and innovative management team, supported by dedicated employees who live in coastal communities and contribute to the local area’s economy and sense of community.

The Role:

As a result of our robust growth we are seeking a Financial Business Analyst for our Seawater Office in Blacks Harbour, NB. You will lead the forecasting process, working with management employees from our seawater operations to streamline the periodic forecasting and modelling process. You will prepare fixed asset budgeting, update projections and aide with the consolidation of information for senior executive. You will support the overall Financial Planning and Analysis (FP&A) function for the seawater group of companies. Additionally, you will be required to perform cost of production and key performance indicator analysis and will be assigned to specific projects as required.

You will have a minimum of 3 years of financial analysis experience, a professional designation considered an asset, and have finely tuned organizational and detail management skills.

The successful candidate will be a self-starter that thrives in a very dynamic work and data driven environment and will be proficient with Excel.

The Opportunity:

The role description is just one part of the story. This is an opportunity to grow, to stretch, to work within the parameters of the role but stretch to your fullest potential. We are a team that counts performance, we reward contribution and we recognize talent. It is about being at the center of the fastest growing company in New Brunswick and knowing you are part of that growth. The ability to bring your passion for learning, desire for growth, and energy for moving your career forward is what we offer.

The Why:

Why Cooke…simple because we are a company that rewards initiative, resourcefulness and work ethic. We will champion your growth and provide you with the platform to create your path, your career, and your future.

job_title: Intermediate / Senior Business Analyst, SAP Solutions
job_description:
PermanentCGI is the World’s 5th largest independent IT and business process services company. We provide high-end business and IT Consulting, Systems Integration and IT & Business Management services. CGI has over 100+ IP-based business solutions in 40 countries spanning Financial Services, Government, Healthcare, Manufacturing, Retail, Telecommunications, Utilities and Oil & Gas. We are a proven and demonstrated success, achieving an industry-leading track record of on-time, on-budget projects and innovative solutions.

This is a great opportunity to become an employee of CGI, based in Edmonton, to provide leading business and information technology consulting services to guide our client through their major business changes.

If you are an experienced business consultant (or equivalent professional) with an entrepreneurial spirit and a passion for creating outstanding business results for clients, then CGI may be the place for you. We are looking for confident Intermediate to Senior Business Systems Analysts who have a deep understanding of how organizations function, perform and change, with broad skills in gathering and analyzing data, analyzing and solving complex business problems, writing and presenting, facilitating and coaching. Grounded in business, you are also fluent in technology – able to assess a client’s current technical environment and develop technology requirements and conceptual solutions to meet business objectives. You are comfortable working with all levels of client organizations – from the executive suite to the front line.
Build your career with us.

It is an extraordinary time to be in business. As digital transformation continues to accelerate, CGI is at the center of this change—supporting our clients’ digital journeys and offering our professionals exciting career opportunities.

At CGI, our success comes from the talent and commitment of our professionals. As one team, we share the challenges and rewards that come from growing our company, which reinforces our culture of ownership. All of our professionals benefit from the value we collectively create.

Be part of building one of the largest independent technology and business services firms in the world.

Learn more about CGI at www.cgi.com.

No unsolicited agency referrals please.

CGI is an equal opportunity employer. In addition, CGI is committed to providing accommodations for people with disabilities in accordance with provincial legislation. Please let us know if you require a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during any aspect of the recruitment process and we will work with you to address your needs.
Your future duties and responsibilities

Liaison between information technology teams and business teams
Identify, validate, and prioritize clients’ business needs and requirements
Participate in and/or lead requirements workshops/JAD sessions to identify business needs and requirements
Document current business processes, business flows, rules and artifacts, and propose business processes, business flows, rules and artifacts
Produce detailed requirements documents and requirements traceability matrices
Review and analyze existing application effectiveness and efficiency
Develop strategies for improving and leveraging systems
Create and execute thorough test plans

Required qualifications to be successful in this role

5 or more years of progressive experience as a Business Systems Analyst in related Information Technology / Information Systems environments
Experience documenting business rules, data models, business cases and business case summaries
Experience with business process re-engineering and business process modeling
Experience facilitating workshops and JAD sessions
Experience with SAP solutions
Excellent oral and written communication skills
Post-secondary education in relevant discipline or equivalent work experience

Attributes:

Communicates ideas in both technical and user-friendly language
Excellent listener with strong interpersonal skills
Self-motivated and directed
Excels in a high-pressure and fast paced environment
Quick learner
Problem solver
Team player

Nice to Have:

Relevant certifications or training such as IIBA or PMP
Experience using COBIT and/or ITIL

#LI-AM1

Licensing Analyst
Your passion is striving for Operational Excellence!
The role as a Licensing Analyst is responsible for the integrity and accuracy of Softchoice database systems. The Analyst will maintain service level agreements and deliver accurate information to various business units. This individual is responsible for compiling data and carrying out statistical analyses to evaluate data quality and deliver accurate information to various business units.
Reporting to the Director, Licensing Operations, this incumbent will have accountability for internal reporting to support our partner programs and incentives. You will oversee best practices related to reporting, reconciliation and analysis of monthly performance files. Your understanding of the Microsoft program and incentive policies will allow you to provide guidance with operational execution.
We are looking for someone that can contextualize strategic vision, with the learning agility to think nimbly, communicate and co-ordinate cross-functionally and find creative solutions.
Your mission as the Licensing Analyst for the Licensing Group at Softchoice will focus on:
Establishing, maintaining, and executing licensing policies and workflow management. You will proactively manage the integrity and accuracy of the licensing database. You will be responsible for managing the policies that govern Softchoice’s licensing data including acquisition of data, transformation, and handoff to downstream systems to ensure compliance, through a high focus on innovation and data analytics.
Responsibilities will include in-taking business needs to identify variances or gaps, identifying inherent/ residual risk(s) to drive department automation and most importantly, supporting the Director with business transformation initiatives for scalable growth and increased profitability.
We’re looking for an incumbent who will be responsible for:
1. Data Quality and Reporting
Assist in establishing policies and procedures to ensure licensing data meets defined quality targets.
Establish data policies and procedures to ensure data meets or exceeds quality metrics as defined in the Licensing Scorecard.
Work with stakeholders, especially IT and the SFDC Team, to inform and drive system improvements to increase data integrity.
Work closely with IT to help maintain/develop/refine the data model to ensure it meets business needs.
Creation of reports and dashboards that provide the data necessary to measure business performance and analyze trends.
Understanding and analyzing changes of new incentive programs to determine impact to current business performance.
2. Analytics and Process Management
Assist in defining key performance indicator (KPIs) for all licensing data parameters, and build/maintain relevant dashboards.
Assist the licensing teams in the creation of business rules, data structures and entities to maximize automation and increase accuracy rate.
Proactively identify data issues, perform root cause analysis and provide recommendation to drive data issue resolution.
Maintain changes to data process maps, document new processes and support ongoing audit requirements.
3. Project Management
Work with cross-functional teams to deliver process improvement projects.
Management of project plan(s) for all ongoing projects within the Licensing Operations Team.
Act as a subject matter expert and support corporate projects to ensure that processes meet corporate data policies and procedures best practices.
As our ideal candidate you’ll also have:
Post-Secondary Degree (BA in Economics, Finance, or Business OR BSc in Engineering, Computer Science, Statistics, or Mathematics)
1+ years of experience in business analytics or business operations
Excellent interpersonal skills with strong orientation towards high energy teams based work environments
Strong written and verbal communication skills and the ability to interact professionally with senior management and other business units
Self-driven, motivated to excel, ability to work with minimal supervision, and maintain productivity
Strong sense of internal customer and the importance of the voice of customer
Knowledge of SQL or Python required.
How Do We Hire Great People?
We believe in matching the right people for the right role. Once you’ve applied for a position, our team of Talent Advisors will review your resume and application against all open roles at Softchoice. We also keep in mind any future or upcoming roles you may be a fit for. As part of our selection, onboarding and development process, we utilize tools to help us better match candidates with our roles.
Applying for a role at Softchoice is not complete until you have completed both the formal online application and the Predictive Index tool (PI). Completing the PI tool will take no more than 10 minutes of your time.

If we see a match with your skills and our open roles, we will reach out to you to schedule time to talk so that we can learn more about you and you can learn about us. Only those candidates selected for further consideration will be contacted directly. However, we will retain your application on file and would be pleased to contact you if further opportunities arise.
Need more convincing this is the right next step in your career? Here are the reasons why folks love working here!
Softchoice has been recognized as a Best Workplace in Canada by the Great Place to Work Institute for 13 consecutive years
Softchoice certified as a Great Place to Work in the United States (2016)
Meaningful work that drives professional development
Ability to enter and grow within the technology industry
Being part of a winning, high performance team
Every employee gets two paid volunteer days per year
We serve large and mid-sized clients from a variety of industries
We’ve raised over $2 Million through our staff-run charity Softchoice Cares
1 in 5 employees have invested in an ownership position in Softchoice
About Softchoice
Softchoice is one of the largest IT solutions and Managed Services providers in North America! We are an influential, growth-oriented organization determined to enable our people, our clients, our partners and the communities we serve to realize their potential. Our unique culture fosters a friendly, open-minded workplace where employees are encouraged to bring their whole selves to work. As a member of a dynamic, high-performing team, each Softchoice employee is hungry to learn, valued for their contribution, and approaches each day excited to make an impact.
We would like to thank you personally for applying to Softchoice.

Please note that we will review your application and only those candidates selected for further consideration will be contacted directly. However, we will retain your application on file and would be pleased to contact you if further opportunities arise.
Again, thank you for your interest in a career at Softchoice!Note: Completion of a satisfactory criminal record check, education verification and reference checks are required prior to employment.

AccommodationSoftchoice is proud to provide employment accommodation during the recruitment process. Should you require any accommodations, please let us know in your application or reach out to asktalentacquisition@softchoice.com and we will work with you to meet your accessibility needs.

Job Description
Aon is looking for a Business Analyst (10 months contract, with potential to getting extended or converted to Perm)

As part of an industry-leading team, you will help empower results for our clients by delivering innovative and effective solutions as part of our business group within Aon Risk Solutions, in Toronto, ON. As a Business Analyst, you will report directly to the Operations Director.

Your impact as a Business Analyst

Job Responsibilities:
Support project in acting as key liaison between the business and our Information Technology (IT) team
Support industry research activities
Work with stakeholders from across the organization to gather requirements
Perform data and operational analysis utilizing Excel and other reporting tools
Take ownership of projects: create and maintain project timelines, ensure project milestones are met on time, verify that all project deliverables are of the highest quality, and keep team members informed on status and changes in project requirements and deliverables
Coordinate activities for larger scale projects: creating and maintaining key project documents, supporting issues management, drafting project communications, etc.
Document processes, recognize opportunities for continuous improvement; suggest solutions to the team, and step-up to take on tasks to improve processes
Assist with building and execution of UAT test cases
Support development of training materials and training delivery
Coordinate with external vendors as required
Coordinate Operations activities to support the rollout of technology, training coordination, training documentation, UAT, communication

You Bring Knowledge and Expertise

Required Experience:

A minimum of 3-5 years’ related experience ideally within the P&C insurance industry
Customer focused committed to process improvement
Experience in Project streamlining, redesigning, mapping.
Exp in small or big projects.
Strong presentation skills
Ability to work well under pressure within deadlines
Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal
Proficiency in various software applications, including Microsoft Office and Visio and strong knowledge of project management methodologies and tools
Knowledge of project management practices, procedures and principles
Ability to communicate complex ideas in a clear, concise manner across functional and technical departments.
The successful candidate must be able to think quickly, be strategic and be able to interact with a variety of people with the organization and adapt their style to different personalities.
Ability to work with minimal supervision and manage multiple tasks and priorities
Candidate must be energetic, driven and committed to project success while working under tight time constraints and pressure.
Education:
A university degree is preferred or equivalent work experience
Business Analysis course work preferred
Project Management Professional (PMP) certification an asset, or working towards
Project management experience is an asset
Experience in meeting, workshop or classroom facilitation

Locations:
This role will be based in Toronto
Will periodically require travel
We offer you

A competitive total rewards package, continuing education & training, and tremendous potential with a growing worldwide organization.

Our Colleague Experience:

From helping clients gain access to capital after natural disasters, to creating access to health care and retirement for millions, Aon colleagues empower results for our clients, communities, and each other every day. They make a difference, work with the best, own their potential, and value one another. This is the Aon Colleague Experience, defining what it means to work at Aon and realizing our vision of empowering human and economic possibility. To learn more visit Aon Colleague Experience.

About Aon:
Aon plc (NYSE:AON) is a leading global professional services firm providing a broad range of risk, retirement and health solutions. Our 50,000 colleagues in 120 countries empower results for clients by using proprietary data and analytics to deliver insights that reduce volatility and improve performance.

By applying for a position with Aon, you understand that, should you be made an offer, it will be contingent on your undergoing and successfully completing a background check consistent with Aon's employment policies. Background checks may include some or all of the following based on the nature of the position: SSN/SIN validation, education verification, employment verification, and criminal check, search against global sanctions and government watch lists, fingerprint verification, credit check, and/or drug test. You will be notified during the hiring process which checks are required by the position.

Aon is committed to a diverse workforce as an Employment Equity employer (Women, People with Disabilities, Aboriginal Peoples, and Visible Minorities).

Nothing in this job description restricts management's right to assign or reassign duties and responsibilities to this job at any time.

At Sun Life, we work together, share common values and encourage growth and achievement. We offer many career paths that attract a wide variety of talent and skills. Follow a path that lets your talents shine.
Job Description:This role is dependent upon a Canadian enhanced reliability security clearance, which requires minimum 5-year Canadian history review by the RCMP.
The candidate will be a member of the SQL Server Client team within Data Management Services (DMS). The primary role on the team will be as a SQL Server Database Administrator supporting various client applications, but the individual may be asked to take on additional duties including infrastructure support and training on various emerging technologies related to Business Intelligence and Big Data solutions. The team has members in Canada, the US and India supporting a wide range of distributed and mainframe applications across many continents. The core hours for this position are 08:00 – 16:30 but are flexible within a range as long as there is proper coverage within the team. All team members must have the ability to handle 7X24 rotational on-call duties, after hour change support and disaster recovery support (will require cell phone, laptop and guaranteed coverage from home). To ensure proper training and support for this position, the candidate's desk space should be in close proximity to the rest of the DMS team members in the designated location.
Main Accountabilities can include:
Administrative support of SQL Server versions 2005, 2008, 2012, 2014 and 2016 including: Database Engine, Integration Services (DTS, SSIS), Analysis Services (SSAS) and Reporting Services (SSRS)
Infrastructure support of SQL Server versions 2005, 2008, 2012, 2014 and 2016 including: server/instance installs (stand-alone and clustered), service-pack upgrades, hot fixes, client tool installs, readiness programs, new feature exploitation, research and development (as needed by Infrastructure manager)
Support of application and database upgrades from existing SQL versions to, SQL2012, SQL2014, SQL2016 and future supported releases
Pro-active and reactive performance analysis, monitoring, troubleshooting and resolution of issues
Migration of database objects from development through production following documented standards, policies and procedures (Change Management Process)
Monitoring and support of nightly production batch cycles
Organizing and monitoring personal workload and escalating to manager when issues arise
Regular review of database maintenance and performance improvement procedures
Ensuring the proper setup and validation of backup and restore processes
Participation in a rotational on-call schedule
Occasional participation in after-hours and weekend support of production implementations, infrastructure activities, and various disaster recovery exercises
Regular database capacity planning related to database growth and system utilization; trend analysis
Working closely with other team members, technical/team leads, management, specialized IT areas and application support teams to ensure consistent delivery and quality of database services
Helping define, document and implement consistent standards and procedures across the team
Support of PowerShell, T-SQL stored procedures and functions to support internal processes and improve system performance
Maintaining up-to-date documentation and procedures for all supported applications and environments
Managing medium to large projects and participating in a variety of projects through the entire project lifecycle
Maintaining 99.99% availability for all production environments
Assisting clients with various issues related to connectivity, permissions, access
Evaluation of functionality and features with newer versions of the SQL Server DBMS
Sharing ideas for process improvement and innovative solutions to known problems
Qualification & Work Experience:
BE / B Tech /MCA / M Tech / Proven administration/analyst skills preferably with a degree in Computer Science or related technology degree/diploma, or equivalent experience
3 to 5 years of SQL Server database administration experience handling medium to large databases
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Experience with the Microsoft BI stack
Experience with on-call support and trouble-shooting
Strong T-SQL skills that include a thorough understanding of system tables, stored procedures, functions, triggers, and SQL tuning
SQL Server 2008, 2012, 2014 or 2016 certification (optional)
Hands-on experience with SQL Server installations and patching
Strong knowledge of SQL Server database tuning using Profiler, Index Tuning Wizard, Dynamic Management Views and Functions (DMVs), and other third-party tools
Strong knowledge of SQL Server Management Studio and Business Intelligence Development Studio
Strong knowledge of SQL Server database backup and recovery strategies
Strong knowledge of SQL Server replication, mirroring, log shipping, maintenance plans and DR recovery strategies
Experience with Sybase Power Designer
Experience with Redgate SQL Backup tools
Knowledge of data-mapping and logical and physical data modeling
Strong organizational skills with the ability to handle several tasks efficiently
The Base Pay range is for the primary location for which the job is posted. It may vary depending on the work location of the successful candidate or other factors. In addition to Base Pay, eligible Sun Life employees participate in various incentive plans, payment under which is discretionary and subject to individual and company performance. Certain sales focused roles have sales incentive plans based on individual or group sales results.
Diversity and inclusion have always been at the core of our values at Sun Life. A diverse workforce with wide perspectives and creative ideas benefits our clients, the communities where we operate and all of us as colleagues. We welcome applications from qualified individuals from all backgrounds.
Persons with disabilities who need accommodation in the application process or those needing job postings in an alternative format may e-mail a request to thebrightside@sunlife.com.
We thank all applicants for showing an interest in this position. Only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

Role Summary:
The Senior Business Solutions Analyst will play a pivotal role to ensure that the Information Technology team fully understands the strategies, objectives and detailed requirements from business stakeholders to provide technical solutions. This role will ensure that applications developed or maintained adhere to the requirements of the business and technology/quality standards. The Business Solutions Analyst will implement and maintain a set of standard practices and processes to guide how business applications are developed, managed, improved, and, when necessary, retire (application lifecycle management).

You will:
Applies business analysis methodology to elicit, analyze, specify, and validate the business needs from key stakeholders
Performs business analysis planning to outline the tasks and deliverables needed for the project and estimate the time required including the time of the business stakeholders involved. Considers:
Critical project characteristics such as the size of the project, the business risks involved, the number of interfaces the project will include
The processes that need to be adhered to for the project
The project methodology being used for the project, project roles and responsibilities, and what deliverables are required
Plays a pivotal role in ensuring IT’s understanding of business requirements
Thoroughly document and maintain business requirements
Applies business process design methodology to document business processes, analyze issues and opportunities for improvement, identify process performance targets, and redesign business processes, including cost-benefit and return on investment (ROI) analyses for proposed changes to aid management in making implementation decisions
Assists in Integration and Acceptance Testing, develops testing scripts/plans, supports the development of training and implementation material and works with the Solutions Delivery Team to coordinate implementation
Ensures the traceability of requirements through each stage of the requirements gathering process, mapping requirements corresponding functions in the solution
Works on multiple concurrent project types including: Cloud-Based solutions, custom development, and enhancements/support
Takes an enterprise view in recommending solutions that benefit the whole company, not just a specific business area
Contributes to managing the business relationship
Ensure corporate data is secured in accordance with IT security policies
Ensures appropriate technical documentation is created and maintained
Identify opportunities, risk and constraints for IT to enhance the business
Maintain a good understanding of the organization’s business units’ functions and processes

You have:
EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE REQUIREMENTS:
Post-secondary education in the field of Business Administration, Finance or Information Systems
Minimum 5 years in Business Analysis
Knowledge of the property management industry and core business process and operations is an asset
Experience in conducting interviews and facilitating workshops to gather user requirements via workshops, questionnaires, surveys, site visits, workflow storyboards, use cases, scenarios and other methods
Proven experience with business and technical requirements analysis, business process modeling/mapping, methodology development, and data modeling
Extensive practical knowledge in importing data for use in report software, spreadsheets, graphs, and flowcharts
Good technical knowledge of common programming languages
Good knowledge of application and network security best practices
Working knowledge of network and Windows operating systems
Working knowledge of network hardware, protocols, and standards
Excellent knowledge of Microsoft Office including Visio
Knowledge of ITIL Framework
Knowledge of project development methodologies including Agile
Solid knowledge on digital products including e-commerce, web and mobile
Experience in Master Data Management solution and Customer Loyalty program in retail space

CORE COMPETENCIES AND SKILLS:
Able to exercise independent judgment and take action on it
Excellent analytical, mathematical, and creative problem-solving skills
Excellent listening, interpersonal, written, and oral communication skills
Logical and efficient, with keen attention to detail
Ability to effectively prioritize and execute tasks while under pressure
Strong customer service orientation
Experience working in a team-oriented, collaborative environment

Responsibilities
Performs all general cost accounting and budgeting activities for an assigned operational group, including handling and scheduling a variety of financial activities within strict guidelines and in accordance with applicable policies and procedures as established by Business Leader - Finance, Accounting Manager and/or Corporate Finance. Accesses privileged and confidential information as required to perform assigned duties.
Coordinates and develops operational unit budgets, in association with Business Leaders and Managers, including:
assembling and analyzing historical cost and activity data necessary to prepare budget projections for discussion and approval;
making adjustments for reasonableness, supported with justification as required, based on historical, current and projected financial operating environment;
coordinating and preparing justifications for a variety of budget items such as operating and maintenance items, medium and long range capital expenditure forecasts and future business programs.
Prepares regular performance and variance reviews, in associations with Business Leaders and Managers, including participating in the analysis of activities, unit costs and program expenditures to explain variances and recommend remedial action; and to coordinate the preparation of year end forecasts.
Maintains a current knowledge of applicable accounting and financial systems, policies, coding and procedures. Advises the operational group regarding application of accounting and financial procedures to aid in the understanding and effective use of financial reports and other activity related information.
Participates in the development of recommendations to enhance or establish financial policies and procedures, reporting forms and formats and related issues.
Prepares, sets up and reviews work orders and other job costing system entries, journal vouchers and relevant financial reports for accuracy, justifiability and completeness as necessary
Conducts research and special analyses related to operational unit activities, unit costs and programs, including:
preparing ad-hoc reports for rate applications, regulatory studies and other special studies as required;
maintaining statistical databases and financial spreadsheets, summarizing information in appropriate presentation format.
preparing and presenting written, graphical and oral reports and presentations to facilitate the preparation and understanding of budgets, variance reviews, costing analyses and other special projects, including recommending courses of action as appropriate.
Participates in the development of financial and other management information systems including:
providing user input regarding system, information and reporting requirements;
testing modifications and/or enhancements;
conducting training sessions for the operational group as required.
Performs a variety of related duties such as local purchasing, fleet and facilities management and similar support duties as appropriate to assigned operational areas.
Performs duties of a minor nature related to the above duties which do not affect the rating of the job.

Requirements
Completion of third level of a recognized accounting program, such as CGA or CMA, or equivalent.
Demonstrated organizational, oral and written communication and presentation skills.
Demonstrated ability to work effectively both independently and in teams.
Working knowledge of statistical analysis, cost benefit analysis and related analytical techniques.
Basic knowledge of computer systems operations, environment peripherals. Sound working knowledge of financial, work management, accounting, spreadsheet, and specialized software in use in the department.
Three years directly related, relevant experience.
Valid British Columbia drivers licence.

job_title: Business Analyst, Enterprise Data Program (12 month contract)
job_description:
TemporaryBusiness Analyst, Enterprise Data Program (12 month contract)
The opportunity
As a Business Analyst, you will be passionate about implementation, support and improvements of data systems that enable corporate functions such as market & credit risk, collateral and liquidity, capital markets trading and portfolio management, private capital, performance measurement and regulatory compliance.
You will play a key role underlying all initiative delivery. Your responsibility is to understand, document and facilitate agreement on requirements, approaches, specifications and decision variables that enable the delivery of appropriate solutions to achieve the business and project goals.
Who you'll work with
You will be joining the Business Analyst team. In this dynamic role, teamwork will be the key to your success, working with other solution teams including: Relationship & Application Management, Project Management, Solutions Engineering, external vendor consultants and QA on a dynamic portfolio of initiatives that encompasses production support, small & medium improvements and projects. The ultimate goal is to deliver on business needs and provide customer value.
Additionally, the Business Analyst elicits client needs for information and functional capabilities. You will document requirements, develop functional specifications and ensure requirements traceability as part of delivering application and information solutions to internal business partners.
What you'll do
Engage business clients to elicit business requirements and understand objectives
Produce business analysis related documentation, including (functional and non-functional) requirements, current and future state processes and workflows, and solution specifications to a high quality standard
Produce business requirements for data, identify data sources and deliver data specifications
Work with data vendor manager to establish agreements for new external vendor content
Document the flow and transformation of data from suppliers through data repositories and to end user datamarts/applications
Work with business and solution teams to ensure that solutions being delivered meet business intent and provide business value
Work with QA teams to develop test plans and ensure they understand the business requirements and are able to test solutions appropriately
Engage business clients and oversee User Acceptance Testing
Reference and apply our internal Delivery Framework in the context of delivering of business analysis functions and materials
Participate in the initiation and planning of projects - including facilitating the definition of objectives, scope, and WBS as well as provide work estimates
Provide coaching, professional guidance and support to Business Analyst peers and co-ops, as required, to foster professional development
Contribute to the operation and improvement of the delivery team
Exercise appropriate judgment in identifying and calling out risks and issues
Build proven partnerships with Business management and staff, Client Relationship and Application Managers, Project Managers and other key partners.
What you'll need
University degree or equivalent experience (Business/Finance, Financial Mathematics, Computer Science, Engineering)
Having additional certifications such as CFA, Certified Enterprise Data Professional, Certified Business Analysis Professional, Process improvement methodology accreditation or Accounting certification would be an asset
Minimum 4 years’ experience for business analysis in the institutional investment industry
Solid understanding of various asset classes including Equities, Fixed Income, Options, Futures, FX and Swaps
Ability to prioritize, coordinate and complete tasks to meet deadlines
Superb communication skills (written and verbal)
Ability to work independently and in a team environment, collaborating effectively with business, delivery and technology partners
Experience collaborating with project delivery and technology teams to deliver solutions that tackle business problems and meet business requirements
Experience in translating business requirements to technical specifications
Ability to build and maintain strong working relationships with multiple levels of clients, team and partners
Robust understanding of agile and waterfall project management delivery methodologies and the difference between needs and wants
Enthusiastic customer service focus
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills
Experience in planning and leading UAT
Experience with the following technologies (in order of priority) is an asset: PL/SQL, MS SQL Server Databases, Bloomberg, Markit EDM (Cadis), SimCorp Dimension, Charles River Development, Findur, Oracle EDQ (Datanomic), PowerBI
What we're offering
Pay for performance environment that offers competitive salary and incentives
Numerous opportunities for professional growth and development
Guaranteed retirement income through a defined benefit pension plan
Discount programs including Edvantage and Perkopolis

Works closely with operations managers to understand their business needs and performance issues, supports the preparation of Capital Project Proposals and operational project business cases and justifications, participates in the design, development, and maintenance of the operating and capital budget/forecast information system, prepares various reports, analysis, and recommendations and participates in special projects as assigned.

KEY ACCOUNTABILITIES

Provides technical expertise and decision support resources for the development and reporting of the annual operating and capital budgets and quarterly expenditure forecasts including examining the relationship between cost and performance variables and identifying underlying issues and key cost drivers within the business operations.
Works with operations managers to understand their business needs and performance issues and to support them in utilizing financial information to make prudent business decisions.
Supports the preparation of Capital Project Proposals and operational project business cases and justifications.
Participates in the design, development, and maintenance of the operating and capital budget/forecast information system.
Prepares various reports, in-depth analysis and recommendations for senior management decision making.
Participates in special projects as assigned by the Manager and provides operational business knowledge and liaison support to the Vice President and Director, as required.

Clearly identify impacts of changes
