Ability to work well in a fast paced team environment
Ability to write high quality product documentation, specifications, use cases and test cases

Excellent written and verbal communications skills and ability to perform product training sessions for internal and external customers

If you're looking for a workplace where employees are passionate about their work environment, then read on. What sets Equitable Bank apart from other companies is its culture. We celebrate and embrace the fabric of diversity, the employee engagement process and collectively take pride in our business successes. Our commitment to our customers, our partners and our employees creates a stimulating and exciting atmosphere that generates innovative products and outstanding service quality.

Equitable Bank is Canada's ninth largest independent Schedule I bank, serving Canadians coast to coast. It offers a diverse suite of residential lending, commercial lending and savings solutions, including high-interest savings products and GICs. Through its proven branchless approach and customer service focus, Equitable Bank has grown to approximately $25 billion in assets under management. Most recently, Equitable Bank launched a digital banking operation, EQ Bank, and introduced the EQ Bank Savings Plus Account. Equitable Bank currently employs over 600 employees across the country.

Within Equitable Bank's Core Lending business, Single Family Lending Services funds mortgages for owner-occupied and investment properties across Canada, while Commercial Lending Services provides mortgages on a variety of commercial properties on a national basis.Equitable's Securitization Financing business originates and securitizes insured residential mortgages under the Canada Mortgage and Housing ("CMHC") administered National Housing Act.Equitable Bank also offers a range of deposit products including short-term, long-term and Cashable GICs, available in non-registered or Tax Free Savings Account ("TFSA") across Canada. And it offers a High Interest Savings Account, available from authorized investment advisors through the FundServ network.

Equitable Bank is a growing Canadian financial services business and a wholly owned subsidiary of Equitable Group. It was founded in 1970 as The Equitable Trust Company.

Job Title: Senior Business Analyst
Department: Tech Delivery - Enterprise
Reports To: Manager, Technology

Purpose of Job

The Senior Business Analyst (BA) will facilitate the identification and documentation of detailed user stories (functional requirements), process and system flows and contribute to the overall user experience, technical solution, and acceptance criteria for the company’s core banking platforms and interfacing applications. The BA will facilitate communication between the business and IT, soliciting input and expertise from business subject matter experts and technology teams. The BA will support testing phases as well as assist with project implementation. The scope of most initiatives includes multiple business stakeholders, and downstream systems and vendors. The BA will be a core member within a cross-functional Pod that deliver initiatives using EQB’s hybrid-agile methodology and tools. The BA will work with stakeholder groups across Product Management, Operations, Fraud, AML, and multiple Technology teams and suppliers. EQB is using the latest suite of Atlassian tools (JIRA, Confluence, and add-ons) for capturing epics, user stories, flows, technical design documents, testing, and sprint-based execution.

Main Activities:

Establish a plan for stakeholder workshops to capture and elaborate detailed user stories, by bundles of Themes and Epics.
Facilitate workshops to document customer / user needs, process / system flows, and end to end requirements as detailed user stories. User Stories will include key areas such as happy path experiences, alt/error flows, spec-by-example, acceptance criteria, and business value.
With cross-functional Pod and external supplier support, decompose user story and experience requirements by supplier. Establish and maintain traceability form the Bank’s overarching requirements to each supplier.
Drive and ensure sign-off of BA created artefacts across the Pod team and stakeholders.
Support cross-functional Pod and to create technical design documents, create acceptance criteria and testing artefacts, and story point estimation (where applicable).
Support ad hoc business and technical analysis requests to support main activities as required, such as API data maps.
Support daily stand-ups and project velocity reporting as required (ex: pace of writing & approving detailed user stories).
Work with Quality Assurance team by providing input into the test strategy, test scenarios, test data requirements and supporting user validation
Communicate changes to the requirements effectively and on a timely basis to delivery leads, project managers and other necessary stakeholders

Knowledge/Skill Requirements:

5 or more years of experience in delivering technology projects in a Business Analyst capacity or related role participating on full lifecycle project implementations
Deep understanding of Software Development Life Cycle concepts.
Experience with both waterfall and agile methodologies.
Business domain knowledge in Canadian Lending - Residential or Commercial, Term Deposits or Accounting and Finance is mandatory.
Good understanding of Compliance (FCAC) and Regulatory (OSFI, CDIC) regulations and policies
Extensive experience in web interface analysis and mapping documentation.
Good understanding of technology such as: online channels, real-time APIs, data storage / data bases, data domain models, UML, data mapping.
Proficient user of all Microsoft tools; Knowledgeable with Atlassian suite (JIRA & Confluence).
Post-Secondary education, preferably in Technology related fields
Additional desirable skills include:
Experience with OneSumX
Experience with mortgageHUB
Experience with Portfolio Plus

Nomis is seeking a high calibre Business Analyst to serve our growing client base of retail banks in the US, Canada and worldwide, in the area of pricing optimization of their lending portfolios. You will contribute to our client pricing engagements from "kick-off to go-live", including business consulting, requirements gathering, analytical and technical solution design, data pipeline configuration and statistical modelling, testing and validation, user training, and supporting customer adoption and insight generation as they "put rates in market" leveraging our proprietary software. We are seeking a candidate to work from our Toronto or San Francisco Bay Area offices.

Who We Are & What We Build

We partner with Banks and FinTechs on their journey to best-in-class pricing technology and analytics so that they deliver more value to their customers, employees and shareholders. Our top-notch people, proven technology, and innovative analytics are tackling big data challenges at banks and lenders every day. We deliver market-leading cloud-based Pricing & Profitability Management solutions and insights for the Banking & Financial Services industry leveraging cutting-edge behavioral data science. We are a Blue Chip venture-backed company with the vision to transform the consumer banking landscape.

Who You Are

Intensely curious, collaborative, structured and detail-oriented, you are a strong and credible client-facing business consultant and project manager, as well as an experienced hands-on data analyst and model builder. You are equally comfortable thinking through and communicating the big picture and the technical/analytical details. You have a keen understanding of financial services and have a demonstrable track record of translating business user needs into transformational analytical solutions that yield real business value. You have experience and skill working and effectively communicating with a wide variety of business and technical stakeholders (both vendor and client side).

Responsibilities

Consulting


Elicit business requirements from clients in a structured, collaborative way and translate into analytical/technical solution design.
Coordinate project teams (including vendor and client stakeholders) to keep projects on-time and on-budget, with high quality and customer satisfaction/retention.
Create and deliver impactful presentations to influence clients and facilitate team communications
Communicate pricing recommendations clearly, concisely and confidently to clients

Data & Analytics


Develop data pipeline and modelling specifications based on customer requirements.
Build, adapt and validate data pipeline and customer response models leveraging strong SQL, R, and Excel skills.
Develop expertise regarding the Nomis Price Optimizer (NPO) and its various analytical and technical components; apply this expertise to effective and efficient solution design and configuration based on a given bank's requirements.

Solution Design


Design and implement A|B test programs to prove product and pricing recommendations in market
Collaborate with internal teams to translate requirements into solution design, modelling plan and execution, software configuration, and timelines
Design and develop Tableau dashboards and reports that drive informed business decisions and measure performance
Identify insights, features, and enhancements to be productized by the development team

Desired Skills & Background


Bachelor's or Master's degree in a quantitative field
3+ years of experience in business and data analytics
Strong statistical skills and experience focused on business decision making and problem solving
Demonstrated skill and extended experience with R, SQL, Tableau, Excel, and PowerPoint
Exceptional problem solving skills, collaborative teamwork, intellectual horsepower, curiosity, initiative, and attention to detail
Strong communicator, persuasive presenter, fast on your feet, and innately organized
Ability to simplify complexity, in particular to communicate statistical and analytical concepts and findings to a wide range of business and technical audiences with appropriate levels of detail and emphasis
Sufficient interest and exposure to Java coding to engage with dedicated developers (be a good consumer of code)
Willingness to travel up to 30% of the time
Experience within banking and financial services sectors

Position Overview:
Jack of all trades, and master of many? In this newly created role, you bring a wealth of technical and business acumen to the table. Your reporting, research and analytical skills are second to none. This role is split into two parts – reporting and research and analysis.

In the Reporting portion (primary focus), you will create and maintain dashboards, board/steering committee presentations, SLA/KPI reports, Scorecards, SOX (Sarbanes Oxley Act) compliance dashboards and any other reporting required by the IT Group.

In the Research & Analysis portion (secondary focus), you will use your deep understanding of the IT realm to perform research and build business cases for Technology and Related projects.

And lastly, to keep the role dynamic, you will participate on special projects as required.
Key Responsibilities:
Create and maintain dashboards, board/steering committee presentations, SLA/KPI reports, SOX compliance reports, Scorecards and any other reporting required by the IT Group:
Gather required data from systems, vendors, and required sources in various formats (raw, formatted, etc.) in order to aggregate in a presentable manner
Setup a framework to allow for pulling and reporting data in the required cadence (daily, weekly, monthly, quarterly, etc.)
Setup process and policy to measure variances to agreed SLA’s, KPI’s
Adapt presentations based on audience level (e.g., board-level vs. department-level)
Revise/maintain SLA’s in partnership with the business
Other kinds of compliance reporting as required
Research and build Business Cases for Technology and related projects:
Research various solutions and create compelling business cases reviewing options in an unbiased manner
Create TCO and ROI models to support recommendations
Participate in evaluation of technology and value
Work independently, hands-on, and through others as needed
Work with various lines of business and stakeholders, ensuring all business requirements are captured
Stay abreast of new metrics for Governance (including SOX), KPI, SLA reporting for IT Organizations
Stay abreast of emerging technologies that would benefit the business
Assist in special projects, departmental invoicing, and perform other duties as required
Work with minimal supervision
In building business cases, you will gather requirements, create competitive analysis, solution comparison, RFPs, RFQs, and any other work required to complete the business case(s).
Education, Qualifications and Experience
A post-secondary education in Computer Science, Information Technology, Business Administration and/or relevant experience
Gathering, analyzing, documenting and reporting data related to IT internal control processes over financial reporting
Coordinating efforts across multiple IT functions and departments to ensure SOX compliance requirements are met within required deadlines
Responsible for identifying internal control deficiencies and ensuring the timely implementation of corrective actions
Sarbanes Oxley Compliance testing on IT controls and documentation
Significant interaction with key business process managers and IT management
Interaction with IT third-party vendors managing and/or supporting the company’s internal controls
Completing GAP assessments on IT controlled environments involving SOX Controls
Reviewing external service providers through SSAE18/SOC reports and Complimentary End User Controls
Performing deficiency assessments of SOX IT controls and preparing reporting
Reviewing and documenting with management exceptions identified during walkthroughs or testing of controls
Maintaining an inventory of all SOX IT deficiencies
Working with process owners to develop management action plans for SOX IT deficiencies, monitoring the status, and testing for completion by the due date
Supporting business partners with remediation activities of SOX deficiencies
Supporting Internal and External Audit testing of SOX IT controls
5+ years working in an IT Analyst role performing similar Responsibilities (preference given to candidates that are strong in the Reporting portion)
5+ years experience with creating executive-level presentations, dashboards, scorecards, and reports to various levels of an organization focused on IT
5+ years experience with enterprise reporting platforms (SSRS, Tableau, etc.)
5+ years hands-on experience with various application and technology stacks
Possess high organizational and planning skills
Works effectively and independently in a dynamic environment
Responsible, takes ownership of work, and follows through to completion

Able to learn new technologies quickly with minimal supervision, self-starter

Adapting to Change: Have the ability to anticipate change, is open to new ideas, processes, product lines, and technologies. Treat these changes as opportunities for learning. Communication: Demonstrates strong skills in all forms of communication; able to deliver convincing, knowledgeable and well-articulated written and verbal statements both internally and externally. Persuasive and skillful presenter, who encourages candid and open communication within the team.

PermanentUniversity Health Network (UHN) is looking for an experienced professional to fill the key role of Learning Management System Analyst in our Organization and Employee Development Department.
University Health Network (UHN) is Canada’s leading research hospital. UHN encompasses Toronto General Hospital, Toronto Western Hospital, Princess Margaret Cancer Centre, Toronto Rehabilitation Institute and the Michener Institute of Education at UHN. The breadth of research, the complexity of the cases treated, and the magnitude of its educational enterprise has made UHN a national and international resource for patient care, research and education. UHN consists of 16,000 employees, more than 1,200 physicians, 8,000+ students, and many volunteers. It is affiliated with the University of Toronto and educates thousands of healthcare professionals that work in Canada and around the world.
As a member of the UHN eLearning team, the Learning Management System Analyst acts as the global system administrator for the Learning Management System (LMS) to ensure that it meets the priority needs of UHN.
Responsibilities:
Maintain the smooth configuration, implementation and operation of the Learning Management System.
Remain current with the systems’ functionality and how it can best serve the organization’s current and future needs.

Act as the escalation landing point for all LMS end users, including learners, managers, supervisors, and training administrators.
Analyze stakeholders’ business processes and workflows and translate them into system functionality to help align organizational needs with existing system features.
Build simple and complex learning activity structures including ILT courses, curricula, learning plans, and configure eLearning content for upload.
Consult with stakeholders to determine reporting needs and analyze system capabilities to meet those needs.
Create, maintain and update reference materials for learners, administrators, managers, and other stakeholders to enable accurate and knowledgeable use of the LMS.

Bachelor’s degree or formal technical education in a related field.

Negotiating skills to build consensus on a common set of requirements from all stakeholders.
Innovative, analytical, and creative thinker who is comfortable researching, testing and deploying new solutions, and technologies.

Ability to work effectively with people at all levels of the organization as well as with vendors, IT and external stakeholders.
Strong customer service, consultation, and technical education skills required.

Main Purpose & Function
This position will provide an excellent opportunity for an individual to work amongst a highly-motivated parks planning team and enhance their research and planning experience in a large-scale parks and recreation context.

Set in Stanley Park at English Bay Beach, this position is located within the Park Board’s Mid-century Modern head office and works within the Park Board’s Planning and Research group. The successful candidate will contribute to the development and coordination of Reconciliation-focused local and city-wide planning studies, master plans, recreation facility planning and environment planning and projects, which guide the overall development and delivery of the Vancouver’s parks, recreation and natural systems.

Specific Duties & Responsibilities
Reporting to a Senior Park Planner, the Reconciliation Planning Analyst is responsible for the planning and research activities, data collection and logistics that support the planning, design and implementation of Vancouver’s parks and recreation services. The Planning Analyst’s detailed research, knowledge and skills supports the Reconciliation Planner in developing and implementing the Park Board's Reconciliation Strategy. This strategy represents a significant step in the Park Board's effort to resolve historical and complex political, social, economic, and cultural issues and relationships related to the Park Board and First Nations and Urban Aboriginal communities.

The Park Board's Reconciliation Strategy is a high profile policy platform that is the Park Board's strategic opportunity to improve the health and well-being of Aboriginal people and build relationships at the political, staff, and community level. The Reconciliation Strategy will influence the policy direction and actions of interconnected strategies, including the Stanley Park Comprehensive Plan, VanPlay (Parks and Recreation Services Master Plan), and other major projects and initiatives to ensure that these reflect the needs of urban Aboriginal communities and First Nations.

The Reconciliation Planning Analyst also assists in key communication pieces such as Board memos and reports (that are presented to Park Board Commissioners by senior staff), external correspondence, presentations for a variety of audiences, and public engagement processes. The Planning Analyst assists in managing external consultants, advises and develops studies, surveys, and monitoring and evaluation tools, prepares and delivers presentations to internal and external audiences and implements consultation plans.

The position will use their excellent relationship building skills to liaise with cross-departmental teams across the Park Board and the City of Vancouver, other levels of government, and external stakeholders including the non-profit sector.

Qualifications
Education and Experience
University degree in landscape architecture, planning or related discipline, or an equivalent combination of education and experience
Demonstrated experience in park, recreation and environment planning, design, policy and program research and analysis specifically relating to current-term and long-range planning
Experience in project management, data analysis and interpretation, demographic analysis, report writing and research coordination related to urban park, recreation and environment is required
Experience in implementing Reconciliation initiatives an asset
Experience working with Indigenous communities and/or groups an asset
Experience applying Reconciliation principles in a Planning and/or Research context an asset

Knowledge, Skills and Abilities
Strong knowledge of urban park, recreation and environmental issues (including demographic issues, planning, design and development trends), and sustainability.
Considerable and demonstrated knowledge in Indigenous rights and Reconciliation precedents, including (but not limited to) Aboriginal Rights and Title, United Nations Declaration on the Rights of Indigenous Peoples, and the Truth and Reconciliation Commission 94 Calls to Action an asset.
Excellent written and verbal communication, presentation, and interpersonal skills.
Ability to communicate to all audiences.
Excellent information and data management and analytical skills.
Strong organizational skills and the ability to adapt to priorities and meet prescribed deadlines in a changing environment.
Ability to work in a fast-paced environment as part of a team and ability to manage competing pressures.
Ability to be resourceful and efficient to obtain data and research within existing frameworks
Ability to use MS Office Suite (Word, Excel, Access, PowerPoint), , and Adobe Creative Suite (PhotoShop, Illustrator, InDesign) is required. Ability to use 3D software such as Sketchup, CAD software such as AutoCad and GIS software such as MapInfo is preferred.

As one team, we are all united by our vision to deliver energy for all. Our successful growth as an upstream oil and gas producer has been achieved by consistently finding and developing world-class assets.

Our business is focused on safely exploring and producing from conventional offshore, unconventional and oil sands assets. As part of the CNOOC Group of companies, which span the entire energy supply chain, our size and capability create a competitive advantage that ensures we deliver long-term value. Our growth strategy is to safely and sustainably develop our high-quality portfolio to deliver energy for all.
Why CNOOC International?
At CNOOC International, we take pride in our corporate culture. From East to West, we foster an ethical, responsible and safety-first mindset to build trust among our stakeholders.

Bold ideas, diverse perspectives and the determination to fuel our success are what set us apart.

A career at CNOOC International is about moving forward – learning new skills, broadening experiences and making meaningful contributions. We offer an unprecedented opportunity for growth and development. From personal career development that enables you to fulfill your potential, to employee programs that help you make the most of life outside of work, we care for our people and it shows.

Working for us means no matter what you do, you have the ability to make an immediate impact.
Your contributions are rewarded with highly competitive compensation and training that will open doors to your future. In return for your hard work, tenacity and contributions, you can expect an array of benefits.
The Role:
We’re seeking an IT Graduate to join our Information Technology team in Aberdeen as part of our UK Graduate Programme.


As part of your development, you will benefit from hands-on learning opportunities across our IT support function and will develop innovative technology projects with support from our team of talented IT professionals.

Reporting to the Team Lead – Business Applications, you will complete rotational assignments over a three-year period in roles such as Data Scientist, Business Analyst, Project Manager, IT Architect, Infrastructure Support and Data Management.

Combined with targeted technical training and career mentoring opportunities, you will accelerate your knowledge development and technical understanding, whilst making meaningful contributions to help us think differently from the start.

As well as collaborating within the IT team, you will work closely with subject matter experts in our business and the wider Oil & Gas industry, both on and offshore, to drive Digital Transformation through the application of technology and innovation, reducing costs, increasing productivity and boosting business performance.
Who are we looking for?
Successful candidates will have a degree in a Computing or a related field. Applications are invited from Graduates with a 2:1 degree or above, or Master’s degree in a Computing discipline.

Beyond that, we are interested in hearing from candidates with the following qualities:

Excellent communication skills and the ability to work closely with colleagues from different teams and locationsKeen problem-solving ability to help address real problems through the application of technologyA passion for innovation and technology to effectively deliver the right solutions to our businessAn interest in working offshore in the North Sea on short assignments to gather requirements and deliver solutionsA flexible, forward-thinking attitude and a desire to achieve
In return for your hard work, tenacity and contributions, you can expect an array of benefits. From personal career development that enables you to fulfill your potential, to employee programs that help you make the most of life outside of work, we care for our people and it shows.

NFI Parts, the parts sales and support for New Flyer Industries Inc. (NFI Group), is seeking a Customer Service Analyst to join its growing international team.

NFI Group is North America’s largest transit bus, motor coach manufacturer and parts distributor. NFI Parts provides part sales and support activities, technical publications, training and support for its OEM product lines (transit buses and motor coaches). All buses and coaches are also supported by an industry-leading comprehensive warranty, service, and support network.

Join us as we continue advancing innovation and sustainable transit solutions that connect people with places. With 31 locations across the U.S. and Canada, and over 85 years of experience manufacturing buses, NFI Group is building on a solid foundation to drive North America forward with progressive transit technology that serves communities and makes cities smarter.

Don’t settle for a job when you can build an impactful and exciting career.

Position Summary:

As a key member of our Customer Service team, you will work directly with customers to understand their business objectives, funding and operating budgets, customer forecasts and usage, programs and buying trends. You will be responsible for the research and in-depth analysis of that data to create strategies for sales improvement initiatives. You will provide team guidance and mentorship, and monitor and coordinate team workloads.

What you will do:

Provide insight of customer stocking philosophies and trends/programs.
Create customer sales plans and revenue budgets with input from the customer service Manager.
Understand high activity items and their usage to assist with stocking levels.
Review contract/quote awards win/loss rate and develop a quoting strategy plan by customer.
Create and monitor specific customer targets, sales plans by revenue dollars, margin dollars and margin percentages.
Manage and monitor overall customer contract performance.
Provide guidance, mentorship and support to customer service representatives.
Determine what the inventory investment strategy should be with customers when evaluating contract award and performance.
Collaborate and meet regularly with Territory Sales Representatives to establish and maintain and effective customer strategy and visiting schedule.
Review bus build schedule and establish a new customer strategy.
Present Recommended Stocking List (RSL) to customer, coordinating provisioning conferences when required.
Monitor the impact of currency (FX Fluctuations) and adjust the quoting strategy as required.
Preferred Skills
Post-secondary education in a related discipline and/or equivalent experience
Must entail advanced computer skills with a strong knowledge of Microsoft Excel and Power Point
Experience in complex data gathering, data mining and analysis with high attention to detail and accuracy
Possess strong planning, organizational, analytical and strategic skill
Project management related experience would be beneficial
Ability to converse in a professional manner in both written and verbal communication
Motivated self-starter with capabilities to work within a fast-paced team oriented environment
Basic knowledge of transit vehicles and systems would be considered an asset
*Travel is required for this position*

Best Buy for Business
Creativity and customer service are what fuel the success of the Best Buy for Business team. This group provides unique product and service solutions to diverse clients across the private and public sectors — from hotels and restaurants to some of the country's largest corporations.
Access to commercial goods while minimizing costs of goods is crucial in today’s B2B market. The BBfB Analyst provides analysis, executes processes, and utilizes business tools and metrics to ensure that decisions to purchase are well informed. This role also identifies and provides recommendations of clearance practices for unutilized project purchases or underperforming open for sale stock.
As a BBfB Analyst you will…
Utilize the existing SP tool and be responsible for evaluating inventory purchase requests from the sales team, providing the approver with relevant information and delivering a data driven recommendation in a timely manner
Work with the BBfB Vendor Management team in reviewing the sales pipelines (via CRM), forecasted opportunities, history of sales/purchases, and other relevant data to build data driven recommendations on product purchases for the purposes of reducing cost and/or improving customer experience (i.e. speed of delivery)
Ensure available Inventory-On-Hand (IOH) quantity and quality is easily accessible to the BBfB sales team
Reduce aging inventory & product write-off by recommending substitutions for in progress opportunities
Find most cost-effective solutions for unutilized product purchased for project and make recommendations to reduce in future
Perform inventory call-backs from stores for unutilized project product
Work with members of Business Development/Operations team to communicate and incent where appropriate
We hope you are passionate about…
Communication – you enjoy communicating with internal and external partners to resolve issues
Logic and critical thinking – we’re largely a data driven company so consideration of all angles and viewpoints is vital
Innovation – as a tech company we are constantly changing and evolving; an openness and willingness to embrace change is critical
The experience we need…
1-3 years of experience in retail as well as retail buying, inventory or planning experience
1-3 years of experience in retail management, operations or logistics
Bonus points…
1-3 years of experience in the consumer electronics industry
1-3 years of management / business development / manufacturing / supply experience (from vendor or manufacturing perspective) with responsibility to provide product to retail outlets
Bachelor’s Degree in Operations, Supply Chain Management, Business, or Economics
Supply Chain Management Designation
We believe we have the unique opportunity to help customers enrich their lives and pursue their passions with the help of technology

Join us on our exciting journey!

IQVIA™ is The Human Data Science Company™, focused on using data and science to help healthcare clients find better solutions for their patients. Formed through the merger of IMS Health and Quintiles, IQVIA offers a broad range of solutions that harness advances in healthcare information, technology, analytics and human ingenuity to drive healthcare forward. Those who choose to work with us are joining a recognized global leader — a company uniquely positioned to help clients make the most of market opportunities and respond to challenges that affect global healthcare. We’re committed to blending industry expertise and advanced technology to deliver the most accurate perspectives and in-depth analytics on healthcare dynamics.

Role Summary:
The person in this role is responsible for the on-time completion of projects or components of medium to large projects for clients in the pharmaceutical or related industries. Identifies and elevates potential new business opportunities.

Responsibilities:
Participates teams in the design, development and delivery of consulting projects or components of medium to large projects.
Reviews and analyzes client requirements or problems and assists in the development of cost effective solutions that ensure profitability and high client satisfaction.
Provides direction and guidance to Analysts assigned to engagement.
Develops detailed documentation and specifications.
Performs qualitative and/or quantitative analyses to assist in the identification of client issues and the development of client specific solutions.
Designs, structures and delivers client reports and presentations that are appropriate to the characteristics or needs of the audience.
Recommends improvements and alternative solutions to resolve problems.
May identify new business opportunities of follow-on work and new leads at assigned client.
Assists with providing follow-up with client after project deliverable has been completed to ensure client satisfaction.
Proactively develops broader and deeper knowledge of related consulting methodologies and pharmaceutical market through on the job experience and participation in training opportunities.
Begins to develop practice specific subject matter expertise.
Minimum Education, Experience, & Specialized Knowledge Required:
Bachelor’s degree with 3-6 years of related experience in consulting, pharmaceutical and/or healthcare industry.
Developing solid project management skills and client influencing and relationship building skills.
Works willingly and effectively with others in and across the organization to accomplish team goals and is effective working in a matrix environment.
Developing ability to manage multiple projects, juggle priorities and deliver on tight deadlines.
Developing excellent presentation, communication and client influencing skills.
Preferred Qualifications
Working knowledge of IMS data or similar data at Patient, Prescriber and Account levels.
Experience with Marketing and/or Market Research studies, Source of Business, Length of Therapy, Patient Journeys, etc.
Experienced with developing consultative relationships with senior level managers and executives at clients in the pharmaceutical/healthcare industry.
Experience in commercial aspects of the Pharmaceutical industry and data
Consulting experience including client-facing roles and project management.
Additional Skills and Knowledge of Interest:
Knowledge of consulting methodologies, tools and techniques related to functional area.
Knowledge of key issues and current developments in the pharmaceutical and healthcare industries.
Experience with Media agencies, Consumer data, campaign management, ROI and other related study types.
Therapeutic area knowledge in various medical conditions including but not limited to Oncology, Immunology, Diabetes, Cardiovascular, Vaccines, and rare and orphan diseases
Knowledge of Sales Operations including but not limited to: Sales Force Effectiveness, Sales Analytics, Call Planning, Targeting, Segmentation, Territory Alignment, Sales Sizing & Structure, and Incentive Compensation.

PermanentHelp us boldly shape retail in Canada

Canadian Tire Corporation’s (CTC) rich heritage of serving Canadians from coast-to-coast dates back to 1922. Our vision is to become the #1 retail brand in Canada by 2022 and we are focused on innovating and making important investments in our business, especially when it comes to our people. To reach our goal, we need the best talent to help us evolve and drive change across the business – and boldly help shape Canada’s retail industry. As we strive to be at the forefront of a complex and vastly changing retail industry, it is an exciting time to join the Canadian Tire family of companies.

The mandate of the Credit Card Operations Delivery team is to provide CTFS with a vendor management and delivery competency for TSYS and Acxiom, as well as be a liaison and escalation point between those vendors, the CTFS Business areas and IT.

The emphasis of the Senior Data Analyst is to increase the benefit CTFS realizes from its investment in data and analysis while managing risk and cost. The strategy is to focus on improving operations, analytics and reporting.

Reporting to the Manager – CRCD, the Senior Data Analyst is responsible for actively managing data as a corporate asset for CTFS. Success in this role will yield highly available data sources which offer an exceptional degree of reliability, consistency and trust for our analysts and for data-driven decision making within CTFS and other areas within CTC. This would be achieved through (but not limited to) excellent requirement elicitation, solid Information Management processes and procedures, and Best Practices in the areas of Data Quality, Operational Efficiency and Vendor Management.

What you’ll do

Manage day to day Acxiom and TSYS relationship

Project Lead on new initiatives – build and execute critical path

Drive efficiency and effectiveness, issue resolution

Analyze/understand data from various sources/vendors, transforming this raw data into useful information and Data Mart Development

Recommend and facilitate decisions related to process and design, risk and contingency strategies

Provide leadership/consulting in best structuring of data

Develop and maintain internal process documentation, including architecture, policies and procedures, as they relate to data analysis and reporting

Develop and maintain Best Practices in Information and Vendor Management

Develop data quality standards

Ensure high degree of accuracy and trustworthiness within the data

Manage/Liaise with vendors and stakeholders to support the data needs going forward

Present/gain approval from key stakeholders for proposed solutions/plans

Demonstrate personal commitment to self-improvement and growth

Demonstrate leadership and teamwork skills

Who you are

We are looking for individuals who are:
Creative and courageous, with the ability to manage in an environment of change and ambiguity to help us take bold, strategic moves in this rapidly evolving retail environment

Action oriented, and comfortable taking calculated risks to better serve our customers and business

Outcome focused, critical thinkers with the ability to analyze and visualize, to ensure continuous improvement across our entire business

Collaborative team players with superior influencing skills, who build relationships easily across various stakeholder groups to move initiatives forward

Inclusive leaders who build and develop teams that effectively anticipate and respond to disruption, while consistently delivering strong performance

If you’re curious, ready to take on new challenges and open to doing things differently to help us evolve rapidly, then this is definitely the place to be.

What you bring

Established experience in effective Vendor Management

Strong analytical capabilities and skills required to provide efficient and effective solutions

Strong technical experience in programming, querying data, data models, database design

Solid SAS, SQL and Unix skills with demonstrated ability to develop and learn

Advanced technical skills, knowledge and experience in use of PL/SQL and Microsoft Office Suite (Excel, PowerPoint, Visio, Word)

Deep working knowledge of Data Warehouse/Data Mart design and development

Ability to work with large and diverse sets of data

Ability to take initiative in recognizing data issues/concerns or areas where improvements could be made

Demonstrated planning, report writing, presentation and communication skills

Strong attention to detail

Established experience in effective Vendor Management

Ability to build and maintain professional working relationships (both internally and externally)

Excellent time management, organizational, change, and priority management skills

Ambitious self-starter with the ability to work independently or on cross-functional teams

Demonstrated ability to balance multiple priorities and react to changing environments to meet deadlines

About Canadian Tire Corporation

Canadian Tire and its family of companies are boldly shaping retail in Canada and we continue to deliver a positive experience for our customers. As one of the most trusted brands in Canada, our employees take pride in the work we do across the country. It’s more than the iconic triangle that keeps our employees around. From benefits and perks, to learning and development opportunities, to our commitment to Jumpstart – these are some of the many reasons why Canadian Tire Corporation is one of Canada’s Top Employers.

The Registrar’s Office (RO) is involved in all aspects of academic life, including marketing for undergraduate student recruitment and admissions, enrolment, examinations, development and application of academic policies, and convocation. This position supports the systems-based processes for these activities and drives continuous improvement through systems development projects.

The Business Systems Analyst (Analyst) provides functional business analysis and project leadership in systems development related to student information systems (SIS) of the University, while supporting major, more complex business processes within their portfolio. There are several critical aspects of support including provision of accurate and timely data to support the Registrar’s Office units and staff and faculty to facilitate and enhance decision-making, strategic planning, and communications. This role is forward looking and is regularly assessing the current and future technology needs of RO stakeholders in order to meet and exceed their expectations.
Responsibilities
Functional Leadership in Business Analysis and Development
Provides business analysis for new problems or changing processes (may be introduced by legislative or policy changes)
Works closely with stakeholder groups (faculty, staff, students) to understand and interpret diverse requirements for new developments and/or improvements to existing processes; stakeholder needs
are often conflicting requiring careful facilitation and negotiation
Identifies and/or verifies user needs; creates user stories and test scenarios for large development projects
Undertakes research of new tools and functionality to support registrarial activities across the campus; engaged with implementation of these tools (setup/configuration, development, testing,
training)
Functional project leadership role in systems development, working in partnership with IST and other departments on development projects
Functional leadership for system upgrades, enhancements, and fixes—research, identification of test scenarios, and quality assurance—and assuring that stakeholder needs are met
Expertise and Leadership in Complex Processes and Operations
Resource and source of expertise and technical support on SIS functionality within assigned portfolio; liaises with other departments and users across campus such as Faculties, Graduate Studies and Postdoctoral Affairs, Centre for Extended Learning, IAP, Finance, Cooperative Education, Housing, and many others—as well as staff in the Registrar’s Office
Responsible for configuring and running complex processes that frequently require manual adjustments, including the setup, maintenance, and optimization of large processes (e.g., Academic Progression, Academic Advisement, scheduling classes/exams, etc.)
Accountable for system configuration maintenance and functional setup
Responsible for understanding the implications of security as related to developments
Identifies errors, trouble-shoots, and problem-solves related to processes and functionality within the system
Provides data analysis as appropriate, directing solution design of end-user reports, technology solutions for operational problems, and production of reports and queries
Delivers ad hoc data as requested (e.g., research requests from faculty, Office of Research, external parties)
Client Relationships and Support
Builds and maintains effective working relationships with stakeholders within the RO and across campus, often acting as a liaison between functional and technical requirements
Monitors relevant business processes and stakeholder use of systems to identify opportunities for business process improvements
Develops and maintains procedures and user documentation; takes a lead role in the planning and delivery of training workshops to both internal and campus wide staff
Responsible for training staff on new business processes and monitoring accuracy of system coding and business processes of existing practices
Participates in various working groups and project teams, frequently including IST, GSPA, CEL, and Finance, as a partner in service excellence; in this context, seeks opportunities for shared services,
collaboration, efficiency, and support; supports alignment of conflicting needs and priorities across business units

Portfolio: Student Awards and Financial Aid (SAFA)
Accountable for the accuracy of financial aid reports and integrations
Leads the preparation of operational and business procedures to support the ongoing policy requirements as they relate to financial aid
Develop and modify queries in response to policy changes
Responsible for accurate set up and disbursement of funds through financial aid authorization and disbursement processes
Create student budgets, maintain set up tables and complex budget formulas that will ensure accurate budgets are built for all undergraduate and graduate students
Design, test and implement a set of institutionally defined rules to create financial aid packaging for students
Analyze and disseminate complex government reports to extract data required for the setup of OSAP data elements, table views and data transfers to the SIS
Responsible for ensuring accurate data and set up criteria are in place within the SIS and the Ministry’s (MAESD) Bursary Recording System
Develop and maintain an effective process for monitoring student funding eligibility and changes to need assessments; make adjustments to bursaries using sound judgment
Analyze and interpret the University’s tuition structure and the MAESD Tuition Fee Framework for the creation and maintenance of cost code tables, cost sheets, and program information
Responsible for creating and managing the content of the SAFA office web site
Other
May be called on to support exam, convocation and other Registrarial event support
Performs other duties and assists with special projects as assigned
Qualifications
Undergraduate degree required, or equivalent education and experience
Completion of courses in Business Analysis or a related discipline, or the Canadian Business Analyst Professional (CBAP) certification would be an asset
5 years of progressively responsible business systems analysis experience including demonstrated experience with an enterprise student information system and technology projects
2 years student information system experience including configuration and setup of processes, quality assurance and testing of new functionality
Extensive experience in working with queries and relational database tools
Significant experience in interpreting requirements, fit/gap analysis, data modeling, and documentation
Demonstrated strong analytical and problem-solving skills are essential
Innovative, with strong continuous improvement and project management skills
Proven ability to understand complex situations, tasks or problems, often with multiple stakeholder groups, analyze them using a systematic approach and identify patterns and connections between situations that are not inherently obvious
Proven ability to adapt and work effectively within a variety of situations including changes in job demands, changing or competing priorities, or multiple stakeholder groups
Demonstrated ability to maintain strong working relationships, to engage and influence stakeholders
Demonstrated ability to complete tasks on schedule
Good understanding of university policy and operations
Good understanding of relevant legislative and compliance requirements (e.g., FIPPA, AODA)
Excellent written and interpersonal communication skills
Proficient with MS Word (track changes, compare and merge files, table management, footnotes)
Advanced knowledge of Excel (macros, pivot tables, lookups, data import)
Proficient with PowerPoint (creation of dynamic presentations, use of charts and images)
Proficient with an enterprise student information system (Peoplesoft, Infosilem, Cyon would be an asset)
Proficient with building queries and with database tools
A continuous improvement mindset and an exceptional customer service focus are critical for success along with exceptionally strong attention to detail and problem-solving skills

Position Summary:

407 ETR operates, maintains and owns the right to toll the world’s first all-electronic, open-access toll highway which is situated just north of Toronto and stretches 108 kilometres from the west to the east of the GTA. 407 ETR uses leading edge technologies to enable a barrier free highway and provide customers with a fast, safe and reliable travel alternative. The Company’s sophisticated highway electronics and back office systems will track usage and manage each customer’s account.
The role of the Procurement Analyst is to support the Procurement Manager to manage and administer contracts for departmental spending on services and products throughout the organization. Procurement Manager

Ability to work efficiently, manage multiple priorities and meet tight deadlines with minimal supervision
Perform data gathering and analysis related to Procurement policies, processes and tools.
Prepare metrics and analysis for Procurement function dashboard
Create and submit monthly/quarterly status reports to management
Administer and maintain procurement information repositories
Assist in forecasting and budgeting procurement needs

Assist in establishing vendors of record as required;
Meets with internal customers to develop RFx requirements and coordinates the RFx process and evaluation process to ensure timely results;
Support the drafting and administration of RFx’s to source goods and services;
Collaborate with the Legal team to ensure vendor contracts are successfully negotiated
Build, develop and maintain strong relationships with internal business stakeholders and key suppliers/vendors
Provide support for ordering and payment process; liaise with AP department to ensure accurate and timely payment of invoices if necessary for the business
Prepare and / or facilitate the issuance and tracking of purchase orders

It’s an exciting time at Innotech-Execaire Aviation Group. For more than 50 years, we have provided a full range of services for business and commercial aviation customers. Today, we are transforming and growing to meet the demand of OEMs, business aviation customers and airlines. We are a premier Canadian aviation company with an international presence!

If you’re looking for an opportunity to join and grow with a dynamic company, you will thrive at Innotech-Execaire Aviation Group!

Business Process Analyst

Reporting to the Vice President of Information Technology(VPIT), the Business Process Analyst is responsible for identifying and improving the outcomes of operational processes to increase efficiency and customer satisfaction as well as reducing cost. The candidate will also be responsible for leading continuous improvement initiatives for all departments in the organization, as well as evaluating, planning and implementing the improvements in the business processes and practices. Other aspects of the job include group facilitation, compiling and tracking data,preparing training materials and documenting processes.

The Business Process Analyst must be prepared to explain and defend any proposed changes to the current system.

Responsibilities
Identify, plan and implement key projects to improve quality, reduce cost, increase productivity and improve cycle time by reducing wasted time, scrap, rework, etc. resulting in significant business improvement and customer satisfaction.
Identify and facilitate process improvement projects, training/workshops to drive cultural change
Drive value stream mapping to define “As-Is Analysis” and the transition to Future State
Develop and conduct compliance audits, program evaluations and reviews to drive results with the fortitude to ensure change is permanent
Provide executive management with project status updates, feedback, and appropriate reporting on key responsibilities and objectives.
Receives input and coordination of information from various parties, and prepares and presents such information for management review.
Strong understanding of Continuous Improvement concepts, principles and practices.
Job requires a willingness to lead, take charge, and offer opinions and direction.
Support/change management plans and training plans to ensure new processes are implemented in an optimal fashion, supporting the organization through the various stages of change.
Work with the training department to develop training programs for the broader team related to the tools and solutions created.
Participate in training facilitation of key process enhancements where applicable.
Qualifications
Bachelor’s degree preferably in Industrial Engineering from an accredited University
3+ years’ experience in process improvements, cross-functional collaboration and workflow generation
Exceptional communication skills, both verbal and written, problem solving and analytical skills
Strong leadership skills, ability to learn and apply new concepts and overcome obstacles with change
Strong work ethic that is able to work independently but also works well in team environment
Results driven with an ability to effectively multi-task in a fast-paced environment
Experience in Six Sigma, Reengineering or other Continuous improvement methodologies would be an asset
Technical Competencies
Advanced knowledge of Microsoft word, excel ,Visio and ERP applications
Lean Six Sigma Organizational training and certification would be an asset.

and a great dynamic team!

job_title: Senior Business Systems Analyst - TELUS Partner Solutions
job_description:
TELUS Partner Solution team is on a mission to, “Bring a world of possibilities to our customers and the best of TELUS to the connected world”. Our team members are continuously learning, insatiably curious, challenge the industry norms and approach uncertainty as an opportunity. At TELUS we embrace change and initiate opportunity through strong collaboration and a desire to take our ideas global. By creating a safe environment of support, we encourage our team to take calculated risks, have the courage to innovate and learn from our mistakes. As a team we are also aware of the world around us and we work to make a positive and lasting difference in our communities and the lives of others. The difference we make today can help build a brighter tomorrow.

TELUS Strategic Sourcing Provider team (SSP) manages both Buy and Sell for Strategic accounts, supporting revenue and expense for TELUS. We pride ourselves on managing partnerships with domestic organizations to provide product offerings and build a broad range of possibilities for their end customers.

The Senior Business Systems Analyst role requires a mixture of financial, technical, business analysis, and communication skills. As part of a larger team, you responsible in assist the SSP team to drive profitable growth by supporting and developing monthly reports, forecasting, development of predictive analytics, and translating data in simple yet intelligent information. You will be responsible in managing monthly reports, dashboards, translating complex data in to meaningful (simple) format, identifying opportunities, exposing risks, forecast and developing predictive analytics. You will lead presenting key analysis through analytic tools to help provide critical decision making for our key customers across Partner Solutions.

If you’re looking for a collaborative, high performance, and customer focused culture, come join our team!

Responsibilities:
Works closely with SSP team to develop monthly financial reports capturing key highlights, variances and risks
Take ownership of month end reporting activities for the SSP portfolio; you will be responsible for preparation of reports/dashboards and variance analysis explanations
Assist in cultivating a fact-based-data-driven decision making culture and implement the best in class end-to-end predictive analytical process to effective business decisions
Prepare monthly triage forecasts, Strat checks & annual budgeting
Build complex models using statistical or operational research tools and techniques focused on providing clarity to complex business issues and situations
Conceptualize and present key drivers and relationships between data sets to support strategic business decisions
Act as a data and Key Performance Indicator (KPI) consultant to the business, ensuring high quality of repeatability and reproducibility of system and process data
Lead strategic complex end to end team project efforts and develop tactics and timelines to address specific project objectives to ensure customer needs are met
Synthesize analytical and modeling findings/insights, and ensure it is clearly communicated to stakeholders in business context in order to be able to solve customer/business issues and objective
Work collaboratively with external vendors on solution requirements where required
Support a number of business critical operational activities
Continue to enhance our Business, Customer and Market Intelligence and drive actionable insights for our sales, marketing and care teams
Manage and maintain buy side tools and data visualization tools
Mentor, coach and provide expert guidance to team members
Support ad-hoc financial analysis requests from senior management team
Recognize, recommend and execute process improvement opportunities
Qualifications

Required Knowledge:
5+ years of related work experience in telecommunications, wholesale, wireline and/or IT industry
Minimum of 3 years of related predictive modeling/statistical experience
Knowledge of Wholesale Telecommunications Industry (considered an asset)
Use of data mining and presentation tools such as Data flux/Alteryx, Tableau, SQL considered strong assets
Ability to deal with ambiguity and complex issues and concepts
Ability to react quickly and take advantage of changing business conditions

Within a framework of collaboration, consultation, and solid governance, the Strategic Business Analyst plays a key role in managing the University's strategic resource planning. The Strategic Business Analyst is responsible for managing and driving successful completion of various initiatives and special projects involving Financial Services and for providing reporting and analysis supporting the University's strategic directions. The Strategic Business Analyst acts as an institutional resource and a change catalyst by providing professional guidance and recommendations to project managers and key decision-makers (Vice-Presidents, Directors, or other University senior members). The Strategic Business Analyst is also responsible for developing and preparing impactful internal and external communication materials in support of initiatives involving Financial Services, University senior management, and the wider University community.

Qualifications:

Undergraduate degree in business administration with a CPA accounting designation (CA, CGA, CMA) and five years of related experience in project management, research, financial data analysis, planning, report writing, and communications, or equivalent combination of education, training, and experience.
Excellent organizational, project management, and planning skills.
Good knowledge of business process mapping and business process re-engineering techniques.
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills and ability to research and analyze financial data and to prepare reports.
Ability to build and maintain collaborative relationships with various levels within the University.
Excellent communications skills (oral, written, and presentation).
Strong client service skills.
Excellent report writing skills and ability to develop various communication materials for public presentation or for review by senior management.
Good knowledge of enterprise level information systems (e.g. PeopleSoft Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) and Business Intelligence (BI) applications).
Ability to manage detail but also to envision the larger context of planning initiatives and projects.
Ability to communicate the value and logistics of change management.
Ability to work cross-functionally and collaboratively with others.
Advanced skill in the use of the Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint).
Please include your cover letter and resume in one attachment.

Job Description:

TransUnion believes in investing in the best people. Our dynamic and diverse environment values and promotes the growth of associates in their jobs, roles and careers. Our organization supports ambitious individuals who seek career satisfaction and development.

Who We Are
At TransUnion, we are dedicated to finding ways information can be used to help people make better and smarter decisions. As a trusted provider of global information solutions, our mission is to help people around the world access the opportunities that lead to a higher quality of life, by helping organizations optimize their risk-based decisions and enabling consumers to understand and manage their personal information. Because when people have access to more complete and multidimensional information, they can make more informed decisions and achieve great things.

Every day TransUnion offers our employees the tools and resources they need to find ways information can be used in diverse ways. Whether it is helping businesses better manage risk, providing better insights so a consumer can qualify for his first mortgage or working with law enforcement to make neighborhoods safer, we are improving the quality of life for individuals, families, communities and local economies around the world.

About the Team
Global Decisioning leverages industry data and analytics, coupled with our technology assets, to deliver decision sets, decision criteria and decisioning solutions that help our business customers achieve more. Flexibility, the desire to contribute and an entrepreneurial spirit are valued here. Other highlights include the business-casual atmosphere where our leaders are interested in removing obstacles to your success, making this a great place to grow in your career. We’ve been instrumental in winning important new business and more challenges are on the way.

What you will do

In this role, you will serve as a project manager and business analyst to deliver decisioning and fraud market initiatives on our client's industry leading decisioning platform.
We are seeking a technically savvy individual with the strong collaborative skills required to manage projects of varying scope and work with customers to elicit and document business and functional requirements.
This is a hands-on and fast-paced role where the incumbent will be a key member of the team working on a specific product, and will be responsible for configuring the customers’ requirements into business ready solutions. You will deliver projects on time and on budget, making modifications to project phases as needed to address changes or problems to original scope. You will drive projects to delivery by performing project administrative tasks such as: creating and maintaining project plans, completing project estimates, identifying and reporting action items and risks, project status reporting, meeting facilitation and preparation of meeting notes. You will facilitate meetings with customers to identify all details of business objectives and requirements. The output from those meetings will result in requirement documentation authored by you. You will lead collaboration to help identify creative solutions to meet customer needs and address problem resolution. You will configure, test and deliver decisioning solution requests (for new solutions as well as changes to existing) to customers in a timely manner ensuring that appropriate standards are followed and customer needs are met. You will work with the team’s development and quality assurance associates to ensure captured requirements are interpreted and delivered correctly. You will serve as a Subject Matter Expert and provide non-incident support to customers, sales and other team members.

What you will bring A minimum of 4 years of applicable business experience in IT / risk industry (credit or financial services background preferred). At least 4 years of project management experience, as a member of a project team with at least 1 year as a project lead. PMP designation is a preferred. A minimum of 4 years elicitation and authoring requirements as well as interaction with external customers. Technical proficiency and skill level to learn and undertake solution configurations. Excellent listening and communication skills coupled with a strong technical aptitude. Demonstrated flexibility in dealing with change and adversity. Practical understanding and experience in Agile methodology.

Accommodation is available, including for applicants with disabilities, in accordance with applicable laws.

Your career is important to you. It's important to us, too. The time is right for you to join Deloitte.
At Deloitte, we're committed to recognizing, affirming and celebrating the diversity of opinion, talent and expertise that make each person unique.
A career at Deloitte will offer you the opportunity to:
Work in a fast growing and exciting organization with professionals who are eminent in their respective field
Have challenging and interesting work in a team environment
Continue your development throughout your career to reinforce and expand your chosen career path
Reporting Sr. Analyst
The Solutions Delivery group within Deloitte’s ITS (National Information Technology Services) requires an experienced Reporting Sr. Analyst. This position is based in Toronto and does not require travel.
The role of the Reporting Sr. Analyst is to examine, evaluate and deliver reporting requirements for various functions across the organization. This individual will use proven knowledge of the Cognos BI/Tableau and TM1 tools to guide both requirements and development of new reporting solutions. The analyst is responsible for proactively identify opportunities to develop and upgrade reports based on findings, complete with recommended improvements to - or new requirements for - data analysis, business processes and/or operational procedures.
Role Specific Responsibilities
Business Analysis:
Meet with decision makers, systems owners, and end users to define reporting requirements and goals.
Analyze requirements surrounding business applications, data, data dictionaries, and reporting/analytics.
Conduct data analysis to validate business processes
Responsible for designing, modeling, dashboards or other visualizations.
During design, considers balance of data delivery and data availability
Develop and present technical concept alternatives to Business Analyst and business team
Serve as a technical and / or functional project lead as appropriate
Provide configuration requirements when adding new functionality to existing software applications, when applicable
Creation of report package to manage the access to information needs of the business in a flexible but secure environment.
Business Liaison
Work with Business to analyze and document impact of proposed technology to existing processes and communicate any potential risks
Provide status to appropriate management
Liaise with various business groups in the organization to facilitate implementation of new or improved reporting processes.
Operations & Effectiveness
Participate in planning sessions with Project Managers, Business Analysts and development team members
Establish and clearly document measurable performance requirements, development standards and security requirements
Help resolve issues that arise from multiple development teams working on complex designs
Adhere to technology organization's technical design and documentation standards and conform to applicable architectural standards
Provide input into project / resource estimating activities
Prepare and deliver reports, recommendations, or alternatives for improving processes in reporting systems across the organization.
Advise department and management regarding appropriate, effective, and efficient use of organizational reporting capabilities and functions.
Document critical changes to the business intelligence infrastructure in accordance with proper change management procedures.
Coordinate and perform in-depth tests, including end-user reviews, for modified and new processes, and other post-implementation support.
Implement communication and knowledge sharing process for team members
Refine and enhance technology methodologies and / or standards
Qualifications:
Five plus years of experience within data warehousing, business intelligence, enterprise reporting and dashboards.
Three plus years working with business intelligence / visualization tools:
At least 2 years experience with IBM Cognos Analytics is required,
Experience with Tableau or PowerBI is considered an asset.
Advanced knowledge of data reconciliation management, aggregation and analysis techniques.
Advanced data manipulating, mining, query skills.
Strong experience with SQL coding.
Knowledge and experience with a database (advanced SQL, MS SQL, DB2, Hana) is a plus.
Modelling experience with FM Manager, ERWIN.
A university degree with mix of technical and business discipline or equivalent school and work experience.
Understanding of best practice systems implementation.
Detail oriented with passion for technical quality and client service excellence.
Ability to build strong client and peer relationships while working in a team environment.
Structured and strong organization skills in a client facing service oriented organization.
Strong verbal and written communication skills.

Join Canada’s lifeline!


We’re seeking a Business Support Specialist, Stem Cells to join our team.


Be part of a dynamic, innovative, collaborative, diverse and caring organization committed to saving and improving the lives of Canadians. We are the connection between the sincere generosity of donors, and the heartfelt appreciation of recipients. Thousands of Canadians depend on our programs every day for reliable access to safe blood, plasma, stem cells, organs and tissues.


In this role you will oversee all activities related to the management of, and relationships with, committees and working groups within the stem cell program. You will develop and produce comprehensive data and analysis required for reporting at various levels of the organization. You will also develop and produce stem cell specific products for external customers, and provide business document management expertise, development and support for the Planning & Development group as well as Stem Cell Operations.


Are you ready to embark on a meaningful and inspiring journey, where what you do matters? Be part of Canada’s lifeline. Because we can all be the reason, the connection, that keeps Canadians living.


Responsibilities include:

Oversees all aspects of stakeholder relationships and committee management within the stem cells program.
Manages the committee meeting schedule, drives and facilitates agenda development, organizes planning meetings, participates in and/or facilitates meetings and oversees logistical activities of support staff.
Uses strong industry knowledge to develop and produce complex internal corporate/executive reports required of the Stem Cell Program.
Develops and produces stem cell specific products to inform and influence external customers such as WMDA, FACT, collection hospital reports, newsletters, and the Stem Cells Program annual report.
Plays a primary role in developing the Stem Cells Annual Report comparative to those of other international registries.
Conducts regular environmental and horizon scans to identify, assess and inform the program leadership of emerging issues, practices, and risks that may impact the stem cells program.
Builds strong working relationships with international colleagues to have on-going conversations and information exchanges to gain information on changes in transplant practice, including emerging therapies; this may include attendance at international conferences and/or participation on WMDA working groups.
In collaboration with the Data Analyst, will synthesize/analyze industry-specific, qualitative information to report findings to Stem Cells leadership on a regular basis and incorporate relevant information into annual reports and horizon scans to inform and advance the stem cells strategy.


Required Skills
Education, Training and Experience:

Post-secondary education in a relevant discipline from a recognized academic institution, preferably a University Degree in Public Relations, Communications or Business Administration.
Minimum six years of related experience, preferably in a health care setting.
Project management certification would be an asset.
Experience in stakeholder engagement.
Strong written and verbal communications skills.


Demonstrated Skills and Abilities:

Ability to work in a complex environment and manage multiple priorities with demanding timelines.
Judgement and the capacity to analyze conflicting demands and advise on appropriate solutions.
Strong industry knowledge of the stem cells field in Canada and internationally.
Understanding of key performance indicators.
Ability to work and collaborate effectively with colleagues from different departments and backgrounds, and to understand the perspectives of others and adapt messaging to manage conflict and influence positive outcomes.
Demonstrated ability to synthesize complex information and create content that is relevant, engaging and clear to target audiences.
Effective verbal and written communications skills in English.
Computer literacy is required, including Microsoft Office.
Strong attention to detail.


Required Experience

Excellent leadership skills

The Digital Services Directorate (DSD) supports Canadians by providing easy, fast and convenient access to information and services online, as well as through phone operations (such as the 1 800 O-Canada service). Located in downtown Gatineau, DSD is where passionate people come to make a difference. We offer an environment that is intellectually stimulating and supportive. We offer a wide range of exciting career opportunities that incorporate an array of benefits and flexible work arrangements that can help you easily balance your work and private life.

As a performance analyst, you help develop plans and business intelligence; monitor business plans and performance; set targets; identify opportunities to improve service delivery; and design and deliver business strategies and solutions aligned with the business architecture of various initiatives.


You analyze the organization’s business needs and business context on innovative, large-scale projects and initiatives. From needs assessment to rollout, you identify, design and recommend business solutions, analyze their impacts on the organization, and ensure they’re integrated. Your projects and initiatives require extensive knowledge of your specialty.


Coordination is critical, so you frequently interact with stakeholders working in many other fields. Interpersonal savvy and the ability to balance the interests of multiple parties are therefore essential.


You serve as specialist and lead teams and decision-making bodies.
