Financial & Business Analyst, Systems & Performance Management, BISS
job_description:
Financial & Business Analyst, Systems & Performance Management, BISS
Reporting to the Manager, Financial & Business Support or a designated project lead (as assigned by the Corporate Director, Systems & Performance Management), the Financial & Business Analyst is responsible for supporting the various revenue generation projects and initiatives within the portfolio. Key areas for active involvement and accountability include preparing financial models, data mining, best practices research, budget/variance reports, process flow diagrams, developing and evaluating performance metrics, etc. or other specific tasks as relates to supporting project charters and workplans.

Key Accountabilities
Monitors, analyzes and assesses the status of ongoing projects & initiatives.
Assists in developing spreadsheets and databases to accurately forecast results and produce reports for review with other members of the Systems & Performance Management team.
Reviews problem areas with the Manager and develops plans to mitigate and resolve identified issues.
Assists the Manager in performing operational financial tasks including budget and cost pressure development, invoice validation and processing, preparation of analyses to support accruals, pre-payments and change orders, and overall coordination with HA Finance departments in matters relating to BISS’ activities.
Assists in the analysis of proposed new initiatives by methods such as staying current on initiatives under consideration; assisting in preparing business cases; consulting with appropriate stakeholders regarding impact assessment and implementation strategies; measuring the performance of the new initiatives against the plan, and critical analysis of variances.
Conducts statistical, workload and financial analyses; circulates reports to the appropriate stakeholders and provides recommendations.
Creates forms for data collection and tracking, and/or identifies and evaluates existing data resources. Assembles, edits and enters data gathered into appropriate databases.
Responds to ad hoc requests for information and analysis by researching and gathering information required, manipulating database fields, preparing spreadsheets, tables, charts, graphs and reports as required to summarize information.
Minimum of a Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, Finance and Accounting, Economics or related field, and preferably working towards a Master’s degree or other recognized professional certification. Minimum of three (3) years’ recent, related financial analysis and project management experience in a large, complex, unionized environment or healthcare organization, or an equivalent combination of education, training and experience.
Demonstrated financial planning, monitoring, analysis and reporting expertise.
Comprehensive technical expertise, process management, analytical skills and business acumen.
Advanced technical computer skills in spreadsheet and database usage.
Excellent analytical skills and the ability to outline recommendations to senior levels.
Broad knowledge of financial analysis techniques.
Demonstrated problem-solving abilities
Demonstrated business acumen for normal business practices, tools and methodologies
Results oriented within a high-pressure working environment with numerous critical timelines.
Demonstrated communication skills and ability to understand and clearly relate to others, at all levels of the organization.
Ability to develop and maintain effective working relationships with internal and external stakeholders.
Ability to organize and prioritize workload and meet deadlines.
If this sounds like you, apply now!

About us
PHSA provides specialized health services to British Columbians, including cancer care, organ transplantation, pediatrics, emergency services, mental health and substance use services, and more. Our values reflect our commitment to excellence and include: Respect people – Be compassionate – Dare to innovate - Cultivate partnerships – Serve with purpose. Learn more about PHSA and our programs: https://jobs.phsa.ca/family-brands
We hire on the basis of merit and encourage all qualified applicants to apply. We recognize that our ability to provide the best care for our diverse patient populations relies on a rich diversity of skills, knowledge, backgrounds and experiences. We strive to create a safe and welcoming environment where everyone can come to work and be their best, authentic self.

PermanentCritical Care Services Ontario’s (CCSO) mission is to identify critical care system needs and collaborate with healthcare partners to improve access, quality and integration for patients. CCSO collaborates with clinicians, hospital administrators, Local Health Integration Networks (LHINs), the Ministry of Health and Long-Term Care (MOHLTC) and other health sector partners in strategic planning and priority setting, monitoring performance management and system accountability, developing policy, programs, and evaluation, and integrating best practices. CCSO is a provincial organization, funded by the Ministry of Health and Long-Term Care, housed at University Health Network.
For more information regarding provincial initiatives, please visit CCSO’s website at www.criticalcareontario.ca.
The Senior Business Analyst, Provincial Projects supports the implementation of Ontario’s Critical Care Strategy and associated programs, under the direction of the Project Manager and Director. The Senior Business Analyst will contribute to the planning, coordination, management, and evaluation of critical care system initiatives and related projects. The Senior Business Analyst is responsible for developing processes to ensure successful project planning and implementation, contributing to business cases for new projects and proposals, mentoring and coaching junior team members, and performing administrative and cross-functional duties consistent with the job classification, as requested.
The Senior Business Analyst will work both independently and in project teams. Based on the assigned project(s), the designated Project Manager supervises the Senior Business Analyst on a day-to-day basis; however, the Senior Business Analyst formally reports to the Director of CCSO.
This position will support multiple projects within critical care, system programs and the incumbent may be assigned to other files based on organizational needs.
The ideal candidate possesses superior skills in research, analysis, stakeholder engagement, writing and project management to successfully deliver on designing, planning and executing initiatives related to the provincial Critical Care Strategic Plan.
Responsibilities include (but are not limited to):

Lockheed Martin Canada RMS Configuration and Data Management (CMDM) team is seeking Junior Configuration Data Management Analyst. This position will provide Configuration Management (CM) and Data Management support to multi programs. The Data Management (DM) discipline ensures the Contract Data Requirement List / Subcontract Data Requirement List (CDRL/SDRL) requirements are identified, recorded, assigned to appropriate disciplines, and tracked in accordance with DM Standards (Formal Data Management).

DM creates and monitors the CDRL/SDRL submittal schedule. DM resolves data issues, distributes schedule notices for pending data submittals to ensure on-time delivery and creates status reports for management review and action. DM reviews the deliverable program data to determine completeness and submits to the customer as specified in the contract.

The Configuration Management (CM) discipline works closely with the program execution and engineering teams to manage the technical baseline. CM tasking in this role will include the use of CM tools for configuration identification, configuration control, configuration status accounting, configuration verification and audits, product release and delivery and provide solutions to a variety of CM technical challenges.

Daily responsibilities include establishing and maintaining program CM systems, including the program documents and managing configuration baselines, ensuring all required process steps have been completed prior to release and documenting released configurations. Position requires great attention to detail with respect to managing hardware development environments and program technical data, understanding of ITAR processes and strong presentation skills. Candidate must be an advocate of continuous process improvements.

Employee TypeFull Time
Business Environment
Lockheed Martin Canada is the Canadian-based arm of Lockheed Martin Corporation, a global security and aerospace company employing 98,000 people worldwide, including nearly 1,000 Canadians. By applying innovative approaches of our highly skilled and experienced Canadian workforce, we have been Canada’s trusted defence and aerospace partner for over 75 years. We operate major facilities in Ottawa, Montreal, Halifax, Calgary and Victoria and work on a wide range of major programs from advanced naval technology products and unmanned systems software to providing delivery and in-service support of the latest military aircraft to commercial engine repair and overhaul capabilities.
Clearance required for roleNato Secret

2+ years of related experience in Data Management or Configuration Management
Proficiency with Microsoft Office Products, specifically: Excel, Word, Access
Experience with Windchill or PLM/ PDM environment is an asset
Above average oral and written communication skills
Clearance Requirement: A clearance is not required upon hire, but the position will require the candidate to obtain and maintain a minimum of a NATO/SECRET clearance.
Desired skills, qualifications and experience
Self-Starter, willing to learn new tools and work with a variety of technical and non-technical disciplines
Ability to pro-actively interface with team members
Data Management and/or Configuration Management Experience
Experience working in an Engineering design environment, interfacing with Hardware, Systems, Software and Test Engineers
Proficient in use and administration of Windchill PDM
Understands principles, standards and processes, such as described in EIA-649B, Configuration Management Standard
Demonstrated ability to support multiple ongoing projects and parallel release activities
Equal Opportunity Statement
Lockheed Martin Canada is an equal opportunity employer that values diversity in the workplace. We are committed to excellence in serving all customers, including people with disabilities, and we encourage feedback on the provision of these services.

ABOUT SOLUTIONS DESIGN AND DELIVERY
The SOLUTIONS DESIGN AND DELIVERY Department creates opportunities for improvement, within the operations portfolio (national scope) and provides operations application support to the field operation. The team specializes in the use of innovation and creativity in making sustainable transformation and change happen. This team has three main areas of focus: Business Intelligence, Process Improvement and solution design and delivery.
The Solution Design & Delivery Team is responsible for identifying, planning and implementing Information Management/Information Technology based solutions in Operations; working in tandem with Information Services/Technology and the Mobility Team. This team is dedicated to design and implement systems which integrate care processes with the electronic capture and review of clinical data, reduce dependence on the paper patient chart, and substantially improve the delivery of patient care. These information system implementations intend to advance evidence based clinical practices, facilitate easy, secure access to client information and clinical documentation via an Electronic Health Record (EHR).

POSITION SUMMARY
Reporting to the Leader, Operations Solution Design and Delivery, Business Analyst will play a key role in ensuring SDCs & other lines of operations have a successful change management and transition to new or improved technical solutions. As well, you will participate in the training associated with new and existing technologies to support operations.

RESPONSIBILITIES
Solution Design & Delivery
Support the implementation of best practices, and work collaboratively with internal teams to implement evidence-based processes/practices, including re-engineering and standardization of processes within operations
Support Service Delivery Centres (SDCs) & other lines of operations in developing change management and process improvement plans based on outputs from internal and external operations performance reviews/assessments.
Support performing audit and validation testing of various applications and business data sources
Participate in process and quality improvement methodologies such as FMEA, Value Stream Mapping, Root Cause Analysis etc.
Assist SDCs & other lines of operations to manage the changes and transition to new process and new technical solutions
Engage user groups and manage users’ expectations
Support development, distribution of implementation materials including guides and toolkits, ensuring consistency in messaging, format and delivery
Support evaluation of operational processes through the analysis and interpretation of complex data and performance metrics, supported by documented standards and implemented practices
Maintain business relationship with stakeholders to ensure successful implementation that enable quality and process improvement for field staff
Training Related
Provide assistance and training to business users on new / improved operational processes, deployment of new technologies and applications in support of operational processes
Support activities involved in the design and development of P&Ps, including the delivery of training to support standardized processes design, development and delivery of training to support operational policies, procedures and standards
Administer training/course evaluations and assessments, focusing on strengths and lessons learned
Communicate training information, reviews and schedules to class participants/facilitator(s), management and staff, including course logistics and required equipment/supplies
Conduct training sessions using the principles of adult learning
Participate in selection, implementation and training of new/revised software applications
Conduct and report on needs analysis of training for ongoing operational effectiveness
Coordinate and facilitate the delivery of training sessions across all sites
Provide training and advice on the use of information systems and technologies
REQUIREMENTS
Degree in Business / Computer science / Informatics / Health sciences with supplemental business education is preferred (equivalent education and experience will be considered)
Minimum 3 - 5 years Business System Analysis experience
Excellent communication, business analysis, problem solving, interpersonal and organizational skills
Knowledge of business, operations and information management
Ability to effectively apply principles of adult learning
User engagement and stakeholder management
Project planning and project control
Project Management Profession (PMP) certification preferred
Conflict management
Familiar with process and quality improvement methodologies
Intermediate to advanced skills in MS Office applications, including Word, Excel, Visio and Outlook
Previous experience training both face-to-face and virtually an asset
Ability to quickly learn a variety of software applications
Experience with SE Health’s information systems is strongly preferred
A strong team work orientation and ability to effectively interact with cross-functional teams
The ability to travel and work in a variety of environments

About SE Health
SE Health is a national health care provider that has been opening the door to new possibilities and care experiences for more than a century. Recognized as Canada’s largest social enterprise, we employ 8,000 people and visit 18,000 clients every day. Through the SE Health Research Centre, our Health Career Colleges and the Saint Elizabeth Foundation, we are helping to make the future of health care brighter and stronger. Learn more at www.saintelizabeth.com or find us on Twitter at @StElizabethSEHC.
SE Health is committed to the success of all its employees. If you feel you need accommodations because of illness or disability, please do not hesitate to contact Human Resources at hresources@saintelizabeth.com at your earliest convenience.

necessary to evaluate complex business problems and effectively communicate at the technical
and client levels.

processes

SENIOR DATA ANALYST
Our Business Intelligence and Analytics team integrates data and develops modern reporting solutions, provides advanced analytics to all business units across the organization to generate insights and foster innovation.

As the Senior Data Analyst in this team, the successful candidate will possess very strong analytical skills and the proven ability to gather, view and analyze all forms of information in detail. You will work directly with the business stakeholders. The ideal incumbent will have excellent familiarity of data analysis processes and systems and outstanding interpersonal skills. Previous experience in Microsoft BI technology such as SQL Server, Power BI and Azure is required. The candidate will need to identify the business needs and requirements, process data from multiple sources, and deliver analytical results. You will be a key contributor who enables Aurora to make decisions by turning data into actionable insights. This position will be based out of our Toronto or Edmonton office.

We are looking for a highly motivated team player who is always able to deliver on time. Apply if you enjoy data and analytics, are innovative, love to advocate for change, and have the desire to develop strong working relationships with intelligent colleagues in a new and fast growing international organization!

MAIN RESPONSIBILITIES:

Maintain strong relationships and work closely with stakeholders to ensure business needs are addressed. Collaborate in small groups to gather business information needs from various teams. Identify business objectives and process workflows, gather requirements from stakeholders, translate requirements into technical specification, create user stories.
Extract and merge data sets from multiple data sources. Perform data cleansing, transformation, exploration, analysis and visualization with Microsoft BI technologies. Build on-demand reports using Microsoft SSRS. Build dashboards using Power BI and deploy to Power BI Service.
Support day-to-day requests for data analysis such as decision support and KPI’s.
Use advanced techniques, conduct in-depth analytics for strategic initiatives as directed by the management.
Work side-by-side with the business stakeholders, iterate the analytical work in an agile fashion to deliver insights.
Participate in the Enterprise Data Warehouse development, enhancement and other projects as directed by the management. Support the team to design, build, test and deploy end-to-end, best in class BI solutions for self-serve reporting and data analysis.
Manage multiple project simultaneously while exhibiting professionalism to ensure an incredible stakeholder experience.

JOB REQUIREMENTS:

A university degree or diploma in Computing Science, Statistics, Mathematics or similar disciplines plus 5+ years of work experience in Business Intelligence and Analytics.
Very strong experience in database systems including data warehouses and multi-dimensional analytic solutions. Very strong experience working with various data types.
Outstanding skills in Microsoft BI technologies including SQL Server, Power BI, Power Pivot and Azure environment. Excellent SQL skills to write complex queries involving multiple tables and develop stored procedures, triggers, user defined functions.
Proficiency in scripting and programming foundations. Knowledge of Python or R for statistical data analysis.

PermanentEmbracing and driving change is critical to our success. The complexity and rate at which the retail industry is transforming has increased exponentially in recent years and we are committed to being a leader in the industry. As such we are relentlessly focused on innovating at every level of our business, investing in new technologies and products, and doubling down on the best talent to drive the company forward. It is an especially exciting time to join the Canadian Tire Family of Companies.

Our Technology team plays a critical role in our evolution, specifically as we transition to an omni-retailer where digital complements the physical. Our commitment to being a world-class digital organization is evident in how we are using cutting-edge technologies to bring our digital strategy to life in-store, online and on your mobile devices, ultimately improving customer experiences, driving traffic, and boosting loyalty.

The Corporate Application Delivery group supports all corporate portfolios with the planning (road mapping) and new capability project delivery. The team works core business hours, with occasional weekend or after-hours engagements to support the implementation of changes. The list of supported portfolios includes, but is not limited to Real Estate, REIT, Corporate Communications, and Jumpstart.

What you’ll do

As a member of the Corporate Application Delivery team the Senior Business Systems Analyst will help define and deliver solutions that meet business objectives and will serve as the ultimate facilitator between the business and IT in truly understanding the business’ needs. The Sr. BSA will contribute to the delivery of projects using the Agile delivery methodology. In partnership with Project Managers, Product owners, Business Stakeholders and IT interfacing groups The Sr. BA will lead the planning, requirements eliciting, analyzing designs, executing configuration changes, creation of test cases, implementation planning and support.

Specific duties include:
Knowledge of Business System Analysis (BSA) principles and techniques

Experience working with business and technology partners to drive discovery of the requirements

Perform work on all aspects of the business analyst process from end to end (SDLC/PMLC: Must be able to support the lifecycle of a requirement package)

Perform all aspects of research, analysis and problem-solve issues with exceptional attention to detail, follow up through resolution, escalating when necessary

Experience with data analysis and reporting

Strong SQL skills – ability to build complex queries, read and understand code and perform in-depth data analysis using SQL and Excel

Excellent communication (most meetings are done over the phone), elicitation and facilitation skills

Strong documentations skills using MS Office tools (incl. Visio diagrams)

Strong team player with ability to communicate effectively with multiple stakeholders of varying levels of seniority

Think critically, and provide innovative/creative solutions to existing problems

Effective time management skills; Able to work independently and manage multiple deadlines/projects

Experience in infrastructure and application upgrade projects is an asset

Facilitate or participate in JAM sessions to refine scope into a project’s initial requirements (user stories) and high-level design, producing appropriate documentation as needed.

Support the Scrum Master and Project Manager during all phases of the project

Understanding of business case development and ongoing project level financials

Enterprise analysis – plan and scope several inter-related initiatives

Apply process standards to technology solutions

Execute system configuration changes as per project requirements

Provide support and participate in change management

Translate system functionality into business relevant language

Strong knowledge of business process design, mapping and optimization

Strong interpersonal and communication skills to play a key role within the project team

Strong planning and organizational skills, ability to prioritize, meet time commitments

Bridge the gap between both business and IT teams, ensuring common understanding and alignment of both functional and non-functional requirements

Build stakeholder trust by understanding business concepts, issues, opportunities and language

Convey requirements and design concepts with models such as gap analysis, UE cases and prototypes

In waterfall projects: using best practice methods and tools, you will be responsible for creating key deliverables like process flows, requirements packages, high level design packages, test cases and implementation plans for stakeholder approval

In waterfall projects: you will implement complete requirements tracking from business objectives, through all project phases, and into downstream processes to ensure consistent and accurate translation of requirements through all SDLC phases

In Agile projects: you will be responsible for creating, refining and maintaining user stories and associated deliverables such as process flows and test cases to meet development and stakeholder needs

Facilitate problem-solving discussions and general communications between the business and IT and within IT itself

Canadian Tire experience and organizational knowledge preferred

Who you are

We are looking for high performing individuals who are:
Agile and innovative individuals, who are able to manage in an environment of change and ambiguity to help us take bold and strategic moves in this rapidly evolving retail environment

Creative thinkers who take initiative and are capable of building, launching and managing projects/programs that drive results for our customers

Problem solvers with the ability to analyze and prioritize to meet business objectives

Collaborative team players with superior influencing skills, who build relationships easily across various stakeholder groups to move initiatives forward

If you’re curious, ready to take on new challenges and open to doing things differently to help us evolve rapidly, then Canadian Tire is definitely the place to be.

What you’ve done

University degree or equivalent

Minimum of 3 years of experience as a Business Analyst in a project-based environment

Fluent in technology and strong knowledge of project and software administration methodologies/techniques

Excellent verbal and communication skills.

Proficiency in written English and good documentation skills.

Good interpersonal skills.

Willingness to provide off-hours support as required

Why us

Canadian Tire is one of Canada’s most iconic and diversified companies. Our culture and values uphold our pledge to sustainable practices, and commitment to our local communities through Jumpstart cannot be beat.

PermanentHelping Albertans achieve their dreams by turning the complex world of banking into brilliantly simple solutions. That’s ATB. Is that you?
Business Systems Analyst – Bank Analyzer
We can transform banking, reimagine it, make banking work for people. We’re on a journey to make meaningful impacts on an industry that has the power to transform a person’s life. When we talk about transformation at ATB Financial, we’re not just talking about pie in the sky ideas, we’re listening and collaborating to bring those ideas to life. To put it simply, we’re on a mission to reinvent how banking can support people's lives. We’re going to provide meaningful solutions to problems, deepen our connection with customers and while we’re at it, transform ourselves from the inside out.
We need collaborative visionaries and executors who are eager to listen to our customers in order to do things other banks wouldn’t do. We’re building a team of relentless, passionate and inquisitive ATB transformers to build our bench strength in disrupting ourselves before we get disrupted.
Want to be a part of our story? If you’re looking for an organization where you can use your talents to do remarkable things, you may be the alpha to our beta and we encourage you to read on.
TEAM TRANSFORMATION:
We’re invested in transparency being a key part of our recruitment process, so we encourage you to check out and join our Team Transformation Talent Community on LinkedIn to gain real insight on our culture and what it's really like to be an ATB Transformer. You can check it out and join us at https://www.linkedin.com/groups/13551363.
Also, to learn more our work and the transformative projects we have on the go connect with us at https://atbalphabeta.com/.
THE OPPORTUNITY:

The Business Systems Analyst will be a primary resource responsible for the day-to-day production support of the Bank Analyzer application on ATB’s Adaptive Financial Systems team. In addition, the successful candidate will provide a wide range of SAP services as part of the work on development projects, including: new application design, development and implementation, systems integration, and testing. The Business Systems Analyst will work alongside Solution Architects, Programmers, Systems Analysts, and Quality Assurance Analysts to understand the system requirements, and the SAP system configuration that meets those requirements.
You will find success based on your ability to:
Act as a subject matter expert with regards to programming, system design, and development related activities. This may include leading configuration and design reviews within a project team.
Work directly with Solution Architects, other Programmer Analysts, Quality Assurance Analysts, Project Managers, Project Analysts, and Business Analysts to design, develop, and document new business applications, and maintain existing ones.
Interact with other departments to clarify and build applications that meet our business partner’s objectives. These departments include, but are not limited to: Finance, Risk and Treasury.
Prepare plans for application construction, implementation and ongoing system support.
Create and vet use case requirements and specifications.
Provide work estimates to managers and project managers as requested. This may include working with Programmers to develop such estimate.
Assist in the development, implementation, and adherence of systems development methodologies within projects.
Construct new applications, interfaces and maintenance changes.
Ensure data integrity and accuracy.
Prepare system documentation and training material.
Job Requirements
As the ideal candidate you possess:
KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS & ABILITIES:
Recognized Information Technology training (university/college/technical school or equivalent experience), with a minimum of 2 years of IT experience. A concentration in finance technology support is an asset.
Exposure to operational process lifecycles and sustainment control methods: error handling concepts, data cleansing and traceability, break-fix analysis, business process monitoring, and others.
System Configuration, Business Analysis and functional specification experience in the following is a plus:
SAP Bank Analyzer, SAP Transactional Banking, Oracle Financials, PeopleSoft, SAP BW.
The following code experience would also be a benefit:
SQL, MYSQL, DB2, SAS, ABAP, Java.
Post-secondary education in finance, accounting, economics or business management and/or financial industry experience, with extensive knowledge in transactional lifecycle or retail financial services, would be a benefit.
Event or transactional based reporting or accounting analysis, as well as a demonstrated understanding of complex accounting methods, are a plus.
Business Analysis, Financial Analysis, product reporting management or previous project experience are all additional skills that would be considered.
Demonstrated understanding or ability to learn detailed technical and business processes.
Strong verbal and written communication skills.
Self-motivated, with a desire to grow and to learn challenging concepts in a relatively short period of time.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Strong time management, prioritization, and organizational skills.
Demonstrated ability to respond to a changing environment.
ATTRIBUTES FOR SUCCESS:
You focus on impact over hard work: what isn't of a concern is the hours you work, but your results and impact on team members and customers
You like to solve difficult problems, together: no one said transforming banking was going to be easy, but we’re collectively reimagining it and there are no solo heroes welcome
You operate with a mentality of Build-Measure-Learn: our agile mindset is not just for our technical teams, it's a mindset that every one of us is asked to operate from. We move fast, we make mistakes but we measure the impact, learn, grow and change as a result
You focus on 10X and leave the incremental thinking at home: if something doesn't have significant impact, you are the person to challenge whether or not it's worth doing
You do it with passion or not at all: you’re inspired by our purpose and you see the link between yourself and the work you are doing to transform banking
You’re comfortable with being uncomfortable: we won’t always have the answers and change is a constant in our world. As a Transformer you trust in our vision and own an attitude of willingness and patience
You keep the customer at the heart of everything you do: Empathy is a core driver in which you navigate the world. You don’t build products, processes and solutions for the sake of checking something off your checklist, you build with the end user in mind, openly engaging new ideas, listening with intent and making decisions with the desire to balance both compassion with logical reasoning.

As a team member with the Transformation team at ATB, you can expect:
No day will ever be the same - we’re learning, iterating and making big steps towards our vision of transforming an entire industry, everyday
The ability to grow a career within an inspiring, impact focused culture where you are surrounded by changemakers and leaders that empower you to use your voice to make banking work for people
To be a part of the energy of an organization that is unlike any other, where you may pinch yourself on the daily and wonder how you got so lucky
Bragging rights! You get to call yourself a Transformer and an ATBer and know you play a direct role in helping us become a cutting edge financial institution (it’s going to feel more like a technology company, but either way it’s hella cool.)
So what can ATB Financial offer you? Imagine paying less for your everyday banking, mortgages, loans and investments. Throw in an excellent benefits and pension package, opportunities for career advancement, and a financial institution that’s leading the way in change – now you’re talking about a career with a company that allows you to grow. As an award-winning employer-of-choice – we have the best of the best working for Albertans. Sound like a team you want to be a part of?
Advancement. Fun. Rewards… We get it.

STEP into a career with one of BC’s Top Employers since 2009.

The Liquor Distribution Branch (LDB) is one of the largest distributors and retailers of beverage alcohol in Canada, generating a net income of approximately $1.08 billion on annual sales of approximately $3.3 billion in fiscal 2016/17. LDB has a workforce of approximately 4,000 full and part-time employees, operates 197 retail stores across the province, oversees the operations of approximately 220 Rural Agency Stores and has the role of wholesaler to approximately 700 private liquor retail outlets and 10,000 licensed establishments.

The LDB is a unique government entity that operates with similar independence to a Crown Corporation under the direction of a General Manager and CEO.
In February 2018, the LDB was assigned to distribute, wholesale and sell non-medicinal cannabis inclusive of a government owned online channel with a mandate to support government’s key priorities of protecting children and youth, ensuring health and safety standards, and keeping the criminal element out of the supply chain. Effective October 17, 2018 the LDB has added wholesaling and retailing of non-medical cannabis –named LDB Cannabis Operations to the existing business of wholesaling and retailing of Liquor.
LDB’s Information Technology Division (IT) provides reliable, responsive and secure systems and services to support LDB in operational excellence and delivering superior customer service.
The LDB’s Information Technology Division consists of six departments and 23 distinctive units, with 200+ FTEs. IT has adopted a multi-sourcing strategy and leverages a combination of internal and external expertise, including outsourced services, contracted services and shared services, to deliver the IT mandate of supporting current operations and future business needs. Strategic plans, governance of standards and risk management are all developed internally to support Divisional and Corporate goals.
The Technical Analyst supports the development of systems changes/enhancements through the various phases of the application development life cycle and undertakes integration project work which has a significant impact on client departments. This position is responsible for supporting the planning, analyzing, designing, developing, testing and implementation of effective solutions to meet requirements and maintaining and enhancing assigned systems as necessary.
This position oversees system applications’ maintenance and enhancements from small to medium initiatives entailing both short and long term projects that may be either of a self-contained nature or ones which require the assignment, coordination and monitoring of work performed by other team or project resources to support the business objectives of the BC Liquor Distribution Branch.
The Technical Analyst emphasis project control, coordination of project performance and economic utilization of resources assigned to the project and in-depth systems analysis to deliver key benefits to LDB departments.

With close to 50 years of physician-focused experience, MD has one main goal: to help Canada's physicians and their families achieve financial well-being. Our commitment to work/life integration, employee well-being and ongoing learning are key factors that contribute to our overall success.
For the sixth consecutive year, MD Financial Management has been recognized as one of the Achievers 50 Most Engaged Workplaces in North America. The annual award, given by Achievers, an industry-leading provider of employee recognition and engagement solutions, commends top employers that display leadership and innovation in engaging their workforces.

What You Will Do:

Reporting to the Manager, Operations & Finance Projects, as the Process Analyst, you will be responsible for enabling the success of process automation and improvement initiatives by working closely with Finance and Operations subject matter experts to develop and document business processes. As a key member of the RPA team, the Process Analyst’s contribution to each initiative requires a mixture of methodology, curiosity and attention to detail.

In this role, you will facilitate workshops with stakeholders and SME’s to gather information and create and/or update current state process maps. You will also job shadow SME’s to identify existing process exceptions and error handling.

An important aspect of your duties will be to assess findings on business processes, methods, systems and procedures for potential business process improvement and make recommendations as required. You will prepare detailed process documentation required to support robotic process automation. In addition, you will participate in RPA build and test cycle to ensure outcomes meet functional requirements prior to User Acceptance Testing (UAT).

As the Process Analyst, you will also be responsible for the creation of future solution design documentation, including future state maps. You will prepare additional documentation as required to support RPA deployment to production environments based on input from team members. Lastly you will create work instructions and user documentation where required. .

What You Need:

A University degree, or equivalent educational or professional experience and/or qualifications

8-10 years of experience eliciting and documenting business requirements and solution requirements including functional, non-functional and data requirements

Advanced knowledge of MS Office Tools particularly Visio

Agile, Six Sigma, Lean experience an asset

Demonstrated ability with the people side of change enabling successful adoption of new technologies and processes

Familiarity with process automation software such as Blue Prism a definite asset

What You Bring:

Excellent interpersonal skills and ability to thrive in a team environment

Superior attention to detail

Time management and task prioritization abilities with an emphasis on balancing competing deliverables

Strong verbal and written communication skills

Ability to develop and recommend creative solutions to complex client problems

Ability to work with minimum supervision and take initiative

Flexibility and a willingness to do what it take to get the job done within established deadline

What Success Looks Like:

You are passionate about the MD value proposition.

job_title: Business Support Analyst- Clinical Design Teams - CST Project
job_description:
Work Site: CST Project Offices - West 8th Avenue

Status: Regular Full Time

Reference#: 111704-ale


JOB SUMMARY:

The Project:

The Clinical & Systems Transformation (CST) Project is one of the largest health care projects in British Columbia's history. It is a joint undertaking between Vancouver Coastal Health, the Provincial Health Services Authority and Providence Health Care to complete a significant transformation of clinical practices and systems. This is an exciting initiative that will deliver key benefits for our patients, health care providers and health organizations.

Job Summary:
Reporting to the designated Manager/Director, the Business Analyst is an integral member of the team providing guidance to senior staff to determine requirements for new health informatics initiatives, including performance measurement and reporting, and program development. Through knowledge of the health system, the Business Support Analyst will document and analyze processes, gather requirements, perform best practice reviews, gather data to support, prioritize and align business case development and requests, and performs current state assessments and gap analysis on initiatives.

The Business Support Analyst liaises with a broad spectrum of clinical, IT and business stakeholders and leaders to assist in translating technical issues into a single, shared and realistic vision.

Key Accountabilities include:
Liaising with stakeholders to understand project structures, policies, workflows, requirements and operations to identify, model and document business, process, and data requirements;
Acting as an advisor to the team(s) by assessing project risks, identifying risk mitigation strategies and opportunities and monitoring risk throughout the life cycle of the project and recommending solutions to achieve goals and outcomes.
Supporting testing;
Development of implementation materials;
Process definition and design;
Translating technical issues and architectural complexities in a manner that assists project stakeholders in understanding issues more clearly;
Working with project stakeholders to test and validate requirements and analysis models by various methods such as reviews, walkthroughs, etc. as appropriate;
As required, assisting in writing user acceptance test cases and liaise between project stakeholders and testing groups; May configure and build using the Cerner build tools;
Developing and documenting detailed application specifications;
Validating specification documentation;
Providing project management support to coordinate and monitor the project and key deliverables
Interacting with stakeholders at all levels, receiving input, and preparing reports for all levels of governance and stakeholders; and,
Performing other related duties as assigned.

QUALIFICATIONS AND EXPERTISE

Qualifications:
Bachelor’s Degree in Business Administration, Clinical Informatics or related discipline, plus a minimum of five (5) years’ recent, related experience in health care or information management, or an equivalent combination of education, training and experience. Master’s degree preferred.
Expertise
Superior analytical skills , documentation, workflows, including the ability to comprehend, analyze and resolve complex issues.
Highly developed business writing and verbal communication skills with the ability to document work appropriately.
Knowledge of project structures; business case development; documentation of workflows; health care setting and analytical tools.
Demonstrable skills handling change requests, impacts, and tracking tasks, actions, risks, issues and impacts.
Resourceful; well-organized; systematic analysis; strategic thinking; critical thinking; attention to detail; leadership and management skills.
Technical writing experience is considered an asset.
Knowledge of information technology applications and outcomes achieved through new platforms
Demonstrated ability to exercise good judgment and initiative, deal with frequent changes; make decisions for a wide variety of complex business matters.
Demonstrated ability to use database, spreadsheet and word processing software at an advanced level.
Physical ability to perform the duties of the job.
Please note:
Hours of Work may vary due to project requirements.
Successful applicants may be required to complete a Criminal Records Review Check.
Only short-listed applicants will be contacted for this posting.

TemporaryFleming College is seeking to hire a Technical Business Analyst – Human Resources.

Note: This is a full-time temporary 9-month assignment, October 2018 to June 2019.

What This Position is About:
As the Technical Business Analyst, you are responsible for rolling out new functions and features within the HR system. We use many of the PeopleSoft HR modules (Human Resources, Payroll, Time & Labour, Absence, Recruiting and Learning) and have a long list of features that we would like to take advantage of. You will be an integral member of the technical support team and this requires that you understand the current business process, configure the system to best suit our needs, train the appropriate users and support the system once it is rolled out.

As a key member of the broader HR team, you would provide operational support to that team and will be constantly relied upon to provide accurate data and business analytics for both operational and strategic business needs. You would develop a portfolio of reports to provide to the College’s users or to external parties. You would respond to the request, understand the user’s requirements, develop the report and then deploy it to the requestor. Your day-to-day support may include the troubleshooting of unexpected problems, reacting to government-legislated or collective agreement changes or keeping our system up-to-date with respect to regular maintenance. This could range from diagnosing and solving a problem in 30 minutes or, testing a new PeopleSoft enhancement for several months. You deliver this work in collaboration with the College’s Information Technology teams.

Your acute business acumen helps shape strategic suggestions to ensure that the solutions you provide are well thought out and analyzed from all angles. Your ability to clearly analyze situations and articulate the relevant data considerations are critical in understanding the benefits and risks for the solutions that are being put forward.

What We Are Looking For:
You will be reporting to me, Colin Hughes, Project Manager & Technical Lead, and you will need to operate as both an outstanding collaborative member of various functional teams and as an independent contributor to find and implement creative solutions. You will need to exemplify incredible customer service and gladly assist someone with whatever problem they have. You will need to be an excellent practitioner of change management who is a ble to create and deliver differentiated training materials and techniques which enable users to take full advantage of our HR systems.

You have a 3-year diploma or degree in Computer Science or related field. You have a minimum of five (5) years of recent work experience in any combination of the following:

Functional experience with Enterprise Resource Planning software, such as PeopleSoft.
Advanced knowledge of database reporting tools.
Project management.
Requirements definition and translation into solutions.
Functional testing.
Troubleshooting system problems.
Training and presentations.

In addition, you will possess excellent communication skills (oral and written) and interpersonal skills which allow you to work effectively in a fast-paced, customer-service focused team amid critical deadlines, multiple projects and competing priorities.

This is an opportunity to bring your unique skills to the Human Resources department, while at the same time challenging yourself along the way. If you see yourself in this role, we welcome your application!

Mercer’s Career consulting business helps our clients around the world engage their talent to drive business performance. As a consultant within our Career practice, you will partner with board members, top-level executives, and HR leaders to optimize business performance through strategies that enable organizations to better manage, reward, and engage their people. We stay ahead of the competition by providing best-in-class information, unsurpassed global reach, dedicated support services, and innovative solutions. Our practice areas include: Rewards, Talent Strategy, HR Transformation, Communication, and Mobility.
Your career will begin within Mercer’s Rewards practice as a Career Rewards Consulting Analyst. You will work with a broad range of clients from various industries in a highly stimulating environment. Working along-side high-performing individuals within project teams, you will help diagnose issues and design strategic solutions that help our clients drive shareholder value.
Your role at Mercer will be to:
Work within a team to provide quantitative and qualitative analytical support to senior consultants.
Conduct research and analysis to understand industry and organization-specific issues, including business strategy, corporate performance, reward practices and industry trends.
Analyze clients' strategic, financial, and organizational information to provide insights that will develop into rewards strategies and solutions.
Prepare client presentations that will be presented to boards of directors, senior-level executives, and/or management.
Example projects include:
Benchmarking and assessing executive, board of director, and workforce compensation levels and compensation design.
Advising companies on human capital integration and retention strategies during corporate transactions (e.g., M&A).
Helping clients utilize best practices in corporate compensation governance.
Conducting job evaluation and pay equity analysis to ensure organizations are compliant with legislation.
Providing clients with market trends regarding compensation and incentive design practices.
Developing career frameworks and structures for an organization’s employees, including salary structures, workforce and succession planning and workforce analytics.
Helping clients re-think and re-design their performance management system.
Education and Experience:
A bachelor's or master’s degree in business, finance, accounting, HR, economics, statistics, or mathematics.
Consulting, business, finance/banking, accounting, HR, and/or economics internship experience.
Strong analytical skills, both quantitative and qualitative, and excellent Excel capabilities.
Experience in data analysis, financial modeling, and presentation design.
Excellent interpersonal, verbal, and written communication skills.
Intellectual curiosity, superior organizational skills, and strong attention to detail.
Flexibility, adaptability, and the ability to work under tight deadlines and changing client needs.
Office Location: Calgary
To apply:
Please submit your cover letter, a one-page resume, and university transcripts via our website at www.mercer.ca (Careers Section).
Please note the start date for this position is in the Summer of 2019.

Using analysis and insights as catalysts for change, we anticipate and understand the individual impact of business decisions, now and in the future. Do you love turning huge amounts of raw data into clean, thoughtfully-analyzed intel that can be used to guide strategic decisions? Do you have the technical skills to take on complex data stories, plus the foundational experience to guide and support junior data analysts? If yes, we’re looking for someone like you to join our rapidly growing eCommerce team as an Applied Data Scientist.
At Best Buy Canada, we believe empowered people and teams make smarter, faster, and more creative decisions. Our eCommerce department is a truly Agile environment, where the distance between any one person and senior leadership is microscopic. Here, you’ll work on something big, small, or super cool and before you can blink 100,000 people will see it. You’ll create fast, learn fast, and develop fast. Oh, and sometimes you’ll fail fast too. That’s ok. (Honestly.) It’s all part of the process.
As an Applied Data Scientist on the Digital Intelligence (DI) team, you’ll be integral to our goal of building seamless online user experiences. As an expert in analytics and eCommerce, you’ll deep-dive into multiple data sources, seeking critical insights and answers to important business questions. In this holistic role, you’ll create revenue-driving business strategies based on analytical insights and leverage your relationships with key stakeholders to communicate them out.
What you’ll be doing:

Stitching, transforming, and cleaning various forms of data, including transactional data, customer behavior data, and text strings (such as customer reviews)
Developing and using advanced machine learning algorithms and statistics to build predictive models, such as sales forecasting and product price optimization, to support decision making in our eCommerce department
Recommending and supporting tools and services for the management of our data and machine learning algorithms
Leading large analytics projects involving multiple junior analysts by leveraging data management techniques, machine learning technology, and advanced visualization tools
Coordinating with corporate BI to establish clear data pipelines with a high level of data hygiene
Creating team- and department-wide efficiencies by automating tasks and analysis using SQL, R, and Python
Coaching digital analysts on data science best practices and guide them when working on complex problem
Championing a data-driven culture by supporting the eCommerce department to raise its overall analytic IQ through formal training, workshops, insights meetings, and presentations to senior leadership

The experience we need…
5+ years experience completing data-driven analyses to solve business problems and generate revenue within a large eCommerce organization
3+ years experience managing and prioritizing project requests, frequently presenting insights and strategies to a diverse set of stakeholders ranging from peers to senior executives
Knowledge of advanced statistical techniques and concepts, machine learning techniques and experiences with applications
Descriptive and predictive modeling and model testing
Strong understanding of experimental design (e.g. multivariate testing vs AB Testing, full factorial vs fractional-factorial
Proficiency in analyzing data using various statistical methods
Experience transforming large scale data sets using SQL, Spark, or other big data technologies
Advanced knowledge of at least one scripting language such as R or Python

Bonus points…
1+ year(s) experience working in an Agile environment; familiarity with JIRA, Confluence
Experience working with advertising measurement methods and technologies
Familiarity with cloud platforms (MS Azure preferred) and PAAS technologies
Advanced business understanding of the retail and eCommerce space

$72,444 - $94,964 a yearDo you enjoy working with data? Are you ready to expand your knowledge and skills for transforming data into high quality information enabling health system evidence-based decision making? If so, the Analytics and Performance Reporting (APR) Branch in the Health System Quality and Performance (HSQP) Division has an exciting opportunity for you!

APR responds to internal and external requests for analytic information and reporting to support informed decision making, business planning, health system monitoring, evaluation, performance management, and policy development.


In this role you will be working independently or leading project teams, preparing analytic information and reports, creating data cubes, data marts and data visualizations, and providing analytics support to the Ministry and other health system stakeholders.


You will employ your analytical and research skills to select the most appropriate methodologies, define the research problems, collect, transform and analyze data, write computer programs in SAS/R/Python, and use data science and machine learning algorithms as deemed necessary. You will be expected to conduct literature review, research on methodology, write qualitative and quantitate results in plain language for reporting purpose, apply your technical knowledge about managing very large databases for complex analytics initiatives and data management.

To be successful in this role, you need to be self-directed and have the knowledge, skills and abilities to engage in collaborative relationships with clients requesting analytic information products and seeking analytic support.

The following APS Competencies are critical to this role:

Drive for Results: The ability to manage a number of projects in a timely and cost effective manner so they follow provincial government and industry best practices.

Develop Self and Others: The job revolves around complex projects with the goal of producing high quality work within tight time constraints. The candidate must be skillful in identifying options and implementing contingency plans as well as having the ability to quickly shift priorities.

Build Collaborative Environments: By providing advice on information products and issues and also advise on areas of expertise to a range of stakeholders.


Qualifications

A University degree (Master's preferred) in statistics, computer science, public health/administration, biostatistics, economics, finance, or equivalents, plus a minimum of 4 years of directly related experience is required. Must have SAS programming skills (Classic or Enterprise Guide). Experience in SQL (Structured Query Language), R, or Python are desired. Project management experience is beneficial. Experience with health-related and/or large datasets is an asset. Research and professional writing skills will also be considered an asset. Equivalencies will be considered.


Competencies

Competencies are behaviors that are essential to reach our goals in serving Albertans. We encourage you to have an in depth understanding of the competencies that are required for this opportunity and to be prepared to demonstrate them during the recruitment process. The link below will assist you with understanding competencies: http://www.psc.alberta.ca/Practitioners/?file=learning/apscompetencies/titlepage&cf=9

As part of the interview process, shortlisted candidates will be required to complete a written test. Candidates are required to submit a well-written cover letter with their application to be considered on this competition.

Business Analyst (AP)
Provincial Health Services Authority - Staffing Solutions
Support the development of our health care providers by championing change and innovation in a dynamic environment.
We are currently seeking a Business Analyst with experience in Accounts Payable (AP) who is looking for an opportunity to gain valuable experience in health care.
This role works closely with the stakeholder groups across and reviews, evaluates and recommends improvement and standardization of business processes to ensure effective utilization of systems while maintaining internal controls and safeguards. Other responsibilities include troubleshooting of assigned business processes and applications and conducting training for staff on the functionality of the business process and systems utilized. This position also plays a critical role in supporting the AP Manager in gathering, analyzing, and reviewing data and/or internal controls prior to responding to Internal Audit projects/investigations, and assists with regular External Audit requests. The Business Analyst is responsible for the regular monitoring of internal controls, collection of evidence, and support of AP Team - ensuring the compliance of internal controls and that they are operating as designed.
Duties:
Researches all variables impacting the timely and accurate processing of AP invoices, including invoice match exceptions between purchase orders, receipts and invoices utilizing computerized materials management systems and software applications. Provides support and training to accounts payable team to manage match exceptions as necessary.
Investigates problem invoices by gathering the appropriate supporting transaction documents, performing analysis and determining applicable solutions.
Develops training manuals and business processes to support the AP business stream.
Troubleshoots data errors and system inconsistencies. Identifies problem areas and improvements to the procurement business process and recommends longer term solutions on an ongoing basis. Provides training and guidance in relation to match exceptions as required within various departments.
Participates in systems development and maintenance by developing and analyzing key performance indicators, identifying needs and defining system requirements, creating project work plans and assisting the team in system development, implementation, documentation, interfacing and maintenance within established policies and guidelines in accordance with the strategic plan.
Performs data gathering and analysis for the function to facilitate operational activities.
Reviews, analyses and evaluates Current State (As Is) and Future State (To Be) business processes, systems and user needs. Provides recommendations for process improvement for the function and works with AP team and manager to evaluate alternative procedural and systematic solutions which most effectively meet needs while maintaining acceptable business standards and internal controls.
Provides user orientation and training based on system and process changes. Develops and maintains reference documentation such as workflow charts, user instructions, manuals and reference materials on business processes, policies and procedures.
Actively supports the Accounts Payable Manager in ensuring that internal controls activities such as monitoring controls are performed, documented and maintained for evidence by Internal and External Auditors.
Supports and participates in highly sensitive investigations. Provides support to the AP manager in gathering and reviewing data, assesses risk and uses judgment to identify key areas of risk. Works closely with AP Manager to provide recommendations to Audit Findings and implement additional internal controls where necessary.
Demonstrates a commitment to continuous learning and continuous improvement within the AP functions including development of internal processes and team members.
May be required to provide input into the development and submission of the annual operating budget and capital planning requirements; monitor expenditures, identify variances from approved budgets, generate financial impact summary reports and recommend corrective action.
Experience with ERP systems and PeopleSoft is preferred

Why work for Lafarge?
Lafarge in Canada is proud to provide construction solutions in the buildings, infrastructure and industrial segments. These solutions are built with high performance products from our cement, aggregates, ready-mix concrete, asphalt and road construction, and concrete products divisions. From the use of alternative materials and recycling to renewable energy, Lafarge's focus is to develop innovative products that can contribute toward sustainably constructed building solutions. Lafarge takes personal growth and development to heart, and provides resources for our employees to take control of their own careers. Through our commitment to communities, to the health and safety of our employees and their families, or through the many volunteer hours of our employees, Lafarge demonstrates our care for people. If you want to work in an environment that values hard work, entrepreneurship, and collaborative teamwork, Lafarge is for you. Building Better Cities is what we do. Come Build a Better Career with us! More information can be found at www.lafarge.ca/en/careers .

YOUR NEXT CHALLENGE:

Description:
The Senior Data and Reporting Analyst will work at our corporate head office in downtown Toronto and assist in the cleanup and maintenance of our HR Master Data shared across multiple HR applications. The role is critical in bringing and maintaining consistency of HR data management practices across the organization.

Reporting to the HR Systems Manager, the Data and Reporting Analyst will collaborate with the HR Regional team, the Corporate HR team and the HR Systems teams to lead and deliver the HR data integrity project. The project will be run in 3 phases and the key responsibilities by phase outlined in the following responsibilities.
Responsibilities:

Phase One: Discovery and Analysis

 Interpret national/provincial/federal regulations to determine implications to current HR data management and reporting practices.
 Identify system and business logic rules in data management to identify data quality gaps and business impacts. Collaborate with stakeholders and subject matter experts to elicit, analyze, communicate and validate requirements for changes to business processes (e.g. client onboarding), policies, systems and data management practices.
 Audit existing data to identify issues related to accuracy, completeness and integrity. Interpret data issues to identify corrective actions for reporting practices.
 Identify opportunities to standardize and centralize HR data.

Phase Two: Data Cleaning and Data Management Standards

 Design the New Data Management and Reporting Practices to ensure HR Data integrity, accuracy and completeness.
 Seek out industry trends to generate and recommend alternative approaches to managing workforce related data and reporting.
 Test new data flows and remediate issues.
 Data Error Resolution by responding to, correcting and identifying the root of data errors - work with the Data Stewards (local payroll and HR use) to ensure HR data integrity, to clearly communicate errors, resolution procedures and new data management practices.
 Train Data Stewards in the application of the new data management practices, if needed.

Phase three: Maintenance of data - execute and optimize Data Management practices

 Support regional team in the maintenance of the data management practices. Serve as a Data Governance & Management communication point of contact to all stakeholders.
 Run bi-weekly Data Audits and correct triggering practice.
 Collaborate with stakeholders and subject matter experts to optimize the data management practices.
 Document finding regarding data challenges and corrections needs.

And all other ad hoc duties as assigned.

WHAT YOU NEED TO SUCCEED

Qualifications:

 5+ years of experience on HR related projects with data impact.
 5+ years of experience as a Data Reporting Analyst
 Excellent working knowledge with MS Office applications (MS Excel in particular) and Visio.
 Knowledge of database principles and SQL language
 Strong organizational skills, prioritization and results orientated to handle multiple tasks/projects and to work independently.
 Good interpersonal skills and ability to work in a multinational organization (Canada, Mexico, Finland, Sweden).
 Systematic thinker, data and analytical abilities.
 Strong mathematical and literacy skills, complemented by excellent visual accuracy skills, accuracy and attention to detail.
 Experience with data manipulation, data transfer automation, analysis and reporting.
 Ability to interface with management, users, and information technology professionals to solve complex business problems.
 Availability to travel in Canada and abroad.
 Languages: English (mandatory). French, Spanish or Finnish an asset.
Knowledge of:
o HR data concepts as they pertain to all HR processes and impact in other corporate processes (Accounting, Maintenance, Health and Safety, etc.).
o Process and data analysis practices and guidelines.
o Internal audit methodology and practice.
o Global HR processes, practices and technologies.
 Experience in:
o Previous experience using HRMS mandatory. Previous work with JD Edwards is an asset.
o Project Management or Change Management practices.
o Data mapping and data integrations between multiple systems.
o Data audits against multiple/complex criteria.
o Analyzing complex data from multiple perspectives and providing optimization recommendations.

Optez pour une carrière enrichissante avec nous!
...............

Cutting edge solutions? Working for a brand that people know and love? We’ve got you covered!
We reach over 60M users internationally and have been named one of Apple's best apps for 2018. Not to mention we are a trusted, reliable and dependable brand that inspires…we have been ranked 12th overall in the Ipsos’s annual study of Canada’s 100 Most Influential Brands – being #1 for Canadian Brands!
The Opportunity
As our amazing Digital Analyst, you will create sophisticated, insightful and interactive reports, generating insights for audience and yields for our digital platforms, and provide recommendations to solve complex business problems and create awesome customer experiences. This role works with the Digital Services team to grow The Weather Network and MeteoMedia business in Canada, U.S. and emerging markets. You are key in assisting platform owners and internal stakeholders to understand customers and competitors by leveraging data from multiple sources across all our digital properties (i.e. websites, mobile and tablet applications) and within the industry. You have a passion for data, a strong background in quantitative analysis using the latest technologies and a gift for extracting actionable insights!

A day in the life of a Digital Analyst:

Support the analytic needs of the Digital Services business unit by using tools from Google Analytics, Google Optimize, Firebase and others to analyze user data.
Have a deep understanding of how consumers interact with our digital properties and relevant research within the Digital, Mobile and Advertising space to forecast trends
Work closely with the Business Systems team to extract insights and identify key trends within our standardized reporting
Report and analyze user path and engagement activity data across our digital properties
Be investigative and proactive in finding the data that answers the “why” of user behaviour.
Lead our consumer testing process through developing, creating and executing multivariate or A/B/ tests that drive fundamental improvements to the site and app experiences that improve customer experiences and grow the business.
Exhibit a high-level expertise in understanding the data and developing the strategies across platform feedback, surveys, testing, CRM systems and market research.
Own the platform optimization and targeting strategy – work with the steering team to develop algorithmic models to drive insights and further the knowledge base of our user traffic
Work closely with the platform business leads to assist in data visualization for presentations and assist with their decision making
Architecting the procedure and process for how to test and learn and resolve all key debates on design and functionality on all websites and apps
This role manages and analyzes inbound and outbound traffic, assesses performance of our external partnerships, search and other syndicated partnerships with 3rd parties that drive traffic to The Weather Network properties.

This is what YOU have:

BA/Business degree/MBA from an accredited college or university in Business, Finance and/or Marketing focus
Established track record in digital analytics or similar role and at least 3 years of working with Google Analytics, Google Optimize, App Annie, Big Query and SQL
Broad understanding of analytical processes including but not limited to data management, forecasting, optimization, predictive modeling, and visualization

But what really makes you stand out is…

Passionate about digital analytics using large scale data (framing – execution – presentation)
Strong collaborator, yet able to work independently and manage multiple projects/responsibilities
Highly effective communicator; able to clearly articulate key learnings or concepts to non-technical partners; excellent presentation skills
Passion for finding the stories the data can tell
Can orchestrate multiple activities at once to accomplish a goal; anticipates and adjusts for problems and roadblocks

Agfa HealthCare, a member of the Agfa-Gevaert Group, is a leading global provider of diagnostic imaging and healthcare IT solutions. The company has nearly a century of healthcare experience and has been a pioneer on the healthcare IT market since the early 1990's. Today, Agfa HealthCare designs, develops and delivers state-of-the-art systems for capturing, managing and processing diagnostic images and clinical/administrative information for hospitals and healthcare facilities, as well as contrast media solutions to enable effective medical imaging results. The company has sales offices and agents in over 100 markets worldwide.

Agfa HealthCare is currently looking for a Global Data Migration Architect to join its team in Canada. The Global Data Migration Architect will directly report to the Manager of Global Professional Services organization, who is currently located at Agfa HQ (Mortsel, Belgium).

The Global Data Migration Architect will:

Define and analyze the scope of migration in co-operation with the customer and other stakeholders (Agfa Healthcare colleagues, third parties)
Identify migration and quality risks, clarify with customers / third parties and mitigate.
Document scope to hand over to project managers worldwide, guide and coach full migration track.
Design and document solid migration plans and strategies,
Continuously help to improve our migration processes, strategies and tools with your insights, experience and passion.
Continuously meet or exceed the quality standards, as we are working in a Healthcare environment.
The candidate will coordinate all migration activities with the relevant project management teams and will efficiently communicate to provide status updates and to drive the migration projects to completion.
The candidate will provide expert consultation, leadership, guidance and technical assistance to our customers during pre-sales engagements in these areas.

The function covers all phases of HealthCare IT projects, i.e. from pre-sales to services delivery and project closure.

Main responsibilities:
Take lead responsibility for the delivery of Migration Services, offered via the local Agfa organizations, for image enabled Agfa solutions (Radiology PACS, Cardiology PACS, Enterprise Imaging): analysis, design, implementation, testing, validation and acceptance by all parties (customer, local sales organization and 3rd party).
Contribute to the development of Integration and Migration Services as required by the Agfa business.
Ensure adequate end-user support for the Integration and Migration Services and transfer the necessary knowledge to the local, regional and global service organizations.
Responsible for pre-sales and RFP support in relation to Integration and Migration Services.
Deliver pro-actively relevant technological information via the appropriate Agfa information channels (intranet, document and project management systems) to support Agfa sales organizations.

Education
Master degree in ICT, electronics, software engineering or are equally skilled through experience.

Experience

5 years of experience as migration analyst, migration architect or system integration engineer, preferably in a medical environment.
5 years of experience and knowledge of TCP/IP, along with other networking protocols such as NFS, CIFS, FTP, etc.
Experience with the IT standards (e.g. SQL, XML), the HL7 and DICOM standards, as well as with the IHE integration profiles.
Experience with VMware.

Specific skills
Familiar with software engineering and recent programming technologies (Java, C#, .NET, scripting, Web services).
Familiar with the most recent ICT developments: Enterprise Application Integration, Web, Operating Systems (Windows, Linux), Relational Databases (Oracle, SQL Server), multi-tier architectures, platform virtualization.
TCP/IP network and IT systems experience required.
Ability to prioritize multiple tasks to meet business needs.
Excellent written communication using Microsoft Word, Excel and PowerPoint solutions.
Fluent in English both orally and in writing. Knowledge of other languages (Dutch, French or German) is an advantage.
Ability to communicate information and ideas in speaking so others with different skill/background will understand, strong presentation skills,
Ability to organize and conduct training for the sales and support organizations.
Solid problem solving and analytical skills; able to quickly digest any issue/problem encountered and recommend an appropriate solution.
Good knowledge of servers, switches, routers, and various network services
Strong team player who enjoys a fast-paced atmosphere
Ability to manage multiple conflicting priorities, commitments and projects
Ability to influence and drive consensus on multiple technical views
Self-motivated, directed and passionate
Ability to learn quickly
Able and willing to travel occasionally (i.e. for specific occasions)

We offer a rewarding career in a field that impacts lives, the opportunity to work with a talented and committed team of individuals, training and career development programs, and a competitive compensation and benefits package. If you want to be part of this experience, we'll take you there!
