Supply Chain Analyst

Role: Supply Chain Analyst

Location: Toronto, ON

Company: Freshii HQ

Reports To: Manager, Supply Chain

The Supply Chain Analyst will act as a lead interface with partners, vendors, and distributors to provide support to the Freshii stores and to resolve supply issues relating to the supply of goods. This individual will manage internal data and analytics to make key decisions and works with our Franchise and DC community to provide daily supply chain support. The incumbent analyzes and monitors inventory levels and provides forecasts to ensure overall goals in service level, inventory investment, and purchasing compliance are achieved. Projects are technical, with a high degree of complexity across multiple teams, both internal and external, and across multiple platforms. The position utilizes continuous improvement principles to achieve key performance objectives in line with business growth expectation and drive the cost to service efficiencies. Supply Chain is a real-life environment where timely determination and execution of the appropriate response to change is daily work.

Responsibilities:

Own DC-level supply chain metrics and drive best practice to achieve KPIs such as case fill rate, delivery on time, forecast, and inventory obsolescence.

Proactively monitor and identify any gaps between supply and demand and create and execute timely solutions to avoid out of stocks (Medium to long term supply plans).

Reduce waste by managing inventory obsolescence.

Supplier Management, ensuring all forecast and supply flow requirements are executed to defined targets/standards

Work with suppliers on the availability of product, production planning and raw material lead times
Develop, execute and monitor the forecast and supply plan for new product launches, transitions, and promotions.

Liaise and communicate with DCs and partners regarding upcoming product launches, transitions, or product shortages.

Regularly monitor the orders of franchise partners to ensure 100% Supply Chain Compliance is maintained across the system.

Manage the listing of new vendors and items with DC’s

Build and maintain strong relations both with internal and external customers

Provide recommendations for the development and implementation of supply chain network changes and processes, which can enhance efficiencies, KPI’s and service for our partners.



Qualifications:

Bachelor’s Degree in business or Supply Chain certificate (APICS or equivalent)

Knowledge of CPG (Consumer Packaged Goods), Retail or QSR Industry

2+ years of Supply Chain experience ( Supply Planning and/or Demand Forecasting, etc)

Lean Training preferred but not required


Competencies:

Strong customer orientation

Proven continuous improvement and project management skills

Demonstrated strong analytical skills

Have a good understanding of logistics and warehousing

Self-starter and driven for results

Demonstrated ability to work collaboratively in a dynamic environment with cross-functional teams.

Attention to detail with a strong ability to multitask

Excellent Communication Skills (verbal and written)

Ability to deal with complexity and ambiguity

Proactive, persuasive, influential and flexible attitude


Technical Skills:

Intermediate to advanced knowledge of Microsoft Office Suite, including Excel, Access and PowerPoint

Job Description

The Cineplex Digital Media division of Cineplex Entertainment is currently recruiting for a Senior Data Analyst, reporting to the Manager, Research & Insights. The Research & Analytics team is a highly involved team of data professionals who love what we do! We are seeking a talented, enthusiastic and client-focused Senior Data Analyst to join our team.
The Senior Data Analyst oversees and conducts the conversion of data into insights that will lead to informed business decisions. As the Analytics team is small but efficient, he/she will work autonomously with Cineplex Digital Media’s top management and executives to present strategic insights that build a stronger company. The Senior Data Analyst will handle multiple simultaneous tasks and will be expected to remain effective and functional under pressure and aggressive timelines.
In this role you will apply your analytical talent to our rich data environment in order to build intuitive dashboards and insightful business reports. You’ll be an expert problem-solver, delivering insights about the business to a variety of audiences and answering tough questions in an intuitive and understandable way.

Qualifications

Education and technical skills:
Master’s degree in a technical discipline, such as Mathematics/Analytics
Relevant discipline in an undergraduate degree
Experience:
Technical fluency with SQL is mandatory, intermediate Python/R for data modelling is required
2+ years of B2C analytics and business intelligence experience
Superior quantitative analysis ability and experience including campaign design, measurement, data mining and predictive analytics
Familiarity with data visualization tools such as PowerBI and/or Tableau
Strengths:
Must be client facing, and a highly collaborative team player who can influence across and up without reporting line authority.
Intellectual curiosity and passion for digging into data and mining it for insights
Strong time management and organizational skills with the ability to prioritize and manage own workload while multi-tasking in order to meet deadlines.
Ability to create and deliver impactful presentations for different levels of audience across the organization
Key Responsibilities:
Be the Subject Matter Expert on all things analytics for CDM, own and be knowledgeable on CDM’s and Cineplex corporate’s database schemas and ways to manipulate this data to benefit our clients
Work alongside the technical support and operations team to drive operational efficiency and improve data quality
Design dashboards and reports, and create data visualizations to identify trends and drive business insights
Work with internal resources or vendors to conduct market research to augment insights drawn from the customer database.
Work on ad-hoc projects as specified by the Analytics team’s road map and its application to the Product team
Additional Information

Interested applicants please apply today.
While we appreciate all interest, only those candidate selected for an interview will be contacted. As part of Cineplex Entertainment’s standard recruitment process, suitable candidate(s) will be required to undergo pre-employment screening as a condition of employment or promotion.
No Agency Calls Please

QUALIFICATIONS
Undergraduate degree in Commerce, Finance, Economics, Real Estate or Business Administration
2+ years full-time professional experience required in the commercial real estate sector
REQUIRED SKILLS
Demonstrated proficiency with all applicable software packages including but not limited to MS Windows; MS Office, including MS Word, Outlook, and PowerPoint; Adobe

We are currently recruiting for a Business Systems Analyst for our Metrotown office in Burnaby, BC. Verify functionality and scope of testing based on system behaviors

Develop and maintain a significant understanding of all aspects of Interfor’s applications and the industry

Keep up to date with current trends and best practices

Diploma/Degree in information systems or experience in related field
3+ years of experience in a Business Systems Analyst or Business Analyst position
Knowledge of and experience with Dynamics AX, D365 and related components is an asset
A general understanding of Windows based reporting tools (ideally SSRS, Tableau, Power Pivot & Management Reporter) and experience using these tools is an asset

Experience or understanding of the forest industry is an asset
Strong business and customer service orientation
Excellent interpersonal skills
Ability to work effectively in a highly interactive team environment;
Excellent analytical, mathematical, and creative problem-solving skills
Keen attention to detail, strong organizational skills
Able to communicate clearly and concisely in both technical and user-friendly language
Highly self-motivated and directed
Ability to conduct research into systems issues and products as required.

Gathering business requirements
Defining user roles / use case development
Defining functional and non‐functional requirements
Identifying assumptions, constraints, dependencies and risks
Facilitation of meeting and workshops
Strong understanding of accounting functions and processes
Strong understanding of enterprise ERP
The SDLC (Software Development Lifecycle) and testing
Experience working with software documentation/workflow tools is required

Vermilion Energy is currently seeking a Business Systems Analyst for a 6-month contract opportunity, scheduled to begin immediately. Managing the customer relationship between IS and specific business areas

Business area planning that includes integration of legacy systems, documenting business cases to justify new application investments, scheduling and management of application projects
Understanding system architecture for the applications within the portfolio
Developing reports, analyzing and responding to requests for data and new functionality
Troubleshooting and repairing problems that occur in the everyday use of an application
Developing and maintaining technical specifications and documentation

Eight plus (8+) years’ experience as a Business Systems Analyst and Systems Analyst preferably in Land
Highly developed analytical skills;
Excellent written and verbal communication skills, organizational and interpersonal skills;
Experience with supporting land applications such as CS Land
Demonstrated proficiency in business modelling, process modeling, data modeling and effort/cost modeling and estimating;
Demonstrated proficiency with SQL and database query tools – SQL+ or PL/SQL;
Strong multi-tasking and prioritizing abilities
Ability to problem solve through root cause analysis
Strong leadership, decision making and facilitation skills
Ability to forge strong and trusting relationships

Open and honest team player

Vermilion Attractions

COMPANY NAME:
Sunwing Travel Group Inc.

OVERALL OBJECTIVE:
The Business Analyst’s role is to plan, coordinate, assist and support the implementation of business solutions, operational systems and processes in alignment with business strategies and initiatives. Using business, technical and communication skills to work with sponsors, business partners, technical teams and vendors this role analyzes business problems and works to implement efficient solutions and processes. Acts as an enabler in continual process improvement to optimize operations and contribute to improved business results.
This individual is responsible for gathering business requirements, converting them into functional specifications, analyzing data and documenting user stories in support of projects and systems. The Business Analyst is responsible for reporting their findings and exploring possible solutions to business problems to maximize benefits and leverage investments. This position reports to the Sr. Director, Business Systems & Innovations and is based in Toronto, ON.
RESPONSIBILITIES:
Work with business and technology stakeholders to ensure alignment between business needs and technology projects, assets and services
Facilitate discovery sessions, brainstorming and business requirements gathering. Evaluate business requirements, data models, system requirements and vendor analysis when recommending solutions
Analyze and document business problems and present recommendations including gap analysis, business process maps, flow charts and relevant technical documentation
Recreate steps taken by user to locate sources of problems using journey mapping, etc.
Capture and document business requirements, convert them into functional requirements, and identify use cases for approved projects working with business stakeholders, technical teams and vendors
Ensure solutions delivered meet expectations as well as interact with the stakeholders to simplify existing processes and streamline information flow
Participate in the coordination of upgrades and rollout of applications ensuring end user and stakeholder engagement throughout planning and implementation
Conduct business impact assessments. Plan change management activities with the business to encourage adoption by end users and high utilization of the solution. Participate in initial training sessions related to solutions when required
Document current and future state business processes, automating where appropriate
Identify gaps between business needs and deliverables
Develop recommendations to resolve gaps
Make recommendations to the business on how they can optimize their project deliverables to better achieve their objectives
Communicate regularly with business stakeholders to provide updates on key enterprise projects
Other duties as assigned
QUALIFICATIONS:
5+ years of experience in a similar role (Experience with Tour Operator/Airline/Hotel systems preferred)
Degree in a related discipline would be an asset (e.g., B. Com, B.Eng. B.Sc.)
Experience in business analysis, systems analysis, requirements definition and deployment of business requirements to information systems
Working knowledge of capturing business needs and developing business requirements and functional requirements documentation
Strong analytical and problem solving experience to deal with complex business problems
Proven ability to integrate perspectives across many functions and generate solutions
Strong organizational skills with an aptitude to juggle priorities to meet strict deadlines
Sense of initiative, self discipline and proactive thinking
Proven ability to work well under pressure and with minimal supervision
Strong interpersonal skills; must be a team player with solid relationship management skills and a customer centric approach
Advanced communication and facilitation skills
Strong technical aptitude combined with solid business acumen
Highly developed skills with MS Office, Access and Visio. Working knowledge of XML, API’s, SQL and HTML would be an asset
Flexibility and willingness to work extended hours on occasion
ENVIRONMENT AND SCOPE:
Fast paced, deadline oriented work environment
Able to work and share responsibilities within a team environment
Open concept office environment
Sensitive to deadlines

If you are interested in applying for this position please submit your application. We thank all who apply however only those who meet the qualifications will be contacted.
At Sunwing Travel Group Inc. our employees are the difference. We therefore encourage applications from Aboriginal peoples, women, members of a visible minority and persons with a disability.

The Opportunity
To help continue fuel our growth, we are looking for a driven, detail-oriented, flexible, Information Assurance Analyst to expand our Legal & Compliance team. Our Information Security and Compliance team goes above and beyond to ensure that both our internal Trulioo and partner security measures are up to par. This role will report into the Information Security Manager. This is a full-time position in our downtown Vancouver HQ, walking distance from shops, restaurants, and public transit. Compensation is based on experience and includes stock options and benefits.
As a part of our Compliance team you will...
Help coordinate the execution of the Information Security Management System and associated programs
Help ensure continued compliance with ISO27001:2013 certification
Coordinate and participate in responses to RFPs and third party due diligence requests
Assign and evaluate vendor due diligence security responses against company standards
Assist in performing security reviews, assess security products, and implement solutions
Review and help further develop corporate security policies to align with global regulatory and information security standards
Research and formulate analysis to ensure continued compliance with Canadian and global privacy and data protection standards
Disseminate and educate internal teams on all related information, including regular training and awareness campaigns
Assist senior staff in related requests as needed
We're looking for someone who has...
Bachelor's Degree in related field or combination of training and certification
2+ years experience in a similar or related role
Familiarity with system architecture and IT systems
Experience with the information gathering, auditing, and project management process
Interest in becoming the resident expert on privacy, data protection, and information security standards such as ISO27001, PCI, 4AMLD, PIPEDA, and more
Self-motivated, driven, and detail oriented
Able to effectively communicate with peers as well as partners or clients
Experience successfully and resourcefully delivering results
Team player with the ability to also work independently
It's a bonus if you have...
Experience working in a fast paced startup environment
Experience with ISO27001, PCI, and PIPEDA
About Us
Trulioo (Truly You) was founded in 2011 by Stephen Ufford and Tanis Jorge, two Canadian serial entrepreneurs, to help reduce fraud, mitigate risk, and increase trust and safety online.
By providing secure access to GlobalGateway, Trulioo's marketplace of identity data and services, organizations can instantly verify the identities of five billion people and 250 million businesses worldwide through a single API. Trulioo helps organizations automate, digitize and scale their customer onboarding, fraud prevention, and compliance operations around the globe.
Our clients include some of the world's most prominent tech companies, banks, payment processors, and money transfer companies, along with major online marketplaces, financial institutions and gaming companies.
A Silicon Valley-funded tech company, Trulioo is headquartered in Vancouver, with satellite offices in San Francisco and Dublin. Trulioo is the recipient of many prestigious honors and awards, including CNBC Disruptor 50 Company, Best ID Verification and Authentication Solution at the CNP Awards for two consecutive years and ranked #1 for Top Identity Verification Provider in the RegTech Supplier Report three years running. We were also the B.C. winner of Startup Canada's 2018 Global Entrepreneurship Award and were crowned winners of the Compliance Innovation category at the 2018 RemTECH Awards.
Working at Trulioo
Trulioo offers a fast-paced, dynamic work environment where all employees have an impact. The company is growing fast, so we like to work hard and have fun!
We have catered lunches twice a week, fresh fruit and snacks, yoga classes, team-building events, and of course the standard ping-pong and foos. But what should excite you the most about Trulioo is the opportunity to be a key player in revolutionizing how technology, trust, and identity intersect online, and working with people who are excited and motivated to make a difference in an area that touches everyone's lives.
Enjoy a rewarding and challenging startup environment filled with fun perks!
Learn more about us at www.trulioo.com
Trulioo is a growing company and while we thank everyone in advance for considering us, only those who are being considered will be contacted.

UNIVERIS, headquartered in Toronto, Canada, is a privately held company and is the leader in enterprise wealth management for the Canadian market. Founded in 1991, UNIVERIS has over 100 staff and 23 leading financial services clients representing over 14,000 financial advisors on the platform. It offers the most comprehensive wealth management solution for financial advisors in the credit union, banking, insurance and investment dealer sectors.

UNIVERIS is a world-class technology platform that boasts a number of firsts in Canadian mutual fund distribution including real-time processing, web access, built-in compliance, plus GIC and segregated funds processing capabilities. Technology innovation is one of the cornerstones of Univeris' product development strategy and through its Evergreen approach to technology, new features and capabilities transparently integrate into the platform.


ABOUT THE ROLE


The Data Specialist will engage with cross-functional stakeholders to advance the Univeris Data Steward and Data Conversion Solutions, optimizing the use of technology and automation. This self-starting leader will be able to collect, prioritize, and analyze data and data management requirements across each of data integrity, data scrubbing, and complex data conversion. This specialist will have extensive experience in data management, transfer, integrity management, including expertise in modern technologies (ETL) to build, implement, and optimize the conversion process. This individual will be responsible for cultivating working relationships with clients in order to identify needs and deliver high-quality data conversion projects, seeing the client through the inquiry, planning, analysis, development, testing, execution and go-live support stages of the data conversion process. This position is part of the Customer Success COE and reports directly to the VP of IT Services and Customer Success.


SUMMARY OF RESPONSIBILITIES

Evaluates, analyses, identifies, prioritizes requirements to implement ETL (Pentaho or similar) technology to renovate and optimize data conversion initiatives

Evaluates, analyses, identifies, prioritizes requirements to optimize the Data Integrity tools

Evaluates, analyses, identifies, prioritizes existing documented processes, protocols, procedures to optimally commoditize Data Conversion and Integrity documentation

Leads data conversion projects following the Univeris Data Conversion Framework, analyzing opportunities for optimization and automation - including implementing new technologies.

Develops strong relationships with all cross-functional team members including Delivery Managers, Product Managers, Release Management, Business Analysts, Quality Assurance Analysts, Systems Analysts, Developers, IT staff and Clients

Evaluates and implements ETL tools and software packages
Liaises as required with internal Subject Matter Experts and IT support staff and provides input to sizing and configuring the production and conversion environments.

Leverages SaaS, Infrastructure, DevOps, Architecture (enterprise and data), and Technology groups to advance the Data Steward practice

Acts as a technical expert and provides guidance and training to clients and staff on data conversion and application use.

Provides input to data conversion project plan, estimates, timelines, risk management plan and communication plan

Requirements gathering, analysis and documenting the system-to-system data mapping, data validation, data enrichment and data transformation rules

Analyzes the client operating model and data, and identifies potential functional and data gaps.

Creates conversion specifications based upon client’s current platform and the desired organizational model, delivering an ETL package and operational model.

Imports, maps, transforms, analyzes, validates, corrects, loads, audits and reconciles client data between the source system, the Univeris EWMS platform and other data sources

Guides the client to execute data integrity verification programs and to correct data issues.

Works closely with the client to set realistic targets and manages expectations and timelines.

Provides support to the client before, during and after the conversion, identifying areas of risk and creating solutions to prevent or mitigate risk.

Works with and leads outsourced resources as required.

Accountable for the overall success of the data conversion projects and for the client's ability to operate on the Univeris EWMS platform with the converted data

Develops effective relationships with clients, working with the client from initial inquiry, through design, development, system installation, data conversion and support stages.

Works with client to explain the data conversion methodology, explaining the benefits of the Univeris EWMS platform, and providing accurate resolutions and solutions to Client problems related to data conversion.

In the installation and support stages works with client to build and deliver the ETL tool and operational model.

Works with the client to establish accurate and realistic timelines for test and production conversions.

Develops and delivers client training for the operation of data cleanup utilities that are part of the Univeris EWMS platform, customizing the training delivery based on client need, knowledge and skill level.

Provides on-going support to the client following the production conversion to ensure operational fitness using the converted data.

Creates and maintains Data Conversion and/or System Implementation documentation specific to each project based on the Univeris Data Conversion and System Implementation frameworks.

Engages in communities of practice, meetups, to advance the Univeris Data Strategy best practices and technology innovations

Proactively identifies own training needs.


DESIRED SKILLS & EDUCATION


Education

Engineering, Science or Computer Science undergraduate degree/diploma, or equivalent work experience.


Experience & Knowledge

Over 7 years of experience in data steward/conversion and systems analysis, preferably in the financial services industry.

Demonstrated experience with ETL and Enterprise Level conversion using standardized tools (Pentaho Data Integration, Informatica PowerCenter, etc.)

Strong knowledge of data conversion best practices

Ability to prioritize and work independently on multiple concurrent projects.

Solid practical experience with MS SQL Server and PostgreSQL databases, and ability to code (T-SQL, etc.)

Demonstrated verbal and written communication and presentation skills, and experienced in delivering client-facing presentations.

Good understanding of investment products and related processes.


Personal Skills

Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills

Strong interpersonal skills and ability to build business relationships.

Technical and process leadership of project teams that include client and Univeris's resources.

Ability to interact effectively with peers and all levels of management, including all Lines of Business and external stakeholders.

Clear and concise writing and verbal skills are crucial to the ability to obtain and disseminate information.

Excellent facilitation and organizational skills and ability to balance multiple concurrent assignments.

Ability to summarize data into high-level themes.

Collaborates with others both internal staff and clients with consideration and respect.

Provides timely feedback and responses to all, especially clients.

Represents Univeris in a professional and positive manner.

Job Description

The Information Technology department at our Home Office in Toronto has an immediate opening for the position of Project Manager / Business Analyst – AudioVisual reporting directly to the Manager, AV and Digital Signage.
The successful candidate will work closely with Business Groups, IT Resources and 3rd party vendors to deliver service and productivity solutions that provide value to our internal and external customers. Specific deliverables include:
Role & Responsibility
The successful candidate will be work within the product roadmap / lifecycle of Location Based Entertainment (LBE) Team Initiatives as well as the Digital Signage portfolio. Working closely with internal business groups, vendors and partners, this individual will provide project management, business analysis, functional expertise and 3rd tier support. More specifically, the deliverables include:
Business Analysis
Understanding “The Business” of the applicable Applications validating business value, requirements and workflow, to ensure that the solution proposed will meet the need and add value. Ensure requirements are thorough.
Document requirements in a concise and clear manner
Develop processes to manage change ensuring that changes in the build and QA cycles are validated and well merited while keeping the critical path in mind
Project Management
Author, own and keep up to date a plan of tasks, timing and people that will ensure success. Ensure key people validate the plan when it undergoes change. Ensure that the remaining effort is clear and up to date.
Contribute to Scrums and Status updates as needed
Own status update meeting with project contributors and stakeholders
Prioritize project deliverables based on business need and dependencies.
Marshal resources appropriately through the project, ensuring they and their managers have ample notice of upcoming tasks and target dates
Keeping resource managers and business stakeholders informed and engaged throughout a project - addressing their concerns and managing their expectation appropriately. A weekly update email should be part of the regular cycle of communication beyond individual meetings.
Keep executive stakeholders informed and committed to championing the work.
Communicate in an effective manner. While E-mail is a useful tool, it is not always the best method of communication. Choose the best method of communication, whether it is e-mail, a quick call followed up by an e-mail, or a meeting.
Roadmap, Client and Portfolio Management
Provide prompt responses to stakeholder questions. Ensure that you don’t lose sight of communications or individual task threads - ensuring that at the very least communication is maintained and items remain on the radar.
Keeping your roadmap up to date with latest asks of the business, re-prioritizing appropriately in line with the strategic objectives of the business and management.
Regular stakeholder and senior stakeholder communications/meetings/touch points to review the roadmap and ensure we are aligned. Ensure we are changing as the business changes.
Address the demand of the business by doing what can be done to move new requests along the process as best as possible while other projects may be the current focus of the team.
Keeping quick wins and smaller initiatives moving - always delivering some progress - while larger projects may be taking their time to complete.
Explain technical details in a manner that non-technical clients and stakeholders can understand.
Functional Role & Solution Delivery
Be a corporate functional expert, understanding how the different roles within the business and outside the business operate the application.
Ensure that documenting is authored and curated for all standard operating practices particular to Cineplex (working with business owners).
Where appropriate understand how the application configuration is maintained and managed.
Develop the skills and knowhow to build out of the box solutions with these technologies, to deliver quick wins to the business & overcome challenges.
Keep up to date with the latest and greatest regarding this technology, by following blogs, forums and user groups and other relevant information sources.
Quality Assurance Management
Authoring and curating a library of functional test scripts for the applications and business processes within your portfolio - ensuring that the scope of the business and functionality of the application is accurately covered.
Ensure that necessary changes to test scripts as result of failures in test cycles are factored back into said test scripts in a timely manner (so as to not lose sight of them)
With each application feature release, author/update test scripts that cover these new features.
Marshalling business stakeholder test signatories through the user acceptance testing cycles, acquiring appropriate sign-off artifacts at the end of this cycle.
Work with the QA Automation Specialist to migrate our current paper based test processes to automated solutions - learning these new test tools and then training users appropriately.
Housekeeping & Managing Up:
Adopt and leverage the IT tools, standards, protocol, processes, and cadence of Software Solutions team used to deliver on the success factors noted above.
Escalate appropriately and timely when a situation threatens the success factors noted above.
Support Management
Understand that support is our most important priority that is shared with other support personnel
Prompt response to support threads.
Triaging effectively to determine business impact and sense of urgency around a support case - providing prompt attention to incidents with the highest impact to the business
Effective problem investigation that leads to problem isolation. This involves the acquisition of all evidence available (logs, accurate UX accounts, app data etc.), leveraging technology specialists, lining up the timing of events to present probable narratives, narrowing possibilities based on the evidence and not wasting time on hypothesis with clear evidence to the contrary.
Effective management of support tickets with 3rd party Software Vendors, which involves: accurately documenting the issue within the support management tool of the vendor, including all necessary evidence to help 3rd party team isolate situation, documenting repeatable steps that produce the issue, prompt response to vendor support team queries, facilitation of calls or screen casts to assist in isolating/understanding issue, connect business users when necessary, prompting vendor team appropriately for incident updates to ensure momentum on investigation/solution.
Reducing your support load by appropriate hand off to business owners and support personnel (CMC, Guest Services etc.). Hand off includes: Knowledge Base authoring and curating, communicating and coordinating effectively with support personnel management to ensure the appropriate training.
Periodically reviewing all knowledge base materials within your portfolio to ensure that it is up to date and reflective of any recent changes in the environment.
Keeping up to date on new features and functions of software & services being leveraged in your portfolio.
Periodically touching base with support teams, reviewing KB materials and ensuring that support team are fully armed.
Escalating to support personnel management when support teams have failed to handle a support case appropriately or have handed off too soon to second tier support without leveraging KB materials/training. Reviewing and adjusting process if necessary as a result of consultation with support personnel management.
Always analyzing support incidents types, to isolate improvements to knowledge base, business processes, training or application features (likely all) - and then making these changes a priority to be addressed - drumming up the necessary support from other stakeholders and driving the changes needed to reduce support and empower users.
Adopt and leverage the IT tools, standards, protocol, processes, and cadence of the Software Solutions team used to deliver on the success factors noted above.
Escalating appropriately when a situation threatens the success factors noted above.

Education
University / College education in a computer related course of study or equivalent experience required.

3 – 5 Years of experience in a relevant role

Proven track record in working with internal and external customers while meeting tight timelines

Experience working in a Digital Signage/Customer Engagement environment including a software platform that integrates command and controls along with technology such as LCDs, LEDs, kiosks, considered an asset

Other

A technologist – a self-learner who loves and can pick up new technologies.

A strategist, an organizer – always comes prepared.

job_title: Professional Services Business Analyst - System Analyst
job_description:
Tier1 is a rapidly growing Fintech organization focused on global relationship management. As partners in innovation, Tier1 continually engages with our clients and industry partners to help envision the future state of capital markets and bring it to life. Our culture centers on collaboration and intellectual curiosity. Our dynamic team brings together expertise spanning capital markets, product management, technology and other corporate disciplines to ensure our clients can optimize their client relationship data and translate it into greater engagement and efficiency. We deliver the tools, connectivity, and workflows to power collaboration, transparency, and communications between capital markets participants.

In all that we do, we put our clients’ needs first, working closely to proactively address their pain points and help them clear the path toward opportunity, efficiency and profitability.

Technical Business Analyst - System Analyst

We are currently looking for technical business analysts to join our Professional Services team to serve as a Tier1CRM evangelist to a growing list of customers. Our Professional Services team is responsible for all aspects of an implementation from requirements gathering to end user training. As a technical business analyst, you will be involved in all these exciting activities such as: participate in or lead workshops with our customers to gather requirements for their Salesforce & Tier1CRM implementation, configure Salesforce & Tier1CRM solutions to meet those requirements, deploy changes into sandbox and product environments & run training sessions on how to use Tier1CRM products.

Primary responsibilities include:

Work with project managers to lead workshops with the customers to gather requirements
Recommend solutions to meet customer requirements by leveraging Salesforce & Tier1CRM best practices
Participate or lead efforts to develop and execute testing, training, and documentation
Participate in or lead deployment of Salesforce & Tier1CRM changes to sandboxes or production environments
Assist customers with their data analysis, data migration, and reporting requirements
Analyze root cause of issues to ensure a permanent resolution is implemented
What we look for:

At least 2 – 5 years of experience in a software development company or a bank/investment bank, preferably with CRM experience or Salesforce experience
Salesforce.com Administration Essentials for New Admin (ADM 201) Certification or prior Salesforce work experience
Degree in computer science/engineering/mathematics/business
Excellent oral and written English communication skills
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Ability to explain complex topics in simple terms to project stakeholders
Be able to learn quickly with minimum guidance
Write simple SOQL queries or Apex triggers
Experience working in an agile environment
Knowledge of the capital markets industry
May require up to 25% travel to United States, Europe, APAC
What we offer?

Competitive salary
Career development & growth at Tier1CRM
Health and dental benefits
Corporate discount for Goodlife Fitness
Exciting social & fundraising events (departmental & company wide)
Tier1CRM is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We are committed to equal treatment of all employees without regard to race, national origin, religion, gender, age, sexual orientation, veteran status, physical or mental disability or other basis protected by law

Health Services – Office of the Medical Officer of Health

Do you have strong research and analytical skills to analyze and synthesize policy and research documents?

Do you have knowledge, experience, and a passion for Community Development?

Can you use your policy research and development knowledge and experience to provide recommendations and innovative ideas to support desired outcomes for a better Community for Life?

If so this opportunity may be for you...

All Ontario municipalities are required to have a Community Safety and Well-Being Plan (the CSWB Plan) in place by January 1st, 2021. The Region of Peel CSWB Plan will identify risk factors and strategies to prevent violence in our community. The development and implementation of the CSWB Plan provides an exciting opportunity for the Region, local governments, police, health, social services, education and community organizations to formalize working relationships and collaboratively advance new or existing priorities related to community well-being and safety.
We are looking for an experienced Research and Policy Analyst to join our multi-disciplinary team of professionals supporting the development of the CSWB Plan. You will provide research and analysis, project leadership, and strategic advice and recommendations on the development and implementation of CSWB Plan and related policies, processes and objectives. You will prepare high-quality written and visual materials to support senior decision makers, including the System Leadership Table and Regional and local Councils, in the development of the Community Safety and Well-Being Plan.
What you will do...
Monitors, identifies, analyzes and provides recommendations on trends, risks and opportunities
Applies advanced knowledge of public health and/or technical knowledge regarding population health, social determinants of health, epidemiology and evidence-informed decision making
Analyzes and interprets complex information to provide strategic recommendations that will guide policy and programming decisions
Monitors, develops, implements and advocates for policies that will have positive population health implications
Provides expert guidance to the program planning and evaluation process
Prepares specialized documentation, technical reports and statistical analyses
Synthesizes complex information into a wide range of written and visual communication products such as reviews of research evidence, briefing documents, policy positions and presentations
Prepares and delivers presentations and represents Peel Public Health at local, provincial, federal and international meetings and conferences
Designs and implements knowledge translation activities related to research evidence, data and policy
Acts as a lead in research evidence review processes
May assist management by providing work direction, advice, training and/or guidance to staff and students

What we require...
Master’s degree in Public Health, Health Science, Policy, Planning, Health Administration, Epidemiology, Nursing, Nutrition or related degree
Minimum of 3 years’ experience in public health preferred
Experience in Community Development preferred
Strong knowledge in qualitative and quantitative research methods and analytical skills including critical appraisal and appropriate use of evidence
Demonstrated ability to apply advanced knowledge of public health and/or technical knowledge including population health, social determinants of health, assessment of research evidence, epidemiology and applicable legislation
Knowledge and experience in developing search strategies and assessing, determining relevance, critically appraising and analyzing evidence
Experience in informing policy development
Excellent written and verbal communication skills with demonstrated ability to synthesize complex information for a variety of audiences
Strong facilitation, project management, partnership/collaboration, planning, problem-solving and organizational skills
Competence in using Windows, Word, Excel, Access, PowerPoint and Outlook programs and reference management software
Location: 7120 Hurontario Street, Mississauga
Hours of work: 35 hours/week Monday through Friday
About Us
The Region of Peel serves more than 1.4 million residents and approximately 163,000 businesses in Brampton, Caledon and Mississauga. We deliver a wide range of resident focused services across the Region.
Our 20-year vision for Peel is “Community for Life.” Our goal is to create a place where everyone enjoys a sense of belonging and has access to the services and opportunities needed to thrive in each stage of their lives. Our 2015-2035 Strategic Plan outlines the work we're focused on to bring this vision to life.
To learn more about the Region of Peel, explore peelregion.ca
Additional Information
At the Region of Peel, we respect diversity and treat one another in ways that are fair, courteous and compassionate, recognizing everyone’s contributions. As an equal opportunity employer, we are committed to establishing a qualified workforce that is reflective of the diverse population we serve. The Region of Peel is committed to providing accommodations throughout the recruitment process. If you require accommodation please notify us and we will work with you to meet your needs. We encourage applications from all qualified individuals; however, only those under consideration will be contacted.

Please be advised, the Region of Peel uses email to communicate with their applicants for open job competitions. It is the applicant’s responsibility to include an updated email address that is checked daily and accepts emails from unknown users. As we send time sensitive correspondence via email (i.e. testing bookings, interview dates), it is imperative that applicants check their email regularly. If we do not hear back from applicants, we will assume that you are no longer interested in the position and your application will be removed from the competition.

Canadian Tire Corporation’s (CTC) rich heritage of serving Canadians from coast-to-coast dates back to 1922. Our vision is to become the #1 retail brand in Canada by 2022 and we are focused on innovating and making important investments in our business, especially when it comes to our people. To reach our goal, we need the best talent to help us evolve and drive change across the business – and boldly help shape Canada’s retail industry. As we strive to be at the forefront of a complex and vastly changing retail industry, it is an exciting time to join the Canadian Tire family of companies.

Primary focus is subject matter expertise and ownership of CTC’s CAFM (Computer Aided Facility Management) system (FM Systems) for consistency and accuracy on a global basis. This role reports directly to the AVP, Facility Services. This data will be used for decision making on long term portfolio planning, capital budget development and prioritization, benchmarking and continuous improvement opportunities.

What you’ll do

Provide drawing updates to reflect recent renovations and furniture reconfigurations

Advise and Monitor drawing standards made to third-party services as needed

Create preliminary space plans in AutoCAD for Planner and Stakeholder review as needed

May be required to meet with Stakeholder and Sr. Management to present proposals and discuss data.

Identify, recommend and implement best in class reporting standards. Align reporting standards with corporate initiatives and target goals

Develop internal and external benchmarking to compare the corporation with similar industries

Act as CAFM subject matter expert for all data maintenance and reporting activities

Document CAFM processes: create Training Materials and User Guidelines;

Roll out/ incorporate and maintain CAFM for all CTC Banners across the country

Work with occupancy planners to ensure processes are being followed consistently,

Address issues with CAFM performance / functionality

Collect and report issues with the tool to Vendor services, monitor issues for resolution and closure;

Design, develop and refine monthly and quarterly occupancy reports using CAFM and other available databases. Determines appropriate methodologies, designs and maintain models to support reporting needs

Identify key metrics using industry standards and best practices, create and continue to develop dashboard reporting for performance metrics using CAFM and other databases.

Who you are

We are looking for individuals who are:
Creative and courageous, with the ability to manage in an environment of change and ambiguity to help us take bold, strategic moves in this rapidly evolving retail environment

Action oriented, and comfortable taking calculated risks to better serve our customers and business

Outcome focused, critical thinkers with the ability to analyze and visualize, to ensure continuous improvement across our entire business

Collaborative team players with superior influencing skills, who build relationships easily across various stakeholder groups to move initiatives forward

Inclusive leaders who build and develop teams that effectively anticipate and respond to disruption, while consistently delivering strong performance

If you’re curious, ready to take on new challenges and open to doing things differently to help us evolve rapidly, then this is definitely the place to be.

What you bring

Experience in using CAFM systems such as FM Systems, Aperture, Manhattan etc. required.

Dilpoma/ Degree in Interior Design/ Architecture / AutoCAD Technician preferred

Experience in Corporate Facility Management/ Real Estate fields is an asset

Technical skills to integrate different databases to support CAFM outcomes, including HR, IT and Finance systems

Strong developed proficiency in Excel and PowerPoint and AutoCAD

Ability to multi-task and manage numerous projects simultaneously while maintaining attention to detail

About Canadian Tire Corporation

Canadian Tire and its family of companies are boldly shaping retail in Canada and we continue to deliver a positive experience for our customers. As one of the most trusted brands in Canada, our employees take pride in the work we do across the country. It’s more than the iconic triangle that keeps our employees around. $68,530 - $78,227 a yearSenior Wholesale Business Systems Analyst
Information Systems R27
Vancouver, Regular, Full Time

STEP into a career with one of BC’s Top Employers since 2009.

The Liquor Distribution Branch (LDB) is one of the largest distributors and retailers of beverage alcohol in Canada, generating a net income of approximately $1.08 billion on annual sales of approximately $3.3 billion in fiscal 2016/17. LDB has a workforce of approximately 4,000 full and part-time employees, operates 197 retail stores across the province, oversees the operations of approximately 220 Rural Agency Stores and has the role of wholesaler to approximately 700 private liquor retail outlets and 10,000 licensed establishments.
The LDB is a unique government entity that operates with similar independence to a Crown Corporation under the direction of a General Manager and CEO.
In February 2018, the LDB was assigned to distribute, wholesale and sell non-medicinal cannabis inclusive of a government owned online channel with a mandate to support government’s key priorities of protecting children and youth, ensuring health and safety standards, and keeping the criminal element out of the supply chain. Effective October 17, 2018 the LDB has added wholesaling and retailing of non-medical cannabis –named LDB Cannabis Operations to the existing business of wholesaling and retailing of Liquor.
LDB’s Information Technology Division (IT) provides reliable, responsive and secure systems and services to support LDB in operational excellence and delivering superior customer service.
The LDB’s Information Technology Division consists of six departments and 23 distinctive units, with 200+ FTEs. IT has adopted a multi-sourcing strategy and leverages a combination of internal and external expertise, including outsourced services, contracted services and shared services, to deliver the IT mandate of supporting current operations and future business needs. Strategic plans, governance of standards and risk management are all developed internally to support Divisional and Corporate goals.
The Senior Business Systems Analyst (BSA) leads the analysis and provides consulting services to plan on-going business and technology needs consistent with BC Liquor Distribution Branch’s strategic plans.
Serves as a liaison between lines of business community and the IT organization in order to provide technical solutions to meet user needs. Possesses expertise in the business unit(s) they support, as well as, an understanding of the IT organization’s systems and capabilities. Analyses lines of business operations to understand their strengths and weaknesses to determine opportunities to automate processes and functions. Assists in the business process redesign and documentation as needed for new technology. Educates the IT organization on the direction of the business. Negotiates agreements and commitments to business partners by facilitating communication between business unit(s) and IT from initial requirements to final implementation. Possesses an understanding of technological trends and uses this knowledge to bring solutions to supported business units to improve operations and enhance the LDB’s competitive edge. May make recommendations for buy versus build decision.
This position evaluates business systems varying in complexity and business significance and ensures clients requirements and priorities are understood and met throughout the systems development life cycle. This position is responsible to know and understand industry best practices and approaches to business challenges and their relation to systems solution. The position is responsible for completing detailed end-to-end business analysis, obtaining clear definition of business requirements and translating them into functional specifications, developing cost-benefit/alternative analysis, risk assessments, recommendations, and preparing branch standard documentation. The position also identifies time frames, resources/ budget requirements and presents findings to both IT and Business Leaders.
To be considered for this opportunity, applicants must submit a cover letter and resume clearly identifying how they meet the qualifications necessary for this position. This information will be used as part of the selection process.

For complete details about this opportunity, including accountabilities, please refer to the attached job profile. For specific position related enquiries, please contact Hector Wong, Manager, Wholesale Systems by phone at 604 252-2976. Best Buy Canada, three times winner of ”Canada’s top 100 employers” award is excited to announce that we are actively seeking top talent to join our IT infrastructure team. If you have a passion for technology and have the drive and commitment to help the team manage and build supporting technology for an enterprise scale, 24/7 global brand then we would very much like to talk to you.
The Storage and Data Centre team is responsible for supporting and developing Best Buy’s IT data storage, backup, Disaster Recovery and Data Centre services, including both operational and project responsibilities. In this role, reporting to the Storage and Data Centre Manager you will implement best practice solutions and use your considerable subject matter expertise to improve processes, designs and services. You will have the opportunity to work with the team on complex projects that provide significant improvement to the business such as; storage migrations, migration to and adoption of cloud technologies, data centre migrations and continuous improvement to processes and tools. You will also participate in addressing technical problems and documenting solutions to complex business needs as you manage and support our enterprise scale Storage infrastructure and Data Centres.
At Best Buy we pride ourselves on our commitment to continuous learning, you will have the opportunity to grow and develop your business and technical skillsets via a combination of on the job cross training as well as business objective aligned training courses.
As a Storage Infrastructure Analyst you will…
Project work as directed by business requirements, including taking part in project meetings and providing technical expertise on matters relating to storage, backup and data centre infrastructure requirements and best practices, producing technical documents and implementing project requirements
Operational support with an emphasis on analytics, including but not limited to internal projects to maintain deployment, orchestration and monitoring systems as well as research, test and implement new systems and technologies
Contribute clear and concise environment and change documentation as well as standard operating practice documents (SoP’s) to the infrastructure platform body of knowledge. Work within the ITIL framework following required workflows to complete tasks
Provide an L3 escalation point for emergent issues; define and lead problem resolution workflows related service desk items.
Take part in strategic management of the department, leverage your significant technical expertise to assist in the definition of department vision and mission.

We hope you are passionate about…
Innovation – as a tech company we are constantly changing and evolving; an openness and willingness to embrace change is critical
Logic and critical thinking – we’re largely a data driven company so consideration of all angles and viewpoints is vital
Having fun while being the best – we work hard but play harder.
The experience we need…
5+ years of enterprise storage and backup administration
Strong understanding and hands on experience with NetApp FAS and/or AFF storage systems
Understanding of IP and Fiber Channel network concepts, and the ability to diagnose and troubleshoot connectivity issues
Strong understanding and hands on experience with FC, iSCSI, NFS, and CIFS storage protocols
Experience running production 24/7/365 operational environments
Experience with multi-data center architectures
Effective communicator, maintaining open communication with other platform team members as well as development staff
Bonus...
NetApp NCDA or equivalent experience
RHCE/LFCE or equivalent experience
MCSE/MCITP or equivalent experience
VMware VCP or equivalent experience
CCNA/CCNP or equivalent experience
ITIL Foundation or equivalent experience
2+ years experience with formal change management procedures

We believe we have the unique opportunity to help customers enrich their lives and pursue their passions with the help of technology

job_title: Cost Controls Lead (Trans Mountain Expansion Project)
job_description:
This position will be working on the Trans Mountain Expansion Project (TMEP) which is currently in the preplanning stage. During the preplanning stage this role will be based out of the Calgary office and will transition to Kamloops and/or Merritt BC for the construction stages.


ROLE:
The Field Cost Controls Lead is responsible for effectively leading a team of cost controls professionals on a construction project and be able to positively influence internal and external clients to achieve results. The Field Cost Controls Lead achieves a high level of forecasting accuracy and is proactive in addressing project cost issues therefore supporting a successful construction project outcome.

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:
Assist Project Controls Manager and Project Manager with development and implementation of contract specific execution plans.
Implement/ Administer Company Cost Capture System (DTC), liaising with Group Business Analyst to adjust/ amend cost allocation codes.
Manage the Cost Database for all project resources, tracking arrivals/ departures of both People and Equipment ensuring accurate set up, rates etc
Act as liaison between Field Staff and Finance, providing support/ guidance to field payroll and accounts payable functions.
Collect and compile project data to track earned value and monitor trends, including project cost codes assigned, man hours reported and project subcontractors.
Preparation of Weekly Cost Liability reports for Equipment, Materials and monitor accruals.
Assist in the production of information for progress invoicing and progress status reports.
Assist in the preparation of Forward Cost Forecasts and subsequent reconciliation of actuals versus forecast.
Assist Project Controls Lead to analyse cost trends, develop and review cost forecasts.
Provide support to the Project Controls Lead to complete change order estimates, review estimates and assist in costing.
Prepare Project Control Reports, according to Project Controls Lead and client requirements (Monthly Reports, bi-weekly and weekly reports, subcontracts progress status, earned value curves, productivity analysis, histograms and slippage reporting/recovery planning).
Highlight risk warnings when identified (cost deviation).
Create daily and weekly cost reports and forecast costs to completion, utilizing progress data from the field.
Perform daily administrative duties, such as daily input of employee time, creation and maintenance of WBS/CBS in accounting system, maintenance of equipment and change order logs, analysis of purchase orders and correct coding, invoice preparation, etc.
Maintain project budgets from initial budget setup to changes upon instruction.
Reconcile billings and cost accounts, prepare analysis and reports.
Support Subcontracts Management.
Note: In addition to these duties personnel are required to carry out such other duties as may be reasonably required in order to support the objectives of the Company.:

POSITION REQUIREMENTS:
Qualifications
High School Diploma.
Engineering degree, Accounting degree, Quantity Surveying Degree or graduate of an applicable technical diploma program, and/or combination of education and relevant experience.
Project Management Institute (PMI) certification is considered an asset.
Experience
3-5 years of experience in an oil and gas construction cost controls role (preferably in the field).
Skills and Knowledge
Understanding of the construction industry (preferably oil and gas pipeline or other linear type construction).
Ability to read and understand relevant construction documents including contracts, drawings, specifications, subcontracts, construction codes, standards, and practices.
Proven understanding of estimating, cost control and project management theories, methodologies, and industry practices.
Advanced knowledge of MS Office, Hard Dollar and accounting software.


WORKING CONDITIONS:
This position is field based and works within remote project locations. Travel and/or living in temporary accommodations is required.

REPORTING RELATIONSHIPS:
The Field Cost Controls Lead reports to the Project Controls Manager and functionally to the Field Project Controls Lead. The position supervises Field Cost Controls Staff.

All applicants will be required to pass a mandatory drug and alcohol test.
We thank all applicants in advance. Only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

COMPANY:
Sunwing Travel Group Inc.

OVERALL OBJECTIVE:
The Project Manager manages projects, ensuring that projects are on time, within budget and at the required level of quality. The Project Manager will work closely with business analysts, team leads, technical architects, developers, Quality Assurance analysts and business managers through all phases of the project management life-cycle to ensure projects are delivered successfully. The role will report to the Senior Director, Business Systems and Innovation and will be located in Toronto, ON.
RESPONSIBILITIES:
Define the scope of the project in collaboration with all stakeholders
Create a detailed project plan which identifies and sequences the activities and tasks needed to successfully complete a project
Determine the resources required to complete the project
Review the project plan with all stakeholders affected by the project activities; revise the plan as required
Determine the objectives and measures upon which the project will be evaluated at its completion including conducting post implementation reviews
Execute the project according to the project plan
Develop forms and records to document project activities
Set up files to ensure that all project information is appropriately documented and secured
Monitor the progress of the project and make adjustments as necessary to ensure the successful completion of the project
Communicate updates to stakeholders including appropriate staff in the organization on the progress of the project
Monitor all budgeted project expenditures
Ensure that financial records for the project are up to date
Prepare financial reports and supporting documentation as directed
Ensure that the project deliverables are on time, within budget and at the required level of quality
Evaluate the outcomes of the project as established during the planning phase
Follow the project management methodology and Sunwing’s project standards documentation to ensure project success.
QUALIFICATIONS
University Degree in a related subject
3 to 5 years project management experience preferably in the travel industry
2 to 3 years process management experience
Excellent computer skills (MS Office, MS Project, database management, simple accounting)
Demonstrated business acumen
Ability to communicate effectively
Ability to work cooperatively and effectively with others to set goals, resolve problems, and make decisions that enhance effectiveness
Ability to assess situations to determine the importance, urgency and risks, and make clear decisions which are timely and in the best interests of Sunwing
Demonstrated ability to set priorities, develop a work schedule, monitor progress towards goals, and track details/data/information/activities
Assess problem situations to identify causes, gather and process relevant information, generate possible solutions, and make recommendations and/or resolve the problem
ENVIRONMENT AND SCOPE:
Capable to work in fast-paced and rapidly changing environment
Flexibility to adapt and able to manage multiple assignments while working independently or as part of a team.
If you wish to apply for this position, please submit your application by March 8, 2019. We would like to thank all applicants but only qualified candidates will be contacted.

Tilray is a federally licensed producer of medical cannabis. We are committed to setting the gold standard of care and excellence in our industry. We believe that commitment starts with a great work environment and benefits for our associates.

Looking to develop your career at the forefront of a rapidly expanding industry?
Ready to apply your talents to make a positive difference in the lives of patients across the country?
Reporting to the Director of BizTech Operations, the Business/Systems Analyst studies business composition, processes, and informational needs of an organization with the goal of developing solutions to enhance effectiveness of company application systems and Electronic Data Platforms. This includes analyzing user requirements, processes, procedures, and problems to automate or improve efficiencies, drive user adoption, increase system capabilities, workflows, and scheduling. the role provides ongoing technical sustainment and training for transaction processing modules that include manufacturing, distribution, finance, and inventory, resolving break/fix issues to ensure orders are successfully processed and accurate. The incumbent is a key resource in mid to large-sized projects, and responsible for ongoing continuous improvement. This individual participates in the implementation of policies, procedures, and documentation that are consistent with company enterprise goals, industry best practices, Health Canada regulatory requirements, and GxP quality standards.
Role and Responsibilities
Identify projects requirements by interfacing with production teams, analyze operations, determine project scope, document results, document process flows, create procedure manuals for the functions performed.
Facilitate technical meetings to define solutions, functional specifications, implementation plans, effort, identify resources, and schedule activities.
Contribute to the development of methods to improve business processes, reduce risks, increase controls and/or increase customer satisfaction.
Develop solutions, workflow charts and diagrams, study system capabilities, analyze alternative solutions, prepare system specifications.
Develop project estimates by identifying phases and elements, personnel requirements, costs, ERP implementation, support and development.
Develop and maintain systems by researching and resolving problems, working closely with IT and Finance teams to maintain system integrity and security.
Maintain service quality levels by establishing and enforcing organization standards.
Communicate information effectively to customers, collaborate with other department managers and technical staff.
Maintain issues log, release log, and decision/approval log.
Understand business unit workflows and how to use technology solutions to support.
Manage requirements traceability information and track requirements status throughout the project.
Organize and manage reports, generic inquiries, establish naming conventions, report commissioning and ongoing management.
Decompose high-level business and user requirements into functional equivalents, specified in an appropriate level of detail suitable for daily use by system operators.
Ensure data quality, develop and publish enterprise data standards including a common business vocabulary, transformation rules, and related enterprise consistent specifications.
Provide business process improvement, ERP adoption and training, isolate and escalate application incidents and problems.
Follow established GxP quality principles of change control, document control, CAPA, and systems validation.
Participate in third-party vendor relationships, SLA’s, and contract negotiations.
Develop and maintain expertise through professional development opportunities and personal studies off-hours.
As needed availability for on-call resource evenings, weekends, and statutory holidays.
Qualifications
University degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Information Technology, or an acceptable combination of education and experience.
At least 3+ years of direct work experience as a Business/Systems Analyst in an ERP environment, with progressively increasing responsibilities.
Experience with Acumatica ERP and SDLC framework are assets.
Proven ability with Microsoft Office applications, particularly Excel advanced functions.
Strong analytical skills, with a thorough understanding of interpreting customer business needs and translating them into application and operational requirements and/or process workflows.
Experience with project delivery framework, application development, and/or program management experience.
Effective time management, task prioritization, and ability to consistently meet deadlines.
Able to work independently or as part of a team. A proven self-starter and highly motivated to make proactive changes.
Possess excellent written and verbal communication skills, and highly analytical aptitude.

Ideally, involved in a data warehouse development project from start-to-end. Skilled in developing Source-to-Target data mapping documents.
Strong analytical skills with the ability to research, identify and resolve data integration issues.
Ideally skilled in MS Excel and SQL query writing for data extraction, analysis, scrubbing, cleansing, reporting etc.
Working knowledge of data warehouses such as SQL Server, Oracle, Amazon Redshift, Teradata etc. is ideal.
Please note this is a one-year contractual position in Qatar.

job_title: Operations - Securities Division Operations - FICC Ops - Commodities Operations - Natural Gas Logistics - Analyst - Calgary
job_description:
MORE ABOUT THIS JOB
OPERATIONS
Operations is a dynamic, multi-faceted division that partners with all parts of the firm to provide banking, securities, and asset management services to clients around the world. In addition, Operations provides essential risk management and controls to preserve and enhance the firm's assets and its reputation. For every new product launched and every trade executed, it is Operations that develops and manages the processes and controls that enable business flow.

YOUR IMPACT
Join the Natural Gas Logistics Team and actively contribute to the entire lifecycle of a physical commodity. Coordinate transportation of natural gas across the continent while serving the operational needs of gas producers, power plants, and industrial end-users. Develop relationships with North American pipelines, storage operators, and our clients to ensure natural gas flows are accurate, timely and cost-effective each day. Work on a trading floor in a fast-paced environment in collaboration with trading and sales. Contribute to a group that places a premium on cross-training, entrepreneurial spirit, and a “team-first” attitude.

OUR IMPACT
Members of the Gas and Power Logistics Team are highly visible participants in a dynamic marketplace. Our actions, attention to detail, and market savvy have a direct impact on one of the firm’s fastest growing business units. The team is responsible for timely and accurate submission of data to the respective system/ market operators. In addition to our core physical scheduling role the team also manages the firm’s physical assets and inventory. We coordinate projects to access new areas of the natural gas market. We provide our observations on flows in the marketplace against current and future commercial opportunities.
RESPONSIBILITIES AND QUALIFICATIONS
HOW TO FULFILL YOUR POTENTIAL

Develop expertise and proficiency on Natural Gas infrastructure
Provide traders and sales teams with timely and accurate market data
Provide Logistics comments in a variety of areas including new trade ideas, system enhancements, and contract language
Ensure counterparty positions reflect internal trading positions and remedy any discrepancies
Monitor real-time curtailments and book representative trades to properly reflect trade economics
Become a proactive team player who takes ownership and accountability of projects, has strong organizational skills, and the ability to effectively manage competing priorities
Participate in ongoing refinement of team procedures and processes to support the developing business
Liaise with Legal, Compliance, Credit, Technology, Tax, Insurance, Regulatory Reporting & relevant external bodies
 SKILLS & EXPERIENCE WE’RE LOOKING FOR
Basic Qualifications
Bachelor’s degree with a minimum of two years experience in physical commodities
Experience working in fast paced environment
Proficient with Microsoft applications
Experience working in trading environment and / or on natural gas scheduling systems
The candidate must be available for work every fourth weekend and the occasional holidays
 Preferred Qualifications
Strong written and verbal communication skills with ability to be clear and concise
Aptitude for building relationships and ability to communicate complex issues to a wide array of internal clients with differing levels of product experience
Work well under pressure and meet deadlines
Ability to learn quickly in a fast moving environment.
Strong technical and analytical skills
Team oriented approach – openness and good communication skills within the team and the ability to work across functions inside and outside of Operations
Demonstrate strong technical skills and keen attention to detail
Ability to innovate, adapt, and develop new processes to serve our evolving business.
Focus on control issues, processes and procedures
Proactive, self-starting individual with high levels of ownership
Highly motivated and ability to coach others in technical areas and problem solving.
Focus on control issues, processes and procedures
Proactive, self-starting individual with high levels of ownership
Highly motivated and ability to coach others in technical areas and problem solving
Any prior experience of Middle Office, Settlements, Documentation, or Commodities more broadly a plus
ABOUT GOLDMAN SACHS
The Goldman Sachs Group, Inc. is a leading global investment banking, securities and investment management firm that provides a wide range of financial services to a substantial and diversified client base that includes corporations, financial institutions, governments and individuals. Founded in 1869, the firm is headquartered in New York and maintains offices in all major financial centers around the world.

© The Goldman Sachs Group, Inc., 2019. All rights reserved Goldman Sachs is an equal employment/affirmative action employer Female/Minority/Disability/Vet.

Aurora Cannabis Inc. is a world-renowned integrated cannabis company with an industry-leading reputation for continuously elevating and setting the global cannabis industry standard.

Through our wholly owned subsidiaries, strategic investments, and global partnerships, Aurora provides a wide range of premium quality cannabis and hemp products and services, develops innovative technologies, promotes cannabis consumer health and wellness, and delivers an exceptional customer experience across all its brands.

Aurora’s operations span multiple continents and focuses on both the medical and recreational cannabis production and sales, patient education and clinic counselling services, home hydroponic cultivation, extraction technologies and delivery systems, and hemp-based food health products.

We operate around the globe pursuing new and emerging cannabis markets where possible through our owned network of import, export and wholesale distributors, our e-commerce and mobile applications, brick and mortar retail stores, as well as grocery store retailers, and pharmacies.

LOGISTICS ANALYST

Aurora is recruiting a Logistics Analyst to work alongside logistics team. The ideal candidate will support the Logistics and External Supply Chain group. The Logistics Analyst will take initiative to improve the movement, distribution, and storage of products, while ensuring all stakeholders are provided outstanding service throughout the supply chain cycle.

MAIN RESPONSIBILITIES:

Perform analysis of a variety of supply chain data sets to measure performance, identify trends and discover optimization opportunities
Budgetary analysis and forecasting
Modelling operational initiatives and projects – from new facilities, to new operational processes, to lean manufacturing initiatives
Developing new methods of data gathering, analysis, and reporting/communication strategies
Analyzing core operational KPIs
Labour costing analysis and modelling

KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS AND ABILITIES:

Knowledge of ERP & WMS systems
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Excellent understanding of logistics processes and procedures in a facility environment
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Superior Microsoft Excel, Word, and PowerPoint skills
Strong team player with the ability to build strong relationships with internal and external stakeholders

EXPERIENCE & EDUCATION:

Bachelors degree or diploma in Business Administration, Logistics, Supply Chain Management or related discipline
Minimum 2-3 years of experience in a supply chain
Excellent organizational, planning and communication skills
Excellent reporting skills
Strong analytical, strategic and problem solving skills
Presentation skills considered an asset
Experience in a 3PL environment considered an asset
Fluent in both English and French is a definite asset

We would like to thank all applicants for their interest but only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

Aurora Cannabis Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer.
