ContractJob summary
Under the direction of the Assistant Corporate Controller, the Financial Analyst is responsible for tracking, monitoring, and evaluating Capital investments of PE group mills. Financial Analyst also work with the Senior Financial analyst for budgeting, forecasting and financial performance analysis to support decision making of HQ executives. This role will be for a Maternity Leave but could transition to a permanent position with Paper Excellence.

Responsibilities:
Capex Control

Facilitates the Capex approval process, monitors project progress, compiles monthly Capex report , collects project close report
Preparation and review of all capital expenditures over established thresholds to review and approve, and such expenditure over higher and established thresholds, to prepare for Executive review and approval, which will include quote/evidence to support the description/scope of work and spend amount
Provides advice and guidance on all accounting matters pertaining to capital expenditures
Lead annual Capex budget process and annual review of past year Capex projects
Ensure all Capex related SOPs are followed and implemented
Provide analysis on special Capex project and help optimize the work flow
Financial Reporting and Analysis

Reviews mills monthly financial statements and checks the accuracy of reports.
Conducts root cause analysis of actual vs. budget variance for mill performance evaluation.
Participates in the budgeting activities with different internal groups (Executives, Departmental managers, and mill accounting team) to ensure the budgets and forecasts are prepared in a timely basis in the correct format. Responsible for the accuracy of the data which may have a material impact on the financial results of the company.
Assist external audit requests
Qualifications:
A university degree combines with a professional accounting designation
Experience with internal control audits and systems
5 years varied accounting experience with project accounting and financial analysis experience
Strong interpersonal and communication skills, able to build a strong relationship with all level of management
Knowledge of fixed asset and capitalization rules and regulations
Thorough knowledge of accounting system, SAP Project System and FICO experience would be an asset
Demonstrated ability to act with high standards and integrity at all times
Possesses situational awareness of surroundings with the ability to adapt to new and changing environments, who can relate well at all levels
A high sense of urgency with regards to moving projects forward and making operational improvements; action and goal oriented
Adaptable and understands a complex and constantly changing business environment. Able to keep pace with a company going through significant growth and change.

Who is Geotab:

Imagine millions of vehicles driving across the globe 24/7. Next, imagine that you collected rich location, engine and vehicle behaviour data on each vehicle through a plug and play device. Our customers have the power to take this data and provide valuable insight toward their businesses because of the Geotab platform. Geotab is one of the leading telematics technology companies in the world and is focused on continuing our rapid expansion worldwide. For more information visit us at www.geotab.com.

FleetCarma has developed the world’s only electric vehicle monitoring and control platform which uses vehicle data and metrics to drive intelligent decisions for fleets and individuals. On any given day FleetCarma’s development garage will be filled with the latest electric vehicles: Model S’s, Volt’s, Leafs and the more than 30 other plug-in vehicles that are supported by our products.

In June 2018, FleetCarma joined forces with Geotab, a global leader in fleet telematics. Together, we'll be working to bring our innovative electric vehicle platform to their hundreds of thousands of vehicles being tracked across the world.

Who we are looking for:

Electric vehicles are coming quickly. Data and input from today’s electric vehicle owners are needed to make sure the grid is ready. Geotab’s EV programs combine data measured from thousands of EVs around the world to inform decisions for improving future grid efficiency and reducing greenhouse gas emissions.
EV data analysts have access to the largest dataset in the world that has real-world driving and charging data from electric vehicles spanning multiple manufacturers. As a result, this team is in the best position to answer the toughest and most pressing questions to support widespread EV adoption.

What are the details of this position:

Success in this role means that utilities are prepared for widespread EV adoption and that EV owners & fleet managers have the real-time and historical answers they need to operate EVs successfully. If you want to combine a fast pace environment with making meaningful impact on climate change, this is well aligned to you.
Duties and Tasks of this Position:
Create new algorithms for custom reporting, understanding the specific needs and objectives of individual clients as well as powertrain and other vehicle considerations
Assist during client calls to explain nuances in analysis and reporting
Analyse Electric Vehicle Suitability in client fleets and provide recommendations on electric vehicle adoption and charging infrastructure
Write professional reports to measure and report on program success and results
Experience/Skills Required:
Bachelor’s degree in Engineering, Computer Science or related
Impeccable written and verbal communication skills
Experience with SQL, Python
Detail oriented and analytical
Strong time management skills
Understanding of electric vehicle powertrains
Able to operate effectively in time-sensitive and high-pressure situations
Strong presentation skills, both in person and over web-conference
Project management experience an asset
Proficient at MATLAB, Visual Basic an asset
Familiarity with power and energy industry an asset
What makes our staff passionate about Geotab?

A focus on electric vehicles, which are both exciting and an important solution for climate change mitigation.
Being part of a world-class technology team
Having a small company feel while being part of a global leader with offices in 7 countries.
Table Tennis at the office! Bring your own bat!
Stocked fridge and healthy snacks
Hot lunch or fresh sandwiches served every Friday
Full medical benefits & 4% company matching retirement savings plan


Our Core Values:
Geotabbers innovate and seek creative ways to continuously improve. Collaboration and teamwork defines the way we work. We love being ahead of the curve, using leading technology, and being agile in every way we do business. We work hard, and we definitely play hard. From the CEO - to the staff - there is an open-door policy for all of us to freely communicate. Geotabbers are dynamic, and enjoy working in a fast-paced work environment. We own our work and take responsibility in a true entrepreneurial spirit!

Geotab encourages applications from all qualified candidates. Geotab is committed to accommodating persons with disabilities throughout the interview, selection and employment process. If you require accommodation at any stage of the application process or want more information about our accommodation policies and practices, please contact us at (416) - 434 4309.
